Reviews.Title: “A real NYC experience!”
Reviews.Author: SallyAlexis
Reviews.Content: The Edison Hotel is an art deco hotel centrally located in Times Square. Although the rooms are small, the overall ambience is characteristic of this exciting city. The Cafe Edison is conveniently attached to the hotel, and adds to the overall charm.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but very old”
Reviews.Author: JJK-KMK
Reviews.Content: My wife, daughter and I stayed at this hotel for four days beginning March19, 2012. We chose this hotel because of its location and price. We read reviews and knew that it was an older hotel but didn't think that would be a problem. When we arrived, we were impressed with the staff and the lobby was beautiful. However, our room was really old looking with uncomfortable beds and furniture. In addition the room was very hot and after turning the air conditioner on, it took until the next day to get to a comfortable temperature. And when I say old I mean things like electric sockets being painted over so many times that plugs wouldn't stay plugged in. The bathroom was also very small with no counter at all. But, I as stated at the beginning we knew this was an older hotel when we booked it and the location and the staff were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, could use a bit of a facelift”
Reviews.Author: sandyinlv
Reviews.Content: We went to NY City with a group of 20 (14 kids 6 adults), so I can give you the pros and cons. A BIG pro is the location. It is right off of Times Square. Just a couple minutes walk and you are right in the heart of it. Super loction for that area of NY City. The subway is also very close by. Elevators were easy to come by. Queen sized beds - rather than small double beds. They have a transportation desk available if you need a shuttle or airport arrangements as well. Cons: Old. I LOVE old and appreciate old (the old metal doorknobs, furniture, fixtures, etc). But, the carpet could be replaced and most of all, the bedding. The bedspreads were kinda' gross and we took them off of the beds each day immediately upon entering the room. The bathtub was a bit dinged up, I'm assuming from age, but that made it seem dirty. There was a musty smell as well. Also, the bathroom was extremely small and the door to the bathroom was directly across from the door to the closet and right in front of the door to the room. So, we had some door issues getting in and out. WiFi was not included and the information in the room said it was $3.95 for 15 minutes! That was enought to scare me away, but another person in our group said that if you called downstairs they offer a daily rate of $7 per day. That would've been nice to know. The hot water is tricky and will change from hot to lava hot with every flush in the joint. So, just be aware and on your toes to quickly move out of the way when needed. The lobby was nice, but a bit restricted. They have a seating area, which was convenient for our group to meet at, but they are very strict with No food or luggage allowed inside of this area.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all!”
Reviews.Author: PatsyRodriguez
Reviews.Content: I was a little leery booking this hotel because of the reviews but because we got such a fantastic rate and we wouldn't be spending very much time in the room we took it. I'm glad that we did! The hotel itself is a little dated but I can say that it is very clean and neat. There was always an available elevator and the staff was very friendly and helpful and we were always greeted with a smile! I would definitely stay here again because of the staff and because of the location. We were in the middle of everything!

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: Mario G
Reviews.Content: For the final days of our honeymoon in the USA we had the bad luck to find this Hotel. All the members of the staff we had to talk to, except for the girl at the transportation desk, were really unkind. The room was old and not clean at all. Pieces of forniture literally breaking down or falling away from the walls. We didn't had breakfast and I feel like it was a good choice. The only positive aspect it's the proximity to Times Sq. Try to get a high floor room if you want to sleep at night.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Location!”
Reviews.Author: Therese523
Reviews.Content: This was my very first trip to NYC and a friend had recommended the Hotel Edison. I was SO pleased with the location - literally around the corner from Times Square and walking distance to many major sites. We arrived at 1:30 pm and a room was ready for us, so we didn't have to wait until 3:00 pm to check-in. Very fast, efficient check-in process. Prior to arriving, I had originally booked a room with 2 single beds, but emailed a request for 2 double beds and a renovated room. I received an email response that my requests were granted. When we checked in, we were given a room with 2 queen beds - which was a nice surprise. The room was clean, roomy and comfortable despite the age of this hotel. The housekeeping staff was very friendly and provided us plenty with of towels. We ate at the restaurant, Sophia's, which was wonderful. Great food and great service. They have a cafe also which provided take-out - very convenient. If I had one complaint, it was the noise level from the street. We were on the 5th Floor and there was jackhammering in the street below from 12:30 am to 5:00 am. Thank God I brought earplugs. We considered asking for a room on a higher floor, but decided not to move. If I were to stay again, I'd make sure I had a room on a higher floor,. There were plenty of elevators that were fast and convenient. The hotel also has a small gift shop and fitness center. Overall I was very pleased with the Hotel Edison and would definitely stay there again - for sure. I would also recommend it to anyone who's looking to go to NYC and stay in the heart of Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Times Square”
Reviews.Author: PauloB_Tewkesbury
Reviews.Content: Brilliant location for sightseeing but after the lobby it's a little jaded. Room was just about OK. NY is NY but did the Viator city tour which was well worth doing.

Reviews.Title: “It is next to Times Square”
Reviews.Author: oooromyooo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this place as it was a great price right to Times Square; our next trip we will probably stay in a chain hotel in the city. We have yet to do so upon a visit and have once again seen why we should. The hotel, upon entry was great. The bell men were extremely helpful, the lobby is very well decorated in an art deco theme, and the sitting area is packed with guests. We came to see that the packed with guests were the people waiting for a room, which they didn't have available to us any early than our 3pm sharp check in. We had requested a renovated room, as those were the better quality rooms as we had read in these reviews. We were told one was not ready, but gave us the option to see another room should we want it. We checked it out and it was nothing special and opted to wait. We came back at check in and our renovated room was thus not available, so we were just given any room. If that was the case to begin with, we would've taken any room and were thus discouraged they did not take our request. The room was nothing special, a two bedroom "suite". Upon entrance, the only two closests are found as part of the first room. The second room has the only entry to the bathroom. We booked this room as we were told it would be two bathrooms and at that point, were happy to have a room to go back and request anything else. Both rooms had outdated furniture and decor, lamps that did not properly work, but were equipped with flat screen tvs (if that's even a selling point). The bathroom was extremely small, no more than two people could fit in at once, and the water pressure in the shower was high, so it was not the most comfortable bath. The heat seemed to be central, or beyond our control, as we would get extremely hot on the cold days we spent there, thus forced to open up a window to cool down as we got dressed. The overall stay was good, no complaints, as at the end of the day it was a place to sleep and shower. If you're looking for a cheap place near Times Square, we would recommend this location as its right there. For us and what we got, we could've stayed at the chained hotel next door for the same amount and got a better quality room, even if we had to share sleep space. Especially traveling with kids, we will next time look for quality not quantity when booking a hotel in the city.

Reviews.Title: “No individual heat in rooms”
Reviews.Author: Srjdavis
Reviews.Content: We just found out that until the outside temperature reaches 50 degrees that the boilers will not "kick" in. We have no control over the temperature in the room. Yikes! The front desk did offer us extra blankets.

Reviews.Title: “Great price and better location!”
Reviews.Author: HarlemGirly
Reviews.Content: Stayed overnight for a Radio City Music Hall Oprah event. We took the Greyhound, walked to the hotel in order to leave our bags. To our delight, our room was ready and we checked in at 12:30PM, not 3PM as we had expected. Room and bath were clean and comfortable. Have already recommended to others and will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “checked in, checked out”
Reviews.Author: brunette76
Reviews.Content: Very unfriendly check-in. We went to our room and it was very small and unclean. Writing all over the walls (maybe this was for future renovation, however I don't want to see this). Asked for an upgrade-denied. Immediately left room and found better room down the street. Asked for refund-denied. Now I am going through credit card company. Glad I took pictures and have them on my phone. Very unfortunate they would not work with us.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: pizpot
Reviews.Content: have just come back from the edison having stayed there for 6 nights and it was fantastic the staff there could not do enough for you they are true professionals to there job this hotel is right on times square and central to everything,theatres shops etc... we stayed here in march 2012 for my birthday went to see the jersey boys a must see and also priscilla queen of the desert, we also used the hop on hop off buses the guys with the yellow and blue coat very reasonably priced $54 for 72 hour pass again thank you hotel edison i will be going back thats for sure

Reviews.Title: “Recent Stay - March, 2012”
Reviews.Author: Vmorison
Reviews.Content: Check-in was very slow. I had received an email that breakfast was on them, but found out since we had a "special" rate, that we didn't qualify for the free breakfast. While the location was great, the staff was less than friendly. The rooms were very outdated. We had a deluxe room, so size was fine for 2 people. Mold in the bathroom. Very few outlets for chargers. Mattress was less than comfortable which you need in New York after being up and out early and coming back late. Ate at the Edison Cafe -- a little pricey and they only take cash. Food was alright. Only 1 waitress was the least bit friendly. Would we stay there again, I doubt it.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location and value for money!”
Reviews.Author: tjshorey
Reviews.Content: Brilliant location and value for money. No complaints other than only having one plug socket in room and road works outside keeping us awake but that's not the hotels fault. Would also say tea/coffee making facilities should be provided but there was a deli next door that sold everything so i could still get my morning fix of tea! I was very pleased with the price i paid for this hotel in the heart of times square and recommend it to anyone on limited budget.

Reviews.Title: “The Edison grew on us!”
Reviews.Author: Darren K
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Edison in March 2012, first impressions were good , the lobby was large and well decorated. But then we went to the room, they were very tatty with paint peeling off, the furniture was very old, there was an electric plug that was coming away from the wall- in need of the very least a lick of paint, if not a full revamp. But it was very clean, the bed was fairly comfortable. The best thing about the hotel was the location-fantastic!! By the end of the holiday our group all agreed that the hotel had grown on us and we would stay again! Oh and the nightime barman is very arrogant and aggressive, chasing after us out the bar, because we had only paid $16 out of his $22 tip because we thought his service was well below par!

Reviews.Title: “Great location but won't stay here again”
Reviews.Author: mystiquel
Reviews.Content: Stayed over a night in june 2010. Positive: location in the middle of Times Square but there are numbers of other better hotels nearby. Old hotel so old rooms not so comfortable beds. Everything costs incl leaving the luggage while waiting for check in.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Edison New York”
Reviews.Author: BrendaGS
Reviews.Content: Just spent a week in New York at a very great property. The Hotel Edison is an older hotel with wonderful proximity to all the Broadway Shows, Time Square and restaurants. The staff is excellent-the rooms are clean-the doorman make it very easy to get a cab and everyone takes very good care of you while you are there. They have an Italian restaurant "Sophie's in house as well as the "Edison Cafe" both Excellent in service and food!! Would highly recommend to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Economical room rates and excellent location!!!!! Could not be happier!!”
Reviews.Author: JHmh1217
Reviews.Content: My family and I just had our second Spring Break stay at the Hotel Edison. The hotel is clean, has a friendly staff, and most importantly has an awesome location. It is right off Times Square!!!! My kids loved it!!! The hotel may not be the fanciest in New York City but it is so nice and very economical. The rates were so much less expensive than all the other hotels in the area. My family and I were out everyday sight seeing and came back every evening and just crashed on the nice clean beds. I definitely will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Never a disappointment!”
Reviews.Author: vicbend
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Edison in NYC from March 27-31st. Room was ready, clean and quiet. Room was booked during a special promotion so the price was exceptional. I always stay at the Edison when visiting NYC and this trip made over a dozen times I have visited. The staff is professional, courteous and always available for any questions or assistance. I had a room with 2 queen beds and the space was adequate. If you are looking for a 5-star hotel with room service and all amenities, the Edison is not for you; but if you are looking for character, charm, location and a place to be comfortable and feel welcomed, then the Edison is the one. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to truly experience Times Square and all NYC has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Older hotel which needs updating but a value for the price.”
Reviews.Author: fitzhoyt
Reviews.Content: Desk workers very nice & helpful however, maid service needs helping. They took our kleenex & didn't leave needed toilet paper or cups. We left note telling them to please leave Kleenex/toilet paper/cups. They still didn't leave the cups... Another day they didn't leave towels... But, I like this hotel & will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, Dirty, Dirty”
Reviews.Author: jokamwisconsin
Reviews.Content: Great location and that is the only good thing good I can say about them. We are not fussy people but this place was so dirty I would never stay there again. When we reported it to the desk clerk who then notified the manager, she wanted to give us a free breakfast the next time we stay with them, which we will never do. Also, the pipes in the building is so noisy it sounded like herd of moose were coming through in the middle of the night.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: annlouisec
Reviews.Content: My first time in NY in March and myself and my husband stayed here for 4 nights. What a great find! If you want to be in the centre of all the buzz then this hotel will NOT be beaten on location. i carried out loads of research (as I do) and this hotel was also very competitively priced. We had a high up room and faced the back (which we requested) and the noise was minimal. As loads of others have said you arent in your hotel room long- but we had a good sized room, double bed, flat screen and although the bathroom was small it was fine and we had no problems with no hot water.Lift security was a great idea and the guys at security were lovely and smiley. The bag guys, not so helpful unless you were a group of young girls if you know what I mean ;) but it was fine we never really needed them. Ate at the restaurant the first morning but prefered Dannys Deli next door-we got toasted bagels and tea from there and had our brekkie on the famous red steps as we were lucky enough to had fab weather. We bought tickets for the open top bus which was great but if you're a wee bit impatient like me the subway is prob a better idea. the buse were $54 dollars for the 48 hours but the subway was $27 dollars for 7 days. The bus was great just took ages to get anywhere. when we return to Manhatten, which we definately will as there was still so much to see, we will definately be staying at the Edison again!!

Reviews.Title: “6 days in New York”
Reviews.Author: joegrimstead
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for a birthday treat in New York City, Fantastic Location, Fantastic Value for Money, Fantastic Restaurant, little worn around the edges but good food. Rooms are great, we literally slept in our bed and that was it, if you go and expect the Hilton then you will not be pleased with it. value for money amazing, I have already recommended this hotel to 2 of my friends and they just booked. Big Shout out to Bobby the door man my husband thought he was great and very helpful. The Lobby of the Hotel is gorgeous, Staff are a little frosty, but I didn't let bother me. Our Room was cleaned to perfection everyday. Beds were lovely and comfy Shower was not fantastic, but it did the job, as I said we didn't go all the way to New York to sit in our room and grumble.

Reviews.Title: “Edison Hotel Times Square”
Reviews.Author: Norm93
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights in March 2012. The reception staff were very friendly and helpful, we did not have to queue and room keys were ready on arrival. The rooms were adequate -clean and comfortable. There are about 6 lifts and the hotel has about 22 floors. At certain times there is a wait for a lift to come but not that often. The security staff are very quick to check you have a key if you come in off the street and go to the lifts so thats a plus. We did find that the prices in the bar were a bit dear $7 for a lager. The decor in the hotel is very plush, plenty of room to sit in the lounge area and a little shop for those last minute souvenirs. The internet area had about 4 screens but it was really hot if you sat there for any length of time as there were large spotlights overhead lighting the area. We left our bags in a designated room on the last day and were given a luggage tag and when we returned for them all we had to pay was $1 per bag + a tip (of course) for the porter. Transportation back to Newark was arranged via the booth in the Hotel Reception and we had no problems at all. The hotel is ideally situated for getting about, Subway nearby and Times Square literally yards away. Will most definitely stay at the Edison again. Had a brilliant time in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Outdated”
Reviews.Author: 1catsmeow
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a fabulous Times Square location. There are some very unique and nice things about this old building, eg. the lobby. But our room was quite outdated, particulary the bathroom, with rusty sink and bathtub. If it was just spruced up a and updated a bit with some new fixtures it would be much more comfortable. We booked it because it was more affordable than other hotels in that location and that is why. If they update it, the cost will go up. It wasn't a completely negative experience, but I wouldn't want to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, plenty of room for family”
Reviews.Author: reforlando
Reviews.Content: We stayed four days, because of a multi-date discount came early for a wedding. Due to the location, we were able to get same day tickets to two shows (half price ticket office is immediately adjacent). Also easy to get a cab from here, Starbucks, pharmacy, great pizza all one block away or less. Plenty of restaurants, all open very late. Thought it would be too noisy, but was able to sleep through the night no problem, also drapes blocked the lights effectively. Not the most modern, bathrooms need a little regrouting, but beds were comfortable, heat worked well, plenty of hot water, and the two bedroom suite was plenty of room for two adults and two teens (two closets and lots of dresser space). Staff was very nice, fixed an issue with our reservation immediately and even called to make sure we were satisfied, business center really worked great with an emergency issue that came up. I would absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: mbcomer
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights. The location is perfect and it's a very clean hotel. We stayed on the backside of the hotel and didn't hear very much noise. The cafe was great for breakfast. The deli next door was good for breakfast too but not to good for lunch. I plan on staying at this hotel next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: chris c
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights over Spring Break. The staff was outstanding: from front desk, to security, to concierge, to cleaning staff. Our room was cleaned, down to changing the sheets, every day. The check in/check out time took a cumulative 5 minutes. The kept our luggage several hours on the last day while we squeezed in a few more hours of fun. The concierge knew just about everything, and the few things he didn't, he researched and found out quickly. And everybody was genuinely friendly. The hotel was well located, both to the Theater District, as well as to a large subway station a few short blocks away, literally a three-four minute walk. If you're into the whole Times Square thing it's right there. Well, not right there, you really can't see it from your room, but it's about 200 feet to the right as you exit the front door. I was a little worried about it being obnoxious and noisy. It really wasn't. I'm kind of a light sleeper and the noise from the eighth floor never kept me awake. There's a great bagel place on the way to the subway named Time Square Bagels. Any line in the morning move quickly, but know what you want or you'll get treated like an idiot. Let's be honest though, if you're standing in line with a giant sign/menu in front of you for five minutes, and you don't know what you want, well, you kinda deserve it. Anyhoo, I'd stay there again in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: AFORD87
Reviews.Content: Arrived on Sunday 18th March at approx 6pm. The lady on reception was moody and not welcoming at all. This seemed to be the case with this lady on reception for our whole stay. We was on the 8th floor which had not yet been refurbished. It smelt stale and the decor was really old. Our room had two queen size beds which were comfy and the bed linen was clean. We looked out onto 47th street which was noisy but to be expected. The bathroom was small but served its purpose. The doormen were always friendly. The location is brilliant and I think this makes the hotel better than it actually is. The main thing was it was clean which is good and it is convenient and good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “New York New York is a wonderful town”
Reviews.Author: bonpurple
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip and we weren't disappointed. The location is excellent, the hotel is a bit run down in places but it is clean. We asked for a high floor so we heard less noise but the windows aren't sound proof so you hear everything , even 22 floors up, but to be fair its a city that never sleeps so we should have expected it. We bought the all tours bus ticket for $54 and it was great, especially the night tour where you see Manhattan from Brooklyn, be prepared for the ride over the Manhatten bridge if your on the open top bus, scary as hell! Food is expensive but the Deli next door to cafe edison is great for breakfast. Ask for doggie bags if you can't finish but want something to eat later as the meals are hugh, its the done thing anyway. Drink is expensive @$14 for 2 beers we found Hurleys up one street to be really nice and homely with good live music. Turn right outside the Edison and you are on Times sq, but if you turn left and keep walking you get to the Pier and they have a NYC yellow water cab and you can hop on and off all day for $24 and you get a great view of the Statue of Liberty on the way back.

Reviews.Title: “1st new york visit”
Reviews.Author: carol4nne
Reviews.Content: as per previous reviews i agree this has character. however it is also grubby and rundown. location is excellent and could have been better if our room hadnt had benefit of ongoing air conditioning units and generators running nonstop ouside our window.( i would have upgraded but my partner wasnt bothered). the shower did'nt always run hot which is a shame as it was quite powerful. reception staff varied between total indifference and helpful depending on shift. customer service and concierge v. helpful and happy. due to location i may try again but would probably upgrade. if you want a drink you should try the glass tavern just down road

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Brenda D
Reviews.Content: For the money you can't beat the location. Room size is small, but you shouldn't be sitting in your room anyway. Rooms are well worn, but clean and like other reviewers I enjoyed the hot shower after a long day of sightseeing. Staff was friendly and helpful. The only negative was the single ice machine that is on the second floor. I recommend this hotel to all my friends going to NYC and every one has been happy with the recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “Location location location!”
Reviews.Author: dckloftus
Reviews.Content: Bang! Your right in the middle of everything and subway stations are a couple minutes away so location was a huge selling point for us. The room was clean and decent size as was the bathroom. The room came with a comfortable bed and sleeper sofa, large tv and desk. Hotel service came with all the amenities expected from a city hotel. I will definetly book with the Edison again.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Yorkshire Dales National Park, United Kingdom
Reviews.Title: “1st time in NYC...fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: sandy1919
Reviews.Content: the hotel itself is a bit dated, but clean and very comfy beds.bathrooms small, the shower was very powerful & hot! brilliant location. the little deli shop next door was great & open 24hrs! would recommend the hop on/hop off bus or get yourself a weekly ticket for the sub, works out alot cheaper. had a fantastic time and will defo be back to the edison!

Reviews.Title: “Very Fine Hotel and Very Reasonable Price for the Location”
Reviews.Author: Gerald B
Reviews.Content: The hotel met all expectations as noted on the other Tripadvisor comments. The Leisure Room was small, but we were out exploring and watching broadway shows. The shower was fantastic. We have been to other hotels and the complaint about the showers were just trying to figure out exactly how it works. This one was easy to use and the tempature was on-the-mark. The hotel staff was very nice and the Edison Cafe gave a good, though a little pricey, breakfast. When go back for more plays, the Edison will be our first choice for booking. I do recommend this hotel to other travelers wanting to explore NYC, you definitely are in the Heart of Broadway.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location and a fine Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hoopy-Harry
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights for St Patrick's Day. The location could not be better, bang in Times Square. My room was compact, clean and comfortable all I ever ask of a room. When in NYC I expect only to sleep in my room and spend very little time there. I found the room to be too warm, however the maid explained the air con and that sorted the heat. I found the staff to be most helpful and very polite. Having read some reviews on here I thought that I was in a different Hotel. On checking in I had the option to upgrade for $10 per night but I did not feel the need. Thank you Edison, I had a wonderful time and I shall most definitely be back. TIP. I used a currency $ card for my trip in order that I did not have to carry any cards with me, when I arrived staff asked for a card for verification. I gave them the currency card, however they swiped $125 from it and I was unable to receive that back til I got home. Its common practice but thankfully I had enough cash or it could have been a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lesley M
Reviews.Content: I was worried about staying at the hotel after reading some of the reviews. Our stay was brilliant. Perfect location for sightseeing,we were given a map on arrival which helped us plan our days.We found the lifts fast, some of the reviews said they were slow, and although the hotel was full we hardly had to wait for lifts. The bathroom was small but adequate with plenty of hot water and fluffy soft towels. The bedroom was a good size but there were no tea/coffee making facilities, on future visits I would take a travel kettle. Most of the front of house staff were very friendly and our check in was speedy. I would stay at this hotel again and would recommend it to friends and family. Thank you Edison for making our stay so fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Surrey_UKSca
Reviews.Content: Great location but our room was VERY small and our basin did not work and even after reporting it was never fixed or acknowledged. No view from our hotel but not a major thing. Would be good to have tea/coffee facilities in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Greatest location in NYC!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Nutcha_Art
Reviews.Content: I think the location is so good, just 4 or 5 block from time square. The price was a bit expensive because of the location. But, there was no laundry room, the warm water sometimes not work, small deluxe room and too many people in lobby. Anyway, there was good.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Rio de Janeiro, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil
Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Alan D
Reviews.Content: Excelent Hotel, excelent location. I and my wife are happy. Thank you !!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: SMM45220
Reviews.Content: I found this to be a good hotel. The rooms are somewhat small, but they are spacious enough for business travel or for one or two people. The hotel is expensive but the value is good for the location, and they seem to often have deals available on their website. The location is great - it is right in Times Square and across the street from a subway station. The rooms were clean and the staff was courteous. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Davina D
Reviews.Content: I was quite apprehensive about this hotel having read some of the reviews and seen some of the photos other tourists have submitted, especially relating to room size and cleanliness. Yes, the room was small, but ample and there didn't appear to be any other problems. The water was only tepid for a day or so, but having spoken to the reception staff, this was rectified immediately. The breakfast in the Cafe of the hotel was, I consider, pretty poor - orange juice in plastic cup, small poached egg "swimming" in a bowel of water - however, lots of local Deli's where breakfasts much better. I consider the hotel to be average, but the location, just off Times Square and next to Broadway, couldn't be better. Some reviews commented on the lack of decent views from their window, and I agree, although we were able to see some of the billboards in Times Square, however as a base to sightsee around New York, this brought my review for the Edison Hotel up to 3 stars or average.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: debsBirminghamUk
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Edison in march for my 40 the celebrations . Stopped for 3 nights and over all it was very nice .... I would stay again

Reviews.Title: “Not fancy or large but great value and location”
Reviews.Author: carriesk
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here twice, once in 1991 and again in 2010 (it wouldn't let me select that far back) and had the same experience both times. There is something to be said for consistency. It is a great, old, art deco hotel. The rooms are small and the views are nothing to write home about. However, the location is GREAT. You are close to subway stops and just steps from Times Square. They were remodeling rooms at the time so they may have improved since then. This is a budget-friendly, convenient, New York City hotel. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Super Value”
Reviews.Author: H199
Reviews.Content: We have stayed several times at the Edison and consider it a great place for the price. We booked the winter special rates and stayed 5 nights. The first night our room was noisy with pipes banging all night. The staff were very gracious the next morning and immediately assigned us a new room. It was very quiet! The room was spotless. Mattress and linens were new. At the price we pay we don't expect a luxury hotel. This is a solid, comfortable, and very central hotel. We expect to stay here on future visits.

Reviews.Title: “excellent stay, amazing location”
Reviews.Author: donna m
Reviews.Content: me and my boyfriend went for a week stay at the edison hotel, hotel perfect location,m right in the middle of times square when u watch films or tv programmes with times square and has the big mcdonalds sign and where the ball comes down at new year the hotel is right next to this, 10 steps out the door, right in middle of everything and right in broadway to see a show ticket office again is right outside the front door, best thing we done was get the hop on hop off bus, go for the red bus not the blue one, blue bus does not have a downstairs if it rains, and wen we wnt was very windy so great to pop down stairs, also if you get the hiop on hop off, do the night time brooklyn tour the sights take ur bereathe away the hotel itself very comfortable room, some people complain that the furniture doesnt match but i look for cleanliness and as long as i have sumwhere to sleep at night im happy, but lovely hotel, some people might say its not the most upto sate hotel but i was there to see new york not insde hotel room, amazing trip, most places to eat are diners but great food and massive portions but you walk so much u appreciate a big plate of beautiful american food, and to top off my tip i got engaged so this place will always be special to me and when i come back i will definetly be returning to edison hotel, also for my mums 50th in a few months we will also retun to edison

Reviews.Title: “Re: Great Holiday & Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: amberchic25
Reviews.Content: My friends and I have just returned from NYC where we had the most amazing hol, fab time! We stayed in the Edison for 6nights and had a very enjoyable stay. The desk staff were very accommodating and helpful. When we arrived, we checked in and it was complete within 5mins, no delay! I had requested a refurbished room which we got and it was just what we needed, a huge King bed which was sooo comfortable and very hard to get out of it in the morning! :) Breakfast in the cafe which is part of the Edison was lovely, food was very nice and the price was reasonable - I would recommend the pancakes, delicious!!! The hotel is rustic and traditional but I like that feel and it had an old time grand feel!! There was security at the desk before you entered the lift which was great; he made sure the people entering the lifts were staying in the hotel. Our room was cleaned every day and we received clean fresh linen and towels every day. The hotel is located just off Time Square, fab location! I had observations about it at first, I thought there would be lots of noise but it was fine, I slept like a babba most nights! All in all, I had a great stay at Hotel Edison and I would thoroughly recommend it to people who want a hotel with a great location and a hotel with a good price tag! I will defo be returning! :)

Reviews.Title: “Would not return!!”
Reviews.Author: joppa57
Reviews.Content: After booking a four night stay at the Edison hotel, I emailed the hotel directly to confirm that I had booked a suite with two double beds and a pull out sofa bed. I received an email confirming these exact details the same day which all looked promising, how wrong I was! On arriving at the hotel, I was a little disappointed at how different, or should I say run down, the exterior of the hotel was compared to the pictures on the web and within brochures. Once inside, however, the lobby/reception area was a little better. This feeling soon faded when we began the check in process. We were booked in by the 'assistant manager' who booked us into a double room with a pull out sofabed (I was travelling with my sister and my father) on explaining that this room was unsuitable and on producing the email confirming the booking I had made for a specfic type of room, the assistant manager told me over and over again that the hotel did not operate a policy where the would guarantee a specific room and the member of staff who sent me the email was wrong to do so. On attempting to discuss the situation with the assistant manager, she constantly spoke over me telling me she was trying to explain what the hotel policy was. Not very professional or polite, I thought! The assistant manager then told me that she could give us another room that one of us could stay in - a bit of a compromise we were prepared to make until she said it was going to to cost us $229.00 per night!! Clearly that wasn't happening. On asking, again, to see 'the' manager, the assistant manager went into a back office and reappered five or so mins later when she, in a very unfriendly manner, told me she had a suite with three beds she would move us to, excellent, I thought. Where to start with the 'suite'. The bathroom was awful. The grout between the tiles was black and mouldy, the toilet bowl was situated in such a stupid postion that you had to step over it to get into the bathroom itself. The shower was little more than a warm drip. Not great. The beds were comfortable but the room badly needs redecorated. The carpets were threadbare and the walls were filthy, there was even a bootprint halfway up our wall!! In saying all this however, I must say, we did sleep very well as it was very quite (21st floor) and the bed linen was clean. And now to Cafe Edison. This 'restaurant' is attached to the hotel, I believe it is rented independently but to the average guest, one would presume that it was part of the hotel. We were fortunate enough to only enter this place once. We went for breakfast on Tuesday morning. The first word that springs to mind regarding this place is 'dire'. Service was quick, thankfully, so quick, infact, that my sister's tea cup had not even been cleaned on the outside after another unfortunate patron has drank from it!! After just one bite of my toast, my eyes suddenly locked onto the mouse that ran across the dining room!! We, quite clearly left, immediately, despite the waiter shouting that we had not paid the bill. We never did pay the bill! On complaining to the manager, I have to admit that he dealt with the complaint promptly and he himself was horrified and embarrassed by the mouse situation. Financial compensation was offered to us and accepted by us on check out. We will return to New York but I have to say, we will never set foot in Hotel Edison again and we will not recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Not luxurious but quite good”
Reviews.Author: Midaan
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a lot nicer and cleaner than I had expected before arrival. Our room was clean, nice and spacious enough for two persons. Not especially luxurious but good enough. Located right next to Times square and Broadway TKTS booth.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, Top location!”
Reviews.Author: lisapaulhumph
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 4 night stay at The Edison, and we had a fantastic stay. Dont expect 5 star when you havent paid for it! I get tired of reading reviews from people who expect to pay minimal and get luxury. This Hotel ticked all of our boxes. It is obviously in THE BEST central location. It has stunning decor, which is mostly well maintained. The rooms are a little shabby, but they are clean, comfortable and functional. Hopefully you are not planning to go to New York and stay in your room! Cafe Edison is great for breakfast. Dont bother to shop around, its good value and great food and service. The gift shop and bar are good too, and both worth a visit. We got welcomed with free wine on Friday afternoon and greeted by customer relations staff, who were very helpful. I found reception staff to be a little less welcoming, and not over friendly or helpful. But dont let that deter you, as you have a concierge, security and others who are all helpful and accommodating. Rooms were cleaned well, daily, with fresh towels and linen and toiletries. Will definately stay here again, and am happy to reccommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Standard hotel with the BEST location!”
Reviews.Author: Selby05
Reviews.Content: I stayed here a week ago whilst on a college trip! I was a bit apprehensive after reading the bad reviews and to be honest after staying here it's clear that some people are incredibly fussy! Our room was basic but clean, there was enough space for the 4 of us sharing. You could hear noise and see flashing lights from outside but you'd get that anywhere throughout new york. The decor of the hotel was amazing, a little dated but that was the style. The service was great from all staff! The location of the hotel was brilliant just round the corner from times square. It really wouldn't of mattered if the hotel was terrible because the location makes up for it - big time! The overall holiday was amazing and the hotel really contributed to it! Do not listen to all the bad reviews, it annoys me that people whinge about the decor of the hotel or the service of the staff, you are in New York city - you should only be in the hotel to sleep at night that's it! Would definitely stay here again when and if I return!!

Reviews.Title: “More than adequate”
Reviews.Author: Julesharm
Reviews.Content: Very clean even if is a bit of a faded glory. Staff most accomodating and friendly (with the exception of the hotel bar cocktail waitress!!). Rooms a bit small but this is New York - and the bed was extremely comfortable and the shower great though bathroom small and meager. Needs painting/refurbishing but a good valiue and great location. Would recommend

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Convenient Stay”
Reviews.Author: Carolyn82
Reviews.Content: We travelled to New York for the first time last week and had a 4 night stay at the Edison Hotel. We booked a Queen room through Expedia (best rate we found) and requested a renovated room via the hotel. On arrival, check in was quick and friendly and we were allocated a room on the 17th floor. Our overall first impression was indecisive as to whether we had been given a renovated room or not, as parts of the room were a little on the shabby side. However, the room was clean, relatively spacious with a huge, very comfortable bed, nice bed linen, and a large television. The bathroom was on the small side and the bath itself was very small, however the shower over was nice and powerful which was great. Even though we were on the 17th floor, traffic noise could still be heard 24/7, but this is New York and only to be expected (we took ear plugs with us which cut out the noise so we slept well). We had breakfast at the Edison cafe once, and found it to be quite good in terms of food choice and cost. Service was very efficient and we weren't kept waiting, even though it was quite busy. There are computers for guests to use on the ground floor for a charge, however both checking-in online and printing your boarding pass is complimentary, which is extremely useful. There is also a travel desk and a computer terminal near reception so you can book a car/shuttle etc back to the airport (we found it was a little more expensive than booking direct with the shuttle bus company at around $27 pp to JFK, but this was inclusive of tax and gratuities). There is a comfortable seating area by reception, and someone will call you when your transport arrives. You can also leave your luggage at the hotel after checking out at a very reasonable 50 cents per bag.There is a little shop in the hotel where you can buy snacks, papers and gifts, which we found to be cheaper than the other touristy shops in the area. On the whole, we would recommend this hotel if travelling on a budget. The location is fantastic, being just steps away from Times Square and the TKTS booth. We had a comfortable stay and found the staff to be friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Some check-in problems - but still a great value and location!”
Reviews.Author: Bandit-One
Reviews.Content: We spent a week here during our stay in NYC. It's the third time we stayed at the Edison Hotel. We pre-booked the room long ahead through our travel agent and we got a really good price. The staff was very helpful when we arrived with our car (and loads of luggage). But then the Check-In: We did book a room for two with a queen bed. The quite unfriendly desk staff told us there's only a double-bed left (smaller than a queen). We argued a while but then decided to take it anyway. But then we went to our room....what a shock! It was so small, the bed did barely fit in there and was tiny. The furniture and bed looked so old and tired. And we almost couldn't fit our luggage in the room. We couldn't accept that. The other two times we were here we got much bigger rooms with a much newer interiour. So my wife went back down to the front desk and told the we will not accept this. We booked long ahead, we stayed here before, we will stay for 7 nights and will not accept this room. If not, we want our money back and stay somewhere else. After a few minutes the manager stepped in and....surprisingly there WAS another room available. A lot bigger room with a King-Bed ... the room was more than twice the size of the other one. After that our day was saved and we could enjoy our 7 nights in NYC. The Hotel itself is dated, but the location is, for this price, unbeatable! The room was clean and actually really big (by NYC standard). The bathroom was also a quite dated, but clean enough. And even though the Hotel is so close to Times Square, we had quiet nights here and a really good sleep. We had a good week, after a pretty bad start. It's comfy, it's safe and you just really get great value here. Staff is helpful and nice (not counting the Check-In). We sure would stay again. But just be aware that room sizes and qualities do very much vary obviously. Check your room and, if you're unhappy, insist on getting a better one. Wanna know more about my trips? Click on my profile or visit: route66traveler.jimdo.com

Reviews.Title: “Edison hotel time sq”
Reviews.Author: suzisanchez
Reviews.Content: "Hell is murky, and all the devils are in it" I luckily managed to get a room upgrade easily so do ask for one if unhappy. (had booked queen- size revamped room...got a dungeon! ) .Reception staff seem to be on some kind of anti-depressants on the whole...glazed eyes and confused expressions tinged with a hint of annoyance. security men are great though. Great pianist in the bar, which was cozy and atmospheric. My upgraded room was a dream! My original dungeon was a thing that will haunt me forever though. Great location, nice lobby area, good shop and deli attached. Just stick up for yourself if you do stay there, and you will be fine. Had to fight through Expedia for my refund for swapping a night due to flight delay. Reception staff seemed deliberatley obstructive in regard to this and denied ever hearing about my 24 hr flight delay!

Reviews.Title: “Budget Bargain”
Reviews.Author: sannie09
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Edison last week, 26th Feb to 1st Mar. I got a great offer on Expedia, 350 Euro for 4 nights for 2 people in a double queen room. Anytime I go to New York, I stay in this hotel, the location is excellent, it's on 47th Street, right on Times Square. It's only 5 blocks to Port Authority ( about 7 min walk), where you can get the bus out to Woodbury Commons. The hotel is about 3 stars I think. It's clean, central and usually quite reasonable. The staff are friendly and efficient. There is a restaurant and a diner attached to the hotel, the diner is handy for breakfast and its cheap and cheerful. Next door is a deli shop, we had lunch there one day (got a nice salad made up). The only flaw is the noise at night time, depending on which room you are staying in, the rooms at the back of the hotel are less noisy. Obviously New York is the "City that never sleeps", and there's not much you can do about the constant car horns and noise levels, but the windows seem to be very thin. But for me, overall, the price and location out weighs any negatives, and I wouldn't hessitate to recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Dont stay here”
Reviews.Author: Maria M
Reviews.Content: I will not be staying here again, have been to New York often, love it all, but this hotel is a never go back hotel. Overpriced with rude staff who do not want to know, dismiss you quickly. Bathrooms so small that it enables you to wash your teeth without moving from the loo seat, should you be so inclined. They like to charge for every single extra you can imagine - full size bath towel, leaving your luggage on last day, etc etc, never known anything like it before. Have stayed in better hotels for lot less, so go past this one and keep on searching.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location - but shabby, no service and way too expensive!”
Reviews.Author: purple_dk
Reviews.Content: Having frequently used The Hotel Edison since 1969 as my ”home base” whenever my way has been taking me to the Big Apple - it was only natural to stay here once again during my last stop-over. This time, however, shall probably likewise be my last one as I have to admit that I no longer find price and product matching. The hotel was worse than ever as to décor and service. Nothing has really happened here since my very first stay way back – apart from escalating prices! On the positive side you find no better location. The Edison is a few yards from the hustle and bustle of the ever alive Times Square and hence the perfect place to stay if you are in town for sightseeing and theatre. All major theatres are minutes of leisurely strolls away only – and last minute tickets can be purchased at the booth right on the square at affordable rates. The many sightseeing buses have their regular stops here too - and you can easily walk the short distance to the “must-see” places such as elegant 5th Avenue, Central Park, Park Ave., the impressive Rockefeller Center with lovely cafés, restaurants and shops and fantastic Radio City Music Hall for grand shows and concerts. It’s really difficult to find a much better location, if you are to explore the Big Apple. But – there is really nothing nice otherwise to be said about the hotel as such. In spite of several refurbishing rounds, it looks still very old and shabby. The regular rooms are tiny – even compared to European standard – which says a lot. You can hardly squeeze a double bed with a single side table into the rooms, that seem dark and uninviting. The bathrooms are likewise tiny and look like they have been painted over and over without anyone having removed the old peeled paint prior to. I can really say nothing nice about these rooms apart from it being a place to put your suitcase and drop your head for a bit of sleep. Being in a typical old New York building your view is likewise most likely to be the room across from you and with really nothing to look at and keeping light out. The rooms have no facilities to mention and are lacking security boxes. You need still to go down to the reception and ask for them to store your valuables in a vault – meaning having to queue additionally up whenever you need any of your stuff or need to open/close your box. Service has never been the big deal at this hotel – but now there isn’t any at all. We had to wait rather long at the check-in counter to catch the interest of the clerk, who was chatting with his colleagues rather than tending to the guests. No porter was called to help us with our luggage (not a problem for us being European, but pretty odd at an American hotel especially as they have a bell-boy desk…). I’m sorry to say, that it’s sad to see such a hotel with so much potential not caring for neither the property nor its customers. Next time I’m in town, I’ll look up alternatives – there got to be better deals and value for your money than The Edison. Sorry.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel/Excellent Price”
Reviews.Author: NYCADK
Reviews.Content: Rooms are small (in a European hotel sort of way, but absolutely spotless. We prefer some atmosphere, rather than a impersonal chain hotel, so The Edison is absolutely wonderful. The lobby is an absolutely standout gem, the doormen are super friendly, the coffee shop/restaurant is a NYC classic, Sofia's lounge (site of a scene in The Godfather) is friendly and old school, and the upscale Rum Bar is fabulous. In the evening, room keys are checked, and no one is allowed up into the elevators without a guest's permission. You cannot beat the location. Sixty steps from the center of Times Square. (I counted!) Right smack in the middle of the Broadway area, with the city at your feet. Absolutely wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: TheatreWill
Reviews.Content: My family and I really enjoyed our stay at The Edison Hotel. We have stayed there a combined four occasions. We love that the hotel is in the heart of the theatre district. The location is very convenient and within walking distance of many great restaurants. There is a nice little shop next door with food, drinks, toiletries and anything you might have left at home. The hotel gift shop is reasonably priced to pick up in last minute NYC souvenirs you might need. The hotel was very nice about holding our bags both when we arrived before check-in time and on our final day while we went out before heading to the airport. The hotel has a solid, trustworthy feel. We have stayed in different types of rooms and enjoyed the smaller suite the best. Great experience overall.

Reviews.Title: “Pros: great location and clean. Con: Rooms are very small and very shabby.”
Reviews.Author: BasiLisaB
Reviews.Content: Rooms were shabby and small but **immaculately clean**. Location can't be beat. We were impressed by the lobby, service was efficient, but very disappointed in the room. Smallest room I've ever stayed in. Smallest bed, and smallest bathroom, too. I could touch each wall without moving from one spot. Carpet, wallpaper and paint were very worn. Bathroom door required a full body-slam to open from the inside. But on a whirlwind weekend trip, we were hardly there. Location was convenient enough to pop in and out in between activities. And at the end of the day, all we cared about was that the bed was clean and the bathroom was spotless. The hotel should pay the cleaning staff very well, because that's all the room had going for it. Air conditioner drowned out most of the outside sound. Heard the occasional siren or vehicle, but not bad, considering we were on the 3rd floor. Strange sounds from the pipes, during the night, that woke me up twice. Bed was hard, but I like that. Blanket was the thinnest I'd ever seen, and no spare blankets or pillows were provided. But we didn't need extra blankets, because the hot water pipe in the bathroom gave off so much heat, that we had to keep the A/C on "cool" -- in February! We closed the bathroom door and enjoyed our own private dry sauna...

Reviews.Title: “This is the one - yes please!”
Reviews.Author: tom o
Reviews.Content: The Edison hotel has everything . Stayed for a week in late February Booked a wonderfully comfortable 2 double bed ensuite room which was spacious & was was made up every day to perfection . Great coming back to the room after a lot of sight seeing to find the room as pristine as the the first arrival time . The bar on the ground floor proved to be a real bonus.Live Jazz every night & frequently at 6 pm also . No need to search for entertainment , it was right on your doorstep Location is superb right beside Broadway & Times Square . Downside ? yes- a bizarre shuttle service which stopped about 5 times around the city centre collecting other passengers .It took 2 hours to get to J.F.K . Beware! Otherwise this hotel is number 1 & I will return very soon

Reviews.Title: “Great location, ideal hotel for a short stay in the Big Apple!”
Reviews.Author: BuffyRocks
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated just off Times Square near to the show Ticket Booth and the M&Ms store, so is in an ideal location for exploring. The hotel has an Art Deco style which fits in perfectly with the style of New York. It's a massive hotel with about 20 floors. The check in was simple and straightforward and there is an elevator to take you up to your room. We stayed on the 14th floor. The hallways are painted neutrally and the room has plain coloured neutral walls, a plain green carpet and the bed was firm with very, very soft pillows. I found the room to be very warm in early March, which is when we travelled - so were glad to be able to open the window. Being so high up there was very little street noise. The ensuite bathroom is what you would expect from any standard basic hotel. The shower is over a bath and apart from regular temperature changes it was fine. This hotel is absolutely fine if you want a no frills budget hotel in the heart of the city which is clean and comfortable. The hotel also has a concierge who can tell you anything you need to know, an adjoining cafe which is reasonable for breakfast and a jazz bar with live music for that late night night cap.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Louise P
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent out honeymoon here in June of last year, on arrival I loved the 20's look of the hotel, and was pleasantly greeted, we checked in with no problems and went to our room, which, unfortunately was very small! We weren't very happy so took our luggage back down to reception and asked if we could change rooms as we weren't happy, the staff couldnt be more helpful, lots of appolgies and moved us to a larger room right away. The location is fantastic, just round the corner from times square, and the little diner attached to the hotel is lovely, my husband and I had breakfast there every morning! Overall pleasant stay and the staff were very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again for sure”
Reviews.Author: SonnyJay
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 24th - 28th Feb 12. Excellent location, right in Times Square. Easy to walk to Radio City, Fifth Ave, Central Park and Empire State. The room was small but thats what I expected from NY but very clean. Fab shower!!! The check-in staff were friendly enough, not over the top but efficient. You had to show your room card to go in the lifts which I thought added extra security. We never used the cafe but the rum bar was nice for a drink at the end of a long day. When you check out you can leave your bags for the day at a cost of 50c a bag. I thought this was very cheap so we gave the guy a bit more.. they were very helpful. The rooms are not modern but completely fine for a short break where you will just be sleeping in the room. I have read some reviews on this hotel about noisy pipes - we never heard this but it is something I have come across on previous visits to NY in different hotels. Go to the visitor centre in Times Square, they are very helpful in there!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - not very friendly”
Reviews.Author: MoabRiverlover
Reviews.Content: The room was small, but I'm a solo traveler who usually stays in small hotels or hostels and don't mind that as long as it's clean, which it was! The staff was not unfriendly at all, they just weren't friendly either. They all seemed very tired and were just going through the motions until their shift ended. The location of the hotel was perfect for walking everywhere and there is a metro station a bit over a block away, which was very nice. I would recommend this for an independent traveler who is resourceful and self-reliant, definitely not for someone who needs a bit more maintenance.

Reviews.Title: “I realy enjoyed it”
Reviews.Author: DoronMilano_Italy
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location, logical price, clean & the personal is kind & helpful. The only negative point is yhe age of the hotel so don't wait for modern furniture, bathroom is small.

Reviews.Title: “Dreadful, not recommended”
Reviews.Author: Mrs87
Reviews.Content: We spent a 6 night stay in this hotel for our first trip to new york at the end of Feb 2012. The location of the hotel is great as its in walking distance to most things to see. After a delayed flight we arrived later than planned to new york and decided that we would get some sleep before exploring the city. On first appearances the room looked ok, maybe a little dated, not the queen bed or refurbished room we had requested but the view made up for this a little. Someone had left the bathroom window open which was making the room quite cold as it was late, when my hsuband tried to close it the window fell out on him in the bathroom - quite a death trap to be honest with potential to seriously hurt yourself or someone passing by on the street below if it fell the opposite way. We were prepared that being so close to times square that there maybe be some noise in the room however we weren't prepared on the noises from the hotel itself - after falling asleep I was woken in fear, in my sleepy daze I thought someone had managed to get into the room while we were alseep and was now crashing around in our bathroom, as my husband went to investigate it turned out to be the heating pipe in the bathroom that ran between floors (I would explain this to sound like someone hitting a scafolding pole repeatedly with a heavy duty spanner), this started off our first sleepless night as it would eventually stop banging after 10 - 15mins and then start again about 20 min's later. We got what sleep we could and in the morning complained and asked for someone to have a look at our room. After explaining the situation to reception the reluctantly sent someone up to have a look, he arrived promptly, looked at it and immediately proceeded to explain that there was nothing he could do as it was the heating pipe for the hotel and it would proceed to make the noise every 30mins as thats what the heating timer was set to and it may make these noises more frequently if it is could outside as it is set to maintain a certain temperature. After complaining further the reception reluctantly changed our room but couldn't understand what all the fuss was about as apparently this is the norm for new york hotels! Room 2 - seemed to be closer to times square as your could hear the police cars clearer starting and stopping their sirens trying to get through the traffic. However we were now woken up our neighbours each time they would run any water (sink, shower or toilet) which would sound like they were in the room with us. Certainly in our own room you wouldn't want to have a wash in the sink or take a shower if your partner was still asleep and wouldn't dare flush the toilet as this would end is an extremely loud vibration and bang after the bowl emptied. In the end we gave up and decided not to continue complaining as the chances of finding a room of good standards in this hotel seem to be slim and although our second room had its problems it was the lesser of two evils. The room keepers are dreadful, the do not understand what the do not disturb signs mean as they would continue to enter the room, on 3 nights they knocked on our door in the early hours of the morning (with the sign on the door) attempting to give us bedding that we hadn't requested and would not appologise when they were told they had the wrong room, one on occasion not even the floor number was correct let alone the room number. Generally the staff are unhelpful, especially the door man how would scowl at you and even go to the extent of walking away from the door without opening it for you when your hands were full with bags etc. The bar was in our opinion exspensive. We tried once to enter the small shop that was reported to have essentials but it was closed. The reception was more often than not unhelpful. Conceirge were helpful enough however I would not suggest getting theatre tickets from them as they are expensive and can be brought cheaper elsewhere. After all the other problems with the hotel I wasn't happy about trying the hotel restaurants and preffered to eat elsewhere. The hotel does offer luggage storage after you check out at a rate of 50c per bag per day however one or two of the bell men will expect a high tip as I was listening to one requesting tips from others storing their luggage. I would not stay in this hotel again or recommend to anyone. I feel let down by the positive reviews that are given for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “would return to this hotel”
Reviews.Author: livelife29
Reviews.Content: Stayed in hotel end of Feb 2012, room wasn't ready when we arrived and we had to wait an hour after normal check in time. I had booked a deluxe room, don't feel that it was deluxe, it def needed upgrading, bed covers, floor covers etc needed to be changed. On saying that the room was decent size, bathroom small but perfect. Great power on the shower. Hotel is in great location. Out the door and just on Times Square. Concierge Andrew was of great help to us. For price and location this hotel is fine a little outdated but would return here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in NYC”
Reviews.Author: Dave F
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Hotel Edison on several occasions, most recently in February 2012, and have always had a very nice stay. The rooms are clean and comfortable and many have been upgraded. The amenities were fine and the housekeeping excellent. The staff is friendly. I especially like the fitness room and also the Cafe Edison, which is a great place for breakfast, lunch or dinner. I also enjoyed Sofia's, the Italian restaurant in the building. You cannot beat the location, especially if you are in NYC to see some plays. This is not a "fancy" hotel but it is perfectly adequate and I would be very happy to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A well deserved 3 star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PADGETTS
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Edison for 4 nights, middle Feb 2012 and it was a decent hotel. It is very dated and nothing modern in sight, but it is very clean and comfortable. We upgraded to a deluxe room which i think is just a double room with a sofa in and maybe a bit bigger but hey, it was only a small fee to upgrade. The location is superb, smack bang in the middle of times square, literally 30 seconds walk round the block and you are where all the lights are! Overall the hotel is more than good enough for a short break to new york and to be honest you don't spend that much time in your hotel. The staff were more than friendly enough but most American people are. We had no issues while we were there, we would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Book this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MJR733
Reviews.Content: Definately the best hotel in NYC to stay at if you are on a budget! Great staff friendly and helpful, the best location ever if you want to be in the middle of it all, nice comfortable room and beds, I stayed with my teenage daughter and we stayed in room 1103 11th floor which had 2 double beds the room was clean, well decorated and enough space for the 2 of us. I have stayed at many hotels in NYC and I will definately be returning to the Edison. NOTE: Email the hotel before your trip and ask for one of the newly refurbished rooms and if you have paid for a twin room ask for the beds to be doubles! Great bar attached and good cafe. Don't listen to the bad reviews they must only come from people that have nothing better to do and spend thier life moaning about things. Cant wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Georganne S
Reviews.Content: Whenever we visit NYC (which is several times a year) we have been staying at the Edison Hotel on Times Square. Granted, it's an older hotel but we find it very, very clean and comfortable. We've always had good service whenever we needed help. We usually reserve a "combo" room - 2 bedrooms with one bathroom and it gives us a little more room. We, also, eat breakfast (and sometimes lunch or dinner) at the Edison Cafe. It's a typical NY eatery but the food is usually pretty good and so are the prices compared to many other places. The Edison Cafe has been host to a number of celebrities. We like the fact that it's close to all the Times Square "goings-on". I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and price”
Reviews.Author: Otnorot
Reviews.Content: I will simply reiterate what the other traveller's have said. This is an older property and it shows its age. We booked it for the great location, the reasonable price and as we don't spend much time in our room anyway. I understand they're renovating and we were hoping we'd get a nice updated room. We laughed as the twin bed room we got looked like the room our kids slept in at our grandmother's. The heater was unplugged when we arrived so the room was cold. Once that was fixed the room was too hot. Oh well, no big deal. Just know what to expect and that you're not looking for luxury or a hip place (it ain't the W) and you'll be good.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal for the $$”
Reviews.Author: J-Boy99
Reviews.Content: Stayed mid week for about 120$/night. Staff was helpful. Great location and decent bar. Rooms are small but clean. I had one (?queen/double) bed and that was enough for 1 person. Would definitely come back if the $$ is right.

Reviews.Title: “Nice art deco, close to Times Square, large rooms”
Reviews.Author: Amsterdam_Chris123
Reviews.Content: I only stayed one night at this hotel for a business conference but I enjoyed it. The hotel is close to Times Square which allowed me to take a walk and visit this sight despite my strict schedule. The hotel staff was quite friendly, the rooms spacious and clean. The room furthermore offered all amnesties one needs during a stay in a hotel. Would definitely come back again!

Reviews.Title: “2 nights on Broadway”
Reviews.Author: Mark526
Reviews.Content: 1st review but hopefully many more to come I spent a lot of effort finding the right balance of location, value and quality for our family of 4. Pleased with ... location - 100 yards or so from Times Square; security - were asked to show our key before entering elevators, large 2 room suite but very tiny bathroom Disappointed with ... Shower could not provide a balance of hot or cold water, morning 1 was just plain cool water, morning 2 my wife practically scolded herself (I didn't attempt a shower on morning 2 because of the issues In the middle of the 2nd night we were awoken by load banging in the bathroom. There is a silver pipe in the corner that comes out of the floor and extends through the ceiling. The noise was inside the pipe. I touched it and it was no less than 200 degrees (Perhaps it supplies hot water or is part of the heating system). The noise stopped but it was unsettling. I did not speak to front desk about water or the noise since I'm not one to complain or make a scene. At checkout the clerk did not ask if I was pleased with the stay (had he I would have shared my concerns).

Reviews.Title: “Great Service , cant wait to return”
Reviews.Author: Loubirkett
Reviews.Content: we booked this after changing hotels after reading bad reviews. This was recommended to me by friends who stayed there two years ago. We booked a suite 2 with two single beds and a seperate living area. Cant fault the room yes its not modern but its a 1930's art deco hotel if your looking for glass walls and stainless steel bathroom fittings then try the W hotel next door. Our room had a lovely charm to it and yes the bathroom is small but it more than enough for what you need to do in it. I pre ordered the balloons and cupcakes for the room upon arrival, they were not there unfortunately but one call to reception and Marla Edgar came up within 10mins with them and also a breakfast and cocktail voucher which was unexpected but very appreciated. The staff from the reception desk to the concierge were very helpful and polite. My only complaint was the price of the wifi which we didnt use at nearly $4 for 30mins is excessive and i noticed upon checkout you can become a member of the hotel for free and one of the perks is free wifi. So i will look into this if we ever return to New York. Overall i would highly recommend this hotel its right on the doorstep of times sq and is perfect for sight seeing.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Rienhart
Reviews.Content: Near theaters, hop on hop off bus stop, shopping and restaurants, the Edison is a perfect hotel for first time visitors to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jackiebur
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here before and found it very comfortable and clean. Staff friendly and a good bar downstairs. Staying there again in a couple of weeks and looking forward to it!! Its also an excellent location and very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Good Times”
Reviews.Author: Justnotcricket
Reviews.Content: Great location and good value. We had a view of Times Square but were high enough so that the noise wasn't a problem. The room was comfortable, clean and serviced efficiently. The staff were friendly and helpful. We'd stay there again. It's probably a 4.5 rather than a 5 because, as others have noted, the furnishings in the room were on the tired side. However, we had a great holiday and the hotel played its part so I'm opting for an "excellent" rather than a "very good".

Reviews.Title: “Excellent price, great location”
Reviews.Author: bjp76
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful but busy. The reception area lives up to its pictures of deco art and beautiful lounge area. The rooms are slightly tired, but I believe the price reflected this. We did have a heating issue (other reviewers have mentioned this) but after our first disturbed night we were moved quickly to a room on the other side of the building - it is clearly an issue they are aware of. Excellent cleaning staff who took pride in their work. The Rum Bar is fab - live piano jazz / blues every night - dangerous for a girl who likes cocktails. Edison Cafe is a bit tired but the food is fresh and service excellent. We didn't use Sophia's restaurant as we wanted to eat at other locations nearby. On returning to the hotel day or night we were required to show our room key to access the elevators, this is an excellent idea as the hotel is very near Times Square and it gives a feel of security. (Reception area toilets also needed key for entry.) Room key also gains entry to the fitness suite at the top of the hotel which is well equipped with machines (no pool or spa - asking too much of Manhattan I think!) Loved this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very cheap but suffered from bites :(”
Reviews.Author: Jas83
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week in February with family. The location is fantastic really close to times square and the staff were helpful but you have to be willing to tip well for good service. Our room did appear to be clean (a little shabby and old looking but that was to be expected with the price as it was very cheap), however I did suffer from bites more than likely from bed bugs which did spoil the experience. So if you are going to stay here be sure to cover up because the bed bugs will bite.

Reviews.Title: “Smelly room”
Reviews.Author: Ihskane
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Edison from 16th to 20th of February. Even though the location is great the room was a terrible dissapointment. We were on the 12th floor and the room was smelling musty. The linen were also smelly and one of the sheets had old blood stains + the blankets were wourn out. We had problems with pulling up the blind until my husband fixed it. Its a shame that the hotel is so worn-down since it has a potential to become an example of a beautiful Art Deco style hotel perfectly located in the amazing New York City!

Reviews.Title: “Times Square Historic Hotel right i the heart of the action!”
Reviews.Author: gigicleveland_Ohio
Reviews.Content: I just 'did' Times Square for New Years Eve and loved that my hotel was literally 200 feet away from all the craziness. It was easy to get to, and on New Years Eve, relatively not a bad price. Also, it allowed us a haven, right in the middle of the action. No one without a hotel key could enter the building that night, so it was awesome to be able to find a 'safe' spot, without crowds to return to that night. The staff is excellent, and professional. It is a historic building, and in it's lobby is the famous Edison cafe, a typical New York cafe, frequented by many stars, with simple fare, but the best blintzes on the planet!

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: hotelharpy
Reviews.Content: I think the Edison is the first hotel I have stayed in which lived up to expectations. It is not a luxury hotel and doesn't advertise itself as such. But it does have excellent staff, clean and tidy rooms and that wonderful location, on a quietish side street but within minutes of Time Square and all its facilities. We booked a suite and asked for a refurbed room. We were not disappointed with our corner suite on the 17th floor. The beds were surprisingly comfy and the bathroom, although small, had a very hot shower. We just needed somewhere to hang our towels and it would have been perfect. As everyone says, you don't book here to spend all day in your room and it is perfectly placed to explore Manhattan. We always breakfasted in Cafe Bene, on the corner of 49th and Broadway I think, which had lovely waffles and a backroom decked out with books which was peaceful away from the hubbub. We will definitely return to the Edison!

Reviews.Title: “Close to Times Square”
Reviews.Author: JDWLOO
Reviews.Content: This hotel is older and is in the middle of a renovation, but the location and atmosphere of the hotel is great for New York.
