We've stayed here several times and keep coming back, as the location is perfect for Times Square and TKTS is only a 1/2 block away. The price is awesome for the location.

Reviews.Title: “A little disappointed”
Reviews.Author: MaryC66
Reviews.Content: Our first encounter the minute we arrived, we found that the employees behind the reception desk to be a bit rude. The rooms were advertised as having coffee makers in each room. When I asked the front desk about it, they said they do not provide coffee makers in the rooms. I love my coffee when I first open my eyes in the morning. Our room (actually the entire hotel) was so hot we had to keep the air conditioning on at all times. Our room was very clean but very small. In the bathroom, there was not much room to lay out your toiletries, and we had a lukewarm shower in the morning. Also, they only gave us one pillow each, and it was flat as a pancake. We had to prop our heads up with rolled up bath towels. Needless to say, we will not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “4 night stay, small but fine”
Reviews.Author: sezSussex
Reviews.Content: hotel is perfectly places for times square and lots of attractions. Diner attached is good for breakfast, they also deliver to room and there are 2 deli's on the same street to buy supplies. The room I booked was a queen suite which had a very larege bed, think it was a king as it was 3 pillows across, and a small 'double' sofa bed which was fine for 1. There were only 1 adult 2 kids aged 10 and 12 so was fine but not have got 2 kids in sofa bed. No kettle, v small bathroom but almost all new york rooms are like that from my experience. Gym ok, had to pay $10 for 24 hrs internet which was ok....starbucks across the rd has free wifi!! It was clean and pleasant, all you need when you are out all the time Thomas cook did the best deal at the time and lots of rooms have the same room rate so you may get a bigger room for same price. My mother had a queen room and the bed was a small double, only good for 1 in my opinion! Got New york pass which worked well, walked to water taxi and there was a guide on board was very informative about all the tourist places.

Reviews.Title: “Manager not very helpful. Excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: Selenna25
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Edison Hotel from 10 - 15 feb with my husband and teenage daughter. I booked a junior suite. When we arrived at the hotel there was a mix up with our room and I was advised by the receptionist to speak with the manager on duty (Val) who apparently could resolve the problem. However it turned out the Val the manger wasn't very polite or helpful and didn't make any effort to resolve the problem. In the end we had to stay in a room which we didn't book. Having said this the rest of the hotel staff were extremely polite and helpful throughout our stay. The location coundn't be any better. Excellent restaurant and cafe on site. I would recommend this hotel however if you encounter a problem don't speak with Val if you want a positive outcome.

Reviews.Title: “Recommend this hotel - we want to go back!!”
Reviews.Author: sandals37
Reviews.Content: The bad points first - there's only 2.. the bed was extremely hard and there wasn't any coffee or tea making facilities in the room (however none of the hotel's we looked at offered coffee making facilities either).The location was brilliant, right on the corner of Times Square, but quiet at night. The room was cleaned every day with fresh towels supplied. Security was excellent - very polite and checked door cards every time. Reception staff extremely helpful. We would stay at this hotel again if we returned to New York. we did think the restaurant attached to the hotel was expensive for breakfast (we only ate there once) but on the corner of Time Square there is a local cafe called Carve. highly recommend breakfast and other snacks there. It was the fraction of the cost, freshly cooked and offered very good value. It's open 24 hours a day and we never saw it empty in our whole stay. Be very aware of sales people approaching you to sell tourist sites and theatre tickets, our experience was they were more expensive than buying direct. We got caught out at the Empire State building with being offered a combination ticket for Skyride and Empire State. Just go for Empire State as the 'ride' works out at $32 each for a 15 minute simulated ride, that was of very poor quality. Lastly, we found purchasing a subway unlimited week ticket was invaluable for getting around the city. It's hard to explain in words how amazing New York is, we had a brilliant holiday and would love to return again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Lost in the 60's”
Reviews.Author: Lillyput918
Reviews.Content: My husband and I arrived at this hotel on a Saturday evening. Entering the hotel we thought it was a real find because it was really stunning, very nicely decorated, helpful staff. It wasn't until we rode up to the 8th floor and entered our room that we were so disappointed. The room was small, the decor dated, and the beds ... OMG! I think the mattress had to be at least 40 years old and the bedsheets were yellowed with age and had a musty smell to them. The bathroom was so small you could barely turn around in it and looked as though it hadn't been updated in decades. I have to say the room was clean but I can't say anything more positive than that. The hotel is definitely a great location for sightseeing and the price was very good. Don't eat at the little cafe inside though because the prices are ridiculous for what you get ... $17.00 for breakfast for 2 and we hardly had anything. The cashier and waitress were not very friendly either! Plus factors were the staff in the lobby. The concierge was magnificent; the security staff very kind and dedicated. You have to show your room key to be able to get on one of the 6 elevators. The doorman was the best ... he was helpful, kind and solicitous. Stay here if what you want is to do the sightseeing but don't expect to rest well in the beds after a long day of walking around the city. By the way, they charged us $60 to park our car, when a much lower price was advertised on their internet site.

Reviews.Title: “edison hotel new york,yes please.”
Reviews.Author: splottboy1970
Reviews.Content: myself and my partner louise stayed here 12th to 15th feb 2012,straight away i will say it is a busy hotel lots of nationalities here,our room wasnt ready for some reason so i said i will take what they got for the moment and get it sorted following morning,our room was on 9th floor,great room just to tye us over.also complementry breakfast vouchers for the duration of our stay for the inconvinence,tidy.following morning duty manager as promised sorted out our room and upgraded us to a junior suite,even better,stayed in 17.15 fab room.apologies but i lost the names of duty manager that morning and doorman but big thanks to front desk youssef and agnes in transportation who delt with us very well,cafe edison is a little gem,all the staff very friendly and there egg n bacon breakfast was exellent,first time ever as well exellent tvs in the rooms.everything in this hotel was clean and very comfy beds.good idea with staff next to lift to check your door card,all of staff on duty were very polite.dont even get me started on location!!!!!!!!!!!1.just turn right out of door you are on times square.turnleft you have on the corner ny tours red buses,very funny guides and theres a deli on the corner that does the best pizza ive ever had.if anybody reads this review take it from me,this is a good and busy hotel,oh, go to meanfiddler pub also.thanks again edison.fab hotel.love j p osborne and l cotterill.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: Melony F
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at the Edison for 3 nights while in town for one of the many Broadway shows. The hotel staff gets a big mention here.. They were all so great to us, made us feel welcome from the minute we pulled up outside, till the moment we had to say goodbye. Our room was comfortable, we had 2 queen size beds and there was plenty of room for all our things. I see most people comment about the bathrooms being small, but we had no issue with it. The beds were comfortable, the linens were clean, and the pillows were nice and soft. The location is superb! So many things within walking distance, but trust me.. you need more than 3 days to see it all! Thank you Hotel Edison for helping me make my daughter's dream come true, we will be back someday!

Reviews.Title: “Best value and location in Times Square”
Reviews.Author: KathiHBCali
Reviews.Content: The location can't be beat -- 3 subway lines within a block, close to theaters, up the block from TKTS and some great Irish pubs. The hotel is old, but clean and well maintained with small bathrooms, comfortable beds and very decent prices. I always feel safe when I'm at the Edison and can only conclude that it must be a great place to work since some of the staff have been there since my first visit in 1999. The deli (next door to the hotel) is getting better every year -- a good spot for a quick, but cooked to order, breakfast before heading out to see the rest of the city. If you are looking for luxury this isn't your place, but if you want a comfortable, safe place to stay with easy access to everything the city has to offer, at a reasonable price, the Edison is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Surprise”
Reviews.Author: burlbeach
Reviews.Content: Terrific place! location for shows is the best! Rooms a bit small, but who cares if you are going to be going to shows? Very comfortable king bed with nice linens- The Edison was a surprise to us, as we remember the days when this location was "iffy:. Walked to MOMA as well as to and from Grand Central, so no need for taxi. Will definitely return!!

Reviews.Title: “6 Star Location. Super comfy bed. But could do with a lick of paint.”
Reviews.Author: webster34
Reviews.Content: We did 6 nights here and went for it because we wanted the 1930's art deco feel, plus we got a good deal on an hotel slap bang on Time Square. The room was a little tired and in need of updating, but it was clean and comfortable and the bed was super comfy. The location was excellent. We literally walked out of the front door and straight onto Times square so we were made up. Not to mention Patzeria Perfect Pizza was pretty much right next door. (except for the weird Scientology Church and it's even weirder minions mithering you every time you walked past). We were only a few minutes walk from Hell's Kitchen and all the little bars and restaurants that made most of our nights. As expected the service we received at the Hotel was very good and The Edison Diner served superb reasonable priced food that set you up for the day. Overall I was very pleased with the hotel considering how much we paid and if I head back to NYC I'd probably look into staying here again. It could do with renovating but then maybe it would lose some of it's 30's charm?

Reviews.Title: “Great location but lacking comfort”
Reviews.Author: jeff p
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located right in times square which makes a short trip to New York to see Broadway plays and shop easy. However the rooms are quite old and not in a way to preserve character. The worst part of the room is the windows, they are double hung windows that are probably about 30 years old and the weather stripping is shot on them, so any sound outside goes through them like they were open, and they dont do a good job at keeping the heat in. our room was around 16C/61F the whole time. the bed we had was a king but it was a fairly cheap quality mattress

Reviews.Title: “Treasure on Times Square”
Reviews.Author: Shwetabh K
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Hotel Edison in February 2012 for 2 weeks. I booked it because it was very cheap and was right on the Times Square. I was expecting a poorly kept, shabby hotel. What else can you expect for in less than $100 a day on Times Square? However, upon arrival in hotel, I was pleasantly surprised by the hotel. It is a hotel at one of the best locations, well kept, very safe, very friendly staff, decent rooms, clean bathrooms and with all the amenities. Yes, hotel does need some renovation but it is not bad either. I really loved this hotel and recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great option”
Reviews.Author: El J
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Edison Hotel in January, a kind staff( yes at the elevators if you don't show them your room key and just pass by, they ask for it in a not so cute way, but its for your safety), clean, nice lobby, and we got a recently upgraded room (very nice room for the price- no bedbugs, no mold, no night noise) They were remodeling some rooms on our floor but we didn't had any problem with noise or whatsoever (although we were away from the hotel all day ) Location= superb (20 meters away from Times Square) Price= excellent. Would definitely book Edison's at our next trip to NYC. (note for the internet people..WIFI is 9.99 for 24 hours, you can get free wifi on a starbucks right across the street)

Reviews.Title: “OK - But great location”
Reviews.Author: finn0802
Reviews.Content: Me and my sis in law stayed in this hotel for 4 night, we booked a twin room. For a location this hotel is great, out of the doors on 47th street, turn left and you are right on Times Square - wonderful! The room itself was ok, fairly basic and could do with a refresh of the paint etc in the room and hallways, we were on floor 8 of the hotel. I would stay again with my husband as I would be curious to see what the double/king rooms are like. On a slightly negative note the temperature in the room had a mind of its own, it was freezing one minute and roasting hot the next, but this is a very minor thing. I would say that the hotel and Expedia suggest that there is a safe in the room, this is not the case, its a safety deposit box in reception. Overall its a nice hotel, great if you want to be close to Times Sqaure and all thats nearby.

Reviews.Title: “First time at the Edison and won't be the last.”
Reviews.Author: Neil S
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Edison for the first time from 31st January to 6th February and were delighted with our stay. We normally go cheap and cheerful and book in to Milford Plaza when in NY but decided to change to the Edison a week before our stay as we had the option of taking a suite for a little more than what we were paying at the Milford. We were not disappointed with this decision. The Milford is currently a building site and would have meant for an awful stay in NY. In comparison, we found the Edison to be peaceful, relaxing, friendly, clean, and an ideal location. As one of our party has not been keeping great health recently, taking a suite was the ideal decision as it meant he was able to relax in much more comfort. Yes, the room was a little dated but you get what you pay for -if I wanted super luxurious, modern quality I would have gone elsewhere and paid three times the price. That said, the suite was clean, comfortable, the bed was soft, the bathroom well stocked and clean, and we really couldn't find fault. I have read reviews on here of construction work going on - I was not aware of any work going on in the hotel, maybe we were just lucky. Will we back? Oh yes. The Milford's loss is the Edison's gain and I look forward to our next stay with great anticipation.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Great Staff!”
Reviews.Author: Traveler2121
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Edison Hotel for over 20 years; my most recent stay with some cousins was between Christmas and New Year's. We checked in Dec. 27 and checked out Jan 3. The staff behind the desk were quite courteous at check-in. Our room was ready when we arrived. (The sales/reservations staff had helped us out in an extremely kind gesture due to changes in our reservations related to a death of a member of the family who was also a long-time Edison patron.) The two room suite worked out fine for the three people in our party, with a sofa bed in one room and a queen bed in the other. The bathrooms at the Edison are not huge but they serve their purpose. The Edison is a New York institution, built in the era of Art Deco. Their lobby is a prime example of spot-on renovation and restoration with New York murals on the walls in the style of the 1930's. It's a classic theatre district hotel. When you choose the Edison, it is not going to be the Ritz Carlton as far as furnishings, but the price is not going to be the Ritz Carlton either!!! The Cafe Edison is my favorite New York breakfast spot - the waitstaff are friendly, fast-paced and pure New York. Sofia's, a restaurant and bar in the hotel, offers great cocktails and conversation. The crowd seems to be a mix of locals (some who work in the nearby theatres) and tourists. The Edison's location is prime. You can be in Sofia's at 7:45 PM and stil make any 8:00 PM curtain in the theatre district by walking there. It's also near to the N/R subway station on Broadway and 47th St. There's also a great 24/7 deli next door to the hotel on 47th Street.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but Comfort Upgrade Needed”
Reviews.Author: jsaint625
Reviews.Content: We recently took a mini family vacation up to NYC and stayed at The Edison because of its location. It's right near Times Square which was a huge plus. The staff, especially Gio and Bobby at the front door, were outstanding. Unfortunately, the hotel is in need of a comfort upgrade. The mattresses in our room were hard as a rock, probably left over from 1931. We also has breakfast at the hotel. The prices were cheap and the breakfast came out quick, maybe a little too quick. The wait staff were very attentive but the quality of the food should have been better. I also tried the hotel bar one night. Unfortunately, I tried to take my $11 glass of wine back to my room but I was told it was against the law or hotel policy.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Edision”
Reviews.Author: Cork2004
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is the best aspect to it. It is right next to Times Square. You couldn't ask for a better location. However the room was somewhat dated - furniture, etc. It came as part of a package deal and offered good value for money. This hotel is ideal as a base for visiting/touring NY by day.

Reviews.Title: “You can't beat this place”
Reviews.Author: Stuart S
Reviews.Content: Location location location! Great staff. Very accommodating and attentive. Room clean and beds comfortable. Bathroom clean but small. NYC hotel rooms are somewhat small in general and I suppose the Edison is no exception but when you're in NYC why are you in your room? My third visit. The price was very competitive (end of January). They have valet service and the car will cost you $45.00 p/day to park. Not cheap but convenient. Internet access not included just under $10 p/day. Otherwise a very good value and I will continue to be their guest when I'm in town.

Reviews.Title: “Not Brilliant...needs customer service improvement”
Reviews.Author: laura2306
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location, rooms very dated and tacky, not like the website shows but clean enough if you are on a budget and dont want to spend too much time in the hotel. the staff were rude, they didnt have a record of our booking so i had to get proof out and due to this our group was split and we all had to share double beds not single which wasnt ideal. for the 3 days we were there every single time we went back to the room we couldnt get in, we asked reception and they sent security up with us and explained we kept getting locked out due to the room not being occupied ( they still didnt book us in) this did get annoying but when i dared to compalin i was met with glum faces and "cant be bothered attitude" fair point i wouldnt be back in a hurry as a smile costs nothing. but we were on a budget and didnt spend too much time there so wasnt really an issue.

Reviews.Title: “Location! Location! Location!”
Reviews.Author: Carol E
Reviews.Content: My daughters and I came to the Edison on the recommendation of a friend. We couldn't believe the location as we were dropped off at the door. We were a little early for check-in but the front desk was able to find a room for us. This was just the start of the welcoming atmosphere that we found at the Edison. All of the staff that we dealt with, from the front desk to the concierge to the wait staff in the adjoining restaurant were very friendly and helpful. It is an older hotel but the rooms are clean and the beds are comfortable. Times Square is practically outside the front door and we found we were able to walk to many of the sites we wished to see. I have raved about this "find" to one and all and would definitely come here again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Choice”
Reviews.Author: Jonathan V
Reviews.Content: I am a longtime New Yorker, born and raised in the city, but have been away for a few years. I went back (with my husband-to-be) to spend a few days as a tourist in Times Square before our City Hall ceremony. He had picked this place out months ago because its reviews were good, its prices were low, its location was stellar, and it had deep connections to local theatre history. (As well as to film lore, since Luca Brasi of "Godfather" fame was garrotted in one of the downstairs bars.) We found the staff very friendly, actually. We thought the place was clean, and it looked great, especially the lobby lounge. As for the location, it's convenient to everything the city has to offer. The Rum House downstairs offers exceptional cocktails and live music. The Cafe Edison is a cute old-school diner. And Sofia's is a quaint, less "in your face" dining/drinking experience. Check-in is at 3pm, so plan ahead. And go in the winter to take advantage of some genuinely outrageous discounts. (The price of our stay dropped TWICE before our visit! Keep your eye on the website!) This place may not have all the amenities of the other souped-up NYC hotels, but it's definitely a great choice if you want to save money without accumulating sketchiness.

Reviews.Title: “VFM!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: JonoXL
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a stay at The Edison and have to say the overall experience was very good. As most have stated in earlier posts the hotels position in Times Square is fantastic, right in the centre of it. Now for the hotel itself. Booked the hotel through its own website as I found no other site could match it on price, (winter special I think). Booked a room with two queens as it was the same price as a double, queen or king. Requested a renovated room after reading some of the posts here. The hotel stated this could not be confirmed as they allocate room on an availability basis. We arrived at the hotel at approximately 2.00pm, went to check-in which was quiet and were allocated our room right away. Up to our room which was situated on the 14th floor. Our room was huge and seemed very nice. It overlooked the Barrymore theatre roof and looked into some offices and apartments but was not too intrusive. Even at 14 floors, if you are a light sleeper, you'll struggle to get any shut eye due to the noise from traffic horns, sirens and party people out having a good time. The bathroom was adequate for our needs but was a bit dated. The lobby areas are very nice and there always seemed to be plenty of staff on hand for any queries you may have. Found the all the staff I had dealings with to be pleasant. Liked the idea of having to show your room key before you could enter the lifts. Used the cafe attached to the hotel a few times for breakfast. Good sized portions and friendly staff. Used the bar once it was ok. For what we paid, we can have no complaints and would recommend this hotel and will use it again if we are looking for a hotel in Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Rating”
Reviews.Author: Jean Marie W
Reviews.Content: My husband and I enjoyed our stay at the Edison Hotel Times Square for its friendly and accomodating staff and affordable room rate. We're seniors on a limited income. The hotel is in a great location. Our room was clean and attractive and. we enjoyed having a restaurant and cocktail lounge on site. We will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable & Cozy!”
Reviews.Author: lightitup
Reviews.Content: I recommend this hotel to anyone on a budget who is traveling to NYC! It's just steps from Times Square, has an awesome restaurant inside of it (Cafe Edison - suprisingly good. especially the matzo ball soup) and is super affordable.

Reviews.Title: “Worst bed ever”
Reviews.Author: W_citytripper
Reviews.Content: The only good thing about this hotel is the location, almost on Times Square. The staff was not very friendly, we arrived around 2 PM and had to wait in line twice to then hear that we had to wait until 3 before we could check in. So we asked whether we could leave our luggage and maybe use the restrooms which was frowned upon as if it was such a strange question. We returned to the hotel after 5 and after waiting in line again, we finally got our room. When we got back late at night, there was a safety control to check whether you were a guest of the hotel, which is fine but not when they start shouting when you can't immediately find your hotel key. The room was tiny and very outdated. The room looked very shabby and definitely could use a bit of paint. There were no available outlets except for one almost at the ceiling in the bathroom. The bathroom was very small, you almost had to get into the bath tub to be able to close the door while you were in there. The bed was horrible, I woke up with the worst back ache ever. The next day we checked out and went to another hotel, as there are better hotels located nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: DanishCritic
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. I've stayed there with my wife and teenage daughter several times now. Clean and nice. And an absolutely great location without to much noise. Be aware of room sizes and rating. Check with the hotel and several hotel booking sites before booking. Great and affordable breakfast cafe.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable hotel in Time Square!”
Reviews.Author: Lizivipa
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at this hotel for my birthday weekend, which was surprisingly close to Time Square. Valet parking was expensive $60 per night. But we got a great deal for the rooms. The staff was very courteous and fast. The room was perfect since we were not planning to stay in our rooms only to sleep. The only thing was that the bathroom was a bit small. I will definetely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Old and shabby, but you're at Times Square”
Reviews.Author: NPOConsultant
Reviews.Content: This ancient art deco property retains some of the glamour of an earlier, grand era, but the rooms are shabby, worn, and rundown. Small bathrooms, ancient fixtures, inability to do much about temperature control. But the prices reflect this situation, so you get what you pay for,

Reviews.Title: “Such a great location”
Reviews.Author: littlemissmoppet
Reviews.Content: A week before departing we changed our booking to the Edison and were so pleased we did, the location is super, 3 subway stops very nearby and a great cafe for breakfast, what more could you ask for. Our room was adequate with two double beds for the 3 of us, clean and comfy beds if a little bit noisy from the street, but hey this is New York the city that never sleeps. Staff were friendly and even got us a limo back to the airport for the same price as a taxi. Would definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: C C
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with the accommodations. It was my friend's first visit to NYC and she will definitely stay there again. The rooms were clean and the beds were comfortable. Several rooms were being renovated during our visit on the 5th floor.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: Ecze
Reviews.Content: The hotel has great location. Rooms are very clean and satisfying. Hallways need renovation, if you care the hallways:). I would recomend for anyone who doesnt want to spend fortune for hotel in Time Square, Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Saved the day!”
Reviews.Author: Hannah J
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff really went above and beyond to assist my husband and me during our stay at Hotel Edison. We were travelling from Canada en route to Puerto Rico for a cruise and decided to spend a day in NYC. Well, that seemed like a fantastic idea when we booked the trip months in advance....not exactly the case when I found myself 6 weeks pregnant and sicker than I have ever been in my life. I had a miserable flight down from Canada, was horribly ill and on the verge of a complete breakdown when we arrived at the hotel at 8:30am. I had checked in advance about early check-ins, due to the popularity of the hotel and being at full capacity nearly all the time, they don't do early check-in. I spoke to the gentleman at the desk, explained the situation, and begged for a room so I could lay down and try to beat the morning sickness. I can only assume I was some pale shade of green at the time. He took one look at me and started clacking away on the keyboard. Within 60 seconds he handed us a key and asked if there was anything else they could do to assist. I burst into tears I was so grateful and thanked him profusely. The room was great, king sized bed, sitting area and a retro bathroom. Once I was able to sleep for a few hours, we spent a lovely afternoon exploring the Big Apple. I cannot thank the staff of the Hotel Edison enough for such wonderful and compassionate customer service. I will reccomend them to anyone I ever speak to regarding accomodations in NYC and will certainly return for another visit down the road.

Reviews.Title: “Location amazing”
Reviews.Author: Tenners208
Reviews.Content: Worth the money as you could spit to times square as it is so close. Within a walk of central park too. The hotel is in need of a face lift but for the money it's fine. You could choose to stay at the pricey W hotel next door, but of you are like me and my fiancé it was just somewhere to put or head down as we were just on the go constantly. NYC is my favourite place to visit and I have been to the Caribbean a food few times, all over Europe and up and down the uk. Also I have travelled in America and have found NYC to be so in your face cultural I don't know how anyone could fail to fall in love with this, the capital of the world. Don't expect 5star luxury from the Edison, however expect lovely staff and a clean, safe place to stay. Also the rum house is a cool step back into prohibition as an old school speak easy. Had some serious benders in here. Enjoy people!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A great 5 days in NYC”
Reviews.Author: Janey871
Reviews.Content: The Edison Hotel staff made my time in NYC a very happy experience. The housekeeping staff is wonderful, the rooms are very clean, and the concierge staff is so helpful. I was able to print my airline boarding pass at the end of my stay which is wise to do before you leave for the airport. The doorman, bell captain, and front desk staff are employees who greet you with a smile. It is a secure hotel. Yes, it is located in a prime location, but it is the staff who I will remember. I will select this hotel for my next NYC trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, average rooms”
Reviews.Author: 29Lu
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Edison over Christmas. We found it to be a little run down but as we did not spend a lot of time in the room it didn't matter too much. Could not beat the location if you are wanting to be near Times Square. We were surprised that we did not hear more noise from the streets. Rooms were comfortable although a little on the small side for families of 4. Staff were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Central location but very poor service”
Reviews.Author: Desman31
Reviews.Content: The hotel is half a block from Times Square, i.e. a dream location to set up your HQ for visiting NYC. That's the only good point. When we arrived from Europe after a long trip we found a room that was freezing cold. We had to keep our jackets on, like being outside (this was in December !). We couldn't find the commands for the system so we went to the front desk to ask for a solution. They said they will send someone... One hour later we asked again, then nothing again. In the end we asked for extra blankets (there was none in the room) and when the maid knocked at our door we got... extra pillows ! Tired after a very long day/trip and desesperate we finally fell asleep to wake up at 5 am, frozen to the bones. Hence after breakfeast I asked to change room, The new one was much warmer. The heating system was not blowing cold air, which was a big plus, but it was not heating either. We gave up and decided to go enjoy the city. In the evening the room was no much warmer, so I went down to the front desk again and a miracle happened : one of the clerk actually knew something about the heating system. You had to open a grid in the bottom to access the controls. Hallelujah. Despite these adventures I have to say that the bathrooms I really tiny and that the waiters at the restaurant are not very nice. Overall this was a bad experience, I am not happy with the lack of help from the front desk and and I will not go back there.

Reviews.Title: “A TERRIFIC TIME IN MANHATTAN”
Reviews.Author: Daniece C
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Edison Hotel because it was close to Times Square and Broadway. I will definitely stay there again anytime I travel to NYK. The location was perfect, the lobby really nice, the attached Sofia Ristorante was delicious and the staff there is great. We even went downstairs to Club Cache.....great treat.

Reviews.Title: “Two weeks in NYC with 3 Aussies”
Reviews.Author: HelenSteady
Reviews.Content: As stated by other reviewers, the lobby has been updated but the culture shock begins when you exit the elevator at your floor. Sad can be the only description. We had booked a Combo Suite and received an email before we arrived asking if we would like an upgrade. Of course we said yes. My 26yr old son wanted to know if this was an upgrade, what was the size of the room we would have got before. I explained that this is NYC and unless you pay lots and go for something a lot newer, this is what you get. I didn't mind the size of the two rooms. With three of us the fold-out bed was used and we had to ask for more blankets in order to make this a little more comfortable. The hotel was great and gave us a fridge and we bought a kettle so we were able to have tea/coffee/breakfast in our room. What was a shock was the size of the bathroom. It was possible to sit on the toilet and have a wash in the basin at the same time. To climb into the bathtub needed clever manipulation. I can't say for sure but I think the floor probably wasn't vacuumed in all the time we were there. I was there a number of times when the room was serviced and it seemed a very rough and ready clean. Would I stay again? I'm not sure. However, it really is well situated for everything on Manhattan. The staff (doormen, front desk, security) are very good. The Edison Cafe is good value and the deli beside the hotel came in very handy a lot of times. Hopefully, plans are to update all the floors. Once again, would I stay again? Based on what I have just said I probably would.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: A C
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a place to crash in the evening and have a decent night sleep this is the perfect hotel for you! decent prices at an amazing location, no deals like that. nice service and good value for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Value, Value, Value at Times Square”
Reviews.Author: Veteran's wife
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been going to the Edison for many years on our annual sojourn to NYC. The lobby has been updated and the rooms are in decent and clean condition. It's the value and location that are impressive. Step out the door and you are right in the middle of Times Square. The staff are especially friendly and the price can't be beat. Just one note to considerate, though - parking is very pricey - $45 per night. But this is times square and you won't find parking much cheaper anywhere in this location. I can't speak highly enough of this hotel. It is old, historic and charming.

Reviews.Title: “Loved staying @ the Hotel Edison”
Reviews.Author: cindy g
Reviews.Content: Our son turned 21 on New Years Eve. We had stayed @ The Hotel Edison previously & we were anxious for our family to enjoy this momentous occasion in New York. We had the times of our lives. This hotel is nothing fancy but very comfortable & you can make your way throughout Manhattan easily. The staff is efficient @ their jobs, the rooms are clean but dated. Will stay again when we return in the future. The concierge Andrew is no jerk (as a previous review stated) & quite dedicated to his job! I had worked w/ him for several months prior to our visit. He spent countless hours researching possible events to celebrate our son's birthday & I found him to be professional.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel right in the heart”
Reviews.Author: dixoncaroline
Reviews.Content: The Edison Hotel was an excellent hotel for my 3rd trip to New York, we had a double queen room for 4 women which was more than adequate, clean and tidy, maybe another socket or 2 but that really is the worst thing I could say, no interrupted sleep comfy beds, the location is absolutely brilliant couldn't be any better, turn right outside the hotel a few steps and your there Times Square wow, didn't use the cafe/bar, hotel arranged transfer back to Newark :(( brilliant choice for anyone on their visit to New York and would definitely recommend The Edison to anyone and will be booking it again on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: stephuk1982
Reviews.Content: have just returned from new york after spending a week at the edison i can defo recommend this hotel as after reading the poor reviews on here i was abit nervous regarding staying here. We arrived and we couldnt check in until 3pm so we left our bags in the baggage hall and went to explore, we then returned to check in and we were given a room which was a little dated due to the fact that i had requested a refurbished room i was a little dissappointed so i returned to the check in desk and explained to them i wasnt happy and within seconds i was given a fantastic room which was spotlessly clean and was cleaned everyday which was fantastic as this is all we wanted as we knew we wouldnt be in the room very often.Rooms were spacious and enough room for me and my friend. The hotel could be updated but if you go to this hotel you can clearly see this is in the process of happening, We are looking to return next summer and would stay at this hotel again without a second thought. Reception staff, door men and all the staff were very polite and always went out their way to speak to us which was good. Location wise this hotel is fantastic, right at the end of the street is time sq what more could you ask for. Would recommend this hotel to anyone who asked me where was good to stay in new york and yes i would return to this hotel. If you get a chance to see a broadway show go and see the lion king as this was a fantastic show.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and location, hit-or-miss beds”
Reviews.Author: RoyalsFan60
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a near-perfect location close to Times Square and the theater district, this is the place for you. You're greeted by a classy-looking lobby when you enter the hotel, and I found all the staff there to be friendly and helpful. My only warning would be in terms of the beds, which can range from very comfortable to very hard depending which room you get. Our first night proved to be less-than-comfortable as we got a hard-bed room, and had difficulty figuring out how to cool off the room. We reported our concerns to the front desk staff and they were very helpful and apologetic, offering to show me several rooms they had available to see if there might be a room with softer beds. We found one that fit the bill, and spent the final two nights there sleeping comfortably. They also gave us the first night free due to our concerns with the room discomfort, which was nice. My advice is to sit or lay down on the bed when you check into the room before unpacking, to make sure you have a room with a comfortable bed. Some of the rooms have been recently renovated, but some of them have hard beds too. We also requested a room facing away from the street on a higher floor, and weren't bothered by any street noise. There's also plenty of elevators, so we never had to wait long for one. There are computers available for guests to use for a charge, but not as expensive as some other hotels I've stayed at. There's also a coffeeshop there in the hotel which serves reasonably-priced food. And again, the location puts you close to Times Square and several Broadway theaters, as well as many restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “The Edison Hotel New Years Eve 2011”
Reviews.Author: lynnelizabeth
Reviews.Content: Great, affordable, clean hotel with amazing staff. We had a wonderful time!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location !”
Reviews.Author: Kate H
Reviews.Content: We were told that the location of this hotel was good - but we didnt realise how good. You are literally 2 minutes from Times Square - but we didnt notice any noise from our room. Dont worry about any negative reviews - we had a great time. The hotel is all Art Deco and feels like 'Old New York'. The room was on the small side but we were out by 9am and home late so it didnt matter atall.

Reviews.Title: “LOVELY HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Deeg D
Reviews.Content: We read many reviews about the Edison before we booked our Thanksgiving trip. The most consistent comment was small rooms and since we were going to be there almost a week, we went smart and booked a suite. The nite we arrived it was late and pouring rain, the front desk staff was wonderfully pleased and most helpful. Our room was VERY pleasant AND overlooked the parade route! Throughout our stay the hotel and staff lived up to every expectation...with one exception, the concierge! Though this was our first time to NYC, for the most part there is endless information on what to do and how to do it. The one time we needed assistance, we went to the concierge, big mistake, what a jerk. No matter, we decided we'd make it without him and went on. Overall, GREAT HOTEL! Thank you Edison!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel right in the heart of New York!”
Reviews.Author: CWR2210
Reviews.Content: Travelled to New York in December 2011 and was slightly worried reading the reviews on here....load of rubbish! we had a great stay, staff were friendly and helpful at all times apart from the manager in Sofias who I have to say was extremely rude to us. However, that certainly didnt spoil our stay! rooms were adequate and comfortable and views were great. the hotel is just minutes away, no, make that seconds away from Times Square so excellent location. The bar is lively and the cafe does some lovely food and deliver tea and coffee to your room if requested. All in all it was a great stay, great hotel and great staff! We will definately return to the Edison.

Reviews.Title: “Older hotel but GREAT location”
Reviews.Author: Sdtravelers619
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a nice place to sleep when you are in new york, this is the place to stay. Its very inexpensive and close to everything. It is an older hotel so you can hear all the pipes but its not too bad. Times square is one block away. There is a nice little bar on the bottom that is fun too.

Reviews.Title: “Edison Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Orlando00
Reviews.Content: I bought this on Sky Auction for three couples - we stayed 4 nights - October 1 - 5, 2011 Was very happy with the price, but was apprehensive because of negative reviews - Considering the price of less than 150 per night including taxes! and in Times Square! - it was a steal! Sure the hotel was dated, but the rooms were great - much larger than I was lead to believe, because of the negative reviews. Would definitely stay here again - its just around the corner from the Marriot Marquis, and only one half block off Broadway

Reviews.Title: “BEDBUG infested!!”
Reviews.Author: Jeanne999
Reviews.Content: I left this hotel with bruises on my legs from scratching my BEDBUG bites !!! Rude staff, tiny rooms, and FYI, art deco in a hotels description actually means that they havent changed a thing in the last 30 years! The best thing about this hotel is it's location.... But it's not worth it...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel. Superb location and very clean.”
Reviews.Author: JennHen
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Edison Hotel over new year and was very impressed! After reading some of the negative reviews on trip advisor I was a bit concerned the hotel would be awful. But thankfully that was not the case. The twin room we had was a good size by NYC standards and spotlessly clean. Yes it was a bit dated but the location more than makes up for that. I had a fantastic stay and would Definitely stay here again. Excellent hotel excellent location excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “location”
Reviews.Author: Laura K
Reviews.Content: On our recent visit to NYC we stayed at the Edison - I was afraid of bedbugs but was very pleased at how clean and upgraded the rooms were. I stayed alone in my room but I was not afraid at all. I felt very safe. One point rooms have a deadlock but could use a security chain to use if checking the door. Staff very friendly - I like the security of having to show my key before entering elevator. Location is the real bonus - you are steps from times square and being there at Christmas and New Year's made it all the better. I would definitely recommend it and stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Reasonable Rates, Some of the Industry's Best Staff Members”
Reviews.Author: John R
Reviews.Content: I've been staying at the Edison ever since I was a student at Syracuse University, when I would run down to 'The City' to take in a couple of Broadway shows on the weekend. Now I can afford more opulent venues, but go back to the Edison out of loyalty. It's just steps from the TKTS stand, offering reduced prices to the finest shows. I love the Art Deco lobby, which has been restored beautifully. The Edison has some of the industry's very best staff members. They include the ever wonderful Gloria Pierrot, Guest Relations Coordinator. There is nothing which this marvelous lady can't do and she does it instantly and she does it with a smile. Ania Cabrera, the Housekeeping Floor Manager, too is someone right from heaven. I have allergies; so, she always ensures that I have the appropriate pillows. By the way, she gives me brand new ones. As a result, i sleep better at the Edison, than I do at my home in Beverly Hills.

Reviews.Title: “great price; great location for theatre!”
Reviews.Author: Hillary_9
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Edison is steps away from the half-price Broadway theatre ticket booth on Times Square and within a few blocks of all the major Broadway theatres. With the newly up-graded rooms, the hotel now has extremely comfortable beds with lovely bedding in their newly carpeted rooms. (ask for an upgraded room.) Nice lobby; helpful staff. Plenty of nice elevators. Can't beat the price for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: danielle g
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to NY. I had tried to keep my expectations low, because I had read mixed reviews about many hotels in NY. It was a good thing I did. Our room was very very small, outdated, and the bed and pillows were horribly uncomfortable. What I will say is that the room was clean. The location is unbeatable, we walked everywhere. The staff was also very friendly too. I do realize that the hotel was doing renovations when we were there in December 2011, but our room had obviously not been renovated yet. I have definite plans to return to NYC, but am unsure yet if I will return to the Edison. I am not a snob, I do not need a luxury hotel room, but I do need a comfortable bed!

Reviews.Title: “Poor customer service too”
Reviews.Author: Humphriesout
Reviews.Content: I communicated with the hotel who promise via this site to look into matters. Truth is though, the hotel didnt want to know about my problem at this hotel as previously described. The travel company I booked this night of hell with in the UK, Travelbag have given me £100 compensation for the hell we suffered at the Edison. You have been warned. The hotel is poor. The customer service is poor. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, clean, cordial.”
Reviews.Author: Donna M
Reviews.Content: I had not been to NYC in 40 years - since I was 18 - and really didn't know what to expect for such reasonable rates. I had all pleasant surprises. The location is amazing. Standard double room was small, but clean, and the beds are VERY comfortable. Felt very comfortable with security. Staff was efficient, helpful and cordial. Lobby is small, but has beautiful art deco decor, and holiday decorations were traditional and beautiful. Will definitely return to The Edison, and I plan to make a NYC visit quarterly to make up for those 40 years.!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: robbo2118
Reviews.Content: Excellent location for exploring NYC. Staff very polite and helpful. Room was very small and dated however, location more than made up for this. Would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in NYC!”
Reviews.Author: Jtwist37
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location! Walked everywhere! Felt safe! Hotel is very clean and comfy. Will definitely be back! And will definitely recommend to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location”
Reviews.Author: jo_hadley
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as a family of 4, mum, dad and 2 20+ year old daughters. This was a special family holiday as our youngest daughter was 21. We stayed in a two bedroomed suite. The hotel itself was ok, the room could have done with a bit of updating but after a day out and about in New York all you need to do is sleep! Even though the room looked a bit tired it was cleaned every day so no worries there! The location is fantastic, right next to Times Square, which makes London look like a little village! Short walk to central park which was beautiful (did the carriage ride :0) and plenty to keep you amused in Times Square itself! Had a good day shopping at Canal Street which was a short taxi ride. Went on the ferry to Liberty Island and Ellis Island which were both amazing. A good tip for all you Brits, there is a deli a couple of doors away from the hotel where you can get a decent cup of tea anytime for a couple of dollars and take it back to your room! In the deli they also sell a hot serve yourself deli, we filled up a couple of trays and sat on the viewing steps on Times Square and just sat and watched the world go by, amazing! Would definitely stay here again as its clean and location is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel Right in the Heart of Times Square”
Reviews.Author: Michelle M
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the Edison Hotel on Times Square. We had a fab time. Location is excellent and for New Year's Eve on Times Square it was a must. We were able to get right into the heart of the action as we had our key card from the hotel with us on the night. Staff in the hotel were really professional and extrememly friendly. There was never a problem when we looked for anything, from the front desk to security, bell boys and cleaning staff everyone was so helpful and went out of their way to assist in any way they could. Would definitly recommend this hotel for your stay in the Big Apple!!!!

Reviews.Title: “new york”
Reviews.Author: yvis59
Reviews.Content: Although this is an older Hotel it is full of character and the staff are so freindly and helpfull. It can be a bit noisy but thats only because you are in the center of everything that is New York. Times Square is right on your door step. Loved it all

Reviews.Title: “Convenient!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jessica S
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel could not be any better. It took 3 attempts before we were able to check in to our room because the maid service was still there. We were offered a different room, but after finding out that our room was a renovated room we decided to wait until it was ready. We're patient people and did not let this affect us, but instead decided to venture out to Times Square and Rockefeller Plaza since they were so close to the hotel. The hotel room itself was nice and clean. The bed was not comfortable, but we were so exhausted at night that we feel asleep easily. Bathrooms are small, but sufficient. I saw people complaining about the outlets and while there were few outlets, it wasn't that big of a deal. I think we often get used to rooms having more outlets than we know what to do with. I suggest requesting a renovated room upon check in and then don't return until you're ready to call it a night...soak up the city!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: peterj911
Reviews.Content: They say that location is everything, and that's definitely the case with the Edison Hotel just off Times Square in New York City. Literally steps away from the Red Steps and the Broadway TKTS booth, the hotel's site on West 47th Street is about as convenient as you can get to the center of the Times Square action. So it was a pleasant surprise to find that a moderately-priced (for NYC) property could also be such a pleasant place to stay. We were refered to the Edison by family who had stayed there previously (and who we were meeting in NYC at the hotel for a family celebration). They called it "adequate." But the lobby was lovely with its Art Deco theme, and the front desk staff was friendly and helpful. The lobby was bustling when we checked in, but the wait was not long and our room was ready even though we checked in prior to 3PM. Yes, the Edison is an older hotel, and some of the rooms (including ours on the 16th floor) are very small and somewhat tired. However, we're aware that the hotel is in the midst of room renovations, and that they simply had not reached our floor yet. Regardless, the room was more than adequate for our needs. One very positive aspect of this room (the first of two we stayed in during this visit) was the shower in the bathroom. Our experience with hotel showers is generally not good, and we didn't expect much this time, but were very pleasantly surprised with the excellent water pressure, as well as the height of the shower on the tub wall. My wife and I are both tall, and the shower was a wonderful treat after a day of walking the streets of New York. We had our 16th floor room for one night, and then checked out so that we could re-check in under a different reservation when the rest of our family joined us. Our second room was on the 5th floor and was much larger, and had obviously been renovated. Shower was just as good there, too, though! Another observation about the Edison is that the elevators were speedy--there are plenty of them, and we rarely had to wait more than a few seconds for one of them to arrive. We'll definitely consider the Edison again when visiting New York.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Service & Staff”
Reviews.Author: Vera S
Reviews.Content: Though I have not had the pleasure of staying with the Edison, I hope to share in the experience some day. Fortunately, I did have the opportunity to call upon the Edison for a generous favor, to which (without hesitation) management instantaneously stepped up to the plate. I hope one day that many more establishments can boast as big a heart and as dedicated a team. Cheers

Reviews.Title: “A gem--- large rooms, great experience”
Reviews.Author: AggieAuthor
Reviews.Content: I just got back from the hotel. Stayed there four days between Christmas and New Years. I had stayed two nights at another hotel in NYC (Park 79 at Central Park) and moved out because it was a horrid experience. I felt lucky to book this hotel online at short notice, and honestly did not have high expectations. The price was lower than some of the hotels in the area, so I truly went with low expectations. I am traveling with my college-age son. When we walked in, we thought they might have messed up our reservation because the room was huge (compared with the one we had just checked out of--- for the same price). It was set up as a suite with a pull out sofa/sitting area, which was perfect for a parent and teenager. The location was great, the concierge was great, and it was a nice experience. Okay--- let's shoot straight here. If I was traveling for romance or for business and money was not an object, this might not have been my choice because it is an older property. But for families or those on a budget (I use the term loosely because the hotel was still a couple hundred a night-- but budget compared to those around it), you really can't go wrong. I do not know if all rooms are arranged as suites, or if you have to reserve it. I did have the option of a 'regular room' or 'delux'. I chose delux because it was just an extra $10 per night. I checked their web site and see that if you aren't trying to stay there during Christmas week, the rooms are actually very reasonable during normal times of the year. Great value. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Roadtrav
Reviews.Content: Great service, great price, great location! Old city charm and luxury in the modern hustle and bustle of it all! Everything made easy from the moment we pulled up!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: highbrae
Reviews.Content: Have stayed in hotels from $39 to over $3,000 per night and for NYC, this one is priced where it belongs. We traveled down with a bus tour run by McCoy Bus Lines from Kingston, Ontario for the first and last time. Be prepared to trip, bodycheck or just shank your fellow passengers if you want a good seat because according to our guide the Bus line doesn't care and you are on your own. For the price I knew I wasn't staying at The Plaza and I didn't. I assume when the tour company squeezes them for prices they give the old unrenovated rooms to those customers. I would look forward to visiting on my own as I think the service can be very impressive under the right conditions. 1) The Room: 919 - Old unrenovated. New windows. Plumbing and furnishings that were new when Hoover was in office. Sheets were clean and no signs of tiny livestock (on us or linens) older oversized closet (walk-in is a stretch) nice size however the anti-theft hanger system is a pain if you travel with your own hangers. Bathroom was the same vintage as the beautiful lobby although not as well maintained. No Bar Fridge (although, their web site says I will have to leave a credit card to use the fridge or the phone) and no WI-FI without the $9.95 per day charge. Disappointed that I couldn't check with home in Canada without extra charges in roaming fees, rooms phone charges or Internet access. Our view was awful however, I have no doubt there are worse views and you are staying in Manhatten so just what view do you expect for what you are paying? 2) The Hotel: It's New Years Eve in NYC, they have one ice machine in the entire hotel (really!?) and it's broken. So not impressed. The lobby? it is a work of art and I so wished the rest of the hotel lived up to its promise. I know they are trying to keep up the renovation work and I know it is not easy to get everything done as quickly as people want, they could be a little more honest with their web site and show what they offer today. Not what they will offer in the future (renovated rooms) or what they offered many years ago (the views from their rooftop of Times Square which have been blocked for years). 3) The Location: A 5 minute walk from times Square when we were there for New Years Eve was a huge bonus. Theatres all around, and most a very short walk, first rate for that advantage. 5 - 10 minutes down 46th takes you into Restaurant Row, choose your cuisine and price range and you will find it, many Zagat rated. 4) The attached Coffee/Breakfast shop. Is a downtown city, breakfast eatery. It's fast, cheap and average. If you want the Waldorf go there and pay $25 for Eggs Benedict not $9.95. One warning, like much of NYC the gratuity is included so watch your tipping. 5) The concierge staff: A complete waste of time, tried to recommend Midtown Cigars when I was looking for Nat Sherman, not in the same league. Couldn't do anything for theatre tickets other than rack prices or tell me to stand in line. Like most mid-line hotels with Concierge they are nothing but glorified information desks. Not the Concierge of past who knew everything about a city and where to get anything, and I mean anything.

Reviews.Title: “I had a great time for my first time in NY and this hotel made the difference”
Reviews.Author: cdanielle504
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this very prime location for New Years Eve for Times Square. The hotel is beautiful and a great location for the heart of all the action for this major event. I was literally able to snag a great deal at the last minute compared to all of the hotels in the area and I had two queen beds in my room. From the time I checked in to the time I left everyone was really helpful and wonderful. The room was nice. The bathroom was tiny but it was clean and the sink was very modern. You can tell it was an older building and older rooms. Not too fancy but nice enough for the purpose of sleeping. No fridge or microwave and you have to pay for wifi. The hallways are huge. I love the mirrors. For my first time in NY I had a great time and the hotel made it all that much better. The military discount was super too. They only have valet so you will have to park elsewhere if you don't want to do that.

Reviews.Title: “authentic new york”
Reviews.Author: ontariodeb_10
Reviews.Content: Dec. 30/11 Great location, steps from Times Square. The decor in the lounge and foyer take you back to bygone times with class. Rooms are small and comfy (how much time do you spend in your room when in nyc?). Beds firm and comfortable and definitely bed-bug free (i checked upon arrival). Staff were delightful from the check-in to concierge to housekeeping services. The convenience of the cafe for breakfast was much appreciated. The 'Rum House' piano bar provided a nice haven at the end of a busy day. Multiple elevators ensured a short wait to access your room. The security detail when entering the elevator area was also appreciated. All in all a great deal. Will definitely return again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and value”
Reviews.Author: MaryShaw
Reviews.Content: I've stayed many times at the Edison over the past 5 years. An excellent value for the price. Rooms are small and plumbing can be cranky and amenities minimal; but the service is top notch, the location can't be beat. Sofia's Restaurant and the Cafe Edison both echo good value, and Danny's Deli next door is always open and stocks a wide variety of consumables.

Reviews.Title: “Ignore bad reviews - great stay for the price”
Reviews.Author: appletontraveler
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a stay at the Edison. Many Times Sq. hotels can brad about a great location and even good pricing but the one thing this hotel has over the others is the fantastic service. No waiting for 20 minutes to talk to the one grumpy clerk as at several other hotels I've stayed at. The Edison has a wonderful, caring staff. We never waited more than 4 or 5 minutes at the front desk and usually did not have to wait at all.. We were always greeted with a smile and helpful attitude. The hotel has plenty of staff during busy times. When we asked for extra linens - they were delivered to our room in about five minutes. We felt very secure as there is always at least one security person at the elevators on the ground floor. We witnessed two guards stop a group of young men from entering the elevators because they did not have room keys.. There is a nice little cafe next door - decent prices and good food. A great deli, one door away. It's a 30-second walk to the center of Times Square and TKTS.and only about 7 minutes to even the furthest B'way theatre (most are much closer - including two or three on the same block) The corridors are a bit threadbare but the room we stayed in had recently been renovated. It was a suite with two rooms, one queen bed and one sofa sleeper. I dread the sofa sleepers but this one looked nearly brand new and was very comfortable. We were allowed to check in at noon, although the stated check-in time was 3pm. We were also allowed a late check in and checked our bags in the lobby for only fifty cents per bag. An efficient crew of 3 bellmen made sure there was no wait to speak of to either check or retrieve bags. Heat worked very well and the Edison has the deepest bathtubs in Midtown. We love this hotel. Have stayed there 5 or 6 times and it will continue to be our first choice for future visits!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: BruceNorthants
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the end of November for 3 nights, we have stayed in this hotel before and picked it again for it's central location. We did read some reviews before we left which were very negative. This hotel is all about the location for us (just off time square) and as long as your not looking for a posh hotel you should be happy with this one, you can't experience New York from any hotel room! They are renovating the hotel, our room had a newish looking bathroom, rooms and hotel were clean. We did use the Edison cafe for breakfast which was resonably priced and nice food just off the foyer.

Reviews.Title: “A good value in the very heart of the theatre district.”
Reviews.Author: Larry S
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here many times over the last 30 years, mostly for business but sometimes, like this time, for a theatre-going vacation. This time we saw 8 shows in 5 days...great fun! Older hotel but well taken care of. A beautiful Art Deco lobby. For security one must show their room key to get onto elevators or stairs. The 4 of us had a lovely 2 room (plus bath and huge closet) suite with windows facing both the Hudson and 47th st for $239.00/night. Compare that to the Marriott Marquis across the street! The living room has a pull-out sofa bed that was comfortable. Bath small but fully functional. Entrances on both 46 and 47th (47 the main one) both are loaded with theatres. 1/2 a block W of the TKTS discount ticket stand. A covered walkway from the 46th st door to 45 and 44th St. At 45th and the walkway (on that block it's named "Shubert Alley") is "Junior's" Resturant with a very complete take out counter with (usually) no wait, then it's one block back to your room to eat. On 47th is "Danny's" Deli with 24 hour buffet food and sandwiches. In the hotel is the "Edison Cafe" AKA "The Polish Tea Room" for informal B-L-D meals. At the 46th St end is "Sophia's" a nice upscale Italian Resturant with a piano (sometimes bass and sax too) bar. The location of the loan-shark garrotting scene in the Godfather. I'll try to attach a pic I took out the West window. Have a nice trip!

Reviews.Title: “Will most defintely be back!”
Reviews.Author: DRobbo
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel - What you would call an old fashioned b&b but on a huge scale - Cosy, comfortable, relaxed and a perfectly suitable place to stay..staff were friendly and the diner downstairs was great..a great shop/deli next door too.. By booking here, we saved a few hundred pounds to spend in Magnolia bakery and the beauty product filled pharmacies! So what if the bathroom was small - I shouldn't be so large! We were not dissapointed (I took some of these reviews with a pinch of salt but they still make you apprehensive) - the hotel was recommended by a few people that have stayed in many hotels in New York so that swayed it So glad we stayed here - fantastic location and next time I visit, will book the same hotel - right in the heart of it!

Reviews.Title: “Meets expectations with a nice touch”
Reviews.Author: Courtney M
Reviews.Content: For half the price of the hotel my colleagues stayed at, I was very pleasantly surprised with the Edison. Walking into the hotel, it feels like you're stepping back into the 60's, except where you want the comforts of the 21st century. I'm a huge fan of art deco, and the Edison certainly delivered my favorite architecture. Stepping off the elevator into the hallway was quite intimidating as the hallway does not look very nice. Once you open the door, however, the room is snug, comfortable, and seemingly built especially for the flat-screen tv mounted on the wall. The doors were original which added a nice touch, but the bathroom had been completely updated. I was prepared for a very budget feel with it being an off-brand budget hotel, but checked-out very happy. When you stay at Times Square, you don't plan on staying in your room much. Surprisingly for the price and location, you could still do just that at the Edison. I will return given the opportunity

Reviews.Title: “Fab location, nice room”
Reviews.Author: joannasephina
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Edison early November and after reading the reviews on here I must admit I was a little worried. I emailed the hotel in advance and explained it was our first time in NYC and having read the reviews I could see they had renovated some rooms but not others, and requested a renovated room. Whether this helped or not I have no idea, but the room we had on the 14th floor was absolutely fine. We didn't think it was small, just normal sized, and it was nice to have bath and shower (my sister stayed in a 4* in NYC which only had a shower). The bed was comfy and we could even see the Disney store in Times Sq from our room! The location of the hotel is absolutely brilliant. I would stay here again just for that. We loved the doormen at the entrance to the lifts, it made us feel safe that no one could roam the corridors who was not a guest. The ice machine was great and we used this to keep our bottled water cool. Housekeeping left us a plastic ice bucket to use after noticing we'd used the waxed ones. Reception staff were really nice and helpful, letting us check in at 1.40pm. Pipes in room were a bit noisy but hey, it is an old hotel and I can't say it affected us too much. Overall i'd say ignore the bad reviews, you don't come to New York to stay in your room afterall!

Reviews.Title: “Our NYC go-to hotel”
Reviews.Author: Loulynn40
Reviews.Content: Fabulous location, clean adequate rooms, nice reasonable deli just off lobby. We are repeat visitors to the Hotel Edison and recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Second Visit just as Good as the First”
Reviews.Author: piercka1
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to the Edison Hotel in Times Square. This December 2011 visit was just as good as our first visit years ago. The hotel has done some upgrading to the rooms - we had two double beds and a flat screen TV. There was a dresser with a few drawers and a closet to hang a few clothes. The bathroom had a hairdryer and very hot water - this was nice when it was very cold the week before Christmas in the CIty We did not experience any of the problems that I read about on this site in other reviews. The hotel was clean and the staff was very helpful. Yes the rooms are a little smaller than most hotels but you are not in your room when you are in New York City. You just need a clean place to stay and a clean shower. You can not beat the location of the hotel to Times Square. It is the best for the money. I will defidently return without hesitation. If you have any questions please feel free to contact me.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for times square!”
Reviews.Author: lyns1985
Reviews.Content: I stayed here back in 2009 but I couldn't believe how close we were to times square all we had to do was walk to the top of the road and there we were. The hotel had a small cafe just off the lobby which was great for fuelling for the day ahead the pancakes and waffles come highly recommended. The hotel rooms looked a bit tried and dated but we only slept in them so that was no problem. The hotel receptionists were really helpful and on hand when we needed help or advice full credit to them!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing but great location”
Reviews.Author: Eli C
Reviews.Content: old and not charming building,tiny rooms which are not pleasant to the eye,the over all feeling is that except for a great location there is nothing good to write home about.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay at The Edison”
Reviews.Author: MargaretNC1
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel for many years and we have always had great service and accommodations. The staff is superb and always helpful...as soon as we drive up we are taken care of. The cafe is a hidden gem in NYC . We travel with children and I love the coziness of the lobby and the friendly staff. Thank you for another memorable stay in Times Square!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Pat H
Reviews.Content: I've been staying at the Hotel Edison for approximately the past twenty years when I visit New York. I would not stay anywhere else and always recommend it highly when friends and/or family are travelling to New York. In the past several years the hotel has added even more amenities. In spite of this, the room rates are still a terrific value---much less than any of the surrounding hotels that I'm aware of. Possibly the hotel's strongest point, however, is the staff. The doormen, bellmen, front desk staff, and all others are professional, courteous, and always willing to go the extra mile to be helpful. The Edison is truly a treasure!

Reviews.Title: “Old Shouldn't Mean Rundown”
Reviews.Author: vbringgold
Reviews.Content: Old buildings have flair and character, but they must be maintained. The first room my sister and I were in had a broken hairdryer, a heater that only occasionally worked and a leaky pipe that caused a bulge in the wall. When our room was changed so maintenance could take care of the leak, we had a leaky shower head that sprayed us in the face everytime we showered. Lastly (in both rooms), I don't think the matresses have been changed since the hotel was built - they were like sleeping on concrete! The hotel is in a great location, the staff was nice and the lobby was nicely decorated, though. I just hope the owners care enough to provide the rooms the TLC they need.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great stay”
Reviews.Author: fmcs599
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Edison is a great place to stay in NYC. The location is perfect. The rooms are a bit small, but who needs room when you're out exploring all day! Everything is clean and comfortable. The staff is friendly and helpful. And the price was so reasonable! I will stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “New room, incredible value”
Reviews.Author: deborahl2
Reviews.Content: From reading the reviews I expected a somewhat unpleasant room but convenient location. I shortened <!DOCTYPE HTML PUBLIC

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Chris B
Reviews.Content: This is an older hotel that has been well maintained. It is in a great location. Just minutes off Time Square. Staff was very helpful. Bathrooms are very small. I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel's location is right where the action is!”
Reviews.Author: Mitziec
Reviews.Content: A lot of people say that this is an old hotel, but I hardly noticed it. What I did notice, though, were the comfy beds, the generously laid out fluffy pillows, and the small but clean bathroom, which are all perfect things to come home to after a long day of sightseeing. There was no complimentary breakfast but a lot of food places are nearby. The location is great since it's right in Times Square. We also discovered that we can walk to a lot of tourist spots from here--Broadway, St. Patrick's Cathedral, Rockefeller Center, 5th Avenue.... The hotel is also a short distance away from the subway so moving around is easy.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. dated hotel”
Reviews.Author: wallygator53
Reviews.Content: Close to Times Square, but room was small and bed was very uncomfortable. Cell phone did not work in room or lobby..only outside. Room needs major updating. Staff was friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Ignore All Bad Reviews!”
Reviews.Author: Leanne M
Reviews.Content: Best location ever, literally a couple of minutes walk off times Square down a little side street, the hotel itself is lovely, staff really helpful and friendly, it's clean, nicely decorated ( christmas decorations were gorgeous!) the room itself was large, bathroom decent size and cant fault it, clean as can be and no bed bugs which is always a bonus! Yeah the rooms are slightly run down, could do with a lick of paint and maybe an extractor fan in the bathroom (as after 2 people have had showers on a morning theres a few drops of water drippin on you from the ceiling! but at the end of the day that's nothing major) Bellhops incredibly friendly and only charge 50 cents per bag if you need them to look after them when you check out, felt incredibly safe at the hotel and in New York in general and would stay there again no questions! We had a room at the front so expect some noise (mainly cars beeping and sirens!) but you soon get used to it, we asked for a renovated room and thats what we got (slight smell of paint) Very happy with this hotel :) :) We were there for 3 nights and managed to do absolutely everything!! Had the best time and New York is amazing!!

Reviews.Title: “Tired hotel”
Reviews.Author: Coopoerman1956
Reviews.Content: Not the best hotel I have stayed in when visiting NYC. Everything in the rooms and in the corridors looked very old and tired. Some of the fittings in the room were broken and light cables loose. Location is close to Times Square so well placed to see the sights.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: mungoman
Reviews.Content: In real estate, location is paramount! The location of the Edison Hotel at 228 West 47th Street in New York City is ideal for the tourist. We got a great price on Skyauction.com and enjoyed our stay. Yes, it's old and tired but the staff is excellent and very helpful. Try it; you'll like it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but lots of drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: AnnArborMichigan
Reviews.Content: The location just steps from Times Square was incredibly convenient. The room was adequate in size for one person and very quiet, a surprise given the location. Towels were fluffy and the bed was firm in a good way. HOWEVER, the sheets were practically threadbare and needed replacement. The furniture showed many dings. I needed to work at the desk and searched high and low for the outlet until locating it behind the mattress, which was very heavy to move. Like many other older hotels, radiators heat each room, but temperature adjustment is difficult. I ended up using the window air conditioning unit to bring in cool air from the outside.
