The strangest thing was that the TV turned on twice by itself while I was working at the desk. If this had happened in the middle of night, I'm afraid I would not have been able to go back to sleep. Would not stay here again, given all of these drawbacks.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Memersxxx
Reviews.Content: stayed here on a trip away in 2010. The hotel is very art deco.. reminded me of a hotel from the 1920's... beautiful!! The rooms were spotless and the hotel room itself was spacious for a room in manhattan! People that moan about the size of the room, must have come to NYC to stay in their room all day.. its perfect for what you need.. somewhere to rest your head at night and shower etc!!! The location of the hotel was brilliant, right on the lip of Times Square. the staff were very helpful and had great advise on where to shop/eat/drink. I can't recommend here enough...if you're looking for a fab location at a decent price.. then this is it!

Reviews.Title: “Third stay and there will be more!”
Reviews.Author: milljan
Reviews.Content: This was my third stay at the Edison and once again I was very satisfied. Why am I a repeat customer? The location is great, central to everything, it is very reasonably priced, staff are friendly and will do their very best to accommodate your wishes. I emailed in advance to request a refurbished room, it was huge, with a separate seating area, was able to manually control the heating in the room, bed was very comfortable and there was always plenty of hot water and a very powerful shower. All you need when you visit NYC because believe me, you do not spend much time in your room. I would not hesitate to book this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place IF you don't need to use the bathroom!”
Reviews.Author: janetoco
Reviews.Content: This hotel is centrally located in the heart of Times Square with an attached cafe. Couldn't get a better location with the subway a block away, stores, theater, restaurants, etc all within arms reach. Stayed there 2 nights this week and don't know if I would stay there again. Rooms had clean sheets (no bed bugs) but was older and worn a bit too much. Bathroom was a disaster. Only came with 3 bath towels(no washcloths, no hand towels, no bath mat). Had to ask for more. Bathroom was tiny tiny tiny with OLD sink, OLD dirty bathtub, and OLD OLD OLD small tiny shelf above the sink that was dirty and the shelf covered with papers to hide the grime. Remote for TV didn't work and I asked to have it replaced (they never did). Staff at desk were always preoccupied and couldn't care that you were waiting for help. Concierge was nice and helpful. Did I say the bathrooms were a disaster? The tub: I made the mistake of running my hand inside and found layers of grime. There is only a turn bolt on the door and no chain which I found a bit dangerous. The Edison cafe: Can't say enough about the rudeness of the girl behind the register. There were many tables, most of which were empty but she would NOT sit me there because 'I couldn't sit you there - you are only one person and they sit 2-4 people". I kid you not. She had me wait for almost 15 minutes while the tables went unseated until one of the two tables for one opened up. The only other alternative was sitting at the counter and I did not want to do that. She told me that 'it was policy' not to sit me at one of the bigger tables. The entire 20 minutes I was there none of the other tables filled up. She was rude and nasty.

Reviews.Title: “Deceptive Website! The rooms at the Edison are old and dirty.”
Reviews.Author: Brad S
Reviews.Content: 5 of stayed at the Edison on a business trip. All 5 were horrified and tried to find a new hotel, which was impossible in NY at the last minute. Immediately upon opening the door to my room I was back in the lobby asking for the room pictured on the website. I was informed that ROOM (singular) was not available. To his credit - I was given an upgraded room - which was just a LARGER dirty room. Torn furniture, moldy grout, stained wallpaper from the 1950s, old mattress, rust on the bathroom fixtures. First time I have ever slept in my clothes! You have to walk past the W Hotel to get to Times Square which adds insult to injury as the W is BEAUTIFUL (but VERY expensive). Don't be fooled by the rates at the Edison. You get MUCH LESS than you pay for. The only 5 star attribute is the location. So if you don't care about a dirty, outdated room - go ahead and chance it. I will also give 5 stars to the hotel's web designer's Photoshop skills!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location”
Reviews.Author: mike m
Reviews.Content: 30 seconds and your in Times square staff are very helpful room was perfect don't listen to people who moan about their room if your going to New York to spend more time in your room than the city then stay at home i would definately stay here again. if you want to be in the heart of everything then the Edison Hotel is where you want to be.

Reviews.Title: “Won't stay again”
Reviews.Author: DEBPARN
Reviews.Content: Location is great, lobby is beautiful and staff is friendly and efficient. This was a girl's long weekend that had been planned and anticipated for months. The room was a disaster, frayed carpet and general run down appearance. Calling it a "suite" was a wishful thinking on their part. They were also renovating so it was very noisy. I complained to the front desk and we got a slightly better room. I told the desk clerk that the rooms were not what was depicted on the Internet. She apologized and said they were undergoing renovations. I asked for a renovated room and was told none were available. If I had asked for one when I booked, they would have made every effort to accommodate us. Who knew to ask!? So now you all know. Great location but there are many hotels in the area. I would not stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but...”
Reviews.Author: Texastraveler0480
Reviews.Content: The best attributes of this hotel were its location and lobby...Other than that, not sure I will stay here again. Not sure what I was expecting, but the rooms were dated and dirty. While looking for electrical plugs, I pulled out the bed and there was an inch of dust on the baseboards. If you need more than 1 electrical outlet next to the bed, you may want to pack an extension cord. Staff was courteous and helpful, but seemed overwhelmed at times with the tour groups checking in/out. Overall, the room served our needs since we didn't spend much time there.

Reviews.Title: “Good location hotel, friendly staff but no luxuries.”
Reviews.Author: ORLANDOBUNNIE
Reviews.Content: Stayed here recently with a friend in a twin room, the hotel staff were friendly but the room was very small the bathroom even smaller. Clean and tidy but no tea or coffee facilities no in room safe there were safety deposit boxes in reception which were available but somehow we didn't feel as comfortable using these. All in all we were out all day so really only used the room to sleep in. Value for money...yes ,for the location but don't expect a luxury stay or a room with a view!

Reviews.Title: “Seriously??! Does New York City not have public health inspectors?”
Reviews.Author: VBSLondon
Reviews.Content: Without a doubt, the worst hotel I've ever stayed in, outside of India. This hotel was not our first choice to stay during our recent pre-Christmas trip to New York - it wasn't even our tenth choice, due to the poor Tripadvisor ranking this place has received. I'd spent a long time trawling the net for a reasonably priced place to stay in a central location, but every hotel I was interested in was either fully booked, or extortionately priced. So, in the end, with misgivings, I booked the Edison, which still had vacancies in spite of its indisputably brilliant location. We had also noticed that every bad Tripadvisor review was followed by a flurry of excellent ones, posted by "new reviewers", who hadn't posted before, or since. If nothing else, the Edison has a well-developed "damage limitation department". I wish they devoted their energy to improving the hotel instead. Now, before you think I'm being a drama queen, please take a look at the pictures I took in the bathroom of room 1645. Eeeeeuwwww! If you like your reviews short, stop reading now, and just DON'T DO IT TO YOURSELF! If you like your reviews detailed, here goes: We booked a double room for three nights, at a cost of $1,085.71 incl. of taxes. We flew in from Munich on a flight that took longer than usual, due to high winds over the Atlantic, and were pretty tired. It took over an hour to get through immigration. We took a cab from JFK to the Edison, where a fed up looking doorman dumped our cases on the busy pavement, and told us to wait. We decided to wheel our own instead, and made our way to reception. The first impression that greeted us was a strong smell of rancid frying fat. We identified the likely source of the reek as the Cafe Edison, which has an entrance just off the lobby as you walk in the door. We made our way to the reception desk, where two receptionists were busy in a private conversation, and ignored us completely for what seemed an age. Finally, in possession of our key cards, we headed for the lift. The public areas were festive and pleasant enough, if somewhat tired, with scuffed furnishings, and large rolls of new carpet being stored on the way to the entrance of the Italian Restaurant towards the back of the building. This was Friday - when we left on Monday the rolls of carpet were still there. Is there really no storage at all away from public view? It's not just about esthetics - why narrow the way to the back door, a potential escape in case of fire? Once we stepped out of the lift on our floor, our hearts sank. Scruffy corridor, patched up paint work, battered radiator covers, hideous institutional pinky-beige paint work, bad lighting, and the room was so vile we headed straight back down to reception. A young woman issued us with a new room key, and even managed to crack a smile when tipped. The second room was the same size and location, but on a higher floor, and the carpet was marginally less revolting. Had we been less exhausted, we'd have gone back down, hopefully "third time lucky", but frankly, we just wanted to get some sleep. Thus committed, we felt a bit, well, screwed, for the rest of our stay. We should have looked for somewhere else, but that's not how you want to spend precious holiday time, and we already knew the town was pretty booked. The room contained a standard double bed, with polyester sheets, lumpy foam pillows, and a very pronounced dip in the center of the mattress, that suggested a) this is usually allocated as a single room, b) the mattress is cheap and old. Gross! How many generations of tourists have sweated into this thing? Space was so limited that only one side of the bed had a bedside table. The rest of the furniture was old and scuffed - the sort of stuff that people abandon on the pavement when they move house. On the plus side, it was a dual aspect room with a window on each side, one overlooking the distant Hudson, which was nice. Also, the heater was powerful, and we were toasty in spite of the seasonal drop in temperature. The bathroom doesn't have a proper extractor, but a sort of "ventilation hole" with an ill-fitting grille. There was a shower curtain instead of a screen, which must lead to endless flooding and water penetration problems. I have documented the mould and mildew problem in the attached photographs. We had one breakfast in the Cafe Edison, pancakes and bacon, and French toast with bacon. The bacon was pre-cooked, cold and hard, the OJ cheap and synthetic tasting. Cheap white bread, one tiny plastic portion of milk per coffee - thankfully there's a Starbucks down on the next corner. We had one dinner in the Italian Restaurant downstairs. Split-level layout - we were seated at a tiny downstairs table by a totally fed-up greeter, in spite of the place being almost empty. This left us nose-level with the stinky carpet of the upper level. Two waiters kept whining within earshot about the shortcomings of the guy who brings the bread and water. The coat check lady was charming and smiley, other than that our impression was of serious staff dissatisfaction throughout the hotel. If the guest rooms are that depressing, what must the areas be like that are out of public view? I'd hate to work there, seriously. Apart from the hotel, we had a really super time in this gorgeous, exciting city, and enjoyed the sightseeing, wonderful helicopter flight with liberty helicopters, a fun Southern soul food dinner with yummy draught beer at "Delta", with super friendly staff and good music, which is in walking distance on 9th, good steak and wine at Capital Grille (also easily walkable), fantastic Christmas decorations everywhere, super views from the Rockefeller Center, amazing architecture, and the not-to-be-missed Grand Central Station. The Woolworth Building, omg, so stunning! The only other disappointment was the tatty sprawl that is Macy's. Please don't stay here, and ignore the "1 review" brigade that posts rave reviews. The only plus in this place is the location, if you need to be close to Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “We loved our stay there!”
Reviews.Author: iDeacon
Reviews.Content: You absolutely cannot beat the location of this hotel! It is a dated, art-deco style of hotel, but we loved it. Could have used a hot water pot for tea/coffee while getting ready or at night, but Starbucks is right at the corner. Disappointed that they haven't upgraded yet to permit more outlets with all of the electronics we use today, but maybe they'll get there someday. You can't beat the doormen and bellhops! Well-stocked gift shop and good food in the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Best Times Square location for the quality and price”
Reviews.Author: jak_0117
Reviews.Content: Can't beat the location. Restaurant/bar on prem. Rooms with a 'used' look but clean and comfortable. Extremely small bathrooms, but very adequate. Close proximity to everything; 5th Ave, Subways, Restaurants, Theaters, etc. We've stayed at the Edison for many many years and would probably never stay anywhere else. Wonderful, helpful staff! Reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “good”
Reviews.Author: ElisadeA
Reviews.Content: when I arrived it seemed someone had already slept in the bed and the towels were not clean. I told the reception and they immediately changed both linen and towels. from then I had lot of towels, always clean. the staff is kind and helpful. the hotel is not so great, looks old and a bit unkept, but the location makes you forget anything else.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in the heart of NYC”
Reviews.Author: bengallusa
Reviews.Content: Already for more than 15 years I have made the Edison my preferred middle class hotel in NYC. The location is just perfect in mid town, the art deco lobby is a great time piece, the rooms are all you need for a good night sleep and it is remarkable quiet for the noisy Times Square location. Don't expect a big luxury bathroom but the one you get has all you need including always plenty of warm water. The bed in our last room was bit old but my wife and I anyhow slept well. We love the fully original 20th/30th busy breakfast/lunch room with it large choice, however we never had dinner in the restaurant because there is to much choice in the area. We will be back! Ben Gall, Malvern, PA

Reviews.Title: “Edison Hotel is the ONLY place we stay in NYC”
Reviews.Author: djglidden
Reviews.Content: We stay at The Edison Hotel every time we visit NYC and have always had a wonderful experience. Clean rooms, wonderful service, reasonable and friendly staff! The doorman always remembers my granddaughter even though we only go there 3 times a year! We love Cafe Edison too! Edison Hotel is in the heart of Times Square and within walking distance of the theaters, American Girl Doll Place and Rockefeller Center! Can't wait until our next trip in January. The Edison is the ONLY place we stay in NYC!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful time at the Edison”
Reviews.Author: grandmaPortsmouth
Reviews.Content: Have just spent 5 wonderful nights at the edison we found the hotel to be clean and comfortable, the staff were very friendly and helpful, nothing was to much trouble, I admit i was worried about the reviews that had been posted on T/A but i have nothing but praise , yes the rooms were a little tired , we had a room on the third floor, and it would have been nice to have a coffee maker in the room , but with Starbucks across the road it didnt present to much of a problem . The location is perfect . Would i stay again YES and hopefully will do so again in July

Reviews.Title: “I Hestitate to Write This Review...”
Reviews.Author: MrMegabuzz
Reviews.Content: ...because I prefer to keep Hotel Edison flying under the radar and from becoming too popular! I've been staying here for about 6-7 years now on a regular basis and have developed a fondness for their comfortable consistency. This funky Art Deco style hotel may not have the largest rooms, the swankiest amenities or celebrities trying to be conspiciously anonymous in the lobby but thats perfectly OK. There are plenty of other overpriced NYC for you to keep up with the Kardassshians or the new Sinatras. Here you can retrace Luca Brasi's last walk down the hall before he went to 'sleep with the fishes'. The Edison offers a great convenient Midtown location, laid-back ambiance and most importantly a friendly attentive staff that starts right as you pull up to the curb and continues thru check-out. The Rum Bar is the perfect spot to unwind after your drive or day spent pounding the pavement as a sightseer or conventioneer. Edison Cafe is tasty, reasonably priced and reminds you of that Saturday Night Live ' No Coke...Pepsi' skit. My only complaint is that Jose is no longer the bartender in the Rum Bar, apparently a casualty of new operators taking over this part of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great location best value”
Reviews.Author: staceymarie123
Reviews.Content: could not get over the location of the hotel was fantastic! brilliant for the tour buses and shops and could see times square from our window. In corridor window could see hudson river! only minor things that could be better such as the decor hasnt been completed properly, its a bit rough round the edges but because the hotel is clean its not detrimental. The staff on reception arent very hospitable can be quite rude and miserable but your never in the hotel. The girl that opens the safety deposit box is the worst. Also we asked for a later checckout an was told yes however the gorl on reception didnt note it down. It was only upon checking that we found out and uckily tony sorted it out for us. Thanks Tony.Would stay again, dont recommend cafe looked grubby and had a B rating.Also have to pay for each suitcase kept in luggage room?

Reviews.Title: “Location and Price Made This our Choice”
Reviews.Author: TravelMomGeorgia
Reviews.Content: With the very high prices of hotels in NY at Christmas time, the Edison made the most sense for us from a price and location standpoint. You can't beat the location -- one/half block from all the action of Times Square. This is an older hotel so you need to look at its charms from that perspective. Bathrooms are tiny but do you come to New York to stay in your room? No! It was very acceptable for our use, more like a European hotel. Service was fine and everything was clean, just dated.

Reviews.Title: “great location but poor hotel”
Reviews.Author: louise k
Reviews.Content: Arrived at hotel after a long trip and when we opened the door to our room there was no way we were staying in the room for the duration of our trip. The room was smelly and had mucus on the bedside table. When I went to reception and got keys for another room the room had cigarettes ends under the bed smelt of damp, the lights didn't work and was tiny. The third room we were offered was cleaner but was under need of total refurbishment but we accepted it because we were so tired. Staff weren't apologetic even after the comments made about the rooms, they weren't friendly and didn't seem helpful. Wouldn't dream of going back to this hotel and would certainly not recommend this to my worst enemy. The only good thing was the location right in the heart of times sqarre.

Reviews.Title: “What a find!!!”
Reviews.Author: sakeller
Reviews.Content: My two sisters and I stayed at the Edison for our New York quick trip. Great location close to Time Square, Rockefeller Center, Theater District, subways,trains and buses. The rooms are smaller but we had a 5th floor front room with two queen beds with plenty of room for our short stay. Our room was clean and comfortable. Staff members were very helpful with directions, maps and general information. We didn't use the hotel cafe but found a Starbucks within a half block east or west. The hotel held our bags as we arrived before the 3:00 check in and again after the 12:00 check out so we could enjoy the full day in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Rico W
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a fantastic location near to Times Square. We stayed over in early December for some Christmas shopping and sight seeing an were extremely grateful for the close location near to Times Square. We were so pleased to be so central when the shuttle bus dropped off other couples near at hotels near the Hudson! :) I was a little underwhelmed with the room when I first arrived as fairly basic but this hotel is all about location and was perfectly comfortable. The only gripe was occasionally struggling to get hot water from the shower but this was the only negative. PS - try the bar downstairs too, great atmosphere in the evening :) If you can't stay at the Plaza or Waldorf and are Looking for a nightcap ad not much more then you should consider this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints here!”
Reviews.Author: cushman103
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the Edison Hotel recently during a visit to NYC. I found the hotel to have an excellent location, literally a stone's throw from Times Square. It was conveniently located to everything we wanted to do and see. It is an easy ride from LaGuardia, easy walk to Rockefeller Center, shopping, Central Park, etc. While the hotel is old, it is CLEAN. The housekeepers are outstanding. The public areas are spotless as well. Our room was in need of some renovation. The mattresses could stand to be replaced and our table was rickety, but again, the room was CLEAN. And frankly, for the amount of time we spent in the room, it was just fine. The staff was very professional and courteous. I really feel we hit on a good place to stay while visiting NYC. There is a restaurant on site, Cafe Edison, which we did not visit due to time constraints. Family members who live in NY have been there several times before and after shows and swear by the food and prices. We did look at the menu and found the prices to be very reasonable. We heard nothing but good things about the Cafe from anyone we asked. All in all, a great weekend trip for us at a good hotel, centrally located to many things. I would recommend the Edison to friends and others. And to put everyone's minds at ease, we did not experience any issues with bed bugs. I'll say it again, this hotel is CLEAN!

Reviews.Title: “Best location”
Reviews.Author: VanessaBelfast
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over Thanksgiving and the location is great for everything. A 20 sec walk to Times Square, close to Downtown and Uptown Tourist bus stops. Easy walk to Central Park and Hells Kitchen two blocks away for great food. The staff were helpful and pleasant, the cafe reasonably priced for a good breakfast, and Danny`s Deli next door is great for drinks, snacks and take away food. The hotel was warm...perhaps a little too hot, the rooms were clean and the bathroom adequete with plenty of warm water and clean towels. The beds were comfy although we had to ask for extra pillows as the supplied ones are a little flimsy. The ongoing renovations did not impinge on our stay and noise was not an issue as our room was very quiet. E mails prior to arrival and following departure were answered promptly. Overall, a very handy place to stay that is within walking distance of many amenities..its a safe place to walk about at night, even on your own. We would use this hotel again but would try and get a newly renovated room...we did ask prior to arrival but were told it is on a first come, first served basis.

Reviews.Title: “Great except for one thing!”
Reviews.Author: Bobberts
Reviews.Content: We found the rooms quite clean, although dated. The location is great, just a few metres away from Times Square and most of the NYC attractions. Our biggest complaint is the internet speed. It's only 2 m/bits and you have to pay for it too! If you use your computer to check on what's happening in NYC, or you want to buy tickets or even just check the weather, you'd be better to just get in the elevator and head out the front door, put out your hand to see if it's raining and whether you need an umbrella or not. By the time you get back to your room the weather network page might be finished downloading. If you don't care about internet, then this is a great place.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay, shame about the restaurant!!”
Reviews.Author: beckybubbles
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel before and the location is the best, literally 150 yards you are in the bustling heart of Times Square, what more can you wish on a visit to NYC. The hotel is clean the rooms are tidy, dated a little maybe, but perfect for a stay in the city, its all you need for the time you spend in your room. The staff at the hotel are welcoming and friendly and extreemly helpful and ALWAYS really busy so this is extreemly comforting that they manage to keep their sense of humour. My only complaint about our stay is with the Italian restaurant on site, their staff are surly and rude, the food was average and the atmosphere was quite unwelcoming. We ate there on Thanksgiving and well, there definately wasnt much to be thankful for, thats for sure. My saving grace was that they forgot to charge me for a lovely bottle of red we had to accompany the said average meal which went a long way to compensate for the fact I was expected to pay for the shoddy service shown to us. Overall I would totally reccomend this hotel to anyone staying in the city and as there are HUNDREDS of decent restaurants to choose from dont let this deter you from what is otherwise an amazing hotel xx

Reviews.Title: “Regular visitor”
Reviews.Author: tonyr26McDonald_Ohio
Reviews.Content: We have been visiting NY for many years now and had stayed at several different hotels. For the past four years, we have stayed at the Edison. Actually, we couldn't be happier. Our rooms have always been clean and well supplied with fresh towels etc. The staff is friendly and helpful. Yes, the rooms are small and the decor is outdated, both of which add to the charm of visiting the city (at least for us). Sofia's is a great place for dinner and, the hotel bar has reopened. All this said, the best feature of the Edison is the location. Walk out the door and, in 50 yards, you're standing on Times Square. If you've never had your morning coffee on TS at 6:00 am, you owe it to yourself. I have reccommended the Edison to friends and we will continue to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “never again”
Reviews.Author: Jilliano107
Reviews.Content: hotel location: fantastic - next to Times Square hotel accomodation: scruffy -absolutely awful!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, value, location!”
Reviews.Author: Gayle H
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Edison Hotel many times. I love the personal nature of the staff, they remembered me from my prior visit despite a year's time had passed. If you know what to expect, it is never a disappointment. The location cannot be beat, the rooms are clean but be aware, the bathrooms are small and the whole place could use a fresh coat of paint.

Reviews.Title: “Unpleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: John R
Reviews.Content: Our son booked this holiday as a surprise to us with Virgin Travel. On our arrival we could not believe the appaling conditions. We were shown to our room, every piece of furniture was damaged the two seats had stains of an unknown origin. The toilet had hairs from the previuos guests, as did the shower. The smell of the room can only be equated to a very old male sports changing room, many years of many sweaty bodies. We were offered alternative rooms these were no better. We took the decision to relocate as Virgins response was taking far to long. Having travelled throughout europe extensively over the years I have never encountered a hotel so substandard. To balance the review Virgin Travel allocated this Hotel as a change from the original nominated. From their response, hotel quality is not the main criteria but location as clients spend little time in their rooms. The Edisons is well located, cheap and would appeal to the less decerning clients on limited budgets.

Reviews.Title: “Well placed budget hotel for Times Square”
Reviews.Author: Jane W
Reviews.Content: Decor a bit tired but 1930's feel very nostalgic and lovely - look out for the (disused) mail chutes on each floor!! Staff very helpful - lots of little things like concierge desk, transport desk and free airline check in and boarding pass print-off - took stress out of it. Cafe Edison great for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Shopping Shopping Shopping !!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Debbie G
Reviews.Content: I have just arrived back from a six day stay at the Edison Hotel with my daughter. After reading reviews before I went I was not expecting very much . However the location was fantastic. After seeing the parade it was then all out shopping for Black Friday . The staff were very helpful and the burly security guards at the entrance to all lifts made me feel very safe. The decor yes needs updating but the feel of "Old New York". Was great . Hot shower , clean towels and rooms everyday with somewhere to eat breakfast is all we needed ... I would stay here again . Infact missing New York already !

Reviews.Title: “O MY GOD NEVER AGAIN!!!”
Reviews.Author: booms777
Reviews.Content: we arrived on wed 16 nov 2011 on checking in we were givena horrible ,dirty,worn out room with torn bedspread and a filthy rug.on complaining we received another room which on appearance seemed a little better as we were exhausted from our long distance flight we accepted the room.only to discover the following day we had an ant problem!everywhere and to boot there was pubic hair in the bath ,o my god!on complaining to hotel staff we were assured house keeping would take care of the problem.on returning to the hotel late that night we discovered ants all over the writing table next to bed we were sleeping in and in the bathroom .gross! gross!gross! i was beside myself and my sisters were too,we once again complained and a very nice night manager and security came home ,really they said they couldn to much as it wasnt booked through the hotel it was boooked with a company they did offer us another room but that also was what you would call disgusting!luckily we have family in new jersey and they got out of their beds at 130 in morning to come into manhatton for us.it was meant to be a special holiday for us as my eldest sister was 60.but in total hotel was a bloody disaster couldn beleiv someone could even recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise!”
Reviews.Author: Geri L
Reviews.Content: Having read reviews of this Hotel beforehand, we were a little concerned that it was going to be shabby and a bit past its best. On entering the Hotel we were more than happy! The Christmas decorations and the tree looked gorgeous, but the art deco style Hotel itself looked superb. Check-in was swift, and although we were disappointed with the first room we were allocated( two single beds rather than queen size, and a little 'tired' looking) we simply went back to reception and were given another room, a little more spacious, less 'tired' looking and with queen size beds, we were happier. We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights and really enjoyed it. The location is brilliant, literally just a few dozen steps away from the heart of Times Square. What could be better?! We had breakfast at the Hotel on just one morning, (preferring to go out and sample New York diners etc) and found it to be very reasonable on price. We had pancakes/bacon/sausage - delicious!! The only negative we found about this Hotel was the fact that there were no tea/coffee making facilities in the room! Surprising. Hopefully the Manager will read this review and change that! Overall we liked this Hotel a lot and would definitely recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great! exactly what it says on the label”
Reviews.Author: Leighglo
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a gem. Yes it is an old original New York hotel but that is the charm of it. Location,staff and cleanliness can not be faulted. We have stayed and both W and Crown Plaza and although these hotels are modern and more trendy, on a New York trip your there for the sites and shopping not to spend the time in your room. We had a junior suite which was ample for 3 and the Times Sq view was perfect especially to watch the parade go by on Thursday morning . We got a good deal with this hotel and the same trip at a higher star hotel would was considerable more. Hat's off to the Edison see ya next year.

Reviews.Title: “It's good to be back”
Reviews.Author: doilikeholidays
Reviews.Content: This is the third time we've stopped at the Edison and it is unbeatable for location. The bar has been renovated and has a nice atmosphere. It does cocktails but if you're going out for the night I would put those on hold until you return. We did not eat in the hotel this time but only because we love Danny's 24hour deli a few doors down. There is no need to get a cab anywhere - everything you could wish for is on the doorstep. The hotel is clean although the rooms are a bit shabby - but who cares when it's only a place to lay your head. We'll defintely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Location Location & A Superstar named Erica!”
Reviews.Author: LaNush8285
Reviews.Content: Ok.. firstly, if you're looking to book this place and are expecting the ritz-carlton.. STOP! and go and book the ritz-carlton! This place is for those who are after a 3-3.5 star property (in terms of facilities and room decor) and 5 star location! Please note that the hotel is getting renovated.. Rome wasn't built in a day so not all rooms have been refurbished yet! At frst we were given a room where the fittings & decor were slightly older and had seen better days and a few powerpoints weren't working and we made a simple phonecall to reception requesting a room change. We were met at reception by a very lovely woman named Erica! This woman looks and sounds like J-Lo! She was very polite and amazingly helpful and sorted out a room for us that was refurbished and even accompanied us to the room to make sure we were happy with the result! Security is this hotel is awesome! No-one is allowed in the lifts unless they have a room key and this is checked by 2-3 big & burly security guards as you enter the lift area! The main attraction for staying here is because Times square is a hop, skip & jump away! Everything in this hotel was adequate to our needs.. you need to give it a chance and realise that if you want 5 star luxury and location then you're going to have to pay for it If you get given an older styled room.. just simply ask if there is a refurbished one available.. or include the request in your reservation. We will be booking The Edison for our next trip to NYC in June 2012 and we would recommend to everyone to consider the property when going to NYC! (NB: We rated sleep quality low on this review only because we were woken up at 6am each morning by a loud jackhammer from the construction site below our window)

Reviews.Title: “Always nice, now getting updated!”
Reviews.Author: travelingfloral
Reviews.Content: We have always stayed at the Edison when in the city but were pleasantly suprised by the new updates encountered this weekend. Same great staff but remodelled rooms and lobby decor--making a great place eevn better.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: NYC_wannabe
Reviews.Content: NYC is my favorite city and I travel there quite a bit. I've stayed at different hotels during each of my visits and Hotel Edison definitely did not disappoint! First off, the location cannot be beat. You are literally steps from Times Square. You are also walking distance to all the wonderful shopping has to offer. The subway is only a short walk away, but honestly I never had to worry about taking it since Hotel Edison is so centrally located. Since it's in such a busy area, I never felt unsafe walking around. Bonus- there's a Starbucks right across the street! There is a cafe in the hotel, but I never ate there, so I can't give any opinions on it. The room is nice, yeah a little outdated, but it's clean! I stayed with two other people in the room with double beds and we had just enough space. I wouldn't call the rooms spacious, but they aren't cramped either. I get really hot when I sleep and it was nice to be able to control the room temperature (some other hotels have it set and it cannot be changed). The tv was not a flat screen, but again I wouldn't consider that to be of any importance. I would definitely recommend this hotel to people looking to travel to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: redrosie3
Reviews.Content: My friends and I just spent 6 nights at the Edison, I was lucky I had a refurbished room, my friends rooms were adequate but tired in need of upgrading. My room was at the front of the hotel and I found it noisy but you got used to it. The location was fantastic 1 minute to Times Square. The room was only used for sleeping but the flat screen tv on the wall was nice at the end of a long day. Pricewise it was good value for money and our party of eight 'shopping ladies' were certainly happy enough. Would use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Well located”
Reviews.Author: WorcesterMoray
Reviews.Content: Having read some of previous reviews was a bit unsure. However hotel is not bad. It could do with some redecoration but room was of ample size and clean. Bed was uncomfortable for first night (not used to hardness?) but after that was not noticed. Room at front of hotel so some noise at night as work taking place opposite. It's location is very good, right at top of Times Square near to cheap theatre tickets booth. We saw 3 whilst there and savings are good although you will of course only get a limited seat choice but all were good since theatres not that big. Handy for hop on, hop off tour bus, close to Central Park so ideal if you wish to limit walking. Tried the hotel restaurant one evening and portions large and filling. I would use again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Edison good value and central”
Reviews.Author: duncan1951
Reviews.Content: Went as a group of eight. Was a little wary after some of reviews. Yes the rooms are tired and in need of refurbishment but for a centrally located hotel in New York you cannot beat this. If like us you do not spend long in your hotel room this is fine for the price you pay. Could do with tea and coffee in the room but we just went to deli in the foyer and took a cup to the room. Ate a few times in the deli in the foyer and this is quite good and service efficient. It's not the Waldorf but you get what you pay for

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Wrong - Ignore Other Reviews”
Reviews.Author: CaptainsWife1
Reviews.Content: I have just stayed in the Hotel Edison for 5 nights with one of my girlfriends (there were others girls in our party too) and the room we were allocated on the 16th floor was absolutely fine - no complaints whatsoever. It was clean and it had two twin beds with adequate space and there was a big closet too. Every day the room was serviced and fresh towels placed in the bathroom. The location is brilliant in that it is right next to TImes Square and a good walk to most places including the subway for getting out and about. When you come out of the hotel take a left and head on over to either 8th or 9th Avenue for a great choice of bars, shops and restaurants. Also practically next door to the hotel is a 24 hour coffee shop called "Dannys" that does everything from breakfast, snacks and coffee and of course the most devine cheesecake and you can take anything back to your hotel room. Before I stayed in the Edison I was a bit apprehensive because of some of the reviews (particularly from British Tourists) but I am not too sure of their expectations because this hotel is absolutely fine and I would definitely go back again. Enjoy New York - it is the best city in the world.

Reviews.Title: “tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: frogtrotter
Reviews.Content: good base for central new york no coffee or tea making facilities in room we stayed for two nights and it served its purpose basic el cheapo rooms but good location

Reviews.Title: “BASIC BUT CENTRAL”
Reviews.Author: Smokey15_11
Reviews.Content: My friends and I (eight of us) stayed at the Edison from 10th to 14th November. When we arrived after a long and tiring flight the receptionist who "greeted" us was very abrupt and actually told me "to wait over there". We had booked the hotel through Thomas Cook and there seemed to be some controversey over the booking but it looked okay to us. We had booked four double rooms which we thought were twin bedded but were actually one small double bed - good job we were all good friends!! I have since been into Thomas Cook and told them that when booking at that hotel a double room is only one bed. So be careful when you book. There were only two rooms ready for us so six of us went into our room on the 5th floor. It was very cramped (you could only just walk round the bed) and smelled of food. The other room that was ready was on the 11th floor which was very spacious. We managed to get the 5th floor room changed after 5 o'clock and we ended up on the 11th floor too. This time the receptionist, called Marla, was fantastic and very helpful and sorted the rooms out efficiently. The rooms were very clean and comfortable as was the bathroom. We had clean towels every day. The hotel is perfectly positioned for Time Square and there is a great self service cafe next door where we had a good breakfast and was also good for buying drinks and snacks. I would definitely go back but would make sure that I booked a decent room.

Reviews.Title: “Old smelly and unfriendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Mumfigo
Reviews.Content: Just back from our stay in new York we stayed in the edison. This has to be one of the oldest hotels in new York and it looks like it has never been updated Since it was first opened. We arrived late on Saturday nite, first room we got no 25 was so small and smelly, don't think it's used very often, we asked for another room we were given room 36 this wasn't any better though we stayed there Saturday nite. On Sunday morning we were moved to a suite this didn't look to bad although could do with updating, we didn't know that this was just the begin ? On Sunday nite the toilet never stopped filling up all nite and even though the door was closed we could hear it all nite. On tuesday morning my husband went for a shower and the hot water was brown told them at front desk again, I think they were getting fed up with us and our complaints put they were all genuine. We thought things would get better, came back on Tuesday nite and our room key wouldn't work after been up & down to front desk 4 times we got in. I went to get a bottle of water later and my key wouldn't work again. My husband let me in, next morning I went down 3 times with key and the girl behind the desk looked at me as if to say I have better things to be doing, on my 4th trip down she sent security man up with me his key card wouldn't open it he had to use master key, have to say he was the friendless people we came across on our stay there. He said it must be the battery, rang the man to come and fix it this was at 7.30 am at 10.30 no had come, my husband went down to front desk, two man arrived and said they needed to fit a new lock and they would be back in half hour and not to close door, we had to wait for them to come back they arrived back 45 mins later and it was ok after that we were there from sat / Thursday, and the hall way outside our room was not hovered once.Bathroom very small and bath wobbles when u stand in it to ave shower

Reviews.Title: “get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: brad s
Reviews.Content: this is the best way to describe this hotel. No, it is not some swanky upscale times square hotel, so if thats what you are looking for then go pay for that. however, for the money, this hotel works just fine. the only negatives i have can be attributed to the fact that its a really old hotel (which we found added a very nice mstyque to our stay), there was some updating to the plumbing going on that caused for minor inconviences during our stay but nothing to get fussy about, and our bed was solid as a rock, which we got used to. However the positives are, of course that its right in time square, every encounter we had with the staff was great (which is different that some of the reviews ive read), and everything was very clean. We really had no complaints other than a few slight inconviences, but overall for the money you are paying, this is a perfect stay. And if you are really going to complain about your hotel, id suggest not going to the big city anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for Times Sq madness”
Reviews.Author: bl0ndie29
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here previously & really is ideal for theatre district & all that goes with Times Square. Hotel is old fashioned as is quite common in NY but it is spotless clean & an ideal base. Rooms vary in size greatly & it can be a bit of a lottery as to whether you'll get the broom closet or a family room. Edison cafe is handy for early morning coffee's when u're suffering from jet lag but the food is just ok. Hotel staff were very pleasant. Would definitely stay again & recommend if the Times square area is what you're looking for

Reviews.Title: “Central clean location”
Reviews.Author: tecia3097
Reviews.Content: 3 girlfriends and I visited New York for the first time in July. We were very impressed with the service and our rooms-2 adjoining clean rooms (one queen and two twin beds) with one bathroom. We asked for a fridge. The hotel has an deli next door for coffee and breakfast. Close to a small convenience store and liquor store for wine. Within walking distance to the three Broadway shows that we prebooked and to the restaurant district. Quiet because Times Square was just around the corner. Would recommend this hotel in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely MISERABLE experience!”
Reviews.Author: soccercat17
Reviews.Content: The only positive about this hotel is the location. (literally steps away from time square) Me and my family went this past summer (July 2011) to stay here for a few days and it was probably the worst hotel experience I've ever had. The beds were uncomfortable and everything seemed kind of dirty and old. But the worst part was the air conditioning, or the fact that there was none. The first night we got someone to come look at our air conditioner. The man said it was fixed and then left. It was not fixed. So we had someone come up again and this guy said it was broken so they brought in a completely different part and installed it. Then it didn't work again, so they got us a different room. Then when we finally got a room which had some ok air conditioning. We left for the day to go sight seeing and by the time we got back, the air conditioning was not working and they didn't get us a different room until 1am! This just seemed to go on and on. We stayed there for 3 nights and switched rooms 5 times!!!! It was ridiculous and not to mention every single room we stayed in was on a completely different floor. It was not fun having to bring all of your stuff from room to room. They did give us 50% off our bill, but seriously we would've rather just had a nice, cool room for our vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Small,dirty room”
Reviews.Author: JimF1935
Reviews.Content: I was in NYC on business in April 2011. Had an extremely small room that had probably notk been slept in in weeks/months complained about cleanliness. Room was cleaned, but smelled like bleach the next 3 days. I probably would stay there again after it is completely renovated. Location great for Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “November Stay”
Reviews.Author: Eileen H
Reviews.Content: Five of us stayed at this hotel. Location fantastic, Price good, staff were very friendly, rooms were cleaned to a good standard given that the maid service could only work with what they had. Rooms could do with a bit of a decorate but on leaving today spotted rooms being refurbished. Would return to this hotel was a bit worried prior to arrival with some of the reviews but felt it was given poorer reviews than deserved. Thanks to all the staff who helped make our holiday one to remember.

Reviews.Title: “Heart of the City”
Reviews.Author: SerenityKingston
Reviews.Content: Handy to all the goings on around Times Square and the Theater District..Property is somewhat dated but the staff was very accomodating..Concierge was helpful and informative. A two -bedded room is the way to go as it is somewhat larger, beds were comfortable and the windows opened to allow in fresh air...Not fancy but functional and good value for the money..

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect good old fashioned customer service.”
Reviews.Author: Draino47
Reviews.Content: A basically good hotel. It's biggest plus is location which couldn't be nearer to times square, though noise should be expected. Staff are not the friendliest & didn't get the welcome I had heard Americans were proud of. My party & I often felt we were an inconvenience.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the headaches”
Reviews.Author: Wewilldoit
Reviews.Content: Okay people follow our cue. We had someone's dirty underwear under our bed for a whole week. Told them at the desk on the first day and after that and no one came to get them. Thank god it wasn't a dead body. We wanted to have a glass of wine but all they supplied were plastic bagged cups. Come on. The elevator were so slow. Ice buckets are made of waxed covered material and leaked all over the table and floor. Thank god we didn't have the iPad or camera on the table of anything of import ace like passports. No tooth brush holder and only body wash and conditioner which wasn't very good. Cheap stuff. No storage in bathroom for the wife to put her stuff. All had to go into desk drawers. No coffee maker in the room. Had to go each morning downstairs to get to morning cup and over priced coffee at that. No safety deposit box in the room but if you wanted to go and put stuff in the lobby and should you miss place the key it would cost you $150.00. Tons of room to put a box in each suite. Had to show my room to some guy each time I came in even if I went across the street to get something to eat or drink. Not a big deal unless you are loaded down with parcels or bags. Lobby sitting area you couldn't even take a coffee and sit. No drinks allowed. If you like to watch some T.V. forget about it. Something like 8 channels. One of those was about the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Old NYC Charm, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Mike S
Reviews.Content: Let me begin by saying that the Edison Hotel is NOT a modern facility. If you want a modern facility, then book somewhere else. I believe the hotel opened in 1930 or so. The construction is period representative. The halls are narrow, the rooms are small, and the bathrooms are smaller. This hotel is not an example of modern conveniences. It is truly a blast from the past. I stayed with a small group which had 3 separate rooms. Two rooms were with two double beds, one room was with 2 twin beds. The double bed roms were slightly larger than the twin bed rooms. We found the rooms to be clean and well maintained. Bedding was good, and supplies were adequate. The staff was friendly and helpful without incident. Overall considering the GREAT location just off Times Square, the Edison Hotel offers a good value and I would be pleased to return for another stay. Face it, unless you are different than me, you will not spend your time in the hotel room unless you are asleep. A little cramped, but close to all midtown attractions. I found the Edison to be quite charming and very nostalgic....if only the walls could speak!

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely return to Edison”
Reviews.Author: Floridana_11
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Edison very much. Staff was friendly and efficient. Our room was neat and spacious. The walking distance to most important streets and main attractions in New York is a plus for senior citizens. I would definitely recommend it to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “More about the location”
Reviews.Author: Mandaqld81
Reviews.Content: Older hotel, with tiny rooms, uncomfortable beds, tiny bathroom, noisy air conditioning... but 30 metres from Times Square makes it all worth it. We were there for 5 nights, by the 3rd night my back was sore from the bed. We were on a strict budget so this was the cheapest we could find, but was still expensive for what it is, but you are in Times Square, so you cant complain. I would stay again for a couple of nights but if we were to stay in New York any longer, i would go somewhere else and spend a bit more. The restaurant is quite lovely and i believe they have built or are building a nightclub downstairs.

Reviews.Title: “Edison Hotel was wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: ceedob
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from a week stay at the Edison Hotel in Times Square. We found this hotel to be located perfectly...close to all the Broadway shows and surrounded by great places to eat. The Deli located off the lobby had great food (we especially liked the Matzo Ball Soup and Vegetarian Chopped Liver!). The hotel Concierge (Gian, I think) was extremely friendly and helpful with the questions or requests we made. The Doorman got us cabs quickly and with a smile. The Front Desk staff were very courteous, efficient, and friendly. The room (two queen beds) was very clean, with comfortable beds and pillows. The bathroom was tiny, but that was the only downside. All in all, a great stay at a very reasonable price. We had absolutely no problems with this nice hotel and would stay again. An extra bonus: They had computers in the lobby which printed out boarding passes for free.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but that's about all”
Reviews.Author: SJG2011
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is really brilliant...but beware...if you get a room with a window on 47th street, you will be up all night because of traffic noise and horns honking. Try and ask for a room away from the noise and also ask for a renovated room. We asked to be moved after our first sleepless night. It took a few times to get a polite hotel receptionist but finally someone took pity on us and we moved to a nicer bigger and quieter room which we really appreciated

Reviews.Title: “The Best Location For Price”
Reviews.Author: JetleyJ
Reviews.Content: The location is what really makes this Hotel, If you step out the front entrance & look right you can see the steps of Times Square. As for the room, if was an average size, with a small-ish bathroom with a bath & over bath shower & a walk in wardrobe. The room was clean & cleaned daily. The décor was a little shabby but I didn't come to New York to stay in the room! The beds were comfortable, it was clean & the location made it worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Poor Room Quality”
Reviews.Author: KHETANI_A
Reviews.Content: Excellent reception area. Unfortunately this doesnt translate into the rooms. the room we stayed in was dark, lifeless and extremely basic. The bathroom was damp, dripping shower head and despite booking for 5 days, I had to check out early and find alternative residence. Trying to check out (and empty my safety deposit box) took 20 mins. A totally unsatisfactory experience and one which I will not be repeating when I return to NY next year

Reviews.Title: “Just don't do it!”
Reviews.Author: SarahB1957
Reviews.Content: This hotel was booked for us as part of a multi city USA visit. Don't be fooled by the reception area. Although the staff were pleasant, we had no idea of what lay ahead ..... On entering the room my first thoughts were that it looked a bit dated then I saw the stain on the carpet - it was enormous! All it needed was a chalk outline! It looked as if someone had been shot! Taking tentative steps further into the room (incase there was a sniper) I could see that the curtains were hanging off the wall. Hmm, I thought, maybe the escape route? (It was down to a grubby back yard area). Of course not - silly .... closer inspection showed that the curtains were not actually on a rail but had been screwed directly through the fabric into the wall. Someone had obviously tried to close them (as one would) and ripped them away from their fix. Dirty nets, dead bugs and a mouldy bathroom added to the 'interest' of this room. A room change was eventually agreed but we had to move our own things and were so knackered that even though the alternative was not that much better (apart from the lack of 'dead body' stain) we eventually collapsed into bed. As we did not want to waste more time moving around the hotel to what could have been equally poor accommodation, we accepted this fate but vow never to return! P.S. watch out for the rudest man in the world (an old bloke serving greasy breakfasts) at the Cafe Edison. If you are brave enough to stay here, get your breakfast and coffee from the deli a few doors up the road!

Reviews.Title: “Hmm - If you can afford another $100 try the DoubleTree Suites across the road”
Reviews.Author: LazyDaysPrestonUK
Reviews.Content: What a weird place. The corridors are like something out of a horror movie, they are are about the same size as a small A road in the UK. The rooms are tiny tiny and tired looking. There is a cooler in the room which does the job, the noise level is good (I was on floor 9 and couldn't hear a great deal apart from the screams of the new guests as they entered their rooms for the first time) First impression of the rooms is that they are very grubby, however to be fair, on closer inspection my room had a brand new carpet and was generally clean. The linen in the bathrooms was actually very nice, supper clean and fluffy towels. It was a bit of a joke that they are selling replica duvet covers from over $100 each.. Frankly they look like they belong back in the 1950's so not sure who would buy one. Location is great for Time Sq and all that it has too offer. Taxi to JFK airport is a fixed $45 plus tolls ($5). There is a decent bar called the Rum Lounge on the side, there is live piano music in there most nights and it gets a good foot fall of people so is always reasonably busy. I did not eat in the hotel so can't comment on the food. Reception - bedlam. I was trying to check out, 2 people behind reception and 25 people waiting...they need to do a bit of resource planning me thinks. There is a good gym but you have to navigate part of the fire escape to get to it, which is strange.

Reviews.Title: “value for money hotel”
Reviews.Author: camilla703
Reviews.Content: fantastic location, old hotel but felt secure as security gaurd at entrance to lifts and you show room key for addmittance.clean comfortable decent sized rooms , very friendly staff, great bar with music and cafe could do with a make over for a bit of interior decoration but breakfast and food quite good and reasonable price.Reception busy but very helpful. Smallshop also in hotel and internet and transport desk which arranged lift to airport for $16.to jfk.visit in sept 2011.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in excellent position”
Reviews.Author: CEANTHOS
Reviews.Content: Best position for the price, close to Broadway, Times Square etc. Very convenient for hop/on off bushes (just about 75yd to the corner of 8th avenue and the same distance to Broadway) Hotel staff friendly and helpful, only had breakfast in the hotel and couldnt fault it. Shuttle service to Newark airport excellent. From JFK negotiated air train and subway with bags and didnt have far to walk to hotel from 50th street stop. Overall very convenient for everything.

Reviews.Title: “awesome”
Reviews.Author: DDDDDDDDDDDDDD_11
Reviews.Content: just got back from another business trip to nyc.... going to nyc at least twice a month... it was my first time at the edison... Located in the heart of time square...subway station,restaurents,stores ... everything is close by... the hotel itself is a bit old...but the rooms are verry clean... customer service is exelent... i got there at 7am...and they gave me a room right away even if the check in is at 3pm...no extra charge... there was NO BED BUGS. this hotel is a great value for your money if you whant a good product with a great location for a small budget... im going back to nyc this week end and i booked 1 night at the edison again...and since i stayed there a week ago the reservation agent i spoke with gace me 10% off... i didnt ask for but its always apreciated..

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location!!”
Reviews.Author: laurenanne84
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in the best location you could ask for at a great price!. the staff were friendly and helpful rooms were rather small and a little run down but they were clean and had character about them. It looked like the Edison would have been a fine hotel in it's day that's why I feel it has a golden age feel to it! If I was to return to new York I would chose this hotel again!!

Reviews.Title: “Froze my rear off with no heat in a NOREASTER”
Reviews.Author: Lanamamaomaha
Reviews.Content: Stayed from Oct. 27 until checkout on Oct. 31. The heat did NOT work. Just slept minimally as I was cold the first night. Second night asked front desk for maintenance. The maintenance guy was nice and looked at the heat and said the 'plud-in' wasn't working. He said they could move us and I graciously said maybe in the a.m., but two extra blankets for me and one extra blanket for my friend would be fine at that time. They were supposed to fix the heat sometime the next day. We came back that night and it was freezing as the unexpected NOREASTER was brutal on Sat. the 29th. They offered us another room. We moved there and there was NO HEAT there. I called the front desk and they said to wait 15 minutes and it would come on....I was still waiting at checkout on the 31st. I am not a complainer, but I just don't think I would recommend it for the hassles. The location was excellent right in Times Square area, but there are many other hotels to try out that are likely as reasonable priced. I would try those next time. And I wouldn't really recomment this hotel. Sorry.

Reviews.Title: “OK...”
Reviews.Author: risto85
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel after i was in NY for business and spend two nights there to extend my NY time. The hotel is in a good location but looks really tired and is in need of a deep refurbishment. The team there must have a hard job keeping everything clean and you can see that in some areas (special corners in bath, corridors, carpets).

Reviews.Title: “Great location, not so great service”
Reviews.Author: Lovejoynikki9
Reviews.Content: This hotel has the perfect location, it's literally round the corner from Times Square so right in the thick of things, in easy walking distance of the majority of New Yorks greatest attractions, however that seemed to be where the positives ended. My friend who booked the trip called the hotel before we arrived to find out of there was any other information we needed to know before arriving to be told no everything is ready. When we got there they tried to tell us we had not paid for the room when we had paid in the previous January. They then asked for a credit card for security details without making us aware they actually wanted to put a hold on 100 dollars of our spending money. We had to agree to this to be able to stay in the room but under the agreement that this would be released upon check out so we were able to spend the full amount we had saved. Check out comes around, told the money was back with us automatically, tried to spend and card was declined! Went back to speak to the hotel and suddenly the money will take 2-3 working days to go back on the card! The staff were not helpful and got angry with us when we tried to explain that the communication between staff and customers was appalling. Add into the mix that there was no hot water on the first night, their suitcase scales werent working and we didn't have the best stay! Make sure u ask all the above details before staying here!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for theatre goers!”
Reviews.Author: JulietVancouver
Reviews.Content: The Edison is in a great location just off Times Square, this old Art Deco Hotel is a 3* hotel and while the rooms are quite small, they are clean and comfortable and the security is excellent. It can be very busy in the Lobby as it caters to many groups. There are many excellent restaurants close by. The rates are quite pricey but so are most others in this area of New York.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: sunnyjsanders
Reviews.Content: Ok, so the rooms were not the biggest I've been in...or most lavishly appointed, but who cares! I didn't go to the city that never sleeps to stay in my room. I was amazed at the price of the room for where it was located..It was literally a block away from Times Square. Other rooms I had looked at were twice this much per night. It was clean, it was in a great historical building, it had a really good coffee shop, where I ate Matzo ball soup for the first time of my life...YUM. I really recommend this place for an economical trip to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Location gives it a 3 review”
Reviews.Author: julestf
Reviews.Content: Location is amazing - couldnt ask for better for the price And it was clean But thats it Very outdated Entrance on 47th was dark and dingy Room carpet wasnt even laid properly We were right next to the elevator and so had that noise all night Then renovations in the rooms directly above us started at 9am everyday, one day waking us up But at the end of the day we didnt spend much time there we just wont go back

Reviews.Title: “The big apple”
Reviews.Author: Remmers
Reviews.Content: If proximity to Times Square is what you want the Edison is unbeatable. The rooms are basic with no tea and coffee provided and if you are around the 3rd floor by some big exterior aircon units, it is like having an aircraft in your room in the middle of the night.. We stayed there twice in the same week and it was the second stay when we got the aircon problem as the other room was much higher up. The public areas are very good and the hotel is obviously very popular as there are always crowds of people in the lobby. Good security is maintained and the staff for the most part helpful. The breakfast room is good and always busy and the travel desk for airport transfers etc makes things easy.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent find in Times Square”
Reviews.Author: Tamara L
Reviews.Content: When I booked flights and hotel together on Expedia I got a great deal on the hotel price. We had two queen beds and no major complaints. The lobby is beautiful and rooms are right on par with the price we paid. Bathrooms are small but for a weekend trip, the location morrre than makes up for it. We arrived at 11am and they even let us check in early annd for $0.50/bag they stored our bags when we checked out since our flight wasn't leaving until the evening. Unlike some terrifying reviews on TripAdvisor, no bed bugs and the room was in pretty decent condition, all things considered. Beds were actually pretty comfy. Not sure what everyone's complaining about but room 915 was great. You get what you pay for (we paid about $60/night per person and shared 1 room between 4), but overall happy and satisfied. Makes me want to go back to NYC as soon as possible. And yes, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A brilliant stay”
Reviews.Author: Pimple2010
Reviews.Content: We were a party of 6 celebrating a 50th birthday and the hotel couldn't have been better. We had 2 suites with more than enough room for all even with 4 of us in one of them. The staff were all very friendly and helpful and the transportation desk went out of the way to help us when our privately booked taxi was over an hour late, making phone calls on our behalf. Some of the decor could do with refreshing but everywhere was clean and tidy and the public areas with the art deco theme were stunning. The security for the elevators and lobby area was a bonus. The location is superb, right on Time Square and easy access to shops, restaurants, theatres, the subway and other main attractions. The hop- on hop- off buses also stopped close by which was ideal for us. All in all highly recommended - I'll certainly be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location midtown Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: JimDebH
Reviews.Content: We recently spent four night in Manhattan and stayed at the Edison hotel on west 47th Street. This hotel is literally a half block from Broadway and Times Square. It is right in the heart of the Theatre district and close to several metro stations. We walked tot he Metropolitan Opera house at Lincoln square from the hotel and it was a 20 minute walk, It is 12 blocks to the south end of Central Park, 15 minute walk. Lots of great restaurants, delis and shops in the area. The Rockefeller centre is a few minutes walk from the hotel, lots of things to see in the area. At night there are police officers everywhere, we felt very safe walking around at all times. The hotel itself is an older place and the rooms are dated. It was clean and the cleaning staff were very good and efficient. I know some people would not like the place because it does look old, but for the price it is what you expect. There are newer fancier hotels in the area but you would be paying more than twice what you pay at the Edison. We weren't in the room that much so it was fine for us. We ate one breakfast at the cafe in the hotel, it was OK but there are so many places nearby I would suggest you go out most days and look around, there is lots to choose from. Restaurant Row is just two blocks from the Edison. If you like fresh croissants for breakfast, I would suggest trying Amy's Bakery on 9th Street just north of 46th Street. They are great. The check in at the hotel went smoothly and was very good. The staff were friendly and efficient and we had no concerns with anything during our stay. There were lots of people using the hotel and I would say that for the price charged, it is a good deal. I probably would not stay here again, but only because if i returned to Manhattan I would try and stay in another district. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to stay in Midtown for a decent price or is going to be there for any shows in this area.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: k g
Reviews.Content: So, remember this is NYC!! The location is great and the rooms suitably appointed - you have to remember the cost which is a value. Our room was small but do you wish to stay in the room all day?? It is NYC!! We found reception helpful at all times. The location is a short walk to the Metro. A fine breakfast cafe contained within. We would recommend this hotel and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat it for location but the rooms are a bit dated!”
Reviews.Author: McPidd
Reviews.Content: The hotel is literally within a minute's walk from Times Square so you couldn't wish for a better location. The lobby is impressive with great Art Decco paintings and a comfortable seating area and there is a small bar which is handy for a nightcap. The Cafe Edison is a great breakfast stop - it's busy and buzzy with a huge selection of reasonably priced breakfast dishes. Our rooms were somewhat dated and a bit dark but they were clean, the beds were comfortable and the sheets and towels were changed every day. An added bonus was the air-conditioning which was very welcome as it was in the 80s and very humid. The only downside of the air conditioning was the noise - it sounded like a helicopter was hovering just outside the window - permanently! Most of the staff we encountered were charming - particularly the security guys the only exception was the conceirge (Gian) who was most unhelpful when we asked if there was a quiet area we could use in the hotel to make a freephone call to our airline when we were notified our flight home had been cancelled. He grunted at us and directed us to a pay phone in the street - thanks man! The hotel isn't the best but it sure isn't the worst either. It is brilliantly located, felt very secure and represents good value for money. Let's face it unless you want to pay an extortionate rate a lot of hotels in New York aren't great - but if you want cheap and cheerful right in the heart of the city The Edison is pretty good and well worth considering.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Location”
Reviews.Author: shiner139
Reviews.Content: The Edison is only yards from Times Square so is excellent location wise, decor a bit dated, and some of the Staff (Not All) were a bit unhelpful, but overall the Three days we had their post cruise was reasonable, the Room was clean and the Maids polite.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but make sure you use safe deposit boxes, our camera was stolen from our room”
Reviews.Author: Trisha C
Reviews.Content: It was a 9 yr old Olympus so not worth an awful lot apart frpm all our photos! We had left it on the desk on returning from sightseeing around lunchtime & the room had already been serviced.We reported it to reception & security but they didn't really listen,saying it could have been caught up in linen. Apart from that,the hotel was clean & in a fantastic location.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Edison”
Reviews.Author: drosiewh
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel the day before we left...so from that perspective it was good that they had availability. But the price we paid was not worth the hotel. Location is great for Broadway shows and being in the heart of NY Time Square. The room was really small, we had 2 queen beds and the space between the end of the bed and furniture was so narrow that 2 people could not get by. There was no coffee in the room and ICE and vending were only on the 2nd floor of the hotel. (There were 4 of us - me, hubby, teenage daughter and son.) I probably will not stay here again. The room was clean and adequate, but the price was way too high even with the great location.

Reviews.Title: “Location is Great !”
Reviews.Author: Tom-Pea13
Reviews.Content: i found this hotel to have a great location ! Times square is just round the corner . Staff are welcoming and friendly-just like all new yorkers! The hotel itself is quite dated with old decor but OK. Our room,537 on the 5th floor was small and again had old decor but was clean and basic. i would recommend this hotel if you are just looking for somewhere rest your head at night with a great location. we stayed here 16th-20th of October 2011

Reviews.Title: “100 yards from Times Square, Very Affordable. The perfect base for anyone looking to really see the city”
Reviews.Author: Conor-NYC
Reviews.Content: Ignore the bad reviews. If you are looking for the greatest hotel in the history of hotels, don't book here. If you are looking for an affordable hotel room, 15 seconds away from Times Square (literally, come out of the door, turn right, walk for fifteen seconds and you are standing underneath the Coca-Cola sign looking at broadway theatres and thousands of people in Times Square, its an amazing experience.) then book here. It is a minutes walk from four Subway staions which will take you everywhere. You are 15 seconds from times square. about ten minutes slow walk from central park, a 5 minute subway ride from theempire state, what more could you possibly want?? Please bear in mind it is not the Hilton where you would pay for one night what you would get a week in here. I booked this through a package deal and got it very cheap. The second i arrived at the airport, 23rd September i think, there was a 5.9 earthquake in virginia, yet despite the fact that the hotel staff probably had to do safety checks of things like the boiler systems and gas tanks and whatnot, we got checked in straight away into to our decent sized airconditioned room with a TV, Bath/Shower and everything else we needed. The only thing it didn't have that could have been useful was a fridge. however we just used the air-con for that. our stay in the hotel was delightful, with no problems. then, the day before we were set to go home, a HURRICANE roaring up the east coast caused all of the flights to be cancelled. So after a ridiculous amount of time trying to get through the travel agants, insurance people and booking agents, they sent an email to the hotel extending our stay, (as we had to remain in NYC for another 6 days!!!! (which isnt really a bad thing :) )) when we went down to the desk the manager came to see us personally and extended our stay at no extra charge to us. We were even offered a bigger room which we declined as all of our stuff was already unpacked in our room. Despite the several setbacks to the trip, the hotel made it as comfortable as possible, and gave us advice on what to do should it be bad (which forunatley for Manhattan, it wasn't.) which was nice as we had no idea what we should do in a hurricane or earthquake. The restaurant and the deli on either side of the hotel served low priced very nice food and drinks, ( a beer costing 3 -4 dollars as opposed to the 8-15 in bars and other restaurants.) And, they stayed ipen during the Hurricane for patrons of the hotel. The location, the room and the staff made our stay excellent, and helped turn a really quite scary experience (as although the hurricane turned out to not affect Manhattan, no body really knew what was going to happen, ourselves especially) into a really memorable trip, and our room on the 12th floor of the Edison hotel is a major part of that. I know this review isnt really relevant to people who are looking to book a trip, i am simply saying that the hotel helped to make our extended holiday really really great. P.S, do not go to the travel desk, we enquired about our flights, and the only respoinse we got was "cancelled"!!! One word, asides from that it was a really lovely experience and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: missaprilcassidy11
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel to be great location wise. I found the food and service in the cafe to be not great. Food not tasty and service very rushed. The staff in reception was lovely however the key would not let us in to the room on 3 occasions.
