And on the last nigh a letter was pushed through our door at 2 in the mornin I found this very disturbing. Other wise it was perfect and Wu recommend it to others

Reviews.Title: “Ruined the trip”
Reviews.Author: Maria490
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through hotelsearch website (HotelConxions) and was not satisfied. We booked the hotel in May 2011 and fully paid for 4 night, we paid $1010 and had a receipt and confirmation number and everything. When we arrived to New York in September 2011 they told us that we have no reservation. They told us to sit down and wait, the girl in lobby would fax the company and check about this. Ok, we waited for 1,5 hour and then we went to the lobby and asked how it goes to contact them. Then they didn't know about what it was and had forgot us, then she came back few minutes later and told us they couldn't do anything but book a new room for $1300. We didn't want to stay at this hotel after that so we wen't to internetcafé and booked another hotel from hotels.com. The only thing Hotel Edison said was this company (HotelConxions) does not exist anymore and they cancelled all their reservations. Because it was a third party they couldn't do anything and they have no longer contract with them (but they had contract with this company last years) It was the worst day, we arrived at noon in New York and we spent the whole day waiting in the lobby and we lost our money. I am pregnant, and they didin't tell us anything so we were hungry and thursty and couldn't go anywhere, the restrooms in the lobby was locked so we couldn't do anything of the neccesery things. We would have grab some food if they didn't say "sit down for few minutes". I didn't think 90 minutes is few. One whole day was in the hotels lobby. But it was shame because we were only 3 days in new York.

Reviews.Title: “very enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: jenNewfoundland
Reviews.Content: we totally enjoyed the Edison.Great location.Rooms need a little work but are quite adequate and clean.Will definately return.

Reviews.Title: “Too expensive for what it is”
Reviews.Author: DrThwing
Reviews.Content: The location is amazing, but the price ($310 per night for 4 nights' stay WITH Military discount!) was way too much for the tiny bathroom, tepid & weak shower and grim aspect of the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: lindypopsUk
Reviews.Content: Location is everything with this hotel, 2 minutes from Times Square. The room was small but adaquate, how big do you need it to be, we only slept there. Transfers desk helped us get to our cruise ship and the to the airport on our return. lots of eating places close by. We arrived after midnight and got to our room and could not unlock the padlock on one case I called recepetion and witin 5 minutes the maintenance man arrived with bolt cutters

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel in an incredible location!”
Reviews.Author: Chloe L
Reviews.Content: When I read the reviews on here for this hotel I have to admit that I was dreading our stay. However when I got there I was pleasantly surprised! We stayed at the beginning of October and I have to say there was very little wrong with the hotel! When we arrived the staff at the desk were very helpful, assigning us to our room quite quickly. When we did get to our room we discovered it wasn't quite what we had ordered but it was only that the sofa bed wasn't fully made up. This was the only fault because the friend I was staying with had to call down four times before we had some extra blankets and sheets sent up. Not great but to be honest after that there were no problems. Yes, the rooms are slightly small and the bathroom is very small but I didn't find it a problem at all. I don't know what people expect but it certainly exceeded my expectations. Honestly, it was on a par size wise with a 4* hotel room I've stayed in by Marble Arch in London! The best thing about this hotel is definitely the location. I would stay at this hotel again simply for the fact that you turn right as you walk out of the hotel and you're on Times Square. You can't ask for anything more. Everyone was very kind and friendly and I would certainly stay again. Thank you Hotel Edison!

Reviews.Title: “Really Disappointed!!!”
Reviews.Author: chris24Lancaster
Reviews.Content: Not very impressed with this hotel, considering what we paid. Out of our 5 night stay in the US, we stayed here for 1 night, went to Boston for 2 night's then returned here for 2 more night's. On arrival on the 1st October, the receptionist was friendly and professional enough and was really helpful. We went to our room on the 9th floor and as soon as the lift door opened and saw the decor I knew it wasn't as good as the website made it out to be. We got to our room and it was dull and dreary and looked like it could do with decorating. Like a previous comment on here has said, the sockets were not very safe. Our view was of a parking lot and the room felt cold because it had no natural sunlight. We thought maybe that because we were only staying for 1 night, we may get a better room when we returned. We arrived back at The Edison on the 4th October. When I went to reception, I knew we were early for check in and thought that we may have to wait for our room, so was quite prepared to put bags into left luggage and go out for a while. The man on reception was miserable. He informed me we were to early for check in, demanded to see a voucher from the travel agent, wanted a passport and a credit card and said all this without using the word PLEASE!!!! There was a room ready and sadly it was no better than the first one we had. If anything it was smaller, the bathroom was like a cupboard and again the socket's were a bit dodgy. Our view this time was of the hotel's air conditioning unit, which was going all night and on the last night there, my wife was woken at 4.30 by someone bagging on the pipes. The one plus, security by the lift's would not let you passed without a room key, which didn't alway's work. I had to return to reception to get the key's re-booted to be able to get in. As this trip was for our 25th Wedding Anniversary, we were very disappointed by this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I'm sad to have to leave a bad review :(”
Reviews.Author: LisaandChris2008
Reviews.Content: Out of 7 reviews I have left in the last 10 months, this is my first negative one :( Firstly when checking in, (1st October) the reception staff were miserable, no one was smiling, and our lady barely spoke, she almost looked depressed and is clearly in the wrong job :( Not a good first impression. We are from the U.K and had been in Vegas for 5 days, were my boyfriend proposed :) so we were mega cheery and looking forward to the next leg of our trip in New York. We were in room 1632 and when we walked in I could have cried. It was very small, so old, and had a horrible musty smell. The carpet was all crumpled up, which caused a few trips from my fiance and I. The bed was brick hard, and it squeaked and groaned with any movement. The pillows had absolutely no feathers in them and were therefore so flat! The electicity sockets are a law suit waiting to happen. When charging phones or using my hair straightners, they made a 'sizzling' sound, and sockets were hanging out the wall! Jeez! The shower curtain was so grotty and ripped, and one of the towels had blood stains on it?! My goodness!! Our keycard for entry to our room very rarely worked and it took us 10/15 trys to get in! (Using both our cards!) Positives? errrrrrrrrrr...... there is always security men in the lobby who don't let you use elevators unless you show your room keycard which is great. The bar attatched (Rum Bar) is lovely, always buzzing and we seen an elderly gentleman playing the piano which was fab. Sofi's italian at the back was very yum! Yeah it is a great location but so are alot of other hotels. This was my first trip to New York and I will look to pay a little extra in the future (although the Edison wasn't even that cheap!)

Reviews.Title: “We love the Edison!”
Reviews.Author: illtryanythingonce
Reviews.Content: I don't get all the bad reviews - we just stayed at the Edison for the fifth time, and I would highly recommend it! We stayed in Room 1735 - a king bed that was really comfortable, had four pillows and soft sheets. Room was very clean and comfortable, with plenty of comfortable chairs, lamps, desk and flat screen TV. Bathroom was what a bathroom is for - lots of clean towels, soap, tissue, etc. Plenty big enough to get the job done! The staff are wonderful - allowing us check-in at 12 noon with no extra fee! I love the security man - isn't it nice to know that not just anyone can use the elevators? Elevators very fast, hallways bright and clean. We had literally no noise from traffic or "neighbors". The Edison Cafe is one of the best "diners" anywhere and the lobby bar is hopping on a Saturday night (we stayed until 1:30 a.m.!) Do NOT believe those who say it is terrible - stay just once and find out for yourself. Or go spend hundreds of dollars more for something else - your choice!!

Reviews.Title: “Dont do it”
Reviews.Author: Humphriesout
Reviews.Content: We had one night in this flea pit prior to picking up a cruise ship. I saw the reviews before I went, and the replies from the alleged general manager in asking for a renovated room. I asked two weeks before we travelled, I didnt get a renovated room. I got room 1900. The room was filthy, paper coming off the walls, carpets filthy and curling up, the bathroom was like a tip, filthy dirty, no towels, the walls in the room itself and the bathroom had not been cleaned for an eternity. I should have listened to other reviewers. I will now try to negotiate with the company I booked the cruise with who put us in this garbage can hotel for compensation. Be really interesting in what the general manager makes of this truthful but scathing review. For your info manager, we stayed on the night of 23rd Sept 2011. A night I will never forget and one never to be repeated. I await your offer of compensation. I will not hold my breath though. Oh. Forgot to mention the fact that we had no sleep either because of the demolition going on all night across the road from our room. Anyone reading this and still books this place well, dont expect cleanliness or sleep. Just dont do it. I have warned you

Reviews.Title: “Location Worth It!”
Reviews.Author: jhdawson
Reviews.Content: I thought the hotel had an historic feel which is what I like about hotels but if you're looking for the all that jazz, glitz and glamor then this doesnt have it. But what it does have is comfortable beds, friendly and helpful staff and a good location. It's right by Times Square! I don't know if it was just my room but it had a MadMen feel which was fun to pretend I was in the city on business --- oh wait, I was! There were lots of good restaurants near by and a Dean & Deluca on the next block.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and tidy room, hotel in excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: Marion T
Reviews.Content: Our room on the 6th floor was clean and tidy, with ample space for two people. The bed was comfortable and there were plenty of towels. The bathroom whilst small had an fantastic shower. Needed to turn off the air conditioning through the night as it was too loud. Staff were friendly and helpful. There is a small diner about 30 seconds away called Carve which served good inexpensive food, great for breakfast. Don't pay more than $1 for a bottle of water anywhere in Times Square, or you are getting ripped off! We traveled from Newark Airport where we got the Newark Express coach for $15 to Port Authority on 42nd St, then just walked the 5 blocks to the hotel. Location is excellent, saved loads of money as we walked just about everywhere. The hotel is also close to restaurant row on W46th St in Hells Kitchen where we found some good Italian restaurants. Very glad that we had a pleasant stay compared to some of the other reviews.

Reviews.Title: “5* position 3* accomodation”
Reviews.Author: Ronmet
Reviews.Content: The Edison is situated in a wonderful location just off Times square, but the hotel is at best 3* The rooms are a little jaded and require refurbishing. I thought it was clean and the staff were fine. When staying in NY you can pay mega bucks so you have to take into consideration the whole package. If you are on a budget the Edison is perfect purely because of the position.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel and staff EVER!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ginni h
Reviews.Content: Listen, DO and i repeat do not stay here. Mold on the walls, fraying stained carpets, blood stains on carpets, dirty sheets, the rooms smell so bad you can almost not breath without throwing up. Do not think you are getting a deal because the rooms are cheaper than most. You are getting what you pay for!!! Complete CRAP! The staff, particularly the woman manager, the most inhuman, rude woman i have ever come across in my life. When i asked her to speak to the owner or main manager, they refused, saying he was out of town. I had to threaten to turn in pictures online before they would switch our room, which they finally did. The upgraded room was still HORRIBLE. The room isnt even fit for animals to stay in. Go a few doors down to the W, they love their hotel guests and actually treat them like human beings. even if someone offers to give you a free room here, DO NOT TAKE IT!!!!

Reviews.Title: “easy access from JFK”
Reviews.Author: roseannewilliams
Reviews.Content: I'm writing to thank a past reviewer (October 10, 2010) who took the time to write out explicit directions to the Edison from JFK via the Air Train and subway. His directions saved us a fortune in time and $$$. We followed his directions exactly. Because we're from New Zealand -- total population 4 million -- we're not use to modern transport systems. We haven't got them. They can be a bit daunting. BIG THANK YOU TO THAT REVIEWER. We were in New York for four nights from July 10 and the location of the Edison is hard to beat. However our room left a lot to be desired. We were on the 6th or 7th floor and I can only conclude from the many reviews that things are better on the higher floors. Our room was shabby-depressing. There was a heat wave on in New York and the old air conditioner wasn't up to the job. There was a constant whiff of toilet and no matter how diligently the maid cleaned the bathroom there was just not adequate ventilation . . . the bathroom was very old and decrepit . . . poorly ventilated. Our first contact with front desk was not good. We had a young woman who seemed to be world-weary . . . defeated by life. She just did not want to be bothered with us. However there was a great concierge who put us onto a corner cafe/ breakfast place -- out the back door and turn right a couple of blocks --Galaxy Diner. Ignore the hostess at the Galaxy -- another sourpuss -- embittered by life. . . . What is it with these young, beautiful New York women? Would it hurt them so much to smile occasionally? We ended up at the Edison because our NZ travel agent put us there. NEXT TIME I'LL DO MY HOMEWORK. I FEEL CERTAIN WE CAN DO BETTER IN THE TIMES SQUARE VICINITY.

Reviews.Title: “Explore New York City”
Reviews.Author: VisitorfromOntario9
Reviews.Content: Our room on the 11th floor had comfortable beds, a fridge, and lots of fluffy towels each day. Combined with a location on Times Square and close to restaurants and theatres, what else does one need for a great New York City experience......

Reviews.Title: “steve C and Claire F in new york”
Reviews.Author: Steve C
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel before and loved it,yes the rooms are a little bit small but who wants to stay in their room all the time.We came to see New York and the location of this hotel helped that in every way. The concierge booked us amazing tickets for a Rangers game the deli next door was great. All in all we loved it so much we are coming back on feb 25 2012 , I love this hotel and cannot wait to go back, see you soon Edison!!!

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Storbygjest
Reviews.Content: Our experience with this hotel is not so god. Some of the personell at the baggage store room were rude, stressed and unkind. One person in the concierge desk gave us wrong adres to a ishockey match, wrong stadium, and the same guy also gave us wrong information when we ordered a helicopter tour. It is not fun to use valuable holiday time in New York travelling to a closed ishockeystadium in stead of watching a preseason ishockeygame. One of the ladies at the booking desk was unkind and unwilling to upgrade one of our rooms. We asked when booking these rooms that we wanted separate beds in one of the rooms. We wanted to swith from one small "grandlit" bed to separate beds for our adult kids. That was NOT possible, but at least we got a room with enough space to place a rollerbed, so the brother and sister did not need to share the same bed and bed-sheets! The Edison Cafe is a rather sad cafe.... The day we visited the cafe they had the health authorities on visit. That visit resulted in many courses not allowed to serve. And that they told us after waiting aprox 30 min for the food. The only positive with this hotel must be the location. aprox 100 yards from Times Square is brilliant. Many nice restaurants in near neighbourhood as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for Suite lovers”
Reviews.Author: wanderingJL
Reviews.Content: The Edison is located near the corner of W47 street and Broadway, a fantastic spot for theater going.We had suite 1719 which has a large living room and separate king bedroom . Each has a flat screen television. Tiny, tiny bathroom was only drawback other than no in- room safe or WiFi. Plenty of closet space. A wonderful deli-cafe for breakfast can be entered through the lobby. We ate breakfast here every day. A small grocery is just outside the entrance. A small refrigerator was given at no charge. Hotel cost us $1700 for 4 days in the suite which is VERY low priced for this area in NYC.It's cheaper other times of the year. Would certainly stay again. The suite has been restored beautifully.

Reviews.Title: “Well Travelled”
Reviews.Author: avrilwiltravel
Reviews.Content: We really loved the 1920 Art Deco the rooms where smaller than some new hotel,but so was the price. The beds were clean and the towels clean and fluffy, there was no noise to say how close you are to Time Square. The staff were friendly and helpful, I would use this hotel again and recommend it to clients.

Reviews.Title: “Artdeco rooms with a good location”
Reviews.Author: BE-Pieter
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at this hotel in September 2011. The staff were helpful, beds comfortable. It was also conveniently close to everything. The reason why I would not stay in this hotel is because the prices are like the building in NY sky-high in comparing what you get. The bath had some fungus at the borders. The room was outdated and the WiFi was paying. Well.. the hotel is clean and staff was helpful the price didn't justified this.

Reviews.Title: “A Unique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: odie2101
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel as part of a coach trip to New York. The rooms and bathrooms are older, but interesting. The beds were very comfortable, and we did not notice much noise from the street below. When you leave the hotel, it is just a short walk around the corner-and there is Times Square in all its glory! The hotel has a small cafe attached to the lobby, but we ate Danny's Deli, next door to the cafe. It has a great breakfast, at a modest price.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: parisanniversary05
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel in August 2011 for our "babymoon" and had a wonderful stay for 5 days. The staff were helpful, beds comfortable and the breakfast that was included exceeded our expectations. It was also conveniently close to everything. I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, but pricey.”
Reviews.Author: Skyholder
Reviews.Content: Had an affair to attend in NYC. The Hotel Edison was selected for its location. I expected it to be high priced, and wasn't surprised. However, the staff were very friendly. and accomodating. The front desk, and bell staff were very helpful. The room itself was clean, well organized. The room was definitely on the small size, but adequate. If you choose this hotel, just know that you are paying for the great location. If you don't mind walking, taxis, subway.... not to mention parking fees everywhere, choose somewhere else. Overall, a nice place.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - tiny bedrooms”
Reviews.Author: Irish_Native
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at this hotel in early September as part of the 1st leg of a 2 week holiday to USA, I will be frank with you all. Having read previous reviews it is true the hotel is in dire need of updating as it looks like something from the early 1900's in places and as for the bedrooms - you could not swing a cat in the double bedroom we were allocated. However having said that for location you cannot beat it - 1 min from times square and all Broadway a stones throw away. Staff were very courteous & helpful, change of towels, room cleaned & bed made ever day, so it ain't all that bad & a more than acceptable place to plonk yourself when visiting New York - after all you don't come to NYC to stay in your hotel for too long so for value for money & location turn a blind eye to the negatives because in this hotel the positives out weigh the negs.

Reviews.Title: “Close to everything!”
Reviews.Author: warmhrt2
Reviews.Content: This hotel is older but it's a GREAT place to stay ! The door men are great ! Security checks your hotel card to get to the rooms, most of the people at rhr desk are there for you , we've stayed there 11 times and won't go anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “bed bugs!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: emerteeling
Reviews.Content: great location nice modern tv .... stayed at hotel for 3 nights on the 7th floor, arrived at hotel girl checking us in very friendly, got too the room decor was awful. come on people we pay too stay here wy should we give these places our money if they dont look after there decor, fisrt night sleep was amazing only for the fact we done long flights before hand second night we couldn sleep with the noise of pipes, toilets flushin in other rooms and noise from corridors, we just slept with the tv on which turned out fine.... now this is were it gets interesting............ arrived back to the hotel the 3rd evening about 7pm and got straight into bed as we were flying out early next morning, (leaving airport 4am) after about half an hour lying in bed my partner and i start scratching our legs backs arms head.... we thought nothing of it at first but then it kept getting worst, we rang reception and explained manager sent house keeping up too the room.... the guy knocks on the door and in his hand he carried a magnifying glass and a bible... the hotel must of got this complaint many of times because he start looking in the bed for bugs... after a couple of mins we found sum bed bugs, i rang the manager and asked her too come see this...she told me she was too busy and said come too reception and collect my new room key eeeeeeeeeehhhhhhhhhhh come on no questions asked about the bugs, i went too reception reali angry at this point as it was getting late 9pm, i demanded the manager too take a look at these horrible bugs, on the walk up she said too me there are no bb's in your room (bb's) her words not mine. but i never told her what i wanted too show her so were did she get the idea of bed bugs, (this tells me it happened before) most un polite girl ever, she asked the security gaurd too assist her up too veiw our room, she said too him "im going too freak out at somone very soon(she must of been talking about me) he replied me too i havent went home in 3 days!!!! what the fudge.... we arrived at our room and they both viewed these non moving bugs on a white piece of paper and said o were really sorry about this if you need someone too help you with your luggage too the next room just call down, and off they went... we just had enough of the running around so took the other room had a shower and hit the hay too catch our flight the next morning, will never ever stay here again, and for all you people out there dont just stay at this hotel for location reasons as it will just come back and bite you in the a## just like the bugs did us!!! thanks

Reviews.Title: “Does exactly what it says on the tin”
Reviews.Author: Barry D
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 4 day stay at the Hotel Edison and first time in New York. The hotel location is superb, right on times square and within a reasonable walking distance from many major attractions such as Macys, Empire state, 30 Rock, Central park. The hotel itself is dated but more than acceptable as a place just to get your head down for a nights sleep. i found our twin room on the 10th floor to be a decent size inluding the bathroom. The AC in the hotel room could get very cold at night and cannot be turned off. The staff are helpful and the breakfast in the cafe is very good. If youve never been before i would recomend getting tickets for the hop on, hop off bus tour for the dontown area as it stops by some great areas that are too far to walk to (soho shopping, china town, ground zero, battery park) and justjump back on the bus again and it drops you right back at times square. All in all a great hotel, if not a bit dated, in a fantastic location.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: Doc055
Reviews.Content: just literally off times square. Last hotel on our round trip, similar to the milford plaza, bit dated but slightly more updated, flat screen tv and bathroom had been retiled etc. comfortable room clean thats all you need in new york somewhere comfortable to sleep. Bit pricey but for the one night worth it to be in that location. Good transportation booking service to airport which gets one worry out of the way.All in all not bad.

Reviews.Title: “If it's location then this is for you.”
Reviews.Author: karen p
Reviews.Content: our room on the 16th floor it was by usa standards a bit small but there was plenty of space to hang your clothes and empty the cases. we only ate once for breakfast at the hotel it was ok, though we did notice no tea or coffee facilities in your room which was a let down. The only upside to that was danny's deli 2 doors down serves the best coffee and bagels just what you need 1st thing in morning. I would stay at the edison again and would recommend it it was not cheap for the time of year but then you pay for location Times Square on the door step. Thank you Edison Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Average Rooms with BED BUGS!”
Reviews.Author: ellejayd24
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for five nights. First impression was good, nice lobby and easy check in. The room was average, two double beds and a bathroom (took us 2 days to find the light!). It was a manageable sized room, but could have been a lot bigger. My biggest shock came on our 3rd morning, I had been coming up in rashes and bumps for 2 days - but then found a bed bug. The hotel staff moved us to another, much downgraded room, and we had to pay to store our luggage all day while we were waiting for another room. Not pleasent. The location however - is AMAZING! Less than 30 seconds to Times Square and really close to Broadway. I guess the location made up for a lot of it!

Reviews.Title: “right on the spot”
Reviews.Author: Sweden_Lena019
Reviews.Content: Typical New York hotel, with the livrédressed bellboys outside, good service and lots of elevators, ongoing refurbishing during our stay but otherwize super!

Reviews.Title: “Location is what its all about”
Reviews.Author: Foxy1766
Reviews.Content: As with most reveiws of the Edison the hotel in seconds away from Time Square. The room we had was on the 7h floor and was SMALL we could not unpack as there was just no room. The staff where freindly and the security was good. Security based at the lift lobby and asked to see you key card before letting you pass. We didnt eat in the hotel so cant say what the food was like but again if you want to be in the heart of it and dont mind small rooms i would stay here. Next time in NYC I will

Reviews.Title: “I love the Jewish food at Cafe Edison”
Reviews.Author: JeanAllison
Reviews.Content: I order borsht, or matzo brie, or potato pancakes, or kasha varnishkas. I go straight to heaven. Yum! Plentiful and inexpensive. The servers are very friendly and welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “the transportation area”
Reviews.Author: sarah h
Reviews.Content: the great thing about this hotel is the location, the worst thing about the hotel is the so called shuttle bus service, we were told it should take 35 mins to get to the airport from the hotel so we booked it for 5.00pm we were flying out at 9.00pm, what they didnt tell us was there are more pick ups on the way to the airport all over new york city, we jus made the airport with two mins to check in, .. the transportation area in the hotel should tell you this when you ar booking it , we were two hours on the bus,, the hotel is basic,

Reviews.Title: “Times Square hotel”
Reviews.Author: Byakuya12
Reviews.Content: One of the cheaper hotels in Times Square. I visited on a study trip with my university. Had a few problems with getting new bath towels and had to change rooms twice.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, shocking rooms and disinterested staff.”
Reviews.Author: Plummy78
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is it's location - not even 30 seconds from the top of Times Square. However that is the only positive comment I can make. I booked a 'Deluxe' room. Their understanding of deluxe and mine vary greatly. It was deluxe if the definition of this is shabby, dated and cheap. The room I booked was for three people - a queen bed and a sofa bed. It took three requests and eight hours to get the sofa bed made up. To call the reception staff disinterested is an understatement. The attached cafe was also shabby and dated. At least it offered consistency. The deli next door (Danny's) was by far the better option. This hotel has an excellent location. Other than that, I can sadly recommend no more.

Reviews.Title: “new york new york”
Reviews.Author: ardmore27
Reviews.Content: This hotel is idealy sited for transport to all the main attractions ndits good value for money too.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: Annione
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here for 6 nights in september 2011. The room was very spacious, with two beds. It was nice and clean, but it needed venting. We had the window 24/7 and it was fine after that. We had the door to the walk in closet open at all times - it needed the fresh air. Did not smell good. The bathroom was nice and clean as well. We had clean towels every. The room was old and a bit worn, but we found it charming. Takes two minuts to walk to stores, shopping and subway. Love that. Beeing from Denmark we had jetlag and sleept early, wich was lucky, because on the other side of the hotel there was a demolitions going on. Very noisy from about 7 in the morning. Closing the window didn't help, they are not soundproof at all. Loved the hotel, would come back. And maybe book a room in yhe other side of the hotel. We were in room 919 btw. Have a salad at the store at 8th ave between 47th st. and 48th st. It's so good.

Reviews.Title: “Location is not everything”
Reviews.Author: idanma
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a great location just on Times square, but it shows location is not everything. Hotel is very large with very small crowded, smelly, broken rooms. Lobby is small and crowded. Noise from trash collection was so strong on our floor we did not get any sleep most of the night. It took reception a good long time to find the reservation we made for 4 rooms 5 month in advance. Conceirge, security and bellboy were on the look for tips all the time not service.

Reviews.Title: “10th Anniversary of 9/11”
Reviews.Author: Liz339
Reviews.Content: For a two-night stay, we were in two different rooms. The reservation for one room, two beds, was made two months in advance through Expedia; the second room, one bed, was booked the day before we went when we decided at the last minute to leave a day earlier. The cost for the room booked directly through the Edison was much more expensive and about 1/3 size of the room booked through Expedia. The bed was extremely hard and one of the pillows felt like it was full of rocks. We literally could not walk on one side of the bed unless we walked sideways and two people couldn't pass at the foot of the bed...one had to sit on the bed to allow the other to pass. However, the room with two-beds was very spacious and the bathroom just a tad bit larger; so our second night at the Edison was much more comfortable than night one. If we ever stay at the Edison again, I would definitely request a two-bed room. NEVER STAY IF THEY HAVE ONLY ONE-BED ROOMS AVAILABLE.

Reviews.Title: “Heart of the city without emptying your wallet!”
Reviews.Author: bunjies
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Edison at the end of July 2011, we were 4 girls sharing a room. I have been to New York a few times and brought 3 “newbies” to the city! Our first worry was bedbugs as we are aware they are a problem in the city, we went through the room with a fine tooth comb and all was clean. Mattress had a plastic cover which I am guessing was protection against these pesky creatures. Although the room, especially the bathroom could of benefited from some renovations (shower walls a little damaged, some cracks and nicks, nothing major) it was clean and great for the price. The room was not huge but, we were fine even with 4 girls in one room. There was one closet, a TV bureau and a table & chair, the basis. If you are looking for storage for your clothes, this might be minimal though. The wi-fi connection comes at a high fee, but if you walk 20 seconds outside Times Square offers free wi-fi (which we sometimes caught from inside the room) As many said, the location cannot be beat! In the heart of Times Square close to everything! Although, if your looking for a quiet neighborhood, this might not be it. We didn’t hear anything any noise from inside the room, but we went to bed for 4 am. Everything was functional, AC, lights, water. The shower also, but the shower head didn’t offer much of a stream (or am I too used to my giant shower head at home?) We did not have much contact with the hotel staff, but they were courteous every time. We ordered extra pillows and blankets and got them right away, got access to the lobby phone pretty easy and got all the information we asked. Security at all times on the elevators, if you don’t have a room key you don’t go up! (Which is good but caused some mishaps for us think about this : 4girls – 2keys!) In short, If your looking for a luxurious rest in a room with multiple conveniences and appliances – skip this choice. If you’re looking for a good clean hotel room to sleep while you cruise around New York, this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Slicksmt
Reviews.Content: This was a great location for the heart of downtown NYC, the bed wasn't that comfortable as I felt I was sleeping on a box spring. The cafe inside the hotel was great, the food was just plentiful! The bathroom is very small but you are not spending a lot of time in the hotel while you are visiting NYC so for the price and location, it was great!

Reviews.Title: “The worst”
Reviews.Author: Hellogyn
Reviews.Content: Well located but dirty and with unpolite staff! This is certainly the worst hotel I have already been! Old furniture, bad beds, terrible A.C. the bathtubs are always dirty and there are not refrigerators for every room. The worst of all is that they are very disorganized. We made reservations for two rooms with twin bads and when we alrrived they wanted us friends to share a double bad! When we checked out they tried to overcharge a friend of mine for calls she didn't make. And ir you are looking for a charming place Times Square is not the place!

Reviews.Title: “Location couldn't be better!”
Reviews.Author: ut1998nc
Reviews.Content: We had a quick 3 night stay to catch a couple shows and do some shopping, location was perfect! Rooms were just enough for the three of us and clean. Definitly will be staying here next time in New York which I hope is soon!

Reviews.Title: “A Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: paul l
Reviews.Content: Just arrived home from my NYC vacation and i wanted to say Thank You to everybody at the Edison for making my trip a enjoyable/affordable. The room was wonderful all the employess friendly and very nice. The Edison Cafe was awesome "Great Food " at very reasonable prices...One of the best breakfasts in the Theater District. If not for the reasonable rates and great rooms at the Edison my NYC trip would of never been as enjoyable as it was.. b/c i love coming to NYC for thier Broadway Shows i defenetly will be staying at the Edison again and recommending it to all my family and friends

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING LOCATION GREAT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: ch86uk
Reviews.Content: My Boyfriend and I stayed at the Edison Hotel in February 2011 from 21st to 25th. I chose this hotel as I had visited New York in 2004 and had stayed there then. Upon arrival at the hotel we were greeted in a friendly manner. Check in was extremely quick and we were provided with the key to our room. The room was a deluxe double room. I had booked this trip as a surprise for my Boyfriends 30th Birthday and I actually emailed the hotel before arrival to make them aware of this and to see if there was anything they could do to make our stay even more special (cheeky I know but if you don’t ask you don’t get). As a result, they allocated us a newly refurbished room with views of Times Square. The room was very big and spacious as far as hotel rooms are concerned. The living area was big with a sofa and chair. There was a TV and the wardrobe was also a good size. The bathroom was clean and tidy. Some people might call the decor "old" however, this is a hotel with a fifties theme to it so the decor is new, however, is in a fifties style. I had read some reviews about bed bugs at hotels in New York, but i can guarantee there were none of these in our room. All hotel rooms were undergoing renovation. They were working on our floor while we were there but there was no disruption to us. The lifts at the hotel are great, there are several and they are extremely fast. The reception desk is very helpful and there is a dedicated information desk which is manned; we used this to ask where certain shops were and to get advice on restaurants. This was fantastic and if you don’t already have a map, they will provide you with one. The hotel has a large seating area which can be used when you are waiting to be picked up to go home- they don’t allow suitcases or luggage in this area but there is a manned secure cloakroom to store your luggage on your last day once you have checked out, there is a small fee but well worth it. I think it was $2 per item. The hotel does have a cafe where you can get breakfast/lunch; however, the prices were quite high; although they generally were in that area of the city. We ended up having McDonalds breakfast a few days. Overall the hotel was excellent. Don’t forget, you’re not going to New York to sit in your luxurious hotel room, you’re going to explore the amazing city and the hotel is just a place to get your head down. While in New York, try to avoid being stopped by the salespeople in Times Square trying to sell you tickets to a comedy club. We made the mistake of stopping for the first one; they are very polite but they do tend to push you into buying tickets; we didn't on the basis we can see a comedy show at home and wanted to make the most of our time in NY seeing the sights. I would definitely recommend doing the following while in NY: 1. Seeing the statue of liberty. This is quite a way from the hotel and costs around $30 in a cab. There are several different trips: you can take the Staten Island ferry: this will go around the statue or you can take the Liberty Cruise and this will drop you off on Ellis Island. We opted for this. You get off at Ellis Island and can walk around the statue of liberty. It is amazing. The island is not too big but has a Cafe and a shop and amazing views off the city skyline. The minimum stay on the island is around 45 minutes, and then the ferry will return you to the Mainland. You can also choose to go up the statue into the crown. Be aware, tickets sell out for this quickly so it’s best to book in advance. 2. Go to Top of The Rock. The Rockefeller centre is amazing and i must say has must better views than the Empire State. We went up around Midday and the views were fantastic. You can see the whole of Central Park and beyond and a bonus us you can actually see the Empire State. 3. Empire State Building. It is worth going up the empire state, it is totally different to the Rockefeller Centre. We went up here at the night. Be warned, it gets cold and windy up there in the winter months so wrap up warm. Views at night are great. 4. Central Park. This is a must. The park is huge so we took a ride on a rickshaw and were given a 45 minute tour of the park, stopping at Strawberry fields (the John Lennon memorial) and also at the "Friends Fountain". The mark was amazing and the drivers generally have fantastic knowledge of the park and tell you all about its history. The ride was $100 for 45 minutes but you do have to barter with the drivers or you could end up paying more. 5. Fifth Ave. If shopping is your thing, fifth ave is the place to go. It’s riddled with designer shops. FAO Schwartz is fab if you have children, full of toys and the children can play on the giant piano similar to the one from "Big" the movie. Tiffany’s is also on Fifth Ave, i have one word for this: AMAZING. Watch out though, there are no prices displayed so it’s worth asking before committing to buy as things don’t come cheap. There is an array of shops here and we used a full afternoon and evening exploring. The shops are generally open until around 8pm. 6. Ground Zero. This is no longer an awful scene of carnage and rubble; this is now the site of a new tower of hope. It is close to the Statue of Liberty ferry so we combined the Liberty trip with this. It’s very humbling to see. Across the way there is a shop called Century 21, this is stocks designer clothes at high street prices. If you’re willing to have a rummage you can get some great deals. Abercrombie and Fitch are also not far away. 7. Underground. No trip to NYC would be complete without going on the underground to grand central station. It’s very quick and easy to buy tickets but if you are unsure there are people around to help. Grand Central station is amazing, definitely worth a visit. There are many many more things to do in NYC but one thing i would recommend is to plan your trips. This will ensure you get the most out of your time and manage to fit everything in. Restaurant wise, we ate at Hard rock Cafe in Times Square a few times, this was lovely but there is usually a wait of around an hour for a table. Food is amazing and portions are huge. Price is like eating at somewhere like Frankie and Bennies or TGI's in the UK so average really. We also used a small steak house and a pizza and salad bar which were equally as nice. The food is the most expensive thing in NYC so always best to look out for offers as you can end up getting stung with the bill, and there is then a service charge on top. New Yorkers do generally get tipped 15% minimum. Once more thing, don’t get in a black private taxi, you will get ripped off. Always use the yellow cabs. Overall we had an amazing time, it was the trip of a lifetime, but oh boy, it’s none stop and very tiring but worth it by far.

Reviews.Title: “Even the location couldn't make up for this!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ACTW
Reviews.Content: I was told when I booked this hotel that it was a three star... ha! I arrived to see a pleasant bell boy in a uniform that I am sure was once white, he was helpful so I dismissed my first niggle! However, I was then kept waiting at reception until I was eventually served by a miserable, unhelpful man! Not a great first impression... I took the lift/elavator to the sixth floor to greeted by the most disgusting smell on the corridor. I hoped the room wasn't as bad, it wasn't thank god, until you opened the walk in cupboard - I couldn't hang my clothes in there! The room was a good size with a modern TV, shame the decor was not as modern (I think it may have been modern in the 70's!) I also think the 70's was possibly the last time it was cleaned! The top cover on the bed was dirty - I took this off straight away, there were hair grips all over the floor clearly meaning it hadn't been hoovered, there were long black hairs stuck to the ceiling of the bathroom, pubic hairs in the draw and writing on the mirror in the bathroom. I was upset it wasn't what I had received in other three star hotels in NYC. In fact it was that unclean I didn't unpack! Outside there was lots of noise, workmen (which I know can't be helped) and the binmen were outside very late - I think I slept with one eye open! I decided I would let the management know about the uncleanliness the following morning. However, at quarter to eight on our first morning I heard a suitcase been wheeled along the corridor, it stopped outside the door and someone used a keycard to get in our room, not once but about four times even though I was shouting 'hello'. Luckily it was still deadbolted from the night so they realsied we were in there, but really checking out your room while you are in there - not good - what if it had been the middle of the day and with that I quickly got ready and checked into another hotel for the following two nights in New York. If this service wasn't bad enough when I went to check out - two days early, they did not question why I was checking out - what disgusting customer service! I would not stay here if someone paid me!

Reviews.Title: “very good”
Reviews.Author: Cecilemel
Reviews.Content: Wonderfull Location for this hotel. A bit old fashion but this is a really good value for Time Square and for the offer we got. Breakfast included, double bed, and not to expensive Across the street Time Square, subway, tours, shops, restaurants... what else do you need ? The staff was really nice and helpfull. We really enjoy our stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean and nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: CGSR
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this - it was much cheaper than most options around times square...but even though it was IN the square we could sleep at night - not a massive amount of noise. It was handy that there was a concierge and a travel info desk, and there was also an air conditioner that worked well in the heat, and a nice Flat screen TV... Rooms were attended to every day.

Reviews.Title: “There must be better places for the money”
Reviews.Author: Jeanne H
Reviews.Content: The room was small, the bathroom was not clean, wet towels were not replaced and the tub faucet dripped, dripped, dripped. Two requests did not result in any repair of the tub faucet; although we got a boat load of towels we did not need. Staff was courteous and we did get a breakfast coupon, which was a nice place. Breakfast was delicious. Next time, though I'll pay for my breakfast if the accommodations were better.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this place”
Reviews.Author: ybaram
Reviews.Content: One of the worst hotels I ever stayed in. I arrived to the hotel around 11 pm, Friday eve. There was only one slow receptionist and therefore it took more than 15 minutes before I received the key to my room. When I entered the room, I understood that I should have wished that it would have taken the receptionist more time and I had avoided this room. The room was clean in their standards, but dirty in all other standards. The sheets on the bed wasn't something that you happily use (to say the least), and the bathroom had better times (20-30 years ago). The only good thing about this hotel is its location on Times Square (if you are looking for center location in NYC), I couldn't find any other thing that could justify staying in this hotel. Since I was on a business trip, and had to stopover in NYC for one night due to flight schedule, I let my travel agent to choose the hotel, I will never do it again. She got a good bargain on this hotel, but for me no bargain can justify staying in this hotel ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel, a bit tired”
Reviews.Author: welingtonanna
Reviews.Content: Even though this hotel is a little tired, it is very handy to Times Square, which is good, especially if your time is limited in New York. Rooms a good size for New York. Would stay here again, only for its location

Reviews.Title: “All you need in the heart of NYC”
Reviews.Author: Scarlett_SA
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a glorious 5 nights in NYC with the Edison Hotel as our base. We have stayed at this hotel once before 5 years ago and were pleased to experience the same great service. We were able to check in early and our room, though small and basic - had every amenity one would need and was spotless. The location of this hotel is a huge draw card, a couple of paces away from Times Square and located in Hell's Kitchen - with Restaurant Row one street down. The hotel was so central that we only used the subway once and a cab once - and we walked everywhere else! Concierge was fantastic, and the shuttle offered at the transportation desk more than worth the money (to and from all airports every 1.5hours)

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: putputOttawa_Ontario
Reviews.Content: A very good experience overall. Staff was excellent! When we arrived I was a bit surprised to have a room without a real view and was told by friends to expect that from New York. When I went back to the counter to register a safe I mentioned my "deception" to the counter person and she told me to have a look at another room immediately. We did and even though it was smaller, we had a view!!! Each time we had to deal with the staff we had the same pleasing experience. We will go back! Room are small, old"ish" washroom are also on the small size of the scale, but room were clean and had everything we needed. And the location is really really good! less than one minute walk to Time Square!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but likely won't return”
Reviews.Author: Gracer45
Reviews.Content: Great location just off Times Square, with a free (short-order, pre-made) breakfast included in the room charge. The rooms were small, but clean and really all we needed for our 3 night stay. Being from Canada, I wanted my husband to be able to call me in the room each night to save money from calling using my cell phone - the phone didn't work. We let them know on Monday morning, and it still wasn't fixed by the time we checked out Wednesday morning - even though we told them every time we passed the front desk. On Tuesday morning, we realized we neglected to leave a tip for the housekeeping staff on Monday, so my friend left a $5 bill on the bed for that day. When we returned to our room at 3:30pm, the $5 bill was gone, but our room hadn't been touched. We told management - who was really good- offered to give us a new room due to the phone not working and called housekeeping immediately to clean our room. We did not want to change rooms as it was our last night and didn't want our room cleaned at that point - we were busy showering and getting ready for dinner and a show. Housekeeping knocked on our door 3 separate times to clean despite us telling them no - but finally backed off when I agreed to take new towels at least. Overall - great location for the price, decent breakfast but a bit shady on the service. I'm sure management would have called up to see that our needs were satisfied after the housekeeping incident --- oh wait, our phone didn't work...

Reviews.Title: “Will always use this hotel”
Reviews.Author: beaverhausen010
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Edison for the second time from 16th to 22nd August this time with my grandaughter and it was great. The room was spotless and kept that way by the hard working staff. Fresh towels and bed linen daily. We were on the 17th floor and had no problem with the lifts,we did not have to wait long for one. There is always a member of staff on duty to monitor who goes in the lifts so security top notch. Cafe Edison can be reached from the lobby and is good value. There is a room on the 2nd floor that has computers in and for a few dollars you can stay in touch with friends and family on face book or twitter (more important to some people than others) Also easy to do filght check in and print boarding pass. On the same floor is a free ice machine .Over the last five years I have visted New York once or twice a year with family or friends and have stayed in different hotels in various locations and all more expensive than the Edison. Every single hotel can be improved one way or another whether its the decor or service or cost and customers requirements vary so an hotel that suits all is impossible to find. I highly recommend the Edison for location, comfort, friendly helpful staff and price. In fact I am already planning next years visit with my daughters.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable rates in the heart of midtown”
Reviews.Author: latticeguy
Reviews.Content: This is our most frequent place to stay when visiting NYC. Great location just off Times Square and only a few blocks from Restaurant Row. Be sure to try the Edison Cafe, the ultimate NY experience. By NY standards, the rates are reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Its all about Location!!”
Reviews.Author: BennyKenna
Reviews.Content: Arrived in NY with no accomadation and heard about the Edison and its great location, and that it was in less than 2 minutes from the front door you are standing in Time Square... But the hotel itself wasnt great. The room was tiny, the bathroom was small and old. The bed linen was old fashioned, although clean. You are only paying for location and not for comfort! We stayed 3 nights and had to leave I couldnt end my experience in NY staying in such average conditions.

Reviews.Title: “Location...Location....Location”
Reviews.Author: Dianne E
Reviews.Content: This hotel is old, the bathroom is very small, the room is ok...no frills, only one of the 3 lamps in our room even came on, but in 2 minutes you can walk into Times Square. For the price, I would stay there again. You are about a 5 minute walk to Hell's Kitchen Area where there are dozens of eclectic restaurants. We only slept and bathed here, so no complaints. Just set your expectations low and throw the luggage in, lock the door and hit the street!

Reviews.Title: “super location”
Reviews.Author: debs109
Reviews.Content: this was a nice hotel, fantastic loctaion!!!!! clean towels everyday, bed was changed once in the 4 nights we stayed staff were very helpfull room was basic but served the purpose...and when your in newyork your not in your room much anyway haha

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: KristaDawn
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nothing special but it is clean and in a great location. The central location was great for exploring and as a homebase. The rooms are small but it's New York! The cafe in the lobby was good and quick. The 50cents to check your bag before your flight is a nice touch. Would stay here for sure on the next trip to NY

Reviews.Title: “A bit rough around the edges, but has character and served its purpose.”
Reviews.Author: gizmack013
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel last week, and were quite pleased with our stat. It is an art deco style building, and the lobby is fantastic. The valet service was so convenient - except that when we checked in, the girl at the desk took our valet ticket! We thought this was weird, but figured that since we said we wouldn't take it out until leaving, she was just going to keep it in a room file or something... We were wrong! We did get our car back but it was a hassle. Our room was a king and a pullout couch (we took turns). When we got in, the room smelled very smoky, and the air conditioning didn't work. We bought some febreze which helped the smell, but there was no solution to the a/c. That week was so hot, we really wish it worked. Nevermind, though - we had a cold shower every night which really helped. The location is great. So close to times square (closer than we thought) but we couldnt hear it. There was construction across the street all night, but we wore ear plugs anyway, so that wasn't a problem. It was clean, and the bed was comfy (the rollaway was what you'd expect). The bellhop who helped us as we left was so kind, and told us all about the hotel's past famous guests. We ate at Cafe Edison every morning, which was perfect for what we needed!! We'd return, but only if we weren't going in the summer. The lack of air conditioning made the room too hot!

Reviews.Title: “Clean - only positive word to describe it”
Reviews.Author: hodgsons-choice
Reviews.Content: A disappointing stay - which is a shame because the hotel has the raw material to be great - the art deco style and location. Our room was nothing like the photos on this site (or any other website). Don't stay on the 20th floor - all rooms are 1970s decor and bathrooms small - on the positive side, it was clean. The front desk staff were not the most pleasant, but the cleaning staff and bell men were very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Kathleen M
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Edison Hotel. It was ideally located for our visit to the city. The room was ready for our check in when we arrived at 2:30PM. The room was clean and comfortable and the hotel staff that we encountered were curteous and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location! Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: NicoT13
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect, half a block away from times Square! The hotel is average, not bad, but just a nice normal place to sleep in NY.

Reviews.Title: “We loved”
Reviews.Author: Evitosha
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in the best location for a very reasonable price in august ! The room was small but nice and comfortable ,hotel service and the stuff were very friendly.the price is including nice American breakfast and a cocktail in the bar.very lovely

Reviews.Title: “No Bed Bugs!”
Reviews.Author: threehotmonkeys
Reviews.Content: WE had a great time here as we do every year. The people are always nice and helpful and very accommodating. Love the location....right next to a great bar, great pizza and breakfast place, and of course Times Square. I have been going here for years and have never had a problem. Will continue to go there!

Reviews.Title: “Location doesn't make up for the poor quality rooms”
Reviews.Author: -Chanelle-F
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 1 night on a NY stop over..... really was horrified. From the outside the hotel looks OK. Front desk service is good..... then I walked into the room and it went downhill from there. The room was a double, but only had 2 single beds. I could live with that except that it smelt damp, the aircon was really loud and I felt like I was staying in a dodgy hostel. Actually was scared going to sleep! My friend and I wore thongs into the bathroom and I seriously considered just waiting until our next stop to shower!! (Chose to use it in the end). The ONLY plus to this hotel is its' Times Square location, but for me, that didn't make up for the fact that it was just gross. I'd also pay double the price to stay somehwere decent.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location but disappointing room.”
Reviews.Author: dwm59
Reviews.Content: A hotel that has seen better days but continues to be popular with its proximity to Times Square and the Theater District. The lobby is well maintained, the dinning room is well appointed and the bar is charming. The room was small and dumpy; the bathroom was incredibly small! It is a good thing we did not spend much time in the hotel room other than to sleep. I must say the front desk staff were very courteous and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded My Expectations”
Reviews.Author: billLewallen
Reviews.Content: The old world art deco hotel is in a great location and the price is certainly right. While not luxurious, the rooms are clean. I was only ithere long enough for a disco nap and crash after a Broadway show and dinner. The staff were helpful and friendly. I will not hesitate to stay there again later this year.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely will be back :)”
Reviews.Author: EdisonFan
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel was perfect - a block away from Times Square. It has an old time charm, though does need a little fresh paint, new curtains, etc. They immediately sent someone up to vacuum when we called requesting such. Breakfast at the cafe was affordable and very good. Any and all staff we dealt with were pleasant and helpful.If you are looking for a hotel the is reasonably priced, excellent location vs the higher priced, fancier hotels - then make reservations here.

Reviews.Title: “At least the location is good...”
Reviews.Author: rosebud318
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Edison twice in the last year- in December of 2010 we stayed in a room that had no heat. After not believing us at first (we went a whole 24 of a 48 hour stay with no heat because they said it was just cold outside) they came and switched out the unit. In July we were one of the many that had no air-conditioning or hot water- for three full days. It wouldn't have been so bad if it weren't for the fact that it took two full days before they finally came clean and posted a sign in the elevator as to what was going on. At first it was "we will send someone right up to look at the unit" then it was "the power company is forcing us to hold back." There were about three different stories in all and the air conditioning and hot water was always going to return either by eight o'clock that night or the next morning. We NEVER got air back, and when we finally got hot water back on the last day, the lamp in the bathroom burned out plunging the room into darkness! It was comical how bad it was. Still, the hotel is right on Times Square and even with no heat or air conditioning, moldy bathrooms, and tired furniture (Neither time has the room looked ANYTHING like the ones on the web-site) I still considered it a good deal. Despite two disaster filled stays, I was even looking at returning there in December. (Awful conditions or not- it was a great price for the location and I always felt safe.) However, I just checked out their "new" web-site and "new" rates and about fell over- I had to immediately come here and warn people not to spend that kind of money on this dump! Oh my word- I would have died if I had spent that kind of money for the caliber of stays we had, and I CERTAINLY will not be spending that kind of money to stay there in the future. If you can get a room for a cheap rate and don't mind it being a bit rough- go for it. Otherwise- STEER CLEAR.

Reviews.Title: “Very Very Good”
Reviews.Author: JosieJo1968
Reviews.Content: The room with the king size bed was a good size for the price. We did a special for 3 nights. Staff was great and the room was very clean. I would definitely stay here again. Very Art Deco and great location, near everything.

Reviews.Title: “Everything I wanted and I will return”
Reviews.Author: bakerjoe
Reviews.Content: Room was clean...check in and out was quick and easy. Terrific location and is close to Times Square I will return

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel - Fab Location - We Will Go Back”
Reviews.Author: Hotelgirl42
Reviews.Content: This was a 5th wedding anniversary trip to New York - my second time there and husband's first time in New York. We had no expectations of this hotel as it was booked as part of a package but we were very pleasantly surprised. The location was absolutely brilliant - couldn't have asked for more. The room was perfect - clean, with no noise and the best bed ever. The ate at the diner for 1 of our meals every day and the food was excellent. The staff were very helpful. Highly recommend - when we return we'll definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Another Winning Stay At Edison”
Reviews.Author: FiveTenLover
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at Edison. We took a three day 28th anniversary trip to NYC and the Edison staff treated us so well right from the beginning. W even got a deluxe room upgrade without asking. The room was comfortable, well appointed, and roomy. It is not modern, but I love the art-deco style, and if you like that style, this is the place for you. Don't forget to get a meal or two at Cafe Edison, it is just the best... For a picture gallery of our trip go here: http://chrisofmaine.smugmug.com/Travel/28th-Anniversary-NYC-Trip/17181864_8NfDL4

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: DM85
Reviews.Content: Me and my mum stayed for a week in the Edison Hotel encompassing Thanksgiving (which we didn't know too much about but found the parade very entertaining and the dinner/dance cruise we attended marvellous). The hotel is in a brilliant location. Times Square on the doorstep and great transport links nearby (which we didn't utilise really as we walked to most places). The reason we chose the hotel was the price, location and reviews we had read. Since we went, the price does seem to have increased but i'm not that surprised as it seemed cheap in comparison to other hotels we had looked at. The room whilst small was bright, clean and modern. The TV had many channels. We had 2 windows giving nice views and making the room bright. The bed did dominate the room, but there was also a table and chair, wardrobe and drawers. The lobby area was lovely as well, and as it was Christmas time the tree looked great. We only ate at the diner once there for breakfast but this was nice. Unfortunately we didn't discover the restaurant there until we were leaving but it looked nice. The hotel was a fantastic base for our first visit to New York, and we wouldn't hesitate to use it the next time. Here's hoping!!

Reviews.Title: “great location and price”
Reviews.Author: cec0930
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers reasonable rates and a wonderful location. Easy to walk to subways, time square, etc. Nice hotel with friendly staff. We felt safe there. Rooms were decent enough. This is great value to see the Big Apple.

Reviews.Title: “No Frills Hotel with Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: happyNovaScotia
Reviews.Content: My husband and teenage son and I stayed four nights at the Edison July 20th until 24th .It was our first trip to NYC and really wanted to be near Times Square .The hotel was recommended by people I work with and I was told great loacation , clean etc .. So we booked thru their website and got a deal pay now save later so for 211.oo a night we got a huge breakfast every morning ( eggs ,bacon ,fired poataoes, toast ,juice and coffee ) included and two drinks at the Rum room bar .So it was def a good deal .. The hotels best feature is the loaction its literally 30 secs form the Times square bleachers ..This a good for our son b/c some nights he would just go and sit and watch people when we went to bed ..I felt very safe with him doing this since the hotel was that close..The hotel lobbey is art deco sofas and chairs around to sit and chat with people or wait for someone ..The rooms are tired ..We were in room 1526 and we had a quite room we heard nothing and it had 2 double beds and a bathroom ( very small ) . The beds are standard and we slept well ( no pillow top mattress etc ) the bedding was clean and changed daily ..and no bed bugs ( a selling feature as well for us ) ..The towels were clean and we always had enough for the three of us . The room could have used up dates our air condtioner worked well .(thank Goodness) it was 108 degrees when we were there. The people working at the hotel were nice . There is security 24 hours a day and they stand at the elevators and make you show a guest key before you can go up ..Nice catch ..The cafe we had our included breakfast in was like a 1960,s cafe its no frills but the service was fast and the food was good ..The people who work there work very hard and were always friendly ..Would I stay there again ,I would recommend it for thoses who want times sq area for sure and are not into luxury hotels ..just clean and basic .. for those who like pillotop mattress, 400plus thread count sheets and duvets and new decor ..no this is not for you ..But its a great bang for you buck . We liked the location b/c we could go back to our room at 5 or 6 have a nap shower etc before we headed out for a broadway show (all are really near thsi hotel ) and supper ..So like I said LOcation Loaction LOcation .....

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC ALL ROUND - LOCATION 10/10”
Reviews.Author: shonka_10
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner stayed in New York in Oct, 2010. We went for a short 4 day break to do a little shopping and sight seeing before Xmas. The location of the hotel is really good, literally on the corner of Times Square. Rooms are clean, basic and are well equipped. Staff are friendly and it also has a gift shop which is cheaper than some on the streets. (The shop is next to the Concierge). Blink and miss it lol! Anyway, everything about this hotel, stay and visit to NYC was amazing. The following trips are recommended: - Empire State Top of the Rock Central Park Boathouse for a relaxing beverage (Little expensive but worth it) Helicopter ride around the financial district and over the Statue of Liberty. There's also tours like Movie tours and other various tours which are good and well priced and you see quote a lot of hotspots as the tour guide points them out! Overall 10/10 for everything!

Reviews.Title: “THEY GAVE US A NICE DOUBLE ROOM”
Reviews.Author: gm3itn
Reviews.Content: It pays to complain "The Squeaky Wheel gets the Oil" We were going on a cruise to Nassau ,Bahamas with a stop at Port Canaveral. On arrival from Glasgow Scotland we spent the night at the EDISON before the cruise and we were not pleased with the room as we had transferred from the Paramount as they could not give us 2 separate beds..So when we returned to the Edison for 6 nights stay before our flight back to Glasgow we complained and they understood our request and told us a room would be available after 2pm so we waited for it and it was worth it, we were given a 2 double bed room on the 11th floor and it was delightful , quiet, spacious and was lovely to come back to after our daily walks and excursions to NYC and also Times Square is at the end of the block on W. 47th st...if we ever go back to NYC I would be very happy to stay at the Edison if I had the same room!!! ...Les Hamilton .Glasgow Scotland

Reviews.Title: “Much better than expected”
Reviews.Author: Klara62
Reviews.Content: We, a family of 5 (2 teenagers, 1 boy 11yrs and husband & I), stayed 1 week at Edison Hotel from June 18-25. We had 2 suites with 2 twinbeds, our youngest slept in a sofabed. Our rooms were on 15 and 16 floor, not noisy at all considering the location. Very spacious and clean, the furniture was old but ok. The bathrooms were a bit small with shower in a bathtub but perfectly ok. The only thing we were not so happy about was that as it rained a lot and there was a leakage which caused the ceiling to fall down in pieces on the floor just by the window. This happened the day before we would leave and we informed the reception, they send someone up to check but they only put a paper on the floor. Guess they would repair it once we checked out (hope so at least..). The location was perfect for us, just a few steps from TS.

Reviews.Title: “Finally Finished With This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LikeNYC94
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here 5-6 times and considered it a "fair" choice due to location and price, but won't ever stay here again. Imagine staying on the 21st floor in late July with NO A/C in 95 degree temperatures. I checked in at 4pm and was told they would fix a "fuse problem" by 7pm so I stayed (the first hook, I suppose). Then I came back after a show and dinner at 12:30am and, NO A/C. It was a brutal night verging on heat stroke. NO A/C, NO FAN. In the morning--after little sleep--I told them it was a very difficult night. Then a lady at the desk said, "well, the whole block doesn't have power" (in other words, it was now the power comany's fault). Probem is, I stopped in 4 places on the block and yep, they all had A/C. By the way, NO HOT WATER EITHER, so I got my ice cold shower for no extra charge. UNHELPFUL and DECEITFUL MANAGEMENT AND STAFF. Dont' stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Started off great but.”
Reviews.Author: tamati
Reviews.Content: Our first night was okay room was small and bathroom dated but everything was clean and tidy, staff very good. The next day no hot water and no A/C. Okay they will fix by next day. Hello no 3 days later still no hot water or A/C. Record temps in New York Edison Hotel staff guess maybe tomorrow, we have 2 days to go Holiday a nightmare, ring and check before you come.

Reviews.Title: “Great location! Friendly People!”
Reviews.Author: Mratch
Reviews.Content: We highly recommend the Edison Hotel. After all, how much time does one spend in a hotel when you have the depth and breadth of New York City to experience? It is so, so convenient to Metro stops and Times Square. Yet, it was quiet and security was excellent - we took our 11 year old granddaughter and I appreciate the fact that even she and I were asked for our room key before we could go up in the elevator. The restaurant is a great place to start your day and the art deco in the foyer is worth seeing. The concierges were so knowledgeable about the right metro numbers and the best way to get from point A to point B. You will not be disappointed if you want cleanliness, friendliness and convenient location!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: KarenE88
Reviews.Content: This was one of the cheapest hotels we could find in New York. The hotel have a great location next to Times Square. The room was old, but clean with two duble beds. We stayed three friends and one was in wheelchair, there was good access for the wheelchair. We stayed for one week. Most of the staff was friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for....”
Reviews.Author: lassie79
Reviews.Content: I selected this hotel purely on price, so did not expect much for 200 a night in New York. We have stayed in more expensive place and they really are not much better. you only sleep in the room, as there is too much to do in N.Y than sit in a room.. so dont expect a lot here and you will not be dissapointed. The room was big enough furnishings very tied and the whole place needs a total make over and good clean, curtains were almost black with grime. We had this huge mirror fall off the wall in the middle of the night which gave us a fright and they couldnt even be bothered to put it back up again The beds however, were fine and comfortable and bathroom clean and thats about it. Location though is great 20 metres and your in Times square so for a cheap hotel very close to it all it was fine. Breakfast wasnt included but there are lots of cafes for that close by " the Evergreen" same street was great for this and really cheap by N.Y standards and the food good...I think the manangment of the hotel could certainly improve the place and make it look a bit cleaner and smarten it up. I booked on thier own site well in advance as accomodation is hard to get during the summer, and it was full up at the time. On the whole rather shabby, rather grubby....but you get what you pay for

Reviews.Title: “Yikes!”
Reviews.Author: kcarrow
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I have stayed at this hotel in NYC. This hotel seems to be very popular with international tourists and tour groups from Europe. As always, I will provide the Pros & Cons for this hotel. Pros: The hotel is right in the heart of Times Square. There are many hotels in NYC who have "Times Square" as part of their name but they can be 10 blocks away sometimes and when you venture that far away from Times Square late at night, it can be a bit scary. All NYC hotels are expensive and you will find this hotel much cheaper than most that are anywhere near Times Square. With taxes, I paid around $235. Ok, you now have the only two reasons to stay at this place which are location & price. Cons: The lobby is ok but the rooms are very small. I realize that most international people reading this may not be familiar with this reference, but the inside of the room and bed remind me of a Cheap Motel 6. The bed was very uncomfortable and needed replaced, the windows did not insulate much from all the street noise below even though I was on the 18th floor. The worst part which prompted me to review them on Trip Advisor is the amount of Mold that was growing on the wall of the shower. There is no excuse for any hotel to have that and the entire wall was covered with it. Disgusting! I heard people complaining that their air conditioning was not working in their room as well. My worked fairly well but I had to leave it on maximum the entire time I was there just to keep it reasonably cool. Overall: I am not suggesting that nobody should stay here. The pros for some people might outweigh the cons so I will leave it up to your personal preference. I had to go on the hotel website to pay my $10 for internet service and the hotel room pictures they show are laughable as they are the furthest from what my room looked like as they could be. Maybe they have a suite or two in the hotel that looks like that but I have never seen that either time I stayed there. New York is a must see city and I love going there. Enjoy your trip to the Big Apple! Feel free to email me if you have any questions.

Reviews.Title: “4th of July in the Edison”
Reviews.Author: MandM97
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 2 nights July 3/4. We had a package deal to view the July 4th fireworks and The Edison was one of the options. We were very pleased with location. The hotel was very clean BUT very outdated. We asked to switch our rooms because the first room (14th floor) bathroom toliet was leaking. When I asked to make the switch the front desk was very accomodating. I did ask for a renovated room.....which did not happen. The a/c could have been better but overall the hotel was fine. Secruity was great. We got the hotel about noon and was able to get into the room right away!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location!!!”
Reviews.Author: CarolinaMAC
Reviews.Content: This hotel has an excellent location. This is very useful for those who are traveling in groups. If anyone of the group gets tired, he can easily return to the hotel while the others continue enjoying the shops and restaurants of Times Square. I think the room size was good, considering you're in manhathan, as well as the bathroom. Everything was clean. The decor is not up to date, but it does not matter, since the hotel follows the art deco style

Reviews.Title: “Hotel staff was great”
