Reviews.Author: Melyssa_32
Reviews.Content: The Edison hotel is in a great location for everything. The hotel itself was in serious need of upgrading. We stayed in a room that when we plugged in air conditioner it sparked and I got a bit of a shock. The bathroom drain was clogged as well so when u took a shower u were ankle deep in water. The staff was great and very helpful during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “We will be back!”
Reviews.Author: Stacy1129
Reviews.Content: There were NO bedbugs! The room was clean, the front desk, the concierge, the housekeepers and the bellhops were all fantastic and helpful! The air conditioning was not the greatest, but the hotel followed up immediately to my concerns. The location is fantastic, I go to New York 4-5 times a year and we found the Edison Hotel by accident, we will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, for a great price in a great location”
Reviews.Author: sumacOhio
Reviews.Content: Our stay at The Edison Hotel was very nice. We found the hotel to be comfortable, clean and in a great location. We had no complaints of any kind and the staff was kind and helpful. We got to the hotel around 11:00 AM and were able to get into our room right away, which was a big plus. Our room was nice and very clean. The bathroom was spotless. I was a little concerned reading some of the previous reviews, however was very pleased with everything. The hotel is older and the hallways are outdated, but we didn't spend too much time in the halls so that was not an issue with us. We would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Certain rooms should be remodeled ASAP!”
Reviews.Author: luckylady063
Reviews.Content: We came in with a tour of about 60 people. It appeared that we were assigned rooms on the lower floors. Our room 414 was awful....mostly I am referring to the bathroom! It had black mold around the tub and sewer gas came out of the sink drain. Horrrible! We asked them to clean the mold, but all we noticed was they brought us some extra towels. It took until the 3rd day to get really sick from the sewer gas smell. My friend missed part of our tour due to feeling very sick to her stomach from the smell. We changed rooms for the last night, but that was a joke because the shower only had cold water hooked up...no hot water! Be sure to ask for a remodeled room here!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good value in the heart of Times Square”
Reviews.Author: KurtZimmerman827
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay here. Rooms were a bit on the small side, but it is NYC after all. Concierge was very helpful and the diner is to die for. Amazing food! Fabulous location!

Reviews.Title: “stone throw away from time square”
Reviews.Author: dmya
Reviews.Content: Our stay was very comfortable the room was nice furniture and decore a bit worn but very clean and as it was so hot and humid the air condition was a great bonus we were on the 11 floor and time square was visible from our room . we would stay there again and also recomend it to our friends

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location”
Reviews.Author: Calebmondon
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located right next to times square with fairly close access to the subway as well. We had a special deal on this hotel which made it worthwhile value. Overall our stay was good, the room was clean though a bit outdated, no fan in the bathroom. If you were paying $300+ a night I would expect a much larger room. Staff were friendly apart from one at the front desk that was extremely rude when a friend had dropped off a parcel for me to collect. If you are looking to be close to times square there is not really anything closer, but definitely get out and explore the rest of New York

Reviews.Title: “Great location, not so great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ENR722
Reviews.Content: We recently took our kids to New York for the first time. We wanted to be close to time square. The hotel Edison is in a great location, close to all of the shows. The rooms however were very poor. Very thing in the hotel looked like it hasn't been touched in 50 years, the carpets were filthy, electrical outlets were jerry rigged with extension cords, and the service at the restaurant was interesting to say the least. For $300/night, this midwest girl was far from Kansas.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. No wait perfect location!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: CGilmore09
Reviews.Content: When you visit NY you don't come for the hotel you come to see the city. The Edison hotel is a good hotel. It's not perfect but the room are a good size and are clean. The beds are somewhat firm but I had no problem passing out from walking the city all day. The staff was awesome!!! Out first 2 nights we had a jackhammer taring up concrete below us at 7am the staff moved us to the other side of the hotel right away. The LOCATION IS PERFECT!!!! your right on times square. Stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Great location. No complaints.”
Reviews.Author: Happy_Trails052
Reviews.Content: The staff here was friendly. Our room was clean. The location is great and the hotel lived up to my expectations. We didn't come here expecting 5 stars, we came understanding this fit in our budget and is literally 1/2 a block from Time Square!! And it was a hotel that 4 adults could stay in -- from what I could tell, most budget hotels sleep 2 adults in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel and I already booked my next trip in November!!”
Reviews.Author: marla1956
Reviews.Content: I've been to this hotel numerous times and the service only gets better & better every time I go. The renovated rooms are spacious and very clean. The staff are very friendly......from the upper management to the housekeeping.....and all are very helpful & accommodating. Location is perfect if you like to go to the theatre. If you love to be in the heart of Times Square this hotel is for you!!!

Reviews.Title: “Get Ready to Vomit!”
Reviews.Author: tommymouse
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in this hotel a few years ago and we were please with the room, which seemed renovated, and especially the location. So we reserved a room there again for June 2011. Upon arrival at the room, we were so disgusted, we almost vomited. So we requested another room. It wasn't that much better. The halls were nasty and musty. The room itself was being old. The TV was from the 80's, the furniture was old and beat up, the sheets were smelly and musty and seemed as if they were 10 years old. The bathroom was beyond nasty, not only very old, but it had mold in it. It was poorly maintained (I mean cleaned). There was dust everywhere. The air conditioner never got cold enough. I'd rather pay $100 dollars extra per day to another hotel than stay there again and get out feeling like I left a movie scene in a haunted and dirty hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Location - Shoddy Rooms”
Reviews.Author: LondonStephen16
Reviews.Content: Cannot fault the location - a stone's throw from Times Square - and the front desk staff were excellent - in particular Margaret & Donna. However - here's the downside!! 1) bathrooms in both our rooms were of a very poor standard 2) we had to request both our baths to be cleaned upon arrival - both baths very dirty 3) one bath full of previous occupant's hairs! 4) don't stay here if you have arthritis - impossible to adjust washbasin & shower taps 5) poor selection of bathroom toiletries - you'd need a hammer to get the conditioner out of its container! 6) carpet dirty 7) no mini bar 8) no in-room safe 9) no tea/coffee making facilites - we were told that this was against Health & Safety Regulations & yet other New York hotels have them 10) breakfast restaurant food is very average 11) breakfast restaurant adds on a double-tax tip automatically - you DON'T have to pay it! 12) in-room telephone working sporadically & poor line reception ........... so to sum up - great convenient location & excellent staff - but our stay there was spoiled by the dirty bathrooms & general poor quality of our rooms. Would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: blueboy35
Reviews.Content: Found the eddison great for show glitz and glamour then went into the room which i found poor should concentrate on the important things like the room clealiness, comfort and appearance

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location or the price!”
Reviews.Author: Andrea G
Reviews.Content: The Edison is centrally located in the heart of Times Square and the Theatre District. It's not a 5 star but our room was comfortable and clean. The cafe next door is convenient for breakfast and the bodaga next door to that is great too. The Art Decor is charming and the staff is very accommadating. We were really happy with our weeks stay there and thought the price was very fair compared to other hotels in the area. Theatres are right outside our door.

Reviews.Title: “Great NY Experience!”
Reviews.Author: Gpbcfoster
Reviews.Content: What a great New York hotel! The proximity to Times Square can't be beat, and the service and security is outstanding. We got a great nightly rate that included complimentary breakfast, not an insignificant perk. Our room with two queen beds was large and extremely comfortable. We will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: Macker_Kelly
Reviews.Content: We booked the Edison Hotel as it was recommended by the travel agents Tour America. We couldn't fault the location as it was right beside Time Square but the hotel itself was very outdated and not very clean! When we arrived at 2am in the morning after coming from the lovely Las Vegas we entered the rooms which could only be described as a cupboard with a bed!!!! That wasn't the problem as all you need is a bed and bathroom! My parents had a double room and so did me and my husband. Their bed had hair in it, hair in the bath, paint stripped off the bath, floor was manky. Our floor was damp, our bed was damp, bath wasn't clean, toilet made very strange noises! First thing the next morning we asked to be moved and that wasn't a problem, we got some excuse that we were put in them rooms because of the time we arrived at but later found out from other people staying there that they had the same problems and were not happy. Some had mould all over the bathrooms. The rooms we changed to weren't as bad but I wouldn't go back to the same hotel if i go back to New York. The rooms are nothing like what you see on the website!!! If it is just a bed you want for your stay well then this hotel may suit.

Reviews.Title: “Still great value...”
Reviews.Author: wiggy27
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our ninth visit to the Hotel Edison and again really enjoyed our stay. I asked for a room at the rear of the hotel (i'm a light sleeper and find the street noise keeps me awake) and we got a room on the 14th floor at the far end and rear of the building which was very quiet, and absolutely ideal. It had been refurbished and had a new bath, flat screen TV and i think new beds with nice soft pillows! As always we found all the staff to be friendly, and the warm welcome from the bellman who recognised us from our previous visits was very nice, and quite surprising considering the hundreds of people he must see every day! For the first time we had booked the "location package", which as well as giving a $5/night reduction on the room, also included breakfast in the Cafe Edison. There is a choice of breakfast items; pancakes, eggs/bacon and (i think) french toast. I had the 2 eggs and bacon which came with breakfast potatoes, 2 slices of toast, juice and coffee and was excellent. The Hotel Edison is still my favourite place to stay in New York!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and value”
Reviews.Author: DavidJAD
Reviews.Content: We stayed 1 night in this hotel. It is full of character. Staff were all friendly & helpful. Room was clean. Very powerful shower. You get what you pay for, and as you don't pay a 5star price you can't expect a 5star hotel. This is a very acceptable compromise. Location is excellent. I would stay here again, and would recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great location...shabby hotel”
Reviews.Author: breatheorange
Reviews.Content: You are literally steps from the center of Times Square located right next to the W Hotel. That was the up side to this hotel. Their website is a misrepresentation of the rooms. The two rooms they gave us were old, with old bedding, old decor, old bathrooms, old everything. The hallway was musty. We asked what floors had been renovated and they told us that our floor had been renovated which was completely false. If you want a deal in NYC, this is the place. I didn't see anything bad like bugs or dirty rooms. Everything is just old. If you are expecting a hotel room like the one pictured on the website, good luck. If you don't mind old accommodations, this is the place for you. If you do, stay next door at the W. If this was in any other location it would get 2 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel and its staff”
Reviews.Author: evavojtekova
Reviews.Content: I'd like to share my delightful experience during the stay at the Edison in May 2011. I was in NY for business and my hectic work schedule was assuaged by the attentive and most hospitable approach of the hotel personnel. The General Manager, John Canavan, and his colleague, Katarina Sefrankova, are an excellent team in furnishing customer's needs beyond expectations. The hotel's ambiance and a central location are just bonuses, as I'd like to say; it's not about the product, it's about the people. Thank you greatly!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible! I have never written a review for anything on line. I feel an obligation to write one for Hotel Edison.”
Reviews.Author: Mary60878
Reviews.Content: Horrible! Avoid this disgustingly filthy hotel at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “Hope to definately go back”
Reviews.Author: edison67
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travelled with our baby from England. After a long journey, we were greeted with a lovely hotel. The rooms was more shabby than the downstairs lobby etc, but was adequate and clean. Besides, the same floor was undergoing renovation, which I think will enhance the experience. The location (Times Square) is execellent. The staff were friendly, and we felt safe with the presence of security at the doors. We would definately stay in this charming hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “nostalgic charm close to Times square”
Reviews.Author: Relaxedholiday
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is a stones throw from Times square, The Cafe was reasonalbly priced and the staff all very helpfull.The concierge didint really know how to book tours but gave good advice as to where to go and how to beat the queues. Despite signage stating renovations being attended the room we stayed in was comfortable and clean, however the bathroom could have been upgraded and the shower dripped constantly. The bed was firm but comfortable and when I asked for a different pillow one was quickly provided.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location - 30 steps from Time Square - but do not expect luxury...”
Reviews.Author: zsmirnoff
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, not so perfect room. however, i noticed, that they renovate rooms - so maybe i just got a one, which was outdated. Not bad anyway.Who cares - facinating Time Square is steps away, you can get tickets to evening show for 50% off regular price right there.Parking is expensive - but everything is expensive in New York City. Restaurant Row is two blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location”
Reviews.Author: summerfunOhio
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Edison June 13th - June 16th. The room was for two and was very small. The bathroom was like a closet and there was no view from the window in the room. However, the hotel is minutes from all Broadway theaters and minutes from Times Square. The price was affordable and the service was good. For a trip when you spend little time in the room, this hotel was very good. One thing I didn't like was the business lounge. We only neeeded the printer to make our return flight check in and print boarding passes. You must pay to use the computer for the three minutes it takes to make your check in. Other hotels I have stayed in do not charge for this. Also, the computer was unreliable and froze, requiring us to call tech support.. We couldn't just go to another computer since we were signed in and in the middle of the task. The bed was rock hard and we rolled to the middle because of its long time usage. Overall, great location and good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and would stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: Howdyyaal
Reviews.Content: Holiday in New York City was great. Stayed at the Edison Hotel Times Square. They are in the process of renovating rooms. The room we stayed at was acceptable, but the location cannot be beat. I would stay there again. Rooms are clean but beds can be hard, ours was fine but the two other couples had harder beds in their rooms. It was just fantastic to walk out of the hotel and be right in Times square where all the action is.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great stay”
Reviews.Author: Heliconia
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Edison for 5 days. The diner in the hotel is not fancy, but the food was quite good. The service was prompt, and we ate breakfast there every day. We were on the third floor, facing the Barrymore Theater, and there was construction going on. On weekdays, the jackhammer was an annoyance. The staff was friendly, and the room, which could use a facelift, was comfortable. Storage was more than adequate. The bet feature about this hotel i the location. We were steps from Times Square and many theaters. Transportation was convenient, as well. We booked directly with the hotel and were satisfied that we got rooms at what we considered a bargain. The lobby is really a tribute to Art Deco. We would definitely return on our next visit to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: dimalfara
Reviews.Content: We only stayed 1 night but the location couldnt of been any better! Staff was courteious. Room was clean. It suited our needs!

Reviews.Title: “We Stayed Before, and We'll Stay Again.”
Reviews.Author: Greywanderer
Reviews.Content: We stayed in April for two nights. It served its purpose well: somewhere for a family of four to sleep on a flying vist to New York. We had a two-room suite with a shared bathroom. Pricewise, it is good in comparison with other nearby hotels. The big plus of this hotel is its location, literally a few paces from Times Square. As is usual in the USA, the deal was room only. That's fine, we were not too impressed with the Cafe Edison but there are plently of good eating opportunities nearby. The hotel has its own 'fine' restaurant too: Sophie's, which looks nice enough, but we didn't try it. The hotel also has its own pub - The Rum House - which we did try and found rather pricey. It also has a little shop with all the usual touristy bits and pieces where you can mail too, at a slight premium over normal postage rates. Cleanliness was fine - we saw none of the horrors sometimes reported in NYC hotels. Staff were courteous, helpful and friendly. On the last day we were able to put our luggage into store until late into the afternoon, and were able to recover it very quickly when the time came. Staff arranged taxis very promptly, and the security staff were noticeably vigilant. There seemed little chance of anyone other than legitimate guests even getting as far as the elevators. The standard of accommodation is OK if unremarkable, and it suited our purposes. We have stayed here before and would choose the Edison again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: MnMsMemo
Reviews.Content: Pros: Clean place to drop your bags and go, vintage feel, old New York appeal. Reasonable price for NYC. Cons: Tiny room and bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, hotel clean and comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkfans
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel was slightly dated, the bedroom was a good size and we had clean fluffy towels daily. The shower was really powerful and you could run a bath in about 2 minutes. The hotel was a stone's throw from Times Square which was a great location for Broadway, people watching and experiencing the vibrancy of New York. Danny's Deli was right next door, and it was so good that we went there for breakfast everyday. The staff at the Edison were friendly and helpful. Apart from an unfortunate incident where my partner got locked in the safety deposit room by one of the receptionists, Donna, who decided to sample Danny's Deli for herself, forgetting that he was in there. It's O.K he was rescued by one of Donna's colleagues after 10 minutes !!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, decent price”
Reviews.Author: Paulbearuk
Reviews.Content: Took the advice from this site and upgraded to a delux room. Well worth the extra $10 a night - had a separate lounge. Bathroom was a little small, but no problem. Was on 19th floor - no noise at all. Like the security of the hotel at the lift. Highlight was the bar - great little place, also the breakfast in the deli next door. Don't understand the negative comments on here - yes it has parts that need a refurb - but that is taking place. The location and price make up for it

Reviews.Title: “This place is dumpy”
Reviews.Author: scarletbegonia28
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night on a recent business trip. The room was extremely small, smelled heavily of cholrine, and the bed as almost sitting on the ground. Was able to switch to another room still dumpy but smelled better. The hotel is in dire need of updating and a serious renovation. I travel a lot and was looking forward to this stay. Very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “3rd stay here and will keep doing it!”
Reviews.Author: JDWLOO
Reviews.Content: This hotel is older, but very clean and secure. The location is absolutely wonderful if you are in Times Square to see Broadway shows. It is only a half block away from the discount TKTS booth for discounted theatre tickets. The hotel is walking distance to everything in Times Square, Rockefeller Plaza and 5th Ave. There is a Subway station less than a block away for everything else.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ChildeRoland
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure why all the negative reviews. My wife and I spent four nights here in December and loved it. You are literally staying in Times Square. There are plenty of small shops and cafes around the hotel in case you are interested in saving money. Another nice thing about the Edison is that it has two entrances. This is especially convenient if you are waiting for a taxi during rush hour. You can meet the driver on whichever side traffic is moving faster.

Reviews.Title: “We had the best of times”
Reviews.Author: watsonjames
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Edison for the first time last May. It was my very first flight and in a moment of madness decided to visit New York: the place of my dreams. We had reviewed many hotels on the net and had viewed Times Square through the live-earth cam. Because we had no experience of staying at hotels outside the UK, we chose the Edison because it looked and sounded ideal for our holiday; proximity to Times Square and Broadway. The arrangements were made through Expedia and we flew with Continental Airlines: I will not go into the personal fear and anxiety that the flight cost me. We actually met the pilot while we were waiting to board at Edinburgh. I was silently weeping into my husband’s shoulder at the time. The pilot assured me that he would deliver us safely to New York. Jim and I have nothing but the highest praise for the Edison Hotel and all the staff that we came into contact with on our first and this past stay. I could run out of superlatives; kindness, courtesy, good humour and nothing was too much trouble. The concierge, reception and the security men were so helpful and attentive. Jim and I enjoyed our little chats by the elevator bank when we returned from our latest adventure. Especially on the occasion of having been kissed by Robin Williams after watching his magnificent performance. The trip this year was my retirement present to myself and to my hero, husband and navigator, Jim. We chose the Edison again because we knew that we would be welcomed as valued guests. We are now back home in Scotland but we are still buzzing with the romance and thrill of it all. Everything about the holiday, every minute of every day, was an exciting revelation to us. We had managed to extend our holiday by one more day than last year, but it all went by so quickly. However, we did manage to pack in four plays (you can maybe imagine how it felt when we saw and actually spoke to such amazing actors from T/V and the movies) Stomp and two films, as well as many landmark locations. I could carry on indefinitely as New York has captured our imagination and our hearts. I would just like to say how much I admired the plumbing . One quick flush and no noisy tank filling up. Just one little thing to mention, which is not a criticism: this year we did not have a chest of drawers in our room and we had to keep most of our clothes in the cases. Looking on the bright side, it did keep them nice and flat: we also loved the wide screen television and the high level of housekeeping. Yours sincerely Barbara Watson

Reviews.Title: “I RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: nleiastone
Reviews.Content: I would defiantly recommend this hotel… Not only is the location AMAZING the staff was totally accommodating. We arrived there on Friday morning at around 8 am.. though we were unable to do a early check in because they were so busy, we were able to leave our bags, while we explored the amazing city. When we checked in they had us on the top floor 22nd ( I am afraid of heights) and by the time I got up I was not feeling the greatest. We called down to the front desk and within mins. They had as in a very nice room on the 3rd floor.. the room was clean as well as the bathroom, though the bathroom was looking a bit old.. Nothing to complain about… Hello you’re in NYC your only in your hotel to sleep..Every night when we returned to your room it was always clean with fresh towels and all that stuff.. all the staff is very friendly and helpful.. and on your last day our flight wasn’t until late and even tho we check out we were still able to leave our bags with the hotel to enjoy our last day in NYC.. I thought the hotel deserved and 5 starts in my book. I would defiantly be returning to this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Needs alot of updating and a good cleaning”
Reviews.Author: truffie1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with friends for 2 nights. It's an old dingy hotel with mold in the shower. The only thing going for this hotel is the location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NicoleAnn84
Reviews.Content: This hotel is half a block off Times Square, amazing location. There wasn't any lines for checking, and bellhop boys were right there to take up your luggage. The room was the same as every other regular hotel room I’ve stayed in. The only bad part of the room was the bathroom, was extremely small. We changed in the closet because of the limited space in the bathroom. Beds were comfortable and when we needed hotel staff they were always friendly. The Edison Café was a very good place to eat breakfast. The food came extraordinary fast and very food. They are also reasonably priced, the average breakfast per person cost us $8.00 (including a beverage). I would most definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “No. Just no.”
Reviews.Author: Myckyee
Reviews.Content: I had a reservation at the Edison for seven nights - I stayed one. I thought perhaps the charm of the lobby would extend to the rooms but I was wrong. The walls were scuffed and gouged and there were patches of grout where some of the gouges had been filled in. The furniture was stained, the bedding was cheap and old. Noise from the pipes (or something) woke us up and kept us awake. The bathroom was tiny and smelled. Bathtub was stained. It was not what I was expecting and the photos on the hotel's website certainly do not reflect the conditions of the rooms. The cafe is small and dirty and the service isn't great. I didn't bother trying for a better room, I checked out the next morning and went across the street to the Marriott. The service there is impeccable. Definitely more expensive but at least it's not scary! Honestly, because of its location, I think the Edison is great if you are on a tight budget, but if you can afford it go elsewhere. I won't be staying there again unless I start seeing reviews that say they've cleaned up and refurbished the rooms and renovated the bathrooms.

Reviews.Title: “Very basic but great location-not worth what they ask”
Reviews.Author: jamberoo
Reviews.Content: perhaps because of booking late,this was rather expensive for what it was...or maybe all new york hotels are overpriced??? Reception and checking in were good-rooms very old and cramped..no tea/coffee making facilities,iron provided but no sockets apart from unplugging some cables attached to tv,. It was clean but because there was no room we didnt invite maids in to trample over our suitcase on the floor( not worth unpacking for 3 nights) Was on the same street as Ticket office with discounted broadway show ,walking distance to Maceys and central park. Would use again only if it wasnt so expensive...breakfast room was very expensive so go to 9th st. which is less touristy and less expensive ( bus tour guy recommended this)

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as it looks”
Reviews.Author: wilkinson728
Reviews.Content: The rooms advertised are nothing like the one we were given, ours was at the back of the hotel, no outlook at all and the room was awful it was run down and tiny, the air conditioner was stuffed round the edges with material. Very disappointed as this was a trip for my 60th birthday and we thought we were going to a lovely hotel, the only thing going for it is its situation, it is very well located for sightseeing. Would I reccomend this hotel NO I wouldn't.

Reviews.Title: “great place,hotel standard”
Reviews.Author: lilpuddleduck
Reviews.Content: this hotel was in the best place right on times square,unfortunately the room was so small ,thebathroom must have been an old cupboard and the wardrobe ,well i kept my clothes in the case.the resturant was disgusting the waitress was the same.I sprayed my bed with insect repellent.could not sleep for the drunks in the hallway.In saying all this yes i would stay again just for the location.If buying tickets for shows wait until there as I paid £200.for 2 tickets and my friend got them in times square for a fraction of the cost.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: basand
Reviews.Content: Not the best, not the most luxurious, not the cleanest.. but the best value for your money! Hotel's location is excellent (100m from Times Square and lots of restaurants) and the staff is kind and helpful. The hotel and the room are little old fashioned but they are clean and spacious (enough). Absolutely the best hotel in Midtown New York for this price! In other reviews people are complaining about loud outside noises. We didn't hear loud noises! Off course you hear something from outside, but it's definitely not keeping you from sleeping. When you don't have too much money to spend and you don't need to have (too much) comfort or luxury, this hotel is just perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Even Better!”
Reviews.Author: Travelswithsmalldog
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Edison in 3 months. My daughter and I came both times to enjoy NYC and see shows. The location can't be beat and there's a great deli next door. The hotel and rooms are very clean and we had a newly renovated room this time. The staff is friendly and very helpful. With the guidance of the concierge we tackled the subway system this trip. It turned out to be very easy. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Position is the only good thing we found with the Edison unfortunately”
Reviews.Author: bigtractor
Reviews.Content: The hotel was postioned well, HOWEVER the hotel owners really need to start thinking about spending some money on the rooms. The bed we had was about 30 years old, lumpy and noisy, the pillows were way past their life expectancy and the linen didn't feel clean, not sure if it was because it also was about 25years old or just not cleaned properly. Two out of the four nights we stayed we had no hot water and two days in a row I had to ring housekeeping at 5.30pm to come and make up our room from the night before. Out of all the hotels we stayed in USA for our three week holiday this was the most overpriced hotel for the standard of them all !!!

Reviews.Title: “What Renovations??!!!!”
Reviews.Author: magaming
Reviews.Content: Had previously stayed at this hotel 10 years ago, and when it was offered as part of a package initially we were reluctant to stay at the Edison. After reading some reviews and under the impression it had been renovated , we decided to stay there as it is so conveniently located for Broadway. Wrong! The Lobby is even dingier, and our room on the 10th floor hadn't been touched for the last 20 years . Don't bother with the diner either, it still has the same awful plants in the window and the counter surfaces leave a lot to be desired!

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly and dirty”
Reviews.Author: pinapopper
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff acts as though you are bothering them when checking in. The only helpful and friendly staff member was the doorman. They charge you to hold your luggage if you arrive any time before 3 pm check in time. The rooms and hallways are the absolute worst I've seen and I travel often. The bed linens felt dirty the comforter was as thin as toilet paper and had hair on it. The bathroom was small and mildewy. If you told me there aren't bedbugs in this hotel I'd be shocked. Asked for an 8 am wakeup calls but got 3 calls around 7 am with an operator telling a woman caller she was dining wrong room. The phone wouldn't stop ringing so I literally had to unplug it. This is one of the worst rooms I have ever stayed in and WILL NOT ever return.

Reviews.Title: “Basic room; awesome location”
Reviews.Author: Winonz11
Reviews.Content: Found the room to be rather dated. Had an issue with the window when trying open it and suddenly found myself holding the bottom portion of the window in my hands. It took my partner a good 20min to figure how to put it back in. Could have called someone to sort it but decided they'd probably expect a tip to fix it. Other than that, the staff seemed mostly friendly and to be honest, we hardly saw much of the room anyway. As for the location...wow, we were thrilled that we were splat bang in Times Sqaure. Didn't find it noisey at all other than our last night when we were awoken by what I thought was road works. It turned out to be helicopters with reporters following the news of Bin Ladens death. How fortunate were we to be there during the jubiliation and celebrations. Would definitely stay again but maybe upgrade to a better quality room.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly central location and a great room”
Reviews.Author: ChiChihuahua
Reviews.Content: I wasn't sure what to expect from the previous reviews so my expectations weren't too high. We did book this hotel fully aware that this was one of the cheaper hotels and so did not expect 5*s! For what we wanted, basically a hotel near Times Square and in close proximity to all the sights, this was great. We weren't planning on spending much time in our room, only to sleep and shower, as we were to be sightseeing (and shopping). When we checked in we were asked whether we had a preference to be on a lower or higher floor, we chose higher and were given a corner room on their top floor - floor 22. It was a clean fair sized room, with a medium sized bathroom (even though the bath was a tad grubby) but the shower was very powerful. We had slight views of Times Square from one window and out of the other was the side of another hotel (so we kept that curtain shut!). The bed was clean and comfy and gave us a great sleep at the end of an exhausting day! It was quite noisy at night - but you are in New York and seconds away from Times Square so it is expected!! I would definately return to this hotel, the room was exactly what we wanted. We did not go to their bar or restaurant so cannot comment on it. I was pleased that everytime we returned to the hotel we had to show the security guard our key card to get on the lift, its good to see some efforts are made towards guests safety. On our last day, check out was 12 and we wanted to leave our bags at the hotel whilst we went out for the day. The hotel had a secure bag store for the charge of $1, this was great and gave us peace of mind. Overall we had a superb trip and there were no issues with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location in Town!”
Reviews.Author: acorn66
Reviews.Content: There seemed to be mixed reviews for this one but in New York all we wanted was somewhere to get our head down at night. From maps & descriptions I knew the hotel was near to Times Square; I didn't realise it's street was on Times Square! It was fabulous! Considering our location we didn't get as much noise as expected - a couple of nights there were a few horns & screeching but didn't last all night. It is so easy staying in Times Square - lots of tacky souvenir shopping which let's face it, we all have to do a bit of! Teeming with cafes, bars & restaurants, plus it's the best place to get around from (& perhaps more importantly, back to!) - whether you're walking (fairly central for uptown & downtown) and nearly all the buses and all the subway go to or via Times Square! The hotel itself is a bit old fashioned - art deco style - not my taste and the furniture could do with updating in the rooms but it was clean and spacious - there were 2 adults & 2 teens in our room with 2 double beds & there was still enough room to move about. We didn't have a safe in our room but there is free safety deposit at reception available 24/7 which we made good use of - at all times of the day. We didn't eat in the hotel but some of our group tried breakfast and weren't too impressed but it didn't matter as there was a tasty deli next door but one to the hotel and a few more steps & you were spoilt for choice! With all the shopping in the area you probably wouldn't bother with the hotel shop - but do have a look - it was actually pretty reasonable & I got a couple of things in there cheaper than in nearby shops! We stayed 4 nights which I think is the minimum you should have for New York, especially if you've not been before (we'd been once before but still filled our time) - most tour operators seem to offer a 3 night package but that's hard going, I'd really recommend an extra one or 2 nights to really get the best from your trip! Would I go again? Yes & without a doubt I'd stay at the Edison!

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT VALUE”
Reviews.Author: KipsterLancashire
Reviews.Content: Travelled to New York in April to celebrate my daughters 18th birthday and chose the Edison after reading previous reviews as it provided a central location in the city. We were still amazed on arrival to discover just how close to Times Square the hotel actually is,literally 50 yrds away. Our check in, despite arriving quite late was very smooth and we were allocated a room on a higher floor as requested. All staff from the doorman to desk and security were polite and very helpful. We had a family room with two queen beds, it was spacious and very clean and had a great view of times square as we were on the back of the hotel. The room was serviced every day with clean towels and sheets provided. The first night we did struggle with noise from what appears to be a heating system at the back of the hotel but after that it didn't bother us at all. The hotel in general despite being busy was very quiet from a noise perspective. I would recommend the Edison Diner for breakfast , great choice and very reasonable, might even see an odd celebrity or two as we did !! We didn't eat in the restaurant as there is a vast amount of diners and restaurants close by, be aware that being in the theatre district they all get very busy before and after shows. I could highly recommend the Triecolori Italian next door to the hotel, fabulous food and great service. As a base for your trip to NYC I don't think you could beat the Edison for value for money, it may be in the process of a refurbishment and yes a lick of paint on some of the corridors wouldn't hurt but it was clean and staff were excellent. Would definately return in the future. If travelling to NYC for a few nights take a look at the New York pass , saved us a fortune on location visits and tours. Also don't be afraid to use the subway to get to the hotel from JFK, we arrived late Friday night but it was safe and quick to travel into Manhatten from Jamaica Station and cost half the price of a return taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Value, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Morley_Tripper
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 night stay to this hotel and have returned pleasantly surprised. The public areas are very retro and quite charming, as mentioned there is a security guard present at the lifts and you have to show your room key to get past them, which was a nice secure touch. There are no safes in the bedrooms but you do get free use of a safety deposit box at reception, you keep the key to it during your stay, but they are only small, good for travel documents cahs etc, not good for any gadgets. All the staff we encountered were very friendly and helpful. When we first walked into our bedroom (1628) there was a bit of shock at how old it looked, but we had a nice modern TV, and the bed was very comfortable with no bed bugs! The walls were quite thin so if you are a light sleeper then you may need earplugs, I did and managed to sleep fine. The only real negative I could say about the room was the bathroom tiles had mildew and mould in the grouting, there was also some on the ceiling above the shower. To be honest this didnt bother me because the room was spotless in every other sense. The location was superb, being about a minutes walk from times square, and only 5 mins from the subway, you can get to a lot of the big sites within walking distance, and public transport is easy to all the rest. We both enjoyed our stay here and thought the Edison provided excellent value for money, and will return on future trips to New York.

Reviews.Title: “Love its location”
Reviews.Author: vahnhiun
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 days, no dramas. The hotel is located just across the Times Square. If you require basic accommodation just for sleeping in new york city, this is the right hotel for you

Reviews.Title: “Location,location,location!”
Reviews.Author: Retired_Stockevik
Reviews.Content: Always very busy here, just as crowded in the lobby as on Times Square. Edison provides no luxury, but if you want the best location for tourism in NYC, this is the best. 20minutes walk takes you just anywhere in Midtown.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: amyjwilson
Reviews.Content: This hotel is all about the location. That seems to be all i read on other people's Trip Advisor reviews before i went and it is 100% true. I went with a group of friends and we wanted to ensure we had as much funds available for all the sights and shopping we wanted to do that we ensured we curbed our accomodation costs. The lobby was clean and the staff when we arrived were very helpful. We shared a suite and it was on the top floor. All suites are located on the top 2 floors and these floors have not yet undergone refurbishment like most of the other floors. As a result our room was pretty outdated and tacky in places. The carpets needed a good clean and the bathroom had seen better days (not helped that it was all white - well use to be). This aside though, when in NYC you barely spend anytime in the hotel other than to sleep. If you are not out eating, drinking or shopping then you are out seeing the fabulous sights that the Big Apple has to offer. This hotel is in a location that shoes NYC in its best light. I have stayed in a number of different parts of Manhatten and Times Square has undoubtedly been my favourite. The hotel is also a stones throw from the Broadway ticket booth meaning you can get a last minute show bargain for next to nothing. We strolled down on the morning of the night we wanted to watch a show and got 66% off of prime seats. If you want glamour and luxury then this hotel is not for you. If you want a true NYC experience, then it is.

Reviews.Title: “Great One Week Stay with Grandson”
Reviews.Author: rgjreagent
Reviews.Content: My wife, our 10 year old grandson and I just spent a full week in NYC, Times Square at the Edison Hotel. Selected the Suite room category and were very pleased at the room, space and convenience of the Edison. Loren, Skurta & Tony at the front desk were exceptional. Checked in very late and two days later when I checked back to relocate to a room with a King bed, Loren remembered my first name, hasn't ever happened in my 20+ years of travel, especially with all the people that go thru the Edison! Thanks Edison we will be back. Don't miss breakfast at the Edison Cafe.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff-especially reception great location and clean room”
Reviews.Author: San2805
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Edison for 5 days.we were welcomed by a lovely friendly receptionist who was extremely helpful.The room was clean,towels changed every day.Security were great and felt very safe.Fab location.Would not choose to eat in hotel cafe again as staff were surly but really pleased with the Hotel,Great choice for trip

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE HOTEL - STAY ELSEWHERE - Great location though”
Reviews.Author: grdenstate
Reviews.Content: This hotel was terrible. The first room they put us in was disgusting and dirty. They quickly moved us to a different room. This room appeared to be clean enough, until we looked for bedbugs. Though we did not find any traces of bedbugs, one of the people on our trip did end up with some bites. When searching for bedbugs, one is to lift up the mattresses. We found M&Ms and candy wrappers under one of the two beds. The other bed had a HUGE yellow urine stain (i.e. someone did not either clean the stain or clean it up with proper chemicals), and also some trash. What?! We stayed in the room though, because we figured that we shouldn't test our luck. The room also looked like a cat had been let loose: paint was falling off the walls, there were scratches everywhere, many tiles in the bathroom were literally broken, the sink wouldn't stop leaking, everything was really dusty, the list goes on and on. There was ONE electrical outlet within reach for us to use, besides the one in the bathroom. The staff was okay. It cost .50cents a bag if you need to check them, which is ridiculous. It should be free, because you are going to tip the bellhop anyway. The location was great though - 47th and Broadway, can't get much closer to Times Square than that! I would, however, recommend staying elsewhere. I personally would rather give up the location and stay a few blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Needs to be upgraded and cleaned - stay away from this tourist trap!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mike99a
Reviews.Content: Why don't they invest some of the profit into rooms? Our room had old ripped carpet, lamps with holes in the shades, mold in the bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but could use a little TLC”
Reviews.Author: jennaa555
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at Hotel Edison for three nights, travelling with my sister and my father who is a senior. Overall, the hotel is clean, in an excellent location (we could actually see Times Square from our window!) but the rooms could use some renovating. The 'single' sofa bed was very uncomfortable for my father, and was torn on the sides, so not very appealing if you ask me. the carpeting in the room could also be changed as well, since it comes in a floral, outdated pattern. We appreciated however that the hotel staff placed us on a higher floor away from the groups or youngsters, so it was very quiet during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “We had bed bugs!”
Reviews.Author: hopemamma
Reviews.Content: We found bed bugs on our second morning here...We were not charged for our room but one week later I am covered with bed bugbites... We were told they haven't had a complaint of bed bugs for over 1 year.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: friday2514
Reviews.Content: The Edison has some small rooms and it is a little worn. But for the money and the mid-town location I wouldn't stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value!”
Reviews.Author: fletchlisa
Reviews.Content: Stayed in NYC for 1 night w/ 2 adult "children" (19 years old). Easy to get to, valet parking very convenient. Able to check in early w/o difficulty and leave bags next day for a nominal fee. Close to EVERYTHING. Staff courteous. Would highly recommend if you are just looking for someplace to sleep. Beds were comfortable as were the pillows. Did not check out amenities as were busy w/ shopping, shows and eating. We were on the 9th floor, and did not notice any untoward noises mentioned in earlier reviews. Our room was not one of the ones renovated, but was just fine.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for great value”
Reviews.Author: tiffb73
Reviews.Content: Hotel Edison is just around the corner from Times Square. The hotel has a lovely foyer which always seems to be busy. There is security at the lifts to make sure that only hotel occupants can enter. The rooms are clean and not a bad size. The bathroom was nice too. The beds were ok but firm. It really is good value and has a great location. I recommend staying in this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Time Was Had By All!”
Reviews.Author: theo32
Reviews.Content: Hotel has great location and within walking distance of loads of tourist places. Staff were friendly at all time. All of us friends shared one room with 2 beds in, very clean with clean towels every day. Couldn't have asked for more. Deli almost next door - great food all day long - reasonable prices. Well worth a visit. Loved every minute of holiday, will definately return to NYC and stay at same hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with good location but with some minor issues”
Reviews.Author: mrslye
Reviews.Content: I stayed there from 26 to 30 Mar. Location is superb, right in the middle of Times Square. The hotel has seen better days and is undergoing some renovation work. Room is OK. However, if you are a light sleeper, you may have problem sleeping as there is some noise coming off the piping/air conditioning system every now and then. There is a souvenir store located on the ground floor, they sell drinking water, so that is a bonus to my colleagues and I. Breakfast is not provided. We ate at their cafe which is quite popular, reasonably priced too. You can subscribe to 'high speed' internet access from an external provider, it's very slow. Overall, it's a hotel that provides good value since this is New York, where accommodation is expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: hpennber
Reviews.Content: We had a quad room on the 17th floor. Room was dark but spacious and clean.Very quiet. Beds really comfortable and shower was great.Clean towels every day. Hairdrier would not work but a replacement was organised very quickly.Staff very friendly and helpful. Great value. Didn't realise it was so close to Times Square. Only slept and showered in the room so didn't mind that it needs up dating.No tea and coffee facilities. Visited cafe once but was not really inpressed.Danny's Deli, next door but one, is well worth a visit. Good choice of food all day and very friendly and reasonably priced. Check in and check out of hotel very smooth.Very good souvenir shop in hotel. Would stay again and recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Whacked with surcharges right from the start”
Reviews.Author: Familytripsrus
Reviews.Content: We were bombarded with surcharges right at the start at check in. They said that our reservations were for only two which meant a charge of $15/per night extra for a lousey rollaway bed. Next, an additional $19/ night for parking as we have an SUV (saturn Vue) which is considered a larger vehicle. The broom closet we stayed in with the roll away opened up left NO room to get around unless you like acrobatics. The room had NO view except the industrial view of an alley. For the money spent I could/ should have gotten a room at the Millenium or another four star hotel around times square. I often stayed here 25+ years ago with family on weekend trips and this is definetley not the same hotel as I remember. Very disappointed as this mini vacation was a reward for my daughter for doing well in school, next time (next year) I wont be so cheap minded and get a better place right from the start.

Reviews.Title: “Iconic Art Deco hotelright by Times Square.”
Reviews.Author: Lil088
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived, we felt we could have been transported back to the 1920's. Superb unspoilt decor, bellboys, attention to detail. A delightful bar, with a pianist and bass player,( I drank a "Manhatten" in Manhatten!). The room was warm - it was snowing outside-and it was clean and comfortable, The bath was deep and stylish, the bathroom was designed around the theme of Art Deco, right down to the taps. We slept well, only one thing missing, an alarm clock or radio! Aside from that,10/10.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: Skybluetone
Reviews.Content: Stayed here recently for 4 nights and could not really fault it.Here to see New York and not moan about the hotel rooms.The hotel does need an uplift which is now taking place.did not use the cafe but the recently refurbished bar was excellent.Hotel can get very busy but never had to wait long for service,Donna and Youseff on reception were a credit to the hotel. Location is perfect for Times Square and shall hopefully be returning next year .

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good experience with 1 hiccup...”
Reviews.Author: woolzinator
Reviews.Content: Great location, good looking historic hotel where a scene from " The Godfather" was filmed in the lobby. Had one problem with the room heating up too much at night. Didnt say anything about it until 4 hours after we checked out. (picking up our bags from storage) to the front desk manager in an off handed conversation. She insisted in taking off 1 nights lodging even though I wasn't asking for anything. I was impressed in her desire to make up for the problem with the room. She explained that the floor I stayed on hadn't been refurbished yet and was sometimes a bit "hot". Very impressed.... will definately stay again. This was my 4th stay at the Edison. Breakfast at the restauraunt was good too.

Reviews.Title: “Good and not so good”
Reviews.Author: llbqueen
Reviews.Content: My husband and two grown children stayed here in two rooms for four nights. We booked two rooms through a booking agency months before and requested and paid for two double/queen rooms. We arrived and had two twin rooms. The rooms were spotlessly clean and comfortable. Small, but this is NYC. I asked about paying for the larger rooms and was told that if the hotel did not have availability, they could substitute rooms. My daughter and I were on the fourth floor for the first night. We could not sleep very well because the hot water heating system of the hotel was clanging an banging all night long. In the morning, I requested to move and again mentioned the double/queen reservation we paid for. We were told we could move to another twin room if we moved right away as there were no double/queen rooms available- I had to go wake up my daughter to move. The second twin room was on the tenth floor and was perfectly fine. Very clean with comfortable beds. My husband and son were on the ninth floor and were fine with their room. We found the hotel staff to be friendly and liked that the doormen were diligent with checking for room keys to get on the elevator. Please check out Danny's Deli next door. Very inexpensive and good breakfasts and deli sandwiches. We ate there almost every day. My only complaint was that the hotel did not honor our reservation. I do have to say that the company called the hotel after our move to the higher floor and discussed the issue and told us to check back with the desk. By this time, I had talked to the people at the desk twice about the situation and we were comfortably settled in our twin rooms. So, we decided to stay put. I recommend the hotel if you can get on a higher floor away from the clanking pipes and if you want to be in Times Square. Not fancy, but comfortable, clean, and extremely convenient. Wish the hotel had Wifi that was reasonable in price.

Reviews.Title: “Good clean Hotel in good location.”
Reviews.Author: AlexE_Travel
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the hotel the check in was quick. The room was clean and comfortable and it was tidy. The hotel is looking a little old but apparently it is being renovated. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The location was good right by times square. The only real downside was you had to pay allot for WiFi and would of been useful been in new york, Overall I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Its not the Trump Tower, but the Frump Tower”
Reviews.Author: gggallery
Reviews.Content: Did they film horror movies at this hotel? It has the "psycho" ambiance. The first room was creepy so we changed, the second room was larger. The room was clean but they could certainly renovate as they are. The window and the window blinds broke and they fell on my cousin. At night there was a loud noise coming from somewhere as if they were sucking in air or water with a pump.... that did not stop until 6:00am. We got wake up calls that we didn't ask for...and the conscierge was on her menstrual cycle. The location is unbeatable...I would stay again, only when they finish renovating.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, except for the mattress”
Reviews.Author: LarryJ917
Reviews.Content: I'm not some posh crank, so I wasn't looking for luxury when I stayed at the Edison for one night. All I really wanted was a bed near Times Square for the night. I got that. Problem was, it wasn't much of a bed. The mattress was so old or cheap that it sagged like a big 'V.' Needless to say, that wasn't at all conducive to a good night's sleep. I know New York hotels are expensive and I understand that this one is undergoing upgrades, but there's really no excuse for providing guests with a mattress that's better-suited for a prison or an alcohol-rehab facility. Having voiced that complaint, though, I want to note that the public spaces are attractive, the service is friendly and efficient, and the rooms aren't bad at all for the price. The location, of course, couldn't get much better. But please! Do something about those mattresses!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location! Great beds!”
Reviews.Author: higerson
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Edison Hotel and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Very accommodating staff, excellent location and clean rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Traditional hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: ChristinM
Reviews.Content: The Edison Hotel is a very old institution in NYC and right at Times Square. This has upsides but also downsides. The rooms for NYC standards are a good deal. In general though paying that much for a hotel of that age and quality would be ridiculous. Location-wise it can't get any better. A relatively quiet side-street off Times Square with everything around that you need in NYC really. The rooms looked clean although you always have a little "old" feeling in buildings like this. The internet costs extra but is fast and was accessible without any problems. The TV was a little old but did the job. The room was equipped with hair-dryer, iron and ironing board. All you need really. No mini-bar though. The bar downstairs "Rum House" is a great place to hang out with good service. A small kiosk and an ATM is in the house also, which is great. The bed was ok. Nothing more to say about. The bathroom was clean but you could see the age of some parts. The cleaning staff put a lot of effort in the details like towel folding etc. what I found cute. As the pipes are all quite old you can hear them squeak and mourn, if people around your room use them. Unfortunately I woke up by it one night. The Front desk unfortunately was quite unfriendly. The Concierge though was awsome and the fact that you have another desk for ground transportation is nice also. Luggage storage costs $0.50 per piece...even for guests. But in the end it's understandable if you think of the amount of bags they are storing each day.

Reviews.Title: “#1 location”
Reviews.Author: krk4849
Reviews.Content: If you're going to NY and need a room this is great. Valet for $35 a day, which is pretty good for the city. Less than half a block from Time Square. Which is the real reason to stay at this hotel. This is not a plushy hotel, it is a place to sleep. There is a TV, bed, bathroom, hair dryer, iron, shampoo/conditioner. There is more space here than many places i've stayed in NY. There's a concierge, bellman, door man, a cafe attached for a great breakfast, and the bar certainly knows how to make a drink (for $10 ea). 2 complaints-the heat is either on or off, and the shower water is affected by other rooms. But for the amount of time a tourist to this city is spending in the room this is perfect for the price. It's clean, comfortable, and friendly. I would recommend this to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: HappyWandererVermont
Reviews.Content: While conveniently located, this hotel is nothing like the photos on the web. I booked through a reputable online discount site and had to request a room change 3 times before I was even willing to stay the night. I found the hallways and rooms shabby and depressing. Two of the rooms I was given appeared not to have been upgraded for over 50 years and the housekeeping standards are very low. The staff ranged from helpful to clueless to surly. I would never return to this hotel, and not only would I never send a friend there, I have been telling friends to avoid it.

Reviews.Title: “the last place I would ever stay”
Reviews.Author: lleta
Reviews.Content: Every year my job goes to the Javions Convention center for an Expo. Normally in the past weve'e stayed at the Belvedere, due to new management we ended up at the edison. We got there on the mega bus around 11am so we figure we join our co-workers in there room until our 3pm check in. We atlease wanted to drop off our bags. The front desk gave us such a hard time we eventually had to have someone come down to take us up. Than we it came time to check in the room was not even ready at 3. They said they still had to vaccuum. I went up 15 mins after that and he hadn' t even started. The room whole building is old and nasty and smells. The bathroom looked like something off an old horror movie. We had a suite with one small bathroom for 4 women. If the room wasn't stank enough the service was even worst. The rinky -dinky place stopped me to see my key card every time I went up to my room but did'nt do it for every body I went up and came back down forgot something and he still stopped me. I felt like a second class citizen. Never in my life. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “A place to lay your head”
Reviews.Author: Chriscrim
Reviews.Content: If you want pretty - this is not the place to go. If you want a clean place to lay your head and can't afford much - then this is where you want to be. This is one of the few hotels in my price range that offered two queen size beds. When they are done renovating the prices will go up for sure due to its great location.

Reviews.Title: “Beds dip in the middle”
Reviews.Author: Atzela
Reviews.Content: When we first walke into our room, our heart dropped; it was so old and creey looking. This hotel is in serious need of a makeover. However, if you can get past the polyester sheets and the beds that dip in the middle and a super tiny bathroom with an old chipped bathtub and water that alternates between freezing and burning, then its okay. The price is excellent and so is the location. That is as far as I'll go with compliments. We were all a little disgusted with we got there but eventually we accepted our fate and moved on. Its a a little gross but its super clean, if that makes any sense. The towels are fluffy and white (yippee). The windows are old and the blinds fell down.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare”
Reviews.Author: charlotte170676
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this horrific hotel for 4 days. It was the worst hotel I've ever seen. It was centrally located but other than that my hotel experience was a nightmare. First of all the front desk was very indifferent. During the check in I was dissapointed when he did not even look at me and he seeemd overwhelmed I don't have clue why. The rooms were very desolate and dirty. There were hair in my bed and everywhere. The bed sheets and covers were so dirty even my husband could understand it by looking from skype connection. I asked them to change the sheets with clean ones and the clean ones were no diffrent than the dirty sheets. The hotel was a total wreck.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location,value for money”
Reviews.Author: vino081
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel recently on a leisure break with my wife.We booked hotel online and got very good price for 5 night stay.It is in an excellent location just a short walk to Times Square and right beside Broadway.Our room however was dated,but very clean.Could not fault hotel overall,breakfast was very good in the Edison cafe and the Rum House is perfect for a drink or two after theatre.This hotel is ideal for a short break in NYC,you cannot beat the location and is excellent value for money in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Its all about the location!!”
Reviews.Author: EmmaVC
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great value and is worth every penny due to the excellent location. You are literally in the heart of Times Square. I would definitely stay here again for the location alone. The rooms are quite dated but the hotel is currently under going refurbishment. The staff was helpful & it was great that we could leave our bags in the baggage room for just 50 cent on our last day. The only major problem we had was on our journey from the hotel to Newark airport to take our flight home. We booked a transfer through the hotel with a really nice girl @ the Edison (was about $22 per person). Anyway once we arrived at the airport our driver handed us our bags and as we had become accustomed to in NYC we tipped the driver - then he started screaming in our face that he wanted more tip – in fact he said he wanted $5 per person. I just don't think its right that he could be so rude and ungrateful. I understand the importance of tipping & that’s what we did but to be shouted at & embarrassed like that was totally humiliating. I think if the Edison advertises these types of transfers it should be made known if there is a minimum tip. Next time we will be taking a cab!! Overall the Edison was a great place to stay in NYC & already looking to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Very dated in rooms, public areas stunning, noisy pipes!”
Reviews.Author: sarahwdl
Reviews.Content: The entrance to the hotel made us expect great things as it's beautiful in its design. In the room we stayed in, however, it was totally different. Room itself was a reasonable size with comfortable bed, the room was also clean. No tea or coffee facilities were available in the room which was a little disappointing. Sever lack of anywhere to plug in phone and camera chargers. Iron and board provided, although iron couldn't have reached the board by the time we found a hidden socket. Bathroom very very compact and dated. Light switch only on the mirror as a shaving light but to access this you had to try not to burn yourself on the main waterpipe which was hotter than the sun! At approx 5am each morning the heating pipes starting clanking and banging, this didn't stop until around 9am. The rooms were very dated and in serious need of upgrading, this seemed to be going on in some of the rooms around ours. Breakfast left a lot to be desired, only available via a ticket system in the diner next door. We couldn't order from the main menu, just a limited choice which the hotel obviously set for the price. The main attractions for this hotel are the price and the location. Just 50yds from Times Square from one exit, and directly onto Broadway the other.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in the heart of Times Square!”
Reviews.Author: Anna-Bella25
Reviews.Content: We visited Manhatten From July 24th- July 27th 2009... I had already been to the Edison back in 1998, and had loved the location, therefore decided to book there.. We definitely did not regret it! First off, you are smack dab in the middle of times square...yes, you may think that since you`re in the middle of all the action, that the hotel would be very loud and hectic...on the contrary! We barely heard any of the hustle and bustle during the limited time that we were in the room, which was basically to sleep and get ready. The hotel is well kept, as are the rooms! Also, the Ballroom which is part of the hotel and situated right next door was the venue for JLO`s birthday party, which was really cool because we got to watch all the guests arrive :) The hotel has a valet parking, which is at a very minimal cost per day, and is situated across the street from the hotel...the valet service is very quick and efficient. All in all, for the price and the location, id say that this is definitely the best bet for a great weekend in NYC!!

Reviews.Title: “Great if you're not staying in too much”
Reviews.Author: DanSpurrrs
Reviews.Content: The Edison Hotel is in a superb location in New York literally seconds from Times Square. The Lobby area is stunning with a concierge service, baggage and transport service, cafe, bar and gift shop. The overall service was excellent although the transport service were reluctant to help as much as others in the hotel. The hotel has 22 floors including rooms and a free fitness suite. Our room was very dated and not very clean and on complaining the cleaner said if we didn't like it we'd have to move rooms. The heating in our room was extremely loud when on so we had to keep it off overnight. Overall a lovely hotel but poor room so perfect if you're not staying in much!! Refurbishment is however going on and the newer rooms do appear to be very nice!

Reviews.Title: “LOCATION! LOCATION! VALUE FOR MONEY!”
Reviews.Author: GillW3
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is great-just a few steps from Times Square, the theatre district and plenty of good eating places and bars. Within easy reach of the subway and bus tours. And after a busy days sightseeing it was a nice quiet place to go back to. The room was light, reasonably decorated and clean. The bathroom was small but functional, the bathtub was chipped but clean and every day we were given lovely clean white fluffy towels and replacement toiletries. Plentiful hot water at all times and efficient shower. The down side for the nights sleep was a hissing noise from the heating system which my husband found disturbing, we also had to ask for extra pillows but these arrived swiftly. Reception staff were polite and efficient and the concierge (Sandra) extremely helpful and knowledgable booking a coach tour for us and tickets to the ESB. The cafe was good for breakfast, if expensive. We ate there once and then found better alternatives elsewhere. Danny's deli next door was very convenient and well stocked with tasty food. We would definitely stay at the Edison again without hesitation. (We did the bedbug check with the torch etc and can confirm that the room was bedbug free)

Reviews.Title: “Go Back In Time to New York's Classic Hotel Edison”
Reviews.Author: roadandtravel
Reviews.Content: Finding something to do in New York is not a problem. Finding an affordable hotel is. Unless of course you stay at a place in a neighborhood that is lit in red or requires a black belt in karate just to make it to your room. Neither sounds appealing, so the hunt goes on for a hotel that is cost effective, in a great location, and has the amenities that keeps travelers happy…all in the heart of Manhattan. No such place, right? Wrong. Not only have we discovered a hotel that offers all of the above we've discovered one that has history, charm and character…called Hotel Edison. Driving by, even walking by, you may not notice it. Although it's smack dab in the middle of Times Square, it's tucked away on a side street -- 228 West 47th Street to be exact -- just off Broadway. And even though it houses more than 800 rooms, its façade is amazingly deceptive. Sandwiched between an expensive W Hotel and a clothing store, it's barely noticeable unless you're looking for it. The depth of deception is dizzying. The monstrous building is nearly a city block in diameter but because of the way it was built in 1929, it snakes its way backwards and upwards hiding its bulk between neighboring buildings. As a result, rooms offer more peace and quiet than one might expect from the traditionally noisy 24-hour New York chaos, especially in the heart of Times Square. To Read the Full Story, go to: http://www.roadandtravel.com/hotelsresorts/edisonhotelnyc.htm.

Reviews.Title: “Tired but great location”
Reviews.Author: SirNigelC
Reviews.Content: This hotel is decorated in the art deco style and was probably once quite smart. The public areas look to have been refreshed recently and the bar was closed for refurb when we were there but our room was pretty shabby. Great location though and all you need if you're doing the tourist trail. The diner downstairs is good for traditional breakfast (cash only!) and the guys on the door are really helpful

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location!”
Reviews.Author: cmh621
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night with friends and would definitely stay again. The price for the hotel is definitely a great value for the location. You are literally in the middle of Times Square and the theater district. Only 2 blocks away from the subway station too. The front desk staff were nice enough, but not warm or welcoming. The rooms were spacious (especially for NY hotels) although the bathrooms are quite tiny. Our room furniture was a little outdated, but other friends had a renovated room and it was nice. Security always made sure you had a key in order to get into the elevators, which made us feel safe. Only bad thing was the room was SWELTERING and we couldn't find a thermostat to turn it down. Opening the windows helped a bit but one of the windows was broken and there were no screens.

Reviews.Title: “Do they do rooms by the hour ?”
Reviews.Author: WWtravalla
Reviews.Content: Booked a lastminute deal and quite literally last minute as flight departed within 5 hours of booking. Arrived at the hotel and check in was quick. The elevator door opened into what looked like a scene out of a seedy movie. I am sure the woman waiting up the hallway was a hooker as she seemed to be there constantly. The room was tiny with long corridor and an old and badly fitted carpet. The bed was awful with a lumpy mattress. The bathroom was grotty with a stained 1/2 size tub which had been lined but the lining was coming away. The shower pressure and water temp was good. Phoned reception to ask for another room but was told there was none. We were booked in for 4 nights but checked out the following morning and moved to another hotel. I guess if your after a backpacking hotel for a low price in NY you couldn't do much better as this hotel is all about location otherwise steer clear.

Reviews.Title: “Still a great NYC experience”
Reviews.Author: CherylofHatboro
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay @ the Hotel Edison. Just 1/2 block off Times Square; the rooms are small and just the basics, but you can't beat the location nor the price. I felt like a 1940's movies star, walking the halls of the hotel. Danny's Deli just between the hotel & Times Square: great deli for breakfast and lunch options @ very reasonable prices for NYC. Compared to the alternatives, this can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “An Art Deco Gem”
Reviews.Author: FiveTenLover
Reviews.Content: I visited Edison during a long weekend birthday trip with my daughter in the city. We showed up three hours before check-in and were quickly assigned our room. The room was spacious, well kept and had a wonderrful bathroom, with a huge deep tub. I really enjoyed the authentic vintage feel of the hotel. It is not modern, but I prefer that, The room was very quiet at night, and the beds very comfortable. The staff was friendly, punctual, and alert, and the prices very reasonable. Cafe Edison is remarkably wonderful, like wrapping the entire flavor of New York City into one room. I love the place. We will be back in April for my wedding anniversary, I'd definitely recommend Edison for a central Manhatten visit

Reviews.Title: “Best Value in Times Square!”
Reviews.Author: Travelswithsmalldog
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a terrific hotel to base your theatre, shopping and sightseeing trip around this is the hotel. It if perfectly placed for Times Square and the theatre district. Everything is a short walk away. There is also a wonderful deli next door btw. It is clean, quiet and safe. My daughter and I stayed here for an eventful weekend, and we'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “A great location for a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Janet_Reis
Reviews.Content: The hotel is old but clean. We went in January and heating in the room was very room. Some reception staff are helpful and others are careless. The hotel location is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “What a Deal!”
Reviews.Author: tchrkate007
Reviews.Content: One of my friends and I had purchased tickets for Billy Elliot because of Broadway week during which tickets were half price. We were excited about our day in the big city. As our Groundhog Day performance date approached we kept an eye on the weather since this winter has been so unpredictable. As anyone who lives in the Northeast knows, a treacherous ice storm was predicted for 2/1 into 2/2. The Sunday before the performance we decided to investigate our hotel options online. The Edison Hotel was listed as being in the Times Square area with a great rate. We figured...what the heck...it's only one night! When we arrived at NYC's Penn Station, we hoofed it to the hotel. When we spotted the Edison, we couldn't believe our eyes! The doorman welcomed us and check-in was a breeze! This hotel retains much of the elegance of the art nouveau era in its common areas downstairs. It is obvious that they are working hard on gradual updates. True, the rooms are dated, but are certainly clean and adequate. An added bonus to us was finding that Restaurant Row was right outside our door. Literally!
