We enjoyed a fabulous dinner at The French Quarter and then breakfast the following morning at the Edison Cafe. The cafe was a little pricey, but it's NY and remember, there was an ice storm outside. The food was nothing to rave about, but we were thrilled to have such convenience on a lousy day! At theatre time, we packed up and walked a block to the theatre! Our experience at the Edison made us commit to a yearly event - next time it will be two nights, two shows and two dinners! Prior to this trip, I was convinced that I could not afford to stay overnight in NYC. How great to find out that I was wrong!

Reviews.Title: “Good place to rest & refresh”
Reviews.Author: honeyb43
Reviews.Content: This was my second time in the past year staying at the Edison. Again, it was very economical, the service was great, & the location can't be beat. I was on the 7th floor, and while it was undergoing remodeling, I did not hear any noise & none of the work disturbed me. The staff was friendly and helpful. I very much like the security at the entrance to the elevators. Overall, it is not fancy. The furniture/carpet/walls are worn, the bathroom is tiny. But it is okay for the price. I would rather spend my money on other fun things to do in NYC. :)

Reviews.Title: “fantastic location!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: kerri_schultheiss
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the edison for 5 nights in the middle of september! reading reviews and looking on a map, we hadnt realised how close we were to times square! leaving the hotel you are 30 seconds away from the centre of times square which is fantastic! the hotel decor is quite dated but because of our location it didnt bother us a bit! We found the hotel very clean and the staff very friendly! We never ate at the hotels resturant as it was pricey but you have a varst selection of resturants on your doorstep we went elsewhere! Hotel is surrounded by plenty of broadway theatres! There is a safe for each room at the main desk which you can leave valuables and you have to sign in everytime you go so fet very safe leaving belongings there! You can hear sirens and traffic noise from rooms but isnt very loud and expected in a central location! i would definitely recommend staying at the edison hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel with a honest price”
Reviews.Author: JLZ_BR
Reviews.Content: I normally travel alone for business, this is the first international trip I've done with my family and I want to register my happiness to choose the Hotel Edison to stay 8 days in New York. The hotel localization is wonderful, the room we’ve choose is not big and not luxurious, but comfortable with 2 king size beds, but more important for us, the room were very clean, the towels were changed every day and everything was really nice. The staff are friendly and the support provided is also very good. Obviously, we have many other options in NY, but I think this is the best choice considering quality and price. For sure, we’ll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a great price”
Reviews.Author: caryl2005
Reviews.Content: My partner and I have stayed in New York 3 times now, 2 of which were at the Edison. On the other occasion I stayed in a 5 star hotel that had nothing on this excellent establishment. The location is fabulous, the rooms are clean and on one occasion we arrived at 9am and they let us check in then for no extra charge. I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough, when we return in a few months we will definately be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be put off by bad reviews”
Reviews.Author: j2hatt
Reviews.Content: After a recent trip to New York I wanted to add my views to balance all the negativity. Although I agree the rooms are a little dated the hotel is in a great location, the staff are friendly and the communal areas are very well presented and useable. Our rooms were cleaned every day and we were provided with everything we needed. For what you pay to stay it would be silly to expect the Ritz but our party though it offered everything we needed for a fab 5 days in New York

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Trip to Memphis”
Reviews.Author: ashc21133
Reviews.Content: We came to NY to the play MEMPHIS and stayed at the EDISON HOTEL. The location of the hotel was a block w/n the Time Square Area. There is plenty to do and see in this location, which was convenient. We had a room that had double twin beds....the decor is quite out-dated(1970's) and it is very simple. The linen was also simple, but always check your linen at any hotel for cleanliness. The beds were a little hard.., more pillows for more comfort, bathroom was clean..all in all the room supplied the basic necessities needed for a night's stay in NY at a affordable rate in a great location near TIME SQUARE.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: sunni_6
Reviews.Content: As the other travellers said the hotel has the perfect location. Lots of restaurants around. Definitely not impressed with the rooms. Small, dark, out dated, no view. Stuff was nice .Like the breakfast at the café Edison. Very busy in the mornings. Had to queue up but not for so long.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: SallyCads
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights at the end of 2010. Fantastic Location! Rooms are small but good value for the location. This was out second time staying here and would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: dcayres
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Edison hotel over New Years from 30th December - 3rd January, we got a brilliant price for the room but we were a bit apprehensive after reading some comments but the main thing we wanted was location and this is what you got, this hotel is literally right on Times Square!! From arrival and throughout our stay the check-in staff were very friendly and helpful, we requested two extra pillows and they were in our room when we got back, a button fell off my coat and I asked reception if they had a needle and thread and within 10 minutes house keeping arrived with a little sewing kit!! We was worried about how small the room was going to be but we must have been lucky with a corner room as it was huge, nice queen size bed which was comfy, bathroom fairly small but very clean and shower was excellent. Yes the rooms are a bit old fashioned but it didn't affect our stay, I am sorry but you don't go to New York to spend time in your room!!! We only ate in Cafe Edison once for breakfast but the waiter was very friendly, there was plenty of choice and it arrived very quickly. I would not hesitate to stay at the Hotel Edison when visiting New York again, thanks for a great stay xxx

Reviews.Title: “I would recommend Edison Hotel to anyone and will definately return”
Reviews.Author: exploradoraUK
Reviews.Content: We chose Edison Hotel for its location and value for money, expecially as it was over the new year. We read many uncomplimentary reviews on this website, so were apprehensive about our stay. We were pleasantly surprised by everything. The staff were friendly and helpful. The rooms were spotless and better than expected for its star rating. This hotel has everything you need, it is not luxury but is great value for money. I have felt compelled to leave a review so people are not put off staying at this hotel. Even if you are not staying here you should visit the cafe for traditional 1920's food.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: noxous
Reviews.Content: All I can say is that I go back every summer! The Edison hotel is a wonderful hotel, very clean, very big and you can sleep there without any disturbance due to the sound pollution of NYC! We usually book the quad room on ground level, it's cheap enough and sleeps 4! I've never really used any amenities in the hotel, we usually go out from 10 a.m until 3 or 4 a.m and maybe stop by the hotel to drop off bags or change. The location is fabulous and it's the main reason we go there every summer! As long as a quad is availbale we will keep staying at the Edison!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, great price.”
Reviews.Author: JimJamming
Reviews.Content: I'm very glad that I didn't read some of the reviews on here before I stayed at The Hotel Edison, because I would have been put off for no good reason. I had a thoroughly different experience to some of the people that have left reviews here. I returned from staying in the hotel a week ago today. First of all, the location is amazing. Right on Times Square, and central to everything. The doormen at the hotel were very friendly, as were the check in staff who recommended a great restaurant to us. The concierge were also very helpful on a number of occasions, and when it was time for us to check out we were able to leave our bags in the hotel all day for a very small price. The rooms themselves were a little dated, and dark, but had everything that we needed. The beds were comfortable, and the rooms were clean, if a little worn. The bathroom was very small, but I don't have any time for people who complain about barely being able to turn around in it. You shower in there and go to the toilet. You don't go ballroom dancing. If I had one complaint it would be that the glazing was really poor, and let in a lot of noise, and draft, which in New York in January is a bit on the cold side. Also, the heating system made quite a noise when you turned it on. Other than that, though, I have absolutely no complaints whatsoever. We didn't pay much, and I got a decent hotel in a fantastic location.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money, superb location, clean & efficient”
Reviews.Author: SteveRBristol
Reviews.Content: Superbly placed just about 80 mtrs from the ticket outlet right on Times Sq. The hotel is older and nothing like a Hilton or Holiday inn But, The room was a fair size, it was clean and warm there was plenty of hot water & everything worked. The biggest thing I could moan about would be the draughty windows but the 2 pairs of curtains solved that!. The doorman, concierge etc were all friendly and helpful, the reception efficient and the safety deposit boxes free, bonus ! The business centre has pay per minute pcs with web access & printers, Wifi is chargeable though. All in all I thought it was great value for money in a perfect location for my needs as a tourist.

Reviews.Title: “Not THAT Bad!”
Reviews.Author: LynchClan
Reviews.Content: I have always found the Edison to be clean, comfortable and safe. For location and price, it's inexpensive. The deli next door offers a reasonably priced breakfast (rather than an over priced 'continental' one) and the iine for a table is never a long one. I've referred quite a few people to the Edison and not one of them has complained. The only problem that I've ever had here was that the lady at the Concierge was rude and unhelpful but I suspect only because I was trying to ask about alternative car services to the airport rather than the one that she was recommending.

Reviews.Title: “What has happened”
Reviews.Author: Gurk
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 2006 great hotel clean now it is dirty and threadbare WHAT HAPPENED. I was going to stay again in 2011.

Reviews.Title: “What you see online is "not what you get"”
Reviews.Author: kbrowe
Reviews.Content: We were so disappointed in this hotel, both in their staff and the facility itself. The rooms were small, not clean, showers moldy and linens threadbare. Even the hallways were poorly lit and the carpets worn. At first we thought it was just that we had arrived around 5:30pm and we got the last rooms left.....but someone in our group reminded me we looked at 6 rooms and only found one we would consider staying in. We reserved a King Jr Suite and a double queen room. The front desk staff kept sending us to rooms that were either double beds or twin beds. It was incredible they were unable to look at the computer screen and know what the bedding set up was for each room, The poor bellman, who was the only one at this hotel, who was trying to be helpful suggested we go elsewhere. He too was frustrated with going back and forth to the front desk to pick up new room cards. After finally getting to speak with a manager (Val), we realized they had no more king room suites and no other queen double rooms. They simply did not hold the rooms we reserved. I showed the manager two calls on my cell phones where I called enroute to NY to let them know we would be arriving late due to traffic backups in the Lincoln Tunnel. We ended up going back to stay again at the Warwick on 54th St. as we have never been disappointed in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER AGAIN!”
Reviews.Author: FawazAbbas
Reviews.Content: How do you know you've arrived to Edison Hotel, Times Square: 1. If you have to change rooms four times before you can get a clean room. 2. If the rooms stink of damp and the bath tubs are rusty. 3. If the reception, reservations and service staff talk to you like you're a piece of dirt. 4. If you complain on checking into your room that there's hair on your mattress and pillows only to be given fresh ones with pubic hair on them instead. 5. If you ring the hotel operator for help dialing a number only for them to tell you that your phone is not working. 6. If the number on your in-room information leaflet for a local steak house puts you through to hotel reception. 7. If when ringing reception from your room they keep telling you to hurry up because there's people queuing. 8. If the color of the water coming out of your tap is brown. 9. If reception staff tell you there is no availability to extend your stay only for you to find availability online five minutes later. 10. If the heater in your room doesn't work. Do yourself a favor, DON'T STAY THERE. I most certainly will never stay at this pathetic joke of a hotel ever again,

Reviews.Title: “Really poor hotel very disappointed!!!”
Reviews.Author: tinkerbelle2380
Reviews.Content: Me and my Fiance booked the Edison Hotel for our Christmas break 2010 my first time to New York and my first Christmas away I had always dreamt of spending Christmas in NYC. We decided to book the Edison after visiting several websites and all the photos looked good, it seemed to have light airy rooms and seemed to be a hotel that would have lets say the personal touch. We arrived at the hotel very excited especially as this was my first time in new york, the location of the hotel was amazing couldnt fault that at all, doorman was very friendly and helpful, we checked in at reception we had booked a queensize bed room, we went to the room if you could call it a room!!!! it was more like a dark hole I burst into tears it was tiny, really dark, and smelt unclean. The bathroom you could hardly turn around in I turned on the tap at the sink and for about 6 minutes the water was dark brown!!!! I rang down to front desk and got our room changed. Again the room was small the wall paper was hanging off the walls and there was mould over the bathroom tiles, we changed rooms again this time to a larger room again this was dirty there was hair on he bedding, crumbs on the floor along with a hair band on the floor and a bath which hardly had any enamel left on it, I went down to reception again i felt awful complaining but none of the rooms were decent I have never been fussy but this was really bad. The lady on reception desk was very helpful and changed our room this time to a suite, which was clean and decent. We settled ourselves in and got to sleep that was until there was really loud banging noises coming from the bathroom turns out it was old piping for the water and heating. This wasnt really a problem we are both heavy sleepers and we were hardly in our room as we had so much to see and do. Boxing day we had a lot of snow and our flight on which was meant to be on the 28th december got cancelled. We had only reserved our room up until the 28th so we rang reception who told us that we would have to move rooms and check out to check back in this was fine so we packed our things and headed down to reception. It was very busy but this was no excuse for the way in which we were dealt with by the male receptionist. He informed us that there was a room available but nothing available for new years eve!!!! the earliest flight for us to leave was the 1st January!! But that there was internet access on the 2nd floor, so off we went to find a hotel that could accomodate us until the 1 st January, and to our suprise we found availability at the edison!!!!! Our new room was ok again unclean bed lot of hair on it, one unclean towel in the bathroom!!! The maid came up and changed the bed and towels as soon as we rang but we were just made to feel like it was our problem. I just found most of the staff to be too busy to be kind, friendly and helpful!!!! This hotel and the staff weren't acceptable and left me feeling highly disappointed!!!!! I will never stay here again nor will I recomend it to anyone the only thing good about this hotel was the location oh and the concierge team were most helpful at all times.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location, average accommodation.”
Reviews.Author: blissygirl
Reviews.Content: Like walking into the 1950's when you go through the doors of the Edison Hotel. Rooms are small, bathrooms miniscule and the lifts old and slow. BUT it has location location location. Priced extremely well and has a cosy bar downstairs which is a welcome relief at the end of a day's sightseeing. This place is practically IN Times Square. Incredible value for money.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC location, VERY reasonably priced and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: beachbumm00
Reviews.Content: This was the first time I ever stayed at the Edison and my husband and I had a great trip! I heard all the reviews about how close it was but I didn't realize it was literally steps from times square! I know we were probably there during the cheapest time of the year but regardless, $119.00 a night in that location is unbelievable! You can pretty much walk anywhere and if not there's subways on 50th, 44th & 42nd streets. The room size was very spacious for the two of us. We ended up staying in both an outdated room and a updated one and they were both clean. The lobby was very nice and decorated beautifully for christmas. Checking in and out was a breeze! In fact, we were checking out after our two night stay and thought we should tell them about a small ceiling leak in our room that may become a big problem if it wasn't fixed quickly. Well, the girl at the desk asked if it caused us any damage and we said no, she then went on to tell us that she was taking a night off for the inconvience. At first 8 thought she was kidding because we were really just telling them for their benefit. Later that day we decided to take advantage of the savings and stay another night. When checked in again, another girl was so kind to give us the AAA discount which we don't have, which made the room $109 that night. Anyhow, I highly recommend this hotel and already have to my friends. Also, just a few more suggestions....don't get sucked into spending a ridiculous amount of money to the chain restaurants in time square! If you just walk down to 8th ave and take a look around at menu's, you'll find good food at reasonable prices. Also, restaurant row is on 46th st and they always seem to have specials during the day. We got a giant delicious burger, fries and a bud light draft for $6.95. I can't even find that back at home. Great place and Im already planning to go back for a night in feb!

Reviews.Title: “GOOD ENOUGH”
Reviews.Author: here2share
Reviews.Content: We go for cleanliness, safety, and lowest possible cost when it comes to hotel rooms. We got all that. Room cleanliness was good enough to deal with. Location is great..your literally round the corner fr time square. Hotel Cafe sucked & was expensive. The pipes made noise throughout our stay (3 nights) but fr the amazing days we had, fallin asleep wasn't to hard, and I have insomnia! Didnt deal to much w/ hotel employees but they werent exactly jolly people. My point is, if your really there for NYC then the hotel is great. We paid $500 some through Expedia, single bed.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for the price”
Reviews.Author: kayefa
Reviews.Content: This is an older hotel but we always stay there as the location is right in the heart of Manhattan. The rooms are always clean and service tops. Even though it might lack some of the "first class" ammenities like coffee in the room, a deli is just two doors down for a quick pick up of coffee, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but poor hotel”
Reviews.Author: strawberryeater
Reviews.Content: Small rooms, old fashioned, dirty, bleak, would not recommend this place

Reviews.Title: “superb”
Reviews.Author: davida197
Reviews.Content: just got back.excellent location,friendly staff and very clean.room was only basic but we had a street view and could see and hear all the hustle and bustle of time square.to be honest we were hardly in our room.went for a week and never stopped.bed was very comfortable ..a really good mid range price hoteland would definately go back.we went to the tenemant museum in lower eastside and niagra falls..both brilliant along with ground zero(do the accompaniedtour)

Reviews.Title: “ALWAYS PLEASANT EXPERIENCE!”
Reviews.Author: vicbend
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Edison on multiple occasions (more than 8) and have always had a good experience. Yes, the hotel is an older art-deco building, but the location and wonderful service of the staff more than makes up for the lack of extra amenities, such as room service. When I visit New York, I never even consider any other hotels. The Edison is one of the best values in the city, expecially if you want to be in Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, good service, average room quality”
Reviews.Author: Torgny_10
Reviews.Content: Were to stay if you only have 2 nights in NYC ? I would strongly recommend Edison. Very close to Times Square, Broadway, Rocekefeller Plaza and walking distance to Macys, what else do you need ? The room was ok, a little "worn out" but alright when you consider price.

Reviews.Title: “centrally located, basic, perfect for sleeping”
Reviews.Author: rvbolorin
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for the first time in 1993, when after spending 1 night in the Pennsilvannia Hotel I needed to get out of there as soon as possible (Penssilvannia was a nightmare). I have stayed in the Edison about 6 times, 3 in the last few years and I will soon be returning. Location is excellent, in times square, near attractions, subway station, etc. I have stayed with my husband, alone, with children and with teenagers, for new year's eve, in summer, etc, and everytime has been a good experience. I feel secure, the price is right. The rooms are small, bathroom small, no ammenities in the room, place is old but clean, no filthy odors, no bedbugs. If your are going to be in the city most of the time and come to the hotel for sleeping, this is the perfect place.

Reviews.Title: “A surprisingly nice hotel in NYC, conveniently located near everything”
Reviews.Author: CraftycatRI
Reviews.Content: This hotel is old-fashioned but in a classy nice way. We arrived at 11am and were surprised to be able to check in. Valet service was great, the hotel was very efficient. Check in was no hassle, and even though we only had a few bags we were taken to our room by a bellhop. The room was clean,warm, plenty big enough. The bed was comfy. Slept like a log. Never heard any noise during the night. Bathroom is small but water was nice and hot. Cafe had good affordable food. The sitting area was beautiful,a Christmas tree putting you in just the right mood. All the attractions were very close by. We were able to walk to the Empire State Building, Radio City Music Hall, Central Park,5th Avenue and of course Rockefeller Center to see the beautiful tree. We were inches away from Times Square and Broadway. The Edison made our trip an enjoyable and affordable great time. Doorman were very helpful and friendly also. Great job. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Old Fashioned but perfectly placed”
Reviews.Author: todrunktofunkdunk
Reviews.Content: Yes there are better hotels,but at a price. My wife and I just came back from a long weekend in New York and found the hotel perfectly situated, yes it feels like your staying in your Grannies spare bedroom, but we found it very clean and comfortable with good service. Being so close toTimes Square and Broadway we did not need 1 taxi, and could enjoy a walk up 5th past all the shops to central park easily. Personal note, If you are in New York the only time spent in your hotel room should be with your eyes shut

Reviews.Title: “stayed at the edison from 5th - 8th dec 2010”
Reviews.Author: caz2411
Reviews.Content: Me and my daughter stayed at this hotel on the 9th floor and found it to meet all our requirements and more, it was warm ,clean and very well furnished. the staff were polite and helpfull and the location could not be bettered if you planned it yourself! all in all an excellent place to stay and good value, would recommend to all my friends and family.NO BUGS !!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected!”
Reviews.Author: LBL13
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews, I was a bit worried. However if you are looking for an affordable place to stay right in Times Square this is the place! Yes, it is very old and outdated but it was clean and we felt safe. The location cannot be beat. My only complaint was the Edison Cafe', the food was not good and overpriced ( $12.00 for pancakes) also they added gratitude for 3 and it was not stated on the menu. Avoid the cafe and you will enjoy your stay at Hotel Edison.

Reviews.Title: “Experience the Macy's Parade”
Reviews.Author: KahlessNorwich
Reviews.Content: Yes the room was a bit small, and the decor could do with updating in the bedroom. BUT the entrance lobby and foyer were fantastic, very art deco. Staff were very helpfull, and security conscious, checking guests keycards before allowing access to the lifts. Location was superb, just 1 block from the heart of Times Square, and beds gave a good nights sleep. No bed bugs either!! Could do with coffee making facilities in the room though. All in all very good value. The Macys Parade was an experience not to be missed. We had an excellent meal at Dervish Turkish restaurant, on 49th street just 2 blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Totally LOVED this Hotel location!”
Reviews.Author: cdeas
Reviews.Content: I am very happy with my hotel overall!! It was in an awesome location, couldn't ask for it to be any closer to times square! No matter what time of day we left when we came back our room had always been cleaned!! And so safe & secure feeling---the security always asked to see our key!! Loved this!!! It is an older hotel but we didn't stay in our room much and it had everything we needed!! Thanks for a great stay Hotel Edison!! And Brody for the autographed postcard!!

Reviews.Title: “Fine stay provided you are out seeing NYC mostly!”
Reviews.Author: Australians_10
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 3 nights at The Edison for our recent visit to NYC in December. As we planned to be out seeing the city 80% of the time, we weren't keen to spend huge $ and The Edison ticked plenty of the necessary boxes - Location is great if you want to be close to Times Square, Rockefeller Centre, Broadway theatres, 42nd street, Empire State building. Room was small (ie. can't open cupboard, door to room or bathroom door at the same time!) with older style bath, noisy pipes etc. but bed was comfortable and no evidence of bed bugs. Also, the windows opened which was good, because it was a bit overheated in the room even with the heater unplugged. We felt safe both in the hotel and in the area around it. There were no facilities in the room (ie. no coffee maker, no fridge, no free internet, and a pretty average looking cafe downstairs), so as long as you are planning to eat out (there are plenty of options nearby) or pay for internet it's perfect. For New York, this hotel is pretty good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing, I am sorry to say...”
Reviews.Author: DSmith212
Reviews.Content: Being a lover of old, art deco New York, I had the highest of hopes for this hotel. I was very excited about my upcoming stay there, fueled by almost cult-like devotion from previous guests. I had heard that the hotel was indeed old, and in need of some renovation, but this would be made up for by the service. I did not feel that the service was special. Employees were average at best, and often times seemed disinterested. The room itself was fairly typical New York small, but the deal breaker was the bathroom. Minuscule. I thought the bathroom was small at the Murray Hill Hotel, but this bathroom was even smaller. Personally I can live with a smallish room, but I have to have some bathroom space. Based on this, unfortunately I have to say I cannot return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A clean hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: jitterbugYork
Reviews.Content: The public rooms were beautiful - very Art Deco, with 1930/1940's music playing quietly in the background. Once upstairs the corridors were rather un-loved, as were the rooms. We had a room with 2 double beds, a comfortable chair and a dining chair. It was suprisingly spacious and clean, although the overall appearance was a little shabby. The bathroom was clean and adequate and the shower was excellent. The location was perfect; just around the corner from Times Square and within walking distance of many attractions. In the basement on the Tuesday night there was a wonderful swing band playing while diners enjoyed a meal and dancing. If you turn left when exiting the hotel on 47th Street you will come to Carve (a diner on the corner). I can recommend them for breakfast. The French toast and bagels were delicious and so inexpensive. The service in the hotel was very good. We used the hotel safe easily and one little problem we had was solved promptly. I would recommend this hotel and would stay there again but I would hope the refurbishments would be complete by then.

Reviews.Title: “Edison is our hotel of choice when we travel to NYC”
Reviews.Author: dramamama13646
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Edison for the 4th time when we went for Thanksgiving 2010 and were not disappointed. Though the room was standard and small, we never spend much time in our room anyway. Most important to us is the location, and the Edison has it in spades - just steps off of Times Square. Staff is courteous and knowledgable. We enjoy that we can check our bags for $.50 each after we check out and go pick them up right before we travel home. This trip, we were able to check in well before the "official check in time" of 3 p.m., which was a huge bonus. Only issue was with the heat in the bathroom and the difficulty in adjusting the hot/cold water in the shower for some reason. When I mentioned this in feedback to the hotel, they got back to me immediately and offered a discount on my next stay - very nice. We love the Edison!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: nickyjl99
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week at the Edison Hotel in November. What a great hotel right by Times Square its literally a 2 min walk. Our Party had the Combo Bedrooms and a Standard Room for 4 adults. The Rooms were okay but the bathroom in the Combo Room is really small, bathrom in the standard room was fine. The hotel is being renovated and our TVs were upgraded during our stay to flat screen ones. The bathrooms by the reception desk had also been renovated and if this is what is happening throughout the hotel it's going to look a lot more modern. I would recommend this hotel for a cheap and cheerful break. the staff were courteous and helpful at all times.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel in tremendous location, good value for Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: CritoLeeds
Reviews.Content: The twin room was somewhat old fashioned but comfortable. Despite being a little on the small side there was plenty of room for clothing, luggage etc and we were not tripping up over each other despite a stay of 5 days. There is also a nice communal lounge to relax in. Location wise you would struggle to find anywhere better. Only a few minutes' walk from Times Square and the theatres. Maddison Square Garden is walkable within 25 minutes. Despite this central location and a bustling lobby the rooms were incredible quiet meaning an excellent night's sleep. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: SusanEAZ
Reviews.Content: The location was ideal; the room was quiet and clean; the staff was courteous and friendly. The only drawback: not enough electrical outlets in the room where we stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but staff courtesy and accommodations lacking.”
Reviews.Author: TAndD80
Reviews.Content: So excited to arrive in NYC and thrilled with the the hotels location. When we checked in the man was unable to find our reservation and even though we had a printed confirmation, he didn't bother to look at it. After quite some time he was able to give us a room. There was no smile, no pleasantries despite our best efforts to be friendly. Our room was a decent size, but very old. The upholstery was torn on the furniture, the mattress was terrible, we could feel every spring. It smelled old. To top it off, the toilet made funny noises when flushed, then over flowed! They were prompt to respond, but when we mentioned the inconvenience at checkout, they told us to take it up without the company we booked with. Again, great location, great city, disappointing hotel.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location!!!”
Reviews.Author: l00biel0u
Reviews.Content: i had read the reviews on here prior to going to new york, and chose it for the good location and i could not believe when we stopped it is literally on times square it was brilliant for us being a couple and our first time in new york, the reception area was very grand, and the security was really good you could not go in the lifts without showing your card to the security man, the rooms were a great size although they could do with freshening up a bit and a thoroughly good clean (but i am a bit ocd). I never got to go in the cafe because it was always so busy (which is a good sign), for any sex and the city fans Carrie Bradshaw graced her pressence in the cafe. I absolutely loved new york and will be going back to the Edison.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff = great time”
Reviews.Author: LoopyLu72
Reviews.Content: We arrived late night and although the reception man was a bit cold to start with, when we required assistance with the phone, etc. he was more than helpful along with the security guards and doormen alike. The room was basic but very accommodating, it had everything we needed although tea and coffee making facilities would have been nice but the 24hr deli just next door was reasonably priced and also friendly. The hotel restaurant was excellent with both service, food and price but the coffee cups could have been bigger. The location was great, right on top of Time Square and just a small walk from the bus tour stop, Citysights NY - very good and apparantly Al Pacino orders soup everyday from the cafe edison so it can't be bad can it? Highly recommended and would go back anytime.

Reviews.Title: “time of my life”
Reviews.Author: Andrew197040
Reviews.Content: i returned yesterday from a 5 day 4 night break wih friends and we stayed at the Edison. I was reading previous guest reviews for the weeks leading up and on the whole most were good. I have to say i didnt have a problem with the hotel itself. Location is amazing, 2 seconds up the street and you're in the heart of Times Square. We were in a twin room and found it just right for 2 of us. It was clean and tidy and yes I suppose it wasnt the most fancy modern place but then we found it charming as it had a more vintage authentic feel to it. At the end of the day, for the cracking price it was perfect, all youre doing is sleeping and showering. It was our first trip to NY and we had the most amazing time, beyond our expectations, the time of my life.....im definitely going back!!

Reviews.Title: “It Is What It Is!”
Reviews.Author: BadgerConn
Reviews.Content: Pros: Great location and price. If you are in town for a quick event in the Times Square area, looking for a great price, or a combo of both, this fits the bill. Cons: We had a heat pipe in the bathroom that made it 1000 degrees, a drab room much in need of an update, 2 queen beds that were more like fulls, a marching band to wake us outside at 8 in the morning, I think the hotel bar was boarded up, etc. I'd actually say I figured what I was getting for this price in NYC and it met those expectations. The Patzeria Perfect around the corner that is well recommened on trip advisor was great too.

Reviews.Title: “Hands-Down Best Budget Hotel with Best Location”
Reviews.Author: bonsue90
Reviews.Content: I frequent NYC often (as it is the best city on Earth) and when it comes to affordability without sacrificing cleanliness and location the only place is the Edison Hotel. No other property can possibly beat this location while still offering a sane price. It is old, and some rooms are aged.....if you can handle this then there is no other. You walk out the doors and you have a Starbucks to the right and one to the left. All Time Square attractions are within footsteps. You will live, taste and feel what New York is all about while staying at the Edison....for you are in the heartbeat of the City. An added feature,one not even offered at some 5 star properties is that they require you to show a room key before entering the elevators. You have a lobby and a 24 hr. deli next door. Rooms they call double/double are a must for families since these are much larger than their ordinary rooms which are a bit small.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and they know it!”
Reviews.Author: Israelbusiness
Reviews.Content: A colleague and myself stayed here for 3/5 nights respectively. The best way i can explain the service and rooms is that this Hotel has excellent location, right on time square, and they know this. They are fully booked each night, so they don't care about the level of service or quality of the room they give you. I received the worst service from the reception staff and the room was horrible. My colleague moved rooms 3 times till they had a room with heating in it (NY was at zero degrees those days). My shower didn't work, the internet didn't work and the list goes on. I recommend to all my colleague and friends to stay clear of this one.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: biztravler8365
Reviews.Content: The Edison Hotel is in the heart of Time Square and across the street from the Marriott Marquise Hotel. The room rate was unbelievable! The room was small and could use some sprucing up. In fact, a remodel would be best but then the rates my go sky high like other hotels in Time Square. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful. It's a great hotel for the price and location. I would stay again and recommend the Edison to anyone on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “What a great little discovery of a hotel!!! :)”
Reviews.Author: Esal48
Reviews.Content: I had booked the Edison Hotel in August through a travel agent that had recommended it to me. However, once it was booked, I started reading the reviews and was very aprehensive and nervous about staying at the Edison after I had them read. I was all set to cancel and find somewhere else but I said we would have a look and see, but on the grounds we would leave if I was not happy!! :) The minute we arrived, I was at ease. Yes, it is an old hotel, but cosy, warm and very friendly. We were on the 17th floor and yes, our room was small.....but what do you want.....the lights of TimesSq can be seen when you look out your window!!! Room was cosy for two, bathroom was spotless, and very clean and the room was cleaned every morning. It is sooooooo close to Times Sq, restaurants, pubs, EVERYTHING!! :) For me, Im glad I listened to my spouse to not cancel as it is perfect for a short trip to NY! :) As for bed bugs, I came very prepared as that was my main concern but thankfully there were none. Once I got to NY, I noticed that every Duane Reade/Billboards/papers have advertisements and remedies for bed bugs as it is a city problem, not just as Edison hotel problem. Friends of mine stayed in a 4* hotel during August and they were there so dont let it put you off the Edison. During our stay, GQ magazine had a launch night in the hotel with lots of celebs -so it is a popular spot!!! :) Defo defo defo going to stayt again!

Reviews.Title: “Great for site people site seeing”
Reviews.Author: Raymondage
Reviews.Content: if your in and out the hotel like a yoyo this is perfect!!! Fantasic location, very helpful staf, shop out side, really nice food and drinks around. my only complaint is yes is is ment to be old fashion but the rooms are dark and smell very VERY smokey even with a none smokers room. If you only there for a cheap somewhere to sleep....PERFECT!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty from the outside, but the service is AWFUL!”
Reviews.Author: kasnotsen
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at this hotel about nine years ago, and we were extremely satisfied by the service and value we received from this hotel, however this was not the case this year, October 2010. We arrived early due to being on a red-eye flight, and we were told our room would not be ready for about 3-4 more hours. We waited in the lobby, but were restricted from bringing any luggage or outside food/drink into the lobby. I have no idea why this is since the lobby is not very classy, nor is there anything you could damage by having your luggage in there. When we got to our room, we were disapointed by the size. The room was quite small and the beds were extremely hard. The bathroom was only large enough for one person, which made it difficult for 4 girls to get ready. We purchased some cupcakes to share with the 4 of us, so we asked the hotel cafe if we could borrow a knife to cut them. We explained we were staying there, showed our room key, and they still would not allow it unless we ate there at that time. The security guards were also quite rude and abrupt. You have to show your room key to even get on an elevator, which was sometimes quite inconvenient. When we told the front desk about our bad experiences with the hotel, they were indifferent.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: pibling
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Edison for 4 days. great location really helpful staff and excellent security. I have stayed in different hotels in different locations in New York sometimes twice yearly and found this hotel was just perfect. I had read reviews on Trip Advisor which said the hotel was not good. Well the rooms may be dated but they were very clean, bedbug free and the linen was clean and fresh.The Cafe Edison served good food at reasonable prices. The Deli next door is open 24/7 and is an ideal place to grab early morning coffee at $1.50. This is good because the rooms have no coffee making facilities. This is the only hotel I have stayed at not to offer this service but I honestly didn't miss it. Times Square is a stones throw away so perfect location.The staff were friendly, helpful and courteous. Have already booked for next year.

Reviews.Title: “What a Fab place to stay”
Reviews.Author: cleveleystravellers
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 4 night stay at the Edison ,was a bit worried by some previous reviews, but found it an excellent place to stay.Yes some rooms are a bit dated but ours was very clean with fresh towels each day , a superb hot shower and working hairdryer.The bed was very comfy and not a bug in sight, as we were on the 12th floor we had no noise from outside and the staff were very helpful and polite.We didnt spend much time in the rooms as we had loads to fit in, we did the Empire State building, The Statue of Liberty,Ground Zero,Brooklyn Bridge,watched the New York Rangers play the New Jersey Devils at ice hockey in Madison Square Gardens,did a World Yacht dinner cruise,The natural history museum,ice skated on Central Park and saw Lion King,as well as fitting in lots and lots of shopping,no wonder we were shattered when we got home!We had the best time ever I cant wait to go again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Times Square.”
Reviews.Author: beachgal87
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at The Edison 2 times and have to say we love it. Its location is what puts this place on top. The rooms are somewhat outdated but all you do there is shower and sleep. We plan on going back in June 2011 and staying here again. The staff was friendly and there was also a great little cafe at the hotel also that had good prices.

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel i have ever stayed at......”
Reviews.Author: donnajasper
Reviews.Content: this worst hotel i have ever stay at the rooms where like a shoe box the bathroom was even smaller ,just don,t stay there....

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for the value, great location!”
Reviews.Author: krobin23
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a older feel to it, but fits the needs of a busy vacationer. Not a lot of bells and whistles, but still pleasantly surprised. Our room was very nice with a few extras (luggage racks, blow dryer, cups/shampoo) that we were not expecting. Our goal was to have a nice hotel (not great and expensive) in a great location and the Hotel Edison fulfulled that need. Nice breakfast place attached and even had dinner at Sophia's in the back before a show and it was delicious. We only slept in our room and went back to drop off packages during the day. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “I love the Edison!”
Reviews.Author: szabo_10
Reviews.Content: Great price, great location! A roomy, comfortable art deco designed lobby with plenty of couches for meeting with colleagues, clients, friends. The coffee shop is a NY "institution" and great value.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for Times Square but hotel itself a little 'tired'”
Reviews.Author: NackyNoo
Reviews.Content: My colleague and I were travelling for business and struggled to get any good deals for 4* hotels at short notice, so we ended up in the Edison. The location as a tourist is perfect, you're virtually on Times Square as you step out of the block. The rooms (mine was 1440) were a good size but the bathrooms were tiny! If I'd have closed the bathroom door on any occasion I'd have felt claustrophobic - I could have washed my hands whilst sitting on the loo still! As mentioned in the title, the decor was a little 'tired' and worn, as was the bed linen - if the sheets were new, crisp and white it would have felt fresher. Service-wise I have no complaints - I struggled with my aircon, requested an extra pillow and all were seen too speedily. I probably wouldn't chose to stay there again if there were other choices but I certainly wouldn't refuse to go back if it were my only option. Basic but good if you can get it at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Good price. Great location. Old hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Droidtether
Reviews.Content: At first I was worried about stay at this hotel since the reviews are not too positive. Well, I was proved wrong. It sure is not the best hotel. It is not as bad as other reviewers describe. There is a lot better hotels with much cost much higher. I have been to worse and more expensive hotel in London. Price wise, this is not bad. I think other reviewers need to be reminded how much they are pay paying. I will recommend if you are looking for a cheap hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, disappointing hotel”
Reviews.Author: ali_p80
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my husband during the last week of September 2010. The location is great as we were a stones throw away from Times Square. The hotel however was awful. The reception area downstairs looks fine but when we got out of the lift on the 7th floor to go to our room, we were hit by a terrible musty smell in the passage. We had to put up with this for the 3 nights that we were there. Those carpets really need to be cleaned or removed. Then when we got to the room, there was the same musty smell which led us having to go and buy scented candles to hide the smell. The room and bathroom was old and run down. Not nice at all. The hairdryer in the bathroom hadn't been cleaned for ages (full of fluff/dust and starnds of someone's hair). And finally, the bedbugs....by the end of our short stay,I was covered in bed bug bites. Seems like we paid for the location and nothing else. Wouldn't stay here again, I would rather pay a bit more and have a more comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location , friendly staff - worth the money :)”
Reviews.Author: apriljane
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the edison on the 20-25th sept. As a bday present for mine and my friends 21st . Where do I start , before arriving I had read mixed reviews about this hotel and even read up it was a hotel with bed bugs - which scared me a little but when we got there I couldn't of been more wrong - reception staff very friendly and when they found out it was for our 21st we got our room upgraded .. We was in room 2012 a two king bed room with a view - ( not the best view but we was on a side street ) room was cleaned daily with fresh towels etc dnt get me wrong it was very old fashioned but the beds were very comfy ... And guess what we didn't get bitten once whilst we was there !! - literally you walk out of this hotel turn right and your on time square the location cannot be more perfect - the cafe next door was very nice pretty cheap to for a a normal breakfast !. The only issue we had was our room keys stoppEd working due to being next to my mobile but reception didn't hesitate on wasting time to re programme them , I would also like to thank frankii and marco the door men who made our stay very welcome from flaggin taxis to talking to us early hours in the morning when we couldn't sleep ( whilst we had a cigarette ) !!! All in all I would defo stay here again for the money we payed u cannot go wrong -

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location .......lovely, helpful staff!”
Reviews.Author: auds65
Reviews.Content: There was a huge mix up with our booking - the fault of the companies our travel agents deal with, who then are supposed to book the hotel. Two rooms should have been booked & only one had been. Only knew about it because we had emailed the Edison with a question. It took until TWO days before we left to get the rooms sorted for us, & only thanks to the lovely Gloria in reservations at the hotel. We were delighted that we got to stay in the Edison after all! Made life so much easier for our two Aunts in their 70's, one of whom needs to use a wheelchair most of the time. It's so close to Times Square, we knew they were quite safe to go wandering about on their own & they really enjoyed the freedom that gave them. Best location for a reasonable price if you want to be really handy for everything. The rooms were fresh and clean (tho needing serious re-wiring!), NO BED BUGS & any time we had to contact front desk & housekeeping everyone was so pleasant & everything was dealt with really quickly & efficiently. Rooms were also much more spacious than any other hotel I've stayed in NYC before. It's also the only hotel out of the 5 I've stayed in that I would return to! Love the art deco styling in the lobby too. If it had free wi-fi that would make it perfect, although you could pay $1 for 5 mins online in the Business Centre on the 2nd floor.  Fantastic stay! Thanks to all the staff & especially Gloria!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean, cafe reasonable and convenient, got great price on-line.”
Reviews.Author: Kathy33850
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Edison was easy to find, right off of Times Square. The lobby was nice but the gentleman checking us in was having a bad day. Our room was small but clean and had what we needed. The Cafe Edison, right off the lobby, was convenient, reasonable and the food was good (breakfast).

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - even better location!!”
Reviews.Author: JNJ8
Reviews.Content: Travelled to New York with myself and 5 other family members (including 2 pushing 80). The hotel is right next to Time Square and within easy walking distance of most of New Yorks attractions. Only used the subway to get to the Financial district. The hotel is very very busy and dispite emailing the hotel requesting a high floor room and the rooms to be together this wasnt allocated. This didnt matter though as we still all had good nights rest on the 4th and 6th floors. The hotel rooms do need a bit of a makeover and it would be nice to have a kettle in your room, but all in all the rooms are fine. The best part of the hotel is however as mentioned before the location!! Great bar and diner attached to the hotel as well. Would strongly recommend as isnt worth spending the big bucks in the fancier hotels when you are only in the hotel to sleep and have a wash. Would go back there tomorrow!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Average, Old Rooms”
Reviews.Author: cathylil
Reviews.Content: One of the cheapest hotels I could find in Downtown NY for October 2010. Location is brilliant. A few metres from Times Square/Broadway. Rooms are old and small (even by NY standards). Also, because you are right on Times Square, it can be noisy. I paid $260 a night plus tax. I have previously stayed at the Novotel Times Square. For the same period it was $450 per night plus tax. The Edison is in a much better position and I'd stay again for the right price. The diner attached to the hotel is also pretty good value. We had breakfast and lunch there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: bootsieWestYorkshire
Reviews.Content: Rooms are a little tired looking but all is forgiven because of the location. Very busy hotel. Beds comfortable and noise low. Beautiful Art Deco lounge

Reviews.Title: “Fab location - Great base”
Reviews.Author: holgaaa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Edison for a week in Sept/Oct 2010. Ok I am fussy and I was worried about going there from the past reviews. I neednt have worried!! The hotel is very busy always people in and out, we stayed on the 3rd floor and had no view but who cares! It is an art-deco style hotel and does need a spruce up but that is in hand and it is being renovated. The cleaner came every single day and did a great job. We only used the hotel as somewhere to sleep, wash and dress and we were out for the whole time. The hotel is literally on Times Sq it couldnt be in a better lcoation, its only across the road from the Tckts office where Broadway shows are 1/2 price. Literally 1000s of places to eat out and plenty of taxis about. I'd stay there again no problem, if you want luxury go somewhere else!!! My only gripe was that the Air con worked fine but was very loud!!!!!!!! You may need ear plugs but that also goes for the police sirens and tooting horns which is local custom!!

Reviews.Title: “The best Location”
Reviews.Author: hotherdon
Reviews.Content: After reading review me and my mum were a little apprehensive about staying at the Edison but we were pleasantly suprised. We checked in quickly and the staff were friendly. The lounge area has amazing art deco, yes the hotel is a little outdated now but we felt this added to the charm. The rooms were small, the bathroom was tiny but both clean, a few minor repairs to things such as loose tiles but we could cope with this. The only problem we had was our room being close proximity to the lifts but after the 1st day in NY we were too shattered to hear anyway! the reason for going to new york was to sightsee not spend all day in a hotel room so this hotel was perfect right on Times square. we couldnt have asked for anymore!

Reviews.Title: “dated, over priced, disappointing but a fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: mikkyfab1
Reviews.Content: For the money the Edison Hotel was dated, tired, lacking standard hotel facilities such as tea and coffee making equipment, hotel staff were not rude at all but never made you feel welcome, any request for help was hard work, the breakfast in the so called excellent edison restaurant was over priced and ages in coming. The bedroom looked exactly like my granny's bedroom - same 1970's bedspread and wallpaper ( no it was not the classic 1930 art deco it should have been!!) old tired bathroom - again circa 1970 . if this hotel had been in europe it would have either been properly 1930's art deco or been tastefully redecorated every few years. BUT BUT BUT this hotel is just yards away from times square and you can forgive the price tag for what would been a £49 a night rag tag hotel in London instead of the £250 a night that it was, beacause of its fabulous location, even at night the city around buzzed and yet it didnt disturb you in your room. within a few seconds we were at theatres, restaurants and glitz.. overpriced and dated yes but as long as you just use the hotel as a base then it is great and i couldnt say i wouldnt go again due to its location

Reviews.Title: “Great Location,Small Room and NO Bed Bugs”
Reviews.Author: Clemmons_Travelers
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Edison October 6-9, 2010. This has a great location since it is 1/2 block from Times Square and the bus stops for the tour buses. Our interactions with the hotel staff were all positive and they were helpful in providing the safety deposit box services at the main desk. We gave the room a 3 rating because of its size. It might be comparable to an inside cabin on a cruise ship with a window. This room would be OK for one, but is tight for two adults. We gave a 3 on sleep quality because the mattress was old and firm. The hotel was clean given its age. We would recommend Sophias, the restaurant attached to the hotel. The genre of the restaurant is Italian. We also used precautions for bed bugs. We placed our luggage on the luggage stand, the ironing board and the desk. Clean clothes were kept in zip lock bags in the luggage and we had no signs of bed bugs upon our return home. You can get to the hotel from JFK by taking the Air Train to Jamaica Center. From there, take the E subway train to 50th street. Walk towards 47th Street on 8th Avenue and turn left on 47th. The Edison will be about 1/2 block on your right. Be sure to have luggage with good wheels. You can return to the airport the same way. For the return, exit the main door to your left and turn right on 8th avenue. Turn Right on 50th street to enter the subway for the E train. BE AWARE that after you go through the turn styles, you will need to go down one more level for the E train on the stairway located to the right of the turn styles. On the return trip to JFK, you will exit at the SUTPHIN street stop, NOT the Jamaica Center stop. We felt safe on the subways during the day. The cost for this method of travel is $7.25 as of 10/10/10 ($5 for air train and $2.25 for subway). If you are able to lift your luggage over the turn styles, this is may be a cheaper alternative to the shuttles and taxis. As footnotes, the TODAY show is about 20-30 minutes walking time depending on the lights and how fast you can walk. Also, ask for a room larger than 1827 and you should have a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Outdated ,shabby, Unhelpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: Boab42
Reviews.Content: You'll love this hotel if your house is dirty and your 100 yrs old!!.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay.”
Reviews.Author: Teacher4VA
Reviews.Content: The Edison Hotel is an older hotel in the Times Square area. The rooms are small but clean. The bathroom is especially small. Even though these two statements are true, I am still recommending this hotel. The location is really wonderful. The Edison is 1/2 block from Times Square Tickets Booth and the wonderful steps to sit by and people watch. Subways, theater, and restaurants are all within an easy walking distance. The staff is courteous and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Old and musty hotel in need of major revamp but great location - a real disappointment when you open the room door!”
Reviews.Author: Vetty1973
Reviews.Content: Hotel has a great location but is in major need of a complete update and renovation. The Hotel smells old and musty and the rooms leave alot to be desired. The first room we were offered had graffiti on the walls - did the cleaners not see it!!! On complaining, we were told all the rooms were of a similar quality and you may get a better matress in another room!!!! the second room was a little better but still in poor decoative repair with wallpaper peeling and paintwork badly damaged. I know the website says it was built in the 1930's and retains much of it's original features but it doesn;t look like it has been decorated or improved since then either. The lifts are also very slow and you can wait at leat 10-15 minuts in the peak times to get to your floor. Good luck if you're on the 21st floor like we were. No room service either which was a disappointment as the Hotel would appear to missing this simple client need when relaxing on holiday. I would NOT recommend the Hotel to anyone and would not stay there again. The Wellington Hotel just around the corner is far better value for money and far better accommodation but with the same fabulous location being close to everything and offering room service and a typical American Diner attached.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: mollydog112000
Reviews.Content: this hotel is all about location. It's a short walk to many theaters, restaurants, and is right in Times Square. Good location for family with teens. The room is plain, but comfortable. Plumbing in bathroom is showing its age.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Debbie266
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed at The Edison in May. We loved the Art Deco style lobby and were very impressed with the front desk staff. They allowed us to check in early so we could start our sightseeing. We liked that we had to show our room key at night before entering the elevator. This added to the safe feeling we got from staying at The Edison. Location was excellent and the price was right. We will definitely stay at The Edison the next time we are in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot Beat the Location for $ Value”
Reviews.Author: SuzanneP440
Reviews.Content: This was our 4th time staying at the Edison. Each time I look for accomodations I find nicer rooms for sure but not at the price the Edison offers. We saw 6 musicals in 4 days so we were not in the room much! I booked a two bedroom suite which was perfect for my mum, daughter, husband and myself....but the bathroom...wow..small does not describe it.....so incredibly small you can't believe it...let me just say that you can do your business, brush your teeth, and rinse your hair in the shower pretty much all at the same time. So that is the only negative. Good security, cool art deco lobby and a location you just can't beat.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, locaqtion”
Reviews.Author: janetmmyers2
Reviews.Content: The Edison Hotel is a perfect location to launch a whirlwind visit to Broadway. I saw 8 shows in a week facilitated by the nearby half price ticket booth. The hotel is old but very clean. The staff was exceptionally professional. Cafe and restaurant provided tasty and easily accessible meals.

Reviews.Title: “The Edison made our birthday celebration trip go with a real swing”
Reviews.Author: OaDog
Reviews.Content: We stayed with 2 other couples in the Edison to celebrate the 60th birthdays of the husbands in our group. The hotel was in a perfect location for sightseeing and excellent value for money (which counts as we are all Scottish). The art deco interior of the hotel was amazing. To be perfectly honest the rooms were small but very clean and more than adequate - we only slept there after all - with lashings of hot water and fluffy towels. The staff were very helpful and friendly and we approved of the security staff at the lift entrances. We spent one evening in the Ballroom with Jo Battaglia & His Swing Band and had an exceptionally good time. We would thoroughly recommend this hotel and all it has to offer to anyone visiting New York. We would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Best location but that's all there is for this hotel ...”
Reviews.Author: Mimi76Bolbec_France
Reviews.Content: You can't find a better located hotel on time square ... however lobby is like a train station, the little room we had was small with a weird corridor nothing like pix on internet, bathroom still had towells and soap from previous occupants on the floor and all was wet and very dark room ... but I guess when in NY you don't stay in your room !! can't beat the location right out of the door and pretty quiet too for the neighborhood !! no free wifi either when you cab get it free on time square $ 9.95 per day !!!! parking was $49 per night !!

Reviews.Title: “Getting old - but still GREAT location and good enough rooms”
Reviews.Author: Bandit-One
Reviews.Content: My wife and me stayed here this summer for 7 nights after crossing the US. We came by car and it was no problem to park it quick right in front to unload and check-in. A good start. I've been in this Hotel already a couple of years ago. Everything still looks quite the same. The Hotel is right from the Art-Deco time.... some nice old-school feeling. Btw, you also can store your luggage for a while (when check-in or check-out) for only 50ct. a piece. Let's face it: Of course some parts should be renovated. And yes, the bathrooms are quite old and run-down. It is only basic equipped. But this Hotel really gets you the best value. It's really affordable, the rooms are big enough (I've seen smaller ones in this town...it's NY), the staff was really friendly and helpful and the LOCATION is just almost unbeatable. It IS unbeatable if you consider what you pay for this place. And it just felt perfectly safe all the time. You reach Times Square within seconds, it's literally just around the corner! And so are several subway station, which brings you anywhere in NY in a couple of minutes. We had our room on the 22nd floor and it was really quiet up there. Didn't really hear anything from neighbours or from the street. In the end we were really happy. I've been in this town several times. And when we come back next time, we sure would chose the Edison again. It's just the best option. Even the (bath-)room is not perfect... this is New York. You only need your room for (a short) sleep anyway. Wanna know more about my trips? Click on my profile or visit: route66traveler.jimdo.com

Reviews.Title: “Best for central location”
Reviews.Author: auntielin
Reviews.Content: The best thing about The Edison Hotel is its central location on 47th St just around the corner from Times Square where there's always something going on night or day and easy access to the Metro. The worst thing was our bed which must have been the creakiest bed in Manhatten (room 1521)! That having been said, we did sleep ok and it didn't bother us enough to complain or request a change of room. We had a bath and shower with plenty of towels changed daily and the bed linen was changed once during the week, but flat sheet and blanket could do with modernising to fitted sheet and duvet. The six lifts made getting up and down fairly straightforward but breakfast time was quite hectic and one morning, after seeing 5 full lifts going down, we took the stairs. As we were awake fairly early, my husband made us of the gym on the 23rd floor and had no complaints. We decided to use the Cafe Edison the first day while we got our bearings, and decided we liked it enough to have breakfast there every morning as there was plenty of choice, all freshly prepared but don't think you can linger. It's very busy in the morning and a quick turnaround of guests. A decent enough hotel for its price range and no sign of bed bugs which must be a bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Great Art Deco Hotel right in the middle of everything!!”
Reviews.Author: adelgirl70
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Edison Hotel for my 6 night stay for my first visit to new york city just last week. I was a little bit apprehensive after booking and seeing some of the reviews on here..but i was pleasantly surprised! Check in was efficient. The room was adequate for my needs, however a little stuffy. The aircon (once i found it near the window) was just working after i turned it on. The bathroom is a little small but how long do you spend in it? I was surprised to find my room larger than i thought it would be - very useful for my needs. The bed was comfy. There was an old TV - which worked which was good! The concierge was brilliant! I felt safe at this hotel with the security at the elevators too. What i was more amazed at was...THE LOCATION! It is literally steps away from times sqaure and that TKTs booth!! AMAZING. Right in the middle of everything!! Very close to all the theatres which i loved to. Yes its an older style hotel but that is part of the charm. I loved the old style architecture of the 30's.

Reviews.Title: “Big, old-school NYC Hotel personal enough to really surprise me!”
Reviews.Author: TikalTatras
Reviews.Content: The Edison has been under new ownership for the past 2 years. Upon check in, I met a charming, soft spoken older gentleman who was just hanging around the registration area. He told me a bit of the hotel history and then mentioned he OWNED it! Our 17th floor room was high enough to be above the street noise, but that didn't help getting a good night's sleep. I think our bed was an original 1937 that had only hardened with age. Next morning, I mentioned it to the front desk. Upon a quick mid-afternoon return, I found a crew outfitting our room with a brand new king bed! And who just happened to be wandering the halls of the 17th floor..........the owner! Well done! PS. The Edison Cafe cofee shop is famous. A Neil Simon play was written about it.

Reviews.Title: “My new favorite eclectic hotel! Great price, location and staff”
Reviews.Author: i1derynot
Reviews.Content: the Edison was great, our room had an end extra window with a terrific view, the windows really block out any street noise which amazed me. I really loved everything about the hotel. It was authentic, and eclectic which made it so much more special than the run of the mill hotel chain. The entire place gave off a special ambiance that made it a memorable. It was a place to return to over and over again. and you can't beat the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay for my 50th High School Reunion Visit”
Reviews.Author: PeterLoris
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean and nice and enjoyed my stay. Good location.Only problem was dripping shower head which will be taken care of. I will recommend this hotel to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Dump”
Reviews.Author: mrmipps
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel at around 2230 following a flight from San Francisco, so was looking forward to settling into a comfy room just like the ones advertised on their website, this was not to be. On checking in at reception I found the staff to be rude and uninterested in dealing with me there were two gentlemen manning reception each as discourteous as the other. We eventually got allocated a room on the 19th floor and off we went. On exciting the elevator we were met with a grubby looking corridor and the doors to the rooms we passed including ours all looked badly in need of painting and dirty as did the whole corridor. We entered our room and I was instantly shocked at how small it was and how grubby it looked, upon inspection we found it had not been cleaned the bins in the bathroom and main room had not been emptied, sweet wrappers under the bed and the carpet was filthy. The bed was not a proper bed just a mattress on a rolling frame, on the plus side it had been made, there were cables running all around and across the room coming from overloaded sockets that looked very unsafe, and the heater was hanging off the wall. All the furniture in the room looked grubby and the tv stand was broken. I wouldn’t say I have the highest of standards or easily put off by a bit of grime, however this was a bridge to far. I attended reception and asked to be moved as the room was awful and unclean the gent on reception (same one who booked me in) told me he knew the room was not the best but he could do nothing and if I wanted to move would have to ask again tomorrow. I was at this point tired, hungry and losing patience and on advice from my wife left it. As we only had that night and the following night to put up with we tidied the room ourselves, made sure we left nothing plugged in, that would have been hard as there were no free sockets and we had to unplug a lamp to charge phones etc. Also the towels are paper thin and the carpet was so bad you could not walk on it barefoot after a shower. On the plus side we encountered no bed bugs and the reception area looked nice, also the bar attached to the hotel was friendly with a great barman, however this is closing at the end of September. Also the location is good for Times Square, if a little noisy (even up on the 19th floor). Not sure if we dropped on a bad room and bad staff, however will not return or recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby but in the process of being done...”
Reviews.Author: constablejan
Reviews.Content: Shabby but in the process of being done up. Lobby is a 30's deco style and just lovely. Rooms are large and just comfy but could do with more plug sockets. Bathroom was small is but great shower and always hot hot water. Staff could not be nicer and the chamber staff always had a light on for you when you get back. It was great to have the securety on the door as It made us feel really safe, not that New York is not a safe city, bit it just gives you piece of mind. Location is amazing just a few steps away from the heart of the city, times square. Theatre's all around you and the TKS booth is very close so you can pick up your 1/2 price tickets very easily. You can walk to nearly all attractions, or pick up a tourist bus just round the corner. A* hotel

Reviews.Title: “Very central and busy hotel with comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: Frank1221
Reviews.Content: This was my third time staying at the Edison. Hotel is very well located off Times Square. Rooms are not very modern but very acceptable and Edison Cafe within the Hotel is good for breakfast. Did not think that Staff were as friendly on this occassion as previously with the exception of the Concierge (Sandra) who was extremely helpful. Rooms were clean and beds comfortable. Tea making facilities would be great to have in the room together with a full length mirror.

Reviews.Title: “Great location central for all sight seeing”
Reviews.Author: Dede57
Reviews.Content: Travelled with husband and three grown up sons. We had a ball. The hotel rooms were clean but a little dated which only added to the experience I love art deco. The staff were courteous and helpful. This hotel is excellent value for money being on the doorstep of Times Square with subway stations a short walk away making shopping, shows, museums, zoos etc all accessible.

Reviews.Title: “Great location.”
Reviews.Author: Raesansan
Reviews.Content: Edison is in a great location for a weeks visit to NYC. Close to theaters, sights and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in excellent location at a good price.”
Reviews.Author: cruisekeenan
Reviews.Content: It is an old hotel, but kept clean and safe. It is in the heart of Times Square and at a very reasonable rate.

Reviews.Title: “location location location”
Reviews.Author: allan-trish
Reviews.Content: rooms are ok for the amount of time spent in them,clean and comfortable,the location is superb,on a return visit would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Awful hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: awesomejourneys
Reviews.Content: Plus points - fantastic location right off times square. Negative points - everything else! Tiny room, very very old and shabby. Window fell out including frame as was not fixed and simply resting on the window sill! Desperately needs renovating! Bell staff and concierge polite but desk and transportation desk staff appalling and rude. Learnt that Art Deco simply means old!!!

Reviews.Title: “Bad service, bad Youssuf!”
Reviews.Author: ustravelservicecom
Reviews.Content: After we arrived one day later because we missed our flight from Las Vegas, they told us that the 3 day reservation was cancelled and the hotel was booked out! A man from the desk (Youssuf) told us to wait in the lobby so he can see what he can do for us...we never met him again! After 2 hours waiting i asked the desk woman what happened but the only answer was to give us a key to the computer room to find a new hotel...at 8:00 PM in New York!!! So after a long search we landet in the deepest Brooklyn area...and we will never book again the Edison!

Reviews.Title: “Fab location, felt safe would go again”
Reviews.Author: HAirey_10
Reviews.Content: The location could not be beaten. The hotel lobby was very elegant and the staff were very helpful. We took advantage of the free safe deposit box for our valuables (beware there is a charge if you lose your key). There is 24 hour security at the elevators. no room pass no access. Our bedroom was a bit tired but the beds were clean and very comfortable. There is a huge thing about bed bugs in New York, I stripped my bed and checked all the nooks and crannies found nothing and no bites were sustained. Our bed linen and towels were changed every day. Our break was about seeing the sights so we spent minimal time in the hotel but what time we did spend was fine. On check out day they looked after our bags 50 cent charge per bag, well worth it. Tip take a set of ear plugs people in NY like to use their car horns! and the air conditioning can be a bit noisy neither kept me awake.

Reviews.Title: “This is probably New York's best value.”
Reviews.Author: Topaz117
Reviews.Content: I definitely intend to stay at the Edison Hotel whenever I am back in New York. It is a reasonably priced hotel that is an excellent value. It offers a great location and service, restaurants on site and nearby and very safe and comfortable rooms. The hotel is convenient for attending Broadway shows and is less than a half block from the TKTS discount tickets booth on Times Square. We were able to walk to the theatres, which were all within a few short blocks of the hotel. It is also a good starting point for any sightseeing, as many of the tours begin in the Times Square area. In addition, were were very near to restaurant row and other terrific eateries which made it even more enjoyable. The Edison is a delightful art-deco-style hotel that had a lovely lobby and a deli-style cafe as well as a fine dining restaurant to choose from, and their gift shop was well stocked with toiletries, snacks, drugstore items, souvenirs, an ATM, and anything you might need. The staff was very helpful and made us feel like we were in a 5-star hotel every step of the way. While the rooms are not fancy, they are very pleasant, relaxing, clean and quiet.
