When I made my reservation, I asked for a larger room above the 8th floor with a street view, and when it was time to leave, I requested late check out, and each time the hotel accommodated us. It was just a wonderful experience overall and the perfect hotel for first-time visitors to New York as well as seasoned veterans.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic”
Reviews.Author: sarahScotland_UK
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Edison once again this year on my annual holiday to New York and cannot fault a thing - everything I requested was accommodated and the room was large and spacious and Katalina on the Front Desk could not have been more helpful. I look forward to my next trip!

Reviews.Title: “Old fashioned style hotel but comfortable”
Reviews.Author: fleurbaby
Reviews.Content: As i said this is an old hotel and has been kept that way. The rooms are not big but by New York standards they are good sized. Room was clean and had plenty of towels. If i had to find a complaint it would be that the bed was a bit harder than we are used to and there was only 1 pillow each, but i am sure if i had asked we would have got more. The hotel is as close as you get to times square. We had a great view of a brick wall, lol. Dont go to the ROXY for breakfast, cost $55 for 2 coffee's, 1 Juice and 2 Breakfasts. Found a great place down the road, on the Cnr of 8th and W 47th st (same road as the hotel) $2 for a bagel and coffee, or $5.50 for an omlette. Staff there were nice too.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Decor like Grandma's House”
Reviews.Author: SarahWV
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in other, more expensive hotels in the same area, but we've already booked our next trip at the Edison, the first time we've repeated at a hotel. The location is perfect, the staff was very friendly and we were even able to check in as soon as we arrived - at about 9:00 in the morning! The decor is a little out of date, but in keeping with the era of the hotel. Our room was large (NYC standards), clean and quiet. My only complaints about the room were that my tall husband thought the beds were a little small and that the water pressure in the shower was STRONG. It was a little like being sandblasted! (We had other family staying in the same hotel, and they said theirs was fine.) The Edison is a great choice if you'd like to have a little more money to spend out in the city.

Reviews.Title: “location location location for a very good price”
Reviews.Author: ivana25
Reviews.Content: the room was small but clean - service was very good - skip the breakfast, it is not worth it - location is great, right next to Times Square and all the bus tour stops

Reviews.Title: “Older Hotel That Is Loved”
Reviews.Author: Bulldog44240
Reviews.Content: This is my sixth time to stay at this hotel. Even though it is an older establishment it has been well taken care of. The rooms are nice and clean. You definitely want a room with two beds to get the extra space. One bed rooms are very tiny. Location is everything and it could not get any better at Hotel Edison. All the theatres are within walking distance and Times Square is right there. A cafe is attached to the hotel and the food is really very good. I will stay here again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location and friendly, helpful, staff!”
Reviews.Author: jan2550
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is great--we were 1/2 block off Times Square and close to all theaters! The entire staff was welcoming and helpful throughout our stay. Our room was clean and the carpet seemed new. There were many elevators and we never had to wait (in rebuttal to a previous review). The furniture was not new but was serviceable. All in all, we kept saying how lucky we were to have found such a great value, and we would DEFINITELY stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: cosmoDurhamUK
Reviews.Content: First timers in New York! Loved the location of this hotel - so easy to access all the sights. Yes, the wallpaper is peeling in places but overall the hotel is clean & comfortable. We were on the 19th floor & traffic (or other ) noise was not a problem. Room was bigger than anticipated & bed was comfortable. Staff were very helpful & polite. Used the Cafe every morning for breakfast & we thought it reasonable value with a good choice of dishes - particularly liked the freshly cooked blueberry panckaes! If we were to revisit New York would have no hesitation in staying here again - what more can I say?!

Reviews.Title: “Not Elegant or Trnedy, But Efficient and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: honeyb43
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Edison for six nights in July 2010. I was with a group of about 20, and I had a single room. The rooms here are good for one thing ... sleeping. Otherwise, the rooms are small and outdated. But, it worked for me, as I was out in the city during the day and very rarely in the room. The AC in my room worked very well ... almost too well. I know some of my peers had trouble with their AC units though. My room was on the third floor, and I was surprised that I had no issues with street noise. I appreciated the security at the elevators leading up to the rooms. The Cafe was excellent for breakfast. And the deli next door was very convenient, and the ice machine on the 2nd floor came in handy. The only complaints I really have is that the bathroom was very small, and the lighting was awful. The shower was okay, but low pressure. Oh, and no free internet access. I believe it was $10 per 24-hours. Overall, I would stay here again ... in fact, i'm planning another trip to NYC in December. All I'm really interested in is a place to sleep ... so as long as I can accomplish that comfortably, I'm happy.

Reviews.Title: “Room Could have been better (At least Clean Sheets)”
Reviews.Author: IvyFromPuertoRico
Reviews.Content: I have to say the location was excellent!! The staff was great we even had a up-grade when they new it was our anniversay. The rooms were small the bathroom were super small I am a petite so I cant imagine a person with an average hight. To tell you the truth it did not bother me that it was small, I was only going to be at the room to sleep. But the worst part was our sheets and pillow cases they were dirty or maybe it was stained, it even had hairs which were not ours cause we just got there. My opinion for room service is as soon as you see those sheets don't look clean ...that should go to the trash!!! It needs an up-grade.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for Manhatten”
Reviews.Author: barbyC
Reviews.Content: Hotel Edison is in Times Square..If you like the Hop on and Off Grayline Busses you are just one block away...It you want to wander up and down Broadway you are just a few steps away. Air cooler is not great but it was work the location. Not expensive, perfect location, clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but very basic old hotel”
Reviews.Author: Montefrisco
Reviews.Content: great value and fab location, no frills but at the end of the day you will be out most of the time.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs”
Reviews.Author: BizTrotter
Reviews.Content: The lobby definitely is misleading. It looks pretty decent. However, the rooms are terrible. This is a very very old hotel in need of a major remodeling. The rooms are very very small, they smell moldy, the A/C cannot keep the room cool enough, the bathroom at mold and mildew growing all around it, the matters and the pillows were as old as the hotel and very uncomfortable, the shower temperature fluctuated so much that you really are taking a chance on getting scolded. For the business traveler, there are no plugs to hook up your computer to. I had to unplug the light in order to plug in my computer. Bottom line... Pay a bit more and stay somewhere else in the area. There are many hotels within a few blocks of this location.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel we ever stayed in.....”
Reviews.Author: EuropeanTraveller101
Reviews.Content: We picked the Hotel Edison for its location and based on some reviews from trip advisor, I was never as disappointed in a hotel as with the Edison. The room was small, dated, smelly, and bathroom was a disgrace. The staff were unfriendly and seemed uninterested in hotel guests. As I said the room was extremely small. The bed was hard and bed sheets were very old maybe as old as the hotel itself!! The sockets are a disaster awaiting to happen. When plugging in a hair dryer sparks came from the socket. The bathroom is like something you expect to see in a low cost Motel. The bath sinks when you stand in it and there is mould all around it. The carpet was thread bare and dirty. People have mentioned the big advantage was its location on Time Square, however 2 days into our visit we could take it no more and we moved to a similary priced hotel also very close to Time Square and the difference was incredable, a bigger cleaner room and the staff were friendly. Thankfully we moved hotels as the thoughts of returning to the Hotel Edison after a days sightseeing was ruining our Holiday.

Reviews.Title: “old worn out with nice elements”
Reviews.Author: giraflor
Reviews.Content: The bathrooms are old, a bit updated but our bathtub was worn out The restaurant is a mix of mexican with classic elements, not very friendly, and you can not see out of the window - to big plants on the window sill The hall is nice, nice elements, Airco makes a lot of noice in the rooms

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: travelerHarrisburg_i
Reviews.Content: The rooms were small,very dirty. The restaurant that was in hotel staff was very rude to us. Wouldn't go back there again.

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't stay here again”
Reviews.Author: habsfan93
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a mix of good and bad. We had a suite so it gave us more room than the regular rooms at this hotel. The best thing about this hotel is the proximity to Times Square and Broadway. The rooms are in need of some serious renovation/sprucing up because the first impression of our room was not positive. The noise level was not bad except for the idiots above us on our first night and the idiots beside us on the third night. A quick call to the front desk led to no more noise from our neighbours. I did like that they have a doorman at the elevators verifying that people have a room key to go upstairs. I was not at all impressed with the front desk staff of the hotel who were rather rude and not at all helpful. I didn't like that there was no free wireless and they even charge you to use the computers in their business centre (I hate being nickled and dimed by a hotel). Given the price of the room, I didn't think this hotel provided good value and I would never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: gunnark
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent midtown close to Broadway shows and restaurants e.g. We stayed four people (me and my wife and our two teenagers) in a two room suite. Old fashioned rooms, but clean and ok for our purpose.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Edison”
Reviews.Author: DBJoseph11
Reviews.Content: Only thing I hated were the elevators are too small & take too long to get to your floor.....ugh.... Like that Times Square is right around the corner, plus there's a small dance/pub 4 doors down!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, and affordable, but don't go wih High expectations!”
Reviews.Author: Staceygreer08
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Edison in October of 2009. It was the best price we could find in the city, but the room was a hot mess. The carpet was ancient and rolled up everywhere. The repair man was actually in our room when we arrived. The shower didn't work the first day we arrived. The room looked nothing like the pictures on line and we realized it was an old building so we got over it. Didn't plan on being there much anyway. The second day the shower curtain which suspents from the ceiling on a ring completely came down around the tub. And the third night we returned to our room we had no water at all. The hotel didn't inform us that it would be shut off to the entire hotel and we only found out because I had gone # 2 and the toilet would flush. So we called the front desk and they told us it was off. Couldn't tell us when it would be back on and had no intentions of accomidating us somehow. The staff was extremely rude the entire stay. Nothing could ruin the trip since it was our first anniversary, but I can't say I'd ever stay there again. It seemed more like a Hostel than a Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, terrible room”
Reviews.Author: Connorphilp94
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel in February of 2009, the room was lovely, although it was winter and my heater did not work, the shower was just a trickle of water, and my window fell off, yes it actually fell off. I mannaged to push the window back on then went down to reception to complain about the above, and all they asked was "is the window back on?" I said yes then they didn't even bother to come up and check or fix any of the problems I sufferred in my room. Good thing was I was hardly ever in the room. No one else had problems but for me this was the worst hotel I ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, small room but good value”
Reviews.Author: thesmee
Reviews.Content: Before I arrived, I had read mostly good reviews on Trip Advisor, which is why I booked the Edison hotel. And it did not disappoint. The location is really fantastic. Next to Times Square, very close to 5 train lines, and a street full of restaurants serving great food. There was also a Starbucks around the corner with free WIFI. The hotel is obviously quite old, as can be seen from the decor and building structures. But it's well kept. In terms of the room, it was small but clean. It's not as spacious as a room in a 5-star hotel, but they managed to provide a dresser, armchair and a TV, alongside a queensize bed. There was also a closet. So it was a comfortable albeit small room. The bathroom was decent, with provisions of shampoo and soap. Areas of improvement: 1. The air-conditioning. Not quite the kind you can tweak with numbers, and even at it's coolest, the room still felt a little warm at times in the hot summer. If you're the kind that feels hot easily, or likes to sleep in cold conditions, it may not be sufficient for you. 2. There wasn't a fridge or a safe. We ended up cooling our drinks with ice and an ice box bucket (available on the 2nd floor). 3. The temperature in the shower would fluctuate from time to time and the water pressure was a little low. 4. The mattress was a little soft, which is not great when you've been walking for hours and need to rest your back well. 5. The view was bad. We were on the 4th floor and looked out into a parking garage and the back of the next building was very close to us. But apart from the air-conditioning, I think it was generally good value for money, considering I only paid US$186 a night (at wotif.com). For that price, I don't expect a 5-star room and amenities. So if you want a comfortable room at a great location and reasonable price (assuming you can get it below US$200), you can try the Edison Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Bluering73
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff quite courteous, though one lady at the concierge seemed quite arrogant to me the way she had to repeat herself like an answering machine when you want specific information. Room of standard size, there was no power point visible in the bedroom, but the hotel staff kindly provided an extension cord form a power point which was on the wall under the bed headboard. TV old, a good LCD would be a good improvement; it is amazing that there was no small fridge in the room. Room and bathroom quite clean. The big plus of this hotel is its location just a few steps away from Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the action”
Reviews.Author: Pamelafro
Reviews.Content: It certainly is right in the action, if that's what you want! It was very close to Times Square and Broadway, but if you are not interested in the night life it can be a bit overwhelming and over crowded, mainly with tourists. Still, you get a real sense of the excitement of the city, and it is easy to get anywhere from here. The attached restaurant is very basic but quite reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away”
Reviews.Author: Vicki036
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is the location. The rooms that are shown online and in their brochure are not at all like the two rooms we experienced. Room #1 was not updated and the bathroom light didn't work. We switched to room #2 which was a little more updated but the TV and remote did not work. It took 2 calls to have someone show up. It took 2 individuals to fix the TV. The air conditioning did not work either. In the morning I reported it to the front desk. Renaldo was very dismissive and rude about the problem, he promised to send someone to look at it. When we got back to the room at 5P the room was over 80 degrees. The front desk person told me they didn't have record of the complaint! Again it took 2 calls to the desk to get someone to show up. They ended up replacing the AC unit in the room and it took several hours to cool the room down. Stepping inside the room door, the wallpaper was peeled away from the wall from the floor, 3 feet up the wall. The carpeting was buckled between the beds. Just not a pleasant experience. In the meantime I called and left a voice mail for the hotel manager. He never returned my call. This was the worst hotel experience I've ever had. I travel a lot. The hotel did discount my bill but it did not make up for a sub-par hotel. Bottom line, their advertising is bait and switch!

Reviews.Title: “Edison Hotel is all about location, location, location.”
Reviews.Author: LWG65
Reviews.Content: As a senior citizen who likes NYC, theater, restaurants, sight-seeing, I am looking for value at affordable price. Hotels are expensive. The Edison was right for me. This was my first stay. The hotel is so convenient for me, right in the middle of the theater district and close to subway stops. Hotel security is top notch. This hotel is old but in great shape. My room was quite small but adequate. I hope to return many times if the price is right! I recommend the Edison.

Reviews.Title: “Location A+, Rooms C”
Reviews.Author: pennstatefan111
Reviews.Content: It could not be in a better location for soaking in all of the glitz and glamor of Times Square. Incredibly convenient. The guided tour stops are within a block either way, plus it is surrounded by great restaurants and shops. The hotel itself was absolutely clean, well maintained, and the lobby is gorgeous, but this is definitely a value oriented hotel. The interior halls on the upper floors were not air conditioned and the elevator service was slow. We also had issues with our accommodations - promised 2 rooms with 2 double beds but ended up with 2 twins and couldn't move. One of our bathrooms required a step up to get into it which some may consider charming, but others may have an issue with. Beds were not comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “No sleep, no service, no bull****”
Reviews.Author: badnytrip
Reviews.Content: Having just stayed the week before at a hotel at the University of Georgia I had a good basis for comparison. At the Edison the desk staff were surly and not very helpful. There is no ice machine or vending machine on the floor. The air conditioner was not working as it should. House keeping left a lot to be desired in that I had to call one day to have them come make up the room. Overall not a pleasant experience. I will never stay there again and would recommend someplace else with better quality. The no sleep was caused by a jack hammer being used between the house of 1:30A.M. and 6 a.m. AGAIN that is in the middle of the morning. Where I live this would not be allowed but they blamed the city for this bunch of crap.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Molly66
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel! The location was great and the price was right. The room was small, but I expect that in NY.

Reviews.Title: “My room did not look like those on the webstie”
Reviews.Author: KPgh
Reviews.Content: The workout room smelled and looked better than the room I stayed in. You opened the door to a mustly smell. The bathroom was worst than the restroom at the gas stations we stopped at. There was no hot water on Saturday afternoon. On the plus side, I did not see any bugs! I stayed at The Times Hotel last December, and even though the room was smaller, the place was much, much cleaner and updated. Would love to know where the rooms are that they show in the website!! Now I wish I would of taken pictures to post to show what a difference the rooms are.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, very happy with hotel.”
Reviews.Author: DebbiefromMaryland
Reviews.Content: My husband is a typical male and simply said it was nice, but older. It was built in the 1930s. So the bathrooms are smaller. But I'm glad we stayed here. The price on Expedia was great. We were right around the corner from time square and the "tkts" booth, and numerous theaters. Location was awesome. The staff was great. The doorman, bell hops, tight liped security guard, front desk and concierge were so friendly and helpful. They went above and beyond for us. When you are in NY you rarely stay in your room anyway. But the hotel was quaint. Had a sitting area, gift shop, restaurant (where you could buy a beer and take it up to your room), and had a bar. It was perfect for us. Especially the price compared to others. And with such a central location... Enjoy your stay. we did!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great price, great staff!”
Reviews.Author: MTtraveler4
Reviews.Content: The Edison Hotel was a great discovery. I was thrilled to find such an affordable, clean and quiet hotel (as quiet as you can get right off Times Square) in such a great location and for such a great price. I'll definitely stay here again. Love the Art Deco decor. Great breakfasts to be had in the Edison Cafe'.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location...”
Reviews.Author: AussieGC72
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week in June. The location is fantastic, only 20 metres to Broadway, and metro. We were very lucky to get a corner room, so had views out three windows. The room was very dated and small, but the beds was comfortable enough and showers were good. Our air conditioner didn't work well, we reported it and they fixed it within the hour. There is no safe in the room but security boxes are available at reception. Breakfast is available in cafe, but very ordinary, they do an excellent pea and ham soup though . Best double shoot cap, bagel and pizza's are 1 minute walk on corner or W47 and 7th. Only disappointment was after being out all day (from 8am to 8pm) we returned to find our room unlocked. Luckily nothing was stolen but it appears housekeeping didn't lock it properly after they cleaned. We reported it immediately to duty manager. The next morning we decided to check out early because of this and management were not overly concerned. It has nearly been a month and I am still waiting for the refund. If you are traveling with valuables definately lock them in safety deposit box. I would still recommend this hotel for price and location. Also doulbe check the bill they tried to charge $46 in movies when we only watched one (Date Night). They didn't explain why they had accidently overcharged originally.

Reviews.Title: “10 TH TRIP TO NYC AND 10TH STAY AT THE EDISON!”
Reviews.Author: warmhrt2
Reviews.Content: We just got back from another stay at the Edison Hotel in NYC and AGAIN it was great! Everything was just fine, Our room was ready upon our arrival at 10 am , We dropped off our luggage and took off around Times Square, We missed Bobby and Larry this time as they were on vacation but the Edison is our favorite place , Its right in the heart of Times Square and close to everything , if anyones looking for a inexpensive place to stay go there every experience we've had there has been the best , Its an older Hotel so you cant expect Taj Mahal but, as many times as we've stayed there , there has been no problems with anything , I have recommended this Hotel to everyone I know that has come to NYC . One thing I did notice was , security checks EVERYONE'S Key as you get to the elevators and that was A good feeling knowing if your not a guest your not getting up to the rooms !! Stay there !! Its worth the money , you'll see!!!

Reviews.Title: “Girls stay- with the best location you could ask for”
Reviews.Author: sunchiller
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the edison from Newark airport(cost of transportation for 4 was $68 plus tip) at lunch time on monday July 5. check in was extremly easy and they had our room ready for us on the 4 th floor. We had 4 of us sharing a room and I have to say the room was plenty big for 4 girls and our luggage. The room are dated but very clean. Our first night in our room we found that our airconditioner did not work the best, so the next morning we ask the front dest if we could have some one look at it for us and they sent someone to our room within 5 min, and replaced our airconditoner. We also booked our room on line and got the location, location special which included a wonderful breakfast each morning in the cafe just off the lobby. We found this location to be exactly what we needed for going to all locations of plays, grayline bus tours, subway and of course you can walk to alot of the sightseeing places. We found our maid was very pleasant when we chatted with her in the morning on our way out. The door man Frankie was extremly helpful to us when we wanted to go to shop in different places, he even would ask the takxi drivers what they would charge us to go to certain area's. He also suggested a great restaurant just down from the hotel that was excellent. We also found it nice that the hotel had a internet room and it was 1 dollar for 5 min. Like I mentioned earlier we used the grayline hop on hop off bus, we purchase the freestyle pass that gave us 72 hours on the bus all loops and it also gave us 3 attractions of our choice. The grayline office is just around the corner from the hotel so that made it easy to get our passes. . overall I would say this hotel was perfect for us girls travelling alone.

Reviews.Title: “3 Nights in Hell”
Reviews.Author: annie123436
Reviews.Content: I wrote a comment card to the management that read "Words cannot describe how terrible your hotel is. Did you get the mattress second hand from nazi germany after they closed the concentration camps? Nevermind. I doubt even hitler was that mean. All I ask is that you spend a night in your sleezy hotel and painful beds before expecting others too. PS have your concierge ever been to New York?" My friend and I ended up sleeping on the floor, yes a hotel floor, because the beds were unbearable. They were not just uncomfortable, they were PAINFUL. Nothing was clean. The staff was rude. We asked the concierge where a good place to go for dinner was - he told us the same place all three nights. When we explained we had been there already we asked for another restaurant. He looked at us dumbfounded and literally couldn't think of anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Edison Hotel a Solid Choice for NYC!”
Reviews.Author: Blondesteven
Reviews.Content: Four of us stayed five nights at the Edison, in room 1100 and 1110. Overall it was an excellent value for NYC. Pros: 1) location-1/2 block from Times Square, easy access to the subway (especially the A line to JFK), tour buses, Central Park; 2) room was comfortable (not beautiful, but comfy) and clean; 3) service was friendly and excellent; 4) easy check in/out. Cons: 1) furniture is tacky and need replacement. All in all, it was a great choice and value. Food recommendations: breakfast at PAX on 7th Avenue (1/2 block north of Times Square) for great prices on homemade food; and the wonderful restaurants on 9th Avenue (two blocks west of the hotel), including The Hummus Kitchen, Mee Chinese, and Terraza Toscana. All had delicious food, good prices and great service.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: BlueyesOttawa_CANADA
Reviews.Content: Outdated but amazing location! Stayed for 3 nights. Clean and roomy enough for family of four with young kids which included luggage, toys, pillows, umbrella strollers and favorite stuffed animal. Service was quick and efficient. The bathroom is older and there is mildew on walls and ceiling - no ceiling fans to circulate the damp air. Water temp would constantly change so you showered quickly! No air conditioning in hallways and elevators so it`s pretty stuffy. Did not hear the neighbours but we could hear the elevator`s bell. Toilets are quite powerful! Beds were okay, Melatonin helped for sleep! Kuddos for housekeeping as my son had an accident and wet the bed... They had everything cleaned up very quickly. The hotel store is the pits.. looks like more of a storage area as it`s tiny and everything is crammed in there. Went to get some sodas and I stubbed my little toe on a case of soda on the floor along the wall. Lobby is neat and old-fashioned. Security did there thing and responds well with a hello. Had 2 breakfasts at the Edison Cafe. Waiters are older and kind of grumpy but the portions were normal-sized and prices were moderate. Be careful as the tip is already accounted for in the bill! We got caught with that one the first time we went... The umbrella-strollers were a life saver for us for our 6 and 4 year olds as you can pretty much walk everywhere but the kids get tired. Took the subway which was safe and quite exciting for the kids. All in all, we would go again. Travelling with little ones makes you lower your expectations of how much you can do but the kids managed quite a lot. Did manage to hit Time Square, Central Park and the Zoo, Staten Island Ferry to view Statue of Liberty, walked Wall St., 9/11 site, Dylan`s Candy Store, FAO Schwartz, Toy`s R Us, Nintendo World, Top of the Rock, 5th Avenue.. Not bad for a 3 night stay! Would love to go back when kids are older! Internet is not free, $10 for 24 hours. Parking is $35 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: SussexCountyTraveler
Reviews.Content: Great location for seeing Broadway Shows and really nice restaurants - all in walking distance of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “location”
Reviews.Author: elaine20
Reviews.Content: Stayed here again as I had before. It`s not until you go back you begin to remember how good this place really is. Service is first class & they are always ready to help. The location is the best for everything. 20 yards away Times Square. You are in Broadway on this street. Once again if going to New York,I would not even think about going elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Times Square”
Reviews.Author: Videoquest
Reviews.Content: This was our fourth stay at this Hotel. We keep going back for a few reasons. The location is excellent, 1/2 block away to Broadway street and Times Square. Rates are quite reasonable considering the location. Rooms are clean and all the staff is polite, courteous and very helpful. One small downside however, the hotel is quite old and in need of some renovations. I'm quite certain that they'll get around to it shortly. Despite this shortfall the rooms are very clean and have never had any issues. Enjoy your stay! (as we did ours)

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, big rooms good service, good location!”
Reviews.Author: sussi64
Reviews.Content: perfect hotel for tourists and families, big clean nice rooms and very good service. perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Bjfuller
Reviews.Content: Beautiful Lobby, location is wonderful. Rooms were dirty, beds were horrible, I kept waiting for the springs to poke through the padding. Paint was peeling off the walls. Room next door, under the bathtub the floor was squishy

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience...”
Reviews.Author: PickyTravellerGuy
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the hotel for a few nights for a short break to New York, and were told it was close to Times Square....it may as well have been IN Times Square. It's a 15 second walk right to the heart. The location couldn't be better for the price you pay for the Edison. The building itself is beautiful. The art deco lobby is stunning, and you could easily mistake it for something much more classy than a 3* hotel. The rooms themselves were good too, very clean and with good air conditioning. They could do with a slight upgrade to match the rest of the hotel (lobby etc) as they are looking a bit aged now, but you probably wont be spending much time in the room when you have Broadway and Times Sq down the street. The chambermaids do an excellent job cleaning, especially if you see the equipment they have to use. The vacuum cleaners look like they were made around the same time as the hotel itself (1931 btw), but as I say, they do an impeccable job. Definitely recommended if you are looking for a reasonably priced, clean, comfortable and secure base to camp for the night if visiting NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean room, good value and friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: wiggy27
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Edison is a budget hotel but the rooms have everything you need for a pleasant stay; air conditioning, TV, brilliant shower and always plenty of hot water. The beds are comfortable, although there is usually only one pillow each so you might need to ask housekeeping for more, and linen and towels are changed daily. All the staff we spoke to were friendly and helpful. If you're looking for a comfortable place to stay with all the basic amenities, reasonably priced, and only yards from Times Square then you can't beat the Hotel Edison!

Reviews.Title: “Don't do it!!!!”
Reviews.Author: kld816
Reviews.Content: I reserved a deluxe room which consisted of a king bed and a sleep sofa, which would be perfect since I was traveling with my son and granddaughter. We tried to do an early check-in, which we knew in advance would not be possible, but we were told that our reservation was for a room with a single bed only. I was then told that I had to prove that they were wrong in order for them to correct it. Unfortunately, I left my copy of the reservation in the car which the valet had already driven away. I was told by the staff to go to the 3rd floor business center and pay for access to the internet and pay to print out my confirmation. Upon returning to the desk, the clerk saw my reservation in hand. He never even looked at it, he said he was sorry he was looking at a different reservation with the same exact name, yeah right. When we came back to check in at 3 with a new clerk there was no mentioning of a second reservation and no question as to which reservation was mine. Another issue was upon checking out. I called 45 minutes in advance like they request you do and it took 2 hours for them to bring my car.

Reviews.Title: “A really satisfying hotel, that's why I'm a customer since 1978”
Reviews.Author: AnaFlores
Reviews.Content: A nice hotel with excellent location, next to Manhattan's heart. As as suggestion, I recommend to improve the quality of the service for hotel-airport ground transportation, due to the buses that provide that service, pick up passengers from many Midtown hotels, therefore, there is a delay in their service, and they do not take the freeway in order to avoid the toll payment. At the office where I paid for the service (the office is inside de hotel premises) , they've told the trip will be 1.15 hours long, and it took 2.15 hours, instead. I recall that in other times, that same service was provided by SVUs for 10 passenger maximum, and the trip was much faster.

Reviews.Title: “Would I stay again? Absolutely!!”
Reviews.Author: Hyacinth269
Reviews.Content: Hubby and I went to NYC for our honeymoon and just went back for our 10th anniversary and my 50th birthday. Couldn't have chosen a better hotel for location, style and friendliness. We had a fab deal on the room as part of our package through BA and Kuoni and wondered if the hotel would be any good - we were very pleasantly surprised! Room could have done with being brighter and there was no ventilation in the bathroom but that's just being picky. Would definately recommend and use again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our needs.”
Reviews.Author: DurhamKerry
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel and I really can't fault it. It was great value for money, the staff were helpful and courteous. Security was good. The rooms were a little dated, but clean and comfortable, but seriously how much time do you spend there? For the price and location I think it was unbeatable. The cafe next door is also a convenient spot for breakfast (cash only) and star spotting apparently (Sex and the city filmed a scene there).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Allyj1978
Reviews.Content: I loved NYC & this was my first visit. hotel was just off Times Square and ideally located for everything!!! Loved the Broadway Shows & also very handy for the Big Apple Tours. I thought the hotel was lovely & very traditional in what is a very modern city. I thought the standards were very high and staff ever so helpful. Would definately return here. Rooms are clean and in NYC you are only sleeping in your room so its not like you are spending loads of time in it!! All round great value :)

Reviews.Title: “Best value in Midtown”
Reviews.Author: michael062
Reviews.Content: A comfortable, older, more European-style hotel that gives the best value in Midtown.

Reviews.Title: “A good clean hotel in a perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: irishcailin75
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Edison with some friends while on a weeks holiday to new York. This was a first time for all of us in new York and the location of the Edison Hotel was perfect for sightseeing and shopping trips. Hotel was clean and staff were very friendly. We couldn't get over how quiet it was in our room (on 15th floor), seeing as we were only steps away form times square. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Oh Dear...”
Reviews.Author: romacaldwell9
Reviews.Content: We arrived from Las Vegas after spending 7 days there and the next 3 days in the Edison Hotel was the final stay of our Package Holiday. What a let down!!! The reception area of the Hotel was nice enough but our room on the 15th floor was small and very basic. Since it was only for 3 nights we decided it would do, that was until the NOISE started which sounded like people in the room above us constantly scraping their chair accross the floor. We soon found out our room was next to the lift shaft and the noise of the lifts creaking up and down went on all night. The bathroom was tiny and frankly the whole hotel was really old fashioned and not what we would have chosen had we booked ourselves. Sorry would not recommend this one.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER AGAIN!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jo_AnnR155019
Reviews.Content: WORST HOTEL I ever stayed at. Door handle came off in my hand. Could not get out of hotel room. If I tried to dry my hair, bathroom light would go off. Dirty and dingy. No Ice, no fridge. Tried to change rooms, but was told in order to do so, I would have to wait until 3 pm to see if there was a cancellation. Do not book here, or sleep in your clothes. GROSS!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Right in the Middle”
Reviews.Author: Davynessie
Reviews.Content: A hotel right in the middle of things and its not far from Central Park if you like to get away from the tourist thing. The Hotel is dated and needs refurbished but it is clean. We did not have a view from our room which would have been nice. I don't know about anyone else but when I am in New York I don't spent much time in my hotel room so as long as its clean and quiet I'm happy. Its worth the money and I would use it again

Reviews.Title: “Great value - different experience from others”
Reviews.Author: TheatreGeek53704
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at the Edison for four days. My experience was very different from other recent reviewers. As everyone agrees, the location can't be beat for theatregoing. My room was very spacious (for Manhattan) and completely clean. The staff was helpful and efficient, if not friendly. The price was very reasonable. It would have been nice to have a comfortable chair for reading... there was certainly enough room.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: mamaManchester
Reviews.Content: Hotel Eddison we would stay at this hotel again prime location Time Square is on the doorstep Hotel a bit dated but it is clean our beds were made eveyday and white clean towels everyday so for what we paid for the trip we were very happy

Reviews.Title: “absolutly brilliant it was a surprise birthday present from my family”
Reviews.Author: margaretmary60
Reviews.Content: it was everything and more we had great help from franklyn on the front door he was excellent we are going again this year with a few more family and also family from england have booked the same time we,v an extra day this year and we will spend a whole day in woodbury common

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel great location!!”
Reviews.Author: NettyLiverpool
Reviews.Content: The Edison is perfectly situated and ideal for sightseeing purposes. The rooms are clean and not too small. Maid service every day. If you are sightseeing in New York not an awful amount of time is spent in your room. In short the best thing about the Edison is location location location. Come out of the front entrance and turn left you have all the Grey line tour buses where you can jump aboard for the downtown, uptown and Brooklyn tours all highly recommended. Turn right and you are in Times Square grab a map from the Hotel reception and enjoy!! Our trip to New York will be one that will stay with us forever and If we are lucky enough to go back I would not hesitate in choosing the Edison again.

Reviews.Title: “Art Deco Gem in the Heart of Times Square”
Reviews.Author: Brian_in_Reno
Reviews.Content: Nice example of the Art Deco elegance of days gone by. Hotel is well maintained, perfect location to see all of Mid-town Manhattan, and close to subways, buses and some of Manhattan's best restaurants. The Edison Cafe is a good and inexpensive casual restaurant right off the hotel's lobby. Not haute cuisine but the prices are good bargains in this expensive part of town. Hotel Edison is a great place to base your theatre adventures being right in the midst of the theatre district. Rooms are a little larger than the typical NYC hotel. The furnishings are clean and servicable but a bit old. No flat panel HDTV but a big tube type works fine. No free high speed Internet however. Bathrooms are updated, modern, clean and everything works. Good water pressure in the shower. Elevators are numerous and run quickly. Front desk staff and house keeping staff are courteous and attentive to customer needs. Less expensive than the competiton.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for......Location spot on!”
Reviews.Author: Kat_Suz
Reviews.Content: On first arrival at our hotel we were pleasantly surprised, especially reading the mixed comments that travellers have written about this hotel. We had booked a double room and when we checked in we were upgraded to a king size....however it must have been the smallest king size room/bed in NewYork. The decor was VERY dated, the carpets were dirty in patches and the bed was like sleeping on a hard floor - we had back ache for the whole stay (5 nights)! The beds were clean and the maids were excellent in changing the bed and bringing clean towels - which is what you want as its only to put your head down at night. The only other complaint we had was the "Rum House" in-house bar, it was VERY dingy and had a bad damp and stale smell to it - not very welcoming, as it states in the brochure and it certainly doesnt look anything like the picture on the hotel brochure at the front desk! We wont be staying here again and wont be recommending it to friends but our stay was still enjoyable as the hotel could not be more central. It is on Times Square and everything is within walking distance so that is the best part of staying at The Edison.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Elaine459
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location for all teh usual sights of NY City. It looks anelegant buidling but the interir is tired. We witnessed redecoration being barried out on our floor, but the bedrooms were extremely delapidated and tatty. We travelled with parents and both rooms were small, but when you are out most the time they were fine. The cleanliness was second to none and all the management and reception staff were very helpful. The restaurant leaves a lot to be desired, more like a transport cafe, the food is not good and there is a minimum charge. Better cafes/delis can be found in the same block.

Reviews.Title: “Why pay more when you don`t need to!”
Reviews.Author: karentoward
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from our trip to NYC. After reading the mixed reviews on the hotel, we were a little apprehensive. However we couldn`t have asked for more so I say go with an open mind. 5 Star , it certainly isn`t but it does not claim to be. Yes if you want to be really picky, it is a little frayed round the edges but we did not go to NYC to look at the paintwork or to spend most of the day in the hotel! We were celebrating our wedding anniversary on our trip so I e mailed in advance to ask them to consider this when allocating our room. When we checked in, the hotel had upgraded us to a suite for free which was a lovely surprise. The room was pleasant, clean and comfortable with a view of Times Square to die for. The bed was comfortable and we both slept like babies at night totally unable to hear any of the madness that is Times Square. Plenty of storage space for that essential shopping. Bathroom was a little on the small side for the size of the rest of the room but had a brilliant power shower with plenty of hot water at all times. No safe in the room for your valuables but free safes were available behind reception so really if any of your valuables go missing from your room, you really only have yourself to blame for not using this free service. The staff that we had contact with could not have been more friendly or helpful. Reassured by the fact that you have to show your room key to security to gain acess to any of the elevators that lead to the floors. Overall would definitely recommend this hotel. It was great value for money with a location ( literally 50 yds from Times Square) that cannot be beat. If you are not interested in paying the earth for a hotel but just want a good, comfortable clean and friendly base to enjoy all the great things that NYC has to offer, you will find the Hotel Edison hard to beat in our humble opinion. Can`t wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic trip”
Reviews.Author: risspot
Reviews.Content: comfortable clean central to everything stayed last year would stay again

Reviews.Title: “A Hotel worth staying at!”
Reviews.Author: pjred
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 6 nights at the end of May, already planning to stay there again next year when we come over for Xmas shopping. The room was neat and tidy and the cleaning staff do an excellent job. On saying that, all the staff we met/spoke to from the doormen, reception and security were all very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “AWFUL”
Reviews.Author: beaconsfield10
Reviews.Content: Very cheap... Smelly and unkept, Wouldn't even give it 1 star rating... our room smelled like a sewer....rooms have not been refurnished since the first war.... stay somewhere else......

Reviews.Title: “Old an outdated!”
Reviews.Author: lisam878
Reviews.Content: My family stayed one night at the Edison. The old window air conditioner did not keep the room cool. We all woke up several times in the night due to the warm and muggy conditions. This is a very old hotel and could really use an update! Staff was not very helpful or friendly! I don't think we will ever stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs - check your mattress!”
Reviews.Author: MarnieC
Reviews.Content: I hate to post a review like this because the hotel was otherwise very clean and pleasant, but there were telltale blood stains on the sheets that indicated the presence of bed bugs, which we unfortunately only noticed the morning after our first night. The hotel reduced our rate because of the blood stains and promptly changed the sheets, but my husband only realised he had been bitten after we checked out the next morning when he started getting very itchy. We should have asked to switch rooms right away but didn't know at that time that the tiny blood stains were a sign of the bugs. I have left a message with the hotel's HR Director to advise of the situation. Otherwise the location is great for Times Square, and our queen suite (queen bed with separate sitting room with couch and TV) was very spacious and clean - although be warned that the decor hasn't been updated in a very long time.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, though not value for money”
Reviews.Author: Powderbaba
Reviews.Content: * Located 30 seconds from Times Square!!! * Rooms are pretty noisy, even if you were at higher floors * Elevators are pretty crowded... always get a feeling of rush hour * Rooms are not in great shape... and are extremely small * Heater was not working properly (I visited during a snow storm and froze for a couple of hours) * Ultimately, all the negatives are undone due to "Location, location, location"

Reviews.Title: “Location Great - Hotel, Not So Much”
Reviews.Author: Traveler5121
Reviews.Content: Location is the only thing that this hotel has going for it (fabulous). The staff was unhelpful (except for concierge), the room was shabby, small, and felt grungy. Carpet stained, furniture beat up, sheets dingy, restroom tiny. Paper thin walls, banging pipes, noisy neighbors. Yes, it is true that you don't spend much time in your room when you visit NYC, but you do have to sleep there, and that wasn't a very good experience in this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and atmosphere, friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: pwsmom3
Reviews.Content: We loved the hotel and the staff. We were right in the middle of everything we wanted to do and see. The staff were friendly and helpful. The hotel was clean and well taken care of.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location, great experience”
Reviews.Author: DublinJennybear
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on our honeymoon in 2008. The rooms were large and spacious, but quite basic. Good sized bathroom, and spotless. Towels were changed every day. Any time we left we came back to the room looking like it had never been slept in. The decor was a little tired in the bedrooms, but the lobby was beautiful. The Edison Cafe served really nice coffee (especially first thing in the morning after a 7 hour flight) and the portions at breakfast were huge. The hotel bar "The Rum House" is a great place to chill out for the night. Can get very crowded very quickly, but the lady who sings there from Tuesday to Saturday (Karen Brown) is fantastic (and will even invite some of the patrons up to sing). Very pleasent experience, wasn't overpriced, and would happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Full marks to the Edison”
Reviews.Author: WhiskeyHeadBristolUK
Reviews.Content: We travelled to NYC for the first time in May 2010 and I was rather concerned about the variations in tripadvisor reviews. However we got a great deal booking in advance through Expedia so went prepared to complain if necessary. However we were delighted with the hotel. The room (2020) was bigger than expected, it was light and comfortable. The staff were friendly and helpful. The location was unbelievable for the price. OK the furniture and carpets were a bit tired but it was clean and housekeeping was fine. If you want to spend more money on fittings and carpets go ahead but we would rather spend it on having a good time in this amazing city. We didn't eat in the hotel - the deli next door does great breakfasts and part of the holiday is to try different restaurants for dinner. Take some practical shoes and you can walk to nearly all the major attractions. Also take the Grayline 48 hour hop on/off ticket - it's a terrific way to see all Manhattan. I would unhesitatingly recommend the Edison and will stay there again when we return.

Reviews.Title: “The Edison Hotel is a superb choice for those who attend Broadway productions.”
Reviews.Author: ChesterK
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location, satisfactory rooms, a good cafe, and a pleasant restaurant that not only serves excellent fare but also offers highly professional live jazz in its bar. The musicians keep playing after the theaters close, so it's a good option if you want a nice place to be late in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & price and what a view from the 22nd floor!”
Reviews.Author: NBEAbingdonMaryland
Reviews.Content: The Edison Hotel has a nice lobby with seating areas and art deco murals. Service is great! This hotel is close to everything,Time Square,theaters,Radio City,Rockafellow Center and the subway to take you anywhere else is less than a block away!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location....but nothing else!”
Reviews.Author: 9xKINGx9
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Edison with wife & 2 other couples and we all had the same opinion: if it werent for the location, Edison Hotel would go out of business! The staff/service is nothing special....no smiles, pretty grumpy. The rooms were VERY old but hey, for the price, cant complain....had a clean shower and bed and thats all we needed for the time spent in there! We went to the Edison Cafe for breakfast one morning....what a mistake! All our meals were cold.....and the eggs were not cooked as specified. Did not go back. Would I go back? Yes but ONLY based on location & price.

Reviews.Title: “Busy and impersonal”
Reviews.Author: Hugh002
Reviews.Content: Hotel nhad seen better days and could do with a lick of paint here and there. Very noisy fans outside bedroom window. Constant flow of big groups arriving by bus so that each morning it was impossible to get a lift down to the lobby. Great location and room staff seemed friendly. This is a big hotel and hence it was impersonal but I suppose that's N.Y.

Reviews.Title: “Location Superb...but only endearing quality”
Reviews.Author: Akeewee
Reviews.Content: The Edison is very convieniently located just off time square so if you are looking for location above all else - this is the place to booked into. Just be prepared for sub-par service and an old run down hotel akin to a flop house. The beds are small doubles that two cannot sleep in - my husband and I ended up needing to sleep in seperate beds, which - on a "romantic get-away to New York" was really the opposite of what we were shooting for. The bathroom was dirty and again horribly run down and the shower ran hot and cold, I presume as other guests used the water in their rooms. We wont be staying at The Edison again and would recommend it as a place to avoid when staying in NYC

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location but very basic rooms”
Reviews.Author: phototimeUk
Reviews.Content: Could not be in a better location, right in the heart of times square. The room is very old fashioned and small, but comfortable and as your in New York only needed as a pit stop! We recommend eating at Johns pizza which is down a side street at the back of the hotel, and visit the charmin store, you would of never seen anything like it! Just off the corner from the hotel onto times square there is an amazing bakery which has the biggest oreo cheesecake slice :) We went in December so was very cold but the christmas decorations were gorgeous, we even got some snow! Spend a day going to Woodberry common for shopping,can pick up some very good deals. We would DEFINATELY stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Average rooms, Fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: OzAsh7614
Reviews.Content: The rooms were nothing special but for the price we paid in the incredible location I couldn't have expected more. I requested a refrigerator in the room prior to the stay and it was not in the room when we got there but the staff were very quick to see my request was met. I was very satisfied with my stay and can't wait to visit New York again.

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't get much better than this.....”
Reviews.Author: lindylou1963
Reviews.Content: Just returned from trip to New York and having checked out other hotels around the city whilst there, this hotel is an absolute steal. No better location to be found, central for everything and whilst in the heart of Times Square, minimal noise in bedroom. In fact would go as far as to say this is the best sleep I have experienced in a hotel, comfy beds and pillows etc. Find the negative reviews hard to believe. Eat at deli few yards from hotel entrance as well as cafe Edison.

Reviews.Title: “great value/great location”
Reviews.Author: TateCamillus
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel for years -visiting several times each year. It's convenient to the theater, restaurants, subway etc. The rooms are definitely adequate. The price is right, most hotels in the area are more expensive. The rooms have always been clean and i have had no problems. The staff have always been accommadating. The bathrooms are dated but that's not important to me. The Edison feels like home. It books up quickly so make reservations well in advance.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ray1359
Reviews.Content: The website says it all. Great location. About half a block west of Times Square. Walking distance to shopping and many attractions. It's an older hotel, but clean and well kept. It's very busy so if you are planning on checking in early you may be out of luck. There's a great little pub just west of the hotel on 47th. called the Mean Fiddler. Reasonable prices and excellent food, friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: rgrech2
Reviews.Content: Rooms were large and comfortable. Staff was very friendly and helpful Really appreciated the Security before going up to the room.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, bang in the centre of things”
Reviews.Author: rogerdodge_9
Reviews.Content: this hotel is right on times square, couldnt be nearer. PROS. very central, nice thirties theme, comfy beds, good showers,very clean ,helpful staff. CONS. a little dated and dark, expensive dining. the hotel spans two streets, 47th. and 46th. At the 47th. entrance, four doors away is a excellent place for breakfast called "dannies" they provide cooked breakfasts while you wait at very low prices compared to hotel and any other establishment . see my other comments on new york .

Reviews.Title: “Value for money for the location”
Reviews.Author: Coppiabrazil
Reviews.Content: The location is good because is walking distance from Times Square. The Hotel is standard for NY as the rooms that are quite small but in this price range in NY all the rooms are small! The service staff was average. Is a good choice if you look for a not so much expensive hotel in that area.

Reviews.Title: “The Edison Hotel is our Home of Choice while in NYC”
Reviews.Author: margendave
Reviews.Content: We always feel like we are reconnecting with old friends when we stay at the Edison. It has a charm about it that is hard to describe. Joseph, our favorite Bell Man, has been there for 31 years and greets everyone like a member of the family. The rooms are comfortable,clean, affordable and the location is perfect. We are native New Yorkers living in VA and when asked where to stay we always recommend the EDISON Marge & Dave Winchester Virginia

Reviews.Title: “Want time square at your feet then this Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ttshortee
Reviews.Content: I was traveling to NYC for my birthday with the girls and looking for a last minute deal, after looking at pictures etc i could truely say i wasn't looking forward to staying here as it did look abit dated and as my original hotel was bookedi t was take this one or don;t go, so i did. When we arrived the check in staff where really nice the lobby wasn't bad the lift was very small.As we arrived on our floor the corridor where rather scary to the point you just want to your key at the ready to run unlock ur door and dont look back. Me and one of my friends had a room with 2 twins and it was very small but cosy the bathroom was clean but very very dated, however my other friend had a queen size room and that was very very spacious plus they got a 2 seater sofa and their bath room was much more moden. The hotel had a restaurant but it looked abit grotty so we didnt eat their but there is so much choices as the location was Fantastic step out the hotel turn right walk 50 steps and you are at Times Square shopping heaven. On our last night as we where asking for a cab one of the bell boys gave us a number of a limo service that would take us for the same price and at least we could all travel bk together as we had so much bags so that was also very nice that cost $110 to newark. So overall very dated hotel but clean staff are friendly and if ur looking for a hotel where you can shop and drop on a budget or have no other option then this is a good one althrough i have booked ealier this year to get a better one x x x

Reviews.Title: “I love this place I can really recomend to stay at Edison hotel.”
Reviews.Author: isjungfrun
Reviews.Content: Nice place supernice staff i love the room and the location of the hotel. next time we are in new york this is were we want to live.

Reviews.Title: “BED BUGS”
Reviews.Author: luizCuritiba
Reviews.Content: I have being in Hotel Edison, at 228 West 47th Street, in New York, next to Times Square, from 04/22/2010 to 05/04/2010, Room 2123, the location was really amazing, the service was good and the staff polite. The room looked clean, the sheets and bedding seemed clean but it was infested with bed bugs. My daugther got bits under her arms on the first night but we didn't do anything because we ignored that problem. At me the bites didn't start to show up until three days, then both of us had huge welts all over our bodies. The bites itch, burn and swell. When we returned home we found many more bug bites. Really, we´ll NEVER come back to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A perfect hotel in a perfect location with reasonable prices.”
Reviews.Author: Mrscye
Reviews.Content: Hotel Edison is in a perfect location if you want to stay in the theatre district. The coffee shop is located off the lobby and we had a package that included a free breakfast, not including tips. The breakfast was on a limited menu, but the choices were manageable. Eggs, pancakes, cereal, orange juice was included as was coffee. The room was small but very adequate and very clean. We had a nice TV, sufficient air conditioniing, an adequate closet and drawer space. The bed was a big bed, clean and alot of towels were available in the bathroom. The people were very friendly, from the doorman, who we got to know just over the weekend, and the bellhop Joseph. The total experience was very pleasurable. We spent a Friday and Saturday night at the Edison. Friday night we went to see an opera at the Met and walked back, down 8th Avenue. We had adinner at Becco's on Restaurant Row, also in the neighborhood. Saturday we headed up to the park and the Met Museum to see the Big Bamboo and Picasso exhibit. The subway for uptown is right around the corner. We saw "Lend Me a Tenor" Saturday evening. The play I would suggest also, it was a comedy. The location to walk over to the theatre was just a short walk through the Marriott Marquis alley . After theatre we had dinner in a neighborhood eatery. I can highly recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to enjoy the theatre district, and enjoy it without spending a ton of money for a hotel room, that you probably won't be spending a whole lot of time in it anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great security, lovely 'art deco' ambience”
Reviews.Author: compliments3
Reviews.Content: Hotel Edison is a lovely art deco style hotel. The security is excellent, 'you must show your room key upon entry to the elevator section. The staff very professional, and quite accommodating. The rates, considering you're in the 'heart of New York excitement', was reasonable, and the room had a private bath, 'so necessary with a family'! The room was a satisfactory standard room, which, when you're out most of the time, it's acceptable. The beds were unique, as we had not seen 'twin beds' in years, however, again, acceptable, as we were 'on the go' most of the time. We do look forward to staying at the Hotel Edison again, and again. Keep up the good work.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value near Times Square”
Reviews.Author: GoldenRetrieverKatie
Reviews.Content: My wife and I loved the Hotel Edison and it will always be our first pick when it comes to selecting a New York City hotel room. It is less than a minute from Times Square and dozens of great places to eat for breakfast/lunch/dinner. The hotel is also very close to the discount ticket booth for all the Broaday shows. The hotel Edison is just a few blocks from Rockefeller Plaza and most beneficial of all, is very close to several subway terminals. The rooms are small, but not as small as I imagined. The room we stayed in was perfect for a couple. I don't know what accomadations the hotel has for large groups. Another great feature of the hotel is that it has an entrance on two streets which makes it easy to take a taxi in or out of the hotel. (Please do not bother renting a car in Manhattan). I can't stress enough how much we loved our stay at the Hotel Edison.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Staff & Location”
Reviews.Author: saltcoats
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our first trip to new york. We booked this hotel in august before we read any of the reviews. After reading them we were very aprehnsive about our trip. There was NO need for any worry. The hotel was excellent. staff all very helpfull. excellent location. A minute walk to Time Square. The room was very spacious and clean. The rooms were cleaned every day with fresh towel every day. They are not modern in decor, but that adds to the whole experience. The Rum House bar in the hotel was very friendly, with entertainment 5 nights a week. We were there when the volcano erupted. I was extemely upset in case we were put out of the hotel with nowhere else to stay. THE STAFF WERE EXCELLENT. They booked us in for another 11 days at a reduced rate taking 50 dollars off a night. They said if we got an earlier flight we would only pay for the nights we stayed, but at least we had our room reserved. You have to show your room card to the security man before getting into the elevator. Making this a very safe hotel. Our room was opposite the elevators, This did not cause a problem at all. The bathroom is small with a bath and shower. The shower is fixed, but always very hot water. That was our first trip to New York, but not our last and we will be staying at the Edison the next time we go.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: thiago_bergmann
Reviews.Content: Hotel was great (hot shower, clean, room size, location, nice beds) but offer no free internet and the heating was broken.

Reviews.Title: “Can't get a better location or better price.”
Reviews.Author: maryclare_02906
Reviews.Content: We would, without a doubt, stay here again. The old world feeling in both architecture and service cannot be surpassed. So much is within walking distance. The price was very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, amazing location!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: marykate14
Reviews.Content: This is my second trip to this hotel, it's amazing! love the location, love the staff! i would stay here again, again and again.

Reviews.Title: “LOCATION!”
Reviews.Author: neon645
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is it's location. You are literally a 10 second walk to Times Square. The lobby was kind of neat, the staff were friendly and the room was acceptable. You can tell they haven't updated in a while, but everything was clean and there weren't any issues with our room.....it just seemed old. BUT for $160 a night in the middle of Times Square, I'm just fine with ugly curtains and a dated bathroom. This will be the only hotel I will stay in while in NYC. The rates just can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Location Too Die For - Safe”
Reviews.Author: jadoreparis98
Reviews.Content: Went Expecting the Worst..but Thankfully surprised. IT is not modern and updated. It is art deco and dated however we could not be more pleased. It was clean in an ideal location. The art deco detailing should not be remodeled...ever. If you traveled in Europe this is reminiscent of Euro hotels. We had a street side room which could be quite noisy at moments ~ just a City expectation. I don't know why the bad reviews exist....I'd definitely return!!!

Reviews.Title: “Still my NY-favourite!”
Reviews.Author: Hoffa38
Reviews.Content: I have been staying in Edison before and the combination of price and location makes it my favourite in New York

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location but in need of a serious refurbishment”
Reviews.Author: teacher_jones
Reviews.Content: The main thing to remember when looking at booking the Edison is "you get what you pay for." Its location is second to none - being right on the doorstep of Times Square with 49th street subway 2 blocks away, 2 superb delis and a good pub on the same street and in spitting distance of many attractions, restaurants and bars. The hotel however needs a great deal of money spent on it. The best thing about it is the lobby which is clean and art deco in style. Despite what I had read on here I didn't find the rooms too small, it had a desk, chest of drawers and 2 side tables and was plenty big enough for the small amount of time we spent in the room. The room was just incredibly dated and quite tatty looking, it was ok for a short trip and as we're used to staying in hostels we can manage with varying levels of decor but if you are looking for somewhere to stay for a romantic break or a place to take your mum I wouldn't recommend it. The shower had parts of tiles missing and around the plug the bath had lost it's colour so was showing rusty brown underneath. The shower dripped constantly but this wasn't the worst thing, when ever anyone used the taps the pipes would scream and rubble, this was particularly unpleasant at 6.30am. If you can afford a little more for accomodation then definitely look at a more modern hotel but if you are looking for something that is cheap and cheerful then Edison is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel in great location, value for money”
Reviews.Author: bankan
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Edison twice and I've had pleasant stays. Last time, in april 2010, we had booked a room with two double beds but were given a room with two single beds. I complained at the desk and we got a room with two queen beds. The rooms are nice but old, beds are quite hard. There is some street noice but nothing too bad (at least on the 5th floor). Staff is polite and helpful. Bathroom only has a fixed shower head and our last day we had problems with the plumbing. You really do get what you pay for but The Edison is clean, is in a great location and if you only stay in the hotel to sleep, shower and change this is the best value for money.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Affordable Hotel in Mid-town”
Reviews.Author: Rustywagdog
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Edison many times and look forward to many return visits. The hotel kindly emails a weather forecast prior to arrival - very welcoming. Breakfast is a must: solid, tasty food - great bagels; outstanding, quick service; have been attended by same capable servers for a number of years, which suggests reliability. Easy check-in/check-out. Our room was ready by 10:00 a.m. upon our arival!! Convenient and only a nominal fee for storing bags before or after check-in/out. We feel secure: security does consistently check for room keys at the elevator. Location-location-location. Great for those who attend theatre and museums. Excellent Zagat-rated restaurants nearby, even on the same block! We highly recommend the Edison Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Brillaint location!”
Reviews.Author: miniman63
Reviews.Content: Brilliant location, just off Time Square. Chosen by accident so was a little concerned bearing in mind I was travelling with hubby and 3 teenagers! Went to New York to celebrate son's 18th birthday and the trip will be remembered always. Cafe served an excellent breakfast that kept 3 growing boys well filled up until lunch. Only found restaurant on last night - make a booking - very popular, excellent food. Staff polite and helpful.Only downside was bathroom, could have done with a little refurbishment but as we only used the room for washing and sleeping,it fulfilled its job. Will use again if ever in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Great location.”
Reviews.Author: EmilyB6
Reviews.Content: Hotel is not as cramped as expected, very clean and in a perfect location less than a block from times square.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: witten02
Reviews.Content: very big rooms perfect location friendly staff good price qaulity very good service

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: mrburges
Reviews.Content: Good points: Fantastic Location, right off Times Square Clean Late Checkout available (for a price) Good Cafe with great breakfast (get there early, before the que!) Bad Points: You get what you pay for & luxury it aint! The do not disturb sign may aswell not be there, we put it up every day & every day the maid came in. No room service Its an old hotel so very dated & in need of an upgrade but thats why its cheap!

Reviews.Title: “Location was worth it all”
Reviews.Author: Lynn60
Reviews.Content: May not have been the best hotel that we've stayed in, but being within walking distance of everything was worth the stay. We were only in the hotel to sleep & shower. The bed was hard, but we slept well after a long day of touring NYC.

Reviews.Title: “I'll Never Stay Anywhere Else!!!”
Reviews.Author: broadway45Houston
Reviews.Content: Loved staying at the Hotel Edison. The location is truly right in the heart of the theatre district. Enjoyed the great breakfasts each morning. A great way to start the day without leaving the hotel. Each staff member was most helpful. Best value for your dollar.

Reviews.Title: “a bad hotel”
Reviews.Author: 1shosh1
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not clean, especially in the room and by the elevators. We have no free WiFi in the room, no fridge in the room, no safe. The bathroom needs an urgent makeover. We will not come back.

Reviews.Title: “STAY AWAY!!!”
Reviews.Author: NYCHellhole
Reviews.Content: It is 2010 but you would not know if from these accommodations. This outdated hotel is not remotely charming but rather dingy, dirty and disgusting. The rooms are claustrophobic, the bathrooms are tiny, and the bed is hard as a rock with yellow bed sheets. Should be a motel at best and would not stay there even if they paid me to.

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs!!”
Reviews.Author: chchp
Reviews.Content: The economy was not worth the discomfort. I complained about the bed bugs and they switched my room: I got several more bites before I checked out. No consideration/refund was offered.

Reviews.Title: “With helpful staff, and a great location, the Edison Hotel is a good spot for a brief stay.”
Reviews.Author: Oldwest33
Reviews.Content: The Edison Hotel has very reasonable rates, is clean, and is close to Broadway shows. The rooms are spacious, and the staff is helpful. For a small charge, we left our bags before and after our night's stay, which gave us extra time to explore the city. The room did have a few quirks (squealing heater, elevator noises, and a stuck shower faucet) but if quirks don't faze you, this place is a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT ROOM”
Reviews.Author: mrktboy
Reviews.Content: I love the size of the rooms very big that is the one thing that i like about this place. and i love where the hotel is loacated and the great staff.

Reviews.Title: “After forty years staying at the Hotel Edison, I still love it...!”
Reviews.Author: artsinutah
Reviews.Content: I found the Hotel Edison forty years ago and I try to stay there every time I travel to New York. I work in the Theatre and I love the location and the wonderful charm this hotel has. The staff is always friendly and accommodating and the nostalgia is captivating. Another one of my favorite features is the piano bar with Karen Brown...! I just love the Hotel Edison and hope to stay there for many years to come...!

Reviews.Title: “Right in the center of New York for a resonable room rate”
Reviews.Author: ZurichCity
Reviews.Content: We were a groupe of people staying in various rooms in the hotel. Although the last renovation of the hotel is some time ago, we had nice rooms. When someone of the group was to close to a source of noice, it was not a problem to change to another room. The location is faboulous and the charme of the 1930s in the lobby area gives it a special "New York" feeling.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in the middle of everything”
Reviews.Author: YankeePa
Reviews.Content: You will love this older hotel that is clean, roomy with a great staff close to everything downtown. We could walk to shop, eat and seea play. The staff is friendly, courteous and helpful. Well worth the effort.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Trip ever”
Reviews.Author: sar_esq
Reviews.Content: This is the third time we've stayed at Hotel Edison. Hotel Edison has met our expectations each time and we look forward to visiting again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for theater and Times Square”
Reviews.Author: cvqbari
Reviews.Content: Except for some mold (or is it mildew?) on the bathroom ceiling, this Hotel was perfect for Broadway. Valet parking, check-in, breakfast and overall organization was efficient and reassuring. Having so many theaters within steps of the Hotel was an added treat.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay in NYC”
Reviews.Author: marilisag
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at the Hotel Edison and I would recommend it highly. I love going to shows and the location is great! The hotel staff were friendly and helpful. The rooms were clean and although the bathrooms were little small, they were clean, also. We had breakfast at the Cafe there and it was excellent, too! I am planning to go back to the Hotel Edison next month and in May. Reasonable room rates.

Reviews.Title: “Located convenient to Times Square, easy to get around, simple accomodations.”
Reviews.Author: dcon43
Reviews.Content: Small rooms, clean enough, quiet enough, not luxurious, but offers place to sleep when doing the Times Square thing. Not for business people nor is it a romantic get away. Simple, secure and safe, and centrally located. Pretty good value for the price, everything relative. Security is very aware of who belongs and who does not; they are diligent in keeping things reasonably quiet at night.
