Popular with student groups because of the security and location as well as price. Of course, this means students around and possibly in the room next door.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel Edison enhanced the quality of my vacation.”
Reviews.Author: sujuBerlin
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Edison is an excellent tip for a place to stay in New York City. It is clean and efficient and offers its guests the optimal location in the midst of the theater district with easy access to the Metro for sight-seeing as well as to Central Park and the museums.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel at a budget price”
Reviews.Author: Julie86
Reviews.Content: My friend and I booked this hotel on the internet five months before travelling and paid 117 euros per night for a twin bedded room. My daughter found it for me and I can honestly say that it was the most central place to be. 30 steps from Times Square with all the theatres close by, shopping, etc etc. All the reviews are the same, yes it is a little tired but having said that our room was spacious - much bigger than I thought it would be having read some of the other reviews on the size of the rooms. All the staff were very pleasant from the Reception to Security to Chamber Maids. Our room was clean with fresh sheets each day for the four nights we were there, clean towels also far more than we needed. Another plus point is that we were around the side of the hotel, not such a nice view of Times Square, but very quiet and we had great nights sleep with no noise. Note if you want coffee/tea facilities they are not available in your room. We took a kettle and coffee with us as its nice to have a cuppa when you wake up. The cafe edison was very good value for money and we ate one night in the Sofia, although all the waiter seemed interested in was his tip! And the Sofia was quite expensive compared to the cafe edison. The security men on the door were a little brash and told me to "get out of here" when I questioned him in a joking way as to where we pick up the hop on hop off bus, but all taken in good fund. All in all if I was going back to New York I would definately stay at the Edison Hotel. Summing it all up: A little dated, clean, nice staff and incredible value for money in considering you are just off Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible value and location.”
Reviews.Author: coachvu
Reviews.Content: Only 100 feet from Times Square, directly across from the new TKTS booth. Despite this, noise was not a problem. The hotel is a little tired and looks like it hasn't been updated since the late 1950s. That being said, it was very clean, and the staff were very friendly. Bathroom in our room was brand new. You have to pay for internet, but it's cheap by New York standards. Given the location and price, I haven't been able to find a better hotel in the city.

Reviews.Title: “The Edison represents great value for such a premium location.”
Reviews.Author: leebrown2
Reviews.Content: I took a large school trip from the UK (St Clere's School) this February and I have to say that we were very well taken care of by the staff. Everyone from the front desk and housemaids (who are very honest) to the porters were first rate. The security can be a little brusque, but you expect that with some New Yorkers! For the price, I doubt you could get a better location. It may not be a 5 star hotel, but in New York you are so busy with your itinerary that you don't need to spend extra money on plush hotels really. I'd thoroughly recommend this hotel not just for groups, but also for familes and travelling couples who want an affordable hotel in a great location. Furthermore the Cafe Edison makes a decent breakfast at a decent price too.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Edison”
Reviews.Author: kyuupi
Reviews.Content: I think many of the negative reviews come from those expecting the Edison to be some kind of palatial oasis in the middle of an urban landscape. It's not. It IS, however, a safe, clean, comfortable place to sleep. You won't get the frills here that you'll get at some other hotels, but you won't be paying the rates at those other hotels, either. I've stayed at many luxury hotels in the city and still keep coming back to the Edison for the unbeatable location.

Reviews.Title: “Edison is my New York home.”
Reviews.Author: MadamRose
Reviews.Content: Whenever I travel to New York, several times a year, I choose the Edison. It is conveniently located in the Theatre District, moderately priced, and professionally staffed. No matter when I visit, the Edison staff finds a way to accommodate my needs, whether for a small room or a suite, even though the hotel is always very busy. I enjoy the retro furnishings and the beautiful art deco lobby. I enjoy eating at the Edison Cafe and Sofias, both of which accommodate special dietary requirements. The price is right, although I have to admit that, since I discovered the Edison about 10 years ago, I have never looked to stay anywhere else and, therefore, have not compared prices. Whenever I visit, I recognize staff members, and they recognize me. Housekeepers are professional and willing to adjust to my schedule. I appreciate the availability of the Business Center. When flights are cancelled, I know the staff will work with me. I am glad to see someone at the security desk.

Reviews.Title: “Always a Pleasure at the Edison”
Reviews.Author: Questovia
Reviews.Content: The Edison is always a good dependable hotel offering clean rooms, service with a smile, good cafe, and a fantastic location in the heart of the theatre district. Always a winner!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and, when prices are reasonable, a very good deal.”
Reviews.Author: waf203
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a long-time favorite—clean, safe, and ideally located for theater, dining, and all transportation. Unfortunately, it had grown quite pricey as the neighborhood improved, and only recently have prices once again been within our budget.

Reviews.Title: “I would go back tomorrow if I could!”
Reviews.Author: courtsum
Reviews.Content: I could not be more pleased with this Hotel. They are always friendly and very accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast and go is the best way to go”
Reviews.Author: sligoskittles
Reviews.Content: We signed up for the "breakfast and go" package, great room price and a free huge breakfast in a city that would have otherwise been a lot more expensive. The hotel is very clean,safe, charming, older, super location in the heart of midtown and the theater district. Was able to check in early. This is an older hotel, rooms and bathroom are small-ish, but it was comparable to a hotel we stayed at in San Francisco size/quality wise for 1/3 the cost. Check in and out was quick, in spite of the large groups of people (mostly students and families) checking in and out. Seemed family and group friendly. Between this hotel and Fodor's guide to NYC., we had a great time on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Expected the worst.....”
Reviews.Author: bsteel67
Reviews.Content: I foolishly booked my break then looked at reviews and was on this site reading about the Edison Hotel just off Times Square! A good few of the reviews were negative and i was beginning to get worried about what I'd booked up for but upon arrival at the hotel we were greeted by friendly staff, not the horned devils in a few of the reviews. When entering the room i was ready for a bug infested pit covered in cobwebs and cockroaches but the room was tidy and was clean. In some of the other reviews it was said that the rooms were not clean and were dated,which i do agree, but they did have notices up saying that they were in the process of renovating the level. We had a room facing the street and it could get a bit noisy but that is the charm of staying in a city like New York and something which excited us. The proximity to Times Square was second to none and this is probably the Hotels best atribute(only 50 yards away) and right in the centre of the Theatre District. We had a problem with a blocked toilet the first night and I called the front desk and they sent someone immediately and it was fixed there and then. I can't write about the restaurant or bar because we didn't use them. Some of the Items in the Hotel Shop were actually cheaper than the shops on Times Square. Overall the Hotel was perfectly placed for visitng New York and was a very pleasant experience and I would recommend the Hotel as a great place for the Centre of one of the Best Cities in the world

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, great location, perfect for a few nights”
Reviews.Author: Anna_Durrance_Bagale
Reviews.Content: I have just got back from a 5-night stay in this hotel, staying in a twin room. It is in an excellent location, about 30 seconds' walk from Times Square. The rooms are clean and have everything you need. It's not luxurious but then how much time are you going to spend in your hotel room while you're in New York? The staff were generally friendly and helpful. The only slight exception was the staff in the cafe - this place was pretty much awful and we didn't want to sit there for more than a minute or so. The bar also was a dive; dark, smelly and not somewhere inviting. We didn't try the restaurant! There are lots of places to eat and drink around the hotel, as well as millions of shops. An easy $50 trip from JFK, which took about an hour in a cab, I would recommend this hotel, but not if you wanted somewhere special or romantic.

Reviews.Title: “dated but great location”
Reviews.Author: staffyuk
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a stay at the Edison. The Hotel is a little tired and dated but clean just in need of a facelift. Staff all friendly. What the hotel lacks in decor it truly makes up for in location, right on Times Square and all the action. Would stay here again if only for the location. Recommend Danny's Deli right next door for delicious breakfasts and all types of other foody delights .

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet and relaxing!”
Reviews.Author: lumpy86
Reviews.Content: The staff was friendly and accommodating and responded to special requests in a courteous manner. Although well worn, my room was better than expected; furnished beautifully, clean and extremely quiet. The location was excellent for visiting galleries and museums, convention/fairs and theatres. Access to public transit and the variety of dining options was surprisingly convenient. Hotel Edison made my trip a pleasurable experience!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location close to Times Square”
Reviews.Author: Cool-son
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights in June on vacation with one other couple. Fantastic location, a block from Times Square. Rooms were on the small side, but sounds like a common theme in New York. We stayed in a deluxe room, which gave us a little more space. We frequented the lounge which was always entertaining. Great value for the location, as we would rather spend money on activities/dining/drinks than an extravegant hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: frogsRossendale
Reviews.Content: what a fab location the staff were great and would stay there again on my next trip

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, clean, good service and great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Biker_Debbie
Reviews.Content: We visited New York in March 2009 from the UK and from start to finish had an excellent experience. After reading the reviews I was unsure of what to expect from the hotel, but I was pleasantly surprised, firstly I was struck by it's amazing location just meters from Times Square, and I continued to be impressed considering the cost of staying at the Edison was half the cost of other hotels close by. Yes the hotel was a bit old fashioned and is all very Art Deco but the location was superb, the staff were helpful and friendly, the beds were comfortable and the room was clean and everything worked. What more can you ask for? I guess it could do with the refurb but then it would become more expensive like others in the area and if we went to New York again I would be more than happy to stay there again in the condition it was in. If you plan to visit New York to see the sights and do some shopping, and just want a hotel that is in a great location and comfortable to sleep in but not necessarily the lap of luxury then the Edison is perfect. It has everything you need with restaurants, broadway and subways close by, I would definitely recommend the Edison and happily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: TinaUnitedKingdom
Reviews.Content: On arrival at our room I was initially disappointed at its size. Although clean, it was small for 2 adults and 1 teenager. However this is New York and all you need is a clean bed after a long day sightseeing. Service at hotel good with friendly, helpful staff. Restaurant good quality with (as usual) large portions. Would definitely return to this hotel as would rather save cash to pay for sightseeing. Hotel is good value for money - excellent location for exploring the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: waketra
Reviews.Content: Location was great,just steps away from Time Square.Staff were very friendly and helpful and the rooms although dated were clean and had all you needed really.Ate in cafe once for breakfast and portions were huge and good vaue.The rum house had great atmosphere with entertainment as well( singer).Only downside was we were near the lifts which were noisy but didnt take long to fall asleep as we were exhausted ever night from the walking.Would definately stay here again

Reviews.Title: “great location, but then again, not so great”
Reviews.Author: lou2188
Reviews.Content: booked this hotel for about £350 each for a four night stay just after christmas (a very reasonable price for us brits at the time really!). went with a bunch of friends, so essentially it was about a bed for the night which is exactly what we got - nothing more but nothing less. sadly, i only have one positive about this hotel though to be honest, if location is what you're after then i can imagine the negatives will almost become irrelevant as you're literally on times square - i've been to new york a few times and honestly, i can't really think of a better place in the city to be based at as it's so easy to get back to wherever you end up in the day, safe to walk around at night and you don't have to go far at all to find eats and things to do. in terms of negatives, there's nothing so bad that i would never stay here again. maybe i'm just a bit picky, but if you're anything like me where a little luxury goes a long way then you'd most definately wish you were staying in the w hotel next door if you check in here - it was quite painful walking past it every morning really! the hotel is still very much in the 1930s, and though i found the lobby to be quite charming in maintaining its historic features, i wasn't so keen to find the rooms in a similar time era - just no! yes, beds were comfortable enough (though a good nights sleep might partly be due to jetlag and lots and lots of walking!), bathroom small but appliances worked fine, and likewise for the ones in the room too. didn't find the size of the room too bad either for a double double room, but generally speaking it wasn't somewhere we wanted to spend a lot of time in or would want to out of choice. didn't use any other facilities the hotel offered and in terms of service, i only saw a bellboy (my friends had stayed a few extra nights so i didn't need to check in!) who literally opened a door for me when i arrived with no greeting, smile or offer to help with my luggage. hmm! similarly when we left at 4 in the morning to catch the flight home - no goodbyes and it's not like they were busy at that sort of time, but i was far too sleepy to care! despite not being the nicest hotel i've ever stayed in before, i wouldn't rule it out completely for a return trip but only at a last resort. essentially going to new york isn't about sitting in your room watching tv (i'd be surprised if you found the time to really!), but even if you're slightly disheartened by hotels that haven't quite made it to the 21st century then you might be better off looking elsewhere. ideal for a romantic getaway? no. good for a bed and nothing more? yes.

Reviews.Title: “great location,great staff,great city”
Reviews.Author: bellissimaWalesU_K_
Reviews.Content: stayed in new york three times,this was the best location.Speedy checkin.Very friendly staff.No extra charges for safe deposite box.The only problem was a hard bed,but when exhausted from all the sightseeing,I managed to sleep.Price was very good for location and the time of year.Would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in the Big Apple”
Reviews.Author: Popsbrew
Reviews.Content: Accomodations were exceptional and staff friendly and helpful. Enhanced the joy of our visit to the city.

Reviews.Title: “If you just want a clean basic room, with a great location this is the one!”
Reviews.Author: Lloyd2709
Reviews.Content: I booked this accomadation online via travelrepublic.co.uk. Arrived at the hotel during late afternoon and recieved a easy and quick check in. I was in room 1130, this was a fair sized room, but clean. What else do you need when you are out all day and night? Although my room view was of a brick wall!! The location of the hotel cannot be faulted, it is right on Broadway and just off Times Sq! Within 30 secs and you are in the middle of times square!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location but a terrible night's sleep”
Reviews.Author: Miratio
Reviews.Content: It is the perfect location! A short hop and a skip and you're in Times Square and the place is buzzing all through the night. Even though it is on a side street off Broadway I never felt unsafe. We arrived in the middle of the night and I was shocked at the crowds that I left my room the second I got in to take my first walk around Times Square! The Good: LOCATION! Perfect. Cool Art Deco classic style to the hotel. Good service! Front desk staff quickly assisted us in making some changes to our hotel stay schedule and the door man was very helpful with our luggage and hailing taxis (even if the drivers were another story!). The Bad: Restaurant was definitely lacking. Luckily when you're that central in NYC you don't need to stay in the hotel. Kind of an older hotel, could use some upgrading! The Ugly: The room was probably the most disappointing part. Quite cramped. But the bed, the bed was awful. I had terrible sleeps! The bed was very lumpy, hard, and all round uncomfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Clean, Art Deco”
Reviews.Author: ubhari
Reviews.Content: This is our second time staying here and the staff are very helpful. Advantages: Great price for 8 days Great location (times square) Friendly staff Clean Disadvantages art deco so not modern looks old and needs a lick of paint and more dusting more power points in rooms and accessible no tea/coffee facilities in rooms

Reviews.Title: “Fine for Family, Friendly Service”
Reviews.Author: BunSmoke
Reviews.Content: The Edison Hotel is a great location for New Years Eve. My young kids felt comfortable. The room was alternately a bit stuffy/hot and chilly, the furnishings a bit tired, but everything was clean and adequate for our needs. The best thing about the hotel was the excellent staff who graciously admitted us to our room at 7:00 am after we had caught the red-eye from the West Coast. We were grateful to get into our room early so we could nap and clean up. The hotel is historic and a decent value. The mural paintings in the lobby are of substantial historical significance and you should take the time to study them.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad.”
Reviews.Author: jlordy20
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a fantastic location, right next to times square. The hotel is fairly clean, and the rooms are of a good size. The staff are a little abrupt and sometimes unhelpful. The price was fair, and I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “take a look”
Reviews.Author: jannieSuffolk
Reviews.Content: Not the best by a long way but so very close too time square it is worth it. I went with my grand-daughter she is 24 what we saved on the hotel we spent on sight seeing and eating. It was no more than 400 hundred yards to the hop on hop off bus. Eating at 11.30 at night and a walk back to the hotel across time square was out of this world. If you want spoilt don't go if you want art -deco give it a whirl. we loved it, the staff were very nice in every way breakfast at the cafe in the hotel quick and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but there is better...”
Reviews.Author: EnglishRichInNorway
Reviews.Content: The hotel rooms near Times Sq seem small and dated. Thought the staff here were not very helpful. Prefered "Stay" hotel but only just.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: TinamarieM
Reviews.Content: Its right smack dab in times square and its got a great Art Deco lobby. Not super modern, this Hotel was fun. George and Gracie Burns lived briefly in the room we stayed in. It has a lot of history, the staff is knowledgeable and the overall vibe was good service, laid back vibe and its rates were better than its more luxurious neighbors. I liked it. I was there before O7 but the date finder didn't go back further. On subsequent trips I stayed with a friends grandmother although I did notice the hotel looking good and I remember it with fondness.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Edison”
Reviews.Author: JakeSmart
Reviews.Content: Very nice 1930s Deco hotel. Rooms quite basic but comfortable. You're unlikely to get a view. Breakfast in the cafe is excellent and inexpensive.

Reviews.Title: “great location for shows”
Reviews.Author: anniepop
Reviews.Content: this is an older hotel with limited amenities but the rooms are comfortable, the bathrooms small, but the location is GREAT--within a block or two of most broadway theaters, Rockefeller Center, and Times Square. Haved stayed here several times and been comfortable. There is a great deli next door for take out and nibbles and an inexpensive restaurant for basic breakfasts or lunches. The doormen are very congenial and knowledgeable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, old and sad hotel.”
Reviews.Author: empty002
Reviews.Content: Ok, if you are not going to spend much of any time in your room, this could be a decent option. I was with friends and we stayed here the night before the Macys Thanksgiving Day Parade. It was next to the route and close to tons of attractions. We weren't spending a lot of time in the room besides changing clothes and sleeping, so it was good for us. It has very old rooms and as things get older, they are generally harder to clean well. The carpets and comforters are just faded and yucky looking. The lamps looked like they were from the 70s. It is pretty depressing to be honest. However, the staff seemed considerate and you are basically in time square. It is a cheap option for the location because the rooms are old and small. I wouldn't only recommend it if you want something with a great location, ok price, and don't care much about the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, but you get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: brianminshew
Reviews.Content: I knew based on other reviews this wasn't going to be the Four Seasons, but for the Money it wasn't a bad deal. We were on the fourth floor and I would definitely recommend going much higher. I normally request away from Elevator and high up, but it slipped my mind. The noise level was unreal and kept me awake until 3am with Sirens and foot traffic below. I'm a light sleeper, but the thin walls, non insulated windows and 'old school' radiator heat didn't give much white noise to drown out the street noise at all. The beds were decent, but the bathroom was stepping back in time for sure. We paid about $200 bucks which is mostly due to the proximity to Times Square. Walk a block and you are there! If you are looking for luxury, this isn't it. If you want a great location and an average hotel, The Edison is a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Edison Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AmandaC3
Reviews.Content: Incredibly central hotel - about 1 minute walk from Times Square. Very close to everything - rooms ok, small bathroom. Maid service very friendly and everything you want close by. Would stay again if the Waldorf isn't in your budget!

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: CourtzV
Reviews.Content: Great location, right on Times Sqaure!! Small rooms but you don't spend much time there! Worth the money due to convenience of location!

Reviews.Title: “Close to Everything”
Reviews.Author: boricua2013
Reviews.Content: LOVED IT ,LOVED IT would definitly stay again !!!!! everyone was very nice and helpful,love the fact that time square was just a step away!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Choose the Edison Hotel for convenience but not for luxury.”
Reviews.Author: lisadevi
Reviews.Content: We got a room at the hotel for one night...New Year's Eve. We actually live in Manhattan, but wanted a room next to Times Square. While the room was clean, it was a bit dingy. There were no attempts to cover up repairs that had been made in the room and the bathtub and tile had black spots. The bed was also tiny and wiry. We could feel every spring in the mattress and my husband's feet hung off the end (he is only 6'2"). The bed was so bad that we almost went home after the New Year's celebration to sleep in our own comfy bed. Oh, this hotel was not New Year's Eve celebration friendly. Other places put much more energy into preparing their hotel and staff for the big event. When I contacted the staff for another room, they were not helpful. They said no other room was available. Meanwhile, when I exited my room to look around, there were plenty of other empty rooms being cleaned. I did not like that the staff made no attempt to accommodate us in another room. As I said before, choose this hotel for convenience, not for luxury

Reviews.Title: “New York”
Reviews.Author: jen_knee43
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay in New York at the Edison Hotel. It was so handy to everything! and the room was great. Would definitely recommend and stay again.

Reviews.Title: “New Year's Eve Week”
Reviews.Author: Alice_LUsa
Reviews.Content: As you can imagine, during the week after Christmas, Times Square is mobbed with tourists and construction preparation for the annual New Year's Eve broadcast. The people watching and location of the hotel are great, for visitors that want to have the Times Square experience without paying a fortune, but the overall accommodations leave something to be desired. The hotel appears to be refurbishing some of its rooms, however. Unfortunately, we ended up in one that has not yet been renovated. On the 19th floor, rooms 1902, 1904, and 1906 have recently been improved, although they are across from the elevator and the walls are thin enough that the elevator bell cannot be ignored. The Edison Hotel is great for the visitor who wants to save some cash and needs somewhere to drop their stuff and get some rest.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Edison”
Reviews.Author: nycfan2
Reviews.Content: Did not like it at all. I would not recommend this hotel, the pictures look better than the actual room.

Reviews.Title: “Fab!”
Reviews.Author: ang28
Reviews.Content: Fab location, great value, and only round the corner from Times Square! Yes, the rooms were a bit tired, but it was very comfortable and clean. We would stay there again. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “high standard”
Reviews.Author: Eva037
Reviews.Content: Last March I've been staying at Edison Hotel. I booked a single room through the last minute travel web site and I must say it was quick and easy, not expensive and safe. Although I travel a lot, It was the first time I booked a room through the net and true I felt a bit insecure about it, but my fears were all gone once I arrived at the hotel. Though it is rated as a 3 stars hotel as far as I concern it is a 4 stars hotel. The business services and facilities were excellent and the location was too good to be true. I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - steps from Times Square!”
Reviews.Author: butterkist4
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in November 2009 and the location is excellent. Steps away from Times Square and Broadway! The hotel itself is dated but the rooms are reasonable and the shower is hot! This is all we needed, as we didn't stay in our room much - only to sleep really. Had no problem with staff - they seemed fine and the concierge was extremely helpful. We had a late flight back on our check out day and we only paid $1 to leave our bags. I wouldn't recommend buying ticket for Empire State, Broadway shows, etc in advance because it's much cheaper when you actually get there! $12 to get the ferry to Staten Island, which included entrance to the Statue and the museum. $47 for a ticket to see Chicago and we had great seats! We ate at Planet Hollywood and several little deli's which were great value. Shopping on 5th Avenue is brilliant, I would recommend a trip to Abercrombie and Tiffany's. Even if you don't buy anything, the experience is brilliant. Just remember to budget for tips because you are expected to tip everywhere. Hope this helps!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but poor in every other way”
Reviews.Author: PhilNorfolk
Reviews.Content: There are lots of hotels in and around Times Square - and as a frequent visitor to NY, I've stayed in many of them. Back in the 90s, the Edison was well managed and a great place to stay, so when I saw a low priced special for last weekend, I grabbed it. I will not make the same mistake again. Besides surly staff, absent luggage check staff, and a "no we can't" attitude, the bathroom was 92 degrees, and the room was in the mid 80s (it was about 35 outside). When I checked in, I asked for a room not near the elevators - and I was assured this it was not. In relaity, it was directly across from the elevators - there wasn't a room closer! The room wasn't ready, but the charged to check luggage until it was ready. No coffee maker, no free wifi (many hotels in Times Square offer these plus free cont. bkfst).

Reviews.Title: “The Pits...........”
Reviews.Author: chs231chs
Reviews.Content: Lousy hotel--awful staff--stay away from unless you do not care about the money you spend! Heat did not work and when reported to staff they could care less. There were no extra outlets to plug cell phone into.

Reviews.Title: “You're 10 metres away from Times Square !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: matty077
Reviews.Content: Couldn't believe how close we were to Times Square/shops/theatres.Twin room was tidy and warm,beds comfortable.Sheets old but clean. Good, powerful shower,clean towels changed daily and maid was so friendly. Rest of hotel staff, with the exception of one man on reception, were also friendly and helpful. The fact that we had to show a room pass to security before entering the lifts was very reassuring. Cafe Edison serves excellent breakfasts to start the day. Very busy but we were found seats almost immediately each day. So if you need a place to sleep and you aren't intending to stay in your room 24/7 while you're in NY, then the Edison is the place to stay. Can also recommend Danny's Deli next door. p.s. didn't find a single bed-bug.The earlier reviews were quite off-putting so we were expecting the worst but were pleasantly surprised.All in all, you get what you pay for and I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel,no problems whatsoever”
Reviews.Author: icf
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from nov 20th-24th,decor and rooms a little dated but we found everything clean,check in was quick and found the front desk staff friendly at all times, Enjoyed the rum lounge pub and the cafe edison,we woild have no problems staying here again!!

Reviews.Title: “You Get What You Pay For!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: worz48
Reviews.Content: Yes this hotel could do with some updating, but if you want better then pay more. The location was great, the staff we found to be very helpful and it was a great idea that you had to show your room key before you entered the lifts to stop non guests entering the floors of the hotel. We could not fault the room apart from it beng very warm and there was definatley no bedbugs!!!!!!! If you want a great basic hotel with a great location then this is it and ignore all the other bad reviews - We just don't know what people expect. We would return to this hotel if we went to New York again.

Reviews.Title: “close the place!”
Reviews.Author: westone31
Reviews.Content: As usual I should have taken the advice of other trip advisors, this hotel should be avoided, yes the location is good, however its not just the fact that the rooms are old fashioned and dated and horrible its the staff who are the real killers..... I have honestly never come across ruder people in my life - I stayed at Fitzpatricks before, this year i was been more price concious as a was doing a few cities...on checking in I asked the receptionist if everything was closed for thanksgiving, i was told by her "if I wanted that kind of information i should ask the porter, I'm not paid to deal with tourist queries!"Guests are "hassled" to and from the elavtor for ID , even if you pop down to the deli for a bottle of water. The restaurant is the nearest thing to a factory canteen that I've come across - staff are almost as rude as reception - food was thrown at you, I would suggest that anyone traveling to this hotel should re-consider you save nothing in the long run.....

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location hotel quite adequate for our needs”
Reviews.Author: ialsolikeholidays
Reviews.Content: Hotel location couldnt have been better, a little shabbier than when i stayed there 6 years ago but clean and quite satisfactory for the amount of time we needed to be in the hotel and would definately stay there again. Would also recommend Dannys deli a couple of doors away.

Reviews.Title: “Location location location”
Reviews.Author: doilikeholidays
Reviews.Content: Just off Times Square, walkable to many attractions. Danny's deli next door but one great for breakfast - looked nothing from the outside but frequented by New Yorks finest. Reception staff efficient and helpful. Rooms of a different era but you get what you pay for and basically you just need a bed for the night. Could definitely do with a makeover but that would increase the prices. Lots of good bars and restaurants within walking distance. Can recommend the Pig and Whistle. Blue Fin on the dear side. No sign of the infamous bed bugs!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION!!!”
Reviews.Author: kikirias
Reviews.Content: The hotel was located in the heart of Times Square, within walking distance to everything, it was clean, the staff was nice, we had no problems and no complains, we felt safe walking around past midnight and everything was litterally steps away, we saw so much and did so many activities, the hop on/hop off bus was barely a minute away and we took advantage of every moment we had there...Not the most luxurious hotel there, but when your intentions are to hit the road early and go back very late, then it was just perfect!!!

Reviews.Title: “Edison Hotel New York”
Reviews.Author: RoseB3
Reviews.Content: Its clean in the City and is easy to get to Places every one once to see Hotel arranges also trips

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs”
Reviews.Author: eimalibu
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in the Edison Hotel for two nights and upon checking out of the hotel I started to notice red welts appearing on my legs. This gradually increased in number and were a result of bed bugs in the hotel. Do not stay here as I have since researched this problem and alot of others have complained of the same problem.

Reviews.Title: “The worst of the worst, horrible, photos very deceiving!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: WTRAVELER_9
Reviews.Content: The worst of the worst, quoted one price, charged another, quoted price for parking, charged another, had to pay for ice, asked for a garbage bag since house cleaning didn't empty the trash cans and we had water bottles ect, lined up all over and was told no, don't worry about it, one door man was very rude, one doorman was very nice. The room was dirty and dusty, I was afraid to take a bath, just couldn't make myself sit in the tub, did take a shower, used a towel in tub to stand on, but the water pressure was great. The rooms are very small, furniture very old and in bad shape, one electrical outlet for charging cell phones, sheets did not fit the beds, beds did not fit the frames, room smelled damp, musty, NO LOCKS on the bathroom door, key cards needed to be used at least twice, first time never worked. NEVER AGAIN!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location & great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: angeandgazbrumuk
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is absolutely fantastic, when we arrived it was dark and we drove through all of the lights at Times square and all i can say is WOW. The hotel is literally on Times square so the location is great. The hotel room was very small with a bed and tv and bathroom but to be honest we hardly spent any time in the hotel apart from sleeping which was more than comfortable. on our last day the hotel stored our luggage for us which cost 50cents per bag so nothing really and there is a taxi rank right outside of the hotel so no problems getting taxis. we mostly walked around the city and i can only advise people to wear comfortable shoes - i wore ugg boots yet my feet were aching so much after day 2. on our 1st day we went to top of the rock and the views were amazing, we never got round to going up the empire state so i cannot advise which was better but top of the rock was definately amazing. we used the subways which were good, a little confusing but as long as you have maps you are ok, i couldnt have been without my map of new york so i would recommend getting one as when you come out from the subway it can be a little confusing as to where you are. we didn't visit ellis island but we did take the staten island ferry which is free which goes right past the statue of liberty so we got plenty of photos of her. i would thoroughly recommend new york we had a brilliant time but very very tireing but panic not there is a starbucks on pretty much every street!!!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel I have ever stay in!!!! Avoid at all costs!!!”
Reviews.Author: giantnrs
Reviews.Content: This the the absolute worst hotel I have stay in (and I have stay in a lot of hotels). I must admit that the entrance had a very nice art-deco feel to it. Sad to say it all changed when I got to my room....The room was small and old....The towels still had hair in them and had a funny smell!!!!! No doubt the location was great but I will never stay at this hotel ever again. I was attracted to the art-deco description on the website but never again...

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Hotel Could Use Renovation”
Reviews.Author: NathanJ4
Reviews.Content: I would deffo recommend this hotel to anyone who doesn't need Hilton or Marriot standards. The hotel is in an awesome location, just around the corner from Times Square with entrances in 46th & 47th. I was there with my parents, my dad ran the Marathon. After the first night (thursday-friday) they went to book a room in the Marriott across the street. Problem was the poor window quality, causing my dad to wake up several times a night. And honestly, they are really picky when it comes to hotels. The rest of the stay, I was thus alone in a room with two double beds, which made it obviously very spacious. The staff of the hotel was very friendly. I left my cell phone, money and laptop on my bed and when I came back, nothing was missing (yes, I think that is something worth mentioning!). The only remark is that everything is quite old. It deffo needs some renovation. The shower wasn't really good, the beds were 'OK' and the doors inside the building were pretty noisy. And of course the windows don't really let you get away from the busy Times Square traffic. Nevertheless, I had a very pleasant stay in this wonderful hotel and I will go back to this hotel for sure! I would recommend to anyone who doesn't mind a bit of noise and a minimum of bathroom luxury in exchange for the awesome location!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location but no kettle!?!?”
Reviews.Author: m_murphy81
Reviews.Content: Firstly, what an excellent location for a 1st trip to New York. It is right in the heart of all the action. The rooms are very basic which was fine as i wasn't planning on spending my time in NY in the room. One grumble i do have is that there are no tea making facilities which is essential when you have been out sight seeing all. Thank god for Starbucks which is on the corner. Staff were all very friendly and willing to help out in any way. The hotel did feel very oldie worldy but you only had to step out the door to be reminded of where you were. I would definately stay at the Hotel Edison again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, tiny rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Kensay76
Reviews.Content: I typically stay either at the Marriott (across the street from the Edison) or the Double Tree at Times Square, however, I was given a special discount for this particular business trip, so I thought i'd try something new! Well, it's no Marriott or Double Tree for sure... however, it's also not the price of those either... it's small rooms, no amenities in the hotel that I could see and the pipes in the bathroom made this knocking sound periodically through the night that was, quite honestly, really creepy, gave the illusion of being haunted since this is an older hotel! haha Anyhow, if you're budget is tight and you just need a place to lay your head at night, then maybe this one is for you.. if you require any luxury, then stay away from here. It's a great place for those who are just there to check out New York and be tourists... as a businessman who travels to NYC frequently, well, next time i'll be back at the Marriott!

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs & Scabies!”
Reviews.Author: ATA9850
Reviews.Content: i stayed at the edison for 3 days for a business trip in September 2009. I came back with scabies & bed bugs. i have been going through hell! PLEASE DO NOT STAY HERE! you will regret it!

Reviews.Title: “No Water? Gee Thanks”
Reviews.Author: talazia
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a show in NYC for one night there - the night they shut off the water from 11-6am. Just a simple apology, and no bottled water available for guests in the lobby. If you are going to shut off bathroom facilities, you should provide your guests with vouchers for another hotel or some other amenity. The rooms were poor, the bedding old and tired, and the walls were way too thin (we could hear everything our neighbors did). The location is good, but that's about all.

Reviews.Title: “Average accommodation - needs updating”
Reviews.Author: mandaJ
Reviews.Content: This was the second time I have stayed at the Edison, the first visit being back in 2001. Aside from the excellent location (which obviously hasn't changed) this hotel is in need of an update. The room I stayed in this time with my daughter was very small and had the two smallest twin beds I have ever seen. The matresses were old and the bedding looked like it had been washed every day since 2001. The room was dusty but OK for the limited time we spent in it. The air conditioning was rather noisy and the bathroom was very small. There wasn't a safe in the room, although we could leave our money and other valuables in the hotel safe in the lobby. There was no view whatsoever from the small window and the carpet was threadbare in places. On a plus side, the hotel is in a fabulous location just off Times Square and was convenient for Broadway and lots of restaurants and shops. If you just want somewhere that's OK to sleep in without any frills, the Edison will be fine, but if you are after a treat and abit more luxury, I suggest you go elsewhere. The Intercontinental Barclay in Murray Hill was fabulous when I stayed there in 2007.

Reviews.Title: “Art Deco Style Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GlobetravellerLeeds
Reviews.Content: We arrived but as usual had to wait for our room. After a long flight this is difficult but expected. The room was clean and comfortable not much space but this is the norm for New York City . The hotel is rather dated but still charming. The public spaces were great with the art deco lounge. This hotel is central in the middle of Broadway so very exciting. The staff were friendly and helpful. We loved New Yorkers, chatty friendly people.On the whole A great stay.

Reviews.Title: “WOULD RETURN, BUT......”
Reviews.Author: KatePerth
Reviews.Content: It was with a little trepidation that I booked the Edison Hotel as was only rated as 2 1/2 star in one of the travel brochures I was using. Accommodation in New York was so expensive at the time we were visiting and the Edison was coming in at a good rate, so I went ahead and booked it. Reception staff are a little surly as some of the other reviews have stated and do not greet you with a smile or friendly manner and this is something I think Management needs to address. We were pleasantly surprised at our room - had booked a room with 2 double beds - and it was much roomier than I expected, tastefully furnished and very clean. Sure, the bathroom was small, but there was ample hot water and again, very clean with change of towels each day etc. We were at the hotel for 4 nights and situated on the third floor at the back of the hotel...can't quite remember the room #, but think it was 323 or 333. The first night we were so tired from the flight, we slept soundly. Second night, we became aware of the air conditioning fans outside our window...were a little noisy but bearable. By the 4th night, it was unbelievable...the noise was incredible. We called front desk who told us they had nowhere to move us to as the hotel was fully booked and they would send some Engineers up to look at the problem. Two Engineers came up and were horrified at the noise emanating from these fans. They managed to decrease the noise considerably and it was bearable for us to sleep - luckily we had earplugs with us- and the hotel advised they would halve the room rate for that night. The bar at the hotel was excellent as was the small cafe there which we attended one morning for breakfast. The souvenir shop was good value with a great range of small gifts. The staff on the Concierge & Transportation Desks were excellent, giving us instructions on finding the closest Catholic Church and organizing transport to Brooklyn Cruise Terminal where we were catching a cruise from. The location is second to none and I would return to the Edison but would be insistent on not being accommodated in a room on the third floor at the back near the air conditioning fans.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than I expected”
Reviews.Author: dbruening
Reviews.Content: Yes its older, the showers have five handles, and the rooms are odd shapes, after all it was built as an aparatment and converted. BUT, the rooms were pretty large, the hallways are double a typical hotel, the staff VERY helpful and the location-well I don't know how you couldbe better placed inthe city-about 50 yards from Times square and pretty much right in the Theater District. We got two real double beds and a cot. Three windows, and we did overlook the alley and had no problems whatsoeverever with noise. Very reasonable prices especially since we did no have lots of time to book ahead. Did not try the restaurants or the bar. Will absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to visit again!”
Reviews.Author: jannamy
Reviews.Content: Great location; safe; clean facilities; excellent, knowledgeable staff. Walking distance to theaters, museums, Central Park and our favorite restaurant - Tony Dinapoli's. Plus, they offer great deals through their website (and honor those deals after booking) Good breakfasts at the Cafe Edison; efficient, fast service; reasonable prices.

Reviews.Title: “stay away at all cost! worse hotel experience ever!!”
Reviews.Author: beckiToronto_Canada
Reviews.Content: We had the misfortune of staying at the Edison in October, 2009. First, the hotel is nothing like the web site suggests. Not even close. Its much smaller, shabby looking, with a cold and unfriendly atmosphere. I am a frequent traveler and have never seen the kind of attitude the reception staff had. They were rude, never said please, thank you or smiled. They barked short little answers to any questions we had. They would not look up when a guest approached the desk but waited until we said, excuse me……. The security “person” who was in front of the elevators always seemed to be more interested in talking to someone than checking out who was coming or going. And when he actually decided to check who was coming, he too would bark that he wanted to see the hotel key. I have never seen anything like this. No hotel should ever allow staff to behave this way to guests. Guests pay for the privilege of staying at these hotels. The staff of the Edison behaved as though they were bestowing a favor upon us by allowing us to be at the hotel. It was a disgusting experience. I did not see anyone tip any staff except the bellboys who were truly decent and courteous. No gifts or tips were offered to any front desk staff. I did not wonder why. The rooms were OK, but nothing spectacular and nothing like in the website. Cleanliness was not on the top of the list. Carpets had a line of stains, like wine or blood, the bathroom was so small, mold on the tiles in the tub, bathroom med cabinet was missing one mirror, the inner shelf which was constantly visible was rusted and disgusting. There was a very poor job of caulking around the tub, a partial caulking around the base of the sink – there was a gaping hole there. Everything in that bathroom looked in disarray, old and unattended. And we got the renovated room! I can only imagine what the rest of the rooms looked like. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone, ever. I would certainly not attend this hotel, even for a meal. But the diner is a completely different story. Stay away from there too. This was the worst hotel experience I have ever endured. Stay away from the Edison. There are many other nice hotels where staff is friendly, courteous and make you feel welcomed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - A Taste of What New York Is All About”
Reviews.Author: CanadaMoe
Reviews.Content: This is the 3rd time we have stayed at the Edison and cannot wait to return to New York. After a day hiking all over the city, shopping, sight seeing and doing tours we find the location so convenient and central to all the theatres. Would recommend this hotel to any of our friends and feel confident that we didn't steer them wrong. Our only complaint were the outside speakers at the piano bar that were a bit noisey and we were on the 7th floor!

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay if you're coming to see the sights in NYC”
Reviews.Author: EfiWarsh
Reviews.Content: I don't understand the negative reviews of the Edison on this site. My daughter and I stayed eight nights in October, and would recommend it highly. Yes, it's not the newest hotel in NYC, but it just might be the cleanest. The staff is great, and the location is perfect for tourists. The room was actually larger than I expected. This is a great place to stay if you're coming to see the sights in NYC. Starbucks right across the street. Security at the elevators to check room keys. That's important. The room was spacious, by New York standards, and clean, with the bed linen and towels being changed every day. I never saw any kind of bug. The shower was excellent, and always plenty of hot water. Subway a minute walk… The location can't be beat. If I were to ever return to NY...I would definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “New York”
Reviews.Author: JennaR1
Reviews.Content: fantastic location, in the heart of manhattan with everything you need around you & more. very comfortable, clean, tidy & all staff were very helpful at all times, would definately go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Phoebe4912
Reviews.Content: Was my first time in New York City. The Edison Hotel is about 2 minutes from the main attractions of Times Square and a fabulous location, right in the heart of it all. Lovely hotel, staff not overly friendly but I didnt go to New York to start a friendship with the door staff and reception staff, so it was adequate for our needs. There are safe deposit facilities in reception and the room was a good size and comfortable and clean. We didnt use the facilities as such, we just used the hotel for a base and to sleep so its ideal for this. Definitely would visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: kingwizard
Reviews.Content: Excellent location - just off broadway right in the heart of the theatre district. The staff were friendly and helpful, gave us information about tours and booked a tour for us and organised us a shuttle to the airport. Reasonably priced especially considering the location. Enjoyed our stay in New York and in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location is superb”
Reviews.Author: Kiwiabroad60
Reviews.Content: In the tourist heart of New York, hotel is now a bit tired but the staff and security were first rate.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location - just a few steps from Time Square and subway stations”
Reviews.Author: Flummie
Reviews.Content: Good place to stay at because of its location. It was clean and it wasn't as noisy as we expected it to be. We would definitly stay there again. Internet isn't free, but there were other free hot spots around so it was possible for us to use the internet directly from our room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: lindylou007
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in September. Our room was clean and large for the centre of New York and we thought very good value for money. The location, just steps from Times Square and all the theatres, is excellent. Had no bad experiences with front desk and Cafe Edison is very convenient for a quick inexpensive breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service at Hotel Edison”
Reviews.Author: RIBMD
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Hotel Edison w/ reservation number on printout. The front desk person checked on his computer and had no record of us. He said our reservation number was not like the typical Hotel reservation number and the printout did not look like their usual reservation receipt. he acknowledged that the logo was correct, but the rest of the receipt seemed like a fake to him. he asked where we'd made the reservation -- i'd booked the hotel via the Hotel Edison web site (just to avoid this type of problem). He seemd disdainful of our problems. My husband independently phoned the Hotel, spoke w/reservation desk and the clerk said we did have a reservation there. Eventually we were given a room there. The lobby area was always FILLED w/ guests w/suitcases. Huge delay to leave luggage for a few hours; we eventually left luggage w/the porter who would say to people: "here's your receipt, your luggage won't be here when you get back" as a joke? Hotel Edison was cheaper than anything else we saw, but we will never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: 69boss302
Reviews.Content: I don't understand the negative reviews of the Edison on this site. My wife and I stayed five nights in June, and would recommend it highly. Yes, it's not the newest hotel in NYC, but it just might be the cleanest. The staff is great, and the location is perfect for tourists. We got a great deal ($159/nt with breakfast included in the cafe). The room was actually larger than I expected. Come on folks. Nothing's perfect, and everyone has a bad day. This is a great place to stay if you're coming to see the sights in NYC. If you want to stay in bed all day with room service and fluffy down comforters, go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Just the place for NYC (location location location)”
Reviews.Author: AnatS
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very basic but good and has a great location and that all that matters when you travel to NY (unless you're on your honeymoon...) I would definitely go back to it on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: zazoos
Reviews.Content: Beautiful lobby to wait for whatever, lots of nice seating. Fun place to stay. Starbucks right across the street. Security at the elevators to check room keys. That's important. Art deco 1920s atmosphere and decor. Such a great value for being in Times Square. I stay here when I go to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “OK for tourist stay”
Reviews.Author: dutch_tulips08
Reviews.Content: Hotel lobby looks fine, but once upstairs everything is old and worn down. However clean but needs to be painted and redecorated. Blankets that go way back somewhere in the last century, not enough room for all bathroom stuff (and we ladies do carry a lot) but still OK for 4 Dutch friends. Having been in Marriott Marquis (May 2008) and Salisbury hotel (May 2009), this is certainly not the best, to say the least, but still ok for tourist visit as long as you spend most of the time outside.... Reception desk, concierge and staff at transportation desk, security all polite and friendly at all times, which cannot be said about personnel taking care of our luggage in the storage room on our day of departury: very unfriendly, not polite and sorry to say: rude. Restaurant in het hotel ok for breakfast but if you reallly want to have a good time: go to Junior's just around the corner from Marriott Marquis hotel. Awesome place to be (West 45th between Broadway and 8th Ave). Real American quality food with perfect service and outstanding choice of dishes. This is the place to be!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Edison”
Reviews.Author: newfgal
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a wonderful 5 night stay at the Edison. I had some reservations due to some negative reviews, but my mind was quickly put at ease once we checked in and got settled in our room. The front desk staff were very accomodating and curtious....they obliged all our requests without hesitation.(We reserved 2 rooms and were placed close together....we also wanted a refridgerator, and got it with no problem.) Cleanliness is the most important factor for me when staying anywhere. The Edison's housekeeping service cleaned our room daily, and changed the linens on our beds daily as well. When you visit NY, most people spend very little time in their hotel room anyway......there is too much to see and do to spend all day in a hotel room. I felt very safe there as well.....no one was allowed in the elevators without a room key..and they were very strict with this...It made us feel very secure. There is a lovely cafe in the lobby and a wonderful Deli next door for quick snacks. Unfortunately there was no coffe perk in the room, but we got our morning fix at Danny's Deli.The location can't be beat. If I were to ever return to NY...I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mickey143143
Reviews.Content: I was a little leary after reading some of the reviews here, but this is a good place to stay. It is in a great location, steps from Times Square. The hotel is old, but the rooms are clean. They are small but to be expected in NYC. The staff was pleasant and helpful. If you want to stay right in Times Square and don't want to spend a lot of money this is the place to stay. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not very nice, but great location to Times Square”
Reviews.Author: Easygoing01
Reviews.Content: Not very nice, felt cheap and old and I felt dirty in the room. Pillows were horrible, they must have been many years old. Sheets were scratchy and old and discolored. Mattress was pathetic, that wasnt a mattress. Its what you would put on a futon. Shampoo & soap were terrible. Thank God I bought my own with me. Towels scratched your back for you, you didnt need to use your hands. Hair from staff or prior guests everywhere, what a turn off. I am not that picky of a person but this was the big joke the whole weekend. We had to laugh at it and tease to try and not to let it bother us. We didnt stay in the room much so that was helpful. But one night we slept fully dressed just because it felt dirty. The location is the only thing good to say. You walk out your door and Times Square was there, that was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic- Location , Price, and Accomadation”
Reviews.Author: mickeym_7
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Edison from 10th -14th September 09. After reading the reviews on this hotel the only thing that I was concerened about was the attitude of the staff but that turned out to be no concern at all. Upon check in the reception were nothing but pleasent, the concierge did not approach us to take luggage or demand that we used them, the rooms were cleaned daily and the on duty lobby staff were helpful. So to get down to the nitty gritty all I can say is that the rooms were clean on arrival and were attended daily, if you hang your dirty towels up they will not be relaced -so put them on bathroom floor when used and they will be replaced, There was hardly any street noise to be heard once inside the room so had a peaceful nights sleep - so raring to go next day ! The lobby clerk will not let you access the lifts to your room if you do not have a room key so keep it handy ( I found this comforting as we were 5 females and thought this to be a great security asset). The location is second to none - about 20 yards from Times Square and the tickets booth for theatre tickets. We had a fantastic trip to New York and would stay in this hotel again without hesitation. We paid $310 per night for a combo room for the 5 of us and found this a fantastic price , the only thng to be aware of is that there is 4 different types of taxes to be added to your room bill per night so keep a little extra aside to pay for this. The combo room was 2 inter-connecting rooms that shared 1 bathroom, as there were 5 of us we requested a rollaway bed for the 5th person as it was 1 double bed per room , the second room without the bathroom had small sitting area there so you could relax. There is a deli just outside the hotel called Danny's that has a fantastic range of hot and cold food that you can either take up to your room or eat in the Deli ( there were some smokers in my group so each morning as they had the morning fix they would bring coffee and b/fast back with them ) On the whole a fantastic place to put your head down while visiting the City that never sleeps. No complaints at all

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: tartan20
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Edison once before, so knew what to expect. Thankfully the stay was no worse than the last time ( 5 yrs ago). As has been said many times before on Tripadvisor, if you want to stay somewhere nice in midtown you need to pay through the nose for it. Even then, the rooms are usually small and the staff are not very friendly. (friend of mine paid $350 per night in the Hudson, lovely room but no room to swing a cat). Thats why the Edison is pretty good for the location, just off Times Square. The room we were in was a standard twin, it didn't have a view except across onto the wall of the building next door and yes the room could of used some modernising. The bathroom especially was dated but the shower, although antiquated, had a really good pressure and there was never a shortage of hot water regardless of the time of day. I've stayed in many luxury hotels where they spend thousands on fancy bathrooms but can't manage to produce hot water when you actually want it. Therefore, i'd rather have a hot shower in an old bathroom than a cold shower in a brand new one!! The tiredness of the decor and furnishings shouldn't be mistaken for dirtyness - the room was actually very clean - I dropped something down behind the dresser the TV sat on and when I pulled it out to get the item back, I expected to find the usual layer of dust from the chamber maid not cleaning the "out of sight" areas, however the skirting and carpet were both dust free so obviously the room had been given a thorough cleaning recently. The sheets were changed once during our four night stay and the towels were changed daily, so can't complain about that. The only thing we did notice is that either it was the room or the hotel, but the power seemed to drop off for a fraction of a second from time to time - for example the radio alarm reset itself and I had to re-programme the time. Also, the TV flickered a few times and reset itself back onto the Hotel Welcome Channel. It wasn't an issue (unless you had set the alarm for your wake up call) and it wasn't really annoying, just peculiar. Also, since I first stayed there, I would say the staff are definately politer than before, with the exception of the girls on the concierge and transport desks - they were both as good as hopeless and needed some basic training in customer service. The security guys that check you have your keycard before getting into the lifts (especially at night), were all very friendly and were always chatty about what you'd been doing that day / night. All in all, anywhere else in the world i'd say this hotel is overpriced and not worth it, but unfortunately as everywhere in New York is overpriced, I would say for the location and the general amenities in the hotel then this hotel is definately not bad value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Near everything”
Reviews.Author: pinkycats
Reviews.Content: The Edison ,while not a Luxury hotel is just fine for the price. New York can be an expensive city! I had a Queen Suite and it was kept clean and fresh. It's steps from Times Square where I enjoyed my coffee on the new pedestrian walkway on Broadway. Free internet would have been ideal ( there is a surcharge)

Reviews.Title: “Good staff, Better value, Best location”
Reviews.Author: Becke13
Reviews.Content: We had a clean and fairly large room at a good price, close to everything like bars, crowd, food, shops, shows and transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Awful room!”
Reviews.Author: Tezgeo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of a split location holiday, after spending 7 nights in The Bellagio in Las Vegas arriving in this hotel was a bit of a shock!!! It looks nothing from the street, then you walk into the lobby which is actually quite a nice 1920's style area but when we saw our room i wanted to cry!!! It was Awful! It felt dirty, the view from the window was of a wall, bathroom was horrible, decor was horrible!! We went straight to nearby hotels to look for an alternative room but after hearing prices we decided it was only a couple of nights and we wouldn't be spending much time in the room so we would grin and bare it!! Only good side was you are right in the heart of Times square!

Reviews.Title: “Superb location -- Full of European charter bus folks and tired furnishings”
Reviews.Author: libertyva9
Reviews.Content: This is probably one of the best central locations in NYC. You can walk out the front door and be in Times Square in one minute. This property is owned by an Eastern European (Polish family, I believe) and is one of the few remaining family-owned properties in NYC. I expect one of the big chains will purchase it in time. Due to the Eastern European influence, the hotel attracts loads of Europeans. The hotel is Art Deco and built in the 1920's or 30's. There is always renovation going on and, if you're very lucky, will get a newly-renovated room. If not, you will get something that looks tired and dated. Even with the renovations, the bathrooms still look old and they did nothing to them. The tile grout in the floor and shower is often dirty and moldy. If you plan on doing nothing but using this as a staging area, it's a great price. If you're looking for luxury and location, find another hotel. It was seen in one episode of Seinfeld and many theatre producers, writers, NYC, and locals frequent the downstairs cafe. Just don't get on a floor where the charter folks are or you will never get sleep. We have had a mouse in our room on two occasions in the last six years. We have not seen roaches, but have heard recent tales of bed bugs from others. It's always a good idea to check mattresses and headboards for bb signs before unpacking your bags. You might need to change rooms if there is an infestation. Outside noise goes 24 hours. You are in the heart of NYC with ambulances, fire trucks, police sirens, garbage trucks, etc. Learn to live with it and you will be fine. Not a cookie cutter hotel as all rooms have different configurations.

Reviews.Title: “Careful--Bedbugs Galore”
Reviews.Author: DCReviewer4
Reviews.Content: After our first night at the Edison, I woke up early in the morning with several bedbug bites--including two on my face that sparked a reaction so severe I had to go to the ER--and even saw one of them crawling on my shirt. YIKES! Hotel management didn't seem the least bit surprised and did not offer an apology, although at my request they did comp us the night and paid to have my clothing dry cleaned in order to kill any remaining bugs. We couldn't find a different hotel to stay in though, so changed rooms (they upgraded us). No more bites after that, but I did sleep in sweatpants, a sweatshirt, and with the light on. We found out later that the hotel usually gets 2-3 complaints a week about bedbugs, even though they use an exterminator, etc. Clearly they are infested. I'll never stay there again, although my boyfriend--who is impervious to insect bites in general and was fine during our visit--has stayed there several times before this and says he will return. He likes the low cost, location, and bar in the lobby : ) Lovely concierge, security officers and doorman.

Reviews.Title: “Edison Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KatyaKatya
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Edison Times Sqaure hotel for a lonf weekend. The location is really amazing, a walking distance from everything that matters. The rooms are fairly simple, no frills, though I guess thats the reason it's affordable. I got the lowest price through last minute travel for that weekend. all in all, it was good, yet simple.

Reviews.Title: “Not Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Soph1981
Reviews.Content: Although this hotel was not as bad as I thought it would be I would not recommend it to any of my family or friends. Pros: 1 - Room size was very good by New York standards. 2 - Our bedding was changed daily and towels replenished. 3 - Staff, with the exception of the female concierge (I don't think she is capably of a smile!) I found all staff members to be very friendly and helpful. 4 - The shower was powerful and we always had plenty hot water - although in the evening it did take about 5mins to come through. Cons: 1 - The bedding may have been changed daily but our carpet was not hoovered once (any we were there for 5 nights) 2 - The TV didn't work properly, when switched on it would stay on for about 5mins then the lose signal and not come on again for up to 20mins - this was worse at night than in the morning. 3 - The decor of the room was terrible, there is a leaflet in reception showing rooms but our room was nothing like the pictures and looked as though it had not been decorated since the hotel was built. The corridors reminded me and my husband of the hotel in The Shinning and if a small boy on a bike or creepy looking twin girls appeared in front of us we wouldn't have been surprised! 4 - The only electrical socket int he room we could use was hanging off the wall and the only way we could get the power to flow was to put the plug into the socket and then push our suitcase in front to keep the plug and socket in place. 5 - The bathroom (although clean) had no form of ventilation meaning it filled with steam immediately, if you kept the door open the bedroom would get steamy even with the air conditioning unit at full power. 6 - No tea or coffee making facilities Overall the hotel was fine for all the time we were in it but you dont want to be dreading going back to your hotel after a long day in the city. If you dont care what your hotel looks like and dont mind wondering when the last time your room was cleaned then this place will be fine otherwise DONT STAY HERE. NYC recommendations I can pass on are: Danny's deli next to Edison is fine for breakfast and it was great for a cup of tea before heading back to the hotel. Restaurants/bars: Buddakan - al a carte Chinese food - excellent Dallas BBQ (time square) - Texas size drinks, huge portions and cheap prices - a great choice. Cafe Cluny (Greenwich Village) - we found this place while looking for somewhere else and glad we chose to eat there as it was a lovely little place Tao & Pastis - good cocktails Vento - downstairs bar Gansevoort Hotel - rooftop bar Blue Fin (Time Square) - good drinks and excellent for breakfast. Top of the Rock was also excellent, we did Empire State last time but I think TOTR has the edge.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away - bed bugs!!”
Reviews.Author: uraptor
Reviews.Content: My friend had bites all over her body. It was obvious that the hotel has plenty of experience dealing with bed bugs. They gave us a refund but that doesn't compensate for the hassle and annoyance

Reviews.Title: “good for the money”
Reviews.Author: Chicago1996
Reviews.Content: Conveniently located, not expensive for New York. I would advise to bring your own bedding sheets if you can. Theirs appeared to match the hotel age. The good and cheap food one can find next door at small, but clean Dannies place. Food was better than in hotel café. Two days bus tours (4 loops) for 54$ paid off quickly for itself.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Oasis”
Reviews.Author: monkeytrashman
Reviews.Content: My traveling companion had stayed at The Edison a few times. So for this trip I took her at her word that this was the place to stay. She was so right. The price was right. The room, though a bit worn, was large and clean. The hotel is used mostly by Europeans, but we felt right at home. It the heart of the theater district we were a very short walk from most shows, which was are main reason for being there. There are places to eat right on the premises.The Edison Cafe, great for breakfast and lunch. And the Sophia. As for The Sophia, the food was fine, but there are many other more friendly places to eat. Also The Rum bar was a wonderful place to relax and listen to the lounge singer. We had two double beds and were quite comfortable. Don't expect fancy furnishings or a large bathroom. And things look a bit worn. But for the money.... and location,this a clean wonderful place.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located hotel with style although somewhat outdated; quite expensive.”
Reviews.Author: PPRubens
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is superb. Right around the corner of Times Square. The rooms are OK. If you have a room at the back, the noise of the airco of the other rooms is louder then the traffic noise. For breakfast, go to Starbucks and have breakfast on Times Square or go to Juniors' Bakery, one block from the hotel. Communication with the hotel staff through e-mail doesn't work. They simply ignore your mails, and even though we received a confirmation of the booking thorugh Internet, the reservation was not made when we arrived.

Reviews.Title: “A place to sleep”
Reviews.Author: laughingsheep
Reviews.Content: Location An indisputable fact about the Edison Hotel is that it is centrally located for tourists. Its only a few steps to the lights of Times Square and the TKTS booth selling discounted theatre tickets for that day. It's a few blocks from a subway station, so we found it handier to walk to it when we arrived at Penn station, but it was a manageable 10-15 mins with luggage in tow. All the large shops are within an easy walk and there are some good quality, reasonably priced restaurants in the area, despite being bang in the middle of a tourist trap. Rooms New York is an expensive place to stay, and Midtown is the worst as you are paying for location, but £125 a night for this place was depressing, all the more so as this was a good rate. The positives are that the room was a reasonable size but we had a corner room, which made ours bigger than the average, others we glimpsed looked pokey. The bed was reasonably comfortable and the main room appeared to be clean. However, the carpet had seen better days, it was old, worn and poorly fitted (creased at the edges and coming away from the skirting boards in places). The room was also very noisy - we were on the 16th floor and the noise level from outside would have made you think the windows were open, although they were closed with the curtains drawn! This was particularly unfortunate as on the first night of our stay road works where taking place on the street outside. The bathroom was small, old and had been repeatedly and poorly patched up (e.g. a pipe that had been painted and subsequently started peeling was wrapped in a 'decorative' wire mesh). On first inspection, the bath appeared to be exceptionally dirty around the plug hole. Inspection showed that the marks on the bath were pitting on the surface of the tub that couldn't be cleaned away. Some toiletries were provided but I wouldn't have liked to be relying on them as they were cheap and nasty sachets that weren't sufficient for two people. Everyone will tell you that money spent on a nice hotel in New York is wasted, and I have to agree. We could have paid £100 a night more for somewhere like the Library hotel, which I imagine would be a pleasure to stay in, but we were staying for 5 nights and you can do a lot of other things with £500! We did spend a minimal amount of time in the hotel room and while definately not a pleasure, it didn't do me any harm. Food The hotel is attached to what I suppose what would be called a diner. It’s a large room, which has some prominent Art Deco features on the ceiling that the hotel sells itself on, however, the actual seating area is retro and not in an Art Deco way. We ate here for breakfast each morning. It was busy, but it never took longer than a few minutes to get a table. Breakfast was typically around $15 for two and consisted of fruit juice, tea/coffee and pancakes/waffles. The quality was fine, for breakfast, however we didn't eat any other meals there - the dinner menu was unappealing and we were looking for something nicer in the evenings. Value for money In comparison to other cities, I would say the quality of the room and the price represented poor value for money. However, it's New York and having researched the other hotels in that "nothing fancy, 3*" range, I would say the rate and hotel represented reasonable value.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location in New York”
Reviews.Author: chocaholicmanc
Reviews.Content: The Edison was in such a fantastic area of New York. Literally just off Times Sq and just round the corner from M&M World!!! The room was pretty basic but it was a decent size and was clean. My only real gripe was that it didn't have a ceiling light which made putting make up on a pain. I've heard that this is quite common though. It was quite quiet considering how close to Times Sq it was and had a brilliant diner attached to it.
