The breakfasts were good value and decent portions but the other food was only so so. This diner isn't actually part of the hotel though.

Reviews.Title: “close to the action !!!”
Reviews.Author: d0m2001
Reviews.Content: The room was a bit dusty and small but the hotel has a FANTASTIC LOCATION... for a very reasonable fee, too. Times Square is about 10 steps away ! The hotel bar serves great breakfasts ...GREAT STUFF !!!

Reviews.Title: “location location!”
Reviews.Author: wholelottaworld
Reviews.Content: Wow this hotel has a great location steps away from Times Square and Broadway. The hotel is a wonderful hotel with loads of atmosphere set in an art deco style. Our room was lovely and airy, if not a strange shape! Even though right on Times Square doorstep, we found it very quiet with minimal noise (except from the ever nosy taxi drivers who seem to spend their entire shift honking at other drivers) If you are looking for a reasonably priced spotlessly clean hotel in a fantastic location this is the hotel for you. Staff (apart from one or two on the front destk) were extremely helphul and friendly, especially John the porter. Would thoroughly recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel with real New York feel”
Reviews.Author: IrelandHolidayfan
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in one of the best locations near times square. Went on a 4 day shopping trip with a group of 5. Would highly recommend this hotel and would def stay here again

Reviews.Title: “absolute garbage”
Reviews.Author: dog_party
Reviews.Content: There was someone else's trash in the bin, the towels were filthy, there were brown stains all over the sheets, the toilet didn't flush, the 'fitness centre' was an unlit service corridor filled with bins, use of the internet is expensive, and the staff at the desk were incompetent.

Reviews.Title: “Built in 1931 and unhampered by the signs of progress”
Reviews.Author: deadkittens
Reviews.Content: Original bath tub, doors, paint and I think carpet, The AC would not get the room below 80, there was mold in the tub and the staff did nothing, even though I reported the conditions every day for three days. Internet was $27 a day and did no always work. There are only two AC outlets in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: IzzyLima
Reviews.Content: This is an older hotel with the flavor of New York years ago. The rooms are small compared the newer hotels, but comfortable and clean. Everyone on staff was helpful and polite. When we needed something delivered to our room, it arrived immediately. The location could not be better. It is close to theaters, stores, restaurants, subways, other sights and tour busses. I would gladly stay at this hotel again. It is perfect for a vacation in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!!”
Reviews.Author: MST1970
Reviews.Content: I have read many of the reviews and told my friends we were staying in a "dive" in NYC. Boy was I wrong! We LOVED it!!! Our room was a nice size and clean. We had a king size bed with tables on either side, a small sitting area and a desk and table with a mirror. The size of the bathroom was okay, not a lot of room for your stuff, but we just used the table in the room. We had a walk in closet, so plenty of room for our clothes and to store our luggage. The location was absolutely perfect! Walk out of the lobby on the 47th Street side and look your right. You can see the TKS booth. Look to your left and see the theatre where Rock of Ages is playing. Go out on the 46th street side and look to your left. There is the theater for the Little Mermaid (until Aug. 30) and straight ahead is In the Heights. SOOO Close to everything. Additionally, if you go out 46th street side and go to the right, that is restaurant row. Walk 2-3 blocks and you will see all kinds of food choices. The Gray Line bus tour is also right at the end of the block. You can walk to the Empire State Building (15 min), Rockefeller Center (10 min), Time Square (1 min), Pier 84 (Circle line cruises, 15-20 min), Subway (2-5 min) Our package included breakfast in the cafe. You get your choice of eggs (fried or scrambled) & bacon, pancakes or french toast. We had all three and all were delicious and plentiful. We did ask for a refrigerator prior to going to this hotel. We were told that we could only get one if there was a medical purpose. There are no ice machines, so if you plan on having drinks in your room, you might want to bring a small cooler. My husband put our drinks right in front of the air conditioner and put the curtains around them for insulation. He called it our refrigerator. It worked out just fine and was a joke throughout the vacation. Other than check-in and check-out, we had no reason to interact with the staff. We did not experience any problems, so no need to contact anyone. We did not have extra charges on our bill. My ONLY complaint is that the beds were hard. The first night I noticed, the second and third I was too tired to care! The bathroom did not have ventiltaion and we had some condensation on the walls and ceiling. At one point water dripped on me, but I just dried the area around me. Please remember that this is an old hotel and it is not perfect. If you want to spend $300, go to the Marriott around the corner. If you want just as good of a location for $150, then keep an open mind and spend your extra money on theater tickets or a great meal! If you are high maintenance, this is not the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Renovated, what year was that?”
Reviews.Author: Rolmat
Reviews.Content: True: location is great. Otherwise, very tired and not too clean...

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: lordprg
Reviews.Content: This was my second visit to New York & staying at the Edison (the first being Jan 2005) as I'd liked the location so much that it made sense to come back. Location - right on Times Square - it doesn't get much more in-the-thick-of-it than this, you are basically as close to or within easy underground access of the whole of New York Rooms - This time there were 3 of us (me & 2 female friends) & the room we got was laid out in a peculiar way. I had one room with a double bed & the girls had a second room with 2 beds, however my room had the toilet in it so the girls had to walk through my room to get to it which was odd. Otherwise the room was functional, although I don't remember it getting cleaned every day. Food - No meals provided, but the attached Café Edison did a nice breakfast. The Bar attached to the lobby was great too, had many evenings of drinking in there. Staff - the staff on the desk were the most morose bunch of people I met in my whole trip, and if you asked a question it was like you'd asked them to sacrifice their first-born. The staff in the shop & the info desk were really nice & helpful though. All in all, the hotel does what it's supposed to, which is provide a cheap (at the time, I've seen prices recently which have been a bit prohibitive) room in a central location to enjoy the wonder of New York. I will use the hotel again when I come back, unless I come into more money

Reviews.Title: “VERY RUDE FRONT DESK AND PHONY MOVIE CHARGES”
Reviews.Author: HNRStMaarten
Reviews.Content: Beware they will charge your account for the "pay movies" even if you did not purchase them (in your absence any of the staff/management can use your remote and enjoy on your money) and you can not do anything and the front desk supervisor/manager will only be rude and not willing to hear anything from you.

Reviews.Title: “ok hotel good location”
Reviews.Author: littlechef7
Reviews.Content: hotel was in a great location bit old fashioned and tired but was just to sleep in,100yds walk to times square and all that razzmatazz,very very busy but good to see . Next door to hotel is dannys deli the wee guy who owns it is a hoot and very charming everything you need is here,found a good cafe times square cafe round the corner from tgi fridays very reasonable.Subway not to far from hotel but try and walk its the best way.NYC was fine but not a place i would go back to, times square is tacky and a bit blackpoolish(for all the british readers)but on a far bigger and grander scale.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: lexicon828
Reviews.Content: This hotel is adequate, the room was small but very clean and the beds were clean and comfortable. We only slept here so the size of the room was not important compared to the excellent location, steps from Times Square, the subway, restaurants and all the tourist spots. Next door is Danny's Deli, we ate breakfast here every day, a huge buffet of many choices and very reasonably priced. All aspects of the hotel were fine including the Business Centre, except...we had a major problem with the attitude of the front desk staff. After 26 hours of travelling from Australia we were greeted by a sour faced clerk at the desk. When I stepped up to the desk to check in, she snapped at me: "I'm not ready for you, stand back and wait until you're called by someone"...after which she and her colleagues did their best to ignore for us for the ensuing 20 minutes until in the end we had to complain loudly to someone else. On checking out 6 days later, we witnessed an incident involving the same clerk with another guest. Very very rude. Customer service does not exist at this hotel and I suggest all their front desk staff need to be sent off for re-training - urgently! I have been to the US a few times and coming from a country where we do not need to tip and where it is not customary, I have deduced that, in the US, if you are dealing with customer service where you tip, it's great, but if you're dealing in a situation where you don't tip, it's crap with a capital C. But all that aside, we would stay here again; a few miserable front desk clerks won't deter us. The Hotel represents great value for money, excellent location, clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Loaction in NYC for The Price”
Reviews.Author: webkinzmass
Reviews.Content: I lived in NYC. This the best location in NYC for the price. It is an old hotel , so do not expect a lot. If there are pictures of Mickey Mantle in the hotel. You know it is older than most hotels in the Times Square area. If your going to the theatre it is a great location. The TKTS box office is 100 yards from the hotels front door. TKTS sells tickets to that nights shows at 50- 30 % off the price of the ticket. Usually it 's 50 % off the ticket. You are then within a 5 block radius of the mostly all the theatres. You can walk to most of the venues(Empire State building, get there early in the morning) that one would like to see ,thus saving on a cab fare. You can take the subway @ the times square stop if you like to go to the Statue Liberty. (Train number 1, South Ferry stop) After seeing the Statue of Liberty walk three block north to Ground Zero(Visit the fire station across from Ground Zero, Engine 10 and Ladder 10). Buy your tickets to the Statue of Liberty on line. You will save time standing in line. There is a breakfast place down stairs on the first floor of the hotel. We had breakfast and we were on our way. In the evening there is a deli next door,we picked up some food and drink to take up to our room for a snack .If your going to the UN you can walk across town, take the 42nd St. shuttle(S) or taxi. Get a free map of the subway system @ the any subway station or go on line and study it. Many people buy theatre tickets on line at full price when you can get tickets 50% off at TKTS ticket booth .Go on line and see what they are selling. TKTS is how New Yorkers go to the theatre. Plan you Day!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Marsh53
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not fancy but it was clean, had a deli attached to it, and was located a block off of Times Square. It was an easy walk to shopping, tour busses, and the theatre.

Reviews.Title: “Horible, no renovation, filthy, bed bugs!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Big_J_dipset
Reviews.Content: this hotel is disgusting, Rather than renovating, they just paint over the mold and rust, and the mold is just coming out again. the shower head was coroding in the green mold, and it was plain disgusting, as for the hotel room, it smelt alot like Rat [--] and heres the best part, bed bugs, and lots of em, me and my dad were COVERD in bites, like literally covered, we had to throw out souveniers thanks to them, This place was a PURE money scam, bed bugs, rust, mold, sticky dwars in the furnature, all for 150 a night!!!! what a deal!! its cause we threated to contact the health inspectors that they refunded us, im still thinking of doing it. Because when you have bed bugs, its because of lack of cleaning, so obviously the room was NOT CLEAN. if they cleaned often, it wouldnt have been this bad, and even if it wasnt for the bed bugs, this hotel would still be horrible, 2 of the lights in the room worked too, out of the 6...no joke, i no for a fact, that it was not our room only that was infested with bed bugs, it was obviously more rooms, it was so bad that we just had to leave and get a [--] load of calimine medicine. DO NOT GO TO THIS HOTEL. I signed up to this site JUST to write this. 0 stars

Reviews.Title: “In the middle of New York, just walk out your door. Great Location.!!!”
Reviews.Author: wreidnotl
Reviews.Content: The service was good and the reservation staff knew exactly what we wanted. The rooms were clean as were the bed linen and towels. Your are situated right in the heart of New York, some of the reviews give this place a bad rap, we found nothing wrong for the price, what do some people want ?? Maybe they are the sort of people that cant be pleased. I would recommend this Hotel to anyone that wants to visit New York. Thank You for having us 6 girls on a wonderful visit to your wonderful City.

Reviews.Title: “Good customer service”
Reviews.Author: Bloomfield53
Reviews.Content: We visited NYC and were two adults and a 4 year old boy. Upon arrival and checking in, it was apparant that our room wasn't large enough and had no seperate sleeping area for ourselves. However, a quick visit to the front desk and they upgraded our room to a deluxe suite without any hesitation. We were also due to meet some friends later in the day who were staying at the same hotel with their young family and they put us in adjoining rooms. Perfect. We asked for a fridge to put provisions and cold milk for the boy - they agreed to provide one and despite it being reconditioned and about 15 years old, it worked perfectly! We also decided to stay an extra night on a Saturday and this was offered at the same rate as used during the week. The location is why you stay at Edison Hotel, no other reason, it's 20 yards from Times Square and has everything you would need for a comfortable night's sleep. If you want deluxe then go next door to the 4 star hotel where you can pay an extra £100+ per night just to sleep the same amount of hours! As it's room only, for breakfast, we were able (thanks to the fridge) to bring cereal into the room and have that for breakfast as well as visiting Danny's Deli next door and bring bagels etc up to the room without any interference from security/front desk. In addition, towards 8th avenue there's several other diners where breakfast is served at good prices. Enjoy the New York experience, stay at The Edison and don't stay in any other hotel longer than necessary!!

Reviews.Title: “Ok for just putting head down”
Reviews.Author: darraghke
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights after been in orlando for 10 nights.We had stayed in Crowne plaza in orlando which was amazing the edison was a big come down. The hotel is a litle tired and dated.It looked like they were starting renovations when we were leaving. The hotel is right on times square doorstep and is great to get to everywhere. We left the hotel early and didnt arrive back until late so we didnt mind the hotel not being great. All you need is for the hotel to be clean and we got that. The sockets in the room were very loose.i was afraid i would be electrocuted. All in all the hotel is not too bad,.Lucky i read here before we went so we were expecting what we got.

Reviews.Title: “Simple without the frills.!!!”
Reviews.Author: fusciaCork
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 10 days in this hotel at the end of May beginning of June 2009. The room was spacious enough, adequately clean, towels were changed daily and even though we had asked for a room away from the elevators which we didn't get, anyway it didn't bother us too much. we also asked for a fridge to be put in the room which was very useful for drinks etc. The best part about this hotel is its location being in the heart of Times Square. We would go back there again.

Reviews.Title: “Experience”
Reviews.Author: t2nyc
Reviews.Content: Hotel is clean,staff very accommodating,10 minute walk from Times Square,easy access to tours. We came to see NYC not to watch T.V. or look out our window. Price was very reasonable as we did not want to spend our vacation funds on a hotel especially when our day started at 5A.M. until......Total time spent in our room was 4 hours. Do the math. What are you in town for?

Reviews.Title: “Sluggish front desk staff”
Reviews.Author: TorbenFromDenmark
Reviews.Content: When checking in you are met by sluggish front desk staff that quithe frankly couldn't be botherd! The rooms are nothing to be proud of and comparede to the price they simply are not up to standard - even for New York City! We as a group checking in together were given 5 twin rooms on 5 DIFFERENT floors - four of wich had a stunning view of... the rooms opposite the courtyard about 10-15 meters away making them very dark. We paid around 200$ plus tax and servicecharges. On the positive side the rooms ar kept fairly clean. The bar is nice and the location is very close to Times Square. Beware that due to its size the hotel is very popular with larger groups - also groups of younger students.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in the heart of New York”
Reviews.Author: Nipo48
Reviews.Content: Me, my wife and her cousin visited NYC for the first time in January 2009. We reserved hotel directly from hotel's own web pages and had a few emails confirming few things about our room. Or rooms to be exact. We had a great two-bedroom mini-suite with separating doors for privacy for us and for wife's cousin. Price was right because we could reserve room so early. Arriving to hotel was pleasant. There were doorman who helped us with our luggage. Reception was also very easy. Everything was correct with our reservation and smile was on with receptionist. We also got help with luggage all the way to the room. Rooms were ok, not luxurious and not bad. Old but very clean and well maintained. Carpets were living their last remaining years. Otherwise everything worked, hair dryer, TVs, remotes and heaters. Heaters almost too well. Weather outside happened to be coldest since and heaters were giving their best. Bathroom was also old and small but again very clean. Bathtub had same rust stains under faucets but otherwise spotless. Hot water didn't run out and bathroom was warm but amazingly dry place after showers. Towel supply was good and rooms were cleaned every day. A BIG Thanks to cleaners. Views from rooms were not anything special. Windows were looking over roof tops over the narrow streets. Hotel is not a skyscraper so other buildings block the views. Nights were peaceful. Only once we woke up in the middle on the night with a banging noice. I looked out and saw some workers below us, building a tin roof and hammering it, at 2 o'clock in the morning! We were also not near the elevators so no noices from there. And enough elevators there were. You didn't have to wait for too long. Noices from Times Square didn't reach us or didn't bother. On the other hand Times Square is right there on the corner, half block from hotel door. You are so close to everything you need, restaurants, shop, bars and theaters. One theater is right across the street. Subway station is also near. Hotels own restaurant/bar Cafe Edison was a nice place. Food was ok, we tested it on one morning for breakfast. Usually we had breakfast and lunch out in the city. I think this hotel is suitable for those who need a place to change clothes and sleep between shopping and Broadway shows and dining out. But it's not too old place just to stay in, if you just need a rest for a change. One thing about NYC in January or in winter overall. Make sure you have enough warm clothes to wear. We are from Finland, Europe and we are used to having cold winters but it wasn't anything in comparison to this what we experienced in January. Cold wind from North with cold Atlantic ocean together is mix to be aware of. It can give you frostbites if you're not prepared. Ask the doudle-decker guide if heater is working. We got one bus with no heating and we were quite surprised for the temperature. Wife's cousin and i got flu, but what the heck, we got something to remember at least! Kind regards Jouni, Anne and Jaana

Reviews.Title: “Old but nice hotel, perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: ryankerry
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel in December with a group of 14 ladies from Ireland - sole purpose of trip was shopping and sightseeing! This hotel is in a fantastic location, its walking distance to alot of the main attractions. Penn Station is only 5 minutes walk and you are in broadway in seconds. Didnt have a problem with any staff, they all seemed friendly and helpful. Rooms are dated but we had 4 in our room and we still had plenty of room to get around, afterall we only used the rooms for sleeping, we were gone all day. Sheets were changed everyday. We could hear our neighbours tv so rooms mightnt be 100% soundproof but no noise from outside street. All in all i would recommend this hotel, however if you are looking for luxury id advise to stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Decor from the 1930's and the smell to go with it”
Reviews.Author: spin1sheffield
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in New York and the the information about the Edison (this was pre finding out about trip advisor) was good and we looked on the internet and whilst it was not top of the range (we couldn't afford that) it looked perfect. Well!!!! we were very disappointed. The staff were friendly and the location was good, but the hotel room was very run down and it smelt musty and damp. It was very small and felt claustrophobic for all 4 of us (we are brits and used to small but this was SMALL). It was clean but felt unclean due to the scruffy decor and smell. Not impressed!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location but don't expect first class facilities”
Reviews.Author: global-ant
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel as liked the idea of the 1930's Art Deco theme. But then 1930's should not mean run down. The general appearance of the room was a litttle tired. A lick of paint here and there and some general maintenance would not have gone amiss. The bathroom was basic although it looked like some mould in the corner on the ceiling. The shower did not always have hot water. It would also have been nice to have tea/coffee making facilities in the room. The beds were made daily and fresh towels provided. We only had breakfast in the hotel cafe which had a good choice and service was good. This hotel is ideal if you want to be close to the hubbub of Times Square and close to theatres. Our room overlooked the Barrymore theatre. During the night it could get quite noisy but we started to get used to it. Overall, this hotel is ideal for budget travel to New York.

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended - Seedy and dingy”
Reviews.Author: ScarboroughKec
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Edison Hotel. It is in an ideal location near Times Square however that is all it has going for it. It is a 1930's art deco style large hotel that has had little updating since. Our room on the 18th floor was small, dark and dingy. Bedding was creased and did not look laundered. No tea and coffee facilities in room. Electric sockets were black and burnt and there were trailing wires. Staff in Edison cafe were abrupt and rude. We were charged for viewing films in our room we did not view. I would certainly not return or recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amidst the action”
Reviews.Author: Globetr3kka
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Edison in 2006 in July for 4 nights during our trip around the US and we could not have asked for a better location...right off Times Square and in easy walking distance to great restaurants, theatres, shopping and the subway. The room was very small and very outdated, but clean and comfortable and served its purpose. The service and staff were pleasant and helpful when in need of advice and directions. Overall we were very happy with everything and in general if you are looking for a clean budget hotel that can not be beat for location as well as ambiance, this hotel might be for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: nbrown70731
Reviews.Content: Welcome to the City. The hotel is old but clean. The rooms are a little on the small side but hey this is New York. You pay for space to the max. But when you're in TIME SQUARE you don't stay in the room. The room is only a rest stop. When I travel to a big city or popular destination I know the people who works there are providing a service for the money and if you're not spending money don't expect much more than the min. The Edison is located in TIMES SQUARE, and the energy you feel being there is electric. If you're looking for polished chrome fixtures in the bathrooms, microwaves, flat screen TVs, plush beds, etc...this isn't the place. It did have cable, not sure about wifi, etc.... The best thing we liked was the location. Worst thing, we drove a car and parked our car ourselves, as a result we were responsible for getting our bags to and from parking garage, across and a short walk down the street

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, perfect for the price!”
Reviews.Author: Ste08
Reviews.Content: This is great hotel to stay in if you want a reasonably priced hotel right in the middle of Manhattan. Only a 2 minute walk from Time Square and a Metro station, the location cannot be beat. The room was on the small side, but what do you expect in New York? Bathroom was clean and the maids did a great job everyday (clean towels daily etc). Very quiet for the location, did not have any problems sleeping at all. The people at reception were always helpful, so was the concierge. We didn't eat at the Cafe as there are so many places close by that do good food. We tended to grab breakfast from 'Carve' which is a 2 minute walk on the corner of W 47th and 8th Ave - H&H Bagel with cream cheese and a coffee for $2 - you can't go wrong. If you want a basic hotel in a great location at a good price then the Hotel Edison is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable hotel near Times Square”
Reviews.Author: RebeccaMI
Reviews.Content: If you are a cost conscious traveler looking for a clean, comfortable room in a great location near Times Square, this hotel can't be beat. Our room with two double beds was simply furnished. The bathroom was quite small but certainly adequate. We ate breakfast at the hotel diner. Even though it was very busy, the service was fast and the food was good. This retro hotel is reasonably priced in an expensive area of New York. It is showing it's age, but it is still charming.

Reviews.Title: “New York was amazing, and so was this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Emzie27
Reviews.Content: I was at the hotel for 5 nights and honestly only used the hotel to sleep in as there was so much to do but I enjoyed staying there when I was at the hotel. The location was fantastic and was central to things like bus tours and restaurants. The maid service was brilliant as a couple of times I ended up talking to the maids. On arrival, the gentleman at the reception desk offered me and my mum two double beds or two single beds in our room and as it turned out we ended up with two king size beds. When leaving, our flight was not until 10.30pm and check-out was at 12. The bellhop took care of our bags but the hotel let us keep our rooms until 3 in the afternoon so that we had more time to get ready and we did not feel rushed at all. I would certainly recommend this hotel to anyone, the art decor in the lobby is phenominal!

Reviews.Title: “Never Again!!!”
Reviews.Author: jellybean54
Reviews.Content: Just spent 2 nights at the Edison. The first room they gave us on the 18th floor which was supposed to have a queen bed was horribl, the bed was as hard as bricks, pull out sofa was ripped and had holes, carpet was all buckled, bathroom - no words can describe it. We tried to get another hotel but they were all booked so my husban went downstairs and asked the manager when the last time it was updated - during the Hoover Administration? He told the manager the room was not acceptable. We were given another room on the 11th floor which was better - but that is not saying much. The carpet wasn't rippled, bed was more comfortable, no rips in furniture. The bathroom was so small, the toilet was about 10" from the floor, could only put on hot water in shower, and the towels (plenty) had long blonde hairs on them. My husband said it was like staying at the Y. Have not stayed in a room in over 20 yrs where there was no phone book (probably because they didn't want you to call another hotel), no coffee pot or literature. People in the cafe were rude however the doormen were very nice. If you are looking for a cheap place to stay this is it.

Reviews.Title: “Mostly good experience”
Reviews.Author: artsmomma
Reviews.Content: The location can't be beat! Rooms are small but clean. Rates are very reasonable for New York and location. The hotel has a retro feel and look. The only drawback to an otherwise good experience was the incredible rudeness of the staff in the cafe, especially behind the counter and at the cashier. Next time I'll eat someplace else, but will definitely stay at the Edison.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Tristanklingsor
Reviews.Content: Listen, if you want to hang out in a hotel room in manhatten, this is NOT for you... If your looking for a great hotel location, clean room, moderately priced place to crash after enjoying one of the greatest cities in the world.. Then get a reservation. If you need a posh place to crash, and you'd rather spend 300.00 a nite than 200.00 then head up the street to the empire hotel. I stayed at both over st. Patty's 2009. Empire=posh, expensive, classy... Edison=great bar, bigger (not better ) room, clean and basic. You get what you pay for, bottom line

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: liamoIreland
Reviews.Content: First time in New York and I loved every minute of it. The hotel was in a fab location central to everything. Staff at the hotel we found very friendly and helpful. Room that we had was very roomy , bed linen and towels changed every day. Did not use the restaurant so cannot comment on it. All in all i would definitely go back to this hotel. No frills just a clean basic hotel and what more do you need when you are in New York as you only use rooms to sleep in.

Reviews.Title: “Reason is Cheap;”
Reviews.Author: scappellee
Reviews.Content: PROS: The desk people seem to want to help. The lobby is a great place to relax. Beds were comfortable. Central location; also a lot of street noise. CONS: Registration computer broken, had to wait in lobby checking back every 15 minutes. Asked for room top floor away from elevator with original registration; got low floor across from elevator. Concierge and Transportation people only want to sell you tickets (BEWARE); seem disappointed when you just want advise (they look completely joyless). Charge you for any wireless; even incredibly slow boarding pass computer. Hot water is boiling to cool; all in the same shower. Someone walked into our room at midnight saying was security checking my "vacant" room: the front desk/security the next morning wasn't sure if was their security or not and didn't seem interested. Next time will look for deal at one of the Marriott near 52nd and 7th (where I stayed last time)

Reviews.Title: “A True NY Experience!”
Reviews.Author: sootin
Reviews.Content: My son won this 3 night stay for two in New York and invited me as the second person. We were booked into a double room and assumed we would have to share a double bed - love each other dearly but draw the line at sharing a bed! So, I booked a single room for myself. When we arrived very late at night, we discovered the 'double' room was exactly what it meant - two double beds and plenty of room for two people. I went to reception the next morning, explained that the original room would be fine for the 2 of us and, without any quibble whatsoever, my single room money was refunded for the second 2 nights, giving us another $290 spending money! I can't say enough in praise of the hotel - front door opens on to W.4th. St. and the rear door onto W.46th.St. and a few steps bring you slap bang into the flashing, blazing, buzzing wonder that is Broadway - what a sight!! The rooms are absolutely fine and perfectly clean, warm, quiet and comfortable - I can assure you, I've stayed in much worse for a comparable amount of money. My step-sister (a one-time NY resident) who joined us for a night from her home in Mass., described the Cafe Edison as a truly authentic, old-style NY diner and she, for one, was delighted to see it. The Rum House was a great place for a night-cap and, if your eyes were too big for your gut, you could take your drink up to your room to finish off whilst lying on your bed in your jammies, watching cheesy American TV. So, take no notice of those few moaning minnies and get into the swing of the Big Apple from a truly brilliant central location!!

Reviews.Title: “Best ever location - Guaranteed.”
Reviews.Author: Shannonside
Reviews.Content: Just Returned from a 5 day stay at the Edison. 12-17th March. This is a budget hotel. Found reception very helpful, check in satisfactory. Had one room with two double rooms, decor was ok, plenty of space, furnishing that one would expect with a budget hotel. Room was very quiet. I was a little reserved about the electrics in the room and the bathroom look very tired. Rooms were cleaned on a daily basis, towels were also changed daily. Lets keep this in context for 5 night in New York $950 i feel this is good value, this is not the Waldorf but a cosy comfortable budget hotel with a very high movement of guests going through the hotel on a weekly basis so my feeling is that the condition of the hotel is very good for such high turnover. Believe me you will not get a better location, this is the best asset of the hotel. When in new york you need somewhere quiet to sleep and a place to shower, you come to New York to see the sights. Very nice clean deli next door. Go on book it, i did and have no regrets and would return and recommend it. If you want a to sip champagne and have a body of people pamper you this is not the place.

Reviews.Title: “All about the Location”
Reviews.Author: apount
Reviews.Content: It really is all about the location with the Edison. As you leave the hotel doors it is literally 50 metres or so to Times Square. You really couldnt complain. Yes it is an older Hotel and yes it could do with a refurbish but i went to NYC with family and we were out everyday and evening so we only really used it for showering and sleeping. That is what the basis of this hotel is! Our room overlooked the Barrymoore theatre on the 6th floor, we had a great view of the street below. The overall size of the room was adequate, the beds were fairly big and the sheets were cleaned everyday. I really enjoyed returning from a day out to come back to fresh sheets and towels. The bathroom was also very good i especially liked the shower that literally blasted you and it was a very warm shower also. In the Lobby there was a lovely seating area, a cafe next door where we ate breakfast and a small shop. The staff were not rude and were pleasant. I will definitely consider returning to this hotel as the location did it for me.

Reviews.Title: “The location is its saving grace”
Reviews.Author: suzeclarke
Reviews.Content: Luckily I didnt pay for this hotel as i won the trip but i would be very dissapointed if i had. The rooms were very small and old fashioned and had 2 internal doors. One led to the wardrobe and 1 to the bathroom. Not unusual you may think however both were the same size!!! the Bathroom was not even big enough to dry yourself off in after a shower!! The cafe and the hotel pub were both very expensive and I would not reccomend. Also the safety deposit boxes are held in reception and there is a constant queue to actually access your belongings. However the location is second to none and does go a long way in making up for the tiny, old fashioned rooms.

Reviews.Title: “basic, clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: happytravelling50
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 'two special birthdays'. asked for a room on a top floor and were put on the third floor! we couldn't have got a much lower floor! got moved to a higher floor though. rooms were basic, clean and comfortable and surprisingly quiet. the attached cafe on the ground floor had good cheap food with fast, efficient service. there was a liitle shop in the foyer selling reasonably priced gifts, great for any last minute presents. staff didn't seem particularly friendly but were helpful. all in all we had a great time, the location of this hotel is fantastic..... walk outside, walk a few yards and time square is right there!!! would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a place to sleep, a good cheap breakfast, and doesn't expect luxury for a budget price!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location for the price”
Reviews.Author: 2ys4you
Reviews.Content: You really can't beat the price of this older hotel. It's clean, it's tiny, but it's the perfect place to stay. I've stayed here twice and I would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent buy, visitor friendly, and perfect location”
Reviews.Author: idthomas
Reviews.Content: The Edison is a bit frayed around the edges because of its art deco origins, but it has plenty of charm and good service to make up for that. Our room was clean, quiet, with a recently remodeled bath, and with good furniture. We could get a quick meal in the cafe downstairs or a wonderful salad in the deli next door. Surrounded by theatres, a block from the half price ticket booth and all subway and bus lines, the location couldn't be better. Lots of smart Brits and French groups stay here.I would definitely return to the Edison, though maybe hesitating in summer since it's an older hotel and perhaps not well air conditioned.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Experience...Beware!”
Reviews.Author: mnolan3080
Reviews.Content: I booked the Edison Hotel because I was looking for something a little more reasonably priced near Times Square. I read all of the reviews, and it seemed like a decent place to stay. I would not stay here again if you paid me, and here's why (in no particular order): -The decor has not been updated since like 1973 -Fluctuating water temperatures in the shower practically scolded my friend's skin -The room was very hot, and the AC smelled disgusting and made a loud banging noise -The bed was EXTREMELY unconfortable and the sheets were old and gave me the heeby jeebies (they were clean, surprisingly) -Water stains and mold were painted over -Shampoo and conditioner provided were horrible and cheap -No ventilation in the bathroom- not even a fan. Leaving the door open while we showered made the rest of the already hot room unbearable -Window was broken, so they just sealed it shut -Guy at the front desk wasn't exactly friendly when we checked in. We prepaid through a third party reservation web site, and the guy at the front desk didn't even take my credit card for incidentals -Because there are so many "this place is wonderful reviews," we have reason to believe that they "stuff their ballots" -The elevators made strange noises and I wondered if we were going to fall several stories My stay at the Edison didn't exactly ruin my trip, but we dreaded coming back to this dump at the end of each night. We had such a fabulous time in NYC, but it would have been nice to come back to a nicer hotel to unwind after a long day of walking around and seeing the NY sites. I would not stay here again, and would caution you to do the same. If I ever return to NYC, I would spend the extra $100/night and stay at one the national brand hotels. On a lighter note, this hotel is in a very convienent location.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PamaryDublin
Reviews.Content: Please ignore all the negitive reports about this hotel. We have been in New York three times and used this hotel all the three occasions.From the front door staff to the cleaning staff, they couldn't have done enough for us.Fab location, steps away from Times Square...

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, great location”
Reviews.Author: MsND
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Edison hotel in september for five nights with my two sisters. We had a triple room and although it could do with a bit of update decor wise to was very big for a new york room. The room had two large double beds and still had quite a lot of space to walk about. The bathroom again was quite large and had bath and shower. Not really sure what else you need of a new york hotel room. The hotel had a gym on the top floor and had a large number of machines and also free weights it also has large flor to ceiling windows for you to look out of when your running on the treadmills! There are two restaurants in the hotel we only used one, the cafe at th front of the hotel, it was ok nothing fabulous you can get better food in places outside the hotel. The bar in the hotel was brilliant and the staff were such good fun always willing to chat and recommend new drinks and the best part is for a hotel bar it wasnt even expensive. Apart from the bar the best thing about this hotel is the location you are literally within 50m of times square and can walk everywhere from the hotel, whether its to the shops, central park, empire state building you can do it all. If you do have the pleasure of going to new york i recommend getting tickets to see chicago it makes for a great night out. The cast are brilliant and regardless of whether you know the storyline or not before you go in you will still enjoy it. Im going back to newyork in september and will definately checking to see if i can book a room in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, everything we needed”
Reviews.Author: WashPA0214
Reviews.Content: As they say - LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION. It's a great place to stay in the theater district! Nothing special, just a room to sleep in that is clean, warm and close to everything. If you want fancy - this is not the place. It's simple. Oh, nice towels too! I will be back for the next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Location-Times Sq from our window!”
Reviews.Author: LuSadler
Reviews.Content: Hi! We stayed at hotel Edison whilst in New York as part of our Honeymoon. We got there, signed in straight away, went up to our room, which was on one of the top floors. We had a room that looked between a side street-straight onto Times Square! The place is REALLY dated! But who cares? your in New York!!! The room was a average size, big enough for our cases and to walk round, the bathroom was a good size and clean. Nice big tv, but we just really wantedto see what ny had to offer! One morning we had a breakfast there, it was quite good and the bar was reasonably cheap as well (and we spent quite a while there I can assure you!!!.) If what you're looking for is a cheap base, clean, and comfortable, then why not book here? The service, we found to be really good, the housekeeping girls were friendly and all the staff were informative. There was always a security guy too, checking everyone's room key as well, so we felt v safe there. We would stay there next time and would reccommend (our not so rich) friends to stay there. Any questions, I'd be happy to help : )

Reviews.Title: “Home From Home”
Reviews.Author: tallaghtdublin
Reviews.Content: Good Location.staff very friendly.Ideal for times square and Broadway shows Bedroom very good But could do with a coat of paint would recommend this hotel..

Reviews.Title: “Happy with the Edison”
Reviews.Author: lynnelizabeth
Reviews.Content: I was a little nervous about staying at the Edison after reading some of the reviews. I'm pleased to say that everything was great. We arrived early in the morning, well before check in. I was planning to just leave our bags and come back when my room was ready but the front desk offered us a room right away and a free upgrade and even let us go up and check out the room before deciding. It was larger than I was expecting and was nice and clean. I've travelled enough to know not to expect the Ritz and that NY hotels are pricier than most. The location was terrific if you want Times Square and the restaurant attached was very reasonable and served a good breakfast. Cash only at the restaurant though, unless you set something up with the hotel and your credit card. I only hope I'm as pleased with the Wellington Hotel, my next stop in April/09.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, cozy room”
Reviews.Author: RubyWanderlust
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, with its own perfectly adequate diner (I didn't use the bar) where I got a nice cheap breakfast - even though the prices in the diner went up while I was staying there! My room was very cozy and warm, unlike the temperature outside, and I was tucked away at the back of the hotel with just enough room for a queen bed and TV and closet and that's about it. Very little shelving in the bathroom which was annoying, but the hotel had some great art deco features which more than made up for it. A lot of high school students stay at the Edison so sometimes the hallways can be noisy. I was also woken up a few times by the sounds of my neighbors taking showers - the Edison's walls are pretty thin. But if you're staying on Times Square, chances are you're up for some excitement and energy anyway. Staff can be hard to track down but are always very helpful when you do find them. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel; Great Location; Great time in NYC”
Reviews.Author: CherylofHatboro
Reviews.Content: Searched the websites; found a great rate for this gem. Centrally located; 1/2 block from the new TKTS booth; 1/2 block from subway entrance. 1930's hotel; retains many of the charms (deco paintings in lobby; great attention to architectural detail; steam heating pipe in bathroom made for TOASTY WARM showers). Comfortable beds; two (unexpected) closets in our room; modest accommodations. All that you need when you have the excitement of NYC out your front door. I'm sure other NYC hotels have more luxuries, but this is all you need as a base.

Reviews.Title: “Art Deco Hotel”
Reviews.Author: fox01
Reviews.Content: Read reviews on this hotel and have to say they differ widely from good to bad. On our five night stay over xmas we found the staff friendly and helpful even thou they were very busy. Our room was a two bedroom combo on the 22nd floor it was clean and tidy and furnished in art deco style which was great we thought. The bathroom was on the small side but hey we were there to see new york not the bathroom. We had a side window view on to broadway as we were at back of building. The lobby of the hotel was wonderful with art deco murals and christmas tree in the middle. The diner/cafe in the hotel has good service and excellent selection for breakfast and the eggs benedict was great. We did venture into the Rumhouse bar which was ok nothing special but with hotel prices. We did have a problem with the hairdryer in the bathroom but within ten mintues the repair guy had arrived and fixed it. So just remember this is an art deco style hotel so the furnishing etc are not Ikea style but the location for Times Square/Broadway is second to none.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: luv2cruise2
Reviews.Content: My daughter & I went on a bus trip to NYC to experience New Year's Eve at Times Square. The location was ideal for this purpose & also for getting to many other sights & transportation. This is my third time at the Edison & I find the hotel to be quite charming. I would rate it 3 or 4 stars. It's attraction is it's great location~ near Times Sq., on 46th St (restaurant row) & in the Theatre District, plus close to TKTS & the Times Square info centre where there's some internet access, bus passes etc. We had breakfast at the cafe in the lobby. It was fine BUT they only take cash or travellers cheques as payment. The dinner specials always looked very interesting. Danny's deli next door is also great with fresh fruit, hot buffet choices & sandwiches available. Some items are sold by weight & I must say their orange juice was the best I've ever had! It's also open 24 hours! We really enjoyed our stay there & would go back in a flash.

Reviews.Title: “lovely”
Reviews.Author: fatboy2000
Reviews.Content: Great break. Service was could not be better. Rooms were very nice and clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Love The Edison”
Reviews.Author: dorcastrilling
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stay at the Edison a couple of times a year, and have been doing so for 10 years or so now. Love the location, love the lobby, even the rooms we have always had have been comfortable and clean, despite what others have found. Staff is fantastic; on this stay we asked the first day for extra towels and they were there every day from then on. Cafe Edison and Sofia's are both great. Bobby on the door is the best.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel right at Times Square”
Reviews.Author: tadjr
Reviews.Content: We went to New York the weekend of the 14th to look at the Christmas lights. We had been referred to this hotel by a friend. He said it was nothing fancy, but it was in a great location and he was right. We got to the hotel at about 300pm and asked about checking in. They had no problem letting us check in and we went to our room to drop off our bags. The front desk staff was courteous and polite. The maid was in the hall and directed us to our room. Every time we saw her she was very nice as well. Our room was on the 21st floor. We had a double (although my partners 6 feet legs hung over the end of the bed). The room was small, but adequate. It appeared clean and the carpet appeared new (or just really clean). There were only 2 pillows in the room, but we called room service and they brought some up right away. The bath was clean as well and small, but adequate. The shower was very good (hot water with lots of pressure). The lobby paintings were beautiful and with a little updating (some of the couches have run out of time) the place would be amazing. It is one block off Time Square and close to all the theatres. There is a little diner located next to the lobby that had a decent breakfast. We also ate dinner there and mine was ok, but the hamburger for my partner wasnt cooked enough. We sent it back and they fixed it though. Overall, for not having to leave the hotel/lobby area, the food was good for the price. Its not as bad as some of the reviews on here make it out to be. A little extra care and updating would go a long way to make the appearance of the hotel more appealing, but overall, it was a great hotel with a great location for the price we paid and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “It's not bad at all”
Reviews.Author: nicandeb
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at the Edison Hotel for 5 nights at the beginning of December. After reading some of the reviews beforehand, I have to say we too were apprehensive, but we were very pleasantly surprised. With the exception of one guy, the staff were all pleasant and courteous. The lobby and lounge are beautiful with many art deco features. The lounge had a massive Christmas tree right in the centre of it which was stunning. The sofas in the lounge were large and overstuffed and, if I'm honest, a bit threadbare in places but to me it just sort of added to the whole character of the place. There is a small shop just next to the lounge area which sells just about anything you can think of ... t-shirts, candy, cold drinks, medicines ... it's just crammed with goodies and we found their prices very comparative with other souvenir shops around Times Square. Our room was at the back of the hotel on the fourth floor. It was very quiet, more than adequate in size, VERY clean and it had a brilliant walk in closet to store all our bargains from Woodbury Common in. I didn't think the bathroom was that small and certainly not a lot smaller than any bathroom you would find in a modern U.K. home. The only disadvantage with being on the fourth floor was the lifts (or elevators) were more often than not full to bursting by the time they arrived at our floor in the morning, but it wasn't too much hassel as we just used the stairs. We never ate breakfast in the hotel as the queue was always backed up into the lobby of the hotel. We went to Danny's, a deli next door which was fantastic. The food is freshly made, tasty and very reasonable. We did have dinner in the hotel restaurant just once, the special set menu was a bit uninspiring and the waiter overbearing but the food was okay. The location of the hotel is perfect for a first trip to New York or for returning visitors. It is close to Times Square and Broadway, the Rockafeller Centre, the subway and just four blocks from the Port Authority Terminal where you can catch a coach to Woodbury Common, a must for any visitor. A bit of advice, take a empty suitcase or really big bag when you go because I guarantee that you will fill it! Enjoy your stay at the Edison, I know we did!!

Reviews.Title: “Edison Hotel, NYC - Perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: GiraffeStaffs_UK
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Edison Hotel on Thanksgiving weekend (from England). After reading the reviews on Trip Advisor we were a little apprehensive before our trip. However, we had a fantastic stay at the Edison. Our room was on the 14th floor and it was quite large with a handy hallway and closet (great for storing shopping bags). The bathroom was quite small (as i imagine most are) but was clean and looked new. Considering the hotel is in Times Square, it wasn't noisy at night. (just the odd siren and horn honking which is usual). Would have liked a better view, but you cant have everything!! The lobby was nice with a nice seating area and the Piano bar was how you would imagine an authentic american bar. We only popped in there once for a quick drink, but had we had more time we would have probably gone again. Sofias italian restaurant adjoins the back of the hotel, again, we didnt have chance to go in, but it looked really nice and busy. We sampled the Edison cafe one morning, not overly keen on the breakfasts. We discovered Dannys (just a couple doors away from front of hotel) which does the most amazing all day cuisine. They have a breakfast run, then it all changes for lunch and then dinner. Lovely full breakfasts, or fresh fruit, bagels, just everything. We were gutted we had only discovered it on the last day and we had walked past it about 50 times!!. As for the location of the hotel WOW!!! Walk to the end of the street and you are in Times Square. Walk out the back entrance and you are in Times Square. Just fab!! So convenient after a day out to drop bags off, and go out again. Also,in the evenings, you could go elsewhere, then come back and go out again to Times Square. One bit of advice though, if you go to the Marriott revolving bar (come out of back of hotel and enter Marriott) do not go for the evening buffet. The food is awful and not worth the money. But it is nice to go for a drink there as the bar revolves 360 degrees 48 floors high so you see all of NYC! Try Bubba Gumps in Times Square. Fun dining experience. This was our second trip to NY, so we didnt really do all the sights again, mainly shopping although we did walk across the Brooklyn Bridge and back again ( a total must as the views of Manhattan on the way back are breathtaking especially at sunset, also try Grimaldis pizza place under the bridge on the Brrooklyn side) and we went to Central Park again which is just gorgeous. The top of 5th Avenue by Central Park and Tiffanys, Plaza Hotel etc is just proper NYC, just like in the films. Went to Woodbury Common this time, got some great bargains. Stayed at the Belvedere Hotel last time which was just as good so would recommend either hotel. Please dont worry about staying at the Edison, it is totally fine and a great price (unless they have some dodgy rooms which we didnt stay in). Christmas time in New York is just magical. Enjoy!!!

Reviews.Title: “Dark, dingy,outdated”
Reviews.Author: traveler3784
Reviews.Content: The hotel was really outdated and dark. The room was large king size bed, but the spread, blankets and curtains were very dirty. Bath room was tiny, with mold in the grout areas. Hotel was noisy from inside and out. There were 20 bus loads of people there this weekend. Can't imagine how they stay in business.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: cody8
Reviews.Content: Dont let any negative reviews put you off from using the Edison, yes its an old hotel, and could probably use a facelift, but the beds were comfortable, the room was clean, and cleaned efficiently daily, and the bathroom was ok, everything worked. The staff I would rate from efficient to friendly, all being courteous, the two restaurants were excellent and very reasonably priced, compared to other places nearby.My wife loved the art deco style of the hotel. But where the Edison stands out is the location, right in the centre of Broadway and 5 minutes walk to Times Square. It could not have been better, and lets face it ,we went to NY to see NY, not to look at a hotel room. We would certainly use the Edison again.

Reviews.Title: “What a great location!”
Reviews.Author: hotlips15
Reviews.Content: What more could we want.......apart from a bigger room....yes the hotel was a bit dated but the room was clean and the staff were very friendly. Broadway and timesquare are on the doorstep. The restaurant was heaving for breakfast and the service was fast and friendly with plenty to eat .The hotel definately keeps in the era of art deco. I would go back and recommend to anyone wanting to be in the middle of new york.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ruthie25
Reviews.Content: I have just come back from spending a week in NY, i spent the first 2 nights in The Edison. Im a 25yr old girl who can shop till she drops, my mum came with me and she was also there for the same reason! The location was perfect, 20 steps up the street and your on time sq and broadway.Its also in walking distance on Macys and 5th Av. I had read some of the reviews on this before i left and have to admit i was a little worried, the lobby was bright, i didnt find one rude member of staff and they were very efficient. We were on the 9th floor and had a twin room, it was spacious, maybe a little dark but we didnt plan on spending much time there anyway, the bathroom was perfect, it had everything we needed!Sheets and towls changed everyday. There is a little cafe down stairs,very tasty and reasonable!! What im trying to say,its a perfect location!Your paying for location not luxury,anyway who wants to spend their time in NYC in their hotel room??????? I will definatily be reccommending this hotel to people going to New York!!!

Reviews.Title: “Location is SUPER - that's about it!”
Reviews.Author: eaglebayCopenhagen
Reviews.Content: We booked Edison Hotel because it was one of the cheaper hotels at the time .... on central Manhattan. That unfortunately does not mean that it came cheap. On the contrary accommodations in October is VERY expensive. Therefore, the Edison Hotel is a disappointing experience. Yes, location means very much and 50 meters off Times Square the Edison's location is superb. Unfortunately, the hallways on the 16 floor smelled (I guess it was a long time since the carpet had been cleaned), the room was very small and worn down but the worst was the window which was not windtight so we were freezing! In addition we had a first hand view to the noisy aircondition.... After 5 days we decided not to extend our stay - we found another place which was not as central but several stars better ...... at almost the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Crud Hotel”
Reviews.Author: slick69baby
Reviews.Content: Terrible restaurant, dirty, cheapest beds, little sleep and backache, small rooms, very rude sttaff, tiny bath, The worst $30 Motel 6 is better. Who cares about location when you can' sleep!! Had 3 rooms for 9 nights at about $7,000. A rip off even for New York. There are much better hotels within a block at the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Hated it!!”
Reviews.Author: tidwell1533
Reviews.Content: Very small rooms depressing feeling. The staff are so rude they make you feel terrible for even being there! The men that work there are busy staring at women and it's just an overall bad feeling I got when I was there. My mother stayed there in the 1940's and said it was a great hotel! Boy have things changed since then.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but in need modernising & updating”
Reviews.Author: foxhall
Reviews.Content: We went there as a small group of girls celebrating a special birthday. Although we never planned to spend a lot of time in the Hotel we did expect the rooms to be in the 21st century with modern fixtures and fittings as well as the twin rooms we had booked and had confirmed. We did not expect to have to sleep on fold up sofabeds! Coffee & tea making facilities would have been useful - yes, there is room service but that can prove expensive. Staff were rather out of their depth. In-house restaurant and cafe disappointing and expensive. On the plus side, this was a great location. I get the feeling they reckon that because of the great location they don't have to bother with the finer details. A pity.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: xvicx
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel as the second part of a twin centre holiday with LA first. We stayed at a 4 star hotel in LA so it was a bit different coming to the Edison but it was fine! Rooms like all NY rooms are small but there was still plenty of room for 4. the bathroom was very small but clean. The room was cleaned daily with fresh bedding and towels. The corridors though did stink! however once you got into the room there was no smell so im not quite sure what the smell was! Hotel staff were nice and friendly and the cafe edison was great for breakfast and very reasonable. The main problem is that this is an old hotel with old furnishings which really need updating however non of our stay was bad but a re furb would do it the world of good. Would I stay here again? Yes because the location is amazing and there was nothing wrong with the hotel just a bit worn.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here unless there is no other hotel available in town”
Reviews.Author: lorna_bromleymartin
Reviews.Content: Stayed with 3 friends late 40's, regular travellers. Do not stay here unless you are on a school party or budget tour. Hotel is tired as are the staff. Rooms on most floors not much better than equivalent of post war communist block hotels, tiny dated and poor bathrooms, tired and worn fixtures and fittings, poly sheets and linen - Survives on its position just off Times Square which is the only thing to recommend it - rooms are bigger than normal but worst hotel I have ever stayed in in US. In house cafe poor and restaurant dated and poor food but pricey.

Reviews.Title: “brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: mary1602
Reviews.Content: Could not have asked for a more central location for everything. We walked everywhere. Hotel was clean basic accomodation and excellent value. Staff could have been a bit more friendly. Will return again though.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: mahckz
Reviews.Content: As previously stated, if you are on a budget and want to spend a few nights in Manhattan, this hotel should be your first choice. If you want a five star luxury resort, then be willing to pay twice or three times the price of the Edison. I, my wife and teenage daughhter spent three nights at the Edison, and found it more than adequate. It is close to shopping, plays, restaurants, and times square. You should not plan on spending a lot of time in your room, because as the pictures show, it is not very large, but it was adequately clean. The restaurand downstairs is not very good, but there are so may other places to eat within walking distance, that we did not find this to be an issue. i would rcommend this place to anyone on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Edison - perfectly adequate!!”
Reviews.Author: lula81
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Edison (first 3.5 years ago). I booked the hotel on behalf of myself and 3 others and was very nervous after all the recent bad reviews but was pleasantly surprised. checked in very quickly. Rooms on 3rd floor, were better than last time I stayed. I think the decor / bed linen had been revamped. Clean, comfortable and adequate for what we needed. Base for touring. Excellent location. Had iron, ironing board and hair dryer, tv. Cafe Edison handy for breakfast. stayed 4 nights, i will stay there again when i next go to nyc as the location is perfect and got a great deal at the Edison on CRS website. I would reccomend it.

Reviews.Title: “It doesn't get any better on a budget!”
Reviews.Author: GriffsDevon_England
Reviews.Content: My wife, 3 children (12,17&19) and I had a wonderful stay at the Edison in May. Very helpful and friendly staff, central for all the sights and extremely spacious and pleasant rooms. What made it all the more enjoyable was that we were in New York on a tight budget. We read a lot of negative comments before we checked in but I have to say that our experience was nothing but good!!

Reviews.Title: “Tired & Grim old hotel”
Reviews.Author: spazzmom227
Reviews.Content: Hotel was VERY outdated. Rooms are dingy and you have to back into the bathroom it is so small. Mold in corners of bathtub. Front desk staff, though reported to be unfriendly, were very courteous when I spoke with them. Diner adjacent to hotel had great food and reasonable prices, but very rude employees for the most part. I would recommend this hotel if you were only going to be in it to sleep for a few hours before embarking on another trip. For a longer stay, the money to stay elsewhere would be better spent. Location, however, was excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific location”
Reviews.Author: HeatherAberdeen
Reviews.Content: Terrific location - we stayed for 4 nights. Room was really good size and clean. Bathroom was also clean and towels changed every day. After reading previous reviews had doubts about staying at the hotel, the entrance does not do it justice, but was pleasantly surprised when we arrived in our room. Reception staff were a bit off-hand. Our room was not ready when we arrived and we left our luggage until it was and there was a charge for this serv ice over and above the tip ! The only downside was friends had ordered a taxi through reception to take they over to join their cruise ship in Bayonne New Jersey - and they were charged $147. We did the same journely by public transport and taxi for the last part at a cost of $16.5 - friends were definately ripped off - so beware of ordering taxis from reception.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Cait08
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Edison for four nights in October. The location is unbelievable - you can literally see Times Square from the front of the hotel. The lobby is impressive and the staff were friendly. The room itself was clean but a bit dated. No problems with showers, hot water, towels etc. Our hairdryer gave up after one night though. There was three of us (all girls) and we had two large double beds. Initially I thought the bed was a bit hard but it was surprisingly comfortable. We didn't eat in the hotel so I can't comment on that. I would recommend this hotel for a visit to New York.

Reviews.Title: “dull and dingy-not recommended”
Reviews.Author: holly74
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Edison with my husband in October of this year for 3 nights This was a surprise present for my husband for his 40th birthday and i booked the Edison as my travel agent had recommended it saying that everyone that goes through her agency rates it very highly I have to say i will most definately not be recommending this hotel to anyone.The hotel is situated right on the corner of Times Square which is, i'm sure,the busiest part of New York City.This was not always a bad thing but my husband became ill with a sicky tummy and the noise --especially from the traffic was too much to bear when all he needed to do was rest. The hotel itself is very old and in my opinion could do with a complete overhaul as the whole place is very dingy and grimy looking--a very unfriendly lobby greets you when you arrive along with equally unfriendly,cold reception staff.We were staying on the 6th floor and the lift came in handy and i have to say this was very efficient and fast although some times we took the stairs on the way down as you could wait 20 minutes until a lift stopped where you could squeeze in.The corridor was dull and dingy also and then on entering the room this was was even darker and was a bit foisty smelling (room 647).The room was very small all the drawers creaked or squeaked when opened,the 1 electric socket available had dodgy connections as it only worked when it felt like it and to save risking an electric shock-it was best not to use it.There were 2 lamps in the room that had to be on all the time you were in as the room was so dark as the window looked onto a brick wall.The waterworks in the bathroom were not up to much --the hot water was intermittent and a cold shower is not very desirable in October. The one decent thing was the maid service,they came each day we were there and were very friendly. Downstairs there is a cafe for breakfast--reasonably priced but not sure if my husband became ill from the poached egg that he ate in the morning(it seemed undercooked to me) and its a bit like a cattle market--your second course arrives before you have finished the first. Hope this gives you an insight as we were very disappointed and wouldnt like anyone else to pay a lot of money like us for a very poor quality hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pay for Standard w/2 beds - Get a twin in a hole in the wall”
Reviews.Author: SoundTravel
Reviews.Content: I booked a Standard room with two double beds for 5 nights with the average price being $389.00 per night. I was charged an average of $473.00 per night when the receipt came. Never received a response from Hotels.com regarding the higher rate. When arriving, was told that there was no reservation. The front desk was rude and had to argue with them for an hour and then finally received a room. The room that was given was one with a twin bed in a VERY (hole in the wall) small room. Complained at the front desk and they said that is all they had and that is what was paid for - offered nothing else and wouldn't discuss it any further even after presenting my printed receipt with the room accommodations that was paid for. That is all I asked for - was to have the room that was paid for! Called Hotels.com and was put on eternal hold. Called a different number, asked to hold for 3 to 5 minutes at the most while they called the hotel - they never came back on the line. Tried this 4 times. Called Hotels.com again and needless to say even when asking to NOT be put on hold at Hotels.com - they just do and never come back on the line. Talked with the front desk again and was informed that that they only give rooms for that amount of people checking in - one person, one bed and it did not matter - period. Edison Hotel was given 5 opportunities to make things right and they refused and were RUDE, RUDE, RUDE! Was told that the reserved room was $205.00 a night, that is what they were paid and that is what I was getting. Was then told to contact the agency that made the reservation. Made a reservation and checked in at the New York Marriott Marquis around the corner, packed and started the check out process at the Edison Hotel. Requested 3 times for a receipt during the check out, was ignored and then the front desk refused to give one. I DO NOT RECOMMEND either the hotel or Hotels.com - it is a SCAM! I WILL TELL EVERY ONE I KNOW and NOT TO USE EITHER THE HOTEL OR HOTELS.COM. I book tens of thousands of dollars in travel and meetings a year.

Reviews.Title: “"Fantastic location"”
Reviews.Author: MitchDundee
Reviews.Content: We are just back from a five night stay at the Edison.After reading the reviews we were a bit nervous about staying there. Well we had nothing to worry about. The room was great.The bathroom was in need of a little attention ( re-grouting ) but everything else was fine. A super hot shower, clean towels every day and a powerful hairdryer. The location is fantastic - so close to times square.We were on the seventeenth floor and were at the back of the hotel so heard no noise. There was no view from our window but who goes to New York to spend time looking out of the hotel window. Just go out of the back door of the hotel and cross the road and you can get great half price theatre tickets. You maybe have to spend and hour in the queue but its well worth it. We got fantastic seats for the shows six rows from the front . The foyer is beautiful, the furniture could do with re-covering but it adds to the art deco charm. Overall our stay was fantastic and I would definitly stay at the Edison again!

Reviews.Title: “dont belive all you read”
Reviews.Author: BridLimerick
Reviews.Content: It was fab, location, staff, helpful door man, fab pub next door, diner to die for in the morning next door, all in all fab stay. rooms cleaned daily, cheap and cheerful. if you want up market then pay for up market but we stayed for my husband surprise 50th on the 10th of october and we had a ball. no complaints whats soever and i was [--] my self after reading the reviews as i booked it for my husband myself and another couple. but we would all recomend you stay here if you want cheap and cheerful and perfect location. well done you quys in the edison and thanks for everything. say hello to all in the rum house from the mad crowed from limerick ireland whos 50th birthday we celebrated in style. x

Reviews.Title: “goo dlocation”
Reviews.Author: royyech
Reviews.Content: when we checked in we got a regular Double room and it was too small. we went to the reception and said it's is too small for us (2 men) and then imidiatly replaced the room to a room with 2 big dblb beds. we stays there for 1 week and it was great. the location is great of course but the price is too high (but... this is all over NYC)

Reviews.Title: “Not that bad!”
Reviews.Author: Henwen1978
Reviews.Content: Last month I stayed in the Edison Hotel and was a bit affraid after reading all the terrible reviews here. Well, as everything was arranged allready we headed our way. The hotel is busy, very busy at moments. Just like the location of the hotel. The car, yes we actually drove there, was taken away by a very friendly member of staff. The guy behind the desk was a bit grumpy to be honoust, the bellboy was very friendly and the security staff at the elevators were friendly and helpfull as well. That assured me of a nice stay and I was satisfied. Then we came to our room, right accross from the elevators on the 22nd floor. I expected to hear the elevators but I never did, maybe because we where on the top floor and elevators just do not zoom by at that level. The room itself was fine, a bit old but clean. The towelrack kept falling of the bathroom door and that was the only thing in this room that was in a bad shape. The room kept me satisfied as well. And then the location. it is all about the location. There will be better locations available in NYC but not for this price. The location is fabulous! Just a few steps from Times Square and everything else you might need. All the negative comments did not help me a bit, and are simply not true in my opinion. I had a great time in Edison, as well as with its staff and rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Hotel Great Location”
Reviews.Author: yahooHk
Reviews.Content: The only plus point of staying in this hotel is the location as it is right in the heart of Times Squareand price, only in NYC is $200+tax a night a deal. Otherwise, this hotel is very very very basic with poor service. The last time I was there, one of my bags went missing and concierge staff didn't seem the slightest bit troubled by that. Great hotel, if you don't plan on being in it much. Also lock up any valuables - and try not to leave any small sized suitcases around - as mine went missing.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Edison”
Reviews.Author: telgirl2000
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Edison for 5 days from 15th Sept 08. We had booked 2 rooms, a twin and a double for our party of 4, and had requested they be as close together as possible. We got 1 on 5th floor and 1 on 9th. On arrival one room was ready and one wasnt but we were arriving an hour before check in so not their fault. The rooms - The twin was a good size, 2 double beds but did not look at all like any of the pics on their website. The double was very small. The plug sockets in both were dubious, but just about usuable. Both rooms clean but very old fashioned and smelt a bit damp to begin with, dont know if the smell wore off or we just got used to it! The rooms include colour tv, iron, ironing board and hair dryer in bathroom. We later discovered that the only rooms that look like the pics on the website are a few on the 2nd floor apparently. Service - Staff were a bit abrupt, but facilities such as the free safety deposit box and the luggage storage after check out were very useful. Gift shop staff were not very helpful. Food - We ate breakfast at Cafe Edison which on first sight did not look a very nice place but dont judge the book as the food was pretty good and service very quick. Was full and had a queue most mornings. Location - excellent! right on edge of times square, and pretty central for everywhere else. Would i recommend? If you are only looking for somewhere to sleep and not bothered about the little luxurys you would normally expect from a hotel - then yes. If the quality of accomodation is important to you, then no. The whole place is in need of a lot of updating and redecoration. That said, it was full every day of our stay so the price is obviously very attractive.

Reviews.Title: “A clean and safe hotel in an excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: NB83
Reviews.Content: I was really worried about staying at the Edison after all the terrible reviews, but I was pleasantly suprised!
