Yes, the hotel is old, the rooms are small and dated and there are no extras in the rooms - but its not meant to be a luxury hotel! The location is awesome - about 15metres from the times square and the rooms are clean and big enough. If you're in NY to see the sights and only need a hotel for sleeping then you can't beat the Edison.

Reviews.Title: “A Guest Since 1985”
Reviews.Author: rjohnson54
Reviews.Content: My last visit to The Edison was in Dec - Jan of 07-08. I always travel right after Christmas through New Years. My visits are always enjoyable and the rooms are always very suitable. I began staying at The Edison in 1985, escorting High School student Theatre Trips. I now am a school principal and travel alone and frequently. The hotel staff is and has always been very nice, polite, and helpful. Yes, the location is great, but there is something even greater about staying in a historic building, a part of old New York. I have stayed at the Marriott, The Millenium, The Four Seasons, and others. For the dollar, The Edison is real value. I visit to be in the city, to see the city, and to be part of New York. Staying at THe Edison is just part of being in New York. Even though I have stayed in other hotels, I choose The Edison. It is comfortable, it is familiar, and it grounds me. Russell Johnson

Reviews.Title: “Dirty Hotel”
Reviews.Author: fizz44
Reviews.Content: On arrival at this hotel the receptionist who didn't seem to care less told us our room was not available. Considering we booked the room in November 2007 I was rather shocked, however on production of our hotel voucher a room was "found". The room was just like the photographs in other reports, small and dingy although we were not expecting anything great. However .... the floor of the bathroom was dirty with hair on it and when we got ready to go to bed, my bed hadn't been changed from the previous occupant. As in previous reports, the staff didn't seem to care about customer relations and were particularly unhelpful. I asked if we could keep our room on the last day for a couple of extra hours which wasn't a problem although they did reprogramme the room key. When we got back to the room to collect our luggage we couldn't get in so had to ask a chamber maid to let us in. If you want a hot drink in your room, take your own kettle but be wary of the loose plug sockets! Breakfast in the restaurant was ok - nothing spectacular and they charge you for a cup of hot water (I like herbal tea but they don't have that). On a plus side, if you want to stay in Times Square the hotel is ideally situated. I won't be staying in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: sandra8210
Reviews.Content: this is the worst hotel I have ever stayed in in my life!!!! we arrived at the hotel at the correct check in time, to find our room was not ready. the hotel lobby is nice, so we were shocked by the standard of room- dark, dingy and dirty. we asked to be moved- staff were rude and unhelpful and said housekeeping would come and tidy up the room. the housekeeping assistant came 5 minutes later- she was the rudest little lady i'd ever come across in my life, and when she left there was still hair in the bath!!!!the carpet was stained, the bathroom was tiny- with no fan, the bedding was itchy. we were moved the following day- the room was slighly better- but still no where near as good as the pictures shown on the net. Generally all staff were unhelpful. excursions and attractions booked via the hotel are a rip off. on the plus side location is excellent and there is a real good deli next door where you can get amazing food up until quite late.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant location, Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LeanneG-Liverpool
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 5 nights from the 14th September. i was a bit worried before we arrived due to the bad reviews i had seen on here but out experience with this hotel was fanitastic. Yes the public areas were a little dated, but who goes to New York to spend time sitting around in the hotel?? Our room had 2 queen beds and was quite big enough for 3 of us with 2 suitcases worth of clothes each (we had been on a multi-trip holiday) the room was spotless and was cleaned each day, even if when the maid called it wasnt a convenient time she would ask you what time you would like her to call back, The bathromm was a little small but quite big enough for what you needed. The staff were very helpful (except the transportation desk girl who looked like she really didnt care) the doorman even booked us a taxi to take us to the airport when we were leaving. Safety deposit boxes were in reception free of charge for our stay, this was really handy, and we could change our travellers cheques at the front desk. We found this hotel in an ideal location, right on times square which was where most of the day trips we took picked up, and where all of the quick restaurants such as planet hollywood and Hard Rock were situated. the half price ticket booth was also right facing if you went out the back door.

Reviews.Title: “There is probably better choices”
Reviews.Author: LoneRangerAndFamily
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 days at the end of july with our 2 daughters in a 2 queen beds room. Everything has been said about the Edison. Ideally located, you really are on Time Square but a bit shabby. That's just true. If you are in New York to spend your time as the usual tourist you won't care that much about the tiny bathroom and lack of ice machines or kettles. If you like staying in a comfy, spacious, modern room, you're in the wrong place. We read the reviews on TripAdvisor so we haven't be surprised by the Edison but still we've been disappointed for two reasons. The first two nights were OK but the last night, we had really noisy neighbours who enjoyed watching TV late and loud and we realized the wall were quite thin. so if you're unlucky enough to get careless neighbours you could be in for a bad night. Secondly, the hotel was implementing a new pay per view system and it was clearly not working. They charged us for a movie we were supposed to have been watching and when we complained at the desk they made some research to find that the movie was viewed in our room at a time we were still in a restaurant. They agreed it was a mistake but told us they could'nt do nothing and had to make an official inquiry. It was two months ago and we are still waiting for a refund. Not really encouraging. Next time we will try a more professionnal hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Super Service”
Reviews.Author: BonJean
Reviews.Content: I was on a tour and had no choice in hotels so I didn't know what to expect. I was so happy with the hotel and the service. I stayed there for two days in mid-Sept. and the location was great, not to mention the room itself. While the view wasn't good, I didn't go there to stay in the room and look out the windows. It was a spacious room compared to the other two hotels I have stayed at in Mid-town Manhattan. My daughter from Brooklyn wanted to spend the last night with me and when I called the desk,the man there sent up a roll-away, and when I asked how I could pay for it since I was on a tour, the man (whose name I forget, sorry) told me it would be free. I would stay at the Edison again in a heartbeat. We had tickets to Grease and the theatre is literally next door. Can't get any more convenient than that. I loved everything about the Edison!

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, but.........”
Reviews.Author: nuthirty
Reviews.Content: The room did not look anything like the picture on the internet. There is absolutely no extras in your room. No coffee maker in the room, no ice machines anywhere and no extra blankets. The location is great and the staff is great, but the room is horrible. There was cigarette burns in the carpeting and the linens on the bed and the pillows were old, old, old. There is wireless interent, but it is $10 per day. The worst thing is there was mice in my room. I called downstairs and they sent a maid up with a sheet of sticky paper to put behind the tv. Will never stay there again unless they do some renovations.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: LimaYork
Reviews.Content: Great location,just 50metres to Times Square so can't fault it on that, the only thing really to complain about is the rooms are getting a little shabby and the bathroom could do with new taps and a re-groute and new shower curtains. But overall hotel is quite pleasant just small and overpriced like the rest of the hotels in NYC!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location...”
Reviews.Author: italohio1985
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights at the Edison in a one bedroom suite. I'll start with the very best part, the location. Right in Times Square and the Theater District, walking distance to multiple restaurants, theaters, the TKS Box Office, the touristy double decker bus stops, a Starbucks, cabs everywhere...all this and a very affordable price. The room was clean, and the size was adequate. The sofa bed was a little tough to pull out, but it was fine, about as comfortable as a sofa bed can be. The air conditioner in the bedroom was good and seemed to be about 20 years newer than the unit in the living room. The bathroom was small, but fine. The shower, once you figure out how to control thw water temperature, was fine. This hotel does not provide small bottles of shampoo/conditioner, but rather give little packets, almost like free samples that would come in the mail. The staff was fine, not friendly, but they were professional. The Cafe Edison is perfect for breakfast. Very affordable and the food was good. One major complaint, there are ZERO ice machines for the customers. In order to get a bucket of ice, you have to call the desk and have it brought to you by a bellman. A minor complaint for such a great location. I would definitely stay there again. It's New York City, there's no reason to spend that much time in your hotel room any way!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location......thats about it.”
Reviews.Author: shane_campbell
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Edison has a great location, just steps from Times Square. Thats about the only good thing about the hotel. When stepping in the lobby, you can see the dirty chairs in the lobby. The front desk staff were not that friendly. After check in, we proceded to the elevators. There was a very nasty smell beside the elevators, we have realized that this was comming from the bar that is beside the elevators. We proceded to our rooms. The hallways were dingy and very dirty. Looks like the carpet did not see a vaccum in years. The doors looked very ratty and old. We proceeded to our room, 839, which was a struggle to find due to the hallways not having signs in them directing you which way to go. The hotel does not number the rooms like a normal hotel. The room looked shabby in general. The air conditioner looked like it saw better days and sounded like a airport runway when you would turn it on. The bathroom and closet doors did not shut properly, nor did the bathroom door lock. Not too great when you have people comming and going at different times of the day. Now on to the shower. This had to be the worst shower that I have ever used in a hotel. The water went from cold to hot and vice versa. No happy medium. The shower acted like a garden hose. Not that great. The Cafe Edison was horrible for customer service, half of the employes could not speak proper english, however, the food was good and extermely fast. We paid over $350.00 USD for that room. Much more hotels in NYC that are better priced and will give you what you pay for. All in all, it was a good location. If your there to sleep, and NOTHING else, its acceptable. If you want to shower and have some form of customer service, look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great holiday”
Reviews.Author: dizzyjo
Reviews.Content: My family (group of 12 of us) and I went to NY August this year and stayed at the Hotel Edison. Between us we had 4 rooms. I had some worries because of reviews I had read. I can honestly say that we had no problems with the cleanliness of the rooms - they were spotless - and our beds were comfy. The bathroom was also very very clean - just a bit in need of some care (basin had a little crack and grouting round bath needed re-doing) but they were only minor things. Another criticism was the size of the rooms - but we found them to be quite adequate for what time you spend there. As everyone has said - location was all. So close to Times Square (bit noisy at night - but earplugs work well) and right in the Broadway district. The staff were a bit grumpy at times (we had a mix up with rooms at start but this was sorted out fine). We had breakfast every morning in the Cafe Edison and would recommend it. Go early and you don't have to queue. All in all, I wouldn't hesitate to say don't be put off by other bad reviews. We had a fantastic holiday and would definitely stay at the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “OK with NO Service”
Reviews.Author: Deanne08
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Edison in the beginning of June 2008. We stayed for 5 nights. Our room was comfortable - a little bit dated, but it was not disgusting, but no view, which was fine and we did not expect anything. The issue I had with the hotel was that we had a baby we were bottle feeding, we had just come from Europe and had no issues travelling with our baby in Europe and expected it to be the same. I rang the hotel reception when we arriived to ask if there was possibilty of a kettle or microwave and I was happy to pay more for it. But they advised they did not offer this service and it was bad luck and it was our problem, we should have been more organised. They advised that the hot water was good enough, but every morning we would let it run for about 15 minutes before the hot water would kick in and then you did not need to run the cold tap either to have a shower. I then asked where our cot was and they told me to ring housekeeping, after 3 phonecalls and 2hrs later our cot arrived with no blankets and just a sheet. I also asked reception about our bathroom light as we could not find a light in our bathroom... They advised that every room was different and we would have to work it out for ourselves... after 2 days of darkness, we realised we had found our light switch, but the light did not work unless you shake the fitting... so that worked out... After talking to reception originally, we did not bother them as every time we talked to them about something that involved customer service it was a problem. As a positive I can say the location of Hotel Edison was good. If you have babys or special requests or require service from the staff this is NOT the place for you... but otherwise good location.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Edison”
Reviews.Author: juicyfruit274
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel twice now and loved it. The hotel is right in the middle of Times square and is such good value for money. I have been to New York 5 times and this is by far the best!! the rooms are fine and the staff are friendly. Weever ate in the hotel as there are soooo many places to eat in NY but if you want a very central clean good value for money hotel head here and you wont fo wrong!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location but small rooms and bad service”
Reviews.Author: Zoroy
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights here, and it is only a couple of blocks from times square and a few more to central park, but the front desk staff were quite rude and no one wanted to help us out with anything (our first time to NYC). The rooms are very small and dated, but price reflects this. So an affordable option but don't expect any service at all, we were pretty disapointed on that front.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but flawed in some important areas.”
Reviews.Author: coldal
Reviews.Content: The great thing about the Edison is location, location, location! Just off Times Square it is convenient for many of NY's attractions and the subway. The Hotel itself however is badly in need of a makeover. It is shabby, lacks a number of basics like adequate guest sitting space at street level and the rooms are badly in need of modernisation. The street level grand art-deco foyer seems to be constantly busy with people coming, going or waiting yet the hotel fails to provide enough seating. The Cafe Edison is good for breakfasts but often gives rise to queues to be sitted, and getting an evening coffee or just a relaxing seat proved impossible. Our 7th floor double room had no view at all and was surprisingly small and shabby. There is supposed to be a modernisation program taking place, and to be fair it is an enormous hotel, but there are some basics that need to be sorted also. Other gripes included just tepid water from the "hot" tap both in the shower and wash basin, and check the cleanliness of the cups in the cafe, lipstick marks appeared on more than one occasion on "clean" cups!

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: GKing62
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Edison last september, & loved it s much gonna do it again this september!! We even got to meet Garth Brookes outside Radio City , great place to be based when staying in the big apple.

Reviews.Title: “All around great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: typer-girl
Reviews.Content: I took my 16-year-old son to NYC August 13th, the first visit for both of us. After reading all of the reviews about NYC hotels, including this one, I have come to the conclusion that people just like to complain. We had an excellent stay. The room was average size of any other hotel room (certainly not small), very clean, comfortable bed, and friendly staff. If I have anything to say about the room it would be that the shower temperature varied. Considering all other hotels were upwards of $400+ per night, I considered this a bargain (paid $200) and expected to get what I paid for. I was pleasantly surprised. If you want 5-star, then go to the Waldorf Astoria. This hotel was right next door to the theater where we saw Grease and right in the middle of Times Square. The concierge was very helpful also.

Reviews.Title: “honeymoon heaven”
Reviews.Author: badloose1980
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the edison in mid june, as part of our honeymoon. we were only in New York for 3 days and we were so lucky to stay at the Edison for it's perfectly central location. The subway is only 2 minutes walk away and the shops, restaurants and Times Square is just round the corner. We had one of the superior rooms on floor 7, the room was a little old-looking and the walls and windows had definately seen better days but the room on the whole was perfectly adequate. The bed was huge and very comfy. We booked a show through the concierge which was fab and he was very friendly, we also asked him about where to eat etc. He was very helpful and knowledgeable. Overall a very pleasant stay, just to mention the diner attached to the ground floor is fab for a cheap breakfast. I hope to stay again soon

Reviews.Title: “hotel from hell”
Reviews.Author: TCFWexford
Reviews.Content: just got back from holidays having stayed in the edison for 6 of our 10 nights away. what a dump this place is. there were 6 of us in the party and not one of us has a good thing to say about the place. when we arrived at the hotel we were all a litttle shocked not like the brochures at all everything was so shabby. when my fiance and i went to our room i almost cried when i saw it. the bed was tiny, not a lot bigger than a single. having worked in the hotel accommodation business for over 10 years i was shocked. i know from experience that no american couple would put up with the size of that bed. we went to reception to complain and found the receptionist to be rather rude and unhelpful, she told us that we had already been upgraded ( i'd like to know from what because it couldn't have gotten any worse) and there was nothing she could do. so we were stuck with it. the room itself was spotless, good bless the housekeeping staff because the place is so shabby, paint flaking off skirting boards, walls were in a desperate need of a lick of paint, sockets hanging off the walls, air conditioning was so noisy it was quieter to leave the window open, but the worst had to be the plumbing, the shower was great if you could regulate the temperature, but that too was so noisy. not only when we used it but also when anyone in the rooms around us used theirs. the pipes rattled and banged all of the time. we could only go to the room to sleep any longer and it would depress us. this hotel needs updating now.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, but service at restaurant could have been friendlier”
Reviews.Author: CC012574
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel!! We were there from Aug 7th-10th and stayed in room 1414. Our room was of average size and very clean, didn't worry to much about room service being done for the 4 days that we were there so kept a privacy key in the lock, staff called night of the 8th asking us if we needed anything which I thought was thoughtful. The bar staff were great, the restaurant staff on the other hand weren't so friendly-you felt like you were being rushed through your meals. The hotel is basically located near all the sightseeing, and Broadway Shows-got to see CHICAGO it was great! Front desk and all other staff were friendly. No bugs in our room, the a/c worked minimally, but still kept us cool at night. The beds are a little hard to sleep on, but by the time you are done running around the city of NY your to exhausted to care and I found myself falling asleep very quickly. If you are someone who is looking for something "amazing" my suggestion is go somewhere else. Just to save you time from complaining. With us, all we needed was a roof over our heads, bathroom, a bed to sleep on and nice meals, some place that we would enjoy, and The Hotel Edison surpassed all our expections! This vacation was great, and will re-book with this hotel again in the near future if we go back.

Reviews.Title: “Good for your money”
Reviews.Author: PurpleZebra
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is quite old, but I have stayed there three times and each time my experience was a little different. The lobby was lavishly decorated, but everything else (the elevator and hallways) seemed a little dark and old. The rooms were not bad at all, a little small (but all NYC hotel rooms are tiny) and actually quite modern. It was clean and the hotel location was convenient. I couldn't hear the craziness that is Times Square from my room, which was a good thing. The hotel's rates seem to fluctuate quite a lot depending on the season. But if you are able to get a good deal, I would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: seadoogal
Reviews.Content: My 19 year old daughter and I travelled to New York City from Brantford, Ontario for the Canadian August long weekend. We had tickets to see Wicked on Broadway and stay 2 nights in the hotel of our choice and dinner at the restaurant of our choice. The package was purchased on-line about 8 weeks in advance. We decided on the Edison because of it's close proximity to Broadway, Times Square and many other attractions including shopping. Yes, this hotel is getting a little dated but for the price it is perfect because of it's location. All the West-side Manhattan hotels are getting dated but that is not why we came. We were quoted a room with 2 twin beds and ended up with 2 double beds instead! The room was very clean especially the bathroom. Our theatre tickets and other vouchers were being held at the front desk for us and the staff could not have been nicer. They were always very helpful as was the conceirge and parking valets. We had no problems with bugs or with any of the plumbing. We stayed in room 1204. I was a little worried before we went after booking this hotel and then reading the reviews on this site. This was my second time in NYC and I wanted to stay in a different hotel than the first time just to experience somewhere new. We were not disappointed. I always say "Treat people the way you want to be treated". If you do have a problem, don't take it out on the staff. People come to New York and expect to be pampered like Royalty but I have travelled a lot and realize that it is one of the most expensive places to stay. We ate breakfast in the Cafe and it was good. We were a little disappointed that it closes at 7:30 in the evening because we like to dine late but it was no big deal. There are hundreds of restaurants nearby. We had a great time. Everything was within walking distance and we will stay at this hotel again next trip!!!

Reviews.Title: “Be Afraid”
Reviews.Author: NolaHal
Reviews.Content: We arrived in NYC late one evening to see a show and a museum exhibit the next day. We got the room for $200, but at the expense of our emotional health. The place is creepy. The "gorgeous" lobby is more Fascist Classic than Art Deco. The room was larger than most Manhattan hotels and was close to the theatre--but someone had recently set fire to the bedspread, presumably (hopefully) while smoking. I would have run to the busy, impersonal lobby and asked for another room, but the reviews were so awful--and we had so little time--that I was afraid we'd just end up in a mildewed, bug-ridden room. We stayed where we were and opened the windows. There's still smoke in our clothes. So, the faint praise: if every single room in Midtown was full, I'd stay here again, if only for the location and the lightening-swift elevators. But if you have more than two pennies to rub together, stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, dated hotel.”
Reviews.Author: dippyhippy
Reviews.Content: Stayed for four nights with 2 daughters, aged 16 and 12 in a two queen bed room. Upon arrival, one person helped us with the bags from the taxi into the lobby then another man took the cases to the room which we thought was weird and meant double tips!! Asked at check-in for a rollaway bed which came immediately. The room was average size and had an unremarkable view of a side street. We thought well!, we won't be in here much BUT the biggest grumble is the AIR CON which is useless and you won't sleep because it is SO hot and humid!!! The bathroom was tiny and the shower alternates between warm and scalding. On our first day we returned to the room at 5pm to change and wash for the evening and found that the room hadn't been made up. Whilst we were there the maid came in. We said come back in 10 mins. as we were almost ready to go, but no-one came back to do the room. As we were all sleeping un-covered due to the heat, the beds were ok but we had no clean towels for morning. The other main grumble was there was no lock on the door so housekeeping could enter at any time. At other hotels we have stayed in, there is a bar on the door which allows housekeeping to only slightly open the door. Over-all the location of The Edison is excellent, right in the heart of theatre distict and within easy walking distance of Broadway, restaurants, shopping, central park, ESB, Rockefelller centre, buses and subway. The hotel is of Art Deco style and is clean but out-dated. Our daughters remarked that it felt like Disney's 'Tower of Terror' !!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff...”
Reviews.Author: emma99London
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival we were shown to our twin bedrooms however the beds had not been made. Went to reception desk and they said they didn't know what had happened and that we would have to sleep in a double rooms (was sharing with my mum so wasn't a huge deal). Were told we could change the next morning but we didn't as we wanted to get on with the trip. Unfortunately i had lost my passport between JFK airport and the hotel so was a bit paniked for the 1st day in not knowing what to do, however the hotel staff were very helpful and got me the right people to speak to, luck had it passport turned up and was handed into the hotel security. Rooms otherwise are basic and the aircon didn't really work that well (so if there during a New York Summer, good luck!). Location was great right on Broadway and Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location - Hotel is fine”
Reviews.Author: ChantillyHokieMom
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Edison Hotel 2 nights in July. The location cannot be beat. We saw 3 plays - Little Mermaid is literally next door (we left our room 15 minutes before showtime and had time to spare!) and all of the other theaters are within easy walking distance. The 1/2 price ticket booth is directly across the street - we got excellent seats to Hairspray for $59. The hotel is fine. It's not fancy, but for 1/2 the price (or more) of other hotels in the same area - I don't think you can beat it (we paid $200 a night). The rooms are clean, beds comfortable and our bathroom looked like it had been retiled not too long ago. The concierge was especially helpful in explaining the subway map. I'd recommend this hotel to anyone who wanted to save a few dollars on lodging to spend on great seats at a play or a nice dinner!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: pacino100
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to NYC was great. Edison Hotel was a great location for us to see the city. We could easily catch the subway or walk to Central Park and Rockefeller Center. Several restaurants were nearby as well as the theater district and the heart of Times Square. At night, we always felt like something was happening so we headed to Times Square to check things out. We did not know what to expect in terms of the hotel. The room we had was very small, but we've heard that they are very small in NYC. The service was ok, nothing special. We stayed at this hotel because it was in a good location and affordable. We were so excited so to see the city that we really did not focus too much on the hotel itself. If your hotel stay and service are more important to you, then we would suggest another hotel. We would strongly recommend this hotel for anyone who wants a great location to see the city. And the hotel's diner was great for coffee and breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of Bugs”
Reviews.Author: jtmc7
Reviews.Content: Beware of bugs! Upon returning to our room after the Yankee game in the evening I saw a bug climbing up a pillow on the bed. Upon further investigation, I found 4 more on the bedspread, one on the desk, one on the wall and one on the ceiling. When I lifted up the mattress to see if any were under it, I found a porn mag (but no more bugs). After calling down to the front desk and waiting 15 minutes for someone to come to the room, we called down again. They told us we needed to pack up our belongings and head down to the front desk. When we got there, we were greeted doubtfully, but were given keys to a new room. We hopped in the elevator, and rode up to another room only to find more bugs (different variety) taking up residence along the baseboards. When the front desk was called, they informed us that they weren't sure if they had another room and we needed to come down to the front desk again! We loaded up our luggage again and I brought a few of the bugs I'd killed with a used metrocard as proof down to the front desk. This time the only response the front desk could muster was "That's funny." I They did manage to find us a THIRD room. Despite not having much interest in continuing our stay at this point, we had nowhere else to go. We spent the next hour going through our clothes to make certain there were no stowaways and trying to rid ourselves of that "skin is crawling" feeling and finally got to bed. The good news is that this room appears to be bug free. (I'm writing this from the hotel room without bugs). Beware if you choose to stay here. The location is great but the unwanted roommates are not.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here!”
Reviews.Author: sherrelle
Reviews.Content: I will never stay at the Edison Hotel again! We were traveling in a group and many of the rooms had no air conditioning. Our room had mold all throughout the tile grout and on the shower curtain. The water in the shower went from hot to cold every other minute. There were dust bunnies on the baseboards that looked like they had been there for a year!! The furniture in the lobby looked like they got it out of a dumpster from the street. Very dirty! Old is understandable but dirty and hot is not!

Reviews.Title: “Good location! But nothing else!”
Reviews.Author: Tafki
Reviews.Content: The Edison is located just near Times Square, so it´s easy to get to all interesting locations in New York. Rooms are tiny and everything is old and worn out. Stuff isn´t very friendly, they´ve got their routine with the tourists and that´s it! You should avoid the breakfast, it´s awful! You could get something much more worth the money just two or three blocks from the Edison. Walk in the direction of the Riverside Drive and you´ll find nice cafés which serve a very good breakfast. (I got the best corn muffin I´ve ever had!)

Reviews.Title: “DUMP!”
Reviews.Author: shebalee
Reviews.Content: The lobby of this hotel may be updated, but the bedding and the rooms haven't been redone for probably 20 years! The air conditioning wasn't working properly. The mattresses were worn and terribly uncomfortable. We were moved into a room with a little better A/C, but there was a water leak in the bathroom. We decided we could deal with the leak as long as we had a cool room. One of the knobs in the shower broke off the morning of the day we were leaving. Cheap is not always good. The rooms were gross. They were not clean. I feel like you could get a much better hotel for a little more money. Although this hotel is in a good location, there are lots more to choose from just as conveniently located. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone and will never stay there again!!!

Reviews.Title: “I Will Never Stay In This Hotel Again”
Reviews.Author: palade
Reviews.Content: I used to stay in this hotel several years ago. It was terrible at that time too. Now it is worst. First of all we asked for a different room from begining,the one they gave us was really small and the a/c unit was making noice. Very bad smell ,like mildew... or so. The second room was bigger but more problems. Same kind a smell ,especialy in the bathroom- mildew smell and smell from the next door bathroom each time whem they used the toilet. Very poor bathroom ventilation. The a/c unit was not cooling enough. The carpet was like sea waves and old.It needs to be replace. Old furniture and in poor condition. The bed sheet had holes on it and it was nor replaced in one week. The pillows were small and old and only two. The lamp was not working in the room. The shower head was spraying water allover the bathroom. The towels where old and coarse. Very poor lighting in the bathroom.The room was not cleaned properly every day. There is no signs on the floor with the room numbers to direct you to your room. Very poor lighting in the hallway. I WILL NEVER STAY IN THIS HOTEL EVER.

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect much from the Edison...”
Reviews.Author: ajkst19
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our stay at the Edison Hotel in New York City. They recently remodeled the decorations in the hotel to resemble Art Deco. The staff was VERY friendly and the hotel was easy to navigate. We did not stay long enough to investigate very much. The hotel room was simple, but we couldn't help but notice a musty, damp odor in the room every time we opened the door. The room provided a quiet place to rest and sleep and it got the job done, but do not expect luxury or mints on your pillows while at this hotel. Our air conditioner was very old fashioned and barely worked, which was unfortunate since we were visiting New York City on, quite possibly, the HOTTEST day of the year (98 degrees F). Evetually, we got used to it since we only stayed one night, but it is safe to stay that our 1 night stay at the hotel was below average.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away stay far away”
Reviews.Author: Einsteinian
Reviews.Content: Front desk staff and manager of the day was very rude. I was traveling is a small group and I was rooming with a fairly new to me traveling companion. We had 1 dpuble bed that we insisted that we had reserved two and they would not budge or try to help us by assigneing another room. The room was old, tattered, wallpaper falling off, unsafe electric outlets, bathroom tiles loose and grout filthy and hallways dark, dingy and old old old. Location was perfect but next to such beautiful hotels it made me sad. We spent so much money on the room but it was horrible.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: OklahomaStateFan
Reviews.Content: After reading earlier reviews we were very uneasy about what our accommodations would be like at the Edison. Much better than expected. The room was clean and adequate. We must have had one of the refurbished rooms because it was ok. If you're looking for a Marriott or a Westin, it's certainly not. But if you want a reasonable place to sleep at night and in the middle of Broadway and Times Square this is it. Always had plenty of hot water and cool air-the real necessities of life after touring NYC all day long in the hot humidity. Bathroom was small, but a fairly large closet. Our beds were clean and comfortable. Location was fantastic--"Grease" was right next door!! Gray Line tours departed from within a block of hotel. Subway stations close. Rockefeller Center easy walking distance. Food in the Cafe Edison was extremely reasonably priced and good. Nothing elaborate but what we needed. Our granddau left her cell phone lying on the sill of a window we looked out of at the end of a hall. We got a call from her dad at home. Someone had found her phone, security had scrolled down the list of names and found "Dad", called Dad, and he called us. Phone located and called us before we even missed it. Thought that was pretty good service!! Our check in was easy, doormen, bellhops, and concierge all very helpful. Danny's Deli 2 doors down-good snacks at reasonable price. Overall a good experience for us!!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Location and pleasant staying”
Reviews.Author: Gingerpippa
Reviews.Content: I spent there a whole week with my friends. The lobby is beautiful. The famous cafeteria (also Neil Simons wrote about it) is quite good and I suggest people to have their breakfast there because the price (to be in NY) is very competitive and although the service is sometime rushed, it is very efficient. We booked 2 double rooms. They were small sized but although old fashioned and a bit shabby, very comfortable and clean (I used to work in the same kind of hotel in London UK, and having seeing the cleaners making the room in the Edison Hotel, I can say the level of cleanness was good. I saw the girls changing the bedcovers when the guests were leaving… in London doesn’t happen often). The front desk staff and the concierge service were friendly and professional. Some of them could speak Italian and Spanish (I’d like to emphasize this as my mates were Italian and sometime needed a little help)and I have to say the small gift shop had good prices in comparison with the same kind of shops in the same area. If you have cards to be posted, you can leave them with the shop staff and they will provide to post them for you. The hotel position is exceptional, especially for a first timer visitor. The area is noisy and busy but could be fun during the night. There is a good pizza parlor on the 47th street just 50 mt off the Edison Hotel. The name is Carve and is good for quick snack.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect base”
Reviews.Author: Dirtyminx2004
Reviews.Content: Myself and my boyfriend stayed at Edison hotel in March for four nights! We werent expecting to be astounded by it so thought it was great place for us. The bedroom's decor is out of date but all we wanted were compfy beds and a decent shower!its smack bang in middle of all the action - 2 blocks from subway-no distance at all!The main thing for us that it was safe. You hear of all these horror stories of wallet's, gifts etc being robbed from hotel room. Security was excellent at edison as there is a security guard at elevator's making sure you have room key etc. That was really reassuring. There is a brilliant deli two doors down which is fab!fresh fruit, french toast, breakfasts etc so we would just grab fruit in the mornings. Times square is quite expensive to eat in so having that deli right next door was very handy. The hotel has everything you need and even has internet room where you just feed pc dollar notes. There is a luggage room and restaurant and bar etc. There are also loads of pubs in neighbourhood and few broadway shows on same street so you do not have to go far at all!It is very loud area but surprisingly not noisy from bedroom. If you are just looking for a base and a hotel where you will just be getting few hours kip, I would definitely reccomend the Edison. Really no point in forking out loads of cash if you aren;t going to get out of it. Had fab holiday and will be returning for a girly holiday!

Reviews.Title: “THE place to stay in Times Square!”
Reviews.Author: Yamaha-gal
Reviews.Content: My family and I booked the Edison Hotel upon recommendation of a freind who had stayed there previously. We had a combo suite which was very convenient for our family with two teenage boys. The rooms were adequate and cleaned every day. Yes, it is an older hotel, but it met all our needs. The location for proximity to shows and subway was terrific. It has a nice little cafe and a fine dining restaurant as well. Concierge was very helpful and the staff was friendly. There are numerous places to grab a quick bite or sit and have a meal in this area. We would most definetly recommend this hotel to our friends. The price was good and we would certainly stay there again if we ever have the opportunity to visit again. Rudy and Alma Singleton St. John's, Nl Canada

Reviews.Title: “Dated Decor, Smelly Room”
Reviews.Author: JayBansal
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a great location being in Tmes Sqaure and has enough room to but your shopping in but the decor is very dated! So are the bedding sheets. The duvet cover smelt of body odour and urine. When we phoned to get it changed, a member of house keeping came (after 20 mins) and she had not understood what we had needed changing even though we had said it in plain English. She was rude about it as well telling us that we should have said what the problem was (thats why she was there?!?!) The bathroom was small and the towel railing kept falling on the floor. It is a cheaper hotel to stay in but I would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay in New York”
Reviews.Author: marge08
Reviews.Content: We had the best time at Edison in New York!!! Special thanks to Ryan at Front desk, very professional and helpful! We liked our room 2200 very much, and would definitely like to come back. Our room was a "combo two bedroom" so our sons had their own room, and there was a TV in each room. We had a great view from the windows as we were on the 22nd floor. And the best thing is the location: couldn´t be better with Times Square just one minute away.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable and a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: MrsH09
Reviews.Content: I was a bit concerned after reading the reviews of this hotel but I had no reason to worry. OK, it's a little dated and the rooms are quite small, but who goes to New York to stay in their room all day? My son and I went for 4 nights and we used the room purely to sleep (comfortable clean beds) and shower (hot water and very clean bathroom). The maid came in every day and we had clean sheets and towels each time. And the hotel is in a fantastic location - literally on the doorstep of Times Square. We were on the 9th floor and had no noise at all - the air conditioning was a little noisy but we were so tired we had no problems sleeping through that! So if you've booked this hotel, don't worry. It's great - clean, comfortable and a fantastic location. Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Expensive New York!”
Reviews.Author: Lodge18
Reviews.Content: We went to New York for four nights for my Birthday in May. We chose the Hotel Edison after reading many reviews on Trip advisor. We decided to go for the supreme room. When we arrived after a terrible taxi ride the staff were rather unfriendly, almost rude. We went up to our room on the seventh floor, which was dark and shabby. It was a large clean room with sofa, king size bed, TV etc (no coffee machine/kettle tho) but could really do with being refurbished. The best/ almost only thing going for the hotel is its location!! From what we heard tho all of New York hotels are very expensive and normally the rooms are tiny. If your going to New York you must try this wonderful Cuban restaurant for lunch or dinner Guantanamera 939 8th Ave it was $15 for a 3-course lunch, which was lovely. Also Mint restaurant (Indian) 150 E 50th street, between Lexington Ave & 3rd Ave.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but okay”
Reviews.Author: UkGeordieontour
Reviews.Content: If you want a base in central Broadway then the Edison is okay. If you want luxury amidst splendid surroundings and decor then this is not the place for you. The staff were reasonably helpful. The room was very basic with no tea/coffee making facilities or refrigerator. Generally the Hotel was a little shabby and badly in need of some refurbishment. However, considering the price and location I would use this place in future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel.. Great Location.. Clean - What more do you need!!??”
Reviews.Author: jules_ferns
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Edison last month with my boyfriend and it was our first time in New York. The hotel is ideally located, one min away from times square! The room was average size, clean and the room was tidied and bed was made everyday. Towels were changed everyday - which we did not expect - so that was a nice bonus! The concierge in the lobby was very helpful with any queries we had and arranged a taxi for us getting back to the airport! At the end of the day you visit New York with the intention of cramming everything into a few days - so you are only in your room to sleep. Please ignore reviews that are negative of this hotel, when we go back to New York we are definitely coming back here!! The style of the hotel is art deco so is bound to look old fashioned - those who reviewed it saying it was shabby and dumpy obviously cant appreciate the style of the hotel! A ******

Reviews.Title: “I Loved This Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: bigmacca1916
Reviews.Content: I really loved our stay at the Edison. Its not the most glamourous looking place but I've really seen worse! We got a really good deal for our room - 2 queen size beds and had a really good stay. The bathroom isn't massive but its fine. Was surprised that the small hair dryer in the bathroom was so powerful - not having to take your own hair dryer really saves space! The free safety deposits here are a life saver. Very courtous and speedy service when we checked in and out too. Loved the information service - helped us find great places to eat - Ariba Ariba the Mexican, YUM. The hotel is close to Trattoria Trecalori - try it, again YUM. For breafast we ate at the hotel - fast service and very good prices. Loved the pancakes! We loved the food in New York, we spent most of our time eating. Luckily that you do so much walking in New York to burn off all the extra calories! Wear comfy shoes! The location is amazing - at the heart of Times Square. Right opposite the TKTS booth if you want to go catch a Broadway show. We went to see Grease which was just down from the hotel too. I'm going back to New York. It was amazing. And when I go back I will go back to The Edison.

Reviews.Title: “best location”
Reviews.Author: nikifitz
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Edison Hotel in March 2005. It is located just off Times Square. You walk out of the the hotel, turn right and within the next 20 seconds your standing in the square. This hotel is decorated in an art noveau style and is really stunning as you walk towards the reception area. They have a cafe/breakfast area next door but accessible through the hotel where you go in the mornings which doesn't look much, but does nice food. This hotel is quite a way from areas such as the staute of liberty etc but it so easy to get around New York with millions of yellow taxis and the subway aswell. I'd recommend this hotel because its extremely good value for money. The rooms are comfortable and clean with huge televisions, they are quite basic rooms but you can upgrade to better rooms. The Edison is a short walk to resturant row which i'd recommend you to visit as there numerous restaurants which serve great food at good prices. For shopping theirs obviously Macy's, Saks which is similar to Macys, then next to the World Trade Centre site there is a shop called Century 21 which is like a TK Max but better! Be careful if you walk through Battery Park as when were passing through, there was an audience surrounding a group of breakdancers, we joined the crowd and were nearly pick pocketed! The Empire State builiding is a must see from what i can remember this was quite a walk from the hotel, but as before it is still easy to get to with taxis etc.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: IrelandCarina
Reviews.Content: I went with my best friend for a true shop till you experince in NYC. Upon arriving at the hotel we were slighty shocked as the outside of the hotel is not at all appealing. Inside the lobby was dated and old but clean. We requested a room on a high floor to reduce to volume of noise and we were given this. We had a view of Times Square-you had to hang out the window to see it but it was still a view!. We found the room to be clean but the decor had seen better days. We had two double beds which were very comfortable. All in all the room was nothing special but as we spent most of our time out enjoying the sights this was not a problem. There is a cafe ajoining the hotel-breakfast was not included-which we went to one day and was very nice. New visitors to New York beware postions of food sizes are huge! We ordered 4different things each on the menu and nearly died when we saw the amount of food put in front of us! It was good value of money though. The next day we discovered a brilliant deli just a few doors up with a great selection at very little cost. The best thing about this hotel though was definatley the location . Its located right in centre of Times Square. We found it very easy to walk to all the main attractions- both shops and sights-from the hotel. If you are interested in seeing a show many of the theatres are so close you can see them from the window. All in all it was a very pleasant stay and apart from the dated decor we couldnt complain.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Desdaway
Reviews.Content: I stayed here over New Years Eve for 6 nights so it was obviously a very busy time. The rooms and bathrooms are very small but they are clean and you don't spend much time in the hotel anyway. We had a few problems with the room - the heater was broken causing it to make loud noises and the plumbing was old which ment that we were hearing random (and loud) noises when ever anyone else in the hotel had a shower - as the hotel was full for the first three days we couldn't move but were moved as soon as another room became available. The Conceirge was excellent (1 in particular) and found us last minute broardway tickets and helped with other tours etc. The Hotel is about 20 steps outside of the middle of Times Square so the location is PERFECT for Broardway, Hop on Hop off tours and lots of different food options - which is great because the Edison Resturant is quite poor. As NYE is so busy in NYC i booked 12 months in advance and looked at hundreds of hotels and while all hotel increased their prices before Jan 1st the Edison was the cheapest in the location i wanted and for what i paid and considering the location i found the Hotel to be an excellent choice - probably not the best though if you are used to upmarket hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Dumpiest of all Dumps”
Reviews.Author: sunnysuzy5
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for work and chose it for price and convenience of location. It was definitely NOT worth the savings. To say that it is shabby and outdated is an understatement! My two partners and I got a "junior suite" with one queen bed and a pull out couch...Not one of us would sleep on or in the couch...it was scary! So, we all had to sleep in the queen bed!!!! Thank GOD my partners are my mom and sister!!! In the halls and rooms, paint was peeling, carpets were grungy and everything seemed to be in disrepair! To top it all off, we had breakfast in the dump they call a restaurant and it was disgusting as well. I WILL NEVER go back to that place again and neither will anyone from my company!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Parents Beware!!”
Reviews.Author: joelea
Reviews.Content: Our high school music group booked this hotel through a travel agent months before going there. The agent asked that the group be put on the same floor. Upon arriving there the sponsor found that the 4 boys with 2 sponsors were put on the 12th floor. four 17 year old girls were put in a room on another floor, and a 17, 15 , 6 year old girls along with their 19 year old female sponsor were put on another floor. The sponsor asked if they could all be moved to at least all on the same floor but was told the hotel was full, so we had one group of 17 year old girls on a floor in a room all by theirselves without a sponsor in their room as we were told they girls rooms would be next to each other, and we only had l female sponsor. The hotel had no concern for the safety of 17 year old girls staying alone in a room in their hotel. As a parent I think the safety of a hotels quests should be a great concern of a hotel, but unfortunately it is not of the Edison. Also rooms were in poor shape and smelled.

Reviews.Title: “diabolical”
Reviews.Author: edwinfromengland
Reviews.Content: hotel was in complete chaos when we checked in. door key did not work when we tried to enter room, and was told by staff member to" treat the lock like a woman, and coax it gently.". on entering room and pulling bedspread down there was an ink stain below it and the sheets were grubby and looked as though the previous occupant had just left.the porters were arguing with eachother in front of me as if I didn't exist. we checked out straight away.I would only recomend this hotel too my worst enemy.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby”
Reviews.Author: southerne8
Reviews.Content: This hotel was shabby and tattered. Rooms were very small and uninviting. Sheets were very thin and pillows were on the flat side. Bathroom did not have a counter top to place things on, just a small narrow shelf above the lavatory. Carpets needed a good shampoo or replacement. Hallway walls had scaring and marks on them. The lobby sofas had stains on them and the arms of the sofas were worn and starting to tear. What's so sad is that you could tell that it must have been beautiful when it was first opened in the 1930s. I will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: skymasterztl
Reviews.Content: This was a pretty large hotel on a side road of the north end of Times Square. There was a restaurant joining the main lobby, good for breakfast or a decent lunch. Service was average, we were upgraded to a junior suite which was quite large. It included a living area with a pullout couch/bed and a separate queen bedroom. Decor was definitely dated, but it added personality to the building. Location was pretty much the best part of the hotel, we were able to walk everywhere. The metro station was only a block away also for trips farther then a walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Run - don't walk - somewhere else!”
Reviews.Author: poetmom
Reviews.Content: A few weeks ago I booked rooms at the Edison Towers based on pictures available online – which are the same pictured on this site. When I arrived, I was put on the top floor, where the walls in the hallway were partially unpainted, not due to current renovations, but obviously due to age as the paint had peeled off in large areas. The room itself had not been cleaned since the last guest. The bed remained in disarray, dirty towels were on the bathroom floor, and the bathroom sink and shower were filthy. There was, in fact, a disgusting layer of mildew flourishing in the bathtub. I was rather appalled at the 1970’s décor (not retro!), the slouching mattress, the tattered rug, the filthy curtains, and the questionable air unit on which the cover was broken. I did not use the air unit, but based on appearances, it would not have surprised me if it didn’t work at all. I considered pulling up the pictures on the internet again to see if I had lost my mind, but was unable to hook up to the phone jack, which lay in pieces on the floor, unattached to the wall, broken open with exposed metal wires – an obvious fire hazard. While staff immediately sent someone to clean the room, when I requested a different room they brushed me off and told me there was nothing they could do for me as they were completely booked. The manager, though friendlier, was also unable to assist me. He assured me, “we renovate one or two floors every few years,” and though he offered to move me to a new room the next day when several openings were available, he was unsure both whether my original room was on a renovated floor and if any of the rooms coming open would be renovated and in better condition. A poorly informed staff unable to provide satisfactory solutions combined with appallingly substandard accommodations offered at standard NYC rates – not ghetto rates – convinced me to move immediately to another hotel – which is exactly my recommendation for anyone considering staying here: run, don’t walk, somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Edison Hotel - OK for the price and location!”
Reviews.Author: Happy-Islanders
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Edison April 19-20 to see a show at Carolines. It was a decent experience, although, if you are expecting a luxurious experience, stay somewhere else. It was fine for us staying one night, but if we were staying there for multiple nights it would have been an issue... The place needs some serious TLC. It seemed like they started doing renovations and just stopped. We had a room on the top floor and the paint and carpets were atrocious. The room itself was large, however, there was one full size bed in it which didn't make sense to us since it was a larger room. Being my husband is 6'4", if we had known we were going to get a full sized bed (we requested a king) I would have gotten a room with two beds so we could sleep comfortably. Anyway it was one night so we dealt with it. The bathroom in our room was interesting at most --there was a random leak in the corner, hairdryer was busted and the swimsuit line in the shower was also busted and rusted. Like I said, a little TLC would do some good. What bothered me in particular the most was the lobby area. It looked fine from afar, however, when I looked at the furniture closely, it was disgusting - black and ultra-dirty. The likes of something you would see someone throwing out after a garage sale. It looks like it hadn't been updated or cleaned in 20+years. With that said, the service and employees at the Edison were extremely professional and courteous which goes a long way. The bar downstairs was rickety, but we enjoyed the drinks and the after-theater crowd. See the bartender, Ty, and ask him for a liquid cocaine shot - the bar will seem much better after you have one ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Lovely old hotel”
Reviews.Author: BELFASTS-BEST
Reviews.Content: If anyone wants a super modern hotel forget it, you won't get it at the Edison, but what you will get is an elegant old hotel in all it's original glory, with all the mod cons i.e. hairdryer, powerful shower, iron & board in the rooms and internet access in the lobby. It retains all of it's old charm and you can just imagine being there when the hotel was first built. The rooms are spacious and clean with plenty of storage, but some rooms may be a wee bit dark depending on what room you get. There is a walk in closet where you can hang your clothes and store your cases (and where the iron & board and phone books are stored just in case you need the use of them) The maid comes in everyday to clean and change the towels. The room also has an air conditioning unit which you can also use to heat the room if you're feeling a wee bit chilly. As the hotel has many floors there are six lifts which you don't spend any time waiting for as they are very quick. I was very surprised at the speed of the lifts when I first got into them, so you're not wasting any of your precious holiday time. The Edison is right in the heart of Times Square which is the best place to be if it's your first time in New York. When you exit the hotel by the main entrance and turn right you are only a few yards away from Times Square and when you turn left when you exit the hotel you are only two streets away from Hells Kitchen. The staff are polite and helpful and there is 24 hour housekeeping just in case you need it, which I did and they were very prompt. You may be asked by a member of staff for to show your room key just before you get into the lift which I found really good as it was reassuring that no one who wasn't meant to be there was going to gain access to any of the floors. After checking out you can leave your luggage in a secure area for only 50c if your flight isn't until late. Some reviews on this hotel had me quite worried but when we arrived at the hotel my worries were banished as we had a great time. I was lucky enough to holiday in New York for my birthday along with my partner and two friends and we had an absolute ball in New York. Some day I hope to visit New York again and if I do I will certainly be staying at the Edison. I have already recommended this hotel to everyone that I have told about my stay in NY and a couple of them are booking for next year. So folks have a great holiday when you get to NY.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel I've ever seen”
Reviews.Author: lucylover2
Reviews.Content: This hotel was horrible. The lobby was musty with old stained furniture. Then there was the room. It was as big as a cracker box. The carpet was filthy and pulled back from the walls. The wall paper was stained and peeling from the walls. The bed was like an old cardboard box. The sheets were so thin you could see through them, which was not a pretty picture. I literally cried because we were forced to stay the one night. My husband and I slept in our clothes, what little sleep we got. It was the most horrific experience of my life. It was not worth one star and it did not look like any of the pictures I had seen nor did the desciptions fit it. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. Not even Satan.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic time”
Reviews.Author: belfastgirl42
Reviews.Content: stayed in the edison hotel from 5th / 10th may 08 , myself my partner and 2 friends and we all had a fantastic time. to be honest before leaving the uk we went online to read some of the reviews on the hotel and some of them were very off putting and had me a little worried. a lot of the bad reviews were from american people who had stayed there ( no offence meant towards americans ) but the reviews that had been written by anyone from the uk seemed happy enough with their choice of hotel. its in a fantastic location with times square right on the doorstep, the staff are very friendly and helpful. the rooms may not be massive but big enough and very clean ( the maid is in every day to clean and also change towels ) the bed is really comfortable and the shower very powerful. for the ladies there is no need to pack a hairdryer as there is one in the bathroom and also an iron and board in the walk in wardrobe / cupboard. to be honest there is so much to do and see in new york that we were out first thing on a morning and returning when it was time to go to bed. the bar that is attached to the hotel can be expensive, 2 pints and a brandy and coke was $19 then tip on top so if you fancy a few drinks on a nighttime try finding a bar thats away from times square. if im ever lucky enough to go back to new york id go back to the edison and i would definetly recommend it to my family and friends. we had a ball and hope that you do too

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this dirty hotel with Terrible customer service”
Reviews.Author: 2ColoradoTravelerz
Reviews.Content: I booked a weekend at the Hotel Edison - to surprise my fiance with a weekend in NYC for his birthday. I booked the Edison b/c of it's close proximitly to Times Square and the reviews seemed ok. We've both traveled a lot for business and pleasure, and it's safe to say that our experience here was THE WORST either of us have ever had at any hotel!!! It was one awful thing after another... when we arrived, the bell hop overcharged me for holding my bags, then the first staff member was rude when she gave us our room assignment and key, then we got to our room and opened the door only to find it in complete disarray - it looked like people were still staying there or it hadn't been touched to be cleaned (we didn't walk in any further to see for fear they hadn't checked out), we went back down to get a new room and the next staff member (who we found out later was THE MANAGER ON DUTY) was incredibly rude (again) and not the least bit apologetic. He gave us another key and went we went back upstairs - this time the key didn't work at all so we went back down again. We calmly told him what the situation was and that so far, we were very disappointed in our experience - it was very frustrating. He (the Manager!) told us that THERE ARE PLENTY OF OTHER HOTELS IN THE CITY AND IF WE DIDN'T LIKE IT WE COULD GO STAY SOMEWHERE ELSE! Oh my! We were furious after that and would have stayed somewhere else, but what good would that do us when we'd have been the one to lose the money we already spent on the booking and he'd have gotten away with acting so awful? He didn't even issue an apology for the poor service, raised his voice at us, and was incredibly condescending. A quality, customer-oriented hotel would have offered a warm apology and probably comp'ed us a free breakfast or something just as a nice gesture - instead we got a manager with attitude. Additionally, the room smelled awful and was dirty... even the walls in the hallway looked dirty. Do yourself a favor and AVOID this hotel - spend a few dollars more and stay somewhere where the hotel is clean and the staff is competent. I was so disappointed that my b-day gift to my fiance was marred by the experience at this hotel; thankfully he was gracious about it but he was just as angry and disgusted as I was.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location for Times Square”
Reviews.Author: Glindaba
Reviews.Content: Having not been to New York in four years, we were surprised at how much property prices have risen and, being on a budget, we really struggled to find somewhere decent AND affordable. The Edison is in a great location for Theatre which suited us as this was a "Theatre Trip" (5 shows in 4 days!) and right off Times Square so for that, it was perfect. We had not stayed in this class of property for many years and to be honest, it was something of a shock. The overall feeling was busy and grimy. The staff perform in the classic New York manner of not caring whether you are there or not and did nothing to enhance the trip. Our room (22 floor) was very very basic despite being told this was one of the refurbished ones! Nylon bedspread and none too clean bed linen did not make the bed so inviting, but it was surprisingly comfortable. Stained carpets and poor light fittings added to the general feel of the room. Bathroom small but serviceable. Overall good value for the price but it IS worth paying that little bit extra for additional comfort. The cafe Edison attached to the property offers classic New York food and good breakfasts.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & hotel”
Reviews.Author: AnneNorthWalesUK
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Edison for five nights, it was just what I expected having done my homework!. This is as it states a 1930s hotel, fantastic location, in the heart of Times square. Myself and a friend were on the 5th floor (it has 22), twin room,tv,hairdryer,iron,ironing board,clean and comfortable, there was a minor issue with the tap in the bathroom, we reported this to reception one morning and it had been repaired by the time we returned in the evening.Room size was fine, bathroom small but good enough. The staff were friendly, lady on the transport desk slighty patronising (thats another story). Walk out the main entrance on to 47th st turn right to the junction and you are looking at times square! brilliant, our room was at the rear of the building, no view but great as we could not hear the streets at night. The rear entrance exits to 46th st, opposite you will find a ticket office which opens at 5pm selling knockdown price last minute tickets for broadway shows, as long as you are not too fussy! we saw 'hairspray' for £34.00 each very good, as we had been quoted £80 for grease at normal price.We missed out on seeing Madonna though!. We did not eat or drink at the Edison, not for any reason but we just couldnt wait to be up and out everyday. Great self service coffe/breakfast deli 2 doors away on 47th,(love the Mocha coffee!) at reasonable prices. Go to the comedy club off times square, approx ten dollars, and min 2 drink purchase appr0x 7 dollars each drink, worth going though!. Purchase tour bus tickets, great way to get around, free ferry taxi to staten island, You must pay your respect at ground zero. THE BEST SHOP EVER, CENTURY 21 behind ground zero, bargain designer gear,I purchased KK jeans for approx £18, KK shoes £17 DKNY sandals £12 nine west bag £10.... New York is amazing, very tiring! I hope to go again one day, and will stay at the Edison again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, hotel with character”
Reviews.Author: Rhian666
Reviews.Content: This was our fourth time in NYC but first time in the Edison, we travelled with my husband's daughter and two teenage sons (for their first trip, but not their last!) so had requested one double and one triple room. The rooms were great the triple room had two double beds and was very roomy they were very happy with the room. Ours was a bit smaller with a double bed, t.v. and small built in wardrobe, but sufficient for us. Both rooms were clean and we had clean towels every day. We didn't mind that our room was a bit smaller, as we only use the room to shower and sleep it's not as if you go to NYC to stay in your room! The hotel as a whole was great, it's older but full of character and staff wer helpful and friendly. Location for the hotel was great for Times Square and our breakfast place which we found on our last trip was only a block away. If you want a great breakfast go to the Olympic Diner on 8th Ave just passed 48th Steet, the staff are friendly, efficient and the breakfasts great. I had 2 eggs, fried potatoes and two slices of toast, orange juice and coffee (which they refill free!) all for $5.10, there's a great choice whether your a meat eater or not (which we aren't). We also went to the Scarlatto Restaurant which is a few doors down from the hotel, the food was fabulous we couldn't fault anything, the service and atmosphere was great. Overall we all had a great time and would definately stay at this hotel again. Our rooms were on the 15th floor 1526 triple and 1526 double.

Reviews.Title: “a great stay at the edison”
Reviews.Author: oztraveller53
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Edison with my two daughters for three nights in April. Lobby is an art deco delight. The concierge and security staff were brilliant. We had a combo room which consisted of two rooms, one with a double bed and bathroom and the other with two singles. These were connected by a short corridor. We were on the 21st floor so no traffic noise. Super fast elevator. Rooms were a bit dated but spotless and beds comfortable. the location was perfect. We walked to and from a show (Avenue Q) on Broadway at night with no problems or fears for our safety. Just wish we could have stayed longer. Recommend for excellent value and location

Reviews.Title: “Very poor hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ajl1970
Reviews.Content: Great location for the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. Our first room was the size of a broom cupboard, we couldn't get both our suitcases in too the room. The second room was a little bigger but filthy, dust, dirt and hair everywhere. The lobby looks very nice from a distance but when you sit in the sofas, you notice how tired and used this hotel really is. Also the Cafe Edison has the dirtiest windows I have ever seen, which really sums this hotel up. No way is this a *** star hotel. Tony, London.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Edison - Great location”
Reviews.Author: Shell-TA
Reviews.Content: We just got back yesterday from a 3-night stay at the Hotel Edison. First of all, the location is really great. It's right in Times Square and very convenient to a lot of sites. We had a AAA rate of $215/night for a deluxe room, which included a king bed and pull-out sofa. The room was actually pretty large by New York standards. If we had wanted to bring sleeping bags or Aerobeds, we could have easily fit four people in the room. This room is obviously made for three or four people but they tell you that you can only have two in the room so we didn't tell them our son was with us and booked it for two. My main complaint was that it was noisy (I'm a light sleeper). We were on the 7th floor and could hear a lot of noise from the street. It almost sounded as if the windows were open, but they weren't and they looked new so I don't know why it was like this. But I turned the fan on at night for white noise and that helped a lot. Also, the water in the bathroom would turn freezing cold and scalding hot in an instant. It was impossible to regulate it. I had it set so it was almost cold so that when the hot came on it wouldn't burn me. It was annoying but not so bad that I wouldn't stay there again. The Edison Cafe that is attached was great for breakfast. The food was very good and the service super fast. It is an older hotel but our room was very clean, and the bathroom especially was immaculate. We've previously stayed at the Hilton Times Square and Comfort Inn Midtown but their rates for a room this size were much more so we decided to go with the Edison. At this rate, I'd definitely stay there again but wouldn't want to pay more than $200 - $250 for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: abi-lou-27
Reviews.Content: Location- Well were do I start this hotel is set in the perfect place right in times square the busiest part of new york! No Lie. This hotel is located in the best spot of new york but it does have its downful on noisy cars making noises all night, but i'm use to all that living near a main road. Service- The hotel staff are very helpful in any difficulties or problems that may occur. For example I had difficutly communicating to family and friends back home in the UK but luckily a member of staff of hotel edison had the time to help me to communicate. All staff are willing to help in this hotel and are very polite and welcoming. Rooms- Rooms were very simple and clean to stay in. bedrooms differ all throughout of the hotel so I can't really state every rooom as they differed. My room was on the 12th floor of the hotel and was a good sized as had 3 other students I was stayed with. The bed room had two large beds, t.v, chester draws, bedside cabanet, a table and chair, and two little sofas to look outside the window from. The bathroom was supplied with fresh towels daily and also had a hair dryer included. Although the rooms were perfect, we had some odd creatures in our bath but was no bother as we got rid of them. Overal this hotel was a nice, excitting stay and was a very comfortable stay. I would like to go back as that was a memory with friends from school.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: jellymousse
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 days in March 08 and had a great time. Location is perfect - just a few steps away from Times Square - and the hotel was clean and the staff helpful. Our room might have benefited from a coat of paint but was clean and the bedding spotless. You don't spend much time in your hotel room while in New York anyway! Lobby is stylishly decorated (Art Deco) and always very busy. Used the Deli a couple of doors away from the hotel for breakfast every day - they serve a great selection and you choose what you want and then take it to the seating area upstairs. Very quick and tasty! Hotel lifts are efficient and quick. Not a great view from the room but hey - does that really matter in New York? If you're going to the Statue of Liberty - go early!! We queued on a Saturday for 2 and a half hours outside and it was cold! Would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - friendly staff - well used hotel but clean.”
Reviews.Author: NottinghamTravelcat
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I spent a three nights in March at the Edison. We did not expect a five star luxury hotel, but we were impressed with the helpful staff and our beds were so comfortable that we had no problems sleeping. Our room was on the 11th floor and at the back of the building so we did not have too much trouble with noise. The diner is pretty good for breakfast but sometimes very busy as some people have vouchers for breakfast and do not have a choice. We turned left out of the main entrance and walked to the next avenue where there were loads of restuarants and diners. We had scrambled eggs which were great in an Italian diner. Unfortunately i can't remember the name. The concierge was helpful and helped with a number of requests including getting us theatre tickets - expensive but worth the time saving. Security was good which we liked - you could not get in the lift without showing your room key. We had a really good weekend - it just finished too quickly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ILoveTooTravel
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a week in New York and the Edison Hotel was a great place to stay. For a New York Hotel with four people staying in one room, this was the place. As usual the bathroom was small, but that's the norm for New York. The room is very spacious and was very quiet for being just off Broadway. The location was excellent - everything very close. I would stay at this hotel again. We paid $195.00/night. A good price for a central location.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Locaton, Location”
Reviews.Author: alaskamel
Reviews.Content: After researching, researching and more researching we were becoming very frustrated (and concerned) about our Christmas vaction in NYC - all the hotels in the Times Square area were pricing about $400 - $700/ night. UGH. My mother-in-law found this place (not sure how) and we happily booked our stay for around $200/ night. But, in NYC you get what you pay for.
