This hotel was shabby, old and at first glance a little scary. All that being said, NYC is such a wonderful place, who wants to spend that much time in their hotel room anyway? For the most part, the hotel was clean, quiet and safe. A good place to rest yor head after a long day of shopping, eating and sight seeing. The location cannot be beat. Right off of Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “Clang, Clang, CLANGING PIPES!!”
Reviews.Author: nose4roses
Reviews.Content: My friend and I flew up to NY 02FEB08 to see Spamalot. We had a room with twin beds. When we walked in, my heart sunk; One of us would have to sleep in the bed that sunk in the middle. Like others have said, this hotel is old, ratty, and the furnishings are out of the 1960's. Our bathroom appeared clean, but it was so tiny a large person would not be able to turn around. There was no place to store toiletries. I decided it wasn't worth the effort to try and shower the next morning before we left. At 1:00 am, the pipes in the walls began clanging. Apparently, they must have steam heat and the pipes were in the wall between the bed and the wall near the bathroom. The clanging went on and on and on and on--all night long! We got absolutely no sleep. . . Honestly, I really am not a picky person. But that was the most depressing hotel room I've EVER stayed in. The staff were nice, so no complaints there. And I had a great grilled cheese sandwich in the diner there. I will never stay there again. It's only "plus" is it's close to Times Square. But even that wasn't worth it. . .

Reviews.Title: “Loved the edison!”
Reviews.Author: maxineperry
Reviews.Content: My friend and i returned from the edison hotel on tuesday 02/03/2008. We didnt have any issues with the hotel at all! Ok , it is a little shabby but im a true believer in you get what you pay for! We booked with tradewinds and paid £499 for 5 days including flights and transfers. I think thats a bargain so i wasnt expecting the four seasons. The hotels location is superb and the adjoining breakfast room is excellent value for money. Tea, fresh orange, cereal,and poached egg on toast for $6 (£3). Due to the location it can be very noisy in the room at night due to the police sirens and fire trucks etc but nothing a set of ear plugs cant fix. The bathrooms could do with modernising as our tap did not work very well and the water pipes made some pretty strange noises at night, but the shower was always hot and very powerful. On the whole i would stay here again in a heartbeat, we only slept there and were out all day so it didnt bother me at all. Granted there is a beautiful boutique hotel called hotel W right next door, so if you want to fork out a few extra hundred pounds then stay here, but personally i wouldnt. For the amount of time you spend in the room i think this hotel is totally worth the money, providing you get it for the right price.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: JULESMAC
Reviews.Content: My friend and I had saved up to visit New York for the first time to celebrate our 40th birthdays. Having heard so much about it and having travelled from Scotland we were very excited and we couldnt have asked for more - from either the hotel or the city. The hotel had been recommended and did not disappoint us in any way. It may not be pure luxury but for the price we paid I thought it was fab and I didnt see one single hotel in the whole week that was in a better location for 1st time visitors than The Edison. Staff were all helpful when required and we found all that we needed right there. It has a cafe attached, a small piano bar to rest your weary feet and end the night with a much needed glass of wine, a large reception, very helpful concierge desk, travel arrangement desk (with very able but slightly abrupt arranger), loads of public telephones and a back entrance which takes you straight out to the TCKT booth for the cheap broadway show tickets and a nice Italian. Rooms were fine - clean, bigger than I expected having heard they are all tiny in NY and plenty of mirrors for 2 females who need one each. Bed was comfy enough although we were so tired at night I could have slept on the floor, bathroom was fine and shower really powerful. Clean towels were provided every day and the maids tidied up after us every day. New York itself was truly fab. We did all the usual sights and loved them all. Went to see 2 shows which were great - Legally Blonde and Chicago (girl who played Roxie was brilliant) - and shopped until the credit cards would let us go no further. We went the bus tour on the first morning and the tour guide told us to get to grips with the subway as it was so cheap ($25 for a weekly ticket) and really fast. We were a bit aprehensive at first but found it to be totally safe and by Day 2 we were completely unfazed. There are subway stations on almost every street corner. Loved the buzz of Chinatown - were there 3 times - and also found Ellis Island very moving. If you are only going to go up either the Rockerfeller Centre or the Empire State then my tip would be the RC. Much better views and you can see the Empire State and also Central Park - you cant believe how huge it is in the middle of all the concrete. The view is also uninterupted as it is clear perspex all round intead of wire fencing. Visit Ellens Stardust Cafe just up the road from the hotel on 7th Avenue. Typical American diner but with singing waiters and waitresses. We were in for breakfast one morning and they were up on the tables singing at 9am nd we were in one night after a show and they were still there. Great atmosphere and the food is pretty good. All in all it was a great week and I am aleady saving up to go back (once I've cleared the Mastercard!!!!) Thanks for a great week Mags!!!! Roll on 50.

Reviews.Title: “Overall very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: voban1
Reviews.Content: My husband stays at the Edison every couple of years with a university theater group and he is always satisfied with it. This time I went along as well as our two teen aged children. This hotel is in the BEST area right off Broadway, so much within walking distance. The thing about the Edison is that the rooms are very different sizes, layouts. Only two people in our forty-some people group didn't like their room...only because they got twin beds instead of queen beds...jeez, they weren't even sleeping together. The Edison accommodated them by changing their room anyway. We had a double queen, very clean, bright and attractive. The bathroom was very small but we managed. My basic complaint was that the lobby, which is nice looking, very art-deco, had some gold-covered cloth sofas and chairs that looked like someone had died on them....ewwww. Dirty, stained, gross. I thought that was shameful and that they should replace them. I wouldn't even sit on them. The cafe is nice, they really work hard and the breakfasts are great. Desk people, security, all were decent, personable enough. Housekeeping brought us extra pillows when we requested them (I am a housekeeping tipper too, I always leave a couple of dollars a day at least) Housekeeping did a great job, we were there for a full week and had no complaints. Oh yea, the mattress was really hard. My kids didn't mind them, but my husband and myself noticed it. I was a bit achy when I woke up in the morning, but it went away fast...and I must admit I slept like a rock. I'm sure that there are a few rooms with problems, but I would certainly complain if I found my room to be unacceptable. But remember, this is an inexpensive hotel, don't expect great luxury. I do with they had ice machines on every floor though!! I really would have liked that. I'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel, but Costly Business Center and Temperamental Shower”
Reviews.Author: chicagosean
Reviews.Content: Positives: The room was decent and clean. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Negatives: Shower was difficult to adjust and the temperature fluctuated during the shower. Business center was costly - $0.20 per minute for computer time, not much less than Fedex Kinkos. Overall: Busy hotel located in Times Square, so there is lots of hustle and bustle. I would recommend the hotel for tourists visiting Times Square, but not for business travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Safe Hotel! Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: T9ceyH
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel I was a bit put off before I went by reading all the negative reviews but we had the most amazing time there! Safe homely atmosphere with no hassle for security as we were four females a little wary of how safe things are in the heart of the city but the staff put our minds at ease! The bar was brill wee Francisco the bar man was a gem! And those gin and tonics were lethal! Small rooms but spotless and cleaned every day...good job as we were a bit messy! I lost my purse on the way from the hotel to the shuttle bus and the hotel e-mailed me to say they had found it intact with my money,cards, photographs etc and also I had left jewellry in my drawer in the room which I hadn't noticed was missing how's that for service! I also recommend anyone travelling from UK to buy a $10 phone card as they last for around 5 hours. After staying in The UN Millenium Plaza 5 star two years previous I would definately use this hotel again for service and location after all your only sleeping in the hotel and the rooms were clean!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Edison”
Reviews.Author: Mare308
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I came into town on a Tuesday morning, fairly early. The staff was on the whole very supportative. We were in New York early and had nowhere to go. The Bellmen were most helpful. Thank you...... Frankie. The room was clean and affordable.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at great price.”
Reviews.Author: bebedawl
Reviews.Content: Me and a friend stayed here at the end of February and got a good price for it. We stayed 4 nights. This hotel seems to cater for large groups of school children but luckily they seem to all be put on the lower floors away from families, couples and friends who are visiting. There was never a long wait for a lift, which in a hotel with 21 floors you would expect! We had a room (838) with twin beds which I can't fault, I did request a newly renovated room and wasn't sure if it was or not but everything seemed fairly new. Room was cleaned every day and house keeping were very helpful when I needed extra pillows. Bathroom was always clean and although a little rusty around the plug there was no faults with the shower temperature and pressure was fine. A view of a brick wall but you could just about see Times Sq if you stuck your head out far enough to the side ;) The hotels main TV channel (about the hotel) wished 'Mr B' happy birthday on the leap year, which was also my birthday. My friend asked reception if they could put me on there, to which they said they would try and that 'Mr B' was the owner. Unfortunately we missed the channel that night but the receptionist asked me if I'd had a nice birthday when we checked out so I can only assume they wished me happy birthday on there! Location was brilliant. Cafe Edison was nice for breakfast but a wait if you are up late. Quick service and very cheap. Deli next door great for by the lb food and drinks. Back entrance of the hotel opposite the TKTS office, try here for broadway tickets before going to the shows box office. Starbucks opposite hotel on corner. Try Juniors for breakfast at the back of the hotel (and through the Mariott's covered walk way) quick service, great food. Would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “super”
Reviews.Author: gurl_fine
Reviews.Content: Was only in the Edison Hotel last month, staying there on a shopping and site seeing trip which ment i was only there for some where to sleep. There was only one problem i had, it seemed that there was a very large group of english children stayin on are floor. which ment stayin up very late runing from room to room screaming and gettin up early to go out, which also ment screaming and running from room to room, although i do understand that this was not the hotels fault! Other than that i found everything fine, perfect location, friendly staff and clean rooms. After reading reviews on this site i was very wary about a few things but everything was fine, although after eating in the cafe, i wouldnt go back!!

Reviews.Title: “disgustingly dirty”
Reviews.Author: polsson
Reviews.Content: This hotel was misrepresented completely in the brochure. Walls, carpets, etc were dirty. Room badly needed painting. Curtains were too short to block out morning light. Bathtub needed reglazing. Walls were paper thin-heard everything going on in the next room (and their bathroom!) Disgusting hotel-would steer clear of it completely.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: NEWYORKISGREAT08
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is nothing short of amazing, however the hotel itself is nothing special. Right in the heart of all of the action, the lights of time square glaring at you throughout the day(not brilliant at night if you need it completly dark wen you sleep), but great if you want to feel like you are in New York. Broadway shows are within walking distance(Farnsworth Convention is a great show depsite scathing reviews), and there is no shortage of places to eat and drink. M&M world is just around the corner(yeah, thats right, M&M world), along with plenty of other novelty shops. The hotel is within wlaking distance of all of the top shoping places in New York, as well as a 20 minute walk from the world famous Macy's. The hotel also offers great links to the rest of New York via the subway and some of the tour buses stop and commence from just around the corner. However, the exterior of the hotel is shabby and dated, and this is something that is continued throughout the rest of the hotel. The lobby, resturant, gift show and rooms are very dated, however they are habitable(at the end of the day that is all that matters), there is a new lift system and the bar looked modern. There is a lotof life happening towards the bottom of the hotel, so if sleep is a big deal for you requesting a room on the top floor is recomended. The staff were friendly and helpful, and there is good security. After being greeted by a door opener/bag carrier, you are requested to show your room key before gaining access to the lifts/stairs. There are also safety deposit boxes for storage of excess money and passports etc. Overall the hotel did not contribute anything to improving my holiday, however it didn't contribute anything to tarnishing the best holiday I have ever had. New York, WHAT A CITY!!!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff - Decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: bostonlou
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Edison on Saturday Night (2/23). The thing that stands out the most is that the staff was all very professional and nice. It's amazing how a little customer service goes a long way. The hotel room we had was a suite of sorts with a living room and a bedroom. The pullout couch was a little uncomfortable but it's a pull out couch. The room itself was clean even though you could see it's age. But without a complete redo then there's not much you can do for age. Some people call it charm. I say it is what it is. As long as things are clean then I'm happy. The hotel's location only steps from Times Sq was perfect for us. We were only in town one night to see A Bronx Tale (one block over - amazing show). I would stay here again. Thanks for reading.

Reviews.Title: “best value in new york probaly!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: madartyboy
Reviews.Content: is there better hotels in new york yes certainly is there better for the money probaly not have just returned for new york and stayed here for 4 days the hotel is comfortable bit dated perhaps but worked out apart from the time asleep we probaly spent about 4 hours in the room getting ready for the days activities was the bed comfy not sure because after aday in new york you are so ready for some sleep we found the hotel staff very courteous and helpful would for sure use again because i dont believe for the money you can get a better location we talking 60 second walk too time square amazing if you are more bothered about what you are doing in new york than how good your hotel is this is the hotel too choose the rooms are on the small side for nyc standards but comfortable room was cleaned everyday and bed made etc will use again for sure due to location,location,location

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, amazing location”
Reviews.Author: Gogirl63
Reviews.Content: I brought my daughter on a shopping trip from 17th-21st Feb. We found this hotel clean and the staff were very friendly. It has an unbelievably central location for the price, right in the centre of all the theatres and 2 min walk to Time Square. There's a nice bar and seemingly the best breakfast in Time Square area. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone on a budget looking for a great stay in NYC. We will definately be going back! Our room was small but had everything we needed. I'm sure it could be noisy but what would you expect for NYC!!!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant experience at a tourist-oriented hotel.”
Reviews.Author: DC_Diva
Reviews.Content: The Edison is a tourist's hotel, with a variety of rooms and convenient Time Square location. It's also an inexpensive option for frequent 'non-tourist' visitors. My friend and I stayed here Feb.16-18, 2008 for our annual 'instead of Christmas gifts' weekend. We both go to NYC often and only really needed a place to sleep, shower, and store our stuff for this trip. My friend booked this hotel because of the cheap, sorta-last minute rate she found ($150). We had a nice stay overall. The only glitch was being given the wrong size (smaller) room, which the hotel switched for us after we returned from shopping. The first room was small, with two twin beds and a large bathroom. Our regular room was spacious with two double beds, but the tiniest bathoom I've ever seen in NYC hotels and apartments. This was more amusing than anything else. Some items of note: This hotel is not for you if you don't like noise. Times Square is pretty noisy (as well illustrated by the many Kosovars celebrating their independence Sunday morning). The Edison also hosts many large groups. There were several sizable student groups from the UK while we were there. While it is not a basic amenities hotel, it's not anywhere near luxurious either. The flat pillows made me miss the pillow menu at The Benjamin where I stayed 6 weeks earlier. Otherwise, friendly staff, 70's throwback hotel bar, and cheap luggage storage after checkout.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Edison, A great stay at a great place.”
Reviews.Author: Chocolatetruffels_
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel during a half term with our media group. We found the hotel clean, warm, tidy and well looked after. The room was spacious, plenty big enough for four people, all ameties working. The staff were extrenmely helpful with room problems, over heating occured, however was sorted by a turn of a switch. Each day new things happened in and around new york. You could be updated each day through the tv located in your room. This hotel is in a prime location, literally on broadway, giving you the most amazing views of new york from the rooms. You could not beat it at these prices. On broadway, you really feel like the city never sleeps, late night shopping, restaurants open all hours, broadway shows and cinema viewings available for evening entertainment. For quieter entertainment, try comedy clubs for some light humour. We found this trip amazing and would recommend the stay at the Edison Hotel to anyone. perhaps not in a half term period due to school groups visiting throughout this period. A range of roomsare avaialble giving you the comfort you need during your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: flyer85
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 9th-14th Feb, Centrally located hotel best place in Times Square. E-mailed hotel before we arrived and asked for an upgraded room, we stayed in room on 9th floor which was very clean and comfortable. Staff were helpful, cafe edison was reasonably priced, and is good for breakfast. Would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a great location.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic location could not of been better!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: brisbane18
Reviews.Content: just got back from a 3 night stay in the edison hotel, my room 1415 was a good size and had a modern design, bathroom was very smal but that dosnt bother me, staff were friendly, nice bright lobby with a gift shop, there is also a resturant and a breakfast, snack shop/ restuarnt all atached to the hotel. onto the location.....its was excellent the hotel is on 47th west street which is right of of times square less than a 2 minute walk and you are there, planet hollywood, hard rock cafe and many more shops and resturants are right on your door step along with the bright lights that times square has to offer. i would easily stay at this hotel again, excellent value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Edison - not during half term!!!”
Reviews.Author: energybabe
Reviews.Content: This was the second time we had stayed at the Edison, so we knew that the hotel was not the plushest around, but our previous stay had shown it to be clean and the staff friendly so opted to stay again. Bit of a mixed experience this time. We again had one of the older rooms (despite asking for an upgrade - I was told none available with 2 beds!) but the room although dated (which at a casual glance, can make it look grubby) was extremely clean. However, the hot water seemed to run out by the late afternoon (although when I spoke to the reception, they said they would send someone up. no one came but the water got hot. Same happened next day - do they have a tank which they turn on when someone complains???) On our second day our room was not serviced. We had been out since 8.30 am and this was 6.30 pm. The desk was not very pleasant about it - almost implied that it was my fault somehow - but I stood firm and they cleaned it before we came back at 10.30 pm. It was however unusual for the staff to be so unfriendly. BUT the worst thing was the school parties - felt like every teenager in the UK was visiting during half term week The noise on the first night was unbelievable. The desk said they had 800 staying!! Because of this I would not stay during holiday periods again - it settled down after the first night, but was still noisy at times. The hotel couldn't be better situated however and feels safe. It has been perfectly clean on the two occasions we have stayed there.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: adeevasani
Reviews.Content: This hotel deserves no more than a one (1) star rating. The springs from the mattress were felt through the mattress. My back is in so much pain. I was fine before I slept on that awful mattress! The furniture, walls and carpet were filthy. The heater in my room did not work and one of the windows in my room was taped with a thin layer of duct tape to provide insulation with a message written on the window that said "do not open, danger" ( I have pictures!) This was the worst hotel stay I have ever had. Motel 6 would be an upgrade. DO NOT STAY HERE! You will be dissapointed!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and good service”
Reviews.Author: Rodrigo_Lt
Reviews.Content: Edison Hotel is a very nice place to stay if you are a tourist and want to know the best attractions of NY. Its location, at the heart of Broadway is excellent, specially at night when you can go to the best Broadway shows on foot. Hotel is quite clean and safe and quality of service is good. Hope to return as soon as possible to NY and stay at Edison.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Price, Very Convenient!”
Reviews.Author: bigbillyt
Reviews.Content: We have been to NYC several times. We have stayed at very nice hotels (The Waldorf and The Muse), and we have stayed at budget hotels (Best Western and a few others), and a few in between. In spite of a few minor issues, I would still highly recommend this hotel for folks on a budget. The Hotel Edison is dated, the lobby and the floors are not in the best shape. However, I feel like this is part of it's charm. The location is fantastic, just minutes from Times Square and many theatres and with one of the best Italian restaurants in the area just a few doors down. Best of all, there is an excellent deli style restaurant connected to the hotel and accessible directly from the hotel lobby. So, when you get up on Sunday and want to grab a good breakfast you don't even have to brave the weather if you don't want to. The Cafe Edison staff is very nice and the food is good and very reasonably priced for very good deli style. Beds were very comfortable, the room was clean and the staff was very helpful. Not one of the nicest hotels in NYC, but a pretty decent package for the price. I would recommend this as a good choice for a short trip / long weekend where location, convenience and price are the priorities. Whether you stay at this hotel or not, you should definitely check out their cafe for breakfast or lunch and the Trattoria Trecolori restaurant just a few doors down for some great Italian food.

Reviews.Title: “HOTEL EDISON WAS GOOD”
Reviews.Author: princestgirl
Reviews.Content: We were three friends coming to NYC from Rochester,NY, California and upstate NY. The Edison Hotel was picked for its location and its price. It was clean and safe. We had a good experience at this hotel. The people were friendly and nice. Agnes D, Judy T. and Ramon S.

Reviews.Title: “Just gets better”
Reviews.Author: owenc
Reviews.Content: 3rd time back in New York and this place just gets better and better, the Edison Hotel is a must. the location is excellent its right in the heart of everything surrounded by great places to eat, shop ,drink and theatres.the hotel was clean.the room was adequate in size. the maid came in everyday. the little diner attached is not bad for breakfast, recommend the pancakes or toasted bagel with cream cheese....if you want to see a good show the Jersey Boys is fantastic great story and songs....the Olive Garden in Times Square is a nice Italian.....Jersey Gardens is best for shopping... i recommend you leave the taxis as a last resort and walk as much as possible as you get to see the smaller shops which dont charge a fortune for things like shot glasses, tee shirts and hoodies etc.... find a shop called Grand Slam in Time Square Cups, glasses and teeshirts are a lot cheaper here also a shop called R A G just down from Toys R us the hoodies are only $20 and tee shirts with embroidered logos and not the iron on stuff only $7 the prices difference in other shops can be from $10 to $15. so i hope this information helps and enjoy your trip.

Reviews.Title: “Afraid to Go to sleep”
Reviews.Author: DTropicana773
Reviews.Content: What is wrong with the people who said this hotel was great. I guess you have not had better. This hotel was a disapointment when I was walking toward it. One of the letter was missing in Edison outside the establishment. But the shock was when l got there. The manager had booked me in a smoking room, when l requested a non-smoking room. Told me there was no vacancies to transfer me to a non-smoking room. The stafff was terrible. The room was terrible. The beds were weak and the mattress looked like it had been there since the hotel was first opened. The bathroom was ancient. I was afraid to go to sleep on the bed, l slept on top of the sheets. You had to call to get a ironing board and iron and was told you could only keep it for an hour. You had to call to get ice, no ice machines on the floors. It was a terrible time. I stayed outside most of the time and only came in late at night to get a few hours of sleep. My sister and I stayed up one of the nights and boarded a bus to the casinos because we didn't want to go back to the hotel. The website is deceiving. It shows a beautiful hotel and luxury rooms. If anyone says this hotel is the best that they have had and were satisfied with this hotel, l would question what have they had in the past. I will never go back to New York again.

Reviews.Title: “terrible hotel the staff should be ashamed of them selfs.”
Reviews.Author: manchesterbailey
Reviews.Content: digracful would expect this leavel of service from a weekend bed and breckfast in Blackpool, staff rude especally the eastern european woman who works in the transportation booth she should be ashamed of her self. The only nice ones were the door men and the cleaners. I would recommend this hotel to my enermy. The location is good but if you need help like me and my boyfriend did forget it.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and Clean”
Reviews.Author: DavidWMassachusetts
Reviews.Content: Booked this place a year ahead, for two adults and a teenager for the New Years Eve weekend. This was for 3 nights and we were very pleased. The hotel is clean, staff friendly, and the location perfect for accessibility to all the activities. This was actually the second time we've stayed here. One plus, is the convenience of driving up to the door, and having the car taken to safety without being concerned about where to park in the city. They charge $32 per day for the parking. Well worth it, I think. The room on the 22nd floor was actually considered a suite, with one room having 2 twin beds, the other a king size bed. Bathroom old fashioned deco with original fixtures, was small, but that's how they made them in those days. Convenient Deli attached to the lobby, was great for breakfast, and the many restaurants within short walking distance makes this a fine place to start your vacation. The subway stop is a block away, and Rockefeller Center just about 3 blocks east. We were close to Times Square for the New Years Eve celebration, by using our hotel key envelopes to show the Police at 47th Street. Once near the pens they set up, we tipped a doorman at the Marriott Marquee, who ushered us past the guards and into the crowd. The discount ticket booth for Broadway shows is just one block south through the hotel rear entrance. We didn't have firm plans for each night, so we just bought show tickets each day. In all, it was a great weekend, and the Edison was in the perfect spot.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: jackmuk7
Reviews.Content: Preview your review: Traveler rating: New York City: Edison Hotel Times Square: "Nice hotel in a great location" jackmuk7, Mukwonago, Wisconsin We stayed at the Edison Hotel over New Years Eve weekend. After reading LOTS of reviews we were a bit nervous about having booked the Edison Hotel but when we arrived we knew we had nothing to worry about . We arrived at the hotel after a nice relaxing Limo ride from the airport. It was close to the cost of a taxi so we thought what the heck we are on vacation!!! We were able to check in right away even tho it was only noon. The first room we were given had a window that would not close all the way. Being December we wanted a window that closed compleatly so we went back down to the front desk. They said they would send a maintenace man up to fix the window. Within 5 minutes we had a repair man in our room. He decided he was unable to fix the window. We headed back down to the desk and we were immediately given a room on the 8th floor- no problem. The rooms were small but clean and that is all we were concerned about. We had a room with a queen size bed and a couch. The bathroom was small. The only problem we had with the bathroom was we had a non working hairdryer. We didnt call to get a new one because it wasnt a big concern of ours We ate breakfast at the restaurant attached to the hotel one morning which had VERY resonable prices.We did try to go to breakfast at a restraunt in Times Square but the omelettes were 18 dollars each so we opted for Starbucks instead. There is a small deli type store we found on our last night. We heard they had good sandwiches, fruit, etc at good prices. The Edison hotel is in a great location, its clean, and the staff was very accommodating. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a resonable priced hotel in a SUPER location.

Reviews.Title: “Close to all the action!!”
Reviews.Author: tam14736
Reviews.Content: This hotel is 1/2 block from Time Square. We have a 5yo and a 10yo. We walked all around the city. We had a quad room which consist of 2 double beds, tv, dressing table, closet, chaise lounge and a bathroom. It's cool...you stick you head out the window and you see all the light and hussle and bussle of Time Square. There is a restruant connected to the hotel but the waitress was very mean. We tried to make her laugh but it was like she tried not to be happy. She came to take our order and just walked away right in the middle as we were ordering. We asked her a question about the desserts...and she seemed almost offended! Comical actually. Anyhow, 2 night and 3 days was plenty of time to get the NYC experience. It was very loud at night. We stayed on the 5th floor. If we go again next year, we are going to ask for something much higher. My 5yo had trouble sleeping because of the noise. Overall, I enjoyed it. The hotel price was reasonable and the location was absolutely fabulous! Would definetly recommend and stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Edison Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ElleLondon
Reviews.Content: Hi I have just returned yesterday with my 18yr old daughter. We stayed at the Edison for 4 nights. Location absoultely amazing, room was small, basic but adequate as we only used it for sleeping. Beds were made each day and towels changed daily. Staff extremely unfriendly and very miserable looking! Great deli 2 doors away from hotel, open long hours and can eat there.

Reviews.Title: “Great affordable hotel in EXCELLENT location”
Reviews.Author: natski81
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel edison for 6 nights in June. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Hotels in NYC can be very pricey and finding something that is in close proximity to Times Square at a reasonable price is hard. The hotel Edison is a wonderful hotel right in the heart of Times square. The rooms are comfortable with all basic amenities. We were fortunate enough to get a corner room which was a little more spacious than the other rooms. Unless you plan to spend alot of time in your hotel room, the Hotel Edison is a wonderful base while touring the big apple.For first time travellers we would also highly recommend Photo Trek tours with Mark. He walks you around to some of the major sites snapping photos of you. A great introduction to the city and an even better way to get photos of your travelling party without having to ask passers-by to take a picture.

Reviews.Title: “disappointment”
Reviews.Author: weluv2vacation
Reviews.Content: I would not choose to stay at the Hotel Edison again. We booked this hotel primarily for the price and the location (location is the only thing this hotel has going for it) despite the bad reviews on tripadvisor. It is located in the heart of Times Square. We stayed here for half of our week vacation and the other half of the week we stayed at the Carlton on Madison Ave. PROS: When we arrived the front desk person was helpful and we were able to check in early with no problem. We had booked a room with 2 twin beds but we were upgraded to a 2 queen bed room at no additional charge. Lobby was nice with a Christmas tree. CONS: The room was just horrible! Writing on the walls, numbers to be exact on two different areas on the wall and wallpaper peeling off the walls. I have to stress...writing on the walls! In the very very small bathroom, there were little shampoos and conditioners that came in "packets" that remined me of ketchup packets, plastic cups instead of glass, and a disgusting plastic shower liner. Certain channels on the TV were not working. At one point, the power went out! Housekeeping was horrible as well. I had to call twice for housekeeping to bring me a hair dryer because the one in the bathroom was not working. And when they finally brought it to me, I answered the door to a housekeeper who was chatting away on her pink cell phone! To have access to the elevators, you must show your room keys every time to a security guard. Despite all this, the hotel was very busy with many visitors.

Reviews.Title: “Fine Hotel. Great Location”
Reviews.Author: gjtango
Reviews.Content: Me and a mate (both 20/21) stayed here from 17th-22nd of December just gone. We were staying on the 12th floor. Room was spacious with two double beds that were pretty comfy, a telly, table, two comftable chairs etc. Bathroom was bit small but perfectly fine (some people don't even have bathrooms- as long as it all works that's what I look for!). The gym up from the 23rd floor was always empty and a good place to work out. We spent a good half hour in their each morning before setting out to burn off some calories. All the equipment was in working order & there was a fair bit of it. The Rum House (bar attached to the hotel) was a nice place to hang out and have a drink or two. Cafe Edison (cafe attached to the hotel) did all sorts of food to a good standard. Superb location, with an array of bars and resturants in walking distance. Sampled the best pizza I've ever ate at the bottom of the street on the corner (name escapes me). A MUST for all. Overall very pleased with the hotel and would stay there again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Would Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: salsbee
Reviews.Content: We stayed here recently for four nights and would definitely stay again. Some of the previous reviews made me feel very nervous but I need not have worried. When we booked in I asked for a renovated room - don't know if this made a difference but the room was fine. The bed was comfy, the bathroom spotless and as we were on the 9th floor we were not disturbed by the noise from the streets below. The hotel is definitely fraying around the edges and although our room was large, my daughter's room was tiny. The staff were friendly and helpful and the attached bar called The Rum House was a good place to wind down at the end of the day. Don't bother with the Cafe for breakfast though as there are a lot better places nearby. Could not fault the location nor the price.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location in Times Square”
Reviews.Author: Amellia_7
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Edison Hotel from the 13-15 of Decemeber. Being a Travel agent myself I would sell this hotel to any of my clients. This hotel has the best location right at 47th and broadway right in times Square. The rooms are good size (bathroom a bit small). Rooms were cleaned daily. What else can you ask for in a budget hotel? The hotel looks a little older but not let that discourage you. Theres nothing wrong with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hated it...”
Reviews.Author: Hayles1
Reviews.Content: Just returned from N.Y. We were allocated in room 1634, a room which had not been renovated, the staff were unwelcoming and not that helpful at all. The hotel needs a complete referb. The only thing going for it is the location. I would sum the hotel up as being cheap and cheerless.......Never again

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: pattywagondmb
Reviews.Content: We just came back yesterday after four days at the Edison. I was so worried after reading the posts, but to my surprise the room was just fine. We stayed in room 847 (a room that was just recently renovated). Although not the Waldorf, it was not as bad as some posts have revealed. The location was incredible, the serive was fine. We thought they were extremley helpful, especially with directions around the city. The room was clean, fresh sheets and towels were provided. The security guard at the elevator made us feel safer because you had to present your room key to take the lift up. The deli next store was wonderful for breakfast and lunch. We would stay there again. For that price, and that location, you can't beat it. Enjoy NYC!!

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: daisybucket
Reviews.Content: we have just returned from a 5 night stay at hte Hotel Edison, 27/11/07 - 2/12/07, and cannot recommend this hotel enough. The location was superb, the staff friendly and the room (although basic) was clean and in good decorative order , we stayed in room 614, the maids cleaned our room daily and there was fresh towels. If anyone is looking for a central location on a budget you wont find better than this hotel. If I had to make a minor criticism it would be no tea/coffee making facilities in the room however the deli next door but one has great breakfasts and take out coffees (cheaper that the hotel cafe).

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: fiona_242
Reviews.Content: After reading what felt like hundreds of reviews I booked the Edison for 4 nights in Oct. You couldn't ask for a better location! Busy enough that every thing is on your doorstep, but quiet enough that you could stand outside waiting on someone without being trampled! My room probably had seen better days but, and the whole hotel did feel quite dark all the time. The reception staff also looked constantly miserable, but all the other staff seemed plesant enough. The room was a decent size, and clean Great value for money, I will be staying again!

Reviews.Title: “5th time in New York and still brill!!!”
Reviews.Author: OscSheffield
Reviews.Content: This was my 3rd stay at the hotel Edison and I wasn't expecting great things of it from previous reviews I had read on here but the hotel has got alot better. Prior to arriving I emailed the hotel for refurbished rooms and upon arrivng this request had been done. Our rooms on the 11th floor were spotless, very clean and very spacious, the only down side being one of our rooms was very noisy at 4.30am due to the central heating system my parents asked to be moved out of this room after 2 nights and were given a room on the 22nd floor this floor is currently undergoing refurbishment the rooms were redecorated but not the bathroom. The location is absolutly brilliant you cant ask for anything better. The bell boys on the front door are very good they will arrange anything for you - they arranged a limo for us to take us back to the airport instead of 2 taxis as there was 6 of us and this worked out slighlty cheaper than two taxi's. I wouldn't hesitate in booking this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't ask for anything more”
Reviews.Author: KaykaKFS
Reviews.Content: I spent a lot of time reading reviews, viewing photographs, checking price and location. We are a family of 3 and wanted a decent room at an affordable price in the heart of the theater district and the Edison fit the bill. The staff was friendly or at least cordial. Not everyone will go out of their way to make eye contact or strike up a conversation. But no one was rude and everyone we had to deal with directly was polite and friendly. Our room had two queen size beds, a lounge chair, a writing desk and television. Small but more than adequate even having spent some down time in our room midday. High speed internet is available for a fee. The connection was good, the speed was better than I anticipated and the cost was in par with what I would expect in the industry. The bathroom was extemely small and had NO ventilation. No hooks or counter to lay things down... there was a built in that held towels and tissues and such, and a very small ledge near the sink. Clothing and such (to dress after a shower) needed to be placed on the closed toilet lid or on/in the sink. Not ideal but we managed. Despite what I read about slow elevators we did not have that problem. There are six cars and we never had to wait more than a minute, even at busy times when the first might be full another would be along quickly. There was 24 hour security guard near the elevators... in the morning security seemed lax, but in the evening without exception room key-cards needed to be shown to get by. We didn't eat in the on site restaurants. For morning coffee and quick meals we used the 24hour deli two doors down. It was fantastic, prices were reasonable and the food was good. Full deli, hot and cold food bar including soups, salads, fresh fruits, entrees and side dishes. Mornings they made eggs and omelets to order. Plus they sold all the regular convenience store stuff you might need. The best, Best, BEST thing about the Hotel Edison is the LOCATION :o) Time Square half a block away Surrounded by theaters on all sides If you want to be in the heart of the theater district and would rather spend your money on show tickets than a room you can't beat the Hotel Edison

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed with the Edison Hotel New York”
Reviews.Author: jetsetter2829
Reviews.Content: Just come back from the big apple, what a fantastic place. Very disappointed with the hotel bedroom though. The greetings from the staff as we got out of the taxi were very welcoming,the reception area was all decorated lovely with a gorgeous big christmas tree in the centre, all the staff were exceptionally helpful, then as soon as you got in the lift and entered the corridor to your room, it was if you were in a different hotel, it didn't look as though it had seen a coat of paint for 20 years, the bedroom was very basic, no coffee making facilities (luckily we took our own), no fridge, the towels looked brand new though,crisp and white, the bed linen looked as though it had seen better days. The Hotel is central for everywhere and in a great spot. If you have already booked this hotel don't worry too much, the hotel was only for sleeping in at the end of the day. A little tip, go to Macy's for all your bargains, they have a sale on, upto 50% off most items, also go to the visitors centre on the first floor, take your passport and they will give you a card which entitles you to a further 11% off most items, fantastic if you like shopping. (Bloomingdales does the same thing). Enjoy yourselves, I wish I was going back tomorrow. Please feel free to email me if you need to know anything and I will try and help.

Reviews.Title: “Well...”
Reviews.Author: gorensmine
Reviews.Content: Well.... If you are into floors that have never been vacuumed (there was a bobby pin on the floor for the entire 10 days that wasn't ours) mould on the ceiling, some sort of unidentified mouldish stuff on the shower curtain, Fuzz in the bathroom vent right over the sink, hallways that are dark and it looks like someone sprayed pepsi and chocolate all over the walls and never cleaned it off, I mean ever... then this is the place for you! I stayed at the Edison for 10 days with one of my friends this summer. Our travel agent assured us there had never been a complaint... The only way I understand this is if the others had been blind. To be fair, you don't spend much time in your room. The location is optimal, and that is what this hotel has going for it. The staff is nice and polite, we met a fellow Canadian who tried to get us into a nicer room... he did, the above described is what we got. Apparently you need to ask for a re-furbished room when booking, which I didn't know.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Edison, fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: holidaybug67
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Edison, the location was fantastic, 2 minutes and your were in Times Square, we couldnt have been closer, the cafe for breakfast was great, with a large selection of food on offer, and pleasant quick service. The rooms and the corridors would benefit from brightening up and we really missed tea and coffee in the rooms and feel all hotels should have it. I would recommend it it to anyone on a city break and would certainly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Scary.”
Reviews.Author: whereaminow77
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel on 11/23/07 for my sister's birthday as we wanted a budget-minded hotel in a good location. There was a hole in the wall from the back of the chair. The beds were as hard as rocks. Bathroom had hair in it. Worst part, found 3 cockroaches in the room, one of which ran across my face when I was lying in the bed. Disgusting.

Reviews.Title: “Desperate Hotel...In need of renovations...”
Reviews.Author: Penny014
Reviews.Content: My mum & I stayed at this hotel for 4 Nights & 5 days, I found the staff ignorant, the food terrible & no athmosphere... The decor is very aged, and very old hotel! The rooms very quiet & the room was clean, hotel is very central tho, just off broadway and just 3 blocks from 5th ave. If i was travelling to New York again I wouldn't stay here again as i felt i was looking over my shoulder all the time.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Location”
Reviews.Author: GunnerIreland
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed at the Edison for 5 nights from Nov 12th to 16th. I had read many of the reviews prior to going and was aware that alot of people gave it bad reviews. The Hotel is old and the decor reflects this. The check in was a bit manic as there were so many trying to check out at the same time as new guests were coming in. Some rooms were not cleaned for new guests arriving etc. We eventually got our room having been checked in by a helpful member of staff. The room was not recently decorated and seemed dark and dull. The bathroom was tiny. The room was clean but really could do with being redecorated. The biggest plus with this hotel is the location. It is just off TImes Sq in the heart of New York. There is a cafe in the Hotel that serves breakfast and the service is very fast and efficient. It is also quite good value. The Hotel also has a bar that has a great atmosphere. The bar man, Jose pours a great G&T. On Times Sq there is a great Italian restaurant called The Olive Garden. Well worth a vist. Great Food. Just a few minutes walk from the hotel on the corner of 48th & 8th there is a really good bar called The Social. Fantastic atmosphere and some of the best bar food around. Try the Buffalo wings, onion rings and fries. Also there burgers are great. We went to the Radio City Christmas Spectacular and it was fantastic. Well worth a visit if you are there coming up to Christmas. All in all we would go back to the Edison. Staff were very helpful with any queries we had. Can't wait to hit New York again. One word of advise: Bring LOTS of money. The shopping in AMAZING !!!

Reviews.Title: “O MY NY”
Reviews.Author: myrtlec
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the edison and it was the worst hotel i have ever stayed at. Everything began well then i had to make reservations at the travel desk. The Lady behind the desk was miss leading, not informitive, and lacked any sencablity. I'm gonna stop there with her. Her service was very bad to say the least. I could go on. Then the rooms were a mess. The bath room was gross. They smelt like old pee, there was mold in the tiles in the shower, and our water in the shower wouldn't get above a warm 45 degrees. It was great to get into bed after being froze and beat my the shower. The beds were as comfortable as the sidewalk, nice and hard. The upside of the hotel was the security gaurd that was working in the morning by the elevators. He was a polite man who treated us like guests and not like a pest. The Hotel is close to time square which cuts down on some walking, but maybe a long walk would have been worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Edison Hotel Times Square”
Reviews.Author: solnishko3
Reviews.Content: Loved the Edison. I was very unsure of it at it at first, since it was one of the cheapest hotel deals i found on line (which is not at all a bad thing, but can have various other implications). My friend and i stayed there on Oct 26th to the 28th, and were overall very please with our stay. It borders the W hotel, which as you may know, goes for well over $500 during "hot" seasons. The rooms are very clean, but yes...very small-although i did not expect any less, so it was fine. Overall, if you find a good deal, do not pass it up. GREAT location, i didn't find it to be noisy at all...wonderful room service, and a very friendly staff. I would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel On Broadway”
Reviews.Author: matttristan
Reviews.Content: Horrible hotel, nothing good about it except the door man. rude managers. our room had a cup of coffee in it when we checked into it. the hallyway had no wallpaper or paint on it. disgusting.....dirty.....please do not stay their it will ruin your trip. we checked in and out within 45 min and went to another hotel. saturday oct 27. the manager on duty was clueless, im sure he will not be their when your their as im trying everything to get him fired.

Reviews.Title: “Location can't be beat”
Reviews.Author: pxlbarrel
Reviews.Content: As others have said, the location of the hotel is fantastic. It's located steps away from 7th Avenue.... it IS in Times Square. I love just stepping out of the hotel and into the action. I had a room near the top (19th floor) with one queen bed. It was described as the deluxe room. I had originally reserved it online for a certain cost per night but when I checked in, it was actually $50 cheaper! Bonus!! The room itself had a sofa couch but I didn't need it. The washroom was very small. The room was clean and spacious. The main problem with the room, in my opinion, was the extremely cheap shower curtain they put in the shower/tub. I could have gotten a better one at the dollar store. This thing was barely long enough for the tub and when you turned the shower on, all it wanted to do was cling to your skin. Ugh... The shower head was also a little loose and water spurted in all directions. All the staff I encountered were very nice and polite. They take security seriously too since you have to show a key at all hours before you're allowed into the elevator lobby. The hotel rooms are dated but as long as they're clean, who cares. This was my second time at the Edison. The first time was many years ago and on the strength of that visit, I stayed here again. No doubt there will be a third some time (if I can get a good rate, that is.)

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: AlgarveAllie
Reviews.Content: Like many others before me I was apprehensive reading some of these reviews but didn't need to be! My daughter and I have just returned fron a 4 night trip to NY to celebrate her 18th birthday. We chose the Edison because of price and location and I didn't expect anymore than that. We had a BIG room (505) with two queen size beds and loads of space. The room was not one of the renovated ones and while it was dated it was CLEAN (and I'm fussy!) Maid service was good, lots of clean towels. Left luggage service good on the last day - no queues and 50c an item. Doorman got us a private car to JFK as about 10 cabs went past that didn't want to go - the price was agreed in advance! Top tip - if you are lower down in the building it can be difficult to get an elevator that has space - take one going up and then come down! The one downside was the noise at night - we were low down so close to the noise from the bar and also a lorry depot thing across the road - I always travel with earplugs so no problem for me but my daughter who normally sleeps through anything was didturbed several times

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Barry06
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 3 nights at this hotel. Location: Excellent right in heart of Times square the centre of everything and with great routes from the subway that cover all of NY. Hotel: Clean, very good sized room 4 of us in 2 Queen beds with lots of room, friendly staff overall no faults. I have stayed in mnay hotels in NY over my 30 yrs of visiting and the Edison is a real gem which gives you everything you need. Also great breakfast bar next. Will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: SandraG23
Reviews.Content: Needed a nice but not outrageously expensive hotel room that was close to my meetings in Manhattan. After contacting locals, I was steered towards Hotel Edison. I was in room 1712 and it was great! I expected a small room, after all it is an older building. What I got was a two room "suite" complete with modern furniture, a queen sized bed and a killer view (I could see many of the neon signs and billboards advertising the latest Broadway shows). Yes, there was a bit of noise that does come through the windows but if you need absolute quiet either bring earplugs or stay at a property that is not so close to Times Square/Broadway. The hall area needs some refurbishment but, all in all, I would stay here again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Ignore the Negative reviews!!! Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: elmtree
Reviews.Content: We were given this hotel by a tour we booked online, and was concerned about all the negative reviews also...BUT, what a great place to stay!..We were given a wonderful room 1535, which I recomend for anyone...Great hotel..Nivce people...Wonderful location...Good Deli with great coffee right outside the hotels front door...We really, Really had a wonderful time and I would book this hotel again in a New York Minute!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Worries about complaints totally unfounded”
Reviews.Author: Aguilas
Reviews.Content: Shortly before travelling to NY I looked on this website for updated reviews for the Edison Hotel. I was horrified to see people complaining about the smells, cockroaches in the rooms, lack of towels, ramshackle furniture etc. As I had booked this break 10 months earlier it was going to cost me an additional £750 to change hotels. To say the least I was not looking forward to this part of our tour. I was therefore pleasantly surprised when we arrived on 17th September for 4 nights. Apart from the great location, the room was plenty big enough, the bathroom although small was adequate and while it was old it was spotlessly clean with masses of hot water. Towels (yet another complaint) were changed daily and were plentiful. Additional pillows were provided within minutes of our request. The staff were helpful and I particularly liked it when the bell captain told the taxi driver how much we should expect to be paying so there was no fear of being ‘ripped off’. At one end of the street you could pick up the Greyline coach for the Uptown Loops and at the other end of the street you could pick up the coach for the other Loops. The diner attached to the hotel was excellent value and a satisfying breakfast of eggs, toast and coffee could be had for around $5. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “would recommend thie edison”
Reviews.Author: ngleespen
Reviews.Content: would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting new york. the recommendation of a refurbished room was great advise by another user. a little out dated but as long as you don't require all the "fluff" of a upscale hotel you will be satisfied. everything the hotel had to plan for us went smooth and with out a hitch(transportation, tickets, advise...ect.). if you want some good deals definently visit china town, and never give the asking price there, the will barter with you. and the subway is not scary as portrayed, would recommend buying all day ticket.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Pleasant Experience”
Reviews.Author: Franklin2
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 9 night stay at the Edison. To be honest I was a bit concerned at first having read some of the reviews. However, I requested a refurbished suite and was pleasantly surprised by the accomodation. This place is not the Hyatt, but is an authentic NYC hotel. The suite was clean, with a TV and telephone in both the lounge and the bedroom. It had two walk in robes and the bathroom, whilst small, was well stocked with towels. The bed was new and was very comfortable as was the furniture in the lounge room. The staff overall were excellent apart from one young female staff member on the front desk who was particularly rude. The location is excellent and in terms of value for money I was not disappointed,

Reviews.Title: “I will stay here again”
Reviews.Author: grace_73
Reviews.Content: We stayed here Oct. 4-6, 2007. What a great hotel. The location is the seller of course. A few steps to Times Square! The check in was quick, no big line up. The doormen were very helpful. Quick elevators. The room was a bit small and the bathroom even smaller, but not an issue as I was only sleeping and showering here. The windows opened which was a bonus. Nice cleaning staff too. Downstairs there is a friendly little bar which we enjoyed. Also, attached there is a restaurant. We ate here both mornings and the food was good & cheap. If you don't want to sit down, next door to the restaurant is a deli. Go and get your food and bring it back to the room. I would definetely stay here again and I would recommend it to anyone. We paid $220 & $230, respectively. With everything else so expensive in NY, saving a bit of $ on your room sure helps.

Reviews.Title: “Not Great”
Reviews.Author: amdmr
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights, we had to cry and beg for two double beds when the rooms were booked months in advance for 4 people. Tiny rooms, outdated, no electrical plugs and the bathrooms were the smallest I have ever seen! Not a great place for 4 women. Location is central and decent only if you can put up with the Times Square tourist traps, but you can walk to nearly every Broadway show. Price is pretty good for New York.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific for the price and the level of service!”
Reviews.Author: zoesgirl
Reviews.Content: I was referred to the Edison by host of a conference I was attending. I wasn't sure about the quality, especially when I went online and booked a room that contained two rollaway cots. My husband had to back out of the trip at the last minute and when I got to the Edison, I told the front desk that I was one instead of two. I ended up in a nice suite with a real queen bed and a livingroom area. I have to say I was pleasantly surprised by how clean the room was and how wonderful and helpful the staff was. Believe me, for the location, it is a real bargain and I had a great experience (others in my conference from all over the country were not as lucky, most paid more and got far less). I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean room.”
Reviews.Author: broadwayjenjen
Reviews.Content: I have been to the Edison twice...once in May 07 and once in Dec 05, both times the service was very nice, the rooms were very clean, and of course, the location did not change and it is FANTASTIC. The first time we had a deluxe room and if you can afford the extra, it is well worth it, LOTS more space. The second time we had a standard room and it was kind of cramped although that did not matter(as the usual story goes in NYC, we only go to the room to nap/sleep!) There is a little store right next door that we stopped in nightly for bottled water or anything else we needed because we found no ice or vending machines at the Edison. Quite frankly, consider the price part of paying for the location and not so much the hotel and you will be a happy camper :O) Half a block from Times Square, near all the Broadway theatres, a few steps away from Restaurant Row, and Subways on almost every corner. I booked with [--], GREAT WAY TO BOOK YOUR TRIP!! Thank you for sending in your review. The community appreciates your feedback.

Reviews.Title: “Just don't go in half term! =]”
Reviews.Author: Truth11
Reviews.Content: My stay at, "The Edison," was pleasant although there was some problems.. My tip.. never visit New York in half term week, you will be swamped with school groups that keep you up to the early hours of the morning. Upon arrival of the hotel, the lobby was clean and efficient. The staff greeted us kindly and had staff take our luggage to our room. The rooms.. well.. they were what we paid for. The overall look of the room was clean although the room looked like we had walked into a time warp. The wallpaper was old and the carpet was stained. The bathroom had no locks on for privacy and the shower would always run cold water. The showers were so loud that we could hear next door's shower being run in the morning. The overall experience of the stay was satisfactory although we did have students keeping us awake. We did complain, but all they could say was, "I'm sorry sir," with the fakest smile accompanying it. I'm sure I would have had a better stay when not staying in the school holidays.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: sunchiller
Reviews.Content: Just returned from New York city from a girls weekend, We booked a room for 4, and was a bit concern due to the fact some of the reviews were quite negative. However to our surprise it was not everything people said. Our room was large for a new york hotel room. The room is was clean, yes it is dated with rooms that could be painted and old carpets. But who cares when you are only there to sleep and change. When you come out of the front door you are only a 2 min (tops) walk to broadway. The elevators can be slow but no biggie. The staff is friendly, and very helpful. The security by the elevators are great people to chat with for help with finding out were things are. We ate breakfast at the restaurant at the cafe in the hotel, food really good, staff not overly friendly. We also went to the Rum bar each night before we went to the play and met alot of nice people from around the world, staff their were pleasant. Only one thing to watch for the hotel has a service to the airport but charge 14 dollars or more a person and that is way to much if you are a group of four. As paying that its 56 to the airport and by taxi it is only 30-35 with a tip. The morning you leave a bell boy will flag a taxi for you. I would definitly recommend this hotel to anyone I plan to go next year with our kids.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: kate037
Reviews.Content: stayed at this exellent hotel for 6 days with 5 friends. having read some of the reviews i was a little nervous, but the hotel was spotless and the staff i had dealings with were friendly and helpful. the location is superb right off times square, starbucks on the corner ideal for morning coffee, or alternatively great coffee shop below the hotel. nice piano bar within the hotel a good starting point for a night out. lots to do in manhattan this was my forth visit and still found plenty to see and do. recommend walking over the brooklynn bridge and visiting the jewish muesium. good local bars - mean fiddler, scruffy duffys, social and china club for dancing. hotel room was immaculate, two double beds, large tv, air con and ensuite bathroom and large wardrobe. we had room 405 and it was ideal for our stay. clean and a good size, beds were changed and towels changed daily. luggage room available at the hotel, useful if you have a late flight places to eat - breakfast cosmic coffee shop, mcghees and many more. cant understand some of the negative reviews on this hotel. would definately use again

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad for the Price”
Reviews.Author: TerryS401
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night (9/25/07) and I thought it was very nice for the price. Considering other hotels in that area are in a much higher price range, this appeared to be a good deal. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The room was clean. We were 3 adults wih 2 double beds and we were very comfortable. Air conditioning worked fine considering it was a record breaking 89 degrees! Great location, We had to leave very early and it was great the Cafe Edison opened for breakfast at 6:00 am. Very reasonable too! Sure the decor and rooms could use a little updating, but it's not like the hotel was built yesterday!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Edison”
Reviews.Author: eskimogem
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Edison for 5 nights in September 2007, and although we weren't wowed by the hotel, we weren't displeased either. The location is fantastic, 100m from Times Square, and close to access to a variety of subway lines to explore the city. Being so close to the hustle and bustle of Times Square, I expected sleepless nights, but wasn't woken or kept awake once by any noise. The rooms were quite small, but there was plenty of room for two, and there was a good amount of wardrobe space. The decor is a little old fashioned, but the room and the bathroom was very clean. There was a tv with plenty of channels, and the air conditioning was a godsend in the heat! The staff were quite friendly for New York standards, (rude for any other city's standards) and a safety deposit box was free of charge to use at the hotel reception. I can't comment on the Cafe Edison that was attatched, as we never ate there! Overall, the Hotel Edison was an average, basic hotel, the main attraction being it's location, but it desperately needs a makeover, it looks terrible in comparison to it's W Hotel next door neighbour.

Reviews.Title: “better than expected”
Reviews.Author: tinkny26
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights in total after shopping around for months to find a room right for us. Even with reccomendations, we approached it cautiously after reading some other reviews. On arrival we were pleasantly surprised by what appeared to be a recently refurbished room with 2 doubles. Room was comfortable with neutral decor. Bathroom was a little "sad" with some mould on the ceiling, brown tiles and taps that require a knack to say the least. Aside from this, you'd be hard pushed to find a better located, better value hotel at such short notice. PS. Try the Brooklyn Diner...very yummy pizzas and a mountain of onion rings with your burger!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: mevTexas
Reviews.Content: Family of four from Texas. We loved it! Great location. Friendly staff and clean room, dated but clean. We requested a newly renovated room before arrival and got it. No problems at all. Did request extra pillows, though.

Reviews.Title: “Certainly run down since last time I stayed.”
Reviews.Author: Tandarook
Reviews.Content: 2 years since my last stay at the Edison (in 2005) I returned and was surprised at how much the hotel has deteriorated in that time. Our room - always on the small side - had become very shabby. The air conditioner (a box under the window) barely worked and smelt very musty (unlike last time when it worked fine). The windows were dirty, the curtains were torn and everything in the room looked very well used - including small holes in the sheets. It's a real shame as new bedding a good clean and a paint would have this place back to its former good state. I actually bought a friend here and felt embarrassed by the state of the place and the fact I had previously told her it was so great. The reception area still looks OK but the halls are quite poor now, especially the entry near Sophia's restaurant which appears to be being used as a semi-storage corridor for all manner of odds and ends including a desk, broken phone and some old carpet that were there the entire 2 weeks we were in the city. I was also concerned about the security in the lobby area as there seemed to be quite a few odd people 'hanging about' that were not there last time I stayed. I used the public phone booth near the concierge’s desk one afternoon and was concerned about someone potentially pick pocketing things from my handbag. In years passed unless they were guests these guys would have been moved on. All in all the location is still fabulous, the staff are still wonderful but the hotel itself really needs some repairs. If your only concern is cheap - then this is the place for you. While it's true in NY you barely spend anytime in your room I would prefer to stay somewhere that I can sleep without feeling grubby. In future I'll be looking elsewhere I think.

Reviews.Title: “great location on a budget”
Reviews.Author: wisetraveller_7
Reviews.Content: I had been shopping around for a hotel for about 2 months before I actually booked The hotel Edison. I even read the reviews on various sites including trip advisor. I booked through hotelconexions and got a great deal which was the main reason for which I overlooked the not so good reviews. Having said this I came prepared for the worst and it really wasn’t bad at all. Sure the room, bed, bathroom and building were definitely outdated but my room (2 double beds on the 12th floor) was clean, tidy and casual for 3 people. We stayed for about 4 days This hotel is literally at Times square and it’s in a safe area. Being so close to Times Square made navigating the huge city helpful. Staff were polite and let me check in an hour earlier. There is a small pizza shop a few steps from the side entrance and the pizzas were just fantastic!! You need to try it!! I would recommend this hotel ONLY to those who are within a budget and aren’t so particular. You just can’t beat the price in this location.

Reviews.Title: “Be careful”
Reviews.Author: MufiUk
Reviews.Content: We were booked in to the Edison by our UK TA Bath Travel as part of a return crossing package on QM2 and four nights in New York. We were told that this was a refurbished Art Deco hotel, right on Times Square. What a shock when we got there. Not knowing what state the hotel was in before the refurbishment we could not know how it was changed since, but it had a look of dowdyness on entering, and things got worse when we got in the lift, which was more like a service lift to see our room. Although the hotel brochure illustrated modern, clean airy rooms, ours was grubby with ramshackle dirty furniture and a standard of decoration from the middle of the last century, with the bathroom to match. Outside in the corridor two members of staff were having a violent argument during the short time we were in the room. We got out as quickly as possible and had to pay a large supplement to move to the Marriot. There were two more couples waiting to be moved also when we got down to reception. So, be careful with this hotel. Make sure you are going to get one of the refurbished rooms rather than the 1930 vintage we were offered. And would we go back? What do you think.

Reviews.Title: “Great location.”
Reviews.Author: toddthebod61275
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a affordable hotel near Times Square and found the Edison Hotel. We are use to large hotel rooms and found quite the opposite. The bathroom was so small the toilet seat would not go down because it would get caught on the toilet tissue dispenser. Everytime you wanted to raise or lower the seat you would need to move the paper roll. The bathroom water pipe to the toilet was painted silver and the paint was peeling badly. The shower was very nice and had plenty of water pressure. The closet was big enough but probably had 10-20 coats of paint on the coat hooks. All in all, the hotel had a very good location(1/2 block off Times Square) and clean but small rooms that are not well decorated. Also, there is no view.

Reviews.Title: “Small room, clean and simple, GREAT location!”
Reviews.Author: Heidihair
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay here. We were hardly in the room, but it was clean and the window actually opened! That was a nice feature to have at night to let a bit of breeze in -- we were very high up so no car fumes for us :) The A/C worked well in our room too. The place is charming in a retro kind of way, the cafe downstairs had good food and was convenient and my friend even had her hair cut at the salon -- it looked WONDERFUL! We were centrally located and had a great time, the staff was nice and the room and bath were clean. It was a bit worn around the edges as a whole, but not enough to take away from our good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it Loved it Loved it”
Reviews.Author: katie8484
Reviews.Content: Well to be honest I really couldnt fault anything about this hotel. I stayed with a party of 5 and we had a ball! Firstly I would like to say to anyone you will read a few neg reports on this hotel as I did before I went, but ignore. The hotel is a little old but very clean, the staff are lovely esp in the bar and the staff in the lobby are very obliging. It isnt the plaza as I said but to be honest its not really that bad and when your in New York your never in your room. I must say your so so close to broadway and times square its brill, but however surprisingly not noisy. I would recommend it to anyone and anyone I have told about it has gone and also loved it. I am returning there in March and cannot wait. So whatever neg reports you hear as far as reviews go IGNORE THEM!

Reviews.Title: “No AC and Shower a nightmare”
Reviews.Author: matrix1234
Reviews.Content: Location is awesome of Course. We were just there and it was pretty warm, the "air condition" or what ever you call that box in the corner couldnt cool off the room. After hours of walking around the city there was no place to rest and chill out. The bathroom is tiny but thats no big deal, the problem is the water system. The temperature of the water would go from just right to scalding hot. There was no way to get the temperature to regulate. Between an uncomfortabley hot room and an unregulated water system this was a sucky place to come home to after several hours of exploring. The electrical sytem in the room was pretty scarry . There wasnt enough plugs and the ones that are there made me look for the nearest fire exits. The staff was nice and helpful but I feel ripped off.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Shame about the Bathroom”
Reviews.Author: Bazza11
Reviews.Content: Like others before me, I found this hotel OK, the location was GREAT, the staff were pleasant, although when my husband cut his hand badly I was shocked to find that there was NO first aider in the hotel! The bathroom was horrible and in need to refurbishment but the room itsself was ok/clean. When in NY you should spend as little time as poss in your room so it suffices.

Reviews.Title: “with children”
Reviews.Author: Shazzy35
Reviews.Content: As we checked out trip advisor before going on our trip, I thought it fair to let others know our experiences. We have two boys aged 13 and 11. We stayed at the Edison Hotel, near Broadway/Times Square -an excellent location. I loved it as there are many original art deco features, although it is a little shabby in places. Four in one room was stressful at times, with nowhere to let off steam and the problem of varying sleep hours. The hotel's facility of renting movies helped ease some of the stress. We arrived early evening - late to us with the five hour delay - and found everything a bit hectic at first. It wasn't helped by the 11 year old crashing out and being fully alert by 4 the next morning. However, we came to enjoy walking down Broadway and looking at the shops and sights - Toys R Us has a great ferris wheel that the 11 year old liked but 13 year old not impressed by. We are not used to the Americam system of 'room only' and it was difficult to find somewhere for each meal that suited everyone. There is a cafe joined to the hotel, that seemed OK, and a great deli next door. But for us parents, who wanted more than cardboard plates and plastic cutlery, we did not manage to find anywhere mid-market, with decent food that included options our fussy children would consider. Activity-wise, we did a tour on the first day that took in most of the major sites and the Staten Island ferry - this was a great success with a personable guide.
