Second day was up the Rock for fantastic views over the city - all enjoyed and recommended. We also did Central Park, which was good as it was a fabulous day but boys surprisingly bored by it. Third day was a Circle Line cruise around Manhattan - again boys not impressed, weather had changed for the worse and we had a feeling that three days would have been enough! However, fourth day we took the subway and walked over Brooklyn Bridge, which everyone enjoyed, and spent time at South St Seaport pier and museum - again something for everyone here. I think we all appreciate having visited and familiarising ourselves with the sights, the road system, the subway and all the other things that make New York and I think three days would have been enough to see what we wanted to.

Reviews.Title: “First time in New York”
Reviews.Author: jjf15626
Reviews.Content: We came to see Grease at Brooks Atkinson theater (just half a block down the street) for our 32nd anniversary. The room was small, there was no other comfortable furniture except for the bed, so I wouldn't want to be cooped up in the room all day, but there's so much to do in NY that you're hardly in the room. The staff treated us very good, even let us in the room about 3 hours sooner than check in time. No cockroaches were found. The cafe Edison had great food, and I would/will stay there again when I can come back to stay longer and explore the city more.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Edison-what a joke”
Reviews.Author: mark2773
Reviews.Content: We spent the first 10 days of our honeymoon in lovely Las Vegas staying at the Mgm grand and then travelled to New York where we had booked into the Edison on times square. As soon as we got there the place looked grubby nothing like its website, we were given the key to our room and soon as we entered it we got the smell of urine, immediately we returned to the reception and demanded another room which we eventually got. This room was tiny (and from talking to others was the normal size) you could barely fit a suitcase either size of bed which was supposed to be a double but was a lot smaller, in the bathroom the sink was cracked and there was mould growing in the cracks, we were both devastated this hotel was a joke, we couldnt stay there it was just a tacky joke, we decided to find a new hotel in the morning we were so upset we walked the streets of new york to about 6am then my wife had to lye down. Anyway we got a great hotel just behind the edison (the Marriott marquis -a lot more expensive but worth every penny), after a day or two my wife noticed a lump on the back of her leg and it kept getting larger eventually we had to go and see a doctor- it was a bed bite or so the doctor thought and it obviously came from the edison (from talking to people around times square it did not have a good reputation for hygeine). So to end this review- Dont even think of staying there you will regret it, it smells, is tacky and everything said on its website couldnt be further from the truth. This experience really took away from our honeymoon We just hope others will learn from our mistake. I only wish I had my camera to record this nightmare of a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Knew the price was too good to be true”
Reviews.Author: LivTToronto
Reviews.Content: I am very disappointed with the Hotel Edison. The location is great, but the rooms were unclean (especially the bathrooms). Towels were not promply refilled. Sometimes had to wait all day for new toiletries. The majority of the staff was pleasant, but one of the agents at the front desk was extremely rude. We had a question about the valet and he responded angrily- "How should I know? Go ask a bellboy!!". He also became very rude and agitated towards a couple whose toilet had overflowed while they were out for the day. (Not surprising since there was a special way in which you had to flush the toilet) He should have been apologizing and accomodating to the distraught couple. I was very annoyed with the charge of holding luggage for the day. I have stayed in many hotels and this has always been a free service. The air-conditioning barely worked in the rooms. The lobby was an ice box, but the rooms were sweltering. Next time I go to New York I will pay the extra money and find a decent hotel. I will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Shoe Box full of fun!”
Reviews.Author: Percyb
Reviews.Content: When you step outside the hotel, there is an extreme odor. The room is very very tiny and a little gross. The TV didn't work, but we had a really great time. I liked the Art Deco style. Overall, price and location make this a dang good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Eeek a Cockroach!!!!”
Reviews.Author: itssocomplicated
Reviews.Content: STAY 06AUG07 - 13AUG07 Much like many people on here, we did our homework and checked reviews, contacted the hotel in advance of our stay requesting a renovated room etc.,.......well unfortunately that isn't quite what happened. Having arrived a bit before the check in time, we were pleased to be allocated the room and key and went to check it out...room 1538. Bit dark, bit tired, small, (terms used before in these reviews)..but hey its just a place to lay your head (we told ourselves). Oh and the AC made more noise than a Brass Band.....just a place to lay...etc., Jet lag hadnt quite kicked in but the thought of being back in NYC and so close to Times Square, wash a rush....so we unpacked and went of to get reacquainted. We managed to burn up several hours more before we returned to the room for some sleep......ahhhh...just a place to lay your head...... Quite a comfy bed...got the extra pillows (a must on arrival ask for them) ...a warm humid evening/night, during which I thought I felt something land on my neck....oh dear.......and then suddenly my wife screamed.....COCKROACH!!!!!....ugh...(pictures available on request). Not a great moment...it was BIG RED and very UGLY.....having "stunned" it I realized it may not be alone...and what was that that had landed on my neck? A call down to the reception (5am) and the guy down there said it would probably be about 10am before anything could be done....not very happy with that response I went down to see him in person.....wife still hysterical in the room. Must admit we got a new room within 20 minutes (even though "sorry we are full, no rooms to change to") Room 2018....and moved straight away................your waiting now are'nt you?.....what was that room like?..........FANTASTIC.....BRILLIANT.....SUPERB....a reasonably sized room, nice and recent decor with a great view (look down and left straight to Times Square) We have no other complaints about the hotel other than the obvious....but hey it was only a place to lay........oops sorry. Staff and amenities were great, the Edison Cafe (attached to the hotel) has a more traditional style......its Pure New York....staff work their butts off...food is plentiful and cooked however you prefer. There is also a Deli/Cafe a few steps from Edison -New Diamond CAFE - a good standard option within easy reach....handy for a coffee to take up to your room whilst you get ready for the next round of holidaying. Location is another obvious plus....out of the Main Entrance doors turn right...walk for 2 minutes..and you are there, right in the Heart of Times Square. All usual "must do" tourist attractions are within an easy walking distance, for those that are able, if not there is plenty of public transport and the hotel has its transport desk that can always help you make any special arrangements. Another handy tip: Go to the Time Warner building, just off the Columbus Circle, adjacent to Central Park...go into the basement and feast yourself on the wonderful array of foods which are available...salad bar/deli set up is heaven....pick whatever you like from a vast range of tastes and styles...go and get it weighed in at one of the forty odd checkouts and pop over the road to Central Park for a picnic...so romantic Finally (if you have managed to read this far...HIYA!!!)..we WOULD stay at the Edison again even with the night visitor event in our minds...we felt secure and looked after in there, the location is excellent and at reasonable rate (safety deposit box access from the front desk.....which is NO charge) all seemed to be run very efficiently. So perhaps when all said and done.....it ISN'T "just a place to lay your head" after all John & Lyn (UK)

Reviews.Title: “Just right”
Reviews.Author: twotips
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a location central to all the action but at a price more reasonable for what you get than at most other Manhattan hotels, this is it. It's an easy walk to Broadway theaters and must see sights of NYC. Just a few minutes walk from the heart of Times Square. Famous restaurants just around the corner. Subway nearby for quick access to points farther out. Staff was friendly and welcoming. Bed was comfortable. The room was nice sized. We really enjoyed our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel and what a location”
Reviews.Author: X42316
Reviews.Content: Me and my family stayed at this hotel for a week in 2005, and it was fantastic! Our family room was quite small, but had very comfy beds, good for collapsing on when you're jet lagged! I'd heard that the hotel was next to times square, but I never pictured it as close as it is! It is located right next to the restaurants and bars on times square, so you don't have to travel for miles and miles to get a decent meal. The breakfasts in Cafe Edison (a restaurant in the hotel) are very nice indeed and offer generous portions. I don't think hiring a car here is necessary, as alot of things are withing walking distance, and there are the yellow cabs and subways! I had great time in NYC and I would recomend this hotel to anyone who was going there!

Reviews.Title: “Would Return in a Heartbeat!”
Reviews.Author: Mom_of_Twins14
Reviews.Content: I traveled to New York with my 14 year old twins. We had a room with two double beds. The shower head was super high (great for tall people, which I am not one of). Wall plugs seemed limited but we were able to survive. There was more than enough room for the three of us!! Everything was wonderful. The people were friendly and very helpful. We never waited longer than a few minutes for an elevator (up or down)! The location was perfect! We walked just about everywhere! Never needed a car or taxi. If you are able and like to walk, then you will love that shows, Times Square, Central Park, 5th Ave, etc. were all within blocks of us. Thank you Edison for making our trip to New York a fabulous one! Like I said, we would return and stay there again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for nostagia lovers”
Reviews.Author: vanmunchen
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Edison is like stepping into a time machine which transports you back to the '30s or '40s. Nostagic music from the time wafting through the lobby helps to emphasise the mood. Rooms are of an average size but furnishings are a bit dull. As others have said, the location is fantastic - you couldn't be more central. Very lively bar and good cafe.

Reviews.Title: “Missed Opportunity”
Reviews.Author: WorldTravellor_7
Reviews.Content: What a wasted opportunity. Great location, and what was obviously a great hotel sometime in the past. Art deco, middle of the Theatre district, 50m from Times Square. Dirty rooms with an obvious lack of maintenance, but not uncomfortable. Staff had no concept of "customer service". But worst of all was the "Diner" attached to the hotel - without doubt the worst place I have ever eaten. Three meals were left less than half finished, and staff "care factor" was zero. It wouldn't cost a lot to upgrade the Hotel, and replace the diner.

Reviews.Title: “Not pretty, but EXCELLENT location”
Reviews.Author: vysheim
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with mu boyfriend to visit NYC. I think I must give my opinion since I always look for reviews before staying somewhere. Pros: 1.Location- The hotel is in the middle of Times Square, almost the same street as Broadway. Is really nice to go walking in the area enjoying Times Square in the night. Walking distance to Empire State Building, Rockefeller Center, Theater District, 5th Avenue, Madison Square garden and to subway stations. 2. Parking- The valet parking was 32$ the night. Not bad and the people in charge of the service are great. 3. Very comfortable bed (but bring your own pillows) 4. EDISON cafe- great breakfast Cons: 1. Appearance- The hallways are just UGLY. The building looks very old and kind of hospital-like. 2. The bathroom shower had 4 faucets instead of 2 and the bathroom flushed the same way as public bathrooms. Was funny looking. 3. Didn't like the towels at all. 4. The curtains didn't provide much privacy from the outside. If there's nothing better for my money I would stay there again knowing is not perfect at all. I went to NYC to be out of the room most of the time, so I had no major problems with my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Old-fahioned decor”
Reviews.Author: SEF2
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for one week during a business trip to New York. I booked it because of its proximity to the place where I was working during the week. I had stayed at the Pennsylvania Hotel nearer Macy's last time I had come to New York for business and had been a bit disappointed with it, as the decor was old-fashioned, the rooms looked a bit run down and the lobby was always crowded, so this time I decided to try the Edison, as it looked more modern and advertised a nice bar in the lobby, which I thought would be a nice place to go after a long day at work. However, it was almost identical to the Pennsylvania - very old-fashioned, unmatching decor in the rooms and a crowded lobby, so I guess this is typical for this part of New York at the 3-star price range. The rooms were cleaned daily, but on the evening I arrived I found rubbish in the bathroom bin and a used towel hanging from the shelf, although the bed was made, so I got the feeling someone had used the room after the maid had cleaned it, which didn't give me a good opening impression. For the rest of my stay, though, the room was cleaned daily and the towels were changed daily. The shower in the bathroom was a bit hit and miss - the water was either freezing cold or scalding hot and gave no warning when the temperature was going to change! The bathroom was quite small and there was nowhere to hang a handtowel, except from the shelf over the basin. I tried to watch the TV in the room on my first night there and couldn't get the remote control to change channels. I reported it the next morning and when I came back to the room that evening the TV had been left on (I assume to show me it had been fixed). The room itself was a decent size for one person - there was an armchair and a desk, as well as a double bed. There was also a telephone and an alarm clock in the room and a hairdryer in the bathroom. The worse thing about the room was the noise from the street - it's near Times Square after all! Sounds of traffic, horns, sirens, thumping music, etc go throughout the night, but if you close the window and switch on the air conditioning it drowns out the worst of the noise. The bar, which sounded really nice on the website, was a tiny pub-like area with some mediocre entertainment - it was always crowded, so I had to go outside the hotel to get a drink. As the hotel is in a tourist area there are lots of places to get something to eat, but they are mainly chain restaurants and burger bars and I always went over to 9th Avenue for a meal, as there are lots of independent restaurants there where the locals go. The hotel also has a restaurant and diner attached to it - I didn't eat here, as I found a more authentic one on 9th Avenue that I went to everyday (The Westway Diner) - huge portions, reasonable prices. Despite the number of people staying in the hotel, I didn't have to wait too long to check in or check out. The lobby just beyond the reception desk has a seating area and is a nice place to sit if you are meeting someone. It is beautifully decorated in art deco style, but it does get very crowded. There are several lifts, so I never had to wait long to get into one, but I was a bit concerned about security, as, although there was a notice telling you to show your room key to a security guard who sat near the lifts, I rarely saw a guard there and even when there was one, he never asked to see my card. The corridors are very long and when there is no one else about, it can be a bit creepy walking back to your room from the lift. The worst thing, from a business point of view, is that there is no business area with computers where you can access the internet. I think you can access the internet in your room if you have a lap top, but I didn't have a lap top with me and would have found an internet room really useful.

Reviews.Title: “Will never stay here again”
Reviews.Author: ALloyd
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in quite a few hotels, but this has been the worse by far. First of all, the rooms are tiny. The beds in our room seem to be sunken in the middle. The bathrooms are extremely small. A rather large individual would have a hard time trying to manuever in it. Also, the tiles in the bathroom had mold/mildew and there was a giant bug in there as well. The carpet in the hall was dirty and the walls were dirtier. The only positive thing I have to say is that it is in a good location. It is convenient to Times Square and Broadway. There is also a pizza parlor next door. I would recommend getting a slice. The food was good and the service at the pizza parlor was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “We love the Edison”
Reviews.Author: hubnmo
Reviews.Content: Ordinarily, my mother and I stay at the Edison for a mother/daughter week each year. This year, we decided to go all out and spend Spring Break with my husband, two daughters (18 and 25) my mother and I. What a treat! We arrived VERY early, and I voiced my concern about having my 67 year old mother's single room on the same floor as my husband and myself. The desk staff went above and beyond and gave us all three rooms on the same floor and side by side. My mother's single room was way beyond average. While our other two rooms were just as nice. I can't give an opinion about the cafe on site, but there is an OUTSTANDING cafe just on the other side of the Marriott's tunnel named "Junior's"! Superior breakfast and (for NYC) a very reasonable cost. As far as dining experiences go, exploring the restraunt row is almost as fun as shopping! Speaking of shopping, China Town is a hoot! Give it a try for faux or more designer bags and jewlery. But I digress...Back to the Edison....There is a quaint little bar in the lobby. It was a cozy atmosphere in which to get a really great cocktail after a long day of sightseeing and shopping. The bar staff was very friendly and knew their way around a Cosmo. As other posters have noted, the Edison is not in any way, shape, or form one of the newer mega-hotels, but it is charming in it's own right. I will continue to stay at the Edison on every future stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: stupidfakename
Reviews.Content: Stayed with three friends for a moms-only week in NYC and we absolutely loved the hotel. The bathroom was spotless (and two of us are fanatical clean-aholics so it was inspected thoroughly, as were the beds!) The location is superior! Everyone we met there (okay, with the exception of one grouchy bellboy) was courteous, thoughtful, helpful and considerate. The hotel is not new and could use some updating, but - quite frankly - that is part of the charm. This is not a chain hotel with generic everything - this is an eccentric, artistic, quirky and beautiful piece of Broadway history. We absolutely loved it and will return if possible!

Reviews.Title: “Give it a Try”
Reviews.Author: Newmania
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews, I was curious to see why half were negative and half were positive. Overall, I rate this place a 3. Positives= our room was ready at 1 PM when we checked in; the room was slightly shabby, but perfectly comfortable for our needs; the suite was priced well- only $277/night including tax; the water pressure was great. The location is excellent. Breakfast was reasonably priced and tasty. Overall the staff was professional and helpful. Negatives= the halls and elevators were really hot; fixtures, towels and furnishings were budget style; the business center was roasting hot. I would stay there again- the price and location outweigh any drawbacks.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, great locations, but a little icky...”
Reviews.Author: Mika047
Reviews.Content: I guess for the price we paid (well under $200) and being located in a great location RIGHT IN Times Square, I really can't complain. The hotel was a little bit dank and musty with the faint smell of body odor. The bed and sheets were clean enough but the carpet wasn't very nice and I wore bedroom slippers when walking. A queen sized bed took up 3/4 of the room and the bathroom was about the size of an airplane restroom with a small tub. But, when you're vacationing in New York, how much time do you really spend in your hotel room?

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Parrisa
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently spent seven nights at the Edison Hotel. I booked this hotel as I had previously stayed there about ten years ago and found it very reasonable. It is not a luxurious hotel, and if this is what you are looking for, the Edison is the wrong hotel for you. But the price, $160/night for a queen bed, AAA rate, and location were what we were looking for. Yes, the hotel is somewhat worn, but our room, although small, was clean. The first night we spent an uncomfortable night as the mattress seemed outdated and was very hard. I spoke to the front desk the next morning and the mattress was replaced by a new and very comfortable one. I also asked for extra pillows which were supplied. I had requested a quiet room and we were on the fourteenth floor at the end of a hallway and did not notice any street or hallway noise. We found the Edison cafe to be reasonably priced and a quick way to have breakfast and the food was tasty. As previously noted, the location of the hotel is great. It is in the middle of the theater district, right by Times Square, the half-price theater ticket outlet is in the hotel right behind the Edison and it is close to subway lines. The double deck hop on and off bus stops just one-half block from the hotel. Once our mattress was changed, my husband and I were totally satisfied with our stay, but again, this is more of a "budget" hotel and not a hotel for someone who is looking for luxurious linens and decor and a spacious room.

Reviews.Title: “Barely okay”
Reviews.Author: Carocook
Reviews.Content: I would agree with the reviewers who applauded the Edison for its location. It could hardly be better. And the staff was friendly enough. But, oh, my, a lot of things have to be overlooked if one comes away from this hotel feeling positive about the experience--like dimly-lit hallways and rooms, stained carpets, beat-up furniture, abrasive towels; hard, flat pillows; a hair-dryer that doesn't work, a toilet that doesn't flush properly, and a barely adequate air-conditioner to name a few. The Edison reminds me of European hotels I used to stay in in the 1960s, the ones that cost $3.00 a night. They were shabby, but they were cheap, so we just laughed at the sub-standard quality. I realize that $230 for a double room is inexpensive by NYC standards, but, when I pay that much money, I am not amused by inconveniences and discomforts.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: kiwitraveller55
Reviews.Content: Our friends recently stayed at this hotel in Times Square and said it was great and exceptionally well located to Times Square. They were right. It is right in Times square so be prepared for staying in the horn tooting, siren screaming capital of the world. It is singularly the noisiest place I have ever stayed. Aside from that it is a hotel designed in the Art Deco period. Unfortunately they have done nothing to it since. Our room was not cleaned very thoroughly (hairs and rubbish all over the bathroom floor) The bed linen looked like it had been slept in (and not by us!) The room had a very unpleasant odour. The bath taps ran continuosly and no one was interested in repairing them. The rooms were tired and run down. The hotel staff were surly and very uninterested in providing any level of decent service. The hot and colds taps in the shower ran like a symphony orchestra - hot one second and cold the next. The best I can say about this hotel is it's location in Times square. They have a cafe attached which is cheap for breakfast, or so it seems until they start adding on the taxes and compulsory "gratuities" (which runs between 15-20%) In fact all they do is double the tax. We noted a lot of places in New York add a complusory tip into your bill and then expect you to tip on top of that. So they are double dipping a lot of the time. The subway is the quickest transportation on Manhattan Island. Although not as good as the London tubes they are reasonably quick and have lots of destinations. A single ride is $2 per person and you can purchase a 'Metrocard' in 4,10,20 etc denominations. You can use one card for two or more people (you just hand it over to them and they swipe it through again). You can't do that with the 'Oyster' card in London. Unfortunately it is difficult to find any maps of the various different lines in the tube stations themselves so try and get a map from one of the tourist centres. Otherwise you may find it a little frustrating trying to work out where you should be. By water the cheapest and most efficient travel was via Water Taxi and using their "hop-on-hop-off" system. It goes quite close to the Statue of Liberty so you can get some decent photos. However it does not stop on the Island like some tour boats do. Electronics are very reasonable for Kiwis to buy. Expect to barter HARD and make sure you know what the price of the same item is at home. We found that on average you could buy the product for 1/3 of the ticketed price. Our best dinner was in Greenwich Village/Soho. The people and the restaurants are very eclectic and although very busy - nothing like Times Square. We likened moving around (actualy shuffling) in Times Square to the end of a football match. Only it never eases up except on a Sunday morning. It's chaotic, frenetic, alive and exhausting.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, rooms...ok...”
Reviews.Author: Dani_Serres
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is its location: right in the Times Square! The hotel is little old, but the rooms are ok... It is the best price on Times Square, worthwhile.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: shazzie123
Reviews.Content: I stayed here as part of a group of 11 in late May/Early June. The location is sensational - right off Times Square - and they did us a really good deal for a 2night stay. The hotel restaurant was lovely (great breakfast omelette!) and the staff were polite - our Asian waiter even spoke a few lines of Irish to us! The hotel bar is really cosy and comfortable - somewhere to enjoy a quiet drink in a relaxed ambiance. Four of us shared one room and found it to be spacious, well-lit and clean. The cleaning staff were very dilligent, always asking if we needed fresh towes etc. All in all, we had a really pleasureable stay at Hotel Edison and I'd certainly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “You Can't Top this Deal”
Reviews.Author: St.LouisEileen
Reviews.Content: This is the perfect tourist hotel. Right in Times Square, a block from Restaurant Row. The price is unbelievably good, the lobby something to travel to see(WPA murals on twenty foot ceilings) And make sure to check out the cafe. The staff is friendly and helpful, and the security is good. My single room was about the size of my large bathroom, but who cares? It had everything I needed, it was clean, and it was comfortable. I had one of the new mattresses. This is an older hotel. You can see the wear and tear. But for the price, it's all worth it. And it's just fun sititng in the lobby watching the people. Eileen D. St. Louis

Reviews.Title: “Great location ... mediocre hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dwaylar
Reviews.Content: Basically the hotel has some problems but if you're not worried about luxury I'd recommend the stay simply because of the location. Plenty of Broadway theaters within a block of the hotel. Times Square is only 1/2 block from the hotel's entrance. The rooms are very old and worn but for the most part were clean. There were bed bugs in the first room they gave us but the quickly put us in another room which was better. The A/C barely keeps the room at a comfortable temperature from the August heat so we picked up a small fan to help with the cooling. The windows do not open so there is a slight musty smell from the humidity. The hallways are also quite musty smelling. There is a business center with plenty of computers and printers which came in very handy for printing out maps and itineraries. The lobby is a beautiful art deco design and the staff are very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but beware of bed bugs”
Reviews.Author: Wombatkev
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last Oct for 2 nights and it was bad. First the good things: location was excellent - couldn't get any closer to Times Square. Price was fairly reasonable for NY standards. They also allowed early check-in as we got in on a red-eye flight from SFO. The lobby also looked quite impressive with its murals -- so good first impressions so far. Now the bad: rooms were incredibly small and old (while NY rooms are smallish, this one was really small). The room and bathroom looked like something out of the 1960s. The worst thing was the bed bugs! After resting on the first day we found ourselves itching all over and found a number of bed bugs on our beds! We scrambled in the middle of the night to ask for a change of rooms. The receptionist did not batter an eye lid and moved us to an even smaller room with one bed, but luckily with no bed bugs. It was the first time I encountered bed bugs and it was scarry .. the itch lasted all through our 2 week holiday in the US. After that, we moved to the Grand Hyatt and it was heaven by comparison -- and we paid only a little more using Priceline.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: The-Clouds
Reviews.Content: I admit, I was a little skeptical due to some of the reviews on here but I was pleasantly surprised. We arrived around 2:00 and our room was ready, check-in was a breeze. The lobby was nice and the employees were very helpful. The room was nice and clean. My only issue was the bed; it needs to be updated, it's a little worn. But, good enough for a night's stay. Location was perfect. We were within walking distance to everything. We walked to Broadway to see a show, afterwards we walked to a Rosie O'Gradys steak and seafood (the food was delicious.) I believe the cab ride to Laguardia airport was about $28. All in all it was a great trip!

Reviews.Title: “My hotel next visit”
Reviews.Author: RonitIsrael
Reviews.Content: Location: great. Two minutes from Times Square. Close by 6-7 minutes from subway. Safe also at evenings for single woman (till 2200 at least). The room size: Fare enough. Basic but sufficient for sleeping etc. there is a cabin for suitcases and bags, it has a door. Very convenient. Cleanliness: all right. The Bathroom:. is very small and if you plan on putting sophisticated make-up, bring ahead a big mirror and remember you'll have no convenient place to pamper yourself. The bath tub is in the standard size and you have warm water whenever you need. No shower head that you can hold in your hand, though. The air condition: as many pointed before, it is sometimes noisy and you're advised to bring ear plugs. The service: answers immediately and solves the problem (the air condition was only warming) Breakfast: downstairs is the Café Edison which spares you the search of a diner in the mornings. Wide range of dishes. Fare prices. Work quickly. Coffee: at the corner there's a Starbucks branch. Very convenient. Club at night: 4-5 evenings a week there's a good singer in the in-house club downstairs. Most enjoyable when you return from your evening out and wanting to have a night cap over good music. Eating near by: Euoropa café on Time Square. All the ways to create your own salad. Big dishes. Not expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect position”
Reviews.Author: marburt
Reviews.Content: We (2 middle aged travellers) arrived approx 2am and were slightly put off by the general appearance at that time of night but in the light of day things looked up! Yes, it is old, worn, knocked about and not quite what we had hoped for after spending two weeks on a five star caribbean cruise but after spending three nights there I would have no hesitation in returning and recommending this hotel. Why? Firstly. the price was superb considering that you are right in the heart of Times Square, right on Broadway. Secondly, our room was very large (2 double beds), bright and airy with 3 windows, freshly decorated, and the beds were the most comfortable I have slept in for a long time. (lovely fresh bed linen too!) And the pillows were so comfy! (wish I could have put them in my luggage). And all spotless! OK the bathroom was a bit dated and small but again spotlessly clean and plenty of towels etc changed daily. And thirdly, the staff were pleasant and helpful - no complaints there. And the diner was OK for breakfast. So what more could I have asked for? I knew when I decided not to pay exorbitant rates that I would not get the Waldorf Astoria but believe me I was more than delighted with the Edison. You certainly wont get anywhere more central to everywhere at this price. So if you are looking for somewhere to have a clean bed, be right in the heart of the action and not spend a fortune dont be afraid toconsider the Edison, you'll go far to get better.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel”
Reviews.Author: litehouse15
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 3 nights. Beautiful lobby and the people at the front desk were great. We paid for twin beds but got full size beds. The rooms were big enough and very clean. I enjoyed the restaurant and the bar. The location was wonderful. The only thing I had a complaint was the noise. We were on the street side and I could hear music and horns but most of the time too tried to care. I enjoyed the Gift shop, travel services and they booked your transporation to the airport. Great for the price and location is to die for. I also got to see Kevin Spacey when he was in the play just down from the hotel. He signed his autograph and got some good pictures. Will be back next year

Reviews.Title: “BEST deal in NYC!”
Reviews.Author: skj02
Reviews.Content: The Edison Hotel is just a few steps away from Broadway/Times Square - literally! We stayed here for a conference, which was held at the Marriott right across 46th street. We literally walked out the door of Edison Hotel and into the door of the Marriott. We paid about half the price of the Marriott and even less than anyone else at the conference who stayed nearby in other hotels. And best of all, we had the largest and cleanest room of anyone who tried those other hotels. The staff was super friendly and helpful, the location was awesome, and the room was very comfortable. Edison Hotel is HIGHLY recommended by us!

Reviews.Title: “The Edison is fine”
Reviews.Author: jackie464
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a one night stay at The Edison. Location is awesome. I had tickets to A Moon for the Misbegotten, (with Kevin Spacey), I had to walk a few doors down the street. The room was basic, but I have paid more for less. It was clean, an absolute in my book and yes the bathroom was small, but I didnt spend much time in the room anyway. There was a little noise from the piano bar downstairs (I was on the 12th floor), but the bar closes at 1:00 and I dont think I heard any music after midnight. The only downside was parking...not because there isnt any, there is...and they park for you, but we were staying in town until about 6:00 and in order to keep our car where it was, we would have had to pay for another full day....we chose to move it to another lot and pay there. But I would stay here again for a short term stay!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Edison was great!!”
Reviews.Author: purvi
Reviews.Content: I read many reviews on Hotel Edison they varied so much it made me curious. The fron desk people were polite and helpful. The room was typically small but clean and recently tastefully renovated. The elevators were way above average for a NYC hotel. Of course the location is absolutely fabulous and the art deco lobby beautiful and well maintained. The restaurant OK for breakfast & lunch. The deli delicious do not go after 1:00 AM or before 6:30 am. I would definitely stay there again. DEP North Carolina

Reviews.Title: “Great for Theatres - Fantastic Value”
Reviews.Author: Simon1944
Reviews.Content: The 46th Street entrance/exit is opposite the half price TKTS booth and the hotel is just 5 minutes from most Broadway theatres. It is the perfect location for seeing shows. I booked a mini suite for $225 + taxes which had two separate room each with seating, television and a closet. One had a sofa which rolled out into a double bed and the other had a double bed. There was one shared bathroom. It was excellent value. The lines for checking out and checking in at the front desk were sometimes too long - but oveall the Edison offers fantastic value. I have been staying here for more than twenty years. Occassionally I have tried alternatives but the Edison is the best value - and so convenient for theatres. The Cafe Edison is also great value - although they don't like you to linger too long after breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic break, lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: kazzio
Reviews.Content: We have recently returned from our break of 4 nights in New York. We stayed in the Edison and I have to say it was brilliant! Staff were friendly and helpful, the room was very clean and recently refurbished. The Edison Cafe has a fantastic breakfast and the bar is great (the locals drink there after work). The lobby decor takes you back in time - you can just imagine how New York used to be, its very ArtDeco - we loved it. The location, as others have said is perfect. Turn left and your on Broadway - walk right and you will come to Central Park, walk left and your on your way to The Empire State Building. I will definately book this hotel again when I next go to New York.

Reviews.Title: “Great central hotel for Times Square & Broadway”
Reviews.Author: Pembsskier
Reviews.Content: We took the whole family to New York this Easter and was very pleased with the Hotel Edison. It was clean the staff were friendly and we would certainly stay there again when we visit New York.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location - good for children”
Reviews.Author: beth71
Reviews.Content: My eleven year old son and i have recently visited this hotel and were very pleased. The edison has a fantastic location for getting about to all the main tourist spots, empire state, central park, Broadway, (obvisouly there is walking involved but that's how you see the best of NYC) the hotel is well priced, again considering the location. Rooms were comfortable and clean, the bathroom is small but that really didn't cause any problems. Times square at night is a great place to wonder around and is only a stones throw from the hotel, 'toys r us' and the m 'n' m shops are great places for children to be children. A snack shop is just next door to the hotel for hot drinks , the only down side to the hotel is no tea and coffee machine in room! Overall a great hotel we would definatly go again.

Reviews.Title: “urrrghhh !!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Trunta
Reviews.Content: Booked in, reception staff rude and uninterested, room shabby small , smelly , dirty. Boxes 3 high packed our corridor (nice and safe in a fire). After a terrible nights sleep booked out and found a proper hotel. Ive stayed in some hotels in my life but this takes the biscuit. I would say this hotel is only good for 1-2 nights very budget accomodation for students. Its location is mentioned many times by people, Mcdonalds on time square is clean and warm, and the staff are polite. So please believe me , its a very low quality budget hotel, which does have a place in the market, but please dont spoil a nice holiday by booking this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “No problems with the Edison”
Reviews.Author: taurusbrisbane
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed at the Edison for seven great nights in March 2007. Yes, the room and bathroom were rather small, but they were clean and well serviced every day. The location of the hotel simply cannot be beaten. Minutes from Times Square, Restaurant Row and all the great shopping of Midtown. Cafe Edison downstairs is a great place for breakfast at very reasonable prices. This hotel has a lot of charm, but could do with some updating. This was my second time in New York and my first time at the Edison. I will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “First Time in New York! Great Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Miranda678
Reviews.Content: Four of us shared a room here for our five night stay in New York. Good-sized room and we didnt get in each other's way, and the beds were extremely comfortable. Sheets, towels changed every day. The Concierge was more than helpful, each day we would say where we wanted to visit, and she would give us a map and mark the Subways, etc. The Deli next door was amazing, we could buy our coffee and breakfasts there and have it in our room. No problem. All in all, I would thoroughly recommend this Hotel. It was a delight to stay there. Cant wait for our next trip!

Reviews.Title: “I loved it toooooo!!!”
Reviews.Author: northshoreeagle
Reviews.Content: My wife, daughter, and sister stayed there last summer and we had a blast. We had two rooms on the third floor and they met our needs. And the Edison DOES have room service. I ordered breakfast every day for three days from the cafe. You get it delivered in bags and with plastic utensils but its available anytime the Edison Cafe is open. Its just a great place and the TKTS joint was right across the street as was Starbucks and the tour buses and Times Square. We loved it.

Reviews.Title: “I LOVE the Edison”
Reviews.Author: margieHouston
Reviews.Content: I am writing in reponse to negative reviews posted about the Edison... I have stayed at this hotel at least 20 times in the past 10 years and I love it for many reasons. First, the price. Nothing close to this wonderful location can compare. No coffee pot in the room? Who drinks that awful stuff anyway; Starbucks is just across the street. No room service? Yes, but the iconic Cafe Edison is connected (and many connected folks can be seen there)! The Edison is walking distance to almost everything including all the subway stops... We ignore the banging pipes and appreciate the art deco style and mostly all the friendly and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Ever, Over Priced for Quality!”
Reviews.Author: Tracyface40
Reviews.Content: We paid over $200 per night for a double room ONLY, no breakfast, in this hotel. When our travel agent gave us the website of the hotel, we took a look and it looked delightful, simple and very clean. However, when we got there the walls were disgusting and the room was a disgrace. We asked to be moved as we had paid a lot of money for a room, which I would pay no more than £50 per night. But according to them, all rooms were to the same standard. Then the card lock on our door broke and we were unable to get into our room. This was about 1am after a night on the town. We called the concierge and they made us wait 20 minutes outside our room for someone to come and fix the door. The concierge tried to get in for at least 10 minutes before admitting the lock was broken (which we already knew - cheers). So then we had to wait for a kind of locksmith to come and completely refit the door lock, which took another half hour. Again, they made no attempt to move us to another room. I understand that Times Square is quite a popular place, but we looked at the Renaissance Hotel, which is a 5* hotel located next door, with marble floors and white gloved concierge, and it was only $50 extra. We checked out one of their rooms and it was amazing, with tea and coffee making facilities and free wi-fi. Unlike the Edison who do not provide tea and coffee making facilities and their wi-fi is non existent! My advice, don’t stay at the Edison, if you can afford an extra $50 per night, go to the 5* Renaissance Hotel next door. I am going to write a lovely letter of complaint to my travel agent who misrepresented this hotel to me.

Reviews.Title: “Shappy”
Reviews.Author: ocarrollm
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel at the last minute so I didn't get a great deal that must people seem to have got. I paid around $230 for the room for one night. The room was one the 4th floor and was very small; you couldn't swing a cat in the bathroom. The bed clothes were tired as were the carpet and cutains. Overall the room was as basic as one could expect which wouldn't be so bad if you got a good rate but with what I paid I just felt ripped off. Beyond the room the hotel is very tired,shappy and not very clean. I was immediately on arrival put off when I say the filthy lobby windows. As for the area, I'm not a huge fan of Time Square and people should be aware that it is tacky and touristy. I wouldn't return.

Reviews.Title: “steps from times square”
Reviews.Author: jimbits
Reviews.Content: I've used trip advisor many times so now it's my turn to give back. This hotel, although not fancy, has alot of charm to it. This was our first trip to New York City so we were a little overwhelmed by deciding which hotel to use and we were not disappointed. Check in was very busy when we arrived but we were taken care very promptly and efficiently. Our room on the fourteenth floor was well above the street noise. The bathroom was outdated but it served its purpose. The room was very clean and we never had a problem with towel supplies or anything else. Unlike alot of people on this site, I am happy as long as things are clean and work. Heck, you are in New York, who hangs out at their hotel? The location is fantastic as it is quite literally steps from Times Square. We arrived at night and didn't really know where we were at as we got there. After checking in at around 10 pm we went for a walk and we came around the corner and Bam! there it was, Times Square lit up and crazy busy. The Rum House was a great place to unwind after a busy day, quiet with a bit of thirty's charm. The Cafe Edison was a great place to start the day as breakfast was cheap, plentiful and super fast service. Service in New York was so good everywhere and fast. Where I live pizza delivery can take two hours and Tim Horton line ups are 20-30 mins.(Tim Hortons are Canadian Starbucks but better) so maybe it just seemed fast to what I'm used to. The Grayline tours office is only a block away and I highly recommend the tours except maybe the Brooklyn part. The deli next door, as you've read here, is pretty good too. Our only regret was that we saw one Broadway show (The Producers incredible!) and not more. We will stay here again as the price, location and service is so outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Lovely Rooms, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: philandcarys
Reviews.Content: I'd read a few reviews and was expecting much of the Hotel Edison but was very pleasantly suprised. Our room was absolutely lovely, quite spacious and really nicely decorated, and very clean. We didn't have much of a view but we were only on the third floor anyway and as everything you would want was right outside the hotel this didn't matter. The location could not have been better - right in the heart of Times Square - excellent for going out and rolling home at the end of the evening. The staff were very friendly and helpful. All in all we were really pleased we booked the Hotel Edison and would definately stay there again on our next trip to New York

Reviews.Title: “Supercalifragilisticexpialidocious!”
Reviews.Author: Helge&Norm
Reviews.Content: We couldn't fault our stay at the Edison. The hotel is in the heart of the theatre distrisct. We went to see Mary Poppins during our stay. Our room was lovely, very clean. We had clean towels every day. We stayed for 5 nights and the bed was changed at least once that I know of, probably more. The hotel bar, "The Rum House" was very lively and packed every night. The staff were friendly and helpful. We would certainly stay here again and hopefully very soon. Helen and Norman. Faversham, Kent. United Kingdom.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal for NYC!”
Reviews.Author: JLN-4
Reviews.Content: Edison hotel was in a great location - literally around the corner frm Time's Square and next to all the Broadway theaters. I will stay there again when I visited NYC. The rooms could use some updates and they were not the cleanest. That said, the room was much cleaner and bigger than my last experience at a hotel in New York. Overall, it is great value for NYC and the staff is very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Dont stay here if you need your sleep!”
Reviews.Author: tinkerbell44
Reviews.Content: If you need more than 1 hour sleep to function, do not stay at the Edison Hotel!! I agree the location is great, but what use is being close to everything if you are too tired and miserable to go anywhere/enjoy anything?? We were a party of four. When we got to the first room there was something brown and horrible sprayed up the wall by the door, so i quickly allowed the other couple to have that room! When we were taken down to our room it was slightly cleaner! It also seemed that dodgy that we actually used to wish each other good luck and we'd hopefully see you in the morning as we went to our seperate rooms! When it came to going to sleep - we were staying at the front of the hotel and there was a lovely man who liked to spray clean the pavement outside at 1 o clock every night!! (It is not a quiet spray cleaner!) I think maybe they need to invest in some thick double glazing or something because by the third night of no sleep i could quite happily of opened the window and dropped our wardrobe on the 'lovely spray cleaners' head!! The lucky other couple were right by the lifts as well, i would request to be moved if you get put there as your dreams will be full of, 'Ding, Ding!' otherwise. Obviously that would depend on you actually getting to sleep! Now i am not a snob, i have stayed in some very dodgy B&B's in blackpool etc but I just really need sleep! On the whole, i suppose we did get what we paid for, but i would just like to advise other people who need at least 4 hours sleep that it is worth paying a bit more to stay somewhere else a bit further out. You can get everywhere really easily by tube anyway you dont need to be staying right in the centre! Have a good time!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JoHouston
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I were there the week of December 11th and could not have had a better time. I was a litte concerned about the hotel after reading some of these reviews. But when we got there our room was ready for us before the check in time. I was really pleasantly surprised about how nice I thought our room was. I see where there were complaints about the size of the bathroom, what do you want to do in there? It was fine for running in and cleaning up. As far as the complaints about the hallways, its an older hotel in New York, that is what makes it interesting. We were out the door by 6:00 a.m. every morning and did not return until anytime before 11:00 p.m. We were not even in there long enough to worry about it to begin with. I had also locked ourselves out of our room two times and had to run an d get another key. That was not a problem at all either. The restaurant downstairs was great for getting something decent to eat at a reasonable price. They served you promptly so you could get on your way. You are right there by Times Square and pretty much anywhere else you want to go. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: JackMan_ValleyGirl
Reviews.Content: Review title says it all!! Times Square is literally 10 yards from the hotel front door. The lobby and public access areas are very Art Deco and sum up the era of the 1920's. The rooms are clean and comfortable, however they do need a fresh lick of paint, updating would be the wrong word to use because of the style of this hotel. The photos on this web site are very accurate and contrary to other reviews we found the hotel staff on the whole from the hotel porter to the receptionists helpful and courteous. Cafe Edison, cheap and cheerful, food is good and plenty of it, and was used by New Yorkers which is always a good sign. Overall a good hotel we would stay at again. A lick of paint should not put anyone off this hotel as location more than makes up for it. One must do trip for those with a sweet tooth is to Juniors in Brooklyn. This has been voted the best cheesecake in America and quite rightly so!! Easy to get to on the subway, ( don't be put off by rude and unhelpful staff in the ticket office). There are 2 others, 1 in Times Square just behind hotel and the other is in Grand Central Station which both do great breakfasts but make the effort to go to the Brooklyn site which seems to be more frequented by locals than tourists which is reflected in the price and size of the portions!! Breathtaking!!!

Reviews.Title: “Why all the complaints?”
Reviews.Author: newyorkisawesome
Reviews.Content: I don't know why so many people are complaining! I stayed at the Edison for four nights, and my room was lovely. I think that they have been renovating floor-by-floor, as we took a trip to the 22nd floor, and it wasn't particularly nice. The corridors are quite shabby, but the rooms are nice, clean and well maintained. The beds were comfortable, and there is an iron, hairdryer, phone and TV in every room. The maids are wonderful, the beds are made every day, the bathroom cleaned, and fresh towels put in the bathroom. And the rumor about them stealing money is untrue, as I left money out on the side every day, meant as a tip, but it was never taken. I would definitely go back, but try to get a room on a lower floor, because to be honest the views aren't great from any side and the rooms on the lower floors seemed nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SouthJerseyDan
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at the Edison twice in the last six months. Overall, this is an excellent value Hotel in a great location. The Cafe Edison (aka the Polish Tea Room) is excellent - try the matzo ball soup. As others have said, the rooms are adequate, clean and comfortable. The decor is outdated and shabby, and but has a homey feel to it, like visiting a great aunt. If you are looking for a place to stay that offers great value, choose the Edison.

Reviews.Title: “Just what I wanted”
Reviews.Author: NYC-rules
Reviews.Content: Hotel Edison is all we wanted in a hotel in New York. As we didn't plan to send much time in the room it was fantastic. Its right in the middle of everything, but from our room we couldn't hear any noise from traffic or anything which is good. Staff seemed friendly and helpful didn't really need to speak to them much. Theres a shop in the hotel which is cheap and sells everything! Very conveniant. I would definatley stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “very unhelpful staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: ScotlandRachel
Reviews.Content: Firstly the location of this hotel is great, times square is on your doorstep. HOWEVER, the staff in this hotel are very,very unhelpful and unfriendly. For example, i needed to find out about transport to the city hall, i asked at the desk who directed me to the transportation desk who told me to ask the concierge. No one interested in helping. Heating in room did not work, phone did not work, bits of chipped enamel floating in bath, hairdryer broken, door hard to open with room key. Payphones in lobby were mostly out of order. Staff at front desk ignored people and stood talking to each other. I am not a hard person to please, i have travelled to many countries throughout the world and have stayed in many hotels,this was by far the worst. My advice to you -pay a bit extra and stay at one of the many other hotels in the area. I will return to new york, i will not return to the edison.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: HolidayQueenIreland
Reviews.Content: Really dont know what people are expecting for the price,okay its not newly renovated but the location is excellent. you are in NY for the sights, shopping!!! Staff were very friendly, food in the little cafe was really good and very cheap compared to other places. Sitting in the middle of broadway what more could you want. When I return to NY Hotel Edison will be my first stop. Think price and location, the rest can be overlooked

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel - don't understand all the naysayers!!”
Reviews.Author: illtryanythingonce
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Edison January 27 - 29, 2007 in room 1468. Lovely, lovely time!! From the doorman to the concierge to the housekeeping, everyone was attentive and friendly. We checked-in before 2 p.m. (listed time is 3 p.m.) and didn't have to say a word! Desk staff had our keys in our hands in under 5 minutes with a smile and a "welcome"! Hotel location couldn't be better - across the street from the Barrymore Theater, two blocks off "hell's kitchen" restaurants, 7 blocks from Central Park and close enough to Times Square to whistle!! Given that, the room was extremely quiet, only a few horns were heard through the open window at night - part of the NYC experience. The room itself was NOT "small" or "tiny" as some reviewers said - I'm not sure how large you need it! I am not aware of many hotels that offer king beds (without a premium!) and our queen was comfortable. We had a shower/bath tub in a well-appointed bathroom. Past reviews and the hotel website said that hair dryers were only available upon request, but our room had one in the bathroom that worked well. Lots of towels, nice water pressure, clean tub. Room had a writing desk, satellite television, large closet and chest of drawers, two night stands. Only had to ask for extra pillows. Got a terrific price by calling the hotel ($175/night) and would stay there/recommend it anytime!!

Reviews.Title: “mouse was in my room with glue traps under the bed”
Reviews.Author: mspiddles
Reviews.Content: The hotel had a dirty bed spread, and the water coming out of the shower had rust in it. I woke up in the night to find a mouse in my bathroom. I call the front desk and someone came and just swept it away with a broom and dust pan. I was horrified. Then I noticed other glue traps under the bed . I felt the hotel was very unclean. The staff was nice, but hotel was not a clean place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad place to stay if you get a good deal”
Reviews.Author: Luv2Travel2006
Reviews.Content: Booked a room here for four nights. Hotel is centrally located; right in the heart of Times Square. It's good base for exploring Manhatten but be aware due its location-it is busy and loud day and night. I could hear sirens all night. Room was larger than expected. I'm not too picky about furnishings but I really didn't feel the room was thoroughly cleaned - more like a surface cleaning. The washroom sink was not washed but the faucets were shined-that sort of thing. Would stay here again if I had the same discount (about a $100/less per night than what is currently advertised on special)-I got lucky with that!

Reviews.Title: “Bring slippers”
Reviews.Author: SheGoes
Reviews.Content: Central location for theater-goers, but the cramped rooms are very dirty and in need of a serious update on the bedding, mattresses, carpeting, and plumbing. One room had a chipped plywood cupboard in place of a closet, and one room had a large spider web in a dark corner. I've had to stay here several times for work and it's one of my least favorite hotels. I had to move the bed in order to get at the phone line to connect my lap-top computer.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value right at the heart of the action”
Reviews.Author: MALLA1
Reviews.Content: First an important tip!!! Try to book your cab from the airport to the hotel in advance we got off the plane and when we walked out of arrivals we were approached by drivers offering to take us from the hotel they quoted prices between 70 & 90 dollars once outside we found a cab who charged us just $45 This Hotel is ideal if you want to be in the heart of things its less than a 30 second walk from Times Square. We used the hotel just as a place to sleep and freshen up and for this purpose the hotel was perfect. We did not eat at the hotel so I can't really pass comment on the food but even if you did not like the food there are plenty of other place ranging from all you can eat chinese for $9.99 to expensive restaurants all within a very short walk. Our room was on the back of the hotel so the we did not suffer from the noise of the traffic.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Location”
Reviews.Author: l_crane13
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a location that can not be beaten. Just a few steps and you're in times square. The rooms are of a good size for new york standards and the staff are very friendly. It was all clean and felt safe. I would defiantley stay here again if I get the chance to go back to new york.

Reviews.Title: “hotel location superb, rooms spotless but need updating / redecorating”
Reviews.Author: P&Cazz
Reviews.Content: We stayed 30th Dec - 4th Jan 07. Check in and out not a problem. Staff we delt with were very helpful. Room was a bit dark and dated but spotlessly clean and average size. Corridors need a lick of paint tho'. Hotel is an old building and lobby is grand and has alot of character. Location of hotel could not be beaten. Had the windows open, (as times square was only a couple of hundred yards away) before we went out new years eve. Atmosphere and noise were brill. There is a nice deli next door. Numerous places to eat. If you have a big appertite, go to planet hollywood and try the ribs for size. You might have to undo your belt a couple of notches afterwoods. My girlfriend thought she had died and gone to heaven - SHOPPING PARADISE..................need I say more. I dont like shopping that much but i bought a few items also. Very cheap with exchange rate nearly 2:1. Police on every corner, felt very safe. People friendly in general. Overall a brilliant break in a fantastic city Planning our next trip already!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel All Around”
Reviews.Author: EngAkWaSdKy
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Edison Hotel back in March 2006 for a ten day trip to New York City. For the price paid, this hotel is definitely a steal. They could even stand to raise prices a litte (in their own interest, not travelers!) and I think people would continue to book there. Let's face it... It doesn't have a pool, etc., but who the heck goes to NYC to swim?! This is definitely a budget hotel, but if you're anything like me, you just need a place to keep your luggage and to sleep. So if it's clean and safe, then it's good. And that's exactly what the Edison Hotel does. Staff was excellent... went out of their way to help when they could. The lobby is an excellent place to just chill out... and the 24-hour deli next door is a lifesaver! Fresh, yummy muffins and French Toast, as well as a grill with hamburgers, etc. and a salad bar. But the best part of the hotel is the location. Why stay somewhere 10-15 miles away and commute each day to the city when you can stay 1/2 block away from Times Square? I went to quite a few theaters to see Broadway shows, and in fancy shoes I was still able to walk to every single one of them without my feet aching. Now that's location! And with a subway stop just down the street, the further away tourist sights are just a short walk away, as well. I'm hoping I get the opportunity to travel back to NYC, and when I do you can bet I'll be rebooking with the Edison. Would definitely reccomend to anyone who isn't so snobby that they have to stay at a Westin, Hilton, or Sheraton. :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: jessicah1ll
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location if you want to be close to Times Square and Broadway, the only problem with this is the noise at night, which wasn't helped by the noisey pipes in the bathroom. We moved rooms which helped slightly but just beware of the traffic noise. The room was avaerage size, but the bathroom was quite small but everything was clean. The location is so good that the noise didn't ruin the stay for us and I would recommend the hotel (but ask for a quiet room), there are so many restaurants along 8th and 9th Avenue that offer very reasonable fixed prices menus, so there was no need to venture to the more expensive Times Square restaurants either.

Reviews.Title: “Very dirty hotel”
Reviews.Author: Llygoden
Reviews.Content: Have very mixed feelings about this hotel. Got in around 2 p.m. and got into my room immediately. While my bathroom was spotless, the couch in my room was almost black and greasy. My bedspread was filthy as well, but not the sheets, they were clean. I could tell that the maid staff worked hard to keep the place as clean as it was, but that's little comfort when you won't even put your suitcase on the couch because of the filth. I won't be staying here again and it's a shame because the staff is great and it's a wonderful location.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: harleygirl50
Reviews.Content: We just returned from New York and we stayed at the Edison Hotel. I can't say enough about the place. Our room was great, bigger than I expected.It was clean and the hotel staff was very helpful. I would recommend this Hotel to anyone. I would not recommend using WooGo to book my reservations again as they tried to move us to an apartment a week before we left and after an hour on the phone was moved back to the Edison Hotel and then they rebooked us for the wrong dates. The Edison took care of us with no problem.

Reviews.Title: “Best Blintzes”
Reviews.Author: blintz
Reviews.Content: We could only book one night at the Edison on our recent trip to NYC but it was worth it. Great location, lovely lobby, friendly staff, clean rooms, and the best and biggest blintzes that I have ever had! We walked back to the Cafe Edison from our other hotel on our last day in NYC just to eat their blintzes again! Why stay anywhere else?

Reviews.Title: “Let's Get Real”
Reviews.Author: esamrei
Reviews.Content: About two weeks ago I decided to go to NYC for an overnight stay for the night of December 5th, I checked the dotcoms and my travel agent - either the hotels in NYC were sold out or they wanted a minimum 2 night stay or they wanted minimum $400.00 plus per night. I realized that it is a tough time to get a room in NYC. So, I remembered the Edison - I called the property directly spoke to a delighful reservationist who informed me that they did have a room for me and the rate was $165.00 plus taxes. I reserved the room immediately. By the way several dotcoms had the the same room for $399.00 - sometimes its wise to call the property yourself. You could save yourself a lot of money, in addition the dot.coms want payment in full at the time you book - when you book with the hotel they hold the room for you with your credit card and you don't pay until you check out. Remember with any hotel, if you pre-pay with a dotcom they already have your money and any complaint you may have, may not be treated the same as it would if your reservation was booked with the hotel directly. I walked into the hotel lobby at 11am, checked in and went directly to my room on the 6th floor. Our room was fine - two queen beds, TV etc. Ok the bathroom is small, but I'm not planning on doing any ballroom dancing in a bathroom. There was plenty of room to do bathroom things. The room was clean, well heated and adequately appointed. As others have said, if you go to New York to sit in a hotel room, there's something wrong. Again, as in other reviews I have written, let's keep it in perspective (I can't believe the review where the Edison was compared to The Bellagio in Las Vegas - how ludicrous!) Keep in mind the Edison is a very high traffic hotel and there is a lot a wear and tear - they just do not renovate as much as the others. In the hotels that charge $400-600 a night ,they do so because they are constantly replacing and doing the cosmetic makeovers to keep people from whining. This costs money and it is reflected in your room rate. I'd much rather pay less have a decor a few years old and still have the cleanliness - this is what you get at the Edison. And yes, The Edison is very conveniently located in Midtown Manhatten with access on 46th and 47th Streets - just a few shorts steps will put you in Times Square or on Restaurant Row or at your favorite theater. Walk in any direction from the hotel and you will find an unlimited number of places to eat. The staff was friendly, courteous and attentive. In short I will stay at the Edison again and again and I will continue to wonder why people whine about getting a bargain in a very expensive town.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: Diane5757
Reviews.Content: My friend,her daughter and myself stayed here for 3 nights and I would deffinately stay again. We requested an early check in, and was able to get in at 11am, the room had 2 rooms;one with a queen bed, the other with a full fold out coach and full bed. The staff was friendly and helpful and the rate can't be beat for NYC (our room was 250$ a night). There was a great deli next door with a fantastic food bar of freash and homeade entrees, and the hotel is about a half a block from TImes Square. Mind you the hotel is older and a bit worn but clean and safe. We all agreed we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel for a great experience”
Reviews.Author: Tetelo
Reviews.Content: Having read some of the mixed reviews on this hotel I was ready to ask for a new room even before I entered the building. When I went to reception the staff were friendly, quick and full of helpful information. The inside of the hotel was is a bit dated but I think it adds to the character. The rooms are not as small as I thought. We choose a non-smoking room and it was in good condition and very clean. The bathroom is small but adequate and again very clean. The location of the hotel is the main second to none. You walk out the front door and you are on Time Square. We went to the Lunt Fontane Theatre which is next door to the hotel and had a great experience of our first Broadway show. The hotel is very keenly priced for the location and I would suggest that this hotel is perfect for anyone who wants a central base in a clean and friendly environment.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: purpledonmar
Reviews.Content: This hotel is all about location. It is fantastic for Times Sq and the surrounding areas with the Subway close by at 42nd Street. Our room was small and a little dull ( could do with a lick of paint to freshen things up !), but was spotlessly clean, as was the bathroom. The staff were helpful, but a little grumpy and gave the impression that you should have known the answer to the question. The only problem experienced was that the credit card style key for the door did not work properly. Staff did try to rectify it, but had little success. This did not spoil our trip as we were there to see New York and not the hotel. The Cafe Edison next door was great, excellent pancakes ! There is also a great deli adj. to the hotel and is open 24hrs. Would stay here again as was clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: bonjovirock
Reviews.Content: I first stayed at this hotel in Nov 1998 and again in Nov 2005. The hotel has a fabulous location, right off Times Square, making it an ideal base for sightseeing. Housed in a fabulous, old art deco style building we found that room standards can vary quite a bit. On our first stay we were given a room which I can only describe as a prison cell: dark corridor and tiny bars above the door!! It was the size of a shoe box and we requested a move which we were granted the next day, when rooms became available. On our second stay we booked a mini suite to accomodate three of us and this was fine. Bathrooms are tiny and there are no amenities (Tea/coffee etc) but rooms were clean and comfortable. We ate breakfast at the cafe a couple of times and it is very good value. The pancakes are great!! Overall, this comfortable hotel offers great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “PERRRRRRFECT!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ry_dermo1
Reviews.Content: The Edison is just perfect for people like myself. I took my girlfriend to New York for our 21st birthdays and we just loved it. We didn’t stop. The Edison is in such a perfect place, I cannot stress how perfect. We counted its 100 steps from the hotel door to the end of street and at the end of the street just happens to be Times Square. We were on the 19th floor in a fairly large sized room. Nice double bed, good TV channels, a huge walk-in wardrobe and a nice sized bathroom. At the end of the day the Edison probably is not a five star hotel, but it more than makes up to being one. The room was very clean and the maid service is fantastic. The staff were all nice (Except one or two miserable so and so’s – but you get those kinds of people all over the world….hey my next door neighbour is one!) and we had no trouble with the hotel at all. The Café Edison is a bit too rough and ready for 8am every morning, we couldn’t relax in there, but we found a nicer place down the road. The 24 hour deli is superb and so reliable. The gift shop and hotel lobby were great. The Edison does exactly what you’d expect, keeps you safe and warm and provides a cracking bed to sleep in! Lets face it, your in NYC you are not there to sit in the hotel all day. If you don’t like this place then sure pay more money for another hotel, but you wont match this location if you’re on a budget. All in all we loved the Edison and NYC is worth every penny we spent. Don’t be worried by the reviews on here, they are totally out of context, if you’re an everyday joe and not some stuck up country person you will LOVE this hotel like us!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fine”
Reviews.Author: Drschlock
Reviews.Content: It was my first time in New York and I was there for 4 days for work. The hotel was fine for my purposes, it was clean and the bed was very comfortable. Yes the room was a bit shabby and worn but if you're worried about that then there's something wrong with you. You're in New York City, the room's surely just somewhere to leave your bags and sleep occasionally. If you think like that then it's perfect, 30 seconds walk from the hustle of Times Square but quiet enough to sleep. Also the big Art Deco reception was cool. I need to go back to New York and do it as a tourist not for work but when I do I'll stay at Edison again, it was cheap and fantastically located.

Reviews.Title: “Lots to like about the Edison”
Reviews.Author: runnergal
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best deals in the area! Travelled to New York with a couple of girlfriends for one night and on the advice of my 80 + mother-in-law with loads of New York travel experience, chose the Edison. We were quite comfortable in a room with 2 Queen beds on the 6th floor. Yes, the bathroom is small and there is no mini-bar but for the price our expectations were not high. The staff outside (especially Bobby and Franklyn), inside, and in the diner were outstanding! Very Clean and the location is phenomenal. Take a moment to find Fire Station 54 (left out of the hotel entrance and around the corner) to view the memorial in honor of the courageous firefighters lost during the horrific events of 9/11. We missed out on the piano lounge where we heard there is live music until 1 am but will be sure to take it in the next time we are in town!

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: Hasers
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel directly with their staff. From the beginning I had a great impression. The reservation's agent, Gloria, was friendly and very helpful. The location of the hotel could not be better, right in the heart of Midtown. One of the best comments I can make is that the first room we were assigned smelled of cigarettes. I am allergic to smoke. My husband went to the check-in desk and explained the situation to the man. The gentleman, tall man with light curly hair, I cannot remember the name, immediately moved us to a "non-smoking" room. We must also say that the doormen were great and helped us get taxis a few times. The hotel and rooms are a bit dated, but the treatment we received was really good. I would stay there again in a heartbeat. For someone on a budget, it is a great place.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Andy_from_Oz
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel in a fabulous location. We recently stayed there for nine nights. The rooms are not huge and the facilities are basic (small bathroom / no mini bar etc) but the hotel is very clean and comfortable and the staff were very helpful. There is a Deli next door (not the cafe) which has great food especially for breakfast and is open 24/7. The location is the best feature -- everything in the heart of NY is an easy walk from the Hotel. Remember this is a 3 star hotel -- clean and comfortable with a fantastic location and at a good price for where it is -- would definitely stay there again. There is so much to see and do in NY that you only need a room to sleep in ..........

Reviews.Title: “Be Afraid”
Reviews.Author: NJ_Visitor
Reviews.Content: One of my worst hotel experiences and I paid $280 for the privilege. I commute into the city every day. Occasionally because of my schedule, I decide to stay overnight in the city to save time and stress. I booked a room via a third-party reservation service (no complaints). The hotel is described as a 1930’s building in an art deco design. It is, but I think the rooms have not been remodeled since then. Very strange room layouts and, as other have said, small rooms. Again, no real complaint. However, when I arrived in the room, the room seemed well maintained, but worn. OK. However, when I went to the bathroom and lifted the toilet seat, the toilet had not been flushed after a prior use – and I am not saying the water color was not clear. I called the front desk who sent a maintenance man to the room with a plunger. He flushed the toilet and asked, what my problem was since the toilet was working. I said that the room had obviously not been cleaned and could they send someone up to clean the room and the bathroom. His response, the cleaning staff was off duty.
