I asked to change rooms, but was told no rooms were available. I was grossed out from that point, did not sleep much that night and checked out early in the morning to return to my office. The only good thing I can say is that check-in and check-out was effortless, and the front desk did send someone to the room fairly quickly. I will never stay there again, and am telling everyone I know about my experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lizal
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Edison was a good enough hotel in an Excellent location, only half a block from Times Square. The room was rather small but clean. There was no coffee or tea making facilities, but there was a cafe on the ground floor you could buy from. I would say that the hotel has been well lived in and could do with a good refurbishment. It was a good base for all the sightseeing . It was very central.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location, but confirm your reservations!!”
Reviews.Author: angel0615
Reviews.Content: It was our first trip to NYC. Impossible to find a hotel room under $200. I finally came across the Hotel Edison which was $225 for a mini-suite. Decided to book it right away, as it seems other hotels were all booked. Upon checking in at the Hotel Edison, they could not find our reservation! I dug to the bottom of my luggage to find the hotel confirmation I had printed. They entered the reservation #, and low and behold, no reservation! Great, now what? The attendant at the front desk was extremely nice and helpful. She upgraded us to a 2 room suite! Wow, I couldn't have been more happier, this is going to be a huge room, or so I thought. Yes, it was 2 rooms, and had 2 TV's. I was expecting a king size bed, but it only had a queen. Bathroom extremely small, but the shower actually had water pressure. This room was also on the 18th floor. Rooms definitely in need of some renovation. The lobby was very nice and clean and looked more of an upscale hotel. Had a small gift shop, and 2 restraunts. Obviously this is an older hotel, but the price was right, and the location superb. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Edison”
Reviews.Author: Gue
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel in a triple room on the 10th floor for 4 days with a daughter and grand daughter. Following the bad ratings on this site we feared general low standards. However the 10th floor room was nice, and the reception staff efficient and polite. The location on Manhatten is almost unbetable. K. N. Thygesen, Munkebo, Denmark.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price!”
Reviews.Author: egyptqueen25
Reviews.Content: This was awesome. We paid 240 a night, and were certain that it was going to be pretty shabby. it wasn't at all! great price for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressed!!!”
Reviews.Content: I went to New York with four friends from 12 to 16 October 2006. We stayed in the Edison Hotel. I found the location was excellent. We were right in the middle of Times Square and there was a subway station close by. We could walk to Macy's which was a couple of blocks away. The rooms were small enough but they were very clean and comfortable. We found some of the reception staff to be a bit rude but other than that I cannot fault the place. I would definitely reccommend the Edison Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: sheronm
Reviews.Content: I take theater groups into New York every year. I have been using the Edison for 18 years. It is an old hotel, but the service is good for the money. The rooms are clean. The location is wonderful! The food ok, but the breakfast is probably the best value in New York. I always recommend the Edison due to it's location and the price. In fact I will be taking 60 more people there this December.

Reviews.Title: “ok abit noisey though”
Reviews.Author: FAB22
Reviews.Content: As the rest of the comments, very central, stayed 5 nights. The first room on floor 4 was very tiny it was a twin and we had booked doubles, we was advised to see reception the following day, we did and was delighted when they gave us a double doulbe on floor 15 which was also a smoking floor. recption staff were very goood and the cocktail lounge at night very frienly with all nations. what more could you ask everything on your doorstep.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Reb35
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Edison for 5 nights in September. The hotel is old and small especially the bathroom. Apart from that I really didn't have any complaints re: the Edison. No problems with staff and had an easy check in/check out. You can't beat the location. You're right in the middle of Times Square as soon as you walk out. There's also a laundry place on the next block which comes in handy. Our room was on the eight floor. You could still hear the noise from the streets but that's expected. It is New York. Booked through HotelConxions.com which was a lot cheaper than other web sites. Overall, I found the Edison sufficient for my stay. It was clean and the location can't be beat. I'm sure it's a lot cheaper to stay at the Edison than the other hotels nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in perfect position!”
Reviews.Author: saraquails
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Edison with a friend for a three night stay and I have to say that, although is not the greatest hotel in the world (far from it!), we were really pleased, especially compared to the place we stayed last year. And anyway, when you go to NYC on a budget you have to know what to expect! The hotel is very big and they have a lot of staff especially in the Reception department, so, even if they are all corteous, they are not overly friendly but only because they have so many people to attend to. When we arrived, after checking in, they had a porter bring all of our luggage to our room. It wasn't ready yet (it was only 11 a.m) but they let us leave our luggage there and we could get changed after 4 hours on the train from Boston. The room itself was very clean when we came back that evening and all of the other days (which is a very good thing because in NYC many hotels are never too clean!). It was quite big for NYC standards, with two big queen beds, a big TV, a small round table and two little armchairs, a dresser and a big mirror all over the wall (quite nice for the ladies to check out their outfits!). It was obviously quite noisy from the street below, but again, this is NYC, and, honestly, after a day walking around the Big Apple, we were so tired we didn't really notice! The bathroom was quite small, with a bathtub, a sink and a WC (there was really not much space) but it was clean, there were many fresh towels and it served its purpose. We used the internet point on the 2nd floor ($ 1 per 5 minutes) but other than that we never used any of their other amenities (bar,lounge, etc etc) because there is a litlle shop just next door that sells everything (soft drinks, snacks, cigarettes) and they also have an ATM machine. But the best thing of the Edison is obviously the position. Get out of their revolving door, turn right, take just a few steps and you are in Times Square! Fantastic! And from there New York is all yours! I will definetely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Christine166
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is fantastic! It is close to almost everything and I felt very safe in the surrounding areas. Check in was quick and easy and we found the staff to be very helpful. The room was a bit small but adequate. There is a shop in the lobby which is great if you have forgot anything. The Edison Diner is good value for money. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Fair, but poor service”
Reviews.Author: Photomaniac
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for three days. It was clean and well worth the price. It's close to Broadway and Times Square. The things we did not like was: - The air conditioner was a bit old and noisy. - The Internet service is from a third party provider. The area is bombarded with wireless signals, and the signal drowns. The hotel took no responsibility for the loss, and pointed us to the provider, which is a company in Canada. The man in the reception told us they have had several complaints about it, but did nothing to help us out. This was on Sept 12th 2006. - Our booking was including breakfast. The booking did not state that we needed a voucher in order to receive free breakfast. We talked to the front desk, and received no help whatsoever in this matter. We had to pay extra for it, and that is annoying when you have already paid. The Edison Cafe serves a great meal, though, and the service was also great. Overall it is a okay hotel, and it was the best deal we could find, but the problems described takes one star off. Don't expect any service.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: CLADSWELL
Reviews.Content: our first visit to the states and it was great. the hotel was very grand, but our room was dark and very noisy due to the air conditioning vents being outside our window. also the electrics are very doggywatch out for the loose sockets in the BATHROOM. the stairs were dark and dirty, and no direction signs. the lobby is spectacular very glittsy. the breakfast cafe was very good and prices were ok. we would recommend this hotel but check your room before the bell boy leaves you. LAWSON TAYLOR &FAMILY.

Reviews.Title: “good value for NYC”
Reviews.Author: Grinchie
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the Edison while we were in town for a taping of a television show. I wanted a place that was near the action, didn't cost a whole lot and had private bathrooms (high standards, right?) We were pleasantly surprised by the Edison. Our room was on the 9th floor and was very nicely furnished. It says it's in art deco style, which means that it's actually been decorated in that style or it hasn't been touched for many decades. Luckily for us, it was the former. The rooms are small, the bathrooms smaller (and much like the bathroom in the house where I grew up, right down to the brown tile and the metal medicine cabinet). But the rooms are clean and nice looking. We had a view into the room across from us, so we just pulled the curtains closed. Overall, a good bargain for New York. What was NOT a good bargain were our drinks at the Rum House - two vodka and sprites cost $20 with tip.

Reviews.Title: “Edison is simply HORRIBLE”
Reviews.Author: VivekG
Reviews.Content: Edison is by far the WORST HOTEL we have ever stayed in . The Rooms were extremely shabby . The staff was just not courteous . The bedsheets were not clean .There was no fridge in the room . No locker as well. Even Hotels in Europe have bigger bathrooms than the Edison . The bathrooms had rusted pipes running through . It was horrible. The Hotel came to us as a shock as we had just stayed at the Bellagio in Vegas and the Amalfi in Chicago before coming to NY. We were just not comfortable staying there . Actually staying at the Edison practically spoiled our NY Trip. We payed $240 /night . But i rather pay more and stay somewhere,where atleast i get to sleep well. We have been to NY before and stayed at the NY Hemsley previously at nearly the same price. There is a world of a difference between the 2 hotels . Edison-Never Again. Hope you guys take my suggestion.

Reviews.Title: “Very Ok for the price”
Reviews.Author: coppath
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Edison in September for 5 nights. The price (1050$) was ok for the hotel. The rooms were small but clean, the bathroom was clean, nothing to complain about. The Location is perfect if you like the Time Square. Especially in the evenings and nights its perfect when you dont want to go too far by bus or subway. Its alway worth for a walk at any time. event two night clubs are just some steps away. Everyone was friendly and we didnt have any problems. So 3,5 points would be fair, but our room (floor 21) did not have the nicest view so I gave 3.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Jsahonta
Reviews.Content: The Edison Hotel is in a Perfect Location, round the corner from Times Square. I found the staff in the Gift Shop very helpful and the Busboys were very friendly and could not do enough. I recommend for travellers to go to a excellent Deli just a few doors down from the Hotel - they offer a wide variety of meals at a great price and they are open 24 hours. Be careful of the oreintal gentleman on the front desk - when checking out he did not say two words to me and my younger sister. Had no customer service!!! Our room was comfotable and clean and that's all you really need when you are in NY. I would go there again and I would recommend this hotel because you can't beat the location.

Reviews.Title: “Edison is great for budget travellers”
Reviews.Author: vthanop
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Edison hotel for a week in August. We knew from the reviews not to expect much. It is a huge hotel with 900 rooms. The lobby is old but beautiful. We stayed in a double room at the 17th floor. The room was really small, but we expected that. It was nicer than we expected, and had a window overlooking the street, so it was not dark. The bathroom was fine, small, but we didn’t need more. It was cleaned daily, and the towels and sheets were changed daily too. It was a little worn out, but not enough to create any problems. A great advantage is Edison cafe in the lobby. We had a -no breakfast included- reservation and Edison cafe solved this problem. We paid extra of course, but it was really cheap and breakfast was quite good! The cafe room is also nicely decorated, reminded us of hotels we see on old American movies. The greatest advantage of all is, of course, the hotel’s location. It is a two minute walk from Times Square, close to the subway station, and in walking distance from most of the sights (Top of the Rock, Grand Central Station, 5th Avenue, ESB). Also, if you are interested in TKTS booth for Broadway tickets the hotel’s back door leads exactly there!! If you are looking for a luxury stay and up-scaled accommodation Edison probably isn’t the case. But if you are travelers who visit New York and want to explore the city, don’t intend to spend a lot of time in the hotel, and prefer to spend your money in sightseeing, eating, Museums, Broadway shows, then Edison is great for you! You can save money to put it in better use, and still don’t regret staying there. We would definitely choose it again!

Reviews.Title: “Be Careful -”
Reviews.Author: jfb42
Reviews.Content: Great Location - but must be hit or miss - We planned ahead, asked for an upper story room (for view), requested a refrigerator, called the day before to confirm everything. There was one person checking-in in front of me. I overheard the conversation - How pleasant the clerk was, asking where he was from, what he was doing in the city etc., Did he want to pre-check out now, his room had a great view on the West side, did he need a bellman etc. I came up, was asked my name, asked if I had any luggage, when I said 'yes' he waved my room key and called a bellman and said he'll see you up. I asked where my room was and was told the 11th floor. We went up to the room. I am used to small NYC rooms, so that was OK. Everything looked worn down - I noticed there wasn't a fridge. The bellman barely spoke and left (I did tip him). I called the desk and was told all fridges were gone, they are first come first serve (it was about 5pm). I was told I could use a fridge behind the front desk, and come ask when I needed to add or remove anything. I said this was very inconvenient - had a cooler full of drinks and snacks for the kids. They said Sorry- 5 minutes later a knock on the door brings the fridge. Open the window - back view of the alley, Crack across the window with clear plastic tape on it. Tiny bathroom, pedestal sink, glass shelf above with broken rail (glass looked like it would fall off if used). Notified the desk and said not to worry - I wouldn't be charged for window or shelf. Trash trucks and parking machines woke us up before 7 each morning. Recommend - Try to get a West side room? Don't think I'd go back unless nothing else anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience for the price!”
Reviews.Author: smile804
Reviews.Content: Booked through the hotel website and got a great room on the 12th floor. Was expecting twin beds and was pleasantly suprised by having 2 double beds. Also had small table with chairs and desk in room. Large walk-in closet. Bathroom was small but still able to dry off in bathroom. Staff was friendly. Cafe Edison in lobby is a great deal for breakfast and 24-hour deli a couple of doors done is perfect for late-night snack. Pub in lobby had piano singer Tues through Saturday. Bartender was very good. Hotel in great location. 1/2 block from Times Square. Close to subway stations and TKTS booth is out the back door (very convenient). Was very pleased especially after reading some of the more negative reviews. Will still there again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “50%-50%”
Reviews.Author: eveg
Reviews.Content: We stayed at edison hotel for a 2 nigths in august! The first night was super. Great room, clean and quiet. The location is perfect! At a few steps of times square. When we arrived at the hotel for the second night a lot of thing was missing in the room (towels, sheet) and a lot of noise from outside (music was loud up to 4 am). But we stayed just for sleeping in room so this hotel was very good! A very nice travel!

Reviews.Title: “The Edison ; A Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: mr_pibb
Reviews.Content: Hey There, I Stayed At The Edison Hotel On August 8th And August 9th, It Is A Very Nice Hotel If You Are Staying For Only A Couple Of Nights Like Me. If You Are Staying Longer Than 3 Nights, I Would Get A Diffirent Hotel. When I First Arrived At The Hotel The Staff Was Waiting Outside To Take Your Car And Park It For 31$ a Day. The Man Helped Us With Our Bags And Put Them On The Trolley. We Walked Into Our Hotel And The Corridors Was Very Nice, The Hotel Had TONS Of Maps And Brochures Of New York City, And They Had All Of The Activities That Could Be Done In New York City. The Staff Was Very Friendly. When We Were Done Checking In We Went To Our Room On The 4th Floor. A Bell Boy Helped Us With Our Luggage. When We Got To Our Room We Were Quite Surprised. The Room Was Quite Small, And You Could Tell The Room Was Old. There Were Two King Size Beds, 1 Big TV. But There Was No Fridge, So You Can't Keep Drinks Cold. Also There Was No Ice Machine On The Floor, So You Had To Phone The Front Desk And Have Somebody Bring Ice To You. There Was A Big Walk-In Closet In Our Room So That Was Nice, However When I Walked Into The Closet It Smelt Musty. The Bathroom Was VERY Small And It Needed Some Updating. There Were 4 Taps In The Shower, 2 On The Bottom For The Faucet (Hot And Cold Water) And 2 Taps On The Top For The Shower Head (Hot And Cold Water) While You Were In The Shower The Water Temperature Would Change Frequently So You Would Have To Often Fool Around With The Taps To Get The Temperature You Wanted. Overall, This Is The Quality Of A Hotel That You Would Expect In New York City. The Location Of The Edison Is Amazing It's A 10 Second Walk To The Centre Of Times Square. So It's Good, There Is The Olive Garden Across The Street Which is Very Good And All Of The Shops Such As Lids, Foot Locker, Grand Slam, Champs Sports, etc. Are All Seconds From The Hotel. The Hotel Also Has A Restaurant Called Cafe Edison, It's Very Cheap And Very Good, You Can Order French Toast For A Low Price Of 1.45$ And The Bread Is Very Thick, They Serve Breakfeast, Lunch And Dinner. However I Only Ate Breakfeast And Lunch There. I Ate Breakfeast Twice And Both Times It Was Great And I Ate Lunch There Once And It Was Great. This Restaurant Saves You A Lot Of Money For Other Goods In New York City Such As Clothes, Hats, iPods, etc. Overall This Hotel Is Great For A Couple Of Nights! I Loved The Hotel Edison And I Would Definitly Stay There Again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location - small but clean!”
Reviews.Author: Luvsentrain
Reviews.Content: We booked the Edison for one night and were very pleased with the hotel. The location is PERFECT - minutes from Times Square and all the action NY has to offer! We were able to drop our car off at the door to be parked for us nearby in the garage for $31 for the night. They asked us to call 45 minutes before we wanted the car and they would retrieve it for us. When we got down to check out, the car was just steps outside the door so we were able to load our bags and quickly drive away. It was very convenient. Check-in was fine - albeit a little inconvenient. You go to one person to check in, another down the counter to pay, and then back to the first person for the key. Seems like it could be a little more streamlined. The check-in staff were not friendly, not quite rude, but definitely unfriendly. I guess it's what I have come to expect of New Yorkers - just be ready for it! Our room was fine - 3rd floor - pretty spacious for a New York hotel room. The bathroom is pretty small, you have to leave the room to change your mind (!) but all in all, a good value for the money. The room was clean - (checked the sheets, etc...) I think the bathrooms could use a little bit of updating, but everything works and the shower was heaven after a day trekking across the hot city! I'd definitely stay here again - it's a good value for the money and a location that can't be beat!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: kittywills
Reviews.Content: excellent location lovely decor in public areas. room ok. despite previos reviews read before travel we had iron and hairdryer in room. staff very friendly polish tea rooms next door fantastic. would definatley return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Small but nice and clean”
Reviews.Author: candid_s
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend stayed theer for 2 twice - 2 nigth for each time. So we saw 2 different rooms. The rooms were small but clean, tiny but clean bathrooms. The corridors may be a little worn, but you barely see it when coming from trip around NY and crashing to sleep. The staff is very profefssional, plenty of free maps and free guides aroudn the city. TKTs booth nex to the hotel ( 20 meter from rear entrance ), and the hotel placed in the middle of theater district. Deli next to main entrance in very good, but the cofee shops in hotel isn't bad also. TIMES SQUARE IS 50 METER FROM MAIN ENTRANCE. You feel safe in the hotel, and you have a free safe deposit at the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Ever Stayed In !”
Reviews.Author: herbsUK
Reviews.Content: Firstly it's worth pointing out that I normally only ever write reviews where I have stayed at places and found them to be ok and to hopefully put people's minds at rest and have never written a bad review before.... I came to New York in May with my wife for 6 nights. We booked this months in advance and specifically asked for a quiet room on a high floor as we appreciate that New York is not exactly quiet. On arrival the foyer seemed quite nice but the receptionist didn't seem to have any notes of our requests (including a room upgrade as it was our anniversary). We asked for a high floor and were taken to a room on a high lever but it was opposite the lifts so obviously wouldn't be quiet. We were offered a room on the 8th floor which we pointed out was fairly low so were then taken to a room which I think was on the 23rd floor which was literally the very farthest room from the lift which we thought would be ok. By this time were tired & hungy so dumped our cases into what looked like a small room and went for a bite to eat. It was only when we came back and had a look around that we saw what a disgusting, filthy room we had been put in! The room was very very small, the carpets were soiled & stained and the bedding was like something out of Porridge (a UK sitcom based in a prison!). To top it all off there was an enourmous metal heating pipe running up the side of the building which was right outside of our window and gave a constant humming noise. We decided to stay there that night as it was late and look elsewhere in the morning. I slept on the sheets as I didn't even want to get in the bed and spent the night itching from I hate to think what. The next day I went to reception and said that we were leaving (he didn't look like it was the first time anyone had said this) and he told us to contact Expedia for a refund as the hotel does not issue refunds. We went to the Novotel nearby which was excellent - see review - and eventually received a refund from the hotel for the nights we didn't stay there - at least there's some credit to them there. This is the only time that I have ever felt the need to write a poor review but this really was a shocking, horrible hotel.

Reviews.Title: “bad security”
Reviews.Author: SGRIERSON
Reviews.Content: My daughter stayed at the Edison Hotel from 05-22-06 through 05-28-06 with a group of students from The University of North Texas. During the last night of her stay someone came in their room while they were sleeping and took her purse and another girl’s purse. This was immediately reported to security. Both purses were later found, one by a dumpster outside the hotel and the other was turned in a couple weeks later by a guest who found it in their room on the 10th floor. They had stayed on the 5th floor. I have two issues with Hotel Edison 1.What kind of security do you have that someone can come into your facility and steal from guests room while they are sleeping? It sounds like an inside job to me. Do you background check your employees? 2.Why did we have to pay to have the purse and its contents shipped back to us? It cost $29.38 to have it shipped back. If I were in your position I would have paid to have the purse shipped to the guest and replaced the $40 that was missing. I think it would be in the hotel’s best interest to review some of it's policies and look for ways to improve your guest relations.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: enchantedacres
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 3 nights in July in a smallish room with twin beds, clean tiled bathroom, plenty of clean towels, friendly helpful staff. The cafe is quick and cheap for breakfast and has other meals as well. We tried the Rum House Bar after the theater and enjoyed the piano player so much we returned every night. The Art Deco lobby is a beautiful pleasant place to meet your friends. I've stayed here 4 times in the past 12 years and have been satisfied every time. I'll definitely return as the location and price can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: Meredy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Edison for our 20th anniversary. Yes, the rooms are small and the hotel is older but the location and price could not be beat. As AAA members, we only paid $150 a night!! The staff was friendly and helpful. The rooms were clean and, since we asked for a room on a higher floor, very quiet. We would stay again. I'd rather spend my money on shows and shopping than on luxury accomodations.

Reviews.Title: “better than reviews”
Reviews.Author: NBAMA
Reviews.Content: From previous reviews, I was apprehensive, but very satisfied with my room, and, overall experience. I was in a room on the 9th floor, so street noise was at a minimum. A/C worked well. Bathroom was dated, but clean. The bed was comfortable. Carpet in room appeared to be new. I was even pleasantly surprised by the size of the room. Lobby area seemed to be constantly crowded with foreign tourists, but the hotel staff seemed to handle it well. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just read the title of my review and that says it all. The room was supposed to be handicapped accessible and you couldnt swing a cat in there let alone get a wheelchair in, the bathroom was a cupboard, was filthy and smelly (insecticide) there were roach traps in the store room next door, the corridors were very dark and dingy and I will certainly not recommend anyone stay here ever if they value their lives. Environmental Health needs to be called in.

Reviews.Title: “Why the complaints”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After having read several other reviews on this site, i found many to be exaggerated either too positive or negative. The rooms were extremely small and perhaps the interior was outdated. At the end of the day with a hotel like the Edison you are paying for the location. Considering you are less than 50m from Times Square, its quite a bargain depending on your willingness to search around. For those who complain about the room size, whats the fuss? You don't go to New York to lie around in a hotel room. It's only purpose is to crash out at the end of a long day. Regarding other reviewers comments about the arrogance of hotel employers, it should be noted that New Yorkers aren't really known for their charm and this isn't just indicative of the hotel staff, we encountered many people without manners not so say that this is always the case. The Cafe Edison is also a good place for breakfast with quick service and reasonably cheap. I advise you to try the pancakes.

Reviews.Title: “Grubby and unloved”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This promises to be a lovely hotel but the reality is somewhat different. The building is old and unloved. The first room we were offered had a filthy bathroom and cigarette burns in the bed cover. The corridor walls were very stained. The staff were very brusque and didn't seem to care. I certainly wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “small but clean, great location”
Reviews.Author: tashb929
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised by the Hotel Edison. My husband and I spent three nights at the hotel as part of a bus trip from Canada. Our room was small but clean. We had a working air conditioner, an iron and ironing board and hair dryer in our room. The location is great and we could not hear the street noise with the air conditioner on. I would recommend the Hotel Edison to anyone looking for an economical vacation to New York City.

Reviews.Title: “Midtown Manhattan Bargain”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I just returned from a 5 night stay in the Edison. Having stayed in four star properties in Manhattan, I booked this with some reservations after reading other reviews, but we were pleasantly surprised. We had a "mini-suite" for $210/night, which turned out to be huge by Manhattan standards. In addition to the king bed we requested, the room had a sofa (which may have been a sleeper -- I didn't check) and desk. After confirming that there are no ice machines on the floors, I called to ask if they had refrigerators, and after we checked in, one was promptly delivered -- and free. We bought two ice trays at a local store and had more than enough ice throughout the stay, as well as loads of room for restaurant leftovers. They claimed the room had been renovated, but the furniture was pretty shabby and the carpet needed to be replaced. However, the room seemed clean enough and the service was more than adequate. The bed was comfortable, although not a full length king. The bath was small, but had a full tub with good water pressure. The AC was fine, until it began to get really hot our last day; we were comfortable, but I doubt it woud keep up in a prolonged heat wave. The location can't be beat. Aside from the close proximity to theaters and the TKTS booth, restaurants in the areas are incredible. We walked west on 46th and found some excellent deals on a wide variety of "pre fixe" menus. Instead of using the hotel valet parking (I think ~$35/night), I made a reservation at a city garage about 6 blocks away for $20/night. After unloading, the garage was a short ride and a pleasant walk back to the hotel. I would definitely stay here again. But I would be sure to call ahead and request a bed preference and a refrigerator.

Reviews.Title: “Location”
Reviews.Author: stupidscreenname95
Reviews.Content: Great location only minutes from Times Square and the Theatre District. Close to Central Park and the Metro. It is an older hotel so some parts were in need of a coat of paint but spotlessly clean and everything worked!! I think you would be hard pressed to beat the price in this location. The staff were friendly and attentive but not over the top. The bar downstairs is great too with a mix of locals and tourists so a friendly relaxed atmosphere. You can't beat the eggs benedict in the cafe downstairs!!!! Would go back tomorrow (once the credit card recovers....)

Reviews.Title: “Steady Edi”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and i booked the Edison for a four day city break and this was after lots of price comparisons. The location of this hotel makes it very hard to beat. Yards ( and i do mean yards ) from Times Square and in the heart of the theatre district. Our room / bathroom was comfortable and clean. And it was a decent size. We were on the third floor with no view but also no noise. Housekeeping visited everyday and supplied clean towels. The hotel bar was good for a nightcap after being out but why come to New York and sit in a hotel bar? We didn't visit the cafe as the 24hr deli next door was graet. Fresh friut and sandwichs or cooked breakfast with seating upstairs. Everything you would want to see in New York is within walking distance from the hotel. We walked right down to and across the Brooklyn Bridge ( about 3 miles away ). It took us allday with stops in China town, Little Italy and various other shops and interseting sites along the way. So why bother with the subway? Central park is short stroll away. We took a cycle rickshaw ride around the park as we could stop and get out and take photos etc. The bottom line with this hotel is if you want brand new top quality this is not it. But clean, friendly, comfortable and with an unbeatable location for the price, it's the rock steady Edison for us.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Edison Hotel in July 2005 and found it to be excellent value for money. We are returning to New York in August 2006 and after comparing other deals for hotels in New York City have decided that a return trip to the Edison is a MUST. We found that the rooms were clean, comfortable and quiet. The staff were helpful and obliging to our every request. I suggest that those complaining about the Edison do a quick 'reality check'! This hotel simply cannot be beaten for location (it is literally on the doorstep of Time Square), staff (I found them to be very accomodating and I had come off a twenty hour flight) and cost (what more do you want for that price?). There are alot of options for dining and shopping close by as well as being able to walk comfortably to all theatres and attractions. This hotel is as advertised- three stars, great location. After looking at the other options available in this price range, the Edison wins our vote hands down.

Reviews.Title: “kiosk is a big no no”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Lets start by saying the reception staff were great. The shop staff even better, so helpful with phone cards etc, but that kiosk that sells theatre tickets and books the airport bus is a huge scam. Tickets they wanted $96 each for were available at the theatre on 42nd at $46 for 3 !! The airport bus was dirty with a rude driver and too many people for seats available. Bags had to be loaded by our party or would have been left at the hotel entrance. AVOID!!!! Take a walk and buy your own tickets for shows and a yellow cab is almost a cheap with much better service. The hotel was fine. Good position. Nice room. Deli was good value although the man at the door could be a bit off. The waiting on staff were fine.

Reviews.Title: “Always a great place!”
Reviews.Author: MarkSC
Reviews.Content: Well, let's just say we've only stayed at two hotels in NYC and we only stayed at the other place once. This is our "home" in NYC. Great location, great price, and very nice staff. If you're a Broadway theatre nut, then you can't do better. 15 second walk out the door to the heart of Times Square....literally! It's right there. Both the Barrymore and Brooks Atkinson (recent home of the Odd Couple) Theatres are on the same block just seconds away. Have to be honest, the one drawback our last trip were the pillows. They weren't much thicker than airline pillows so I would make a point of requesting additional pillows or bringing your own. But it's a small thing to deal with when you're talking about great location and great price. The property is very well maintained and has none of the mustiness you might expect out of a hotel that's been around since the 30s.

Reviews.Title: “Liked hotel - don't let negative reviews scare you”
Reviews.Author: paulbart
Reviews.Content: Hi - Just a quick note after returning from a weekend in NYC. Before heading there, I read reviews of the Edison Hotel here on TripAdvisor. I had already booked my hotel (without having first checked TripAdvisor), so the negative comments here had me a bit scared that I was going to end up in a 'dump'. Of course, I was only in one room (a single for $170/night), and can't comment on all of their rooms, but I have to say it was perfectly clean, didn't seem "old" or "musty". I wouldn't say it's the greatest hotel I've ever been in, but I didn't expect more than an average hotel for the price (keeping in mind that this is NYC, the $170/night price isn't top-of-the-line). I saw at least one review where the people complained about the maid service bothering them on check-out day (check-out time is 1pm, but the maid kept bothering them starting at 10am). I was there two nights, and was out LATE each night. I put the "Do not disturb" sign there both nights. The first morning, I actually didn't leave the room until about 2pm. The second morning, I was checking out, and left the room at about 1pm. I heard NO knocks on the door either morning - the maid staff actually *paid attention* to the "do not disturb" sign - something very rare, IMO. Oh, as others have mentioned, the 24-hour deli next door makes great sandwiches - especially nice when you're heading back to the hotel at 4:30am after a night of partying! - Paul

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: auntienofun
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 4 night stay at the edison last week. We checked in and were pleasantly suprised that our room had been upgraded to a suite (there were 5 of us) at no extra charge. We had a room with one king bed and two singles so we still needed a rollaway bed for the 5th person but the extra space was great. We were on the 21st floor with a view of times square. We have no complaints. The room was clean and the location was excellent. If you want a moderately priced hotel that is close to all the action, definitely stay at the Edison. Fancy it is not, but for the price and location we would all definitely stay there again. The deli next door is great and we took the greyline 2 day bus tour which I would definitely recommend. We saw a lot of sights that we would of not seen otherwise since we would of had to either take the subway or two taxis for all of us.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Pinni
Reviews.Content: Mum and I stayed for 2 nights at the Edison en route to Las Vegas. We stayed in one of the rooms that had been refurbished and found it to be very clean with large beds - the painters were working on the rooms along the corridor from us but we had no noise from them. Bathroom on the small side but again clean - what more do you need in NYC as you don't spend much time in your room!! The hotel is 1minute walk from Times Square so it is handy for all the attractions. We had read reviews before we stayed and most spoke about the deli next door which we found to have an excellent selection and we ate there for breakfast on both mornings that we were in NY. Didn't really have much interaction with staff but any dealings that we had, we found them to be as helpful as needed. Only slight downside was that our room overlooked the street that the hotel was situated on and we found ourselves being woken with noise and sirens etc - though could have been jet lag contributing to our upset sleep pattern. Would stay here again as it was handy for attractions, clean and value for money in the centre of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Still love the Edison Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Labatt
Reviews.Content: Once again, we stayed at the Hotel Edison for our Memorial Day visit to New York. As always, we love this hotel. While the rooms are not fancy, the location is fantastic and the rate is outstanding, very reasonable by New York standards. While some of these reviews talked about rude staff, we have always found them helpful, and we stay here two to three times a year. And while people talk about rooms, seriously, if you're in New York, how much time are you going to spend in our hotel room? Between theater, restaurants, walking the city and the park, and visiting with friends, we see it to sleep. Give me a clean room in a good location, and I'm happy. Only complaint, which others have noted, is the lack of electric outlets. It's an old building. Still our New York choice!

Reviews.Title: “Good location! Clean rooms!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Well, we stayed here for 6 nights, we had a late arrival because we came from Vegas, we arrived at 1 am... we got a room with 2 separated beds, but we've booked one double bed...the next day we could ask for that room with one double bed..it was no problem! We''ve got a nice, clean room at the 21st floor! Nice view at Times Square, no noise around us! My bf and I loved it!! The location rocks!! Near the hotel there's a Deli, with fresh food all day, fruit, bagels, croissants...everything you can mention, they have it there!!! The next time when we will go to NYC, i will go to the Edison again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location would stay again”
Reviews.Author: Nga_Mihi
Reviews.Content: OVERALL: Excellent location, nice cosy environment POSITIVES: * 30 second walk to Times Square from hotel * Very clean rooms * Wireless internet available in each room * Excellent selection of food available from the 24hr- Deli a couple of doors down * Friendly hotel staff * Modern gym on 23rd floor (open 6am - 9pm) * Thick bath towels provided * 1 min walk to subway station (49th st/ Broadway - take subway line R, W or N to get off at Whitehall to go to Battery Park, Ferry for Statute of Liberty) * Very close to hop-on/ hop-off tourist buses COULD IMPROVE ON: * Room size a bit on the small side * Decor in public hallways could do with an update (smell of musty carpet) * Poor lighting in rooms (a few more lampshades in each room would do the trick) OTHER: * Hotel gets very busy in the weekends * Approx $8 USD in taxi to UN Headquarters from the hotel * Catch bus #105 (departs from Broadway) to the UN. Ticket costs $2 if you do not have a metrocard * Consider taking hop-on-hop-off tourist bus from Times Square (tickets approx $39 USD) to check out NY sites. The bus (various routes) departs / returns to the Times Square area and is only a few mins walk from the hotel * I stayed here for x6 nights from 19 – 24 May 2006.

Reviews.Title: “Total Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I don’t know if it was because I booked through Hotels or what, but the room was absolutely terrible, I asked for a non smoking room, and when I got to the room, the smell was disgusting , and you know was what their answer?, “we will send somebody with a spray” imagine!, besides that I had to use my slippers to walk through the room because the carpet was humid and dirty. Please thing twice before booking this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “currently renovating”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were transferred to the Edison after a terrible problem with a WooGo reservation. We really didn't want to stay right in Times Square, but had no choice. The room was on the 9th floor and we were awakened by construction noises as they are renovating the hallway. The room itself was very nice and clean, but there are no ammenities -- no small refrigerator, no microwave, no ice, no coffee -- the room is just for sleeping. This was a consideration as the place we had reserved had all those things and we were trying to save a little money by not eating out every meal -- this is not an option at the Edison.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Eric37
Reviews.Content: In April, my boyfriend and I went to New York City for the second time. Last year, we stayed in New Jersey. This time, we were very excited to stay in the heart of New York City, at the Edison hotel. We stayed there for two nights with a group of 55 people. The check-in went very well. In less than 10 minutes, everybody had the key to their room. Our room was located on the fourth floor. It was small, but clean. The view was terrible (the other side of the hotel), but it made us laugh more than anything. It was quiet during the night, apart from some siren sounds, which is more than normal given the location. We had bought tickets on-line for Rent at the Nederlander Theatre, which was an amazingly good show. The hotel is located just a few blocks from that theatre and we could easily walk to it. The Edison hotel is a great choice for people who don’t absolutely need luxury and who want to stay in the middle of Times Square, at a good price. There is no hairdryer provided, so don’t forget to bring your own. However, there is an iron and an ironing board in the closet. Finally, the staff is friendly and helpful. When we go back to New York, we will certainly book in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “much better than expected”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a seven night stay at edison hotel. After reading the reviews i was so terrified as to what expect. On arrival the hotel staff were very nice to us.. some are a bit blunt but i think thats just the way they are..!!. The rooms were of adequate size and the beds were very comfortable to sleep in. Yes the bathroom is small but that was a minor..suitable for what you needed to do. I would suggest taking a extension wire as there isnt enough sockets...but all in all the stay was enjoyable and i didnt have any complaints. It really isnt as bad as what most people say... Yes the hotel is a bit old fashioned ..but simply nothing to worry about...the location is fantastic..you dont appreciate how close you are until you get there. The 24 hour deli just next door to the hotel is great to kick start your morning. I would def stay there again. Oh and if you do get cold as they set there heating according to the outside temp ...i suggest calling housekeeping for extra blankets!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, marginal hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: You can't beat the location, right in the middle of Times Square. The hotel itself however, needs refurbishing and cleaning. The hallway walls were stained or dirty, I did not want to look that closely. We stayed in a room with 2 queen beds. The beds were fine but there were no outlets to plug anything in. We had to use the bathroom outlet to charge our cell phones. The bathroom was tiny, the tiles were chipped, and I tried not to look too closely at it again. Thank goodness I'm nearsighted. The service was terrible, you pretty much have to jump up and down and wave a white flag for them to notice you. It seems a place for big tour groups to stay. We picked it because of the price and location but I don't think I will stay here again or recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Already planning my next visit!”
Reviews.Author: Tinks1954
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a long weekend in NY. Hotel Edison even better than my expectations-quiet, yet right in the heart of the city and literally a few steps from Time Square. I loved the reassuring 'ding' from the elevators in the middle of the night. Just something to bear in mind, take an extension lead, especially if you want to power up a camera etc while drying your hair- oh and be prepared, the current is different so hair drying can seem to take forever! Would I stay there again? I'm already planning a return trip!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Having read some of the reviews of the Edison I was extremely sceptical about my stay in February. However, on arrival we couldn't believe the room we had for the price we'd paid (approx £250 each for 5 nights). Our room was a great size with a huge walk in closet and it was extremely clean. Times Square is right on your doorstop (less than 1minute walk) and lots of attractions within walking distance, Fifth Ave, Central Park, Rockerfeller Centre, Empire State Building. The heating was a bit noisy when it started to heat up in the morning but being so eager to get out into the city every morning, we never found it a problem. The hotel has a fantastic cafe right next door, which you can access through the hotel lobby. Amazing food that'll set you up for a day's sighseeing. Also a great deli bout 2 doors down from the hotel which I believe is open 24 hours. Hamburgers are delicious. Highly recommended. Some members of staff were unhelpful but overall the Hotel Edison is a great find right in the heart of all the action. Would recommend it to anyone. Booking another trip back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Art deco”
Reviews.Author: Odge
Reviews.Content: Having returned from New York, I would recommend the Edison to anyone wanting a clean room 30 seconds from Broadway! We found a fantastic deli just right of the hotel entrance where police and NY yuppies all ate---fantastic! If ever I went back to New York, I would use this hotel again---but be warned, no kettle so no tea! How English is that!!

Reviews.Title: “Noisy”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is a little faded although the location is good for Times Sq/Broadway and for central NY the prices are not bad. However, you need to be aware that the Fire Dept is round the corner and boy, do they love to use their sirens! They were called out 3 times the night we stayed there so if you want a good night's sleep, go elsewhere. Also, do not let the hotel arrange airport taxis for you as they charge way over the odds - we enquired but were quoted something which sounded outlandish so we took a taxi from the roadside right outside the hotel and it cost less than half!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to fear”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was skeptical after reading some of the reviews about this hotel, but it was absolutely fine. Nothing to write home about, but certainly nothing to be nervous about either. The location can't be beat--it's literally steps to Times Square. Bathrooms were average--smallish, but clean. The beds were comfortable and the room was surprisingly quiet given the hotel's location. Our air conditioning worked fine (it was a warm weekend in NYC) and everything was well supplied. The staff was friendly. I requested a room with a view, but I knew it wasn't guaranteed so wasn't too disappointed when we had a view of the other side of the hotel. However, the view from the window in the hall right outside the room was quite nice. I really can't complain at all about the Edison--yes, it's an aging hotel, but it's clean and seems be be managed well. For the price and location, I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved New York”
Reviews.Author: gvee
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 day holiday in New York. Stayed at the Edison Hotel right in the middle of Times Square. Location was perfect, hotel was not perfect. If you love Art Deco you will love it here - if you are looking for modern facilities then don't book it. Our hotel room was a "quad room" which was two double beds and a shabby bathroom. The room had been recently refurbished and was clean and tidy. Large TV, iron and ironing board. New York was fabulous - everything we imagined and more. Book the Edison for its history and location - if you want luxury then don't book it.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location for the price!”
Reviews.Author: lfisgd746
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a ladies weekend in NY where we stayed at the Edison hotel. Room 430 was spacious, quiet, clean and beds were comfortable. We had two closets! Staff was friendly and helpful. Hallways are scary looking, they are in the process of renovating. Times Square was about 30 feet away, Starbucks across the street. Restaurant and Deli downstairs. Location was perfect we would so stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Edison is well worn and by all accounts, well worn out. In addition to frayed rugs, small rooms and an extremely uncomfortable bed, the floors were dirty, the sheets like sandpaper and the blanket filled with pills. The service was poor also. I was forced to have a bellman escort me to my room after I explicitly said that I would prefer to go myself. I was told by the gentleman behind the desk that it was hotel policy and that he would only give the key to the bellman. It was a cold evening in New York so I turned the heat on once I settled in and nothing happened. When I called the front desk and to report that the heat did not work I learned that the hotel controls the heat based upon the outside temperature. When I complained that I was cold, I was offered blankets. The room was very small and had no chair to sit in except for a very uncomfortable desk chair. To add insult to injury, my room key got demagnetized and did not work 4 times during my 3 night stay. When I complained about the inconvenience, the woman behind the desk ignored me. Beware of bargains in New York City. Hotel Edison was cheap by New York standards, but at $170.00 a night, it was definitely not a bargain. I would never stay there again. If Hotel Edison was the only hotel that I could afford, I would stay home.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Edison”
Reviews.Author: wesley03
Reviews.Content: This hotel is excellent if you are a first time visitor to New York or you don't plan to spend much time in the hotel. The location of the hotel is perfect. On the doorstep of Times Square and obviously plenty of attractions and restaurants nearby. The Staff are very friendly and efficent. Despite the amount of people constantly checking in and out we had the concierge come to us immediately to assist and it only took a matter of moments to be checked in by front desk. The hotel had a old fashioned look and feel about it but not to be mistaken for run down. there are a few things that needed modernising but nothing that would affect your stay. The rooms are large, comfortable and very relaxing. Excellent on suite facilities. I loved my first time in NYC and would love to some day go back. I would stay at the Edison again purely because of location but also because the rooms are fine and the staff go out there way to help you. A fantastic NYC hotel

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: stayed for 5 nights at this hotel, although location great I found the place to be very dull and needs a good deal of refurbishment as its seems stuck in past as decor goes, also room had no extra plug sockets for hair drier (no hair drier in rooms ) so had to unplug the TV socket or crawl under the table and use the socket from the lamp also coming from England your appliance will not work as well as back home (took ages to dry, would have been quicker if I had stood out side) you can get one from house keeping but they do not always have one in so plan early if you are going out on the town, Cafe Edison is a good place to eat and good prices and very quick service but not very pleasant staff, would rather have stayed next door at the W hotel

Reviews.Title: “ew”
Reviews.Author: bostondorismorris
Reviews.Content: We walked into the room and we so grossed out we immediately got on the phone and tried to book another hotel. Due to the fact that we had amazing Tarzan tickets we were unable to get out of there that night, but we left promptly at 8am the next morning. The hotel is in such a need of renovation its pathetic. The yellow glue is showing through the probably 20 year old wallpaper. The sheets are clean, but there are so old they are yellow. 30 minutes of wireless internet costs $3.95, the Hilton has it for $9.25 for 24 hours. Upon arrival we found someone elses hair on the bathroom floor. The floor hasnt been swept in a long time, and I didnt want to sit on any of the furniture it was so unclean. The Hilton is $30 more. GO THERE....NOW!! We did!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I cannot understand all the bad reviews! I stayed at the Edison for 3 nights (on the eighth floor) with a group of friends in February. We had an amazing time and could not fault the hotel. The rooms were clean and of a good size, the staff were friendly and you could not ask for a better location right in the middle of Times Square and the theatre district, a few minutes walk to the Empire State Building, Fifth Avenue and Central Park! We did not eat in the cafe so cannot comment on it but there is a well stocked deli next door and a starbucks opposite the hotel. If you are looking for a reasonably priced hotel in an excellent location i would definatley reccomend the Edison and would not hesitate to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “No daylight”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel Edison months ago for three couples. We travel together often and were disappointed to find on booking in that we were on different floors. Still, not the end of the world. However, on walking into our room we almost walked out again. It was dark and dingy and so small we couldn't walk by the bottom of the bed as a chest of drawers with the tv on almost touched the bed. The general look of the room was shabby and the same applied to the bathroom. The sheets and towels were clean so we thought we could cope as the Hotel is in an excellent location. Next morning we discovered that this room got no daylight at all and was so dark it was depressing, even with all the lamps on. I mentioned this fact to a desk clerk who said if we wanted to come back later and see someone, we may be able to change rooms. As we had unpacked and had a days activities planned we did nothing. In my opinion, these rooms are ok for a last minute 2 night break (maximum) but they are not suitable for a five night stay and certainly not the rooms you expect when booking well in advance. I would definitely not recommend the Edison. It needs seriously updating, (and a major new lighting scheme!!)

Reviews.Title: “Somebody shoot this hotel and put it out of its misery.....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Dial 9ll.....This pathetic and worn hotel needs a serious makeover. "Shabby" would be a benevolent description of this tattered and torn tenement hotel on W 47th Street. The room was suitable for the Mayor of Munchkinland but not his wife (or boyfriend). The bathroom hadn't seen a a new appliance since the 1970s. I just know the bedspread was taken from the set of Father Knows Best, but it had been colorized. The walls are paper thin. The cleaning staff begins their work day, at 6:30 AM promptly. I know this as I heard them precisely at 6:30.... laughing, shouting and banging their cleaning weapons. Something tells me, that's about all the cleaning staff does with those cleaning weapons, wave them around to make emphatic points during conversations with each other. On the plus side, Starbucks is across the street, the W hotel is next door (fantastic 7th floor lobby) and I found the staff at the Edison to be quite helpful...AND there are legions of them, swarming the lobby. For the exact same price, run do not walk to On the Avenue...a stunning upscale and compared to the Edison, a luxurious 10 star hotel on W. 77th between Amsterdam and Broadway.

Reviews.Title: “Grotty Hotel”
Reviews.Author: megsmum91
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot and tend to keep an open mind about reviews etc choosing to make my own mind up. But I have to say that some of the reviews on here about this hotel were 100% correct. We stayed on the 8th floor and our room was dingy, dark and far from clean. There were unidentifiable stains all over the headboards of the bed, the bath was stained and dirty with someones elses hair in it.While towels were changed daily the maids did not clean the room and marks we had noticed the day of arrival were still there when we left. We did ask to change rooms and as this is a busy hotel this proved futile. Staff didnt seem to want to help at all with the exception of one lovely girl on the Theatre Ticket desk and this was outside the hotel when we were having a smoke ( incidentally this is a non smoking hotel ). The cafe while friendly was typically "greasy spoon" and while we were not due to check out until 1pm the maids hassled us from 10am to leave the room. On the plus side New York is a fab place to visit, the hotel was right on Times Square and as such is the perfect location. The deli beside the hotel is out of this world and we ate fresh trays of fruit for brekafast every morning and coffee that was very good. You had the option of hot food to to carry back to your room. Woodbury Common was well worth the trip, be prepared to spend a whole day there shopping but as there are no cars allowed it is a safe place to shop. Do go see a theatre show, we saw Mama Mia and got the tickets from TKTS near the hotel , all 3 of us got for the price of one full price Ticket. if you are there between 2-3pm there are minimal queues with a good choice of shows. Almost everywhere is within walking distance worth while familiarising yourself with locations of where you want to visit first as the hotel will tell you it is a fair distance to walk when it isnt. New York I would go back to but would never put foot in the Edison again

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Edison Hotel is in the middle of LIFE (10 seconds from Time Square). With 10$ you can see your room in 5 minutes :)) Including Smoking Room if you need. Nice person inside. Not a very good view. For me and my friends it was great, because I want a nice place not a "Bora-Bora" place. Go to New York ang go to Edison Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Emble
Reviews.Content: A group of 45 of us stayed at the Edison from 12th- 17th February and all these reviews left me feeling really concerned about what the state of the place would be like. I needn't have worried at all, the room we had on 3rd Floor was a really good size and newly decorated without losing some of the original Art Deco features. Huge walk-in closet, smaller bathroom, good clean room. Beds were changed every day and the cleaners couldnt have been nicer. There was a lack of plugs so if you do go its probably worth investing in an extension plug. Iron and ironing board in the closet which I wasnt expecting. No hairdryer or coffee making facilities but I didnt miss these as I prefer my own and there was a great Deli and the Diner next to the Hotel. Bar is fine to grab a drink and listen to the piano music, but if you want to go somewhere nice for a drink, dress up, go next door to the W Hotel and have a drink in the lobby bar.... so chic it hurts! As for Location, you really couldnt fault it, PERFECT!! Literally off of Times Square/Broadway and close to EVERYTHING! This hotel is exactly what you need for a trip to New York, clean, comfortable, safe, friendly without the 5 star haughtiness and cost. Wouldnt hesitate to recommend it to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “As good as I remembered it in 1997.”
Reviews.Author: Keefcat
Reviews.Content: You could not be in a better location, restaurants, bars, theatres, shops and the subway right on your doorstep. It's a bit noisy at night but it's outside noise and it is the middle of NYC !! Travel with earplugs, you'll never notice. Tha staff were fantastic, very helpful, they confirmed our pick-up back to the airport and the left luggage couldn't have been simpler, 50 cents a bag is an absolute bargain. Had breakfast at the Cafe Edison every morning to plan the day ahead, very good value. 5 of us stayed for 3 nights and it couldn't have been better - rooms were spacious (there were 3 adults in one room), bathrooms clean and tidy. Excellent.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we went on a school trip to new york and stayed at the edison hotel for 4nights, and it was great! we were on the fourth floor. 4 of us shared a room, there wasnt loads of space but it was big enough AND 2 of them were messy!! last 2 nights there was 6 of us sharing the room,(yes 6) and there was still room! wonderful location, right in the middle of times square, and not to far from our main attractions. the bathroom was really small and could do with abit of bleach as there was dirt round the taps, but the shower was powerful and there was hot and cold water! the deli downstairs was really inexpensive and served us really quickly so i recommend that! also the little shop next door had everything you needed. i didnt come across the bell boys or staff at the front desk so we cant commment on that! we would stay there again and recommend it! all in all it was great!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great price”
Reviews.Author: lanymor
Reviews.Content: This hotel could not be in a better location. I thought it was going to be really noisy at night but it wasn't, apart from the occasional 'ding' of the elevator right outside our door. Perfect for seeing all the sights of NYC. Staff were very helpful on check in, with several queries during our stay and when we checked out. My only negative comment about service would be the appalling waitressin the cafe, who really made no effort at all, and then we found a 20% tip included in our bill. Not worth it! Go to the deli just around the corner which is great! Rooms are a bit small, but we spent very little time in them and when we did we slept from exhaustion! Bathroom was tiny but who cares, it was spotlessly clean, toiletries included and the maid service was great. The hotel could do with some refurbishing as the carpets and hallway were shabby looking as were the lifts - I mean elevators! All in all it was well worth the money and I would think about staying here again when I return to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Edison Hotel in terrific location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Edison just before Christmas and got a very good price as I booked in May, but didn't read the reviews until November and they were so awful I wasn't looking forward to my trip. It is basic but our room was clean (and I think I'm pretty fussy) quite small but big enough. The bathroom was clean and I was overall very pleased and it certainly was no way near as bad as what some people had written. We we're on the 8th floor round the side so it was very quiet. The corridors were a bit tatty and need a refurbishment, but it will probably double in cost if that happens. Location is great, this was my third trip to NY and I would certainly stay there again. We didn't have any problems with staff, in fact they were quite pleasant compared to one hotel I stayed in in NY. Would say if you don't mind basic but want clean and good location then Edison is great.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, fantastic location!! :o)”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We arrived back from New York on 3rd January 2006, having spent 5 nights at the 'Edison.' This was our first trip to 'the big apple' but certainly won't be our last!! The hotel is located in a brilliant position, about 1 minutes walk from Time Square. Ignore all the reviews about the hotel being dirty and the staff being unhelpful, everything was quite the opposite. The rooms had plenty of space for myself, husband and 2 children (aged 12 & 14). The bathroom was not the biggest I've seen, but then you don't spend your holiday in a bathroom, do you? Towels were changed every day, which is the main thing. We ate breakfast at 'The Cafe Edison' every morning, which was value for money and just what you need to set you up for a day's sightseeing. Breakfast was served very quickly by friendly staff. If you don't want to eat breakfast in the cafe, you can use the deli next door to the hotel, which serves everything you'd want for breakfast and more!!! Alot of people chose this option and took food and drink back to their rooms. We also tended to do this after a long days sightseeing. We'd buy tea, coffee and snacks and take them back with us. There is a gym in the hotel which my husband used a couple of times and also internet access which my children wanted to use but didn't have time!!! In a nut shell, the hotel was great, the staff very, very helpful and the location fantastic, especially on New Years Eve!!! When we return to New York we will definately stay again at The Hotel Edison, without any hesitation and also recommend it to any friends and family too!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not good!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed for extended period at either end of our holiday. Great location BUT very rude, unhelpful staff, dirty, old rooms, and stained bed linen. If you are unlucky enough to get a room with banging pipes don't expect to get much sleep, they were shocking. Very overpriced, even for New York, I am sure there is better value out there and I will be looking for it next time!

Reviews.Title: “As good the second time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Edison on my first trip to NYC in January 2005, and liked both the hotel & the location so much that I booked to go again with some other friends over the last week (18-24th January 2006) Firstly, for the cost the location is absolutely amazing! literally a minute from the centre of Times Square & into the thick of it all. The service was spot on, from checking in & porter service to room service & the rest we had no complaints at all. This time (as there were 3 of us) we got a 3 bed/2 room room on the 21st floor. the facilities were basic but that was all we required, both rooms had a telly for experiencing the wonder that is more adverts than programs. We spent most mornings in the Café Edison for breakfast where it's cheap & cheerful & a couple of nights in the Rum Lounge bar where the staff were friendly & joined us mad merry brits & other fun people that we met along the way. I would recommend the Edison to anyone who wants to experience New York but wants to spend more money on enjoying the city rather than staying in "the best" (read: most posh) from a central location & I will definitely consider it above any other for my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Had a good stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Edison for three nights on 1st of December 2005. I was a bit concerned having already booked our stay and then reading the reviews afterwards - not good planning! However, I was glad that I hadn't read the reviews first. The hotel was fine, the rooms were clean. I would describe the decor as being slightly, but charmingly shabby. I felt that this added to the atmoshpere of the place. Bathrooms could do with being refurbished, but were clean. Beds were very comfortable and the rooms were cleaned and towels replaced every day. I agree with other reviews about the staff being unhelpful and rude. We had been informed that we would have somewhere to leave our luggage on checkout. When we asked the gentleman at the desk, we were greeted with a shrug of the shoulders and a brusque 'don't know.' When we asked if he could find out he said 'No' and left us to sort things out ourselves! Great location and impressive public areas. Would stay again, but if you would like to keep the illusion of American hospitality, good humour and helpfulness.....don't ask the front staff for help or advice!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised!”
Reviews.Author: trainingforatri
Reviews.Content: I read some really bad reviews about the Edison, and I was expecting the worst. However, once we got there and checked in, I couldn't have been happier. The hotel was tastefully decorated in Art Deco style, and it looks like the pictures on their website! Yes, the rooms were small, but hello! You're in NYC! not to mention Times Sq!. The W Hotel is right next door, restaurant row is one street over, theatres, restaurants, everything is in walking distance! The staff was so nice and accomodating! Here is a helpful hint...electrical outlets are few and far between! Bring an extension cord or surge protector! I highly recommend this hotel. We were there for New Year's Eve, and I was very satisfied. I will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “a real New York City experience”
Reviews.Author: ReginaFillangie
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Edison 3 times in the last 5 years and I now live in the neighbourhood. I stayed on a recommendation and I've since recommended it to others. You get a very New York City experience when you stay at the Edison. Yes, the location cannot be beaten. Yes, depending on the room you go for a standard room is pretty small but if you're hear for a weekend you should just be crashing in it so no worries there. I would recommend upgrading to a mini suite if you have the ability. They are much bigger (especially those on the 18th floor) and you get a sofa and lots more natural light. I don't know about you but when I came to NY on holiday I wanted to get a real sense of the place and the Edison helps to do that: what you see is what you get, just like the whole City. I highly recommend both the bar (think its called the Rum House - great atmosphere and perfect for a pit stop either pres or apres your evening's activities) and also the deli/coffee shop attached to the hotel. The food is GREAT and the service is again very New York-y. (For any Sx & The City Fans this is where Carrie went after she got rained on outside the Guggenheim and then went for some soup - she was sat at the coffee shop bar and got talking to some loony old lady who put lithium on her ice cream). True, there are no tea/coffee making facilities in the rooms (like all other Brits this is a big deal) but I've never seen these in any American hotel! Also you can nip downstairs to the coffee shop anytime for a hot drink and there are delis on either end of the street open 24 hours. Sometimes its more cool to stay in an atmospheric place rather than a sanitized, bland upscale hotel - the Edison is "a true NY experience". Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Deeburkett
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights with my husband and 10 year old son on 27th - 29th December. I must admit after reading the reviews after I had booked the hotel, I did try and cancel it. However I am really really glad I did not. We had a room on the 8th floor, which was a corner room with a king and queen size bed. The decor was tasteful and not tired at all, although I do agree that the public corridors could do with a lick of paint. The beds were clean and comfortable. Ok the bathroom was tiny and could do with a refurb, but the shower was hot and powerful and I don't go on holiday to spend too much time in the bathroom. There was a little street noise, but I was in New York and just happy to be there - it did not keep me awake at night. The staff were really courteous and friendly towards us, and the bell boys in particular were really helpful. We also ate at Cafe Edison for our first breakfast, and it was fine - again the staff were friendly - however I have had better food, but I have also had a lot worse! You cannot beat this place for location, it is literally seconds away from all the action - and we had a fantastic time - I would certainly consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: anongalway_Ireland
Reviews.Content: After reading many reviews on this site about the edison i was worried about staying there between the 1st and 5th of jan. but the hotel turned out to be quite pleasant and did exactly what it was supposed to do i.e provide a clean, comfortable bed and hot powerful shower with good housekeeping in an excellent location. Although the hotel does definately need some refurbishment it was comfortable and clean and was perfect if your planning not to spend alot of time in your hotel room. The hotel is seconds from times square and has friendly staff. I'd personally avoid the cafe downstairs though as food is average and quite pricey and with the choice right outside your door why settle for that!

Reviews.Title: “Adquate if you want a bed and a shower.”
Reviews.Author: sarahdaly1976
Reviews.Content: I'm the sort of girl that believes a hotel room is for sleeping and showering in because the rest of your time should be spent out doing and seeing things. If this is also your idea of a hotel then the Edison is for you. We stayed four nights over the New Year period and for location for this time of year it can not be beaten. I couldn't comment on whether it was value for money as it was booked as a package (however I suspect all hotels in this area are over priced at New Year). The rooms are basic, no mini bar, no tea and coffee making facilities (info important for the British!), no hairdryer. Both the bedroom and the bathroom areas were clean but in need of repair and renovation. The shower dripped but didn't keep us awake. We we're up on the 16th floor at the back and heard little street noise (the occasional siren) however some of our party were on the 4th and 9th floors on the front and commented that they could certainly understand why it's the city that never sleeps! The reception staff weren't particularly helpful. The deli a couple of doors up has a great choice and is very cheap for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “I'll Stay There Again!”
Reviews.Author: chgreen
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Edison Hotel about 18 years ago. It was Ok. My friend and I were taking our young granddaughters to New York this Christmas. I made our reservation at the Edison, but was a little apprehensive. I had read a review that said to stay above 5th floor because of street noise. We were on 6th floor and there was street noise. Ask at check-in for the best floor to stay on to not have street noise. Hotel Edison has a decent price (for New York), and the location is the best. The room was very adequate, compact, but clean. Bathroom was adequate (not large) and very clean. I am picky about hotel pillows and mattresses and I have no complaints about the Edison. Theirs were better than most hotels. Elevators were very convenient just walk in front door and elevators are very close. Housekeeping gave us more than enough linens after we were short one set of towels the first morning. They also repaired a floor lamp. Concierge was helpful. I will definitely stay at the Hotel Edison again.
