Reviews.Title: “LOCATION 5/5, ROOMS 1/5”
Reviews.Author: antnic1
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at the Edison from Dec 27 2005 to Jan 1 2006. The location of this hotel is spot on if you want the hustle and bustle of the busy city. Its virtually in the heart of Times Square and the theatre district and just a few blocks from the subway. What lets this hotel down is the rooms. We stayed in room 2117 on the 21st floor. The room is tiny! It looks as if it has been cut in half. There's barely enough space to walk between the bottom of the bed and the tv stand. When our eyes had adjusted to the cramped size we noticed how grubby the room was. The skirting boards were black with filth and the carpet was no better. To be fair the bathroom wasn't too bad. If like us you won't spend any time in the hotel other than showering and sleeping its ok. We were disapointed that there are no tea and coffee making facilities, but in all honestly there probably isn't room for them. Take your own hairdryer if you need one, my girlfriend bought a cheap one because she assumed they would have one. I can appreciate the numbers of people that must use this hotel but there's no excusing the dirt. My parents stayed in this hotel in Sept last year and apart from the size of the room they couldn't fault it. Maybe their room had been decorated more recently. The staff are polite and helpful. We didn't use the cafe attached to the hotel because from the outside it didn't look too appealing but that doesn't mean the food's bad. If you are thinking of going to New York don't hesitate, its fantastic. Book it now!!!

Reviews.Title: “A Night to Remember!”
Reviews.Author: chloer
Reviews.Content: We just returned from New Year's Eve in Times Square. We made our reservations at the Edison Hotel last January and were worried after reading some recent reviews on TripAdvisor. We needn't have been. The location was excellent and the hotel above expections. We were on the fourteenth floor and the rooms had obviously been renovated. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We ate several meals in the Edison Cafe. Price was exceptional, quality quite good and fast service amazing. We will definitely return anytime we are in the city whether to sleep, eat or both.

Reviews.Title: “It was good enough”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel Edison from December 20 to 24 of 2005 at found it acceptable. Our room was on the 18th floor. I would say that the room was ‘basic clean’ as there was no garbage in the rooms or cockroaches when we stayed there. The carpet is old and dirty and did not touch my bare feet for the entire stay. It looks as if the carpet is only vacuumed semi-regularly. A quick survey of the room will uncover a lot of dust bunnies, mold and grime; especially where the wall meets the floor. The double bed’s mattress was lumpy, but acceptable. The linen was clean and changed every day. It just looked like the room needed and really good scrub. Bring earplugs that you can wear while sleeping, NY is a city that goes all night. The bathroom was very small, but that is what I expected. The bathtub was not used for a bath due to the mold in the tub around the drain. The facet water was very drinkable. The hotel staff were courteous. The only time I needed to call for assistance was when more towels were needed and housekeeping delivered them promptly. The location of the hotel is its best feature. The hotel is seconds from Broadway, Times Square and the subway. Breakfast at the café downstairs is a must. Dinner at Carmine’s on West 44th (between 8th and 7th ave) is also a must, but you should call for reservations, because when we left there were a lot of people waiting at the bar and on the street for a table. Everyone in the city, with the exception of the NYC Information Booth lady at Grand Central Terminal, was tremendous. All of our silly tourist questions were answered politely and correctly. TIP: Ask someone walking a pet for directions; they almost always know the area. As I am from a popular tourist town, I was able to identify and avoid most of the tourist centric crap that can derail a trip. Just ignore the people selling their items on the street, the guys handing out ANY pamphlets and the tacky ‘gift stores’. Doing this will help save you valuable time and enable you to see everything you wanted to see. My trip highlights were: The Met, Yankee Stadium Tour, Broadway show ‘The Producers’, NY Ranger game at MSG and walking the streets of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: disney743
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Edison from the 15th to the 20th of December. After reading the reviews we were a little apprehensive but figured if we went not expecting too much we wouldn't be too disappointed and I think this is good advice. The Edison is in a wonderful location which is its biggest selling point - walk out the door, turn right, walk to the end of the street and you are in the middle of Times Square. The rooms are clean but basic. In our bathroom the sink was badly cracked and and the enamel was peeling off the bath but it was clean and the bed linen and towels were changed everyday. We found the reception staff to be friendly but did not put themselves out for you. I agree with other reviewers that the corridors are dirty. We were on the 7th floor and there were bad stains all over the corridor walls and the carpet looked about 100 years old! The main selling point of this hotel is its location which cannot be beat. If we were to go back to NYC we would save and stay in a different hotel as the Edison is basic but suited our needs on this trip.

Reviews.Title: “Good location & clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: cabushka
Reviews.Content: My daughter & I stayed here on Dec. 9-11 while on a bus trip. This hotel seems to cater to bus trips as we saw many loading & unloading guests in front of the hotel. This made for alot of congestion in the lobby & it was often difficult to get an elevator. On the plus side: The location is fantastic! Short walk to Rockefeller Center, 5th Ave., Times Square, etc. Bed & bathroom was clean & comfortable but pretty basic & outdated. Room was a decent size with two queen beds, a table, desk & several chairs. A complaint about lack of heat was attended to promptly. On the minus side: The hotel is a little noisy at night. We could hear police action & a fight going on down on the street. The consierge & desk staff were not very pleasant & very impatient when asked for directions. The room temperature was hard to control on the ancient heat/AC register & went from to cold to too hot & made lots of noise whenever the heat came on. Alhough check out time was not until 1 PM, when we returned to our room at 11:30, housekeeping had already cleaned our room & bathroom, ready for the next occupant. Bad reports on the restaurant. Some members of our group ate breakfast there & complained about nonexistant service & "coffee Nazis" who refused to refill coffee cups. We ate at the Diamond Deli one door from the hotel. Highly recommended. Lots of seating upstairs. Excellent coffee & fresh fruit buffet not to be believed--raspberries, blueberries, blackberries, grapes, mellon, papaya, pineapple. Would I stay here again? It would depend on the situation & the price. If I were traveling by myself, probably not. I stayed at the Millennium Broadway last time for not much more & it was much nicer. But if my next bus trip landed me here, I wouldn't be too disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Hotel with character!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Like other reviews I've read, I was a teeny bit sceptical about staying at the Edison - we were there from 4th - 8th December and can only come to the conclusion that the negative reviews were about another Edison Hotel!!! Location was absolutely fantastic - less than a minute from Times Square with all the hustle and bustle you would expect - yet, our room was lovely and quiet. We were on the 3rd floor in a double room and honestly, it was absolutely fine. More than big enough, lovely clean bedding, comfortable bed and pillows. Big t.v., table, chair etc. The bathroom was smallish but no smaller than mine at home so I wasn't bothered in the slighest. Important thing is that it was spotlessly clean. If you are into Art Deco, this is the Hotel for you. Walking into the lobby was like going back to the 1930's. Real character and very attractive. The seating area at Reception had a beautiful Christmas tree. The Hotel Staff at Reception couldn't have been nicer. On our arrival, the guy who attended to us was really friendly as were all the staff during our stay. We had breakfast in the Edison Cafe all of the time we stayed and it was great. Ok, could do with a lick of paint but the place was clean and the food well cooked and tasty. Again, the staff were nice. We spent one evening in the Rum House and that was lovely and relaxing. There was a lady playing piano and singing. The guy at the bar was excellent - very attentive and pleasant. Being there on the run up to Christmas, the bar was decorated beautifully and it reminded me a bit of Santa's Grotto - lovely! They have an excellent gift shop where the staff were friendly and helpful. The goods on sale were very fairly priced in comparison to shops outside. Negative comments? If anything, yeah maybe the hallways could do with a lick of paint but we weren't staying in the hallways were we? No, we didn't have tea and coffee in our room but we only ever drink it in other hotels because it's there. Did we miss it? Not a jot. After a day exploring the absolutely wonderful city of New York, the last thing we wanted was to drink coffee - all we wanted to do was drift off to sleep in our clean, comfortable bed. Hopefully, we will go back to New York one day because it is an experience we will never forget - we wouldn't hesitate in booking ourselves into the Edison Hotel again. I can't think of anything that other hotels could offer us over and above the Edison. If you are thinking about booking there then take my advice - ignore the negative reviews unless you are really, really, really, really, really, really fussy!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Wow what a location,2 minute walk right in to the heart of times square!We stayed at the Edison from the 17th nov to 21st,the hotel was average but clean,we had fresh towels and bedding every day,but like in one of the other reviews,who goes to New York to sit in the hotel room,I mean all the wonderful sights to see,the great people,oh and did I mention the shopping!!What an experience we had,my husband,son(who's 12),2 friends and I.Bit cold but who cares when your in such a great place as New York.We will most deffinatly be going back sometime in the near future AND be staying at the Edison.P.s there's a great deli next door,they do a mean breakfast to get you started in the morning and all the different flavours of coffee Mmm.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Clean Room”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had to travel to NYC on short notice for a business trip. I usually stay at the Marriott Marquis, however due to the new york marathon their rates were over $450 per night. I found the Edison nearby for the rate of $210 for a mini suite. The room was spacious, clean and very comfortable. The furniture and carpeting were worn but clean. It's not the ritz but for the price it was a good value for a safe, clean room in a central location. The staff at the front desk and bell staff were very friendly and helpful. I travel to NYC on a monthly basis and will not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “better than expected after reviews on here”
Reviews.Author: steve21
Reviews.Content: stayed at the edison nov 14th to 18th.After reading reviews was expecting the worse but the hotel wasnt that bad come on people for the price what do you expect buckingham palace.Brilliant location to soak up new york hustle bustle noise yellow cabs steam thought it was great.Sure could do with updating but will you stop there when they triple the prices ?.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value for money....bad staff”
Reviews.Author: Nic78
Reviews.Content: Edison hotel is a 3 star hotel so you get what you pay for but how could you fault the location, just steps away from Times Square. People are paying triple the price just two doors up at the W Hotel!!! The hotel is dated, but apparently they are going for the retro look (cann't afford renovations). The bed was small and the bathroom was old and you can tell it is an old hotel but it was comfortable. The staff were beyond rude with the woman at the front desk not even raising her head to look at me just saying YES???? and getting more angry as I wouldn't speak to her until she actually looked at me. When she finally looked up i asked her where i could cash travellers chqs and she just pointed to the person at the other end of the desk, not even answering me. Don't expect service from anyone except the man who doesn't give you a choice and takes your bag to the room and waits for a tip!!! I would stay here again, only for the cost and location and of course the fantastic deli next door!! Definently go to the deli for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “pretty good--it's all about location”
Reviews.Author: mowguy98
Reviews.Content: over the past 3 years, i've stayed in the marriott marquis--very nice but out of my budget to stay in again--the milford plaza, and the edison hotel. of the latter two, edison was much nicer. -room was small but manageable -maid service was very good and clean -mattress was hard--worst feature overall--but we were on the go all day so we still slept soundly at night -elevators were fast -check in for a group of 18 took less than 15 minutes, although it was a little frustrating having to wait on an escort to take us to our room. -location was outstanding. went to brooklyn daily for a conference and the yellow R,N were right there. shows, times square, shopping--it's all there -in my neighborhood, you can get a 5-star hotel for less than what this cost, but in Times Square, I'd stay there again. -cafe edison was excellent, although i'm used to 'warmer' service in the south. great value for amount of food. hot and tasty!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, ignore the bad reviewsl!!”
Reviews.Author: LK1983
Reviews.Content: Myself & 2 friends returned back from NYC last weekend, i had prepared myself for the worst, after reading reviews which had been posted. But once we arrived at 1pm we were able to check in straight away even though it told us on our reservation that check in was after 3pm.The staff were very friendly & the bellhop showed us up to out room on the fifteenth floor, when we walked out of the elevator out room was just on the right hand side. The room was a big enough size & clean, the bathroom a tiny bit small but again it was still spotlessly clean. The hotel has a fabulous Italian resturant / bar located at the far end of the lobby called 'Sofias' it is very reasonably priced especially for a resturant in its location. The location of the hotel is fantastic you are less than 30mins walking time from all landmarks, and great shops there is no need for subways or taxis to most places if you like walking! also you get to see everything, things which you might miss if you travel by taxi or subway. The hotel 2 seconds from the main strip on Times Square. Ok the hallways may need a lick of paint but for a clean & comfortable hotel in the heart of times square book into the Edison.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Edison Hotel for a week with 30 other people from my school. Of course for a school trip i wasn't expecting much but I was surprised. The staff were very helpful and kind. We didn't have many cleanliness problems, except for minor ones in the bathroom. Its in a GREAT location on Times Square and if you are in love with theater, shopping and the night life, then come here!! ALthough, it was a bit crowded here and people tend to get a bit ancy. You don't have to worry about the staff, just other customers. And I must warn you to not go outside at night. There were so many drunk bums on the street! But all in all, COME HERE!!

Reviews.Title: “Not great, not bad”
Reviews.Author: Bandango
Reviews.Content: After reading all the reviews on this website, I was a little scared to say the least! My husband & I stayed there for 4 nights in October and I have to say I was a little disappointed with the Edison. The rooms were very shabby but apart from that it wasn't that bad and the location more than makes up for it! We found the staff perfectly fine, the only thing we missed was a good restaurant & bar in the hotel! However, I probably wouldn't stay there again but thats not to say it isn't fine for the budget traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: corkgal
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Edison from the 26th October to 1st November and could not have been happier. After reading reviews here I told my boyfriend to expect the worst. When we arrived staff were extremely helpful and our room on the 17th floor had plenty of space, was clean, comfortable and had a great view. The bathroom was spotless and really nice. The only problem was with this banging in the pipes that went on at night but if you really make the most of your time in NYC you will be so tired at night that it won't bother you and only woke me up about once in 5 nights. I would recommend this hotel to anyone going to NYC as it's the most fantastic location and was really comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed in The Edison for 4 nights with my boyfriend, I was really scared after reading all the reviews but I got a great sorprise after finding that it is a nice hotel, the staff was very kind and helpful, the room was really small but not a problem, it was clean and safe, and offcourse the location is the best in all New York. I don`t think you need more, yes it is old, but I think its part of the experience. I`m certantly going back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Satisfactory Accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Ginnythecat
Reviews.Content: Great Location - Just around the corner from Times Square. Accommodation - Could do with a lick of paint and a bit of an update but on the whole it was satisfactory for our short stay from 26th October til 29th October. Room was cleaned everyday, fresh towels, beds made etc. It would have been nice to have tea/coffee making facilities in the room but there is a cafe downstairs to get a take out.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly okay”
Reviews.Author: RyanL
Reviews.Content: Okay the Hotel is cheaper than others and basic but if you just want a place to sleep that is very close to Time Square then this is it. After reading some of the reviews I was a bit apprehensive but the room was clean, had a TV and bathroom and the staff were friendly. No problems - would stay here again (Just don't expect the Ritz at these prices).

Reviews.Title: “Very poor hotel”
Reviews.Author: RKPT
Reviews.Content: The only positive thing I can write about this hotel is that the location is fantastic. Now for the home truths. THe hotel is very, very shabby and leaves a lot to be desired. The first room we were given was filthy and I could have cried when I saw the state of the place. We immediately went down to the front desk and asked for another room. We were told that none were available and that we would have to return the following day to move. As requested, we stayed in the filthy room for one night only and were given an alternative room the following day. To be fair, this new room was slightly better, however, the sheets on the bed were worn and the blanket had seen better days. Carpets were very shabby and we had a struggle to find electrical sockets. There is no tea and coffee making facilties, so I would suggest you bring your own. Bathroom was tiny and also in a state of disrepair. Front desk staff not very helpful either. Overall, I would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby hotel, rude, ignorant staff but good location.”
Reviews.Author: SHELLYJ
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Edison at the end of a 3 week holiday in Vegas & California and the contrast between this hotel & all the others we had stayed in was stark - especially the attitude & rudeness of all the staff except the housekeeping ladies who were wonderful. We were put in a room next to the lift workings & got no sleep the first night listening to the lifts going all night - you could even hear the conversations of the people in the lift! (Room 2206 - beware!!) I was reduced to tears by the rude & ignorant staff who refused to move us and just put the phone down on me when I asked to change rooms. We were moved the next day, but I have never ever encountered a less customer friendly bunch than the staff of the Edison, from the check in staff to the bellboys, to the staff in the Cafe Edison. They made you feel as if you were invisible and just about bit your head off when they did deign to speak to you! Only the 2 ladies from housekeeping showed any concern or had a friendly word & smile. I had expected the hotel rooms to be small, which they were, but the whole place was so shabby & in need of a good makeover. The location as great, just a few steps from Times Square, and I could have overlooked the shabbiness as it is only a place to sleep after all, but nothing could ever make up for the attitude of the staff and I would never ever stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Version of Soup Nazi - Gives Midtown a Bad Name”
Reviews.Author: czbllc
Reviews.Content: Worst city hotel I have ever stayed at. Was unfortunate to have had someone else make my travel plans. This hotel -----. The hotel is dirty - not just lobby or elevators or gym. I mean nasty. This is a roach coach. DO NOT STAY. The only thing worse at this place than the scummy rooms and showers is the attitude of the front desk. Think Seinfeld's soup nazi. You have been warned

Reviews.Title: “Good Location...but”
Reviews.Author: shaner996
Reviews.Content: Location is great. Rooms and hallways are old and dirty. Don't have any expectations...or you will be disappointed. I am sure some cleaning and painting would do wonders.

Reviews.Title: “Good for price and location, nothing else”
Reviews.Author: Travel Agent Traveler
Reviews.Content: The Edison is in a great location for theater goers. We stayed for three nights and easily walked to four different shows. The price we paid was much less than the other reputable hotels in the area but you get what you pay for (or don't pay for!). The desk staff while not rude is merely functional. There is a transportation desk with a very harried and fairly useless staff, but no real concierge that we could locate. The bell staff was the most helpful staff we found. The room, called a suite, was about the size of a room other hotels call standard. The windows were definitely not soundproofed. We were on the 7th floor and were kept awake each night by piano music and singing from nearby bars, and the horrendous crashing of dumpsters around midnight each night. The bathroom barely fit one person. Soap is those little bars one used to get in a cheap motel. Shampoo comes in rip-off packets. Bathrooms "glasses" are plastic wrapped in plastic. The tub was badly stained. The sink was cracked. One day we didn't receive washclothes. There was no way to turn on the heat so we had to call down for extra blankets. All this for $185 a night! I know hotels in NYC are costly but this is truely a crime. Having just returned from two overseas trips, we got 4 and 5 star hotels for similar prices. In any case, if you need a hotel near Times Square, want to pay less than the chain and better-rated hotels, and don't care about anything other than having a bed, this is the place for you. By the way, the lobby features a beautifully decorated seating area.

Reviews.Title: “awful place”
Reviews.Author: rufus6
Reviews.Content: palmed off with a single room masquerading as a double. Management didn't want to know. Give this place a wide berth.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby and rude”
Reviews.Author: weliketoleavehome
Reviews.Content: WE stayed here for 5 nights in september. Yes great location but old, not serviced properly, some staff unhelpful( big city syndrome). No mini bar, no fridge, just the basics. Only upside is closeness to Times square etc. By the way the deli next door is run by some very rude people at times but there are other little delis etc around. does not have a warm , comfy feel more of a cold big city feel. we would pay more and stay elsewhere

Reviews.Title: “It's OK......”
Reviews.Author: CosmicGirl29
Reviews.Content: I really didn't want to write the rest as everyone else, but most of it is true! The Location of this hotel is absolutely brilliant, you couldn't be in a more central location, and I have to say this does make up for the shabbiness of the hotel. We had a queen bedded room which was clean, however the bathroom could have done with a 'proper' clean, instead of just a quick wipe round! I think the dust had been settled there for years, and the corridor carpets looked as though they had never seen a hoover! The staff at the hotel were ok, not the over friendly american type, but then again this is a City and thats what I was expecting! Overall a good based hotel, with a great location! Would I go back..... Lets just say I would check other hotels in the same area first before booking this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “not the best place on earth”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: run down, needs money spent on it BUT it's turning over good money so why bother.WE will not book again great location but not again.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: Suzy_Alice
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews i was a little bit nervous about the edison hotel, but when we got there the reception staff were perfectly friendly and the porters were lovely. Hotel needs a little re- styling and the corridors could do with a bit of decoration. The rooms are smaller than website states (note a LOT smaller)! But the tv was a nice size and plenty of channels. The room was nice and quiet considering the roads of times sqaure are just outside. Beware of the a/c VERY noisey! But if you are looking for a nice hotel in the heart of times sqaure then i would say without a doubt try this hotel!! Just on broadway you cannot beat the location!

Reviews.Title: “Great locarion”
Reviews.Author: KimGordelier
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights from 4th Sep. Arrived on Brazil Day (mental), Me, hubby, son (24) daughter (18). Rooms were basic but did the job. You dont go to New York to sit and look at the decor (unless you are Billy no mates). Ours was at the back of the lifts which was very noisy. Staff soon moved us, no problem. The men on reception were fine, the women were surly and anything seemed too much to deal with. Loved the location. Central to absolutely everything. Had a brilliant time. Up in the morning, straight out. (No coffee maker in the rooms - very bad!!!). Ran round New York cos there is too much to see in 4 days. Crammed most of it in. Even saw a band from back home in BB Kings (Napalm Death). Ate breakfast in the hotel cafe twice - good enough. Hotel was a bit shabby, but not at all dirty. Would stay again because of the location. Hubbys only complaint was that they did not show the England game on the pub tv.

Reviews.Title: “Had a "Smashing" time”
Reviews.Author: Dennistravels
Reviews.Content: I went to the Edison hotel with three girlfriends in September 2005. For the most part, the pictures of the rooms were accurate, however the bathrooms are quite small and the showers/bathtubs are a little old. Bring your own hairdryer as there are none supplied in the rooms, and if you need an iron, housekeeping will bring one by for use only for an hour. I would also recommend that if you are acustomed to using the hotel products (such as shampoo and conditioner), that you bring your own bottles. The products supplied by the hotel are small sachets and wouldn't last if you are in a group of more than two. There are no self serve ice machines or pop machines in the hotel either. We ordered ice one night and had it brought up to our room by a bellboy. We did have a bit of a problem the last night we were staying at the hotel. We had initially opened up the window in our room the first day we arrived, (which was quite easy, and it was quite obvious that the windows had been replaced since the 20's) and when we did that, the window pane came out of the track, falling towards us. Luckily we caught the window and slid it back into the track. We had informed the front desk of the issue with the window and they said they would take care of it. Our last night in the room, we came back to the suite and when we opened up the door, the window fell right out of the track, hitting the AC vent, smashing glass all over the floor, and in my suitcase which was unfortunately positioned underneath it. We had immediate service from the maintenance in the hotel and were moved to another room immediately- which was great service, but we would have rather waited, as the window was replaced before we had re-packed our suitcases and the floor merely needed vacumming. The one great thing about this hotel is the location. Times Square is located less than a city block away and there is a great strip of pubs/lounges the other block away. We walked to many of the tourist destinations and there are great restaurants located nearby. An atm is also located at the convenience store next to the hotel and there is a small gift shop within the hotel itself that has a few drinks, t-shirts, key chains etc. For my first trip to NYC, staying at the Hotel Edison was part of the experience. The price is affordable and the location is unbeatable for the price. If you are going to NYC chances are you are only using your hotel room for sleeping anyway, in the city that never sleeps!

Reviews.Title: “A nightmare to say the very least....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this dump for 2 nights....never again and I dont recommend it to anyone...the staff was rude and very unhelful except for the bellstaff who were nice. No one working in this place has the capacity to smile. They even checked us in to a dirty room and we were told it would be done up in 20 minutes...makes you wonders about the quality of housekeeping...!!The room was small and worn and the bathroom ceilling was covered with large balck mold spots everywhere as were the tiles. Bathroom amenities are non exixtant except small plastic packets of shampoo....surprising they even offer that ! The place should be gutted !! A really bad experience... As a hotel worker I can truly say, dont stay here!! YUCK!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Edison Nice clean but rooms small”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Edison very nice rooms clean but on the small size, hallways very warm if hot out side, no ventilation. Restraunt attached to hotel very good food and not expensive at all, very good location. 8/05

Reviews.Title: “shame about the reception staff!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Edison for 6 nights in September. From reading reviews of the hotel before our trip we were slightly worried about what was in store for us, but to our surprise the Edison turned out to be just what we were looking for. The location couldnt be better, only seconds from Time Square,and in the heart of absoulutly everything. It was perfectly situated for tours, Broadway shows and that feeling that you were right in the middle of where it was all happening! The only downside to the hotel was the rude reception staff. On arrival we found them very abrupt and unfriendly, in fact when my husband asked one of them a question during check-in, he found the girl hard to hear, on asking her to repeat the answer she shouted back "I SAID!!" and then repeated her unhelpful reply. There was absolutly no eyecontact made any time I had the misfortune of having to approch one of them, a traite that you would think would be imperitive when dealing with the public. Surprisingly all the reception staff were as bad as each other, the only explaination I have for this is that when advertising for staff the Hotel must have looked for people who were [A] Rude [B] very unhelpful [C] Sarcastic [D] unfriendly and [E] Had absolutley no experience in dealing with the public prior to this position. However we did find all other hotel staff friendly and approachable. Maybe they should swap their staff around, as the cleaners and bellboys did a better job at welcoming us than the people who were actually paid to!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly; efficient;”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I arrived quite early in the morning (9am) after a 20 hour, exhausting flight. The reception was friendly and wonderfully efficient and had my room ready well before time! The reasonable breakfast was welcome. The location was nice, very near Central Park and Times Square- nice for a first timer to NYC. The room was small , but adquate. I will revisit, but ask for a room facing the Carnagie Hall rather than the back of other hotels!

Reviews.Title: “Adequate”
Reviews.Author: jess123
Reviews.Content: Just came back this morning from NYC. Like the others I was slightly nervous about the hotel, however, I really have no complaints. Don't expect to be sleeping on silk sheets or anything of the like. However, this hotel's location cannot be beat, seconds from Times Square. You literally walk out the front door, turn to your right and are in the middle of it all. I would recommend this hotel strongly, location is key. In NYC you aren't going to be doing much other than sleeping in your room anyway. Bathroom and room are fairly small but it's good enough, a nice clean, affordable place to stay near Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “basic but suitable”
Reviews.Author: neeks12
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an ideal spot. Times square is just round the corner, however the hotel is not affcted by any noise. Rooms and basic and maybe could do with bing modernised but for a short stay its ideal as its clean and cofortable. the breakast bar does some great, cheap food and the resaurant is decent. the reception area is large and comfy and staff are friendly and welcoming. Great location and ideal or short stays.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Lou_Lou84Uk
Reviews.Content: Excellent Hotel! I arrived at the Edsion on August 14th for 6 nights and was amazed by it, It was loverly. I was kind of worried about this hotel because of some of the bad reviews ive read and was waiting for something bad to happen, which never did. We were on the 12th floor and our room was big enough for 3 of us. The bathroom was really small but, as many have said, you dont go to NY to spend time in your hotel room or your bathroom. This Hotel is literally seconds away from Times Square, its totally worth staying in this hotel for its location. Housekeeping were excellent, our room was always done to perfection when we arrived back and clean towels and sheets everyday, Housekeeping even came back to our room to give us more towels because they thought they hadnt left enough, they are polite and always said good morning to us. I loved this hotel so much, im booking again for next year. Also, try the Cafe Edison, the pancakes are espicially nice and so is the staff!

Reviews.Title: “Fine for What We Needed...”
Reviews.Author: Kim1019
Reviews.Content: I too was worried about this hotel after reading the reviews after I had booked and prepaid for it. But really, it is completely adequate for a family, or anyone, on a budget who really just wants to see NYC. The location couldn't be better - you are virtually in Times Square, and the double decker tour buses are directly around the corner for the hop on hop off service. Our room was small, two twin beds, but clean enough. The bathroom was tiny, but once again, adequate. Last time I had a shared bath, so this was definitely a step up. The only real turn off to me was a dank odor - when the AC wasn't on, the room definitely didn't smell great. They do charge you .50 for a bucket of ice, which is pretty ridiculous, and unfortunately there is no mini-refrigerator, so you can't bring leftovers back to the room to nosh on later. Which, by the way, if you go to renowned Carnegie Deli, split the sandwiches. They are huge, and it is such a waste when you can't take the leftovers with you. Anyway, in short, if you are never in your room, like we were, this will suit you just fine. There was no noise problem, the room was adequate, and you will be pleased with the location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value at the Edison”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a tour of New England and Canada which started with three nights in New York at the Hotel Edison. For the rate and location, the hotel was excellent value. It is situated just off of Times Square. We walked to Central Park and the Empire State Building on our first day. Our room was very clean and comfortable. The bathroom was on the small side and a little dated but very acceptable. The staff were very helpful and the bar (although a little pricey compared to the U.K.) was also excellent. The Cafe Edison was also very reasonable. We had two good breakfasts there and the service was very quick. Overall, for the budget conscious traveller, you cannot better this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “No Complaints!”
Reviews.Author: MollyFlossy
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Edison for 5 nights in July. After reading the reviews on this site I was really worried about what we were about to face when we pulled up at the Edison. Granted it isnt the best looking hotel. It is old and has had some wear and tear, so yes it could do with a revamp. But hey this hotel has everything you could need. The staff are very helpful and friendly. The rooms aren't huge and are worn, but everything that needs to be clean is clean. The bed was comfy and we experienced no noise, which came as a great suprise! As previoulsy mentioned the location is FANTASTIC! The restaurant is similar in appearance to the hotel. But we had a very satisfying breakfast there and the service was very fast - just what you need when theres so much sightseeing (and shopping) to do. I will definately stay at the Edison if Im ever so lucky to visit NYC again. Lets face it, if your travelling to New York why shell out loads of money on a swanky hotel? Save it and spend it on doing and seeing as much as possible. You spend hardly anytime in the hotel anyway. Don't worry about the poor reviews. If you want a clean, comfy hotel in a great location you wont be dissapointed!

Reviews.Title: “Improvement needed”
Reviews.Author: Monument
Reviews.Content: With my family I stayed at the Edison for three nights midweek. On the plus side: 1. The location of the hotel was perfect, it is within yards of Time Square. 2. The rooms were clean and the sheets and towels were changed daily. 3. The staff were approachable and friendly. 4. The air conditioning was powerful and was really needed during a very hot spell of weather. On the downside: 1. The hotel itself was dimly lit with poorly laid (due to age) carpets that desperately needed renewing. 2. The rooms had only one available power outlet and that was in the bathroom 3. The twin bedded room was small and the bathroom was very small. Overall if you are on a budget and want to be near Time Square the Edison is just about OK. Next time I will spend a little more and find a better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: fourmost
Reviews.Content: Well, i stayed at the Edison hotel in february. The location of the hotel couldnt get any better, we we're only seconds from times square. The room was fairly small, however comfortably had two double beds which suited us great (3 of us) for the amount of time we actually spent in the room, i couldn't really complain. The room was nice and quiet and had everything we really needed. the bathroom was small, but didnt need it to be much bigger. The only problem we had was when we were leaving, we had booked the transport with the hotel to JFK. arrived in reception at about 11.30, out flight was at 9pm. we left our luggage in storage at reception for 50 cents a bag. and went out for lunch, we returned at about 2.30 and sat in the reception area and waited for our transport. They told us it would come at around 5.30pm. we got a little bit worried as at 6pm it still hadnt arrived. at this point i went and saw the woman, she told us not to worry and he ws on his way. she took our reciept off us and told us to take a seat. at 6.30 i approached a different woman on the desk and told her the problem. the lady before this had went home. The women said that there was no transport arranged for us and how we hadnt payed (eventhough she had the recipt infront of her.) I askedher why they would write out a recipt if i hadnt payed, at this point i asked for the manager. he came out and arranged a taxi to take us to the airport. We got half way to the airport when the taxi driver told us that we had to pay, i told him to take us back to the hotel. we arrived back at the hotel at 7pm. where i asked for the manager. he told us that he would pay for the taxi and not to worry. we arrived at the airport just as they were shutting the checkin! wouldn't advise anyone to arrange transport with them! however i would return to the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Location, Convience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: i stayed at the Edison for three nights with my boyfreind, just visiting new york on site seeing. I searched alot of hotels, and booked the edison. I checked with trip advisor and i read a few bad reviews and got scared. I expected the worst. Check in was a sinch. Less than 2 minutes, just had to sign the form and the bell hop brought everything up to the room. We had a newly rennovated room with a double bed, a night stand a desk, a chair and a good size tv. The room looked exactly like the picture because it was remodeled. The room next to ours was not remodeled and it looked like it was from the 70's. It had everything the same as ours, just older style. People complained because there was not enough plugs, it is an old hotel. There was three outlets in the room plus the bathroom. If thats not enough and you need alot bring an extension cord. I had my laptop a curling iron, a blow dryer two phone chargers and an iron. and it was completely fine for us. It's literally a second from times square. Very convient location, as everyone else says. Great shops and food around it. Room service was great. I called for towels not even 2 minutes later they brought me a bunch, same with an iron. I guess the people who don't like this hotel are looking for a 5 star in a 3 star budget. The value was great, and i will definately plan a trip there again. Just make sure to ask for a newly renovated room. They do hold the bags after you check out. It's 50 cents a bag for as long as you need. Who cares it 50 cents, everything else in NY is expensive so i don't know why another review complained it costs 2 dollars to store 4 bags? prolly the cheapest thing there. Check out was easier than checking in. Just give them the room keys and your all set. This hotel is a deal, we visited the other hotels, near it such as the wellington which is the same money and it was gross. The bathroom in our room was small, but had a full size tub, a medicine cabinet, a toliet towel racks, and the sink. It has all the basics. Also i read a review that said there was no shampoo, etc. There was plenty it was on a shelf, they musta not looked hard enough. I recommened this hotel, but not if ur looking for a 5 star. It was perfect for my trip. Pictures are coming soon

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away..Even though good location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This place is the worst I have ever stayed in. The hotel is very old and beat up , needs major renovations. It smells bad also. We were promised a late check out during the reservation process and got denied during the stay. Hotel staff was rude and did not offer to help in any way. The maids were smoking on a non smoking floor. STAY AWAY...never go to this horrific hotel. If you want to throw away your money I would be happy to give you my address to send me a check, this way I saved you a bad experience.

Reviews.Title: “edison was fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Landshark78
Reviews.Content: I just got back from from a 7 night stay at the Edison and loved it. The location was great, the room was clean and good sized with comparable amenities. I don't know why anyone complains! I was a litle worried when I read the reviews and I told my wife to expect a small room that was maybe outdated, but I had nothing to worry about. We saw 7 shows and were within walking distance to all of them. Cab fare from LaGuardia was only $25. The staff, though not exactly friendly, was effecient and accomodating. I researched for months before booking and there wasn't any other hotel in this price range that was this nice (I even poked my head in a few of them while I was in NY). I don't know what everyone that wrote a bad review was expecting. I would definitly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “I will tell Everyone not to stay at the Edison NYC”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Purchased a weeks stay through a travel site and got a triple: two queen beds on the llth floor overlooking 47th St. which had absolutely no view. My room cost was $1322.77 for the 7 nights. Upon check in I was taken to a drabby, dull, small, moldy room in the back of some floor I do not remember, which I quickly objected to! The bellboy took me back down to the desk where I complained, then we went to another floor...same thing, I then became a little irate at the desk and said I would cancel my week and would not pay that amt. to stay in such place, might I add I have read in the reviews that several people have gone to as many as three rooms at the Edison before accepting one to stay in. Same here.. they finally gave us one on the llth floor that had better furniture, nicer spreads and beds, and a larger window and seemed to be more updated. However, the carpet was very soiled. The bathroom was no bigger than a closet and the tub was from the 1940s as well as he shower head. Absolutely no amenities such as nice shampoo or conditioner (none), no hairdryer, no ice ...you pay 50cents for a bucket of ice!!! Did I say, you had little or no plugs for cell phone chargers, cameras, hair dryers, curlers, etc. The pillows are flat as a pancake and that is a fact.We had three people and by the end of the wk. we had 11 trying to be comfortable. The closet door and the bath door open into each other; there isn't any chain locks on the door for safety. The conceirge charges to book shows and trips. Look out. Good things: Sheets were changed daily. Bath cleaned daily. Housekeeping responded immediately when called for extra pillows, towels, washcloths,etc. Check out was a snap. Oops, I forgot, cheapo hotel charged us 50cents a bag to store out bags after ckout until out flight that afternoon. One other good thing though, the hotel desk did print out boarding passes for free, I hope it was a good gesture or not just my look of dispair for staying at their crummy hotel for a whole week. Never again, My dollar can be well spent elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a budget trip to NY!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was a fabulous hotel for the price! We searched for many different hotels and finally settled on this one. Our hotel room was small, but the air conditioning was wonderful! Easy check in, even easier check out. This hotel is right next to the "W Times Square" a fancy hotel. Couldn't have a better location in Manhattan, just a half a block from Times Square and the TKTS booth. Perfect location for subway access and restaurants on Broadway and 8th. I will definately be staying in this hotel again, it was wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: twogr8ize
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Edison for 2 nights. That was long enough. Yes, location is great. Our room had a "smell" to it. Small. Bathroom was uncomfortable to be in. The tub was disgusting, very needed updating. Hated to even step into it. Medicine cabinet rusted. Carpets very worn. No ice, unless you wanted to pay for it. Our first time in New York City, but would spend more to stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Scary”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We looked at numerous reviews before booking The Edison. I don't know if there are better rooms in this hotel than the one we had, but ours was terrible. Smelly and dirty. The lights and air conditioning were off (on the hottest day of the year) in the hallways, giving it a "The Shining" kind of feel. We called housekeeping asking for an iron and ironing board and never received either. Also, they force you to use a bellhop even if you only walk in with a backback as we did. It was terrible. We left after one night and stayed with friends who bailed us out of another Edison Hotel experience. The Milford Plaza is a better choice for only a little more money.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: turls
Reviews.Content: As the title suggests this hotel really is in a prime position just a couple of hundred yards from the fabulous Times Square. The staff overall appeared to be kept very busy and they were efficient. The room we had was pretty small and like the rest of the hotel that we saw, in need of a lick of paint. it was however clean(ish). The en-suite bathroom was absolutely tiny, there was always hot water-the shower was from the 1960's and barely worked!! We used the hotel as a base only, we had three nights in New York so we used the time as best we could and therefore spent little time in the hotel and for this along with the reasonable cost it was good for us and to use it for the same again I would go back to the Edison, knowing exactly what to expect-The Ritz this ain't, affordable and acceptable it is.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Clean and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: rlbintegrity
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night when another hotel wouldn't let us check in a day early. Edison accomodated us at the last minute, and didn't gouge the rate. Great location, very clean and comfortable room. Bathroom, while small, was immaculate. Don't stay here if you want Ritz Carlton amenities. Do stay here if you want a clean comfortable room at a reasonable rate at a great location. The door is 200 feet from the TKTS booth at Times Square. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “good value, fantastic locatoin”
Reviews.Author: canadianpair
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 rooms, 4 to a room for a Friday and Saturday weekend trip. We arrived at 9 in the morning and were given our rooms immediately. This was a huge bonus as it was pouring rain and we had been up since 4 am. Some of us grabbed a nap and others headed out with umbrellas to see the sites. Found the location amazing. We had 3 generations in our group and when some wanted to rest others could head out to Times Square and explore the area. The Diamond deli two doors towards Times Square is a must...Great for breakfast or snacks at anytime. All the locals are in there regularly. Coffee was great with lots of choices in flavours. Felt we got our money's worth in the Hop on Hop off bus. We stayed with Greyline...the other groups seemed to have fewer buses. As we were buying passes for 8 people we were able to negotiate a discount of $3 per person. We were told that the cheapest way to travel from LaGuardia is cabs. We prebooked a van through the hotel and paid twice as much as a cab would cost as well they insisted on picking us up 3 1/2 hours before our flight on a Sunday night. It only took 30 min to get to the airport and it was Not an international flight so we were about 2 hours early than needed. Loved Chinatown. Bargain on the purses. Walk away and they drop significantly. Can't wait to head back. This is a Fun destination for all ages.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: NottinghamPanther
Reviews.Content: At 1st sight, this hotel looks a tad dull, & stuck in a 'Charleston' period time-warp!. Once you've got past those initial 'urrrrrrm' feelings, you'll appreciate this hotel for what it truly is - An EXCELLENT hotel, smack bang in the middle of Time Square/Broadway..which is ultra convenient, & within walking distance of all the major attractions. Stayed here May 8th, 9th, & 10th 2005, & had the time of our lives. As a place to stay it's ok, if all you want to use it for is to rest, shower & change. We never spent any other time here, apart from when we needed rest. The rooms are ok, but quite basic. Would I stay here again?. Most definately..if for the 1st class location & nothing else.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Safe, Fabulous Location”
Reviews.Author: JMSMinot_ND
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a stay at the Edison. Myself, my daughter and her friend (both 17) stayed for 5 nights and had an excellent time. Our room had 2 double beds, a night table, a desk and chair, a TV on an armouire and a small closet. We had no problem with space as there were plenty of drawers to store clothes and toiletries and all suitcases fit in the closet (along with all the hanging clothes). The bathroom was small but adequate. No problems with water pressure or temperature. The room was no frills but we didn't go to NYC to sleep on silk sheets or soak in a whirlpool. Outlets are sparce but I took an adapter with so we had no problems there. Housekeeping came everyday and we always had plenty of clean towels. We were out late every night and I always felt safe when walking back. Checkout time was hours before our flight. The bellman stored our luggage until we were ready to leave. I had the hotel arrange transportation to the airport and all went smoothly. We were well within walking distance to everything...theatres, Empire State Building, 5th Ave shopping, Rockerfeller Center and Central Park. We took the subway to the Statue of Liberty and it was much safer and easier than I thought. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who is more interested in experiencing NYC than staying in a fancy hotel. I will definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and price”
Reviews.Author: ELexington
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Edison June 6 and 7. You can't find a better location, and the price was great. When we arrived in the morning, our room was ready for check in. The staff and service were fine. The beds were comfortable, and even though the building is old the room is fairly clean except for an unidentified stain on the wall (yuck) and hair in the bathroom (what is it about hair in the bathroom-every motel review mentions this........eeeeek). The room was quiet and I didn't hear sounds from the street or other rooms.....had a non-smoking room and never smelled smoke...........

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Adequate”
Reviews.Author: MrsEJr
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at the Edison 20 years ago on school trips to NYC and remembered its awesome location to B'way and Times Square when I was booking a trip with my 14 year old daughter. Still great location, still great art deco lobby, Still a great value. Its a clean room, clean bathroom and thats about all you need in NYC because you aren't there to stay in your room! My only complaints, we had a room with 2 twin beds which was TINY. Next time I'd make sure to request 2 double beds. Also, with two women in the room, outlets were an issue. They were either used and we had to sacrfice a light or the clock or too hard to get to (behind the TV armoire) But we had 2 closets, bathroom was spotless, towels refreshed daily. Oh, also no coffee maker, but I know this going in and we brought some mugs, a hotplate and instant coffee and tea bags with us.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Strebor1984
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights at the end of May, had a few reservations after reading other reviews but was pleasantly suprised on arrival. Room was adequately sized but clean, but it didnt really matter because we only really slept in there. The location is the best thing about this hotel, right in the heart of Times Square. Overall this hotel has such a good location for such a good price and I could not complain about anything. The staff were friendly and helpful and at the end of reading some (bad) reviews I would like to stipulate that you get what you pay for. I would definelty stay at this hotal again, it is reasonably priced, clean and has a great location, what more could you ask for a trip to NYC!

Reviews.Title: “Great location clean and friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: hrona123
Reviews.Content: Just returned with my husband from a 3 night stay (far too short) in the Edison. Great hotel, clean, friendly and in a fantastic location, right in the heart of Times Square, could not have found a more central location for the price. We have already reserved a room for August Highly recommend an audio trip to the Staute of Liberty and Ellis Island cost $16 each but well worth it and very informative. Use the subway incredible low price at only $2 return trip or the funday pass $7 for 24hrs unlimited use. The Hop on Hop off bus was a fantastic way to see the sights and get to know the city $49 each for 48hrs, and the tour guides were excellent. If your planning a trip to the Empire State than make sure your there before 08.30 (10 min walk from hotel) otherwise you might find your queuing for up to 2 hours. If you are a "FRIENDS FAN" than a trip to Time Warner is a must, (next to Trump tower) you will find the whole set of friends on display, you can even have your picture taken on the famous coffee couch in CENTRAL PERK. Have breakfast in Central Park, great value for money and you can watch all the new yorkers , jogging along. There are masses of them. I can now understand why they need to keep fit, this really is the city that never sleeps. There is so much to see and do that you will need all the energy you've got to keep up. Above all take a sensible pair of shoes or trainers, you really will need them, and don't bother packing too much stuff, it's a very casual city so jeans and t-shirts are all you need. Take an extra bag for all the shopping you'll do, we had to buy one as we had so much stuff. and don't leave the shopping until the last minute otherwise you won't have enough time to buy all the things you want. Hence the reason we are going back in August

Reviews.Title: “Go!”
Reviews.Author: smiley1075
Reviews.Content: I booked a stay in the Edison after reading the reviews on this site -- I was really, really pleased and will DEFINITELY go again. The hotel is smack dab in the middle of everything exciting -- 5 minute walk from all the theatres (we saw On Golden Pond -- James Earl Jones rocks!). Great restaurants and Time Square within inches from the front door. Subway is just 3 minute walk across Broadway --- only 15 minutes from Museum Mile (and heaven!). It's a no frills hotel but the staff were the BEST -- friendly and responsive every single time including helping us get ironing boards and pillows in the middle of the night. Queen bed was very comfortable and sheets were sparkling clean, room was spotless. Bathroom small but not a big deal at all (for me). Hint -- When you book the room ask them about the shuttle service they use -- it was great and on time and delivered me to JFK exactly at the time promised. And p.s. -- I LOVED the noise of the city right outside my window -- it's one of the things that reminds me that I'm in NYC and not home in the suburbs!

Reviews.Title: “Edison location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We read the Edison reviews on trip advisor just prior to travelling, having already booked the hotel, and were relieved to see it generally got the thumbs up and we agree. The room size varies with accommodation type our friends had a twin room which was larger than our double but had a more cramped bathroom, theirs had two armchairs and a coffee table ours one chair no table both had large TV’s the housekeeping was excellent with ample clean linen etc. As mentioned in other reviews no kettles, a blow for the Brits it must be our nesting instinct, but no problem all you need to do is scoot downstairs out the door turn right and into the 24hr Deli choose one of many flavours of coffee or a good old Lipton’s yellow label and shoot back to your room in less time than it takes a kettle to boil. Whilst there you can also bring back some gorgeous fresh fruit or hot snacks from the huge range they sell in the Deli; the hotel has no problem with you taking snacks to your room so fill your boots (obviously this is a mission for your manservant AKA husband). Having said that we did not see much of the rooms we were out and about. The location is fantastic just fall out the door into Times Square/Broadway the subway is close by and you can either buy a 7 day travel card for $24 or pay $2 per journey as you please. To be honest most things can be reached on foot, (Grand Central 10mins, Empire State 20mins etc.), which allows you to see the sites and sounds, mostly car horns and emergency vehicle sirens with which they obviously train hard to see who can get the most variety of sounds out of, presumably whilst eating donuts. Eating is interesting as the portions are generally huge in the touristy eateries so we opted to share which worked better. We found the food quality variable, like anywhere I guess, but can recommend the following restaurants Pasta Lovers, 142 West 49th St. tasty food, nice décor reasonable prices and Russo’s in the Sheraton 790 7th Avenue at 51St. where we had an excellent after show meal. Show wise we saw the Phantom of the Opera which was great the tickets were $20 to about $100 we had $55 ones and the view was good. The locals seem to treat the theatre a bit more like a cinema with people entering mid performance and the Spanish speakers seem to feel the need to constantly talk throughout a performance but hey it all adds to the experience. Travel from the airport; fixed cost taxi $45 + tolls and tip, return journey metered and in the region of $60 or there is the shuttle bus $19 per person. All told a great holiday thanks Edison and New York.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fine accommodations”
Reviews.Author: ILikeTheNortheast
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night and saw a Broadway play. Right in the middle of everything, we walked around Times Square, to dinner, the play, a bar afterwards, and the next day walked up to Central Park. Can't ask for more. Hotel is fine enough, a little small, but no complaints. For people complaining about noise, you come to NYC, stay in a hotel right off Broadway in Times Square, and you complain about the noise? Strange.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - SMALL room.”
Reviews.Author: bowdenj
Reviews.Content: Stayed 04/18/05 - 04/19/05 I was in NYC for one day for work taking photos and needed a place very close to GMA studios. Edison is right next to Times Square! I read some reviews on tripadvisor before booking and saw comments about room size. They are absolutely correct - my room was very small (see attached pictures). Also zero view - but who cares - I was there to sleep and then work. Decent wireless service that bills on 24 hour period. I used it Monday and Tuesday both in my room and after I checked out I used it in the lobby area uploading photos, etc. Restaurant at the hotel is a good diner and I thought breakfast was good. Would recommend if you don't mind small rooms. LOTS of Europeans were staying at the hotel - not sure if with a group or independent travelers enjoying the low dollar.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel grows on you”
Reviews.Author: Bozley
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel – this place grows on you. We spent 7 days at The Edison in April 2005 and we loved it. We intend to return next year. The Hotel is Art Deco and you wouldn’t be surprised to see Hercule Peroit there. When we arrived, the outside temperature was 85 degrees F and we were thankful the air conditioning was efficient. The room was adequate with a very good comfortable double bed but UK visitors beware, there are no armchairs in which to relax or kettles for tea making provided. Bed linen is changed daily and the room was kept very clean; free safety deposit boxes are provided. The bedroom had no view but who cares – we didn’t. The Reception Staff were very helpful. Location at The Edison is excellent within minutes walk from Broadway and Times Square. New York itself is a brilliant experience; recommend buying a week-long Metro Card costing $24 giving free travel on Subway trains and buses. We spent most days riding the trains and buses, walking and exploring. There is also a good Internet Café’ on 42nd Street - $5 for 4 hours. Eating: there are a huge number of good eating places (we used Chinese, Thai, Greek, and Italian which are all excellent value). Recommend for Breakfasts – Olympic Diner (48th Street/6 Ave); Evening – Beningtons (48th Street/6 Ave); The Irish Rogue (42nd Street) great steaks; Toni's Italian on 47th street; Anytime – the Chinese restaurants in Chinatown. The deli next door to The Edison (open 24 hrs) is also cheap and good value.

Reviews.Title: “you get what you pay for...”
Reviews.Author: fdonovan7
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Edison hotel April 27th 2005..I found the hotel to be very clean and tidy, maybe its in need of a lick of paint ,but for the price i paid to stay 5 nights i wasnt complaining..The location is absolutely fantastic, you step out of the hotel and your virtually standing in the centre of times square..The hotel bar is a little pricey, coupled with the customary tip, it can turn out to be an expensive night...But hey this is New York, so theres plenty more to choose from..My friends and i found a bar called Rudy,s..9th ave btwn 44th and 45th st.. Its your typical "dive bar". The beers cheap, the company,s great..Its a bit of a dump, but great fun for you people who dont mind the surroundings...All in all we had a great time and will definitely be staying at the Edison on my next visit to NYC

Reviews.Title: “GREAT hotel”
Reviews.Author: Millypie
Reviews.Content: Being a TripAdvisor regular, i had quite a few concerns about our stay at the Edison due to the rather mixed feedback it had received. First of all, i simply have to comment on the location. Located literally around the corner from Times Square, i truly believe there is no better positioned hotel in NYC. Unbelievably close to all the major shows, shopping and general turist attractions, the Edison is ideal for when - after a long day and night of being out and about - all you want to do is get to the hotel without much hassle. Our room was pretty close to being perfect. Yes the bathroom isn't very big and not particular glamourous, but it's clean with fresh towels every day. The room, which also was also cleaned and tidied up every day, was really big. It did in fact have two double beds in there. Some of my family was less lucky with their rooms but my personal experience of the Edison was pretty close to being perfect. The breakfast cafe makes excellent pancakes but i'd stay away from their sausages as their rather... ahem... interesting. The bar on the ground floor is really nice too. All in all, Edison does not claim to be a 5* hotel, but for what it is, i couldn't recommend it enough. I would definitely stay there again, without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: April 26, 2005 I stayed at the Edison last week. My experience was ok, but I had hoped for better. The location is awesome! You're only steps away from the TKTS booths, so plan on taking in a show if you stay here! My problems were... the shower would vary temperatures. Become scalding hot one second and too cool the next. Looks like old plumbing, nothing's modern about the place. There were no hairdryers. Sure you can call for one, which I did, but you were warned that you could only keep it for an hour if you used it! For cryin out loud, it's JUST a hairdryer. Just remember to take one w/you if you stay here, it's not worth the inconvenience! Oh there's no iron either! I thought the beds were extremely hard! But of course if you're like me, you'll have exhausted yourself in NYC, it's such an incredible place, you won't really notice. I ate bfst at the Edison restaurant, and it was a little disappointing. The service is slow and they don't take credit cards. The reason I stayed here and while I'll probably stay again? My company insists we stay within a budget of 175.00/N. That's hard to do in NYC, and getting harder as we approach the summer tourist season. So there aren't a lot of options. I"m just glad to have a private bathroom, and no rats or roaches. So if you look at it like that, the Edison's an ok place. Nothing spectacular, just ok. Your experience starts to be spectacular when you walk through the revolving door out to a street in the most incredible city in the world!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but a key word of warning...”
Reviews.Author: ChrisP26
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Edison with my mother for 3 nights. Would definitely agree that its an excellent location, literally stumbling distance from Time Square and close to two subway stations. One major word of warning - if you are staying on a Saturday night, make sure you get a room on a high floor. We were staying on the third floor, and at about 11pm the night-club beneath the hotel kicked off. The music was very loud in the room (seriously - very loud indeed)... and it went on until nearly 4am! Apart from that, the room was basic, but adequate - clean, with comfortable beds. Did find it a bit of an inconvenience that there was no hair-dryer available, and British guests may want to note that there's no kettle provided in the room. The bellhops were very friendly and helpful, but the reception desk staff were definitely not. Hence us not asking to be moved to a different room when the night-club was blasting out - didn't want to have to deal with the receptionist again. Overall, I'd recommend for the location, but be prepared for basic facilities and make sure you're high up to avoid the noise.

Reviews.Title: “Edison was fine”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My girlfirend and I have just returned from a stay in the USA, we had 5 days in Boston, followed by 4 days / nights in NYC at the Edison. We paid £350 for 4 nights in a double room, booked through travelbag. The hotel room was 'compact', but had all the necessities, large TV (loads of channels) plenty of storage - chest of draws, dressing table, wardrobe etc and the en-suite was very clean and well stocked with soap, towels etc. The only downside was that there was no view from the bedroom window. This is a minor negative, considering that this hotel is 2 minute's walk from Times Square, the cost of the hotel room is good value and you don't go to NY to look out of your bedroom window! You can eat in the cafe of the hotel, but there are so many deli's that it's best to take a wander and try a few out. I would recomend anyone to go to Carve', a sandwich / salad shop that is a minute's walk from the Edison - walk out of the front doors and turn left down 47th street and it's on the corner. The sandwiches are amazing value and taste so good - we ate there 4 times in a row! There are also French and Italian restaurants between the hotel and carve', which I can recomend. I would stay at this hotel again, without a second thought, the staff were helpful and the hotel was as described above.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely perfect for a short stay!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Yesterday we came back from a 5days visit to New York, where we stayed in the Edison hotel. We were 4 persons: my husband and I and two sons of 19 and 13. All of us were very pleased with this hotel: it was clean, the staff was very kind and we heared very little of the noise outside. The rooms are quite sound-proof!(We couldn't even say if we had neighbours or not! and I sleep very lightly!! Even the elevators go smoothly up and down without rattling.) I must say I was a little bit afraid to go to the Edison, after having read all the reviews of the past months, but I've been there now and I can assure everyone that this hotel is above average!! It's true: the bathrooms are really small and should be renewed, and the rooms are as not as spacious as the pictures on the website make you to believe, but who cares! I didn't go to new York to sit in my room or to admire my bathroom every hour of the day. The beds were made every day, the sheets were clean, towels were changed daily and the bins emptied. We didn't have to use the heating or airco, so I cannot say if it works or doesn't work without noise. The Edison café is recommended in a lot of guide books, but this was a big disappointment. The waiters and waitresses were not friendly at all, the food was below average and the restaurant didn't make a clean impression at all. We didn't try out the restaurant in the hotel ( entrance on 46th street). I'd like to finish my review with this statement: When you stay at the Edison hotel, you are in the middle of New York, a step away from a ticket-discount-office for all the broadway productions which are to be seen, only a second away form busstops, next to restaurants, coffeeshops, at ten minutes walk from Rockefeller-center, at twentyfive minutes walk from Macy's and the Empire State building, briefly : you are right in the middle of the Big Apple.. and at a VERY REASONABLE PRICE! If you expect the PLaza hotel here, then book the Plaza and pay for the Plaza Our family was very satisfied with the Edison!

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly does the job”
Reviews.Author: rosecaprice
Reviews.Content: I've just come back from a 6 night stay at the Edison and I must say that it perfectly did the job. I had a group of 28 students and 3 chaperons and I had read all the reviews so I was a real bag of nerves before checking in as I was expecting to find hell. Yes the rooms are not that large but when you pay $ 300 per person for 6 nights you can't expect to find the Ritz. The location is just perfect, right on Time Square. The rooms are cleaned every day, plus fresh towel AND PJ's folded. The beds were very confortable are the sheets were clean plus changed if necessary. The staff couldn't have been more friendly or more helpful and we were constantly in need of something. Steve (the check in guy) booked a restaurant for us, Marco the (one of the luggage man) advised us a real nice Italian restaurant just next door. They really did their best to make our stay confortable. On the first night we discovered that the 8 rooms we had booked were scattered all around the place (not their fault but the website from which I had made the reservations) so they told us to keep our rooms for that night because the hotel was sold out but the day after they put us all on the same floor and had the maid clean up all rooms for us in 1/2 an hour!! all the rooms I've seen were as good. We had one closet and a large chest of drawers, enough room to fit the clothes of 4 girls for a week!!! The bathroom is tiny but how much time do you spend in the bathroom were you're in NYC, what really matter was that it was CLEAN (even if there was a little rust in some of them). No A/C or heating problem. We had a problem with the toilets once but it was taken care of rapidly and efficiently. It's true that the hotel needs more plugs and could do with a little renewal but it is still perfectly fine. I will go back there next time I visit the city, that's for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: engteach
Reviews.Content: Just came back from two nights at the Edison. The place is great, very conviently located 1/2 a minute from Time Square. We just paid 275 CAN for 2 nights + the bus from MTL and it was worth it. The room was small but clean. Just don't ask question to the staff, the kept giving us wrong info. I would go back there if I ever want to stay in NYC again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: NalaetNabi
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice place to stay if you are going to New York. The rooms are a little bit small, but they are nice. It is right in Time Square and it is not too expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Never again....”
Reviews.Author: Juleecat
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 night stay at the Edison. The location is terrific, but that is the ONLY positive remark I have about this hotel. The room was closet sized with 2 twin beds that were hard as rocks, and the linens were soiled. The electrical outlets were loose, and sparks jumped from them is the items plugged into them were accidentally moved. With only one outlet available for use, it was difficult to charge phones and cameras, and use hairdryers and curling irons. The door lock was broken, and our card key stopped working twice, resulting in rude treatment at the front desk to have them replaced. It was very noisy, as there were large groups of highschoolers staying at the hotel, and they were loud and eating in the lobby at all hours of the night. The bathroom was the smallest I have ever seen. You could sit on the toilet, take a shower, and shave at the sink at the same time. Do yourselves a favor, and spend a few more dollars and find a clean, adequate hotel. The Edison management should be ashamed of itself for having a gorgeous historic building in shambles.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, abive average for NY”
Reviews.Author: Steveie B
Reviews.Content: Only one minute from Times Square - excellent position. Good service and efficient staff. Smallish room but just what you expect from centre of NY. Like another reviewer, there was a crack in my sink; possibly we had the same room. PJs not folded (unlike other reviews) but that did not worry me. No safe in room but efficient safety deposit in lobby. 2 internet terminals at reasonable cash rates. Room was available early - 10am. Great after overnight flight. Cases can be left on day of departure for $1.

Reviews.Title: “Great Trip from 3/13/05 - 3/17/05”
Reviews.Author: fluteplaye
Reviews.Content: I had chosen the Edison because of the reviews on here, but as we got closer to checking in, I did worry a bit that maybe I would be one of the few that ending up having a bad experience (The exact opposite was true). We called prior to our check in to confirm our reservation. The first time we were told to call back during "Reservation hours" but the second call confirmed our reservations. We checked into the Edison on the 13th. We were met at our cab by a bellhop who unloaded our bags and took them in.
