We had to wait a bit to check in, but once we were, the bellhop showed up to our room: third floor facing 47th street. The location is amazing. Walking to the corner of Broadway and 47th, you're right in Time Square. Our room was what I thought as large, especially after reading reviews about other hotels in our budget-area. It didn't click until after we got back home, but the room could have been a bit larger because it was a corner room. Everything was super clean. Being on the 47th side, we did hear a lot of noise all night, especially when the building across the street cleaned their sidewalks at 1130pm. But, by the second night, we all slept through the noises. We never heard our neighbors or anything in the hall. Our bathroom was clean. The shower had a continuous drip, but it wasn't bothersome. It took awhile for hot water to come, but I'm guessing it was because of the cold weather. We utilized the bellhops: The second day we asked for help to the subway, and were given great directions. The last night, we asked Joe, one of the bellhops, about a place for dinner. The place he recommended was amazing, as well as college-budget-friendly. Housekeeping was impeccable: After returning for the night on the second day, we realized we were missing a personal belonging. After a call the next morning, housekeeping delivered it back to our room. There were 6 elevators that all worked and were quick. It was hard to get 3 people in a single car during the morning check out, but otherwise, they were great. Check out was quick and friendly. The hotel did offer two pay-for-use computers in the lobby. It was $1 for 5 minutes, which I thought was pretty good. They were fast and reliable. We ate at the deli next door every morning for breakfast. They were reasonable with prices and offered a variety of options, including a fruit/salad bar, a full deli, Mongolian BBQ and hot food. You are able to buy things and go upstairs to a large dining area to eat. Overall, I would stay at the Edison again in a heartbeat. Its great location, friendly staff and clean rooms made for a wonderful vacation! The photos I've posted look super blurry on here. Sorry!

Reviews.Title: “Was OK for a night”
Reviews.Author: TravelGalNewJersey
Reviews.Content: We just spent one night at the Edison recently. Staff was friendly and room was clean and you cannot beat the location for a theater/Times Square night. However - we booked what we thought was a 2 bed room via a internet site and got 1 bed and a rollaway - made for tight quarters. Also, the room was hot for a cold day (the heat was not needed) so we had to keep a window open. Also, the pipes in the bathroom would "clang" every now and again until about 11pm - so no early night! Sooo - overall was OK for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel. Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I have just returned from a three night stay at the Hotel Edison. My girlfriend had stayed there before but i was a little trepidatious having read some of the earlier TripAdvisor reviews. However one should always listen to one's girlfriend! I was very pleasantly surprised. The check in process was smooth and efficient. We had a room on the twelfth floor. One of the most stressful parts of going to a hotel is wondering what the room will be like when the door is first unlocked but we were very pleased. It was a spacious twin bedded room with a large TV that actually worked and had good picture quality, (hey i like watching TV!). The bathroom, decorated in grey tiling was small but clean with a good supply of towels and amenity products. The beds were very comfortable and the sheets clean. There was a large dresser with a good amount of drawer space. The wardrobe was a bit basic but it had a sufficient number of hangers and was fine. Our room overlooked the Barrymore Theatre. During the night there was very little to no noise outside the hotel which for New York is quite an achievement. The air conditioner worked on all the settings and was quiet. Overall for our room I would give it 9 out of 10. Very good indeed. We breakfasted each morning at the Cafe Edison which is just off the hotel lobby. The food was reasonably priced with a good choice of menu. Service was quick and friendly and the food was well cooked. It is obviously a popular breakfast destination for locals too. It has quite a history too, with it's Broadway connections displayed by posters and pictures. One is also dining in good company; there was a recent picture of Chelsea Clinton with the restaurant manager! Overall I would give the Cafe, an 8 out of 10. Before venturing out for the evening we had a drink at the hotel's bar, the Rum House (?). Drinks were very cheap during Happy Hour. The service was brisk and friendly and the atmosphere was relaxed. On one of the evenings there was a lady piano player/singer with a very good voice. They also serve cappucino and espresso's for those in need of something warming but non alcoholic! The lobby at the Edison is fantastic Art Deco and very comfortable. The staff in the hotel shop were all very friendly and one of them "loved our English accents" which is always great to hear! It is free to open a safety deposit box although there is a $50 fine if you lose the key. I admit I had a few frantic moments searching for my key so beware. It can be easy to mislay. The Edison has a great location. As other reviewers have stated, turn right and you are in Times Square! The Subway is just across the street by the Olive Garden restaurant although it is not well signposted. It is 49th Street on the R Line. It also saves you the walk to 42nd Street/Times Square which is the next stop down the line anyway. Don't forget to buy a one day fun pass Metrocard for $7. Excellent value for money. So, our overall verdict on the hotel is 9 out of ten. Well done the Edison!!! No plaudits alas for SuperShuttle. It took us two and a quarter hours to get to JFK from our hotel, picking people up along the way. We drove past/through Times Square three times!! Nerves were getting frayed by myself and fellow passengers as we risked missing our flights. Next time we would buy a return ticket on the New York Transport Service Shuttle bus which includes return transfer to Grand Central Station from the Edison and then a bus directly to JFK non stop. Surely much less stressful!

Reviews.Title: “great apart from 1 minor detail”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: the hotel was lovely, very clean and simple. great location!!! next door to a deli and down the road from starbucks for a yummy morning brunch if you did not feel up to the rather large helping of pancakes in the hotel's diner!! apart from the maid leaving her mark, should we say (one might refer to it as a 'skiddy') in the lav, also switching off one's mobile telephone and the fiddling around with the television settings, they did a very good job (folding our pj's and everything!) we will be back darlings!! (even if the bathrooms do slighty resemble a sauna at times!) thank you hotel edison, much love, twas utterly fabby!!! the room 516 crew alex joy amy and fran (and adam from 510!) xx

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My sister & I stayed there over the Valentine's weekend. For the price and location we found the room to be satisfactory. The bathroom had obviously been updated recently. The beds were comfortable and despite being located at the back of the elevator shaft, the noise from them was not considerable. However the radiator was another issue...it was terribly noisy. However we were out all day and slept soundly so it didn't bother us (too much). If we were going to do New York on a budget again we would book again. The hotel is a buget hotel, and you get what you pay for. The Cafe Edison is great for breakfast and the deli has the best coffee. There is also a fantastic restaurant - the Southside Cafe (I think it was called) which served fantastic Italian at reasonable prices. Sofia's is OK, nothing to write home about.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints”
Reviews.Author: coracle
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Edison end september 2004. My wife and I celibrated our 20th wedding aniversary in New York. I can't understand why there are so many poor reviews for this hotel. The Edison is in the perfect location for tourists with many popular spots within walking distance. The hotel room we had was nothing like you see in the photo's but it was roomy enough and kept very clean. The breakfast is as good as any anywhere in the world, and I have stayed in many hotels around the world. The staff were friendly and the restaurant and bars were excellent. I would stay in The Edison again with no problem.

Reviews.Title: “Not too shabby...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Edison hotel in December 2004 for 3 nights with a friend, and have to say I thought it was a perfect hotel for a short stay if you're on a budget! The prices are very reasonable which gives you more money for the essential shopping trips!! The rooms although fairly basic, were cleaned everyday and had a telly (not that you'll get a chance to watch it really). We did get a bit of noise from the heating system while we were there but nothing that majorly affected us. The bathroom was small but did the job and was clean. I've read reviews that said the staff were rude, but I had no problem with them and found them to be friendly and helpful. Definitely the best thing about this hotel though was the location! It was amazing, and as described you literally turn right out of the hotel and are faced with the bright lights of Times Square! There was a subway about 2 minutes away as well which was so convenient. If you're on a budget, want a lively hotel with cosy rooms and with a great location, then this is the hotel to go for!

Reviews.Title: “I told them to keep the money & ran!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Words could not explain this hotel. I was booked here for a week. After carrying in my suitcases (the bell boy was busy inside). I was shown to my room? The enamel on the bath was so worn it was rusty. The wall tiles where broken. The place, felt cramped. I kept my Coat and shoes on, it was horrible. I Was offered another room which was hotels best (A suit) and was charged extra per night. Well at least it had and extra room. If you cant say anthing good then don't say anthing at all. I was in residence for a total 2hrs, and spent 90 minutes of the 2hrs finding another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “An Utter Disgrace!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: On arriving my first impressions of the hotel where marvellous, it was very elegant and extremely grand. I was showed to my room by a rude, insulent, dirty, sweaty young man! This was not a good first introduction to the hotel, and it put me in an outrageous mood. My room then resembled something of a pig sty, there where dirty sheets, which could only be left to your own imagination, a filthy bathroom and it was piping hot! I went down to dine, hoping things would pick up, but unfortunately i was greeted by another sweaty member of staf! I would offer some advice to the members of staff, WEAR DEODORANT IN FUTURE!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just love this hotel. It's not fancy, but it's clean and the rooms are very comfortable. I've been staying here for years, but have never written a review. The staff is the best part of the Edison, from the front desk to the bellmen, the cleaning people and the cashiers.The Rum House is the best bar in Manhattan with Jose, the best bartender. They have a piano bar and Karen is terrific from Tuesday - Saturday. The price is right and the location cannot be beat!

Reviews.Title: “Run, don't walk to another hotel”
Reviews.Author: Patty39
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with another chaperone as we toured NYC with 10 teenagers the weekend before Thanksgiving 2004. We could not get into our first choice hotel and thought the location of the Edison as well as some reviews we read would make it a good substitute. Boy were we wrong!. We had requested 5 rooms all on the same floor - one for each of the chaperones and 3 for groupings of the kids. We were on 4 different floors. The first rooms they showed us were way too small to sleep more than 1 or 2 kids in. We had to persist very hard to get them to find appropriate rooms. My room was a single, which is another way to say it was a closet with a bed. When they first brought me up to my room (a bellman HAS TO lead you to your room), the room was a mess. Not only was it dirty, but had what looked like aspirins everywhere! The worst is yet to come. My first night I heard some noises in the radiator in the room, despite it not being on. My fears were confirmed when the second day I returned from a busy day to find that a large rodent had invaded my travel bag and ate most of a wrapped protein bar inside the bag. When I told management, they seemed unconcerned but volunteered to move me to another floor. The first room was unsatisfactory so they offered another, informing me that it was a handicapped room. Good luck to a handicapped guest who stays there. There were only two electric outlets so they had strew numerous extension cords all over the floor for the lamps, etc. The handicapped bathroom had a large pipe that extended from the ceiling to floor near the sink that must have been for hot water or the radiator as the I almost burned myself when I tried to turn on the light switch nearby. Did I mention that the a/c smelled of mildew? Hotel Edison was a horrible, dirty, smelly place and I could not wait to get out of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “ideal location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Edison for 6 nights in january 2005. The staff could not have been more helpful when we wanted to change rooms not once but twice because of noise from the stairwell and noise from the heating system. The hotel is in an ideal location but is old and a bit tatty ( frayed carpets in the hall ways, slight rust in some bathrooms ( but nothing major). The hotel is secure and clean and for the price fine. Just a few things to be aware of, the maids knock on the door at 8.30 and then walk in, make sure you have a do not disturb sign displayed. The hotel charges 50 cents a bag to store luggage in security, see your luggage in and collect a ticket, we went out to lunch and found our luggage outside of security in the lobby where they say they were watching it ! I did point out this is not what we paid for. The other gripe was transport, we booked a car to take us to the airport only to findout it was a multi - drop van which also picked up 3 other passengers at another hotel going to various terminals ( cost $24 each a sedan car would have cost $55) and could have made us late at check in. There is no 24 hour doorman to assist. For all this I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “great value and location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My children and I stayed at the Edison Dec. 16 - 20 and were pleased with the location and large room with two King beds. The staff could really not have been any nicer or more helpful with requests for ice and watching our luggage for a few hours after we checked out. The hotel is reasonably priced and just a half block from the heart of Times Square. The room was larger than I expected for 195.00 a night during the holidays on short notice. How ever the bathrooms have apparently not been updated for some time but all I expected was clean at that rate and that is what we got. Downstairs is a really nice, very reasonable cafe for breakfast that that gives the day a nice start. I will definately recommend the Edison to my friends and to you.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great value for New York City. We had a very nice one bedroom suite. The staff is very helpful and friendly. The location is great. I highly recommend this place if you are looking for a good, solid hotel in New York City.

Reviews.Title: “Pros and Cons (including BROWN water!)”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: There was good and bad about the Edison... Not so great hotel, nice staff, AMAZING location! My friend and I went on Sunday to stay there for two nights, and asked the staff at the front desk if we could have a room high up to potentially avoid the noise, and we got the 17th floor. (Regardless, it was still very noisy) The room itself wasn't fantastic, but served its purpose, as did the bathroom. The Supper Club on the main floor of the hotel is an absolutely beautiful restaurant with great service and live jazz music. Unfortunately, for the bad part, our water in the bathroom was brown! We were very upset and went straight to front desk to see what they'd do... they said they'd be happy to switch us, but it'd have to be the fourth or fifth floor; they had just as bad water there. We decided to stay in our original room, and the hotel staff were extremely polite to us, promising they'd do everything they could to fix it, and the situation got much better. (If any of you do plan on staying at the Edison and see a gentleman named Ben at the front desk, tell him the girls with the brown water say hi!) ...Our room had a great view of Times Square, and we could walk to the middle of Times Square in about 30 seconds which was really convenient. ...Overall, it's an average hotel. I'd stay there again, but next time I'm in Manhattan I'll probably try someplace else.

Reviews.Title: “Even better than expected”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were much relieved to be staying at the Edison 09/12/04 to 12/12/04, after being upgraded by our tour operator following the bad reports about the Pennsylvania. On arrival we were very happy with the rooms which were clean and recently decorated. The bar had a good atmosphere and was well frequented. The location of the hotel was excellent, just off Times square and there were plenty of restaraunts and diners close by. We would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Edison!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Edison for four nights from the 4th December and found it to be excellent. It is ideally situated, just a stones throw from Times Square, and easily within walking distance of many of the main attractions. I was a little apprehensive about coming to New York, but the city and the people were all great and we will definitely be coming back, and when we do we will stay at the Edison again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We reserved two rooms at the Edison, at a rate of $165 each. Both rooms had two double beds and were on the 6th floor. The reception and bell staff were friendly and helpful. They recommended a fabulous Italian restaurant down the street and gave us a 10% off coupon. The Edison is half a block away from Times Square. Everything is within walking distance, which makes the location superb. Of course, it's a little noisy at night but we were so exhausted that we slept through it. The rooms were small to average in size but not unbearable. The furniture and rug were old but the beds were clean. The bathroom was tiny and did not have any storage space. There were no available electric plugs to use for our hairdryers, curling, irons, cell phones, etc. We had to unplug some lamps. We called the bellhop upon check-out and he was there within 30 seconds. We were fairly satisfied with our one night at the Edison. We would look for a different hotel next time we are in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Keep coming back year after year!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at the Edison for several years now. Sometimes twice year. I even know the bellhops by name and they know me! For the price you cannot beat it. The rooms are small and also the baths. But who stays in their rooms in NYC!! LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION! This hotel is convenient to everything...Time Square, the subway, broadway. This is not a grand hotel, so don't expect it. But I've had clean rooms everytime. For the noise...this is New York...take ear plugs!

Reviews.Title: “YMCA would have been better!”
Reviews.Author: JustHavingFunOregon
Reviews.Content: Our reservations were made online through a travel agency offering incredible rates for the time of year we were going & after much research on the "hotel", we decided to give it a try. I'll start out with something good - the location is incredible! (This is the "Okay" part of my review.) Two nights prior to our arrival, we called to make sure they had our reservation & our requests for a nonsmoking, updated room & were assured this was no problem. Upon arrival, we noticed a not so up-to-date lobby with tattered furniture & a rude check in person. We were taken up to our room by a nice bellman all the while noticing the dirty walls in the corridor & overwhelming smell of cigarette smoke. When he opened the door to our room, it was literally the size of our closet at home, however I was assured this was one of the updated rooms. After looking out at our view of the alleyway, we decided to ask for another room & we were told there was one other room available 7 floors up, so we went to that room - which was the same exact room - 7 floors up - obviously, not acceptable. We took our luggage down to the front desk & I told them we would not be staying there, the female employee then asked me what I was expecting. I told her all that I expected were the rooms they had on the internet, not a closet facing an alleyway...what do you know, they had one of those rooms available. We were given yet another key to head up there - it was similar to one on the internet, however had a 70's bedspread, the smell of too many cigarettes on Friday night & the bathroom was disgusting. I felt I had to take a shower after taking a shower there & in fact did when we left after our way too long, 2 night stay. Take my advice, spend the extra $50 or $100 a night to get what you want - the Renaissance Times Square & Marriott Marquis are great & the W Times Square is next door to this, haven't stayed there yet - but it looks nice. You can't do budget in NYC - it's not worth it. Lesson learned!

Reviews.Title: “Edison rings the right bells”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Edison Hotel I found to be very good well situated in the heart of Times Square well appointed and well in perfect decorative order the public areas were a joy to behold giving a fine counter point to the modern buildings in the surrounding area the bedrooms were well looked after and the staff helpful, I requested 6 extra pillows these were delivered at once. The room was quiet and no sound intruded from out side or or inside the hotel. Food was well prepared and served in a polite manner. All in all it would be hard to fault this hotel in any way

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was okay but.........”
Reviews.Author: Tawny
Reviews.Content: There were a few things I thought could have been better. The room itself was just okay. The bathroom was less than okay but not unbearable. It need to be given a little TLC and some scrubbing to remove some rust and shower mildew. One of the closets had alot of mold and we didn't use it. The hallways were dark and dreary and the carpet was in need of stretching to make it tight. Even saying these things given the location, the cost of the room as compared to other NYC hotels it was okay. I stayed at a similarly priced hotel and location (The Mildford) last year for the Thanksgiving weekend and would recommend it over the Edison. I don't come to NY for a luxury hotel since I am never there. If you are looking for just someplace with a good location just to shower and sleep this is okay but I think next time I will stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic been here twice and still love it!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: As a travel agent i am privvy to staying at a lot of hotels around the world and I have to say The hotel Edison is a fantastic hotel. I have been here twice before and am going again in 2 months time and recommend it to all my clients. You cannot fault its location 1/2 a block from Times square with a Starbucks on the corner for those emergency caffine moments!. The staff are friendly and helpful, the rooms are large and spacious (although some decore could do with updating ie the floral curtains!!!!!)and the rooms are cleaned frequently. I have yet to recieve one complaint from my clients. A must stay for a sightseeing base for New York, i wouldnt dream of staying anyway else.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Surroundings”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife & I stayed for 2 nights at the Edison Hotel on the 14th & 15th of Nov. As it was part of a low budget trip we did not expect much , but were delighted with the hotel in general. The rooms were comfortable and the hotel surroundings very pleasant, especially the marvellous art decor. The staff were friendly and helpful, & I can honestly say I cannot think of one negative thing to say. Thankyou

Reviews.Title: “Unwelcome visitor!!!”
Reviews.Author: kevin23ian3
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Edison Hotel from November 10th. for 4 nights. While the lobby and corridors left a lot to be desired, we found the room to be quite big and clean. That was until one of us were disturbed during the first night by strange noises in the room. As nobody else had heard it we forgot about this until on day 3 when one of us actually saw it, a mouse running across the room. We had travelled with a large group who occupied a few rooms in the hotel and one other of these had the same problem. When we complained we were immediately moved to a suite ( which was not very large or comfortable) but we found that the staff did not seem too surprised by our complaint which is very worrying. I would not stay at this hotel again nor would I recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Ever”
Reviews.Author: Trotski
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the Edison, terrible hotel. How can you rate a hotel by saying that anyone that spends to much time in there room is sad! Hotels should offer a safe, quiet, relaxing environment, if it doesnt it is not a hotel!!!!! Yes its situated right next to times square, whopphee!! a square with flashing lights and lots of tourist milling around, yes it can be exciting the first timei admit. But please please listen to this review, book at your own peril. Another review stated that you dont go to a hotel to stay in your bathroom!!!! etc etc , well i would say it helps if it is clean and reasonably spacious! Dont book this hotel its below standard, animals at the zoo live in better surroundings. Treat yourself book a decent hotel!

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC!! Highly Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was my 8th time staying in manhattan in the last 4 years. We had booked a twin room but when we arrived we were told it was very small and would we like a bigger room - AT NO EXTRA COST!!!! We were given a huge double room. I had read reviews about dirty bathrooms, rude staff etc and was very nervous about this hotel. But I can categorically say it is without doubt the best hotel I have stayed in in NY. This includes, The Howard johnson, the Penn, The Skyline, Milford Plaza - none of them come close. The place is spotless, staff are excellent, rates are superb, the Cafe edison does a mean milkshake and burger! The location is perfect - one side is Times Square, the othe side is Restaurant Row. I can't think of anything bad to say!!!! Give it a try - you'll be amazed!

Reviews.Title: “It was OK..”
Reviews.Author: AnnikaKas
Reviews.Content: The room was OK, we stayed 4 nights at the 10th floor. Since I've been a lot of times to NYC, I know what to expect from a hotel like this (you can't expect a lot) The staff were friendly, and the had a lot of facilities in the lobby, like Internet, a restaurant, gift shop, pay-phones etc Close to the hotel we found a 24 h open deli, and they had a lovely salad bar and yummie sandwiches. Our friends told us that they found a rat(!!!) in their room, and they also lived on the 10th floor, so that made us feel uncomfortable.. I don't know if I would like to stay at the Edison again, cus I don't like the noise and the overpriced shops at Times sq, I think it's better to stay in midtown east, like murray hill.. But if you are a first time new yorker, Edison is definitly a good place to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Edison from October 20 through the 23rd. The location was perfect for us as we attended two shows. Our room was on the 10th floor and we did hear street noise. We could also hear noise from the hallway outside as people walked by chatting. The bathroom was extra small, but at least we had a tub/shower. The room was clean, the staff was friendly and for the price, it was great. The Cafe Edison was a quick and inexpense restaurant for breakfast. There was a deli next door that made wonderful sandwiches. We tend to not spend a lot of time in our room, but when we did, it was just fine. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from a week in New York. We stayed six nights (October 21-27) in the Edison but only booked in there after reading bad reviews about the first hotel where we'd made a reservation. I then read bad reviews about the Edison so we were a bit concerned at what we'd find. Our fears were groundless. The location is fantastic - two seconds' walk from Times Square and the staff were friendly and helpful throughout (even after I left my camera in a cab). OK, so the rooms aren't massive but who goes to NY to stay in their hotel room? Ours was on the 16th floor and it was clean. Yes, there were street sounds but isn't that what you expect in a city like New York? The Edison diner is great and the New Diamond Cafe next door is fantastic for every kind of food you could want, day or night. I'd have no hestitation in recommending the Edison to someone looking for a good hotel at a decent price.

Reviews.Title: “Ignore other bad reviews!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I satyed at the Edsion between 20th - 24th October 04, and really enjoyed it. We were a bit nervous about the hotel after reading other reviews, but were pleasantly suprised when we arrived. We were checked in by Davor, a very friendly receptionist, and shown to our room by Kevin, a really funny bell boy. We admit, the corridors could do with a bit of updating (but who cares about corridors of a hotel), but the room we stayed in (538) was really spacious, clean and looked liked it had been decorated recently. We stayed in Manhatten in April, and payed much more money for a much smaller room in an other hotel, so this definatley got the thumbs up, right in the heart of Times Square!!!!!! We could hear a tiny bit of traffic noise at night, but come on - Times Square at night is not a quiet place. If you have booked this hotel, don't worry about it and look forward to your holiday. If you havn't, then hurry and get a good deal before it's fully booked. We booked through Hotelpronto and got a great deal - probably the cheapest in Times Square!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Hotel”
Reviews.Author: soloflyer
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Edison Hotel from October 20th-23th. The hotel rooms are in desperate need of cleaning and renovations. The room had a musty smell, there was mold in the grout in the shower and the carpet was so filthy that I'm glad I remembered to bring a pair of slip on shoes to wear while I was walking around. I certainly didn't want my bare feet or even socked feet touching that carpet. The lock on the door appeared to have been tampered with at one time and never fixed. It was so loose, that I had to make several attempts to even get the swipe card to work. I felt that both restaurants were lousy. The Fettucini Alfredo at Sofia's was awful and the breakfast I had at the cafe' was cold. Not one time did any of the waiters at either place come back and ask how the meal was. All they did was slap the check down on the table and leave. Expedia is making a big mistake by advertising this as a 3 star hotel on their web-site. Won't trust them again. At least the rest of my 1st time visit to New York City was absolutely wonderful. I will be back, but I won't be staying at the Edison Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Having read the reviews on this website but already having booked the hotel, I was slightly worried. The hotel, however, fared much better than I was expecting. The room was spacious and clean and, whilst we did experience some noise, it was not anywhere near as bad as other users suggested. The communal area was quite grand and whilst the reception staff could have been friendlier, they were not unpleasant, and the bell boys made up it, as they were friendly and helpful. On the whole, in its genre of cheaper end, tourist hotels in NYC, this one is a good bet.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Food but noisy hotel”
Reviews.Author: Zibode
Reviews.Content: One word sums this place up NOISY!!!! We recently spent 8 nights at this hotel and I cant honestly say that I was overly impressed. The impressive part is as other reviews have indicated you leave the front door of the lobby and you are literally in times square which is great and the rooms are clean, however if you intend on having a quiet stay this is not the place for you! We were checked in on the 6th floor right next to the elevators which you could hear going up and down the wall. Although this is noise you get use to we were paying a fairly top dollar rate in Australian dollars and that is a noise I dont think you should have to put up with. Then over two nights starting at 11 pm till 1pm jackhammering started outside and yes you can hear this as loud as a bell six floors up . We contacted security but he couldn't hear it from the front of the hotel however this noise was coming from a side street which our room faced. We then asked to be moved and with the hotel full they moved us to the 3rd floor in a different part of the hotel which was no better as from 12pm you could hear thumping from drums and guitar playing and some singing. This noise started again at 7am on Sunday morning so if you need a wake up call rest assured the guitar will provide an adequate one for you! I am unsure whether this noise came from the bar lounge within the hotel or a club near by. You are however within a couple of minutes walking distance from the gray line sightseeing office where you can redeem your internet bookings or make bookings. We spent alot of time eating from the FANTASTIC ''Food Imporium" where they have bread rolls ,cold meats. cakes of all descriptions, hot chickens and hot buffet style meals to take away. This was located in the street to the left as you leave the Edison Lobby then turn right at the traffic lights and walk up a couple of streets you can't miss it! The Cafe Edison is WONDERFUL. You are able to get anything from breakfast cerial to evening baked dinners which they change nightly. The cafe is always really busy from hotel guests and walkins from the street. For 12.95 you get half chicken ,vegetables, potato or chips,soup and your choice of beverage. We stayed in New York two years ago and stayed at the Howard Johnson Plaza a couple of streets down from the Edison and had a great stay. The only reason we didn't return there was reviewers had reported bed bugs since our stay. The lobby of the hotel is Lovely and takes you back to the deco style of Radio City Music Hall. Next time I would probably give somewhere else a go and eat at the Edison Cafe.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Terrible Hotel”
Reviews.Author: chemicalsuk
Reviews.Content: We've recently got back from a 2 week trip to California, Vegas and New York. Of the 5 hotels we stayed in, the Edison was by far and away the worst hotel. Don't get me wrong it has a great location practically on Times Square but the hotel itself and the service was appalling. We were checked in by a desk clerk with practically no customer service skills. He barely acknowledged us and kept muttering "This is ridiculous" to himself about 4 times as he was apparently having to deal with some other problems at the time. He then handed the room key to the bell guy and said nothing to us like room number or enjoy your stay or anything. The bell guy took us up to our room. (The bell guys are great as I think some other reviewers have said). We were on the 6th floor with the most ridiculously noisy air conditioning going on from a nearby building. We asked to be moved and ended up 2 (?!) rooms down in a slightly quieter room (as the hotel was supposedly full). With no other option we tried to spend the night there and despite a few drinks to help sleep and earplugs we still kept getting woken by the noise. The next day we were moved to a room on the 19th floor which was the size of most other hotel bathrooms (but quieter). Never once did we get apologies, not to mention for the times the room cards stopped working. The hotel is in desperate need of a refurb. The power points are plain dangerous. On the upside - great location and a fantastic deli is 2 doors down which is great for breakfasts and lunches, but the hotel itself is a house of horrors.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD VALUE ON A BUDGET”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family & I stayed at the Edison in June 04 for 2 nights. Great location, good price. Room size was ok, 2 adults & 2 kids. Decor in hallways was dark & dreary. The room was clean but due for a make over in the next yr or two I think. Someone else mentioned the noisy airconditioning - they are right. We stayed on about the 12th floor at the front of the hotel - it droned on all night. Would probably stay again as the location was brilliant, unless a similar priced/better decorated place was available. Missed not having a fridge though.

Reviews.Title: “Love this Vintage Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I've been to NYC four times, stayed at the Edison 3 of the 4 and will probably return. Love the Art Deco Decor-- check out all the floors, walls and ceilings to really appreciate. (Love the mail chute on each floor, bring your own stamps for postcards) Besides hairdryer and iron, I ALSO RECCOMEND YOU BRING A POWER STRIP WITH YOU! There are only a few plugs in the room and if you travel like us, 3 laptops, two videocameras, two digital cameras, 2 cell phones, hairdryer, curling iron, IPOD you may need them to recharge them at the end of the day! We walked to Broadway shows, Intrepid Aircraft Carrier Museum, Rockefeller Center, St. Patricks Cathederal, Grand Central Terminal, Toys R Us with Ferris wheel, Bryant Park (go there and get lunch from nearby deli) ENJOY NEW YORK and remember, never get out of a cab on the street side, you could get hit, or could hit a messenger on a bike with your open door, these guys go fast!

Reviews.Title: “I thought it was great”
Reviews.Author: KatherineNZ
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed at the Edison in July 2003. We had been travelling in Europe for 6 weeks and experienced a variety of hotels and we thought Edison was wonderful - but part of that might just have been the incredible experience of being in New York for the first time! It was recommended to me by my travel agent who had stayed there herself. The room was spacious with two large beds and a sitting area - no complaints there! The bathroom was tiny but how much time do you spend it the bathroom anyway!! The reception staff weren't overly friendly as has been commented on in some other reviews, but we didn't go to New York to chat up hotel staff. The location is just amazing, so close to everything. We felt safe and comfortable there and I would stay there again and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Centrally Located”
Reviews.Author: ltp_tango
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was very tiny--by far the tiniest hotel room I have ever stayed in--but clean and of modern decor. We received a "special rate" through AAA of $140 a night (including taxes), which I thought was quite high, but apparantly not by NYC standards! My girlfriend and I visited NYC to enjoy the Broadway shows (which were fabulous!) and to take in all the sights and sounds (visit dates - August 19 - 24, 2004). We had a wonderful visit! We were put into a hotel room with two twin beds...the room was so small that I could not open my suitcase on the floor...I had to put it on my bed to open it. However, the room was very clean and quiet. We asked for a room on a higher floor (10th floor), and you could not hear any traffic noise or other guests. The elevators are very FAST, due to a recent renovation, taking literally seconds to go from the lobby to the 10th floor. The hotel staff was friendly enough, and the hotel is within walking distance to EVERYTHING. Three Broadway theatres are right next to the hotel. If you want tickets for a show, go to the TKTS tent in Times Square, which is just a block away. The first night, we checked into our room around 7:20 PM; went to the TKTS tent and bought tickets at 50% off for "Beauty and the Beast", then went to the 8 PM show! (It was playing in the theatre next door to the hotel). Lots of restaurants, nightclubs and bars near the hotel. We walked everywhere...we did not even need a taxi. I would definitely stay at the Edison again. I much prefer it to the cold, sterile environments of the nearby Marriott and the Hilton Times Square. The little coffee shop at the Edison is delightful! It is the hotel's former ballroom, and has a domed ceiling and what appears to be original artwork. We had a delicious and very reasonable breakfast in the little cafe, which was cozy and beautiful. The front desk has a safe for travelers cheques, money and other valuables. We felt quite safe and welcomed in New York. The people were very friendly and accommodating, and we felt safe walking everywhere, even at night.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel experience ever!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at the Edison hotel for a bachelorette party in NYC. When the four of us arrived the parking was confusing. We were told by the desk to wait for the valet ticket in order to get our room. When we finally got our ticket we showed it to the desk and they said rudely, "this is yours, we don't need it". When we got to the room the room was extremely small. It could barely fit the 2 beds in it and it was completely not what was shown to us on hotels. Thus begins the battle with the hotel. After we were given the runaround for about a half an hour we were given another room. We arrived at the second room with our luggage and to our disbelief there was only 1 bed. We quickly argued with the desk to give us the room we were promised or at least a better room with 2 beds. We left our luggage in the 2nd room and headed off to the show we were now late for. When we got back we picked up the key for our 3rd room. We went to the second room to pick up our luggage and saw that there were 4 gigantic dead cockroaches on the bathroom floor. We took our luggage and ran to the lobby. The man at the desk, Steve, finally got ahold of the manager. The manager, in a nutshell, was very arrogant and said that we were trying to scam the hotel to get a free upgrade. We were only trying to get a bug free room that we were promised. I highly don't recommend this hotel! Terrible management.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Great Price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I love the Edison!!! Best Location in the city just walk out the front door and in less than a min you are right SMACK in the center of Times Square!!! Get in line for some 1/2 off tickets or just walk around and enjoy...I have stayed @ this hotel 6 or 7 times & the room has always been clean and the beds are comfortable...staff is always very helpful..got passes to some clubs last time i was there saved the $25 cover charge..room are not fancy...if you want fancy spend like $500 a night and stay @ the W next door... but who needs it the city is @ your feet get out of your room and explore!!!!! The convience store has a great selection of food for any meal you want...Great Breakfeast!!!

Reviews.Title: “Handy to Times Square”
Reviews.Author: DonegalPerson
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Edison in August 2004. Positive remarks 1 Great location - footsteps away from Times Square 2 Great Deli next door 3 Close to local restaurants Negative remarks 1 Reception staff are not very friendly 2 Our room was dark and dingy (no natural day light) 3 Bathrooms very small with mildew 4 Room not very clean Perhaps we didn't get a great room - the other reviewers seemed happy with their accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable & great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After 3 nights of hell at the Best Western President (see review under that hotel) I was happy to move. I'd pre-booked & payed for 3 nights at the Edison for myself & 4 friends. I arrived at the Edison well before check-in (noon) and was advised that my room was available immediately. My friends arrived later in the day and while there was a slight mix-up with the rooms (they gave us 3 rooms instead of 2), the front desk staff were more than helpful and fixed the problem immediately. While the Edison is an older hotel, it was clean and comfortable with everything (a/c, TV, taps etc) in good working order. We were on the 6th floor and didn't find it excessively noisy at all. I would definately stay at the Edison again, not only because it was clean & a great location but it was great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Picky Perfectionist rates Edison high”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you want to be in the thick of Times Square action this is for you. Art Deco. Felt safe there. Restaurant a "polish t room". Rooms with two double beds bigger than typical NYC hotel room that is for sure. Lots of elevators--don't have to wait for long. Also a bar. Convenience store two doors down for beverages and snacks helped too. Across the street from a theatre. Bathrooms small but full tub. Air conditioning good. No bravo channel on tv. Stayed on 9th floor to avoid early morning street noise. Tiny bit of mildew in bath tub area but not enough to make me stay somewhere else. Be prepared for the crowds in Times Square! ATM in lobby. A gift shop. Payphones in lobby. Lobby has a thing where you can check your home email for $1.00 for 5 minutes. Have to pay 50cents for a bucket of ice. The restaurant will put an automatic 15% gratuity on your check but if you call them on it they will cheerfully take it off. We searched the internet for hours and are glad we stayed here and would stay there again. We had a guaranteed ns reservation and checked in very late and ended up being put in a smoking room but it wasn't bad. Activating phone for local calls takes $50 so we didn't do it but still could get voice mail messages. Sounded like a rip off to activate it so we didn't.

Reviews.Title: “maid service horrible..but overall very nice...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: i liked the overall stay at the edison...the room was small but cozy...the beds were nice...its nothing i would spent the amount of money i did on it though...my only complant was the maid service she was really rude to me and my friend...we were getting nagged and nagged to get out of our room...even though check out time wasnt till 3...and it was 9 am...we also had a do not disturb sign on which clearly she couldnt read cuz each time she just opened the door till she go very snotty wit my friend and asked us are we leaving yet..,

Reviews.Title: “What a great old find!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When I told an old New York friend that we had just booked a stay at the Edison Hotel for a great price, she said "good luck." She had stayed there many times years ago because it was the only hotel the state of New York would pay for when she worked there. She said it was pretty basic and not at all that nice. I'm happy to note that she was completely wrong. It is wonderfully refurbished in Art Deco style, with a splendid lobby and very smart, newly renovated rooms. Ok, the bathroom was a tad small, but it had nicely understated new tiles and was kept very clean. The hotel is located literally 55 steps from the TKTS tent on Times Square. All of this and it was still cheaper than most other places in town. We will stay there again often, if you don't take all the rooms first.

Reviews.Title: “It was ok for our first visit”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and two friends just took a trip to New York City July 10-17. We had our hotel reservations booked for over 2 months. We were arriving in NY really late that night, around midnight, so we called the hotel to let them know we would be checking in later than usual. The person my husband talked with said this would be no problem because we had already paid in full. When we arrived the guy at the front desk was very rude and said that they didn't have anymore rooms. He said the only room available was a suite with a king size bed and a couch bed. He offered to send up a roll away also. I guess for some that would sound good, but we were both newlywed couples and one couple got the king size bed and the other got the couch bed that was a little bigger than a twin bed. The next morning we spoke with the manager and he put us in a newly renovated room with a great view. The room had two queen size beds, which was better than our first night. He also bought our breakfast for us the first morning. Other than the confusion the first night, the hotel was ok. It does have a great location right in Times Square. I would say if you are planning on being out and about during the day and only in the room to sleep at night, this would be a good place. Good luck to all!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Edison”
Reviews.Author: lovetogothere
Reviews.Content: My family of 4 stayed at the Edison Hotel on Times Square in New York City for 6 days in July 2004. We loved our stay there. It is centrally located to everything about Broadway and Times Square and the room was great.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A very good hotel in an excellent location. I must say that this was the tops of our trip; can't understand why this isn't rated with 4 stars and why it isn't priced higher. Not that I'm complaining. Parking at $ 30 is high.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED THE AMBIENCE!”
Reviews.Author: ritabryant
Reviews.Content: Perfect location for the theaters and Times Square! Comfy bed, but our bathroom was very small. Nothing fancy but clean and very adequate. We were on the front side facing the street (9th floor) and I had to buy earplugs b/c the noise woke me up at 5:30 am. That's just NYC! The coffee shop was excellent for breakfast. The bar late at night was just right. I don't think there was room service and no iron or coffee pot in room. I paid $140 AAA rate. Would definitely stay there again. Very safe and location was fantastic!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great for that short visit”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Edison in early June 2004 before returning to UK having previously stayed on Upper West Side. Very convenient for all sightseeing and entertainment, rooms might be small but comfortable and very clean. High floors are best especially looking over East River, especially in Fleet Week and Queen Mary 2 in berth. Would certainly stay here again and would recomend the Edison for anyone who wants a place to sleep but close to the action

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: JDWLOO
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights at the Edison and it was great. Rooms are small, but clean. There were 8 of us and we had 2 rooms. Staff was very friendly and the restaurant served a great, reasonably priced, breakfast. Location was terrific. Walking distance to everywhere! Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “The Edison is perfect”
Reviews.Author: michellehancocks
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took my parents to New York and we stayed at the Edison on W47th Street from 4-10 June. It was perfect. I had read previous reviews so knew to take a hairdryer and travel iron. I asked my travel agent to request rooms on one of the higher floors as the hotel is right by Times Square and we were put on the 20th Floor. You couldn't hear a noise from outside. I will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location but dirty hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Myself and my boyfriend stayed at the Edison in November/December 2003. On arrival, we were astonished as this hotel was in an excellent location - right on Times Square!! As we ascended in the lift, we were greeted with mouldy walls and dirty carpets. The room wasn't any better! The bathroom and bed linen was very clean but we had to share slippers when coming out of the shower because I didn't want to walk on the floor bare-footed. However, New york is a fantastic city and we didn't spend much time in the hotel room at all but when I go back, I will spend more money and stay at a better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: JohnEverson
Reviews.Content: This hotel really is in a great location - especially for Times Square & the Broadway Theatres. Rooms are basic - but good value. The Cafe Edison is a real New York experience - don't miss it.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for seeing Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Edison from May27 - June 3 2004, on the recommendation of a friend. It was all he said - ideally located for a first-time visitor - just off Times Square - clean & comfortable. Good size, air-conditioned, smoke-free room with 2 large, comfortable beds. Surprisingly quiet, too, considering the location. Small but adequate bathroom with very powerful shower & plentiful supply of fresh towels. Hotel staff were helpful & courteous at all times. Hairdryer, iron & ironing-board provided within minutes of request. Hotel is just 2 minutes from the Times Square tickets-booth, open-top bus-stops & subway & in easy walking distance of the Broadway theatres, Central Park & other tourist sights. Not very impressed with the attached cafe & didn't try the restaurant. The Deli 2 doors away offers a wide choice of foods for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Edison whilst on a study trip. I found the hotel to be of very high standard with the different facilities and how clean and tidy the rooms where. I would defnately recomend the hotel to anyone and when i visit New York again thats where i will be staying

Reviews.Title: “Excellent price for outstanding quality!! Perfect Location!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: They booked us in at the last minute, no hassles. Great service. Quaint room. Very clean. Amazing price for quality. Perfect location right in times square. 2 minutes from the double decker site seeing bus. On our next visit to New York City we will definitley be staying at the Edison!!!

Reviews.Title: “Easy going at the Edison”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My sister and I spent last weekend in NYC and we booked at the Edison Hotel. Everything went smoothly -- quick check-in, big corner room for the two of us, with windows by each bed. The room was incredibly clean. The bathroom was old and small but we are used to that. It also had a large, deep tub for hot baths. There also was a nice sitting area with a desk. The location was excellent, especially if you are going to a show or want to hang out in Times Square. We didn't spend much time in our room but when we did it was quiet enough for an afternoon nap. Check out was also quick and easy, as was the price. We will definitely stay there again and ask for a corner or the same room.

Reviews.Title: “no1 choice for NYC hotel”
Reviews.Author: poshmels
Reviews.Content: ok, so i had been hearing alot of really bad cockroach-rat stories about hotels, and the first time my friends and I went to NYC, we had stayed in the Meadowlands, in NJ. This time we really wanted to stay in NYC. As we are students, we wanted to find a nice cheap hotel. We booked with the same agency as the NJ hotel one, but since there was no organized trip, we had to make ourselves a package and the agency had suggested this hotel. The agent had suggested us to take 2 rooms, but our ***** was low, so we booked a single room for 4 people. As i was going on the net to search the hotel, i got worried as i saw it was voted 2 stars :( As we knew that the check-in was only in the afternoon, as we arrived NYC by bus at 8am, we wanted to simply check-in our bags, but the main desk had upgraded us to a mini suite with a king size bed with a pull out sofa + a free extra bed.I couldn't believe the room! It was beautiful! Anyways, the info desk was more than helpfull and everything was much more than a rated 2 star hotel. I think that they are trying to renovate the hotel and make it more worthy, cuz i would rate the hotel 4 stars... seriously! the location is more than perfect with the lovely morning breakfast place near called cafe EuropeAn, and with the club downstairs and the one a few feet down the block! The hotel is literaly 5 to 7 minutes away from the bus terminal & subway entrance, and 1 minute away from time square. i'd be now curious to know how the regular rooms had looked like, but instead of looking for a new hotel each time we'll be going to NYC, we,ll be going to this one for sure! (if the prices don't change dramatically)...

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had to go to NYC on business. What a lovely surprise when I arrived at this hotel. The Hotel is older but well maintained. Kind of an artsy Deco style. Hotel staff was friendly and helpful. Room was clean with nice furnishings. Cafe had the greatest food and the lounge was very lively at night. Being so close to Time Square is a very convenient aspect--close to walking everywhere in Midtown. I would highly recommend this hotel and will try to stay there on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Kate_Cold
Reviews.Content: Myself & my partner stayed here for 3 nights 18th - 20th March and found this hotel perfect for our needs. It's literally a stones throw from Times Square & within easy walking distance of Central Park and all midtown areas. We were pleasantly suprised by the room... although relatively small it was clean & comfortable with a daily maid service bringing fresh towels. We were on the 21st floor so experienced no noise from street level. If I was to visit NYC again I would definitely use this hotel & therefore recommend it as a great tourist hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from a weekend in NYC staying at the Edison. The accommodations were small but adequate, extremely clean and quiet. The service was excellent; anytime we even crossed paths with one of the staff, we were greeted with a kind smile. But these things were all just icing on the cake! Because of the fantastic location and price for this hotel, I was prepared to deal with crummy service and below par rooms. Finding the opposite was a pleasant surprise and made our trip, not only very enjoyable, but a great value as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a long weekend, Feb. 28-Mar. 2, 2004. The Edison is a great value for theater lovers. The walk to almost all the theaters is 5 minutes or less. I booked the room online and requested a non-smoking room on a high floor. We checked in about 1 pm on Saturday and the room was ready and very clean and just as I had requested. True, the bathrooms are small and you have to bring a hair dryer (or request one from housekeeping). I travel to NYC once a year for pleasure and this is the first hotel I can recall in the Times Square area that is quiet. We slept like babies with no street noise at all. The beds were very comfortable. I recommend the Edison as a good choice for a moderately priced tourist hotel for theater goers. As a plus, you are literally steps from the TKTS booth in Times Square. Also, the Cafe Edison has a great, cheap breakfast. Eggs, choice of meat, potatoes and toast for under $6. That includes coffee and juice, as well.

HotelInfo.Name: Edison Hotel Times Square
HotelInfo.Address: 228 West 47th Street, Between 8th Avenue and Broadway, New York City, NY 10036
